text: hong kong style dessert found in london. quite nice.

pricey, small  but the desserts were good. ginger milk dessert could really taste the ginger the spheres something was pleasantly not too sweet. if it was not so expensive, i would have given 4.5 stars
great place to get durian deserts

worse worse worse desserts shop. matcha cake tasteless. barley kumara porridge coconut milk is out of date, so you can taste sour. spheres edge is tasteless as well. and the service is bad as well. never ever visit again even it is free.
awful food, rude service, overpricednot authentic is one thing, not edible is another.save yourself from ruining a good time - avoid this place
very very bad. drinks are totally not cold, average food and slpw service.

should have read the review before we went. highly overpriced for what they are. 9.99 for a desert! had to order at the counter as no one came to our table to take our orders and they had the cheek to charge ~3 of service charge. when queried, they couldn't explain in english. made it hard to challenge. be warned!
rude customer service and awful dessert first time and 'never again'. there are much better places in chinatown then this place.
walked in and we were completely ignored by the waiters for about 5 minutes so we walked out instead.
not bad desserts, pricey.cash only.comfy seating area.no toilets.
delicious ! super positive! surprise!!
very small shop. very overpriced for what you get. the "h8" sesame dessert is very disappointing, it seems as if it is ready made from powder. there is no toilet either.
nice food, but the waitress was rude and snappy.
the service girl treated everyone so bad, absolutely the worst setvice in leicester square area.
i had a bingsoo with my friend on summer and it was good enough. however they served another kind of bingsoo with lack of milk. the visual and size is appealing. the cafe itself was nice and cute.
bad service and food, no service at all but they charge service charge!? food isn't freshly made and far from the menu, overpriced and tasteless

4 of us went. 3 out of 4 desserts ordered are disappointing and the 4th one is just average. hot desserts are not hot enough; the mango pancake has too much cream and too little mango. they are not very efficient either

the waitress were very nice and kind, even though one of them was learning english and didn't know much. the strawberry milkshake is the best that i ever tried, good price and feels like you are not in london but in china. the decoration is superb, we need more places like this.
millecrepe at 7.99 - not great. like all the reviews, over priced and not a patch on kova. when are we going to get a proper chinese dessert restaurant that london deserves?
8 for a slice of mille crepe cake!!! and cash only?? cake was fine but wow, that's crazy pricing. staff weren't friendly either.
quite a selection of desserts at a reasonable price
the cream covered mango thingi is literally the tastiest beverage ever to flow down my throat
expensive mille crepe which wasn't as good as kova. additionally, cash only with a service charge for seating me and bringing me a cake. what a joke. avoid at all costs
very pricey for the size of the portions. they only accept cash without even telling you where the nearest atm is (which is far, btw). and overall they are rude.

new dessert hong kong dessert place in chinatown. wide selection but quite stingy with the mango as quite a big difference with the image. reasonable service but i know a few other places i would choose over this one.
overrated. very small servings. very exorbitantly expensive. not very good. candy cafe is much better for the same desserts.

poor services. we have been waiting for 20 minutes for our desserts. when my friend asked the staff 2 times to check our order and she stared at us without any apologizes (even her manager was sitting next to us and she kept using her computer without saying anything) . never come back again.

4/6 items we asked for was either unavailable, sold out or missing ingredients...  very disappointing.  service wasn't great, the waitress lacked enthusiasm, gave the vibe that she can't be bothered and only when i pay to tell me cash only...  not sure if i will go back any time soon.
very impressive and delicious fruit dessert
love the durian shaved ice here. only few places in london to have durian desserts.
the taro ball is a must to try. this place doesnt accept card so be prepared with your cash.

we were visiting chinatown from canada and this dessert shop .what a great find. the staff are amazing! the dessert are also amazing! staff made us feel so welcome each time we were there. an amazing atmosphere and we would highly recommend this establishment to everyone!
lovely intimate little venue perfect for a date.we had some excellent fruit dessert,it was a life changing experience.highly recommend this place.
love the dessert! found this shop by accident but it surprised me! definitely will go back again next time. mango ice was great!
very good food and good communication with customers. recommended  10000% love it
was craving for some chinese dessert and just walk in to this little cafe in chinatown. surprisingly it is so good, matched crepes is awesome not sweet at all. definitely a must try.
the best dessert  ive tried! great choice,interesting tastes.
very friendly and helpful staff looked after us.his recommendation were perfect and matched exactly what we expected.we had a comfortable and nice experience and would like to go back again.
overpriced, inattentive service, cash only.there's much better places for shaved ice and tapioca desserts in london.
great food at reasonable prices. amazing atmosphere interior was beautiful.not accept  america express card.
this is a wonderful place,full of the buzz of being in london .desserts were incredible,waiters were very attentive.
friendly service delicious dessert its okay to open a few more shop!
yummy matcha snowdae (shaved milk ice). server was quite unfriendly but overall a pretty good experience.
they charged service charge ??? without any service ?? ok
service is too bad. we try to enjoy the food but the attitude of the waitor is too annoying!!!
great dessert.seating section was great.amazing atmosphere.everything was well organised.
no air condistion in hot weathertookaway a mango cake and when i back home, the cake looked like thiswhat a jokethe cake costs 7 pounds!
very bad service. staff are talking loud when they making the food. and they even charge 12.5% of bill for service charge,where this confidence comes from?

awful service, disappointing waitress who was not only disrespectful but filled with attitude. slow service. desserts came out completely different to what was advertised and was so bad that we had to walk out.

not all drinks were cold as we expected. the flavours of the drinks, smoothies and ice cream were okay though.the whole place smelled like durian. eventually the smell become less strong till i don't notice it anymore.
diverse and extensive asian dessert menu - well worth a visit to sample.
great dessert service is very good
had a horrible time here - do not order "ginger milk" as they literally just mix ginger and milk and serve it as a liquid.
good desserts, drinks are ok but its but a tad pricey
bad quality food and bad service. very disappointed
super cute caf and delicious desserts! a bit pricey tho, but the location is very cosy
amazing freshly fruit dessert.... the best hong kong style dessert in uk!!!
the most amazing mango ice cream  in soho, london. share with a loved one!
i came here for the durian desserts because i love durian!! we had the durian shaved ice one, and it was so good. i will definitely be coming back to try the other desserts!
the food is good but too much oil for me. small space but relatively friendly staff. i would go again to try their dumping.
great spot in china town for spicy sichuan food. waiter was excellent in offering recommendations. cash only.
great authentic dishes, great presentation of food. the chilli beef and bamboo shoots and whole sea bass were great!
cool restaurant with excellent food at reasonable prices. not suitable for massive groups as you may find the seats uncomfortable. it's perfect for quick authentic chinese dinner.
communist decor. good food. affordable too. what more could you want?
food is too expensive and service too bad. cash only!!!!!!!! no card!!!!!!

this place used to be amazing. the new menu is poor, terrible in fact. seems like an attempt to sell tiny dishes at old prices but they've made them worse too. all the best dishes like fish fragrant aubergine, cumin lamb, green beans with mince pork and garlic and twice cooked szechuan pork are gone. please bring the old menu back!
place is very small but the food is good!
small, busy and buzzing. small dishes, fresh flavours and beautiful presentation - wonderful! gets busy and there is a 12 per head minimum charge.
once we he most amazing chinese in soho, now it's very poor. but still expensive.
do not need to talk about food , the service is just horrible!
its small and cozy, with good staff and very tasty food. the twice cooked pork is superb. go here!

this place had a changed menu and possibly change of management, and the quality of the food dropped - but its great again. very affordable, and genuine chinese cuisine. one of the best places in chinatown - highly recommended!
very authentic chinese~spicy food guaranteed
very mediocre and overpriced food. rude, grumpy and dismissive service.

the best chinese restaurant ive ever been in london. the waitress was really nice and the food she recommended to me was great. ill definitely return to the restaurant in a week. only thing i have to say that they just accept cash.
a cosy and welcome stop during my wander around london.
perfectly decent food, price a bit high for quality
best schezwan in town.. a must in london for chinese food lovers..
would've been nice if they brought me my meal. would've been ok if they brought it after us telling them.
great authentic chinese food
authentic and tasty sichuan restaurant with fast and friendly service

great szechuan dishes bursting with amazing tastes of china in a small restaurant that will make you feel as if your were transported to a rural town in china. service was also patient and friendly. prawn, chicken and pork dishes were great. lamb dish was less successful. they have great teas too!
authentic sichuan cooking, fried fish in chilli oil and shredded tofu  was amazing!
good food at reasonable prices and large quantities. would come again.

authentic sichuan food at a very reasonable price. we were a group of 6 and had to wait 15 minutes to sit down but it was worth it. everything was delicious but the cauliflower stir fry and the fried pork belly were amazing!
i love the traditional spicy dumplings in broth. they are ridiculously spicy and soooo tasty. no alcohol here and simple, no messing vibe.
the mao cai is mouth tingling excellent
delicious and authentic. the dishes definitely reminded me of home. the dishes were served quickly and the service was top notch. definitely recommend.
lovely selection of szechuan dishes, some of which are quite fiery! quick, friendly service. thank you!

ok sichuan food. quick service but without a smile or warmth. and would not accept card payment for an 80 pound bill. had to walk down to the local atm to get cash to pay. my local kebab house and chinese takeaway even take card payments!!

one of my favourite restaurants in london; serves authentic chinese food for a reasonable price. also serve super quickly so its very ideal for the ever hungry person!! every dish ive tried has been really good, highly recommend the .
below average. very salty (nearly inedible) food. service was ok. theres plenty more options on your door step
my favourite place for chinese food in chinatown. it tastes amazing!
portions were way to smallwould not recommend for families
i ate  my first time there and i must say the food was  very tasty.  will definitely come back
always go here when im in london. great place , great food. good spicy food. authentic.

server refused to take an order for another dish saying "you can only order once", and that stupid policy is not listed/specified anywhere. average food. don't waste your time or money here, as they don't value your money as paying customers.
overpriced!!!!! - tasty enough and quick but 12 quid for what seemed half a dish. get yourself to silk road in camberwell.

worst customer service ever !!!! they don't realise we actually pay for the food and not the other way round. not sure who the hell runs this place ... i will never return nor recommend th place , in fact would talk about this to all my friends who visit china town!!

we went there on wednesday night, it's now sunday morning and i'm only just getting over the worst side effects of the worst food poisoning i've ever had - good meal, but worth 72 hours of spewing, don't think so! the doctor told me it was from eating reheated undercooked/improperly stored rice. might have put me off chinese forever...
really authentic chinese place. we ordered 4 dishes and rice and it was more than plenty for 3 people. juices weer delicious.
some dishes (vegetables) were really good, most of the meats were just mediocre. come for the spicy food, but only if you're craving something spicy. wouldn't go out of my way to come back here.
excellent hotpot.
one of the best gems in chinatown to eat. really daring and inspiring dishes on the menu and off the main, busy strip
nice place but they need to improve their service
one of my favourite sichuan restaurant in china town, delicious. most important of all, it is value for money!
great little place with tasty dishes at reasonable prices.
best dim sum.
best restaurant in the world meneu verry good and fast team i like it verry much
not recommended. this place is trash. the waitress was rude and the food was dirty and worst taste.

the service and the tastes of the foods became worse compare with last year when i visited. the sauce of the fish smells and tastes good but the fish was tasteless. i agree with the other reviews that the male waiter was rude to customer and he kept talking to another waitress which was quite annoying to us.
really good szechuan food nice staff unusual for china town, good prices
taste bud overload. if youve never tried it go for it. but be prepared for an other world experience in dining.

highly recommendable place for chinese food. excellent dishes are served with a variety of szechuan flavours and spices. the service is also very good. try the homemade plum juice! it goes perfectly with spicy dishes.

this was my most frequent choice in china town. very affordable and very busy, so didn't expect too much of service, until today we encountered a very rude waiter, slim and middle aged man, i don't want to go back ever again.

simply the best authentic chinese food i have ever had. a lot of the dishes were unfamiliar to me but the waitress helped me pick a really tasty selection. i was worried about the chilli content but it was always perfectly balanced in every plate of food. cash only, and not a big enough space for really large groups.
great if you want szechuan style cooking, one of the best for it in london. decently priced and the service is what you expect in chinatown. can get crowded but i like the food a lot
delicious! we ordered a bunch of dishes to share, and it was perfect. it was our first time trying all of the food we had. perfect amount of spice and flavor.

always been one of the better regional chinese restaurants in london although i note the dish size has shrunk while the prices have creeped up. pretty poor service, as per most chinatown restaurants, and cash only.
i was there last saturday with some friends. we ordered 4 different dishes, and everything was delicious. the place is now starred on my google maps :)
recommend to all if u are looking for traditional spicy food.  i really love this place. used to come for lunch all the time. thought i'd leave a nice msg since the staff were treating me well
i always love food there but they have change the menu and new business idea, in fact i did not enjoy that much like i used to, i guess is ok.
did not feel very authentic. the waiter we had was fine, but the food wasn't great for the price.

i heard good things about this place but wasn't very impressed. i got the mouthwatering chicken ( very very good!) smacked cucumber, which was bland, don't really have any dressing that you would expect and dan dan noodles which were overcooked and claggy.
expensive. cash only. service was not great. didn't get all of the dishes we ordered. food was good.
great selection
the buns and pastries are good but bubble  waffle is very average.
lovely bakery place. variety of buns and cakes for good price. recommend a visit
a good variety of sweet and savoury bread and cakes.

favourite bakery ever. so much choice. they sell bubble waffles, taiyaki and have a huge selection of buns and pastries. the only reason why it isn't 5*s is because the queueing system is never made clear and you have to figure it out for yourself
finally found a place that sells red bean taiyaki in london, and they are just as good as japan - highly recommended! also love the ice cream in fish shaped cones.
good bread very soft.. even sometimes long q.. but it worth...
great ice cream. the waffle was not so fluffy though
custard bun!
one of best chinese bakeries in whole uk imo. always fresh, eye-candy buns and good prices. also always great assortment and availability, which is rare for bakeries. a "must go" place
excellent place. great test of locally made waffle with smooth and testy icecream. also the stuffed waffles we're excellent. highly recommend to visit,  especially with kids.
delicious little fish shaped breads with custard filling. highly recommended! the minis are best.
the woman there gave me fake change, was very rude and the ice cream wasn't that good

i got the two types of big taiyaki, red bean and nutella. the dough is different from what im used to (chewy cakey), more glutinous inside and crispy outside. youd have to pay more for nutella, so id say go for the red bean unless you hate it! a nice little treat!ps. bread in shop looks gooood
the ice cream is a must have when visiting china town.
bad customer service. what they call a "large" taiyaki is pretty small for the price. the taiyaki with the red bean paste inside is good.
great location and delicious baked goods. the taiyaki soft serve with matcha vanilla blend ice cream is to die for.
so glad they are now sakurado matcha store
taiyaki with green tea ice cream is nice, however the staff broke my cookie stick and did not change it...and staff team is not nice at all...they look like zombie, no smile, no emotions~
as usual the "custard fish" went down a treat. they had run out of char siu baos, but it was late so not a surprise. the ice creams in a fish shaped cone were delicious.

unfortunately i did not enjoy the taiyaki... the dough was too stodgy on the inside of the large one and there was not much custard in the small ones. the bakery itself is also so packed and they seem in such a hurry to serve you.
very disappointed, we found hair in our ice cream , we threw it immediately. the ice cream tastes normal.

lovely place, they have a great selection of baked goods.taiyaki is the best thing you'll ever try in chinatown and i would recommend getting them here.i would love to give bake five stars but i found the lady on till was quite rude and abrupt.

i've been there several times, the large variety is always fun to try and the food is really cheap so you end up leaving with a bag full of unique snacks, the one snack friends ask me to get everytime i go are those mini taiyaki so make sure you try them as well.
amazing fresh baked goods. highly recommend!
customer services was terrible.
very cool shop with the fish shaped cone for ice cream. ice cream is soft and nice. can get matcha or vanilla. other buns and food is for sale too
lots of variety of cakes and the teriyaki was very nice as well
i went there and tried the taiyaki ice cream : a wonder. it was delicious and quite cheap. a nice afternoon snack
cool place with speical ice cream cones
matcha ice cream in fresh fish shaped waffle "cone" is delicious
i love everything they offered. but i hate that one elder lady with the glasses!! i simply wanted a fresh taiyaki but she only said "it's hot, it's hot". i don't care if it's hot, it's not fresh!
staff at the till so rude to the customer....make an additional order and she was not happy and told me to go away.  so disgusting!!!
what a massive choice of fresh bread and bakes.
best bakery around. very close to w london hotel. i came here every morning of my trip. come here if looking for amazing baked goods and cheap prices.
i would queue here for 3 days to get a bag of their custard fish, surprisingly moreish.
great variety, lots of flavors. the ice-creams and chocolate fish-shape waffle were enough to make you willing to get in and see the rest.

really nice ice cream and the taiyaki was the most surprising thing was really crispy and well done. prices are decent for what you get. lots of other cakes and treats in the store as well, the matcha muffin is really soft and fluffy.
i come here every time im in leicester square, without fail. tuna rolls are amazing. bread is so soft and the taiyaki is extraordinary not to mention how fresh the cakes are
the staff are not nice, the lady on the counter she was rood with usin fact they have a nice looking ice cream bubble and fish it does not taste nice! and the raspberry they used was not washed!i
amazing chinese bakery and ice cream.lots of sweet, savoury options and cute animal cakes.perfect treat after a meal nearby.
fun waffles with a generous serve of ice-cream, an orio and fresh fruit - every child's dream.
great buns, reasonably priced.
not fancy, but is just amazingly good. super cheap, really tasty variety of baked goods. would recommend the savoury food massively.
i tried the fish cone green tea and vanilla ice cream and the mini custard filled fishies. both were delicious.

the taiyaki ice cream is awesome. the matcha flavour is tasty. smooth creamy ice cream. the cone is crispy and slightly chewy. they give a generous amount of ice cream too. good value for 4. plus you can get a nice photo. they also sell a variety of chinese style bake goods.
the buns are amazing and heavenly good  again and again i am gonna go there
great food, especially the nutella fish shaped pancakes

very old school chinese baked goods - tbh theyre probably a bit niche for most westerners, but i love their chicken floss buns and other assorted goodies such as light as air padan rolls. put them on a tray and then take them to the counter to pay and have them wrapped, or youll be told off.

bake is a popular shop with ice cream, genuine chinese fresh baked goods (these are at a reasonable price). the staff is efficient and works fast. they sell the hyped matcha flavoured icy creamy goodness in an japanese taiyaki. it's good but as is with most hypes - overpriced.
don't know about the buns, the ice cream was nice, the cake not so much.
nice ice cream. you can have it in two flavors; vanilla  or green tea.
gr8
fresh taiyaki made on site with choice of ice creams and fillings. also a good range of chinese pastries.
vanilla flavour was yummy and that fish shaped cone made it much more interesting.

i got the green tea ice cream. beautiful presentation, flavor was a bit lacking (couldn't really taste the green tea/matcha), but the fish pastry was delicious. i got some buns last time and they were pretty soft and fresh.
tea time,supreme. pastries, apple pie, choc fudge exquisite.we enjoy it !one more time. .

fun asian bakery. lots of fun options at affordable prices. there's a slight language barrier which makes their customer service seem lacking. i thought the fish ice cream thing was gonna be a total gimmick (that i wanted to be a park of nevertheless), but turns out the green tea soft serve was quite tastey.
amazing food , especially the pandan cake and ice cream. extremely helpful and will continue to go in the future
lovely soft bread filled with cream and sprinkled with coconut. light as a cloud and very yummy. will certainly be back for more

the food is nice. but the customer service is the worst! the woman who serves the ice cream was so nice! dont get me wrong. but the two people at the till. extremely rude and i have been thee twice. same person and same service from her. if you are ok with having nice food but rubbish service. this is the place for you.

we were too full to try anything more then the green tea ice-cream. the gimmick of the fish is very cool, and tasty. the ice-cream is not too sweet, perfectly balanced. loved it, and would definitely try other things on my next visit.
small take-away asian bakery. loved the small fish shaped pasty that is lightly stuffed with custard.
best hk style bakery in chinatown! i always get char siu bao!
very good chinese buns. they are very creative and flavourful.
always come here for lovely cake, i'd definitely recommend the matcha green tea ice cream with the fish cone! very delicious!!
tried the taiyaki with green tea ice cream.yummy! looked like they had a great selection of baked things.
sweet sweet! i love how they made their bakery so sweet. lst time i went spent almost 20!
they have some dope ice cream. seemed to be in a rush kicking us out as soon as we had our order.
yummy! definitely worth the wait
the egg custards were very delicious. we also bought pineapple flavored bread etc. they were all good.

i don't even wanna give them 1star. the worst customer service ever.. (maybe the lady who i talked with was just really bad, and not rest of employees.) i don't usually write bad reviews, but this place was unbelievable. thank you for ruining my first london trip! i will never go back.
love the pistachio ice cream that comes in a fish waffle cone.
got ripped off. clearly stated 'smallest, cheapest green tea possible'. got suspicious when they asked for receipt and didn't want to give it back. 2nd star for tea ice creme taste.
taiyaki  so delicious !! try it out

it's one of the few authentic shops around leicester square. you can find a wide range of freshly baked products. it is always crowded, and you can't expect much of service, but you can help yourself with peace of mind through a self-service scheme.
so-so. nothing all that special. their soft served ice cream tastes no different than something you can find easily at mcdonalds. just tastes sweet and no other flavour. buns are alright.
good quality tasty food.
fantastic food and lovely service! we come back when next time in london
amazing food, with dumplings prepared in the front. usually busy so book ahead, or go early.
food is nice.  love the dumplings.  but my favourite is the special fried rice.  the staff is nice.
the finest venue in china town
good cheap but not exceptional when it comes to dumplings. tasty but a tad small and lacking the broth inside the dumpling. other dishes delicious so for 30 2 people 4 dishes and tea i'd go again.
really disappointed, the food has no taste and the waiters were really rude.

we've been here a couple of times and the quality varies but this was the worst of the worst. zero szechuan in the szechuan chicken, rubbery squid and dried out crusty xiao long bao. i've had better food and service in a mall food court.
shocking service, food that we did get was mediocre, bizarrely there was a queue at the door, this place sucks, don't go.
disappointing - mediocre xiaolongbao soup dumplings (we tried three kinds) and a zha jiang noodles that had a sauce that was watery. prices were ok and service was fine.
great dumplings, made on site! fast service and at a good price. definitely worth a visit!

did not impress me at all. my kung pao chicken was terrible, one of the worst i've ever eaten. the sweet and sour soup was ok but again nothing special. i guess i will have to stick to dumplings next time.
some of the best food i've had ( try the spicy pork xiao long bao )

terrible service, only half our order after 40 minutes of waiting and then only the flimsiest of apologies. everyone else around use got served well in time yet we were sat with nothing. not good enough so walked out.
amazing food, so so tasty. would go back everyday if i could!
best dumpling i have had.

beijing dumpling is my favourite spot in chinatown and i can assume many share my opinion seeing that there is usually a queue out the door. it goes by fast, don't worry. amazing dumplings and amazing don don noodles. highly recommended!
good staff and yummy food.
solid dumpling spot. recommend.
nice place. maybe could offer more dim sum choices though.
not authentic. poor service with bad attitude.
spot on review by jon wong food good service quick staff were attentive but not overly friendly would return and try the dumplings.
the best chinese in london, value for money. nice and intim atmosphere.
the food in this place is exquisitely delicious, and the atmosphere is excellent.

really happy with this one. much nicer than the last dumpling place that i've visited a couple of months back. all the dishes were very good. dumplings, taiwanese fried chicken and some home made thick noodles. all goodbasement seems to be not suffer from the cooking of the dumplings creating a stuffy atmosphere at street level.
love this place for fresh hand made dumplings. the other dishes on the menu are also well worth a try like fire cracker chicken and smoked shredded chicken!
lousy cooking skills aside, terrible service - so rude, so arrogant and so uncivilised.
the food here is amazing. great service,excellent value for money
unbelievable choices for vegetarians. the dumplings are delicious and the salt and pepper tofu is super moorish.
the dumplings are the only good thing here, rest of the menu is below average and the service is by far the worst i have experience in 7 years in london.

food beyond amazing, exceeds every expectation, especially the dumplings! but the service and staff attitude -- meh. actually thats the only reason its not a 5! please do work on that and you'd get my 5 stars :)
had the hot pot with spicy and corn broth - both good. good selection of seafood and meat.
the chicken craquer is fantastic. the food is good. it's not expensive the prices are good
great food, they were very helpful with allergy advice. bit of a wait for a table.
below what i expected from the existing ratings and patron waiting outside.
soup doups.
some of the best dumplings around and much more. the firecracker chicken is amazing.
great chinese restaurant,  fresh and well price

we were there on a wednesday evening in march. we tried many different courses: different kinds of dumplings, prawns with cashew, rice, sweetsour chicken ... the food was plenty and delicious, service quick although the restaurant was full. would definitely recommend. booking advisable on weekends as there can be a long line.
loved it.
delicious and not expensive
muito bom e barato
amazing food !!
excelente food, big portions, good price!the "la capital" plate is exquisite! also the coconut curry chicken. you can order both to be less spicy.

we had so much expectations walking in thinking we would get the xiao long bao(soup dumplings) filled with mouth burning broth, which is the main selling point of the restaurant, but we were disappointed slightly. the xlb had very little broth inside. but other dishes that we had weren't too bad.
probably the best chinese food i have had in the uk. reasonable prices. good, fast service.
so so delicious. totally worth the wait!
ristorante buono degno delle 5 stelle
eating very delicious and ok, service a little bit unfriendly and annoyed.
delicious. but very crowded, sometimes you cant hear other people on your table because there are 6 white girls on the next table screaming and shouting. besides that lovely.
awesome food and service.
we have been going there for years. great dumplings and well worth queuing for

the service was quick (although it was quiet at the time) and the food was absolutely delicious. you can see them making the dumplings so you know that they're as fresh as they should be. i highly recommend.
great food with good service
absolutely best dumplings i ever had! warning! if you've eaten here all other dumpling places start to taste like s!#t.
some great vegan options. busy place.
very fresh dumplings. despite the large que to sit in, i would highly recommend here if you are in china town
cool.
fast service and good dumplings
the dumplings are great. pay no attention to the service, because it is terrible.
have been there twice and was delighted twice. good service and great value for the delicious food!
very good xiao long bao. other dishes are excellent and good prices. expect bit of queue on the weekend
fine food, nothing exceptional. the wooden tables are all sticky, i assume from the washing liquid being used on them.
amazing. best chinese food i had for a long time. i'd highly recommend, taiwan pork chops especially, good
ordered take away, havent try food yet, but the services are great here!
loved it. great food and a good atmosphere. but the stuff could be a bit more attentive.

weve been craving some xlbs and they didnt disappoint. we tried the pork, the crab and pork plus we couldnt go past the fried dumplings (pot stickers)get here early to miss the queues but its worth the wait.
fantastic! from the kung pao chicken to the peking duck and the xiao long bao the food is very tasty.
you really need to go here if you want some of the best dumplings
oh wow one of the best dumplings i have had in london and i live here and have been to lot of places in the neighborhood
probably the best dumplings in london, but bd has also a lot more to offer: i like to order something different every time and it never disappoints me!

quirky menu takes you away from many of the english "specials" and leads to a more authentic and rustic meal. food good, the deep fired king prawns in egg yolk very good if a little salty. fast service, basic setting, but great value for money.
excellent food! and great atmosphere~ recommend the four season bean with minced pork...it's great!
really disappointed, bad food
great place for dumplings and sharing plates. you can also book online which is great if you do not want to wait. best xiaolongbao in china town!
amazing! worth the wait we experienced during lunchtime.
pretty decent xiao long bao except not enough soup. the other dishes are so so
thought it was supposed to be quite good dumplings, especially xiao long bao. they were the driest xiao long baos i have had. maybe because it was lunchtime, but beware!
my second visit.  had fried pork dumplings, steamed chicken dumpling soup, beef ho fun, roast duck, sweet and sour pork - all superb.  service was prompt and polite.
i loved the food. one of the best places in china town.
fantastic freshly made dumplings and other delicacies
come early to avoid a wait, but the line moves fairly fast. the food is good for uk chinese, but not really beijing.  the pork xiao long bao were great though!
dumplings we'e very good, staff was friendly, but i would past on the satay chicken.
amazingly fresh and tasty! so reasonably priced too. good service.
more like dumplings by dumplings. decent food however the service was terrible and ruined the experience. when we declined to pay the service charge, staff cursed us in chinese. !

this resto serves the traditional chinese fares but the dumplings are yummy. freshly made and reasonably priced too. went there on a weekday so seating was easy. i can imagine the difficulty going here on a weekend considering its location. service is average.
nice place with very nice food and in good amount. fast service, you might cue if you come in peak hours. it could be 5 stars if the staff was less rude when serving the dish.
they are asking for 10 min spend per person without any notice.
i went for the dumplings and i was disappointed, too thick and not enough filling. the rest was nice!!

been to this couple of times and wow the food are amazing. tried different dumplings, the dry chicken noodle and the salt and pepper type chicken. they all had very authentic taste and seeing the chefs making the dumplings certainly adds to that experience. i would go back everytime i go to soho.
good dumplings f or central. men could do with better description though
one of my favorite places in london

everything was soooo delicious! i really recommend the dan dan noodles and spicy pork dumplings (caution: they are filled with liquid, so just eat them in one go, don't bite through it!) the service is better than some other chinese restaurants
my 2nd favourite chinese restaurant in chinatown. great that you can see the dumplings being made on the window.i recommend getting the spicy aubergine dish. it's incredible.
delicous food
dumplings are not bad. reasonable price too.
very good taste.
food was very good but service was lacking.
nice dumplings.
terrible phone service! just call to ask for vegan options and they replied in a really rude way saying they don't do any vegan! completely disappointed!
fantastic place to eat in london
delicious food!

the consistency in quality of food is a bit strange here; the dumplings are great and lived up to its name, but everything else was average or below average. prices was fairly standard for china town.
tasty food, prepared with a lot of skill and care, and feels healthy. often there is a queue, but its worth the wait.
some of the best chinese food i've had london. food comes quick, great selection and reasonably priced.
very good little restaurant.  great dumplings. gets busy which is a sign of quality.  would go back if i was dumpling hunting. the other food looked good too.
taste all right. bite sized too small.
good service, great atmosphere and amazing food
we tried 3 dinners in the same area.  this one gives larger amounts (1.5-2x) than others while price a little lower.  serving time is a little quicker than others.  total 37 pound including tip
delicious and cheap
always fun to visit this soho institution. food is tasty, portions are good size. we always get some dumplings to share and are rarely disappointed
not the most friendly service...food alright but nothing worth remembering

really good chinese food, and won't break the bank.the flavours here are very authentic and the food is prepared very well. the restaurant itself is clean and well presented with polite and friendly staff. combined with reasonable prices, you can't go wrong.

awful service. planned to go for dinner on a sunday night after a theatre play. arrived at 9:15pm in 4 ppl and we were sent away for a supposedly closed kitchen. how is it possible that you close the kitchen more than 1h before closing?? really disappointed!!!
great service. got last spaces before queue started. fantastic food. well recommended
great staff, delicious food and all in all very restful ambience
great atmosphere, in the heart of china town. a variety of dumplings and other dishes, prompt service.
busy but not long wait. dumpling made at the moment and lots of choice.
their dumplings are super tasty ^^
delicious, whole family enjoyed, fried and steamed dumplings, sweet and sour chicken, crispy duck and more
nice food lovely seafood dumplings
dumplings were dry, as its wrapper is thickkkkkkk!!there was no service, the waiters werent likely they are working.
solid place to grab authentic chinese food near leicester square. change from the usual tourist traps!
very good place to eat, ordered 6 different meals all of them was good
gorgeous good, nice atmosphere, authentic and good service

not even average. the food is so sweet it tastes of nothing but sugar. the weird dumplings have soup in them, look yellow and unappetising and taste weird. the service as expected in china town- no one really cares
food was delicious but the people serving forgot to bring 2 dishes we ordered it and they were not being nice. they should improve that to create a better atmosphere for the customer
disappointed, as the skin was very thick and there was minimal amount of soup inside the dumplings.
amazing. best dumplings in london hands down. couldn't recommend more. go hungry as you will want to try everything
busy place, the food is very decent.
amazing dumplings!  even though sometimes you have to wait to get in, but it is definitelly worth waiting!
my favorite dumpling place in london!
dumplings are great. rice is bad. the staff is horrible: rude and of no service at all.

their menu says hot pot.. their window has an offer for hot pot... but when we asked for it, they said they don't even sell hot pot. since we had waited to sit and other restaurants had lines as well, we decided to eat anyway. the dumplings were bland and mediocre, and the rest of the food ranges from okay to bad. very unimpressed.
loved the food.
great stuff
been here three times now. food is always amazing. its very cozy and welcoming. definitely worth a try
best place in china town
i love this place. service is not great but food is delicious, great dumplings!!! one of the best in chinatown!!!
pork xiu li bao, mapo tofu and firecracker chicken never disappoint. fair prices, delicious food.

good was ok, a dumpling place which on a saturday evening doesn't have the full dumpling menu doesn't make much sense. it was also a bit late and they were kind of kicking us out when the restaurant ups was a bit full. not the greatest place and not the greatest food but prices looked quite affordable compared to the quality
the one and only dumpling master in london!best in town!
tasty and very quick staff
amazing dumplings and beijing zhajiang noodle. the worse the service, the better the food :)

asian dim sum food. food came promptly and staff were helpful. my spicy dish was not very spicy and they were out of steamed dumplings when i went but it was quite late. the food was very tasty however. average price for chinatown
fantastic resteraunt. all the food was delicious and big portions. definitely going back.
my favourite dumpling place in london! their soup dumplings are warm and delicious. they have quick, efficient service and its pretty cheap given its central location
i have been coming here for 4 years now, the service is ok but the food is amazing.

one of the best chinese restaurants in london and very good value. hand made pork dumplings and xiao long bao, the best combination ho fan in gravy sauce. service is usually efficient and not overly friendly which is what i expect and prefer at a chinese restaurant!
really great food, for excellent value
delicious food and good prices.
had a lovely lunch although huge. chose the set menu and had too much food. everything tasted great though. will definitely visit again.
amazing food, really enjoyed the meal, highly recommended.

with so many places to choose from, beijing dumpling really does the job, nevermind the short time queuing for a table, the food us really good, especially the fried dumplings! the place was packed but all handled smoothly and stress-free by courteous staff.
amazing food and great service. this is my favourite chinese restaurant. a little wait is necessary to be seated but overall i love it.
reasonably priced semi authentic chinese  food.
tasty food

food is decent and relatively cheap. nothing overly special but is a great catch non the less... been here 5 times over the last year or so and every time there was a queue going out the door onto the street.
i used to love this place until it was shut down temporarily for rat and cockroach infestation. my heart says yes, but my head says no, never again!
a colleague recommended this restaurant. very good value for money. food is tasty and service is fast.
don t come for chicken
very tasty dumplings. definitely try the pork xiao ones!
the dumplings were really good!!! and the rice was on point... good service l, lots of options in the the menu, if you're in china town go eat here good food at affordable prices
such a treat and unexpected surprise. food came out quickly and immediately reflected significant effort. try the honey wings and bubble tea!
thier spicy pork dumplings are to die for
pathetic and rude staff. enter at ur own risk

very nice little restaurant in chinatown. the food is amazing. noodles and dumplings are homemade and the customers can see the chefs at work also from outside, very nice idea. good price for the food
the dumplings were disappointing.
very delicious!
they wanted us to spend 10 per person, it is stupid for a place with typical noodle price is around 7
nice food!

i went with a 9 and 5 yr old.  they loved it all. staff were attentive to them, food choices were uncomplicated but very tasty. went because we saw the ladies making the fresh dumplings in the window.  will return.
very good food! if you also want a bit private, romantic atmosphere, this isnt probably for you. but i would come again anytime! :-)
t's michelin listed restaurant. not star but definitely good dimsum. also traditional chinese and affordable. the atmosphere is a little dodgy but taste excellent.
food is good, place is hygienic..
absolute love is this place.have tried all the dumplings here , its amazing!!never get bored of the food here. best dumplings in china town

awoid this place at all cost!! the menu says nothing about the food ie dumpling in soup turned out to be dumplings in pure water, hot & sour soup turned out to be somethings super sweet with a jelly like consistency and on top of that there was an egg shell in my beef stew!! utterly disgusting!!
food i ordered was not as great as i expected! maybe i ordered the wrong one.
speedy service and big fresh portions too. good value for money.
incredible dim sum, best in chinatown. expect to queue outside for a table at peak times!

fantastic. best in china town. dont miss the spicy pork or chicken dumplings - freshly made at the front of the shop. salt and pepper squid was also a standout - the squid was fresh and supple, not rubbery like most frozen variants. meal for two, with a beer each will cost you about 40, and youll eat very well.

this is one of my favourites chinese restaurants, the food is absolutely delicious, the best are the green beans with mince and the aubergines just melts in your mouth. the menu is huge so you have to be precise of what you order. is a nice place to go with friends because then you manage to test all different dishes.

experience to forget. disappointing: a long queue to go in, for having the typical dishes of low quality chinese restaurant. disgusting: one of the cooks, the line passed by the kitchen, went from touching bank notes, to make dumplings...
excellent food, good service and a wide selection on the menu. the dumplings are a must! prices are reasonable given the location and filling in your menu selections wasn't too much of a hardship
love a dumpling  .light tasty  just delicious
i liked most of their dishes just the chilli chicken felt it was done a while ago and wasn't warm enough.would definitely go again.

ate an early dinner this evening. excellent service. nice, friendly staff. the food was outstanding!  roasted duck, dan dan noodles and dumplings were all delicious. definitely would return and hope to do so.
best chinese restaurant to go to for people of all ages, it has a large menu offering food catering to all needs
the dumplings are superb.
long queue but totally worth it. great selection and menu. the food is tasty and the price is reasonable
nice and authentic location but the dumplings are only borderline
delicious food so fresh and tasty and prices are very reasonable as well
was very disappointed with the food and service. we ordered and the food virtually came out straight away. the waiters seemed very disinterested in you. overall experience was poor

amazing dumplings made at the front of the shop as you watch. highly recommend the soup dumplings in particular. staff are pretty no nonsense which is fine. can get very busy but if you go outside peak lunch/ dinner times its no problem to get a table.
dumpling are pretty good although it's a small dumpling menu. tried several dishes and everything was amazing. had a great dining experience. one of the best i have tried in china town so far.
my go to for chinese food, worth travelling and the queue. dumplings obviously 5 star.
ordered so much food, but was so worth it. all dishes were fantastic. the dim sum was so fresh and can be seen being made. fab place.
avoid this place! staff were very rude and not welcoming at all!!dumplings in soup are dumplings in water. literally. weird. i will never come back there.
very good quality price balance. dumplings are a must. it gets quite busy after 7pm.
long wait to get in. my son loved the dim sum but i was disappointed with my chicken dish. not worth going back
totally uninspiring.  if this is the best dumplings london has, then clearly london has not been to other parts of the world.
awful. dumplings so dry like theyve been waiting there to be served, horrible service with attitude - because i asked for tap water.an overall terrible experience.
excellent. my 'once a month' hangout. the dishes are just so tasty and they don't hold back on the portions
a great place for fresh dumplings. one of the best and cheapest in the west end. the service is beautifully no thrills.
pretty good dumplings for london. 8 per bamboo steamer but they're tiny dumplings. taste okay. nothing to rave about. but that's london for you.
good service, the food is tasty & the restaurant smells so delicious. the dumplings could be filled a little more though. would definitely recommend if you are looking for chinese food.
food is always delicious, big servings and good service - seating could be a lot better but i get that's part of the traditional look they're going for inside

excellent chinese restaurant in london! some of the best chinese dishes i ever tried. the locale is welcoming and nice, although a bit small. does not accept reservations, which is a pro in my book, but i can see how it could be a problem for others.

very good chinese restaurant. despite its name, i think the main dishes (like the tangy lemon chicken) are better than the dumplings. service is good and quick and the place is clean. they don't take bookings, so be ready to queue if you go for dinner.
very good dim sum for a reasonable price. they also serve a lot of other chinese dishes. just be prepared to wait for a table.
high quality food. but i feel like the michelin recommendation is a little much. it's great food but not worth going out of your way for.

i agree with stephania who has left a review regarding the service. we ate here yesterday and the staff were incredibly rude, throwing the food across the table. they had no manners at all. it had a very bad smell too and very surprised at the michelin reviews. we will definitely not be eating here again.
very tasty dumplings! you have to wait in queue around 15 minutes but definetly worth it. also nice house wine.
excellence at it's best...
always reliably good. dumplings are homemade in front of you. xiao long bao to die for.
the fried udon noodles were good but the soup dumplings and fried dumplings were just ok.  the service was terrible.  the waiter never spoke one word every time we asked for something.
while i thought the pan fried dumpling wrappers were a bit thick, the rest were wonderfully thin, all contained tasty morsels inside.
good food for a reasonable price.fast service yet you feel a bit unwelcome but its worth for the food.i would stay away from the wine glass its cute with water.
awesome food would definitely return
outstanding selection of tastes. great service! highly recommended!
great place for dumplings (both fried and in soup) but other dishes are a bit average in my opinion.
great food, well priced and friendly staff

food & drink: 7/10service: 6/10decor & atmosphere: 6/10service speed: 8/10cost: 8/10the best: fast service and good pricethe worst: long wait times and not the cleanest lowdown: the food is decent for china town and the service is good compared to most places in the area. dumplings are the way to go when ordering!
good dim sum in an authentic beijing vibe
great place for chinese food. i have tried many places in chinatown and this one always comes out on top. good prices too. try the dumplings.
food is excellent, soup dumplings are fantastic, but they are reducing portion sizes each time i go
good value food, big portions
a fabulous little restaurant in china town. alwats busy which is a testament to its meals.i would definitely recommend it.
great place. food is very good. staff friendly.and there ribs are great if you like ribs it's a must go.
fantastic food right in the heart of the west end.  well worth a visit.  get your chop stick skills up to scratch though
just the best dumplings ever!! wonderful service and even better food. love, love, love!!
very busy place and the service isn't particularly polite but damnnn... they's some tasty dumplings. food is great.

excellent dumplings and a decent overall menu. worth the wait (there is normally a queue out the door). service is generally abrupt and efficient. on busy days you may need to remind or flag down, but the quality of food never varies regardless of how packed they are.
best pork fried dumplings i've ever had! they even made tofo taste good.

a star for the location and atmosphere. i have no clue to why they have a michelin sticker. the personal is rude.the dumplings are chewy. when served in soup, the soup was just boiled water, no broth or anything.go to the thames southbank streetfood market, their dumplings are incomparably better.
good food and dumplings. the quality of the food is high, but the staff could be more attentive. prices are reasonable.

great value and taste! staff were very busy but welcoming and courteous. food had great flavor and portions were good. really enjoyed the dumplings and dan dan noodles. will certainly visit again when in london.
well worth the wait! usually a line out the door and for good reason. food was great! service could be improved but they dont fake it at least.
good dumplings and fish dim sum, other dishes seemed good but i didnt order.easy going place, very quick service and perfect for a pre theater dinner
nice atmosphere, very quick service, piping hot  and delicious. waiter even told me i was ordering too much food & what to take off!  great, thanks!
the pan fried dumplings were just incredible. i could have eaten about 10, they were so moreish! one of the best places in chinatown for food!

absolutely delicious! i had the spicy pork dumplings, fried pork dumplings, kung po chicken and some chicken fried rice. everything was amazing. located right in the heart of chinatown, quick 5 minute walk from the piccadilly circus station.it is a very small place, so not many seats.

an ok restaurant. food felt westernised and too sweet. the sitting area is cozy and the servers are polite.i dont think ill come again, though. the food isnt really impressive. if youre looking for good chinese food in chinatown, id recommend old town 97.

great chinese restaurant providing quite a lot of dishes to choose from. the service was quick and prompt..  the beef ho fun is a really lovely dish to try. the mixed meat and sea food ho fun is also quite a treat containing prawns, squids , chicken , beef , pork , and loads more... food bloggers this is a place you gotta try out

to be honest, i couldn't see what the hype was about with this place. the queue was about 20 minutes to get in and the dumplings were not all that. we had other dishes but i just was not keen. maybe give it your own review (maybe i was missing something) but i would not go again

works really well with icy weather outside and the warm wooden interior of restaurant, the dumplings in warm soup... almost perfect queue always crazy when i arrive it seems, though of the best  dumplings i have savored.

i love this place. the dumplings are amazing. my family always eats here when we are in town. the first time we went we didn't like that the server was rude. but now we sit in his section everytime, his attitude is part of the experience. very entertaining .
dumpling relatively good and reasonably priced. dog friendly which is rare in london. will go back again.
always amazing tasting and quick to come out! best xiao long bao that ive ever had!
good handmade dumplings. long queue
been 3 times now, great chinese restaurant
from now on my go to place for dumplings!!! long live beijing dumpling!!! they treat you really great!!!!

i had big hopes for this restaurant however the service from the waiter was very disappointing which made my experience not wanting to come back again. there are other dumpling restaurants with better service in chinatown incomparison to here.
good food, cheap and in the middle of london, use to go there often while in my holiday in london.
personally i found the food a bit lacking in flavor and texture overall, especially the steamed dumplings that i tried.
great food including dumplings- fire cracker chicken was excellent
good fine asian quidine.prices a bit extra and staff a bit cold
no queue for the first time ever! went for the famous dumplings. absolutely delicious! very friendly waitress. will be back (again)
superb food! well, you have to queue but its definitely worth it! try the firecracker chicken - delicious!

line/queue up, order up, beer up and pig out.... xiaolongbao are as good as as it gets at this price point in london. no white table cloths here just fast service and check-box order sheets and cold beer. fast, cheap, easy. be sure to come slightly before tourist feeding times.
our favourite soup dumpling spot in london. if you like soup dumplings look no further. much better value for money than din tai fung london!
fantastic food, i keep coming back for more! quick service too so if you have a short time before any appointment, youll have time to eat here
amazing chinese food! there is usually a queue but it moves fast! try the spicy pork baos and the crispy duck!
great tasting food for the cold winter months. the dumplings and chicken were great too!
the best soup dumpling and handmade noodles i have had in london so far, highly recommend the place. you should make a reservation it gets really busy.
fantastic service, food was really good. gets mad busy.
dumplings were not fresh and the food came out really quickly. good place to eat late in chinatown but wouldn't go back for the quality of the food.
i find my chai here
place: Beijing Tong Ren Tang Retail Ltd

text: nice teas at affordable prices
place: Beijing Tong Ren Tang Retail Ltd

text: excellent doctors.
place: Beijing Tong Ren Tang Retail Ltd

text: competent chinese medicine, a nice place, and reasonable prices.
place: Beijing Tong Ren Tang Retail Ltd

text: lovely service and great dessert
a popular place. yummy! worth the waiting.
good ice cream and waffle. long line but it moved fairly quickly.
loved it, unique. but a bit pricey.
nice and interesting. tasty deserts.
delicious! good range of flavours and combinations.
i just love this little place, shame its not a bigger shop with a coffee seating area.. these waffles are just delicious, love how you can have as many toppings as you like.
best dessert in a while.
this desert is one of a kind! whenever you happen to pop in china town, this is a have-to-go place.
bubblewrapwaffle is an amazing little shop, it has great fast service. you can also watch the process as its made which is interesting. i definitely would recommend them.

the desserts are quite unique and this is what really led us here when we saw people walking around with the waffle looking conesthe queue was long. it took over 20 minutes to get our orderyou may however want to share this with a friend if you're not a fan  of that much sugar intake
my bubblewrap ice cream (regular waffle, matcha ice cream, white choc sauce and strawberries) was both delicious and pretty. the service was friendly and despite the line i didn't have to wait long.
had the classic matcha & red bean & mochi flavour bubble wrap, apparently a great combo and i quite liked it except a little pricey. wished the queue was shorter lol.

we drove over an hour just to come back here because it was sooo good. as we got there they closed but fizz let us in, kindly and was yet again impressed both with the customer service and the dessert! got recognised by one of the employees too which added to the experience! definitely coming back.
i've had bubblewrap before but this one is simply the best!  the bubbles are light and crispy and they break away easily. delicious!
incredible food! definitely going again with friends
perfect location and totally loved the waffle with ice cream
best damn waffles has plant-based options
really cool concept! great choices but crowded inside and no seating.
these are so good!
great place for bubble waffle conveniently located in china town. vegan options available and matcha ice cream as well! my favourite is banana combo with dark chocolate give it a try!
crowdedoverpriced no special taste its a waffle with ice cream in itpickpockets there so be aware
the waffles were very good, unfortunately they were out of most ice cream flavours when we arrived.
7 is expensive but its worth the experience at least once
beautiful and tasty dessert.very busy most times but it worthwhile the wait enjoy.
i had the matcha waffle with one scoop matcha ice cream and one scoop strawberry cheesecake and it was delicious
awesome waffle, nice ice cream and an amazing opportunity to step up your instagram game! totally worth the line thats always there...
i love it so light and yummy

unique dessert on wardour street. as can be expected, queue is quite long. the space it very small. service is fast and friendly. the waffle choices are either template or create your own, which gives a lot of choices to customers. this is a good choice for dessert or quick summer bite. price is reasonable/ affordable.
arrive at store before closing time advertised on door and was turned away
$10 for takeaway icecream waffle and poor standard.different quality tof the product for different clients.
do not come here. they advertise closing at 10:30 but close at 10pm! and shut the door in my face
really love it! unfortunately there is no space to sit
amazing desert, and quick service. worth the money

different and very good desserts. the line is always long and out the door. it's a very very small space. if you don't want to wait in line, you can just have a look from the street window.the place smells super sweet from the bubble waffles being baked on site. the service is very kind and helpful. i recommend it!
my daughter enjoyed her bubblewrap. i didn't get much change out of a 10..
had the vanilla crunch which was amazing. love the idea and after a long walk in london you definitely need something like this. sweet and fun!
nice experience! delicious!
one of the best waffles i have ever had!!! if i'm in the area i would most certainly go again. @khana.guy
light, crunchy. evenly delicious.highly recommended.
it was good but i got stressed while ordering my food.
so good, generous portion size and the staff are always lovely. love coming back again and again.
this is some serious desert. well worth it and definately highly recommended.

i customised my own bubble wrap and combined strawberry mochi, sliced strawberries, along with the strawberry gelato and rose petal toppings  totally recommend this combo...if youre a fan of strawberries  its nice to stand near the waffle making machines when its cold outside
great icecream with tasteful waffles
very tasty but slow service.

finally jumping on the bandwagon and tried a bubblewrap waffle here. order pay and taste! everything goes very smoothly. it suits asian tasting bud very well, not super sweet. regardless, the waffle is quite expensive, perhaps a bit overpriced. you can usually have a proper restaurant dessert for the same price.

we waited 15 mins on a sunny saturday afternoon, which is fine. the waffle was delicious, i got the one with strawberry and vanilla ice cream. it was gone quite quickly i gotta say: a bit more ice cream would have been great.
great place to have a dessert in london, but the cafe is too small. the waffle is a signature menu here.

i wanted to visit bubblewrap for months and i've been following them on instagram for at least a year or two--it was completely worth the wait. one of the best desserts i've ever had. i'll be visiting again soon!
a lot of waiting, tastes nice, fun to eat
such fun! delicous waffles with awesome combo ingredients
a novelty at best.
loved every bite. will def see you guys again.
very delicious

great, like everybody i had to queue one hour for trying the bubble wrap. like everybody  i dont remember how it tasted. and like everybody, i could instagram my bubble wrap, get my likes and thats the most important!
the bubble wrap was amazing there. i love it. in germany it was not so good as in london. so if i travel to london, i come back.

central china town so expect queues and high prices. we were lucky and there was pretty much no one when we visited.the waffles are tasty and have a good selection of toppings.only downside is the price, which in my opinion, is high for what it is.
great place where to go when you love sweat. you can choose your favorite waffle.
the line was unbelievable, but so was the food! i will say that waffle was worth waiting 50 minutes for...
just one word... amazing....!!!
delicious!!! long queue but well worth it!
good but not as good as the hype
i am still surprised how tasty it is.. wonderful
tasty! and very tasty!!
keeps me coming back. i like the peanut butter one.
great place for a desert style meal very highly recommend this place for a visit if you are in london don't be fooled by nearby imitations
amazing dessert. there is a queue always, but it doesn't take too long. you can also create your own and it is very filling.
waffle are great, however i went a bit crazy with the toppings, probably you only need 2 or 3. great service from the staff as well.
wow, the line moves extremely quickly, and boy is it worth it! if you're in the area, stop here and come get some!
nice friendly waffle/ice-cream shop.expect a 20 min wait during busy times.always a  good quality product served.very tasty deserts if your around china town,worth a vist!!
wow  good food means long queue .... they served fast. so it went well. especially the waffle was absolutely delicious.
delicious waffles and ice cream.
it was okay just to try it out. nothing to write home about. wouldn't go again to be honest.
must try it even you are on diet. lol.
7.49 is a lot to spend on a egg waffle. the waffle was a bit too crispy (and empty inside) so it just fell apart easily. gelato was good. presentation was also beautiful.
fantastic place for a delicious treat!
cool little place to get waffles and feel the positive vibes of one's of the most festive places i've been in london
the original and best bubblewrap waffle in london. nobody else comes close to their recipe or choice of combinations!
best bubble wrap!
such a delicious treat! the best in soho!
great blend of ice cream, toppings really pack a punch, peanut butter was lovely and surrounded by soft waffle. bliss! there is no seating inside and just a grab and go place.
yum. very good with allergens
it was so nice such an experience. the ice cream and waffle was so good together
well, this is a must when you are in chinatown. it tastes just as good as it looks. be ready for stares and selfies while walking around with this ice-cream.
love you guys. i would love to see a cinnamon apple flavour out there one day. :)

i grew up with this traditional chinese sweet treat....but making it more exciting with ice cream and toppings. highly recommended. i opted for matcha ice cream, sliced strawberries and maltesers....very good indeed! definitely a treat but worth it!

delicious! the cue moves very quick, and despite the line the staff are friendly and helpful! best bit. they have vegan options! only one premade vegan choice, but you can build your own which is awesome! expect to spend a minimum of 8
yummy yummy. long queue but nice dessert, fresh bubblewrap. price between 7-9
sooo good, you can pick so many different flavours and toppings and they're all so great, just be prepared for people to constantly ask where you got it from!!
a little bit of heaven in a bubblewrap waffle!!! highly recommend you give these guys a try!

the most insane sensory journey in the ice cream world. once you have tried it you just want to go back. as it is a very popular spot, queues are massive so don't let this stop you. be patient and you will be rewarded.
tasty but pricey for what it is. 9 with all the toppings.
very good quality ice cream and the cone is so light and tasty.
best bubble waffle in town! it's expensive, but it's worth it! also the service is always really quick despite the long queue. extremely recommended.
great ice cream with egg waffles similar to those in hong kong. i liked that you could customise the toppings, and i chose nutella, hazelnuts and oreo to go with hazelnut ice cream
wow!! taste sensors exploding!! this place is amazing. so many different flavours and variety to enjoy. the freshness of the waffle is astound. straight from the grill into your hand.
its an amazing experience.. if your a ice cream lover, an unique cone made of waffle ... and the rest it's just magicalkunio vlogs, honest review
the bubble wrap waffle is amazing, you should visit if you like waffles
wow, very tasty
amazing. talked me through the menu because i was a waffle beginner. loved it. and very lovely staff too.
best bubble waffles in the world! i had the vanilla icecream with strawberries and nutella.  it even beats those that you find in hong kong and asia.
absolutely delightful! such a fun and unique desert. plus it's yummy of course! i would highly recommend it!
was good last year, unsure what happened but i wouldn't go there again.. waffle wasn't what it used to be..
great tasting waffles and ice cream combos
such a delicious and positive experience, great bubblewrap waffle with a lot of vegan options! i was also surprised with the large portion sizes. i highly recommend this place :)

right in the heart of chinatown, shame they can't have a larger space because the cashier is right by the door, which means sometimes you'll be waiting in the rain. they have a great selection of flavours and there's generally new seasonal items to try if you visit often
loved this place such a creative way to have a waffle. with such scrumptious flavours. i love that you can create your own and the fact that they had vegan options

very tasty ice cream!!you have option to choose your own combination or to take one of the recommended ones.we took vanilla base, strawberry cheese cake ice cream with a topping of condence milk and strawberry.
a great idea! waffle was nice and light and the toppings were delicious
wow,my wife is happy,see you next time.
very yummy! long line but went fast.

they should pay attention what we really want but i know they just want to sell this evening i asked for chocolate icecream and vanilla plus doble chocolate sauce and i get something that i wasn't expecting. i'm really disappointed
the staff were very helpful with advising on dietary requirements.
tasted delicious, great customer service, good texture in the food, friendly staff

my nieces place of choice for her birthday treat. it's a tiny shop, but full of temptation.  the freshly made waffles can be filled with your choice of ice cream,  fruits and syrups.  plenty to choose from.
possibly the best bubble waffle shop i've been to! if i lived in london, i'd most likely go here every week!
quick serving. good selection
i'm in love with this store.  next time i will visit it again . i highly recommended!!

oh love the unique idea of bubble wrap waffles and  gelato...i had a customized apple pie waffle with strawberry cheesecake gelato.. sprinkled with kitkat and white chocolate..it was simply amazing..!!
we come here everytime we come to london, i can not recommend this place highly enough,friendly staff
it was absolutely lush, so good, light n fluffy..defoe going back for more yummmmmyyyyyyy
unbelievably brilliant dessert concept. where's this been all my life?
pricey but very nice

been here too many times to count. the lines can be a little long, but they move quick. double bae is my favourite at the moment. prices are a bit high, but well worth it and expected for this part of town. highly recommend for anyone who is a foodie or just loves desserts!

great ice creams. i had tried more than a couple of time to have one, but for different reasons i wasnt able to. finally i had the opportunity and it was worth it. dont be afraid of the long line, you wouldnt regret the waiting time.
amazing waffles but the store is tiny and there's hardly any space to stand and wait for your order as it gets very busy.
heaven. long queue but worth the wait
three vegan ice cream flavours that were all yummy. the vegan peanut butter waffle base was delicious too. very substantial snack.
friendly staff, who can help your choices.
loved it. and very lovely staff too.
very delicious! recommend to taste! :)
great place for a sweet treat, fantastic range of flavours and toppings, long queues and not cheap but well worth it.
bubblewrap pop delightful treat. will definitely return

if you don't mind paying a lot of money for a desert then the bubblewrap is for you (and all the tourists of chinatown). the bubblewraps themselves are made fresh but the ice cream is not that great - it's the style you'd get in a 100l tub from tesco.

very good place for dessert. lots of different mix and match options as can make your own combination. also have vegan options which is good as many ice cream places don't cater for this. can be quite a wait to be served and it's also quite a small and narrow shop so can be quite a squeeze.
loved every bite! great concept, good quality ice cream...yummy toppings!
who wouldnt love a fresh waffle hugging heavenly treats like oreos, kitkats, gelato, and nutella drizzle? yes, the line can be long, but its worth the wait.
cant beat a bubble wrap, presentation and choice of flavours awesome. queues do get a bit long as very popular.
it was very delicious! for a long time this was on my list to try! i shared this one with my hubby and it was still too much. the only thing was the price, its quite expensive.. but yeah its london.
lovely! i ordered oreo up, and my friend tried the banana one and we both enjoyed it.
great place to try bubble waffles! hot, fresh and delicious - staff are very friendly and have great bants with their customers. must try!
amazing bubblewrap waffles. i have tasted them in tokyo at tokyo tower and i can guarantee you these are better! also the stuff seems to be nice hardworking japanese teenagers.
great place if you like taking photos of your food for social media tricky to eat but very nice
queue can get quite long, especially at busy times, but the bubble waffle is delicious. would recommend.

"nut feast with matcha waffle": the very flavorful matcha waffle is crusty on the outside but soft and melty in the middle; well matched with quality hazelnut gelato topped with a decent portion of hazelnuts - no cheating. will definitely return to try other flavors.
ok, it's good, but not heavenly. i wish the waffle was warm.the waiting line is absurd, come early.
i like waffles and i like ice cream.....what more could i ask for in a venue !
top waffles 10/10 would recommend (already brought all my friends).
so yummy
definitely you must try it if you visit london!the only thing is that probably you'll have to wait about half an hour because the place is quite small and there are a lot of people waiting outside.
product's are good and tasty but at the same time is a bit too exspensive for so little ice cream that u get.
the bubbles are awesome, but i had ice cream on top, which kind of screws it. the area is very busy in the middle of china town, and there is no place to sit, just standing in the rain outside
really tasty, and a good price (between 5-8) don't be put off by the queue, it moves quite fast!
you gotta go here. it's like a fun crepe with bubbles and amazing icecream!
delicious bubble waffle - we tried vanilla crunchy one :). but it is quite expensive - 7,5

firs time i try a bubblewaffle.i ordered the oreo crunchy caramel cheesecake. the waffle itself was thin and delicious. i contained a ball of cheesecake icecream topped with caramel and 4 oreo cookies.just delicious.
a bit disappointing to be honest. not much better than an average stall you'd find anywhere and triple the price.
excellent waffles and quality ingredients.
great bubble waffle, nice dessert to share
delicious waffles and beautiful presentation of food. definitely a must try in china town. don't let the long queues to scare you off.
lovely desert shop nothing more to say really
the pictures dont justify the taste! love it! i got the flavor that is the first on the menu! i loved it!
well worth queuing up for, the queues can be out the door, when ever we goto chinatown we go here for dessert. amazing worth every penny.
so delicious hong kong waffle. definitely buy it again.
so, so good! definitely recommend.

loved the bubble waffle cone but the ice cream itself was just standard ice cream and so you're definitely just paying for the novelty of a fluffy waffle cone than any of the ingredients. instagram worthy and hip and as such a long line no matter that it was a rather chilly day even by london standards. one time stop for me.
i loved it but the wrap could have been crispy.
love this place, there is sometimes a queue out the door, but it is worth the wait! lovely to see an independent place thrive in an increasingly chain filled city!
my girl had one and loved it!!!
great waffles with a bunch of options, they have something for every palate. the only downside is the line that is out the door, about a 20 minute wait to get your waffle.
very pretty waffles (instagram worthy) but not as tasty as i would have hoped.
it tasted as good as it looks. a must try.
delicious, really big serving! lots of different flavours to choose from.
my happy place
amazing waffles! really friendly staff
everyone who loves sweat should try these bubble waffles
the bubble waffles are so crunch, yet soft! delicious! very pricey for what it is, but hey: look how insta-worthy they are?
it was amazing.
fantastic, and very crowded.
decided to visit this as its a instagram place to go. we were lucky enough to get there 2-4-1 offer day, so worth the price. good waffles and delicious ice-cream.
amazing and delicious!
unique and tasty however rather expensive (5-6 pounds per dessert)

nice presentation, tasty gelato, friendly staff. was lucky enough not to queue for silly time. place itself is really tiny, can accommodate max ten people at once than you have to wait / queue outside.
if you want to have delicious waffli then this is your place..
nothing fancy, mostly ice cream in a weird cone with some pieces of fruit; cute though, and good tourist attraction.
