nice waffles, but quite expensive for what they are. they look very pretty and the fillings are nice!
friendly staff and quick service despite the line.
its a crazy queue and waffles of its kind! you cant miss it out. while youre indulging in it and someone calls you fat, eat them too!
this was my favorite thing i ate in london
amazing  please do the vegan one everyday
the icecream was delicious, i'd like a little more of strawberries but was delicious!
not highly priced,  their bubble wrap waffle is so tasty

lined up for 30 minutes.  they need to improve their work flow to service customers quicker.  the waffles with an air pocket was a nice gimmick and makes it lighter than it looks.  ice cream was just ok.  thought it was too expensive, even for london.  the waffle tasted fresh but was just ok.  this gimmick will wear off soon.
delicious waffles
fun and really tasty!
omg so good.  staff were friendly the bubblewrap was sooooo good
would definitely give zero if i can. the egg waffle is soggy and the vanilla ice cream has a weird plastic taste..please dont waste your money and time on this
extremely busy and there's always a long queue but the waffle and ice cream tastes great.
waffles are really tasty but not sure if worth the wait

great for a treat. the toppings are expensive considering the serving offered (it's trendy, and that's what you're paying for) but everything is fresh, and the dark chocolate ice-cream was delicious.there was a 15 minutes wait but the staff is incredibly fast.

there is usually a long queue, but totally worth the wait. at least you have enough time to decide which amazing ice cream flavours and toppings you want and change your mind 3 times. the waffle is always freshly made and tastes amazing
very cool and fun waffles

not that great and way overpriced. the size of this dessert is huge. but they put one little scoop of gelato in a very big cone. the waffle bubble wrap cone was quite dry and tasteless but the gelato was good. its a tourist area, what do you expect.
something different that you need to taste. the ice cream was very good.

wow!!!!! today ive been in the shop for the first time and i tried the bubble wrap waffle  and it was delicious !!!! the one that i tried its called (deluxe love). to be honest i recommend this place to waffle lovers!!!

absolutely delicious. we had to wait for a bit to get in (it was on a monday after lunch), but it was totally worth it. i had an original waffle with vanilla ice cream, whipped cream and raspberries on top. and the other one was the same, but with fudge and caramel. they were amazing :)
if you partner likes waffles and ice cream. then this place is for you.
perfect place to have a dessert! great location, friendly staff and good service. bubblewrap very tasty, freshly made with different options of ice cream and toppings.
very popular for good reason. fast service, lovely ice cream waffles with great selection.
what can i say. if you like sweet waffles then be prepared for a taste sensation.
such scrumptious flavours. i love that you can create your own and the fact that they had vegan options.

great space for a casual lunch. the cantonese style buns are very good, if a little expensive, especially if you have been to hong kong. lots of nice touches, in particular the design of the take away boxes
perfection!!!!! as i see it, it's a must while in the area. you'll thank me later....
great food, beautifully decorated and a wonderful atmosphere in the tea room downstairs. it's a very peaceful place to have a drink and reminiscent of an older time.
traditional chinese buns
the taste of the bun is roughly average,  but the rice using in the rice box is far below average, not really recommended but still can have a try
nice option for a little snack near leicester square. pretty tasty. small bao, prices a bit high for what you get. crowded and a bit chaotic during after work, pretheater.
good buns, good cheung fun. a lot of the buns were sold out when i went as it was an hour before close. would visit again to try their best-selling buns and custard tart
came here for the custard bun. it was delicious! make sure to get extra napkins.
bun and ox stripe were delicious, but the seatings are very cramped and not clean
absolutely delicious as always. i totally recommend the veg bun and glass noodle salad. plus, the takeaway containers are so cute!
delightful buns everywhere
great dumplings, fair price. and don't miss the little chinese fresh pancake stall round the corner on the side street, also belonging to the same place.
excellent, just a shame there isn't more seating for larger groups.

the place is very small and we had to wait around 15/20 minutes to sit down. later we ordered (the food is very quick to make) and we had to eat so fast because a lot of people were waiting to seat and they continued to ask us if we were finishing so they could reserve the table. that has been a bit upsetting.
epic buns at reasonable prices. convenient central location - ideal to stop off for a snack while exploring soho.
very good bun with reasonable price - highly recommended
really good food, cool vibes, and attentive service. the cocktails are so unique and tasty, too. everything was delicious, especially the dan tat at the end :)
a bit slow service.
good buns! pork and lamb in particular
good place for steamed buns. we had the custard bun which i loved. can't find these anywhere else

its an interesting restaurant in soho, not like other chinese restaurants in china town. its small, and only serves steamed buns. highly recommend the lamb and curd buns. but the service is too slow in the morning.
really good and cheap. they are not big plates

the best buns ever! the place has limited seating and pretty packed in the evening. we were lucky to get a seat and enjoy the soft buns! we tried the chicken, fish and veg buns - all came out great! a must try if you are in soho.
a place to try out various buns and traditional chinese food.
best custard buns.

nice street food for hk buns and some of their authentic foods. good price for two, slightly small portion but you can always add one more side dish to cover. i also recommend their real restaurant based in basement of the same place. their fried rice is soso good.

absolutely nice!!! tipical asiatic atmosphere, amazing, i saw that bun only in the japanese cartoon before and once tried you cant do without, they dont have to many seats, but the place is absolutely lovely, anyway they have a restaurant in the basement, so you have a large choose
great buns
good food really great atmosphere
really tasty bao buns. succelent and lots of choice of flavours. vegetarian options available as well
delicious, cheap fluffy buns in a relaxed, informal cafe.
bun house never disappoints
loved pig, and lamb bun, will go back to try again.
one word: wow! we were searching for quick food before the musical, popped in that heaven of a place and enjoyed every bite then ordered two more buns to go. wow
amazing food, great beer, visit every time i have a chance

love the interesting flavour combinations, especially the cumin lamb and the veg. sadly, they didn't have the red chocolate bun, which sounded interesting. the egg custard bun and glass noodles were good, too. relatively pricey for asian steamed buns, but worth it!
dont miss it
delicious, quick ...reasonable!
the best custard buns in london
delicious food and great atmosphere
lovely place lovely price
both bun house and tea room are amazing. buns are exceptional and tea room is just like a bar from bladerunner.
this restaurant is over rated.the veggie was too salted, chicken wing was too sweet, not tasted at all. clay port rice wasnt crispy. only the drink and the service is ok.not worth for the price.
have the custard bun, dont have the fish bun
i can't stress on how you must go here for the best buns in town!
go downstairs to check the beautiful tea room first if you're not going to get take away! especially if you like the film "in the mood for love" ;)
food was super yummy and staff were really friendly :) also the decor was so nice! would definitely recommend checking this place out. and the prices were very reasonable.

delicious, soft, tasty buns. i tried all apart from the chocolate buns which were sold out. all were flavourful but my favourites were the pig bun and the fish bun. the tripe was amazing too. there is limited seating here so you should get takeaway. i will definitely return.
great little place for steamed buns! they have a small selection, but each one is quality!  the custard buns are a must

this quaint little place has amazing chinese buns. the three different types that we tried here were really good. i really liked the custard one.they have some beers on offer which are not your regular chinese beer (read: tsingtao), but offer something unique to the food.the food is quick and very affordable.
very tasty. the food is very nice and the atmosphere is beautiful.
had the egg tarts and a custard bun. the custard bun was great, and the egg tarts were good but the pastry on the egg tart could have been better.

if upstairs had no seats, go downstairs! they have a different menu and they are equally good. nice place to catch up with friends over yummy food. try the salty egg ice cream, they are surprisingly good!
i love love love the custard buns. fast service, great food. unfortunately, its quite small. dont expect to be seated.
fast service. yummy buns. what more can one ask for! :)
good and fast service food was alright
yummy... custard and shrimp and lamb ... all great

lovely, reasonably priced  hong kong snacks. the chilli tripe is delicious as are all the buns. my daughter loves the chicken wings too. downstairs has really great decoration, a well stocked bar, and an interesting atmosphere.
great selection of buns. quick and tasty. definitely going again.
3rd time here, all i can say is yum!
lamb bao and pork bao are great
found this place by accident and came in to get some buns and really enjoyed everything from the service to the food. first voyage into cantonese cuisine. 5/5
awesome buns, very good prices, i recommend the chicken one
moody place with an asian vibe. great buns for a reasonable price. don't hesitate to try a bun if you're around! tip: i preferred the fish one over the classic pork bun.
best salty egg yolk bao
the fish and pig were my favourite! my gf said the veggie one is great as well.
really nice , quick , clean and tasty
nice buns with tasty fillings
the baos at bun house are amazing! i tried every bao on the menu and i would recommend the pig and the custard baos for sure. the iced teas were a disappointment though.

one of the best bun places i have ever being in, i take my friends there all the time every time we go tourism near the chinese neighbourhood its a great place with plenty of bun variety and some intresting and original beers.
cheap and chirpy quick bite without pesky extras.wholesome food served steaming hot. brilliant in cold evenings.
amazing buns! so tasty and so good! the best ones i have ever had! the place is also very authentic. great place, great food, great price!
lovely central spot for a hot steamed bun on the go. fish buns highly recommended
fantastic ambiance, excellent food. would recommend
my first experience at a restaurant like this. it was quite unique and unexpected. i found it a little pricey but probably within range for the area.
super soft buns and amazing taste, tried the pork and chicken. pork was amazing would suggest trying with chilli oil not to spicy but great flavour.
simple but nice. like chicken liver bao. :xxx and soya milk
expensive and the drinks are disgusting
best bun ever had! given the taste of the buns, paying around two pound for each bun is more than reasonable! moreover, each bun is pretty large and really satisfying. can't expect more from 2 pound!
very good place to go out with friends!
lamb chicken pork custard buns are all very good!
inexpensive and tastes great
very nice. the pork and lamb were nice. the chilli oil really upgrades it all.
food good.
great flavors but a bit pricey.
stopped past here for a quick after theatre snack, was perfect and hit the spot!!!!!! great selection to choose from and the buns come in an awesome little box to take away!
buns were tasty!! i like the pork one, as well as the custard one. the chilli tripe was so good too, if you like cow stomach and hot spicy food you should definitely give a try ;)
bit overpriced, but food are delicious!
custard buns are best in london. also try the curried fish balls and the pork bao you'll not be disappointed

food in soho (especially on the go-ho (geddit?)) can be hit-and-miss. but bun house always delivers the goods. the dumplings are delicious. faces light up after the first bite. i suggest ordering the less conventional side-dishes: tripe and fish balls.
good food.  garlic basil wings and glass noodle salad really good.  fish bun and chicken bun great too
amazing!
the pork bun is delicious, the chicken could do with a more distinctive flavour. great for a quick lunch or pre-theatre bite. service can be a bit haphazard though.
nice food. quite dark but the food is amazing.
best buns in london
over price! only the dumpling was nice out of 8 items. small potion but not great taste. 12 half % service charge.

loved the buns. we ate the veggie buns only and had the sour plum tea. yummy! kept coming back for more... ended up buying 8 buns for two people! the service was very perfunctory- could be a lot friendlier
chinese bapao. for me its like snack.
quick service and great food.
pig bun is delicious!
quick service and delicious buns!
piping hot melting salted egg custard buns are a must get! together with their sour plum juice. the tea room downstairs is swanky and takes you back to 70s hong kong! fantastic place to be!
very nice buns but expensive for the size :( 2.50 for one which is roughly the size of a cupcake instead of the muffin sized ones you can get round the corner.

nice buns very fluffy  and nice filling but that's it. the tea and the other food are just average very over priced for what you get...i did not go downstairs for the other menu so can't comment about that side otherwise the bun are  worth a try but i don't think i be back in the near future.........
beef rice was very tasty

delicious buns. i would recommend the pork, lamb and custard buns and a chili tripe and fried cheung fan for the sides.minus two stars off as even though i like this place, the last time we were here it took them 30 mins to make the tripe and cheung fan. no apologies at all.
tasty buns in reasonable price. the starters , fish balls and gloss noodles are very good as well. highly recommended
delicious and affordable, but queues are ridiculously long sometimes

amazing restaurant with lovely outdoor seating! the staff are very pleasant and food is top notch! not to mention the price which is simply unbelievable considering the location and the food quality. they also serve imported drinks such as the soy milk from hong kong which i will recommend.
really nice loved it

being so close to china town its hard to beat the meat bun options available a few minutes away.  however, the dessert buns were really good.  if you're passing by and in need of a sweet treat the custard bun and red chocolate bun are worth the money.next time though i think i'll try the tea room downstairs
very quaint little spot. really enjoyed the food - nothing fancy but delicious. would recommend for a low-fuss, speedy meal.

the male chinese server here is rude to asian or chinese customer in compares to caucasian ones, it feels targeted. dont come to this place if youre chinese, despite that it is an chinese restaurant, they rather have white customer lol
great place. amazing buns at great value. soft and fluffy. chicken and fish the best.only  2.50 each..great atmosphere
really special place. good vegi buns:)
didn't get a chance to try everything as we had just ate downstairs at the tea room but the buns tasted good and the noodles looked  live.

delicious bao place that you definitely need to try if youre a fan of bao buns. there are various flavors, my personal favorite was the pig bao! they also have other dishes worth trying - you wont regret it!
cute little place in chinatown, amazing steamed shumai dumplings and beef bao!recommend
simple yet fragrant buns delivered quickly and to very high standards.
quick and easy and not bad for the price
quirky cocktails and food. very kind staff but takes a little while to get your drinks . fun themed night overall.
excellent! no line and great help from the ladies at the counter.
delicious buns and unusual cinese beers for a convenient price!
really cheap buns (2.50) and really fast service (5 mins or so). all options are really tasty but would strongly recommend the custard bun for dessert

some of the best buns i've had in london were from here. they have a good selection and they also do takeaway which is a plus. the bao's are light, fluffy and not to stodgy and the filling are well flavoured and tasty!

one of best bao zi (bun) in london. must-try : custard bun, pork bun. i tried mushroom (vegetables) bun yesterday, really good ! nice interior design, ambient. they got a crepe shop just behind the bun house, nice taste as well !
great buns, the staff is not too smiley and helpful but its a nice stop on the way :)
the best baos in london
bun is not tasty nor authentic . those think the bun good might never tried real buns.
delicious and very cheap buns
the chicken, lamb, beef and custard buns were incredible!

really nice interior, cosy and very reasonable prices. the buns are freshly made, super fluffy and delicious. the hong kong milk tea is well made but the portion is a tad bit disappointing. staff seem friendly,  quick and efficient. definitely would recommend eating here if you are around.
great place to eat. pork buns followed custard ones are the way to go!!! messy but deliciously rich and tasty.
really lovely food. if you want to know which bun is which the chinese symbols are at the bottom of your receipt.
got the salted egg custard bun to take away...it was warm, gooey and pretty delicious. hard to eat without getting messy. pricey for a relatively small custard bun but quality was good.
lovely service, relaxed and affordable. brilliant buns
amazing! buns were okay, but would recommend getting the rice pots/small dishes. flavour was very good and decent price. definitely coming back to try other small dishes here.
nice cosy small place with great flavour bao & other asian food. good atmosphere and friendly service, would definitely recommend if passing through the area
wow, spontaneously decided to pop in for a single bun and ended up ordering a plate. cozy and tasteful interior, chilled lo-fi tunes, friendly staff and absolutely fantastic food!
so good! love their veggie buns

perfectly located near the theatre playing harry potter--- between parts i and ii, just go there to sample the spring rolls with wasabi mayo (what an invention!) or the lace crispy dumplings, and just sit there and watch the theatre district crowds parade by out the huge front windows.
good menu but not to vegetarians

delicious, hot, and perfectly spiced. i am perpetually on a quest for the best bao--an honorable journey of eating my way through three continents of meats and sweets in bun form. bun house is up there. they have my stomach, heart, and loyalty as the bao-bassadors of london.
really good service. the cashier this evening was really friendly and helpful!
great food!! highly recommend!
so good. food was excellent service was fast very cosy. i can't wait to go again
good taste and good price. the barbecue pig is the really good

went to have a beer and was charged 5 for a small bottle and the beer was warm. when asked about a cold one i was told they didnt have any. would have preferred to have been told before they opened the bottle so i could have at least changed drink option.

great place for a quick feed! the place was buzzing when we got there and a few items on the menu had sold out so would recommend going early. loved the lamb bun and the custard bun was also an unexpected hit! will definitely be back!
delicious and fast. makes chinatown fast food much more accessible.
coziest place ever to have yummy buns! everything we got was fantastic, and the upstairs room is sooo nice and cute.
great place to stop for a quick bite. friendly, fresh and easy
great range of well priced buns, restaurant inside has a nice interior as well. lots of sides as well which can be ordered alongside the buns
good but not incredible. better buns in other restaurants in the same area
food is very good tastes "real" - just a lot smaller than my expectation (especially the beef brisket rice)

beautiful. they sell quick individual delicious buns for 2.5. i loved the veggie one but i wanted so many more. they don't have a bundle price where you can buy lots of buns for a cheaper price. other than that, all good.
the glass noodles is too good!
so good i went back for seconds.
so amazing - just go. cheap, delicious, moorish, authentic. not in the centre of china town but worth the extra couple of minutes walking.
super tasty and affordable buns! i especially loved the pork and christmas buns.
loveeee the food here. vintage vibes and very good buns!
love the yasai bao, pickled cucumbers and quick service!
shumai is awesome! cooked fresh
very cozy place. the bao was great and not too expensive
ok place to eat. nothing special.
2 buns and 1 beer cost 8.8 pounds. good! better than beijing dumpling next door.

casa de baos e comida chinesa, o ambiente  muito bom e a comida  espetacular, pedimos o menu de baos que inclui dois baos  escolha e uma cerveja chinesa do dia, pesos tambm um prato de tripas que so maravilhosas e outro de arroz e carne.a cerveja  boa e o lugar  bastante concorrido.  pr pagamento.
tasty and cheap cantonese steamed buns. definitely recommend the custard buns, they are absolutely delicious.
really tasty food and instant bao buns as you order. i'll definitly be back
good buns for cash strapped hungry people. only take credit cards!
delicious custard bun and veggie bun. very filling!
the quality of the dishes we ordered were more like a takeaway than a restaurant. i guess it was our first and last visit to this place.
very authentic
the best buns in town!!!
soooooo damned goodthanks!
great selection of top buns
that custard bun......
quick, simple and tasty.
what a taste on such a small piece of steam bun!
this place is delicious. i've only gotten take away. the chicken rice pot is to die for, and so are the garlic cucumbers. easy on the wallet too. main guy working take away is also always friendly.

buns are great, presentation is good and a very lovely atmosphere with an american style vibe. prices are not too bad, but eating on street would be cheaper and just as nice. here you pay for the experience.
wooden furniture giving the place an authentic asian look. great spicy noodles and great bao.
amazing buns look out for the custard and the brioche like bun they are

this shop actually exceeded my expectations in terms of taste! the curry fish balls and the smashed cucumbers (pretty spicy though) were excellent! the buns themselves were alright, and all in all it was good value in my opinion for the price you pay.
affordable, nice location i go there when i want to try something new and nice

good place for a quick snack. buns were fluffy but the ones with meat didn't have as much filling as i wanted. the egg yolk one was the best though. super messy and delicious.  milk tea was really pricey for just a small cup. but it did taste nice. overall good enough if you were in the area and wanted a snack etc.
excellent and authentic food, tried all of the dim sum and the flavours and quality was on point. definitely would come back again.
recommended! they do absolutely fantastic custard bun, must try, the custard filling will flow out when you take a bite! their shrimp dumpling is also very tasty!

excellent.  just what i needed, a little hungover and this hit the spot.  the lamb belly in particular was excellent. though i think i would struggle to eat more than two.  will be back.  to try the other items on the menumore seats upstairs. no cash accepted, card only.  2.5-6 a dish. 5 for a beer
nice little place. the custard bun is nice. the wings are crispy. definitely want to come back to try more buns.

the food is really good, especially the buns. the setting is also really nice, but very dirty which made me uncomfortable. the tables and dishes are well kept, but a better cleaning of the seatings should be made. the service is good though!

simply, and consistently, the best bao buns in town. i have a preference for their tripe as well, it's delicious, but the rest of the menu is full of great choices, you can't go wrong with this establishment.kudos to the team as well, no matter how busy it gets they're always cheerful and very polite.
so damn tasty! will be back
easy on the menu and easy on the wallet. good amount of choices with comfy happy service. it can get a bit busy at times but it's worth a wait if you must. a bit touristy yet good reliable choice.
great interior and good quality buns.
had to wait over half an hour with no other customers in. ordered beef with rice, beef was too greasy and too tough to chew on, rice was overcoocked. bad experience, never again
nice steamed buns and fish curry balls. quickly served and reasonably priced at 2.50 a bun. need 3 for lunch. very casual. would be 4* but its a bit lifeless and squashed
awesome thick fried noodles with amazing spices .. best i ever had. matched with a really tasty rice wine!

flavours (except the winter special mulled wine) were good and good for quick eat. probably because it was breezy restaurant, the buns came out little cold though. curried fish balls were cooked well and may be my favourite.
i had there just one dish, i think pork dim sam in soup which was good and descent price. there is always a queue there so i can imagine the other dishes are good as well.

bao addiction is a disease. here, the pig bao transports you through seven levels of umami and the duck egg yolk 'custard' bun basically comes from another dimension. my counsellor will be sending you the bill forthwith.
sooo good! so much flavour, buns are wonderfully fluffy and excellent vibe. ho fun is a must try.
the pork and veggie were delicious. so was the cucumber salad.the chicken bun was a bit dissapointing (it has liver in it). also, the beer was warm...
really cheap, lovely food and a great location.
great food, simple and delicious menu, great decor too!
the buns were lovely and the music and decor made me nolstagic! the only thing is that i found the ordering and picking up process slightly chaotic during busy hours.
lamb and mustard bun tastes great! typical cantonese type of buns and not the same as the way northern china cook buns
food is absolutely incredible and really good value for money! service is fast and friendly! i always make sure i drop in if i'm nearby even if i'm not hungry!
great value, great food!

this is amazing. it was my first time trying asian buns, and omg i love it. we tried pork, chicken and veggies (this one is the best) and the noodle salad . the place is quite small, but perfect for a quick bite. and the prices are okay. i will definitely will go back. can't wait
perfectly cooked steam buns for only 2.50. good selection of fillings with the lamb and fish being highlights. quick service with options to eat in, albeit with not much space, or to takeaway.
never disappointed! hole in the wall but love this place and all it has to offer.

fantastic! the buns here are delicious - we always come here whenever we're in london. all the bun options are amazing, watch out for the custard one though, it is quite explodey, in a delicious custardy sort of way.
stumbled across this place on a day out in china town. amazing value for such high quality dishes! id recommend the chicken bao and scallion chicken rice pot.
fluffy steamed buns come cantonese-style at this quick cafe with a late-night drinking den.
small menu with authentic looking tasty buns with excellent fillings. my favorite is the pig bun. also have drinks and salad available. service is friendly and quick

great choice of fillings, freshly made buns. really tasty and not expensive for the area. perfect snack if youre heading to the theatre afterwards. the buns are only served upstairs - very quick service but not that many tables inside.
the pork brisket was good but servings are small for the price. the steam buns are also on the small side. we thought it was just a pay and lock up but one of our buns took almost 30 minutes.
this place is great! best buns in london
simply tasty!! 2.50 for those tasty buns is such a bargain!! the fillings are nicely spiced and the bun is just so fluffy
the food is really good! the menu is quite limited, and the seating space is a bit small. i would definitely recommend!
food and environment are good. everything served like take away, paper bag, disposable bowl, order and collect by yourself. staff really really impolite and impatient.
buns and garlic chicken wings tasted good, especially beef bun. caf is like self-service (you come, order and pick up your order) and it has 6 small tables.

early dinner, simple, good and quick. had three dumplings (pork 2x + vegetables) as well as excellent cow tripes with black bean and coriander - which is enough. it is a very simple place - more of a (good) snack
the staffs are friendly and the food are nice!

offering a wide selection of fresh steamed buns replenished often throughout the day. three ought to do the trick for most, enjoy with a special beer and don't forget about the absolutely amazing house made chilli oil (be warned its quite spicy).
nice buns, open late

cool little place off the main street. maybe a little pricey but food was very tasty and very fresh. had the pork bao and the rice noodle rolls (a first for me) - cheung fun. choose and order at the front desk; collect when ready from the back bar. good lunch stop.
sadly don't take cash. the taste was good
very tasty. always drop by when i'm in the area for the pork bun. the salted egg and custard is tasty too.
the custard in their custard buns tastes amazing, just wish there was more of it.
i really enjoyed the custard buns and wok fried cheung fun. staff could be more friendly.
really exceptional buns and flavours. must have a custard bun.
the bao bun was super fluffy, sweet and delicious. probably the best bao bun ive ever had. it was there perfect comfort food for the cold weather. would 100% go back. defo recommend !!
really good dim sum here. my favourite is the runny custard bun which is hard to find in the uk. they also do a variety of other chinese dim sum which is all freshly made and tasty.
delicious buns, cucumber and great curried fish balls. eat in the very pretty tiled room or take out.only thing we were less into was the salted soda - it was diet. tea probably a better bet.
lovely street food to have around chinatown. came once and was pretty satisfied. as a fellow chinese person, i would advice ordering the pork meat one as its usually the best in buns!
delicious, fast and good value for money. staff were also friendly and the atmosphere was very cosy and nice
ideal for a quick lunch on the go. buns were tasty, with interesting flavours, and the restaurant was very cute inside.

the buns are one of the best ones i've had around chinatown. bun house has a pretty nice selection of buns as well. i highly recommend this place for a quick bite or takeaway. their custard bun makes for a great dessert after all their other options.

go here. get the custard bun. it is worth all the hype. some people say it's expensive, but i got 3 buns (pork lamb and custard, all amazing - the lamb a little spicy and with a lovely base note of cumin) for 7.50 and was full.
best buns i've ever had. fresh, fluffy, and seemingly all hand made from scratch. side dishes like noodles are also very flavourful. friendly and fast staff.
amazing buns! great for quick service
very cute place! portions are small so need to order at least a few things for a meal. otherwise, great for a snack. the buns were great.
the food was delicious and good value for money.
decent buns and good selection of quick snacks. take card payments which is rare in chinatown.
amazing find in heart of china town slighlty tucked out of sight. reasonable prices and great beer selection. i go here solely for their custard buns alone. delicious.
nice place for casual chinatown dumplings and tasty sides away from sometimes chaotic restaurants on main strip.
love the custard (lau sa) buns!
fantastic buns and even better smashed cucumbers and rolled rice noodles. nice beers to go with.
really nice bun, large choice and typical drinks also available.too bad that the seating is a bit random.
great food and good prices. staff are very friendly also
wow! the buns were amazing! we came back for them for several time while we stayed in london.
good food and cool atmosphere upstairs

a small place making chinese steamed buns. they are tasty, albeit smallish at 2.50. we had the lamb, pork, vegetable, custard, beef and fish buns. all were good. the custard one is made with salted duck eggs, but tastes like normal custard more or less.
small and quirky. very tasty buns
very good food, non ernational service
best, fastest food in central by a mile. this is a need-to-know place
my favourite place to go of all time

super cheap fun and authentic buns!! you pick what buns you want at the counter (i highly recommend the custard buns!) and they stamp them all so you know what they are. take them upstairs to eat with some complimentary sriracha and you're set!

fantastic quality and great price.highlights for me are the custard bun and mantau which are as good as i've had in taiwan. bo lo yao bao was unfortunately a bit poor so avoid that but everything else on the menu is excellent.if you were umming and ahhing about the trip, just get it. also fantastic.
good food, fast and cheap. load up on buns in a matter of minutes. the chilli rice pot was way too much for my weak spice tolerance.
good prices, very clean and pretty spacious with a chilled environment (1920s-ish) and delicious mantou as well, definitely recommended

not much more to say than, absolutely stunning bao buns! the buns here are better than any we were able to find whilst visiting china last year.the place itself is a bit scruffy but feels very authentic. a great place to stop off for lunch or just a snack.
great finger food.  daily special was divine.
really nice buns in london. love it! the pork, the beef, the salty egg custard one is lovely!
amazing buns and always friendly staff. one with custard is a must to try.
waited for 20mins to get my two side dishes. no apologies at all. the taiwanese staff (perhaps a manager) is extremely rude.
love this place ! very casual joint
whole lot of fun. second but to none. pick your fillings and your style, then your wait will be worthwhile.
nice little place for a quick lunch or snack, good friendly service in chinatown and food is lovely too
seriously mediocre buns & dishes. would suggest trying other more authentic restaurants in chinatown
the custard bun was fantastic. really tasty filling. i also really enjoyed the pork bun.
oh yeah, the staff are nice, try a custard bun, eat whilst hot
lovely buns! the duck egg custard is
always delicious at a great price!
went to eat here with a malaysian friend, they were impressed. really tasty authentic malaysian food. staff were friendly, efficient and portions were good
good food at reasonable prices
haven't been here for 4 years, live out of london. food is still excellent and very good value, staff always friendly. decor upgrade really makes it special.
big selection of food, decent portion and good value for money.
laksa is incredible, go now...

very poor. beef rendang was microwaved, food was hot on the outside and cold in the inside - how old was this beef rendang?  neither was it good value at 10 for 4 small peices of beef.  rest of the food was mediocre, surprisingly for its location in central london.   better malaysian food elsewhere.

there may be a wait and a line ride at popular times but it is worth it. the food is delicious. good singapore laksa and the nasi gorang also yummy. yes it is busy and yes expect that your dishes may not all come out at the same time but that's part of it and the focus is on the food.
always yummy and bustling.
reasonable price and very delicious malaysian food. the shop is in chinatown but in a small quite corner, away from all the noisy tourists.
sadly the laksa was flavourless and bland. will not come back which is a shame as the service was fine.
small place but full of customers for a late weekday lunch when i arrived. the singaporean laksa came in a huge bowl and was delicious!
amazing malaysian food, really quick service. a good mix of dishes, for really reasonable prices. tucked down an ally so less touristy than as lot of places nearby in chinatown.
food generally tasty. beef randang really tough. very bad service.
was craving a singaporean laksa while i was visiting london. c & r hit the spot with a tasty laksa, exactly what i needed.
good food and decent prices! service is very good too, orders come pretty fast! very friendly waitresses as well!
hidden on one of the side street in chinatown, food taste amazing. definitely authentic malaysian food.

authentic malaysian food in the heart of london! excellent nasi goreng, just the right level of spice and crunch. ambience is basic which is good because it doesnt take away your attention from the delicious food and efficient service. is a hidden gem
nice oriental food.
great malaysia food in london. satisfied my gf craving. large portion
lovely in a small quiet corner of china town
delicious authentic malaysian food. great service and the food comes in big portions

the (singapore) laksa here is top notch and extremely good value. the bowl that it comes out in is huge and has plenty of toppings. taste is super authentic and definitely one of the best i've had in london!highly recommended!

amazing food for the price! the service was excellent, everytime i needed someone, they were not hard to find and they were very kind and happy to fulfill what i asked. the price is also great considering the great food you get.
love this place, would definitely come back food it great it can get very busy at times but worth the wait.
casual and friendly ambience, never a let down. foods always tasty and served quickly. offering southeast asian cuisine favourites.
the best lapsa in town, awesome food, excellent service, claire was fantastic!!
this restaurant serves the best singaporean laksa in the city.

very nice portion for the price. absolutely loved that the staff recommended ways in which to eat the meal traditionally, for example one of the dishes we ordered is traditionally eaten with vinegar and a member of staff gave us a bottle of vinegar to enjoy the meal with :)
the best singapore laksa in london
a good place to enjoy malaysian food. a bit disappointed my hainanese chicken rice was dry and the rice not too flavoursome. the laksa was much better with a richer sauce
been going to this place for years now. as a malaysian, other than roti king and gopals corner, this is the place to get your malaysian hawker style food fix!
good malaysian dishes
best in town. not keen one one dish ( first time in c&r) kind enough to give me a 2nd dish choice on the house....which was delicious
food was greasy and discovered after my visit the restaurant only has a 1 out 5 hygiene rating!
well priced and tasty

i had the hainanese chicken with rice but there was almost no flavour with the chicken and the chili sauce tasted odd. although the plum and lime drink tasted really good! (only order it if you like sour drinks though). an ok experience overall, but i guess the price wasnt bad for what you get.
good malaysian at very reasonable prices. looking forward to going back and trying more of what they have to offer. i had a short wait for a table but not long. seems to be a popular dinner spot.
clean and good value for money
i've never been disappointed, very good quality food at a very low price. suggested!
as authentic as malaysian gets in london! always enjoy the singaporean laksa, the beef rendang, and the wat tan ho.
delicious. spicy.....
love food here!!! one of my favourite place in london!!
fantastic value cheap and cheerful food.
good malaysian food, but service is not great
great malaysian restaurant. has most dishes you'd expect from malaysia. laksa, nasi lemak, roti canai. and beverages to suit, milo ais, teh tarik etc. worth the visit.

the food and service was great and the fresh mixed fruit juice was devine i could have drink 2 glasses easily. this is one of favourite eateries. the only complain i have is the place was cold upstairs where we set.

nice food, would probably visit again if im nearby. however staff were quite eager to clear the tables. wouldnt recommend getting the chicken wings; they were crispy but had no taste, they also cost 6 for tiny nibblets!
one my favourite authentic malaysian restaurants.reasonable prices with great service.15 years later still going back once a week
best singaporean laksa! been coming here for the last 10 years and always bring new friends recommending the place.
nasi goreng mamak here is the best in town!
little choice of vegetarian food. the dishes we ordered were ok-ish. the tofu smelled and tasted kind of like chicken.would not come back here.

excellent and authentic malaysian flavours for an affordable price. mee goreng, nasi goreng, penang prawn mee are all delicious and really really hit the spot when you need some good asian dishes to feed the soul!
a delightful, authentic place with delicious food. i ordered a malaysian-style nasi goreng, which was amazing. we ordered some starters to share, which disappeared fast. definitely recommend.

my go to place for delicious malaysian food! can get really busy at times but that just attest how good that place is. a recommended place to eat. just remember the seating can get a little cramped, so you can feel as if you're dining with another unknown person

crc is hidden down an alleyway in soho china town uk. close to the new gates. i was pleasantly surprised by them, the food and service were great. if you're with a big group they can move their tables around to accommodate you.

though it was a little difficult to find, it is very much worth the visit. the chicken and beef is halal here. the service was prompt, the wait staff friendly and engaging. the venue is well lit and spaced out nicely for the small space. the cafe has a nice and relaxed atmosphere too.

malaysian restaurant in a little alleyway in chinatown. make sure you turn up with your whole group as they wont seat you. noodle soup dishes are huge!  made the mistake of ordering satay as well which was far too much. tasty.
good laksa - but veg and other smaller things are overpriced
we had a malaysian and singapore laksa, they were good, wont return for them though
great food but the waiter on the first floor was rude. not an issue since i wont be back here again.
good food. good service
amazing food and great service! i had thai food in a malaysian restaurant but was awesome!?
the best a hungry malaysian can do when you're far from home!
amazing food. quite busy so we got there at 6pm and got a table fine.
nassi lemak is the best!
great food but poor service
great laksa. quick service, reasonable prices.
food mediocre
malaysian/chinese caff. good food and the staff seem to enjoy their job.

i had the roti and sauce followed by the singapore laksa and was genuinely blown away by the quality of the food. tremendous value and i'm still thinking about that laksa 5 days later!  will be back multiple times, no doubt.
decent malaysian food.

we ordered ala carte, asam pedas fish, beef rendang, prawn sambal and kalian. we like most of the dishes, but beef rendang was not as we expected, still good though. wonderful service and friendly staff.
best value singaporean food you'll find in the area.

great malaysian food. i used to come here over 10 years ago when i worked in the area. came back last night and was so pleased to see they still serve a great laksa! its a friendly, busy, good value, non chain, little gem. just what london needs.
my food was tasty and the service was good, but my entree came out cold. had to pay extra for rice. prices were okay.
simple fresh fast malaysian food with a very authentic feel tucked down a side street in soho. definitely recommend and go for the laksa if you like something with a punch.
quite busy - good value - food could be better - visited by lots of locals - so maybe we chose the wrong things from the menu
nice malaysian or singapore restaurant.

food was alright, it was nice but not life changing. service was poor (but kind of expected). prices are a bit steep for what you get but i suppose it's in chinatown. the menu photos on google are deceiving and must be from a while ago as the noodle soups are now 9-10 rather than 7-8.
lamb curry, always a good choice
yes! don't tell anyone about this place if you have been there! it's mine!
my favourite place to eat. malaysian food. yummy everytime.
poor food. ordered the chicken it was mainly bone. waitress unaware of allergens (ie: what was gluten/dairy). disappointing as malaysian is usually one of my favourites.
a little gem hidden near chinatown. great food, fast service

i felt they are not as good as 2 years ago... please ask staff for chopped green pepper, it's one of the sauce/spice they offered for customers, that's the most amazing thing. add some into your food then upgrade to another level. the staff that serve us  is quite rude, that's another reason i only gave 3 stars.
awful customer service!! extremely rude waitress who overcharged us and told us to eat faster so other customers could come in. we had only been there 25 minutes. wont be back.
decent place for laksa in london. service is very quick and efficient.
yummy and affordable. quite enjoy the plum lime drink...minus the paper straws
great food and price.  we have been going here for over 15 years
the venue is well lit and spaced out nicely for the small space.
off track but well worth a visit. try the salads especially the thai one with papaya. good food and reasonable prices

get the singapore laksa!! so delicious, filling and cleansing. ambience is lacking and if it's busy then you might be a bit too close together but it's worth it for the singapore laska, 9 well spent!!!
very nice place, they could serve half portion for half price. is worth it to go

authentic malaysian foodhad the hokkien mee (noodles) which was exactly as one would get in malaysia - absolutely delicious!the chicken satay sadly is not as good - seems fried (not charcoal grilled) and the peanut sauce is not that great - still very good.
great malaysian cuisine at very reasonable prices. it's not a place where you spend a lot of time. just eat and go but the food is good.
superb. the singapore curry laksa is amongst the best you'll find london. the rendaang is another must try too.love this place.
most malaysian style cooking. good selection of dishes but nothing exciting.good service.
great food. fast service. not quite enough seating though. but the wait is worth it!

fantastic little restaurant. the food was superb and the service was slick. the prices were extremely reasonable. it's easy to see why people are queuing to get in. food wise, we had the singapore laksa, very creamy and spicy. to drink i went for bubble tea with tapioca pearls.this place is a real gem and a new favourite.
this is a great hidden gem. great food no nonsense service in and out. sometimes there's a q
cheap and cheerful gem! tasty food at a good price. sometimes a bit cramped but this isn't a big issue.
carb heavy,  spicy and fragant and at times squishy food, enjoyable!
don't miss this place if u like malaysia food. it just taste like home - must come
nice, but found it to be more quantity over quality.
delicious laksa, quick serve & great ambiance.however we  waited for 30 minutes to get a table.
great malaysian food at reasonable prices. great value for money. large selection on the menu.

fast service in a modern surrounding, definitely one of the best places i've visited in the soho area. singapore laksa was fantastic. i would recommend researching what you'd like for lunch prior to your visit - so you know what you're expecting if you're fresh to this cuisine!
great value restaurant in the heart of chinatown. make sure you get the barley drink!
friendly staffs and delicious seafood tomyam yummy

good food but not friendly service. it is a shame because the food is very good. it is okay to smile to a customer.... the food comes very quickly so it is not a place to spend time in. it is a quick in and out.
stunning food served with a smile ,great value for money
a delightful restaurant, the fish balls in the singapore laksa were delicious

hidden down this side street in london's chinatown, c&r is my go to for hainanese chicken rice in the uk! it hasn't failed me yet! just a heads up - they won't seat you until your entire group has arrived!
a bit slow in serving you but the food was good
great food and service. will be back to try some more dishes from the huge menu

the food once disappointed me, but no more now.. i loved their mee siam and it's always be my favourite dish.. bery friendly staffs and fast services too.. but it's not a halal restaurant because they do serve pork menu as well..
food is good but getting expensive

malaysian halal diner in soho. prosquick servicemassive portions one of very few halal food places in sohoflavoursome foodconsbusy at timesmistake with our orderseating with other people at busy times
it was authentic and great! all nicely familiar dishes
top notch food and drink, enjoyed with two malaysians who where missing their nasi.. fast service, reasonable prices, centre of london. perhaps not the best place for a long romantic evening meal.

good service, be prepared for a queue. char quay teow was really nice. liked the rojak (mixture of fried tofu and veg in a sauce), fried chicken wings and the teh tarik.  did not like the satay or the roti chanai  but that's me, comparing with the authentic taste i am use too.
comfort food that i would recommend to any south east asian whos in london.
love it here. good prices and very authentic food .
one of the best malaysian restaurants in london!
friendly & efficient service on a busy friday night. tasty food at a reasonable price.
the fried rice and char kwe tiaw are the best

service is horrible, i have never seen anything like that. the staff really doesnt care about costumers and is very rude. they simply made us leave the place with no reason but to have more vacant tables. in the end, they mistreated my friends and me while we were trying to complain about the service and completely ignored us.

the food is amazing! so much to choose from on the menu so brace yourself. it's now my favourite place to eat and the service is on point! even when there's a line outside they really arr so attentive to you making sure you get seated as quickly as possible. they close around 11pm.
always love the food here. very tasty and also at affordable prices! great service from the staff member
great restaurant
authentic food in a calm vibe, clean and tidy would come every week.
yummy. must go if u miss malaysian food
cheap, delicious and v quick service. would definitely visit again.
best malaysian i had in london so far...

awesome and delicious food and good service. they have a big variety of dishes from which you can choose what suits you most.i don't eat spicy food at all and it is one of the few places that i can safely order and not return due to the food being spicy.
great authentic malaysian food!! really quick and affordable. i loved the tom yum seafood noodle soup and the laksa is also great.
lovely cozy place. good service and excellent food. recommended by my malaysian friend.
top food, no frills, amazing value. bang on!
excellent food not bad price for central london. this is a place to eat good food then leave not a place for ambiance or sitting chatting and does not pretend to be anything else.
truly fantastic laksa. the stuff dreams are made of. the restaurant itself is basic but the service is quick.
hidden gem. very fast service, sizeable portions of good food - feels genuine and home made.
best affordable maly place in london, visit regularly, good lasak
good food and cheap comparing with other places.
food ordinary. chicken satay was burnt and tough, seemed like old re-grilled chicken, would not order this again.
the food is amazing
food is great with good portion. would definitely recommend to anyone who craves asian food back home or , anyone who wants to try the best authentic asian meal.
pretty good malaysian and chinese food at a decent price. slightly uncomfortable seating. the venue of this place is not obvious as it is hidden in an alley
absolutely fantastic very reasonably priced food. huge menu. lots of choice. beef rendang, laksa are both amazing :)

the singapore laksa noodle soup was rich in flavour, definitely one of the best in town. kampung style nasi goreng was okay, slightly too oily to my taste. overall taste of food was good with mediocre service quality.
very casual eatery, amazing value for money. service is a bit rushed but it has a lively atmosphere and the food tastes great.
our favourite place in london for consistently fresh and high quality authentic malaysian food. very kind and friendly staff. great prices and always a pleasure to eat here.highly recommended.
great noodles
the food is not as authentic / good as it used to be

dreadful service. the food is authentic and the menu has a lot of dishes you cant find elsewhere. but the service is just awful, even for chinatown. i ordered a roti canai that never came. i had to ask several times to get drinks. go elsewhere, the food is not good enough to make up for the dire service.
echo some of the other reviews - the portion sizes have shrunk tremendously, and the service is totally apathetic. go to rasa sayang instead.
have been a customer of them for man many years. food is always great and consistant. huge amount of choices as well.

the standard has gone done. food not all that authentic. lots of customers. staff not very interested when given feed back that the vegetable dish that we ordered was full of the stalks part of the veg hence not very nice and, it was hard and not easy to eat. disappointed.
this place has been a regular haunt for me for at least ten years! the food is always delicious and the staff are great. good value too.
food here is delicious!
delicious singapore-malaysian food with tasty ingredients. they have the spread of sambals and chili padis which is really key and prices are moderate here. staff are very helpful and available.
super roti canai
nice big portions. id recommend the laksa. standard malaysian food but nothing mind blowing.
big portion with reasonable price, fast service.
excellent singapore laksa
quick friendly service with good food in big portions. great little hidden away option for great malaysian food.
great food! totally recommend the chicken rice here!

4 for a 330ml bottle of lager? that hurt. vegatable spring rolls were from a packet and appeared to contain almost no vegetables. my beef rendang was a large portion and had excellent flavour, but wasn't served hot enough and had clearly just been microwaved as the beef had dried out.
best singapore laksa in london by a country mile.  but don't tell anyone or you'll ruin it for me.
outstanding food, no reservations necessary but you may have to wait for a table. nice cheap and cheerful dinner
good place to come for fairly authentic malaysian dishes. very large portions and a reasonable price.
good but when we went they were out of beef and lamb

one of my favourite restaurants at london china town, good quality food, afordable prices, healthy dishes, their roti canai is very good, fish recipes are incredible, best malysian food in town for sure
fast and quick service,tasty food!
big portions and good quality. bit pricy.
hands down the best malaysian food in london
service good and busy restaurant but had better food
if you want authentic malaysian food... this is the place to go. make sure you grab an ice milo
great friendly service and dishes where yummy; definitely go back n try the other options too..

dreadful staff and terrible terrible service. really not recommended! we went there in a group and the old man was not friendly at all especially when it comes to payment.  never experienced something like this before! we will never come back just because of the horrible service.
great malaysian food and reasonably priced favourite place.
avoid at all costs. got food poisoning. very rude staff.

the dishes are quite large although pricing isn't the most budget-friendly. dishes are kind of expensive for what it is. bf got charged 3 for rice that wasn't made clear that it didn't come with the dish - kind of a scam.

i can vouch for the laksa - under a tenner with a cup of jasmine tea - but i had some serious food envy when checking out what the other (mostly malay) diners we tucking into. looks like a menu well worth exploring...
great service as always , very authentic malaysia food and delicious
the taste of malaysian food here is really authentic
i love this place, big portions to share and reasonable price...nice hangout place...
good food and fast service. exactly what is needed at this kind of place.
delicious malaysian food i approve! the service very fast. the place always full
delicious soups which are tasty day or night, and priced just right.
good food but definitely not something to remember. service could improve a lot.

i tried:1) laksa2) char kway teow(fried flat noodle)3) teo chew fried vermicelli.4) mee hoon kwayin my opinion. all tasted good. i especially like teo chew fried vermicelli. huge/generous portions. i must say the food tasted very authentic.

great malaysian and singaporean food. c &r is one of the beat malay and singaporean places in london. the price is good and the food tastes nice. their nasi lemak is rather nice. some colleagues recommend the laksa. other colleagues say that the hainanese chicken rice is best had elsewhere. overall, very nice place.
good food at a great price. not sure about the hygiene!
for 15 plus years it's a staple on a visit to london. this place is a reason to come to london on its own. a great menu, great staff and recently refurbished it's even more awesome.
the food has flavour at the top excellent moments
great meal with friendly, welcoming staff. big filling healthy portions at good prices. and a nice atmosphere!
best malaysian food i've had outside malaysia and great value too.
nasi goreng kampong was lacking shrimp paste  . i was missing this dish and the one there was alright but it just wasn't the same, you know?
decent food, reasonable price. big serving sizes.
the penang laksa is really good! sour, spicy and full of taste! i recommend also roti chanai and fish balls as starters!

service a little slow...food flavors, good...interesting dishes....rendang good but i make it better at home....i might be just used to my cooking ...we went at 3pm and by the time we left there was already a line of 10 people waiting outside.popular place i guess
went for the roti canai, not many places do that. was nice.
great malaysian food in the heart of london. but pricing is catching up quickly. still love the taste
you have to try the pork belly, it was amazing!
i would give it 6 stars if i could. the problem with this restaurant is that its too awesome, all the food is delicious and cheap. service is great. i cannot recommended this place enough.

this place was a-okay. my singaporean laksa was decent but lacking certain oomph factor - it was good but not great, something i could probably replicate easily at home with store-bought laksa paste. i may return if i am in the area and craving malay food.
the laksa is a dream...
this place is small and the food is not authentic malay. also, it takes 45 minutes to get a simple roti. go to the amazing c & w near leicester square.
quick to get us in and sat down, ordered and served. the food was very well priced and tasted good, would recommend for a more casual but authentic experience.
staffs not friendly and hygienics rating to 2. we can imagine how dirty is in the kitchen
just like in malaysia!
nice stop in chntwn
good malaysian food have been going for many years hasn't let me down
excellent malaysian good - quick and cheap for pre cinema or theatre meal. the roti is excellent
my favourite place for malaysian food in london. small tables and quick turn around. non fussy atmosphere. do try the mackerel and the aubergine with anchovies
excellent quality and value indonesian food
good food, average size portion and bad service. just for a quick bites, not really great for the long dinners.
amazing malaysian food served fresh! one of my best, although rasa sayang beats it by a tad!
the food was a bit pricey for the amount that i got
really tasty. i like it.

amazing food! probably best in the asian restaurant in london. singapole laksa, wangtan ho are my favorite, but everything is tasty here.someone is talking about the service, but i think they got improved although they are busy, quick serving and never feel unconfortable! honestly i don't care the service cuz the food is so good!!!
tasty food
service could have been better but prices were reasonable for that area of london.
service a bit slow,  we had a table for 6 and all meals arrived at different times. quality of food good
great malaysian and asian food.
yummy. great food selection. well priced. fast service. authentic.
the food was very delicious, the service was good too. i would come back next time i'm in london

you get exactly what's promised for a very reasonable price - quick service (you can't book and won't be seated until the whole group has arrived), the food was delicious, a huge variety on the menu and a great central location! i had the hainanese chicken rice with iced milk tea, both of which were excellent. thoroughly recommend.
best place in london to taste singaporean / malaysian foods.
unfortunately all the foods we ordered did not taste authentic at all
very good malaysian cuisine
a bit pricey but it is good food.
good malay food!!
amazing food for whoever like south east asian food. especially i like set menu with coconut chicken curry.
good food but don't buy any veg dish as 9 for a small plate of some greens is a total rip off. they should be ashamed charging the same as a main dish. shame as otherwise it's ok.
huge portions for a small price! the flavours are authentic too.
great malaysian food at a reasonable price

ordered a nasi lemak for a take-away. charged 11.90 when the menu said something else. the lady argued that the price wasn't 'updated'. the food was rubbish. this is a disgraceful version of this popular malaysian dish.

food is good. unfortunately, it's prices just went up in the new year across the whole menu. for example, nasi lemak is 10.50 and penang prawn noodles is 11.50 (with mixed vermicelli and egg noodles). similar items can be had at coconut tree at bang bang for much less.
decent malaysian chinese food... a bit pack but staff was attentive...
great laksa, good bak kut teh, comforting malaysian and singaporean dishes for cheap prices
i always pop in here once in a while. amazing food and nice fresh juices. i always leave full and happy :)
a great place to eat delicious food! the portions are huge and the price is reasonably  priced! the food tasted fresh and i would definitely recommend the singapore laksa.
fantastic authentic malaysian food at the heart of soho. you may have to queue, but it's worth it.
i love the food here. it is so fresh and the service is excellent as well.a very varied menu with something for everyonegreat pricesvery clean as wellrecommended
great malaysian restaurant - helpful staff. very popular. quick service but not rushed.

highly recommend the hainanese chicken rice here! they use the thigh and they definitely do the rice correctly by cooking in chicken stock. the chicken was juicy and filled with taste, love it. missing it now! do not recommend getting the fried tofu with peanuts and shrimp paste sauce.

we enjoyed it so much that we went twice. by chance we had the same young gentleman server who is very helpful in helping us make a decision. we had no clue what we were ordering and we're very very happy with what we got. we can't wait for our next trip to london, we are sure to go there again.baltimore, maryland usa
great food and prices

relaxed atmosphere, quick service, delicious food. i don't know much about malaysian food so don't know how authentic it is but what i had tasted lovely. drinks seem slightly overpriced but the meal was great and very filling!
some items strangely overpriced and not that great overall. to remove shrimp and add tofu costs 1.50. few vegetarian options. wont be coming back.
fantastic authentic malaysian / indo / singaporian food in a clean and modern restorant. would definately eat here again if im in london
food is really nice, only ever had to wait 10 mins at the most for a table. always packed with people,  service is good. shy off one star as the last time i visited the hot food was partially cold.
lovely asian cuisine. had the singapore laksa - nice spicy coconut broth. brisk service. would come back to try other dishes if time allows (am travelling)
this is my ultimate new favourite restaurant. i no longer feel i need to fly all the way to malaysia to experience authentic food. this place is awesome. order the lemon ice tea as well!
great service when we showed up late with a big crowd. amazing food will definitely be back
had fried rice w lamb and spices. really good food at reasonable prices, just off the main passageways through chinatown.well worth the visit!
so yummy! loved the curry
not been here in a while food is good as usual.  i can't give it five stars as it's not the best hokkien mee i've had.

a treasure tucked away from busy streets of chinatown. the chicken rice was delicious and great comfort food. lovely malay milk tea and yummy morning glory. satay chicken however was very dry and when it arrived cold and too greasy.
a m a z i n g. end of review
one of the best malaysian restaurants in london, worth the wait, great value!
hokkien mee is the most authentic i've had in london!
favourite restaurant for malaysian. portion used to be much bigger.
fair quality for its price. considering its central london it is cheap.

after entering and ordering  the simplest plates on the menu took over 25 minutes to serve a simple egg fried rice and a satay chicken, while other people got seated and served within that time. overpriced satay that was cold by the time the rice arrived and the worst egg fried rice ever.never again.
consistently excellent food and quick service. everything on the menu looks tempting and everything i ever eat is delicious. can't recommend enough
the food was mainly malaysian and really delicious.  i was so hungry i forgot to take a picture of the meal i was having! will go back again

when i eat here it's like i'm back in malaysia again. the food is all great, i've been a few times and everything i've ordered has been so lovely (especially the laksa which i struggle not to order every time!) have lived in london for years and this is one of the top places i've eaten.
i saw this place in timeout. good restaurant. the quality was good and the price too. i recommend it.
best penang laksa outside malaysia. and relatively inexpensive for the locale. highly recommended.
my favourite malaysian place in london flavourwise. interior & bathrooms aren't the best
cnr has been my go to place for cheap eats and quality malaysian food in london for many years. i love their roti chanai.
can get crowded over the weekend so plan ahead. portions are quite large and very reasonably priced. if you want good food, then a good place to visit.
9 each soup (very big ones)
decent thai massage for people who like firm pressure lol

my chinese friend suggested i go here for a hair cut, but being only half chinese and my mandarin not very good, i couldn't communicate with any of the hairdressers! i got a disastrous hair cut to say the least, and i was growing it out for 6 months or so. don't come here if you arent fluent in mandarin/cantonese!
this is the worst place... my friends can not believe what they have done to my hair.btw: this is the first time i give a one star
decent comfy environment, very good stylists who understand asian hair. the other services look good too with a 5+1 package deal which i'll consider taking up.
excellent place in chinatown for a massage. i recommend alex,very professional and dedicated to her job. i will return.
came here for a emergency haircut & dye before going on holiday was quite busy however they manage to get me a stylist and did a great job. a special touch like offering a drink would've been nice.
very good massage. the decor is slightly tired perhaps but its clean. the staff and friendly and helpful. worth a visit.
closed already, some barbers moved to miko hair studio, also in china town

fantastic service and very welcome! i went there for my nail and hair done and it was nice experience but if they can play more relaxing music that will be even better. i already recommend to my friend.

had an aromatherapy massage after work which was amazing! he made me feel relaxed and at ease, i didn't want the 50 minutes to be up! great location, in the heart of soho but the studio itself feels calm and miles away from its surroundings, would definitely go back.
this is my one stop shop when i'm visiting london. i get a massage, a manicure/ pedicure and my hair done. great prices. really friendly staff.
i have been using the hair and the nail treatment as well, really good service. polite staff, really professional. i will be back

my friend bought me a voucher from groupon for shellac nails. they look awful! i could have painted them better myself. they are that bad that i tried to go into another salon to have them removed but they were fully booked! i will definitely not be going back here...they must have seen the shellac was a tacky half hearted job!

i had an amazing massage with jerry it was really relaxing and helpful, my neck and my shoulder were really stiff but afterword i was feeling great. the environment is really nice and the staff professional and kind, i really recommend it to everyone that wants to enjoy an amazing treatment, i will definitely come back

do not buy their groupon, they will not let you book appointment times even though they are specified within the fine print. they completely discriminate against groupon holders, and will make it so hard to make an appointment you just give up.
professional salon
great
massage here is amazing.

waited 30 minutes in the lounge for a hair cut. i asked the guy to just cut my hair shorter but gave me a completely different and stupid style, for 24. guy keep talking on his mobile phone. not going back againnice lounge music though
come here for a year ! highly recommend . trinity and momo here are amazing with hair cut and lyn is so good at head massage . staffs are friendly .
great milk tea
great place to eat. good customer services. foods are so good highly recommend their hot and sour soup
best foods

if you wants cheap and cheerful chinese food, served quickly, this is a place to go. staff were helpful and friendly, the food was good but not the best i've ever had (the egg was saltier than i liked).
fantastic food, and open late
very good place to have a dinner late. the food is pretty nice and reminds me my time in hong kong.they serve bubble tea as well ;)
they are selling malaysian hokkien mee, laksa, bak kut teh and many more malaysian food here. taste good. but, service lacking behind.
good roast duck and chinese dishes.  portion are generous and prices reasonable.recommended for chinatown london.
small jammed in like sardines .food nice but pricey
great duck on rice

we visited tpt for the first time today. the food and service was fantastic. we had scallops for starters and the honey pork hawker dish for mains. honestly some of the best food we have eaten in years. we'll be visiting again soon!

awful service as presumably because my friend and i didn't order enough as we wanted their a snack and dessert at 11pm. disappointed with the food quality as well- char siu tasted flat and marinated with sugar. reasonable prices but not good enough to justify being essentially kicked out
one of my favorite asian restaurants in london. authentic and delicious dishes. just keep in mind that the place is really small.

typical bad hong kong service. the impatient waiter talked to us in an extremely unpleasant tone and later threw the fried noodles to our table. i would never visit any restaurant owned by hongkongese anymore.
great food customer service needs to be worked on
everything is delicious!
this place is awesome, that's all i have to say, best chinese in london, really
good chinese restaurant

i've actually never eaten in here but this place gives me a good and reliable fix of a chinese takeaway. seems to have a very big menu with malaysian options, shall give that a try later, e.g. ckt. not quite sure whether i'd choose to eat in here though (as said, good for takeaways)
good for cravings for hong kong food, especially the desserts.  just slightly expensive
nice food, worst service attitude !
terrible service
not welcoming for entrance but very nice food and open till late
i have been coming to this place for years.  lovely food.

this place has slid downwards as their prices have hiked upwards. very mediocre chinese fayre in basic setting - all prices around the 8 - 10 mark.***visitors to london*** please avoid. this place is an old school throwback and not indicative of the food/ value available in london
our fave place in chinatown! the singapore noodles are ace!
the honey roast pork is pretty gosh darn good
good chinese street food.
my chicken didnt look fully cooked and  the rice potion was a bit small . the food is quite tasty but nothing amazing or memorable especially for the price
very friendly stuff, food tastes almost like the one i had in china
my choice of restaurant in chinatown, simple and cheap. open late.
a regular here :) love this place.
the food is so so, but the desert is very good.
ok food
lovely little place for crispy duck...
great hot pots
great duck!
interesting experience!
bad dessert and unpleasant service
the food makes up for the service
good desserts, good neighborhood food and very bad service

this was hands down the worst chinese food ever. two flavourless noodle dishes with a slimy sauce. the fatty duck was okish, but the bill consisted of a random exaggerated number scrawled on a piece of paper. we got fooled by all the good reviews. stay clear of this place!
no responsibilities in food or service.
god someone please get rid of the staff
amazing food
duck pancakes are a must.
good portions
roast duck was nice
delicious no nonsense food... lovely staff however busy it might be.
poor food. lacking flavour
asking you to finish faster and go also when you pay your bill they will tell you 10% off by cash but no receipt for them to avoid the taxes what a business
best chinese street food in london (bar none) - be sure to have the milky tea (like a te tarik)
food not good at all comparing to other res in china town. i can say it is the worst in there. staff charged us extra for no reason and without telling.
nice chinese restaurant with a bunch of chinese visitors. not the cheapest though, at 20 pound per person.
amazing tofu dessert with good price

this has been my fave chinese haunt for several years, delicious cantonese street food, reasonably priced, menu can be overwhelming like most chinese restaurants. best dishes to get our the boneless roast duck, curry beef flank and braised brisket hot pot.
i cant imagine how could i survive my life in london without cafe tpt. for people with chinese background, food from here tastes like home.
dumplings are fantastic. the service really nice. good quality price food. i needed to charge my mobile and they were super helpful with it. totally recommended.
been here twice. always quick and friendly service. great authentic food, also good veggie options. would recommend the chilli and salt tofu (or prawns) and the laska (soup / ramen dish).
extensive menu! one of my friends particularly liked their black pepper beef
i love it. variety of dishes to try!
really good chinese food. we had great nuddels and  peking duck and we loved it. this is an authentic chinese restaurant. great service.
very bad service, staff is very rude. would not recommend if you would like to have an enjoyable experience.
best chinese food i've ever had, fast service, good prices. must try the 3 meat special
great fast tasty chinese food at reasonable price!
cane late at night and was still busy, good was nice but all seemed a bit rushed
meat in vegetarian noodle dish, small pieces of bone in duck noodle soup as well as overall average food loses this restaurant two stars, despite its fast service. would not recommend.
excellent, real chinese food, not the westernised version. enjoyed my lunch.
get past the less than beautiful interior and enjoy the great food
food was exceptionally good, fast service and clean cafe. perfect if you don't want to pay double for a restaurant with a tablecloth
went for the set menu for 2 which included the duck pancakes. loved every dish. the staff were friendly, the service was quick. would definitely recommend this restaurant for some tasty dishes.
excellent food.  service from rex was incredibly kind, personable, and spot on regarding the food.  great place, great people.  thanks, rex!

great food. it's almost always super busy, so there can be a queue for a table. once you have a table and have ordered the food comes very quickly. we went with a good of five, got a huge circular table and had a nice chat over dinner.

service was so quick. food was amazing. we ordered super fast as we had to go to the theatre and they totally understood. got the food to us so quick and we then asked for the bill. bill came within minutes. would recommend
quick, tasty, generous, wide variety of genuine  chinese foods at very reasonable prices, in a humble setting worth regular patronage .
the food is very good and the price is reasonable. staff also good serve. i give 4 star because the dessert.
the service just ok, but the food was not ok...

it's a hit or a miss with dishes. some are good while others taste bad.place is always crowded and tables are so close to each other you might elbow food of fellow eaters from other table.like many china town restaurants, service is all about optimising for time to make more money and less about guest comforts.
dumplings were good , enjoyed a nice meal with my partner and service was friendly
perfect eat and perfect personal. thank you
