how to place you going to go for the decor but the food is ok. the staff were helpful the portions are pretty good. we found the duck to be excellent the vegetables a little bit generic the crispy roast pork very good but the spicy beef dish was average at best.
best place in chinatown
interesting food in relaxed surroundings
very tasty food
stumbled upon here as our usual "go to" was closed for refurbishment.

special fried rice 9.20, i thought it came with a portion of chicken, but no, it was in the rice - really! dumplings were limp, not cripsy. all in all felt ripped off...i'll be sticking to the major chains from now on, at least you know what you're getting!!!
best crispy pork you'll ever eat
an extensive menu of classic chinese street food dishes in a cozy setting with light wood interiors.
typical chinese street food. the environment is not pleasant, we found short hair in our plate and long hair in the dish. they say nothing, just take it away. disgusting!!!
great share option. 15 for a set menu and everything was delicious.

picture : mango and sago dessert. it's pretty okay, sweet and cold and gets the job done, but tastes overly fake. like i know it's fake, but if food could talk this dessert would be holding a megaphone yelling, "i'm made of fake processed stuff."
really good service. flavourful duck!! very popular, so be prepared for a wait during dinner time. went with a very happy vegetarian. will come again.

i went here and was quite nice. i had the crispy noodles with crispy pork but they gave some sauce which was basically a kind of slime. might go back again but will try something different on the menu to be completely honest.
rude and racist proprietor. never coming back again.
dishes cooked to a traditional taste, much appreciated by an elderly parent who's classically trained in clay pot cooking. well done!
super friendly place serving great food in a chilled and simple setting. family friendly, able to cater for allergies. tastes fantastic also
expensive for the yaste of food.   bad customer service with grumpy staffs.
delicious food and friendly staff
food was good but staff was unfriendly. service could be improved.
extremely rude and racist staff. tried to kick us out early by claiming they were closing soon when they weren't. they dumped our food on the table. highly upsetting and not expected in london.
great food and fabulous value. it's not a fancy place, it's all about the food. highly recommended.

decent food but subpar service. the waitress literally whipped my drink away  from my mouth the second i stopped sipping!!! we were given the bill the minute we said we weren't ready yet for dessert and then out came the card machine. the dining room was half empty and it was so unnecessary to rush us through. would not recommend.
macau pork dish is amazing fantastic food long waiting times to get in
nice meal good fast service.
food is decent and service quick , but they won't let you have a table if you're just looking for dessert options.
simple rustic cantonese street food
good dessert menu
good chicken satay, crispy shredded chicken and egg fried rice with a coke for 22.10. quick service and not badly priced for london.
a favourite for authentic chinese street food. and the staff are always lovely <3
never disappoints
the tofu hotpot and the hawker centre style dishes are nice. the duck rice is not as good as some other places. open late so good to go to satisfy a late night craving!
fast service and a large tasty bowl of noodles
nice place for a quick bite.
super unfriendly staff and poor service. would not recommend. four seasons next door is much better.
best restaurant in chinatown. i know because i tried most of them.
best chinese restaurant in chinatown
good service and good chinase food
yummly chinese, hk & taiwanese food. meals are huge. loved it.
love the hong kong  style food.
food was decent but the service was terrible. downright unfriendly i'd say.

cheap chinese lunch menu available.  3 courses with chinese tea for under a tenner in central london is not to be sneezed at. one star off a full house because the portions have gotten smaller recently, as if a few extra mouthfuls of rice will create worthwhile savings when compared to the loss of goodwill.
loved the food here! literally came looking for it....the malaysian fried rice
fantastic place for chinese food. great options, service is fast. the beef pot that i tried was absolutely amazing.
food was nice. service was ok.
eatale but bad... the service not that great as well ...
great food authentic hk street food. i use it all the time.
the worst chinese food that we ever had. the only thing that was good in our order was the prawn crackers. such poor options for veggies. will not even bother checking in here again.

large menu selection, food made fresh in front of your eyes, good for a late lunch. very small, hole in the wall feel. limited seating, so it's better in the less busy hours. i would recommend to a friend.
superb food, great quality and taste. large portions.
average food and okay prices considering its central london... theres better food next door at four seasons though (only very slightly higher price point)!
very crowded and dirty place, the cantonese food served there is less than ok
food is fine but the area is small.
unbelievable food and service was very good definitely recommend
no frills. brisk service. open until 1am. especially enjoy the green beans and hawker dishes.

excellent sago with coconut and mangoand a very large size. average hong kong milk tea. the sago is the one you want to order, and there are several choices. of course they offer regular cantonese-style food as well. (january 2018)
totally delicious authentic food.silly not to try it!i loved the duck.
really nice food- the set menus are fantastic and really great value!!
food was good, a bit greasy but overall pleasant. there were cockraches in the bathroom and one made its way out in my shoe... makes me ask all sorts of questions.
too salty
delicious food and no nonsense!
nice food & juice.
nice food. if you can find you love food here then it is a great place. very nice roast duck and pork.

hidden gem offering very tasty malay cantonese menu. curry laksa amazing and the minced pork and aubergine pot is one of my favourite ever dishes! roast duck and crispy roast pork also delicious! rex and his team are great and treat you like family in this very casual relaxed no frills joint.
big portions.

fast service, good food and overall enjoyable experience. for being in the heart of tourist chinatown, we found this place surprisingly quiet. they are also one of the few restaurants in this area to accept cards. we had a great time, would visit again.
really good food, and the staff is very friendly.
my food tasted delicious, however it went cold extremely fast. additionally, the other diner in my party did not enjoy their meal, hence i have settled on 3 stars.

good restaurant for daily usage. sweet and sour pork is my favorite. a kind of desert soup (may consist of mixed mango, tapioca, and grape fruit) is also recommended. it is open until late, you can have noodles even after having a pint.
pretty good food. specially the crispy pork and the desserts.
a wide variety of tasty chinees food and fast service.
lovely food here. esp the sweet mango desert which is a lil like sweet tapioca
best chinese restaurant i've ever eaten in. make sure you taste the duck.
small chinese restaurant in china town. food was ok for the price. staff seemed tired and unhappy.
best deep fried squid i've ever had.
lovely food and friendly, fast service. average prices. i'll return for sure
popular chinese restaurant with a huge menu! staff and service is good and the prices are reasonable
very nice food and bubble tea, tiny waiting area
fairly standard chinese food but reasonably priced.
fast service, decent portions, reasonable prices.
the food is good but not hygienic and uncomfortable to eat, tables too close, staff is kind (a change for chinese restaurants).

cosy atmosphere. nice food.
hongkongese restaurant which has my favourite iced milktea. the char siu rice is not bad in a reasonable price. it also serves sweet soups which is perfect after dinner and it closed at about 1am.
food was very nice,  service as is usual in this type of restaurant is lacking
the best dessert in chinatown "sweet bean curd"
i'm not the gourmet, i like most of the food. however, this time we order 3 courses two are disappointing and they are very costly. i should have gone to wang kei!!!!

have been coming for years, great food and seems to be loved by the chinese community, which is always a good sign
good food with a reasonable price. the hainanese  chicken rice is not very authentic, the rice is not the correct taste but the chicken is good.
the best chinese food so far. we came on the chinese new year, they were really busy but even so they were really kind and gentle with us. the portions are really good as well!
wasnt as good as expected. service was a little unfriendly and the menu we ordered was not that special. the vegetable soup had a strange consistency, as well as the tofu.

nice chinese tasty 4.2 / 5
authentic. try the crisp peking duck.
delicious  char kwai tuai. very good value

amazing malaysian food, great value in the heart of chinatown!

authentic chinese cuisine that's as close as home cooking comes in leicester square. a bit pricey (45 for two - two mains, bowl of rice and one drink) and small and cramped interior. overall, good for dinner if you're wanting food that reminds you of hong kong.
quite good food but service is.........
very authentic hong kong style food, the hot milk tea is better than explataion

small efficient chinese restaurant which has a well priced and varied menu.
amazing place of tasty food. it's full of chinese people so you may be in the right place!! prices from 10 to 15.

good food, and dessert. top choice in china town.

great food, love this place
one of the best in china town.
just had a lovely meal here with my friend. food was really nice, good value for money. good location. friendly, courteous staff. really liked the cornflake dish. would happily return. thank you

really amazing crispy pork. definitely get this when youre here.
hongkong iced milk tea is really good! the rest are just so so.
cramped restaurant but good (although fairly oily) food

5 star food...
always good to be back to good old tpt! relay on friendly service and good food! thank you rex! see you again soon! from switzerland!

worst dinning experience in the uk. my friends and i stumbled on this place by chance. the food came almost immediately, which is a terrible sign. food was average at best. vegetables were poorly washed and broke a tooth when i bit on a stone .
lovely little place, great food and very welcoming staff

probably the most hong kong place of all of chinatown. authentic char siu and pork belly, add some vegetables and a milk tea, and you might just think youre in the fragrant harbour for a second! service is also authentic (read: quick, efficient and impersonal). reasonably priced.
large range of dishes. didn't have to wait long. and they have hong kong style tea too! :)
great food, amazing service and open until 1am. excellent crispy pork, just a bit salty, but we mixed the black bean beef with it and it was just perfect!!
good, tasty food for a very decent price.
wonderful food
wide selection of tasty food at very reasonable prices in a cosy atmosphere
you have to remember it is a cafe, the food is brilliant , staff are friendly and helpful, reasonable prices, best chinese food i have had for along time ...i going back when in london again .
nice and authentic hong kong style fast food.
the food is very nice, the boss must train staffs to behave appropriately n serve more properly instead of throwing plates, spoons or food onto customers table.
really authentic cantonese chinese food. decent seating.
super cheap and tasty food... could not ask for more!!
good portion for the price and good chicken katsue curry

the stone pot dishes taste better than roasted meat dishes and seafood, friendly service, sometimes waiters give too much advice which makes the customers feel like they are being pushed to order more dishes.
nice and simple.. good cheap eat
finally found my tofu faaaaaaaaaaaaaaa :)
good food, reasonably priced, great staff
this is a really nice place to dine but it is really busy during the peak hours so i try to get in early.
one of my favourite eateries to visit when in soho.

great place serving good quality hong kong style food with helpful staff. i had the roast meat with rice and was not disappointed at al! the red bean ice was also refreshing and fresh. a golden oldie in china town!
not bad! love their milk tea
my favourite chilli tofu
the roast duck and roast pork must try. it is crispy. but the cantonese roasted pork taste is so so. for drink, hot soya drink is not bad.
the service is bad! i can feel the service is so different between asian and european people. this is racism!!!!!! i never come again!!!!!!

nice teas. nice fresh orange juice and charming staff. unfortunately ma "croque monsieur" was terrible. they should take it off the menu really. salad that was accompanying it was something to be ashamed of. not sure i would get back at concerto, if i would i probably try a pastry. they looked lovely
excellent deserts and coffee n awesome cakes.wonderful staff helps all the way i strongly recommend this shop

ive seen a small mouse wondering behind the display cake and my table that was next to it and the cake was a bit dry and not to much flavour i will never go back again ive seen the mouse again before i finish to write the review
great staff and amazing service - so helpful with their limited gluten free options still managed to provide a tasty treat! yum

wonderful taste of pan cace and good service. nice atmosphere. small minus, because toilet didint work as expected ;-)

been there on valentine's day!! quite nice and simple. if u going with a friends for coffee it's perfect for all of you!!!
pure class
cozy caf with polite staff and manager, the irish coffee served was to strong for my girlfriend, and we were kindly given a new one for free.
warm cosy place with great options. no black pudding though
fine place to eat in and later some desert
great place and drinks!

went to have dessert there but they had just a few of the options in the menu. also, the service was slow, considering the small place and being half empty. apart from that, the essert we had was nice.
love this franchised
good desserts that open later than many other. friendly service too. just a little bit more expensive than the others.

we ate a late lunch at this caffe concerto, and were highly pleased by everything, especially by the service from soare and sergio!  soare gave my wife an extra little dessert for our 40th anniversary.  as american tourists in london for a week, this little place has been the best!  5 stars!
great cake and coffee, good place for a tea
the place was nice and the good was good. nice place for a small family. afternoon tea is a really nice way to sit down and talk

went in the middle of the day on a friday. not too busy, had drinks, staff were very friendly.
lovely food..... nice sweet but too sugary
never fails to impress -lovely food , good service

it's food.  not great food.  the chicken avocado sandwich is served with too much mayo.  it was unappealing.  located next to the theaters they have a steady draw but if they were going on just food we.wouldnt try again
great little place for a quick snack. the luxury afternoon tea for under 20 for two was just the ticket. try with the bombay chai tea. lovely.
good deserts and milkshakes, prices quite reasonable but quality tastes. i need to say that, the place is romantic  and classic.
manager a disgrace rude to two customersca member of his staff and a delivery man despicable little man

excellent coffee cakes and calamari!!
good food and good service, almost always seats available.

the food is nice, but not more than that. the coffee actually was not so tasty.about the rude stuff that others wrote, it looks like they not permit people sitting just for coffee. which is makes no sense, since the place is half empty.

nice setting and decoration but that's as far is it goes. overpriced for what it is. only went for cake and coffee so can't comment on the rest of the food.
only one person serving, only one person taking payments , cramped almost no space inbetween tables but why run a  service when you can't even accomodate all guests ? this place is a joke

a great way to escape the crowds of tourists. always get a slice of cake.. or two. i recommend the caffe concerto hot chocolate.

very good food

nice atmosphere

i though if a place charges you 20 on the entrance as a standard price- it must be worth it. could be more mistaken. the place is small much smaller than it appears on the pictures, full of doggy people (the night when we went there). just a gin mill. do not recomend it if you value your money.

great love the place

luxury exspensive

an excellent evening of entertainment - the show was superb and the waitress was very attentive. food was delicious.  a fabulous night out - would highly recommend.

beautifully glamorous place that requires a dress code. the dress code of overly insecure guys who think they can get laid with girls that just want to drink and have a bit of fun. staff is really nice and the architecture is beautiful..with all the money spent on glamour there is little budget left to hire good dj's.

caf de paris is an atypical club, it looks like a cabaret and the atmosphere is great! i went on a saturday night with friends, we book a table through luxguestlist and we were treated like vips. performers enliven the party and the atmosphere becomes hot. i highly recommend it :)
expensive, bad persons, bad idea to go there and have some drinks.
over priced drinks. one toilet. definitely not going back.

cdp london far exceeded our expectations! sevens sins is magnificent! thank you to keith and the entire professional, attentive, polite  and bubbly team. a magnificent evening, surpassing value for money.

promoters approach groups saying they will give you free drinks. once you pay 20 pounds, drinks never arrive to table and they move you to vip like they are making you a favour. once you are there the drink was not even vodka, tasted like water with orange juice. then they get more people to the downstairs area and so on.
nice place but i hope the staff would be more friendly.
always have a great time at cafe de paris thanks to my promotor mia. he really takes care of us and make clubbing at cafe extra fun
an historic (and rather cheesey) club. see if you can access the vip room which is home to 4 or 5 beds. wonder what goes on in there!
nice place to relax

rude staff, first 30 minutes we did not run, they have there that the equipment was then at the entrance to have demanded  20, when we had the vip area, drinks were cheap, coca cola was terrible, i did not like! do not go there, choose something interesting on and where staff are not rude!
reflective of paris but not my favorite
good place to go out. expensive but nice.
amazing place! i crash here pretty often with the girls for a cocktail or two. plus you can meet some normal people here!
great cabaret show on saturday nights. good food and great club night afterwards.
awesome venue. i fell in love with it's atmosphere straight away. i want to go back or better still work there as a photographer

the worst place i ever been in my entire life...ive been in all club in london and i definitely think that this one is the worst one , they promote it like something big but i want give them  even 2 star ...ive read all review of other client and im disgusted .

music was rubbish. floors were sticky. drinks were overpriced even for soho. temporary bar was even set up behind a table that night. looked very amateur. whole place needs a revamp. dont be fooled by the name and photos.
great place but the dj is not that good!

the building itself is impressive, but neither the drinks nor the service were great. the security  was straight up rude, the bartender spilled my drink, and in general, all staff members were unkind. the music was only enjoyable if you had many glasses of alcohol. considering the prices and exclusivity, it's a huge disappointment.
i was fortunate enough to attend a private event at this place. great space, great location.

never go here. they took 20 each from my entire party and then refused to let us in. when we complained and asked for our money back we were physically removed from the building. complete scam with terrible staff who hate their customers.
great when there's live music, you're right there up close to the band
amazing show!!
lot of nice asian desert, quiet place, good for meeting friends and talking.
dont be fooled by these reviews! rude service, below average quality and overpriced! waffles were not homemade...
artificial tasting but delicious
great cozy place to visit, relaxing environment and good value as well, staff working there are very friendly. ideal place to chill or go to with friends
great desserts, reasonably priced. i especially like the hot soup desserts but the menu has quite a wide choice. quite hard to find though if you don't know where to look. i like taking friends here!
the place is cozy. the food is good and special. having been searching for taro ball for a long time... thanks!
nice music and food. hidden away cosy place.
cozy place to hang with friends. food quality is subpar.
affordable and yummy desserts! really cosy which i love and just a nice atmosphere.
authentic bubble tea and desserts. can get busy. good for a pit stop.
great price, plentiful menu and tasty dessert. highly recommended

i came here for a meet and greet experience and i was really pleased with the visit overall. i had a hazelnut latte and my friend had a strawberry smoothie and both were delicious. the music is fantastic and its very cosy. the staff are sweet and helpful and the prices are very reasonable. will definitely come again!

really nice cafe tucked away in china town. i tried a bit taro milk tea with tapioca, coconut and lychee jelly...really impressed. will try some dessert next time. a bit small inside but atill a great little corner to chill and grab a drink. 5/5 for service. see you guys next time i'm in china town.

perfect for a quick stop for deserts. place is very cosy and chilled! we had the bubble tea, one of the fruity house desserts, and a waffle. price is quite fair. i would definitely recommend going for a bubble tea and one of their house desserts. many choices to try from. their waffle wasnt that great.

ordered the shaved ice fruit bowl which was delicious and also ordered the peach crepe however it looked like it was made many hours before serving as it just didn't taste fresh nor the crepe itself hot. highly disappointed.
all my favourites in the cafe, variety of tastes and styles.  in hot or cold desserts.
cozy place. friendly service. they have plenty of bubble teas and desserts selection. loved the watermelon one. went with friends yesterday and really had a nice time.

the waffer at this place is always so good! and there are loads of other options to chose from for sweets and desserts! the cafe itself is a bit hidden, but thats what made  comfortable like secret hideout.(*`*).
nice deserts from hong kong

yummy milk tea and dumpling sweet soup, friendly service and good location when you need a little escape from the busy streets of leicester square ad chinatown. however, i dont think customers that are paying for food and other drinks should also have to pay for tap water, especially on a hot day.
very friendly staff. desserts weren't too sweet. a bit overpriced.

absolutely awful. it was a disgusting dessert! way overpriced for such a small portion! definitely not worth going too! and the worse thing was the service charge - 1:50 extra just because we didnt buy another item?! never going back. unpleasant experience!
cozy and neat little cafe. dessert are nice, staff is friendly too. maybe a bit expensive for just sweets, but the presentation does look good and the dessert/sweets are also not bad. recommended
tucked in one of the side streets in china town is this little beaut. it' a tiny tiny dessert restaurant but you won't be disappointed
very tasty and yummy...highly recommended...love it...

small cafe with delicious asian desserts. you can't book, but they usually try to squeeze you in! service is friendly and quick, plenty of choice on the menu. it is a little pricey for the portion size but to be expected with the high cost of rent in china town. worth a visit, especially if you love mango desserts!
small little place with lots of items on the menu. usually get a crepe and a tea. taste and priced are not bad. good for a couple friends, but like i say, it's a small place so it may be busy often.
small place but a nice atmosphere and great service.
not bad
lovely place for meet-up and an experience of cantonese after dinner drinks
lovely deserts  definitely a hang out spot with friends.
funky vibe, excellent deserts and good boba tea.
i visited on a quiet evening where there were 2 or 3 groups of people, the desserts were delicious.

the deserts were nice and the service was fast. you can't reserve a table so go early. it is a small cafe so we had to squeeze into a small booth area. they have a tv but it was playing korean or chinese music videos. there are a lot of small stairs to climb before you get to the cafe as well.
horrible service, overpriced dessert and ridiculous hidden charges (we were a party of 8 and 2 of us didn't want to order anything and they wanted to charge them 1.50 each).
very nice dessert here .. will go with friends next time then can eat more different dessert great service

desserts are mediocre and excessively sweet, not authentic at all. they mandated a policy of one minimal order per person, despite the fact that it was 10:30pm and the place was 80% empty.as a chinese person i know my food and would recommend that you go elsewhere.
cute and had some tasty drinks and food options. the strawberry surprise was a delight and a very interesting desert.
cosy place with great dessert and friendly staff. best after a nice meal in chinatown.
small cafe with delicious and taste desserts
a petite quiet internet cafe with good service and great earl gray tea! i find it very convenient for getting my thoughts together and reading. recommend it!
amazing place for desserts and boba tea!

the entrance is somewhat hidden away, but it's worth a visit for all with a sweet tooth. it has desserts ranging from fairly "normal" in western countries, like fruit and ice cream, to more traditional asian desserts.
always my favourite place in china town. authentic taiwanese vibe that makes me absolutely nostalgic!
cosy little dessert place hidden in china town.
lovely gem of a cafe! lots of nice drinks and dessert options, exactly the kind of thing you'll find in asia.
love it.  a great place to meet up with your friends and socialise
average. would have been like home if they had more variety.
lovely staff and music and great company

a great honkongese desert place neatly tucked away on a small street next to chinatown. there is no fancy storefront so it is easy to miss and i have never seen it supercrowded. the desert selection is solid and moderately priced. the staff is courteous and a bit shy.
very nice place with good staff and more important, good food.only bad thing, the seats are made of wood so not comfortable long
small, cozy and with plenty of great tasting desserts and coffees. hazelnut coffee=
very friendly service. like others said its a small place but its quite nice and very reasonably priced!
they are serve asian dessert at chinatown, high recommend their crepe, coconut soup and milk tea. small & comfortable space, friendly service and price reasonable

this is chinatowns hidden dessert gem. the staff is very friendly and the selection is so huge! the desserts taste great. if you dont know what to choose try the sugo with peanut butter dumplings. the prices are more than fair.
cosy little cafe that serves a nice selection of sweet asian desserts. you can also pick and mix and create your own desserts with your selection of toppings. service is fast and efficient.
nice bubble tea. one time i arrived just past closing time, late at night. they were still happy to serve me despite having packed a lot of things away. great attitude!
they have a policy for order one item per person. a place for chinese dessert.
pomelo mango is very nice, must try! bubble milk tea a little too sweet, should have options for selecting the sugar level and ice level.
service was really good, the staff were friendly and welcoming. the desserts were delicious! i loved the atmosphere of this cozy place.
small but cozy little cafe with a good selection of sweets and drinks. lively atmosphere and friendly staff.
good place to have chinese dessert, and sit & chat in small or medium sized groups. but they only accept cars for one person in the group, rest us to be cash.
the dumpling ( with peanut in it) is super delicious!
very nice great shredded beef
good duck
food was low quality. maybe this used to be a good place, but definitely not now. would never go back.
best duck in china town

food is good and fairly priced - i ordered rice with bbq pork two times. what matters to me more is the fact that the waiters were pretty nice and helpful! not what you usually expect from a chinese restaurant, so i will come back again for sure!
tamer hassan was at the next table. didn't get no aggro though. sweet.
easy place to go with friends or after a evening friday activity. foos is good and the price very reasonable
no frills, good food, reasonable price and very patient staff and customers (we had 4 screaming kids on the table and no one complained). just a pity they have no dessert!
good for a quick lunch
delicious food

first time trying chinese style lobster noodles  looks awesome  but actually not much lobster meat and noodles  the style is a bit unusual and weird for me, maybe i'm too used to the way they cook lobsters at burger & lobster
a must for their soup in fact all food good

no effort whatsoever in producing good dishes, all drenched in the same sauce  despite being completely different on the menu. if you don't look asian expect gloopy dishes, even if you order the real deal. spicy dishes come without a trace of chilli. did i also mention extremely rude staff? can't recommend it.
very good
a basic no drills chinese eatery handy for theatre land.  no pretensions and a decent price.
unpretentious, no-frills quick food. large glasses of drinkable wine at 3.50. good pit stop before a show!

a 3.6 rating may be misleading - seems a bit low to me. the decor and presentation may not be michelin quality, but the food is certainly delicious - in addition to being an extremely economical option. would surely recommend.
very nice and quick
food was good but we had a feeling that the staff was rushing us.
love the place for both sit down and take away meals.
not the greatest food. food came quickly but starter came after main had been served.

the worst food i've ever had in chinatown. no better than a rubbish local takeaway, bad ingredients cooked badly.they claim to have authentic handmade noodle dishes but when it comes it's dreadful, inedible. i only ate one mouthful and left the rest. go anywhere else at random and it'll be better than this.
fantastic food. great atmosphere. excellent service. the friendliest waiters in all of china town - maybe even london. a must for a night out with friends!
dandan noodle without spicy saucesichuan big bother is watching you
really gone downhill. food is awful now.
used to be awesome, but now ownership has change and it's no longer as good. shame, but all good things...
good food, everything was fresh and tasty ....
roast pork noodle soup, good stuff......enjoy
food is superb!
this place deserves 0 stars.  food is so bad i couldn't eat any of it. portion is so small i can't even see it.   it's really nasty food.  i should've gone to mcdonald's.
no frills but good food
just dont. your tummy will thank you...
great bbq food & tea, comes very quickly
good always excellent
best duck in chinatown

awfully bad service! we didn't get the menu at the beginning, we had to ask fot it. and the bill didn't arrive after a long time! the worst of all was that we even got the wrong dish!! would not recommend this restaurant! 0/10
good quality cantonese food at a great  price
good grub
delicious chinese food.
the best aromatic duck!
i've enjoyed with my family and friends awesome chinese food in london
delicious, quick, and amazing value for money. would definitely return.

for last 15 years, i have been to popping in every 4 - 6 months to buy roast duck take away and the 5 spice sauce which my kids absolutely adore. went there recently and noticed restaurant had been refurbished and staff looked different. possibly new management. the roast duck and 5 spice sauce were tasteless and very disappointing.
needs new menus. otherwise pretty decent. roast duck, bbq and crispy belly pork on plain rice is good
an average experience in culinary excellence
one of the best places for duck in chinatown. really really good.
food good, served quickly. stairs to toilets steep so best not drink too much
love this place, been coming for years. great food, generous portion sizes, fantastic value for money.
i ordered a bowl of need noodles soup and it was not bad.
good flavours not too salty or oily. feels tad expensive? friendly staff and quick service compared to many other restaurants in chinatown.
basic but good

food was okay but the staff were awful, particularly the small woman. we ordered different dishes but we got everything the same, and when we asked them if they were different, they tried to ignore us.
good place for chinese roast meat, crispy duck and stir fried dishes. friendly staff
really bad customer service. we ordered two different noodles but was served the same thing. the waitress didn't even give us a proper answer when we asked her. wouldn't recommend this place.
the place is quite small and cramps. staffs are friendly. food that we ordered mostly very delicious except the last dish which was sio long poa were a disaster. unable to eat at all.
great duck and noodles were awesome
one of my favourite chinese restaurants in chinatown. very affordable yet good quality. extremely reliable.  staff (almost) friendly. ;-)
this was the worst food i've eaten in any restaurant. it was tasteless and expensive. service and hygiene was poor. we would never have eaten here unless a website said it.

by far the worst dumplings ive ever had. asked for the 10 grilled vegetarian dumplings, got 7 steamed dumplings. they took it back and clearly grilled the steamed dumplings so they were rubbery (as there was still only 7). then took a bite and the filling looked, spelt and tasted like pork but they kept assuring me it was vegetarian.

went there last week for lunch. new menu with a great selection of authentic dishes. ordered roasted honey pork, roasted crispy pork belly, chicken with ginger and wine casserole. simple and comfortable environment, and reasonable price. will be coming back again.

delicious food and friendly, quick service in reasonably decorated place close to leicester square. we had the set menu b for 2 people with extra chicken satay strips and it was spot on... if a little spicy! ignore the negative reviews but just check they take bank cards as you arrive. i would definitely go back again!
chinese. food. good. what else? the duck was juicy and crispy? go and see for yourself.

what happened to this place? i used to live round the corner and the food was reliably decent and reasonably priced. i went back today and the food was completely different - poor quality and a tiny portion and the price had increased by 30% to 3 years ago... i wont be going back. avoid :-(
roast duck is one of the best in soho but the prices have become a little steep. may explain why we managed to walk in and get a table on a friday night!
i had the mixed lo mein and it was amazing!!! i also had the spare ribs and shanghai steam buns and they were equally as amazing!!!! definitely recommend this place!! hella good!
staff was very helpful  and good food especially the duck rice

generally go here when i'm around the area on business and need a quick lunch. speedy, dependable, and offering the cantonese classics i can't get near me. definitely recommended if you need a quick lunch service with reasonable prices.
tourist trap dont go there, expensive and poor food
nice food and cozy place
the quality of the food has gone down since the refurb of the restaurant. shame really!
excellent bubblewaffle and service, loved it
simply. fantastic .. an old establishment that kept its level of good food
food was poor, ambience even worse and cold. there are better places in chinatown!
in the middle of the heart of chinatown, an authentic chinese food. good place for an hangout
authentic chinese food.
superb, i've been coming here for the past 25 years and it's still the only chinese i visit in chinatown. crispy duck, shredded beef  lovely.
my wife loved it great food good service
good quality local chinese take away. very reasonable on prices and the food is clean. provides a quick turnaround so you don't have to wait like other takeaways.
friendly staff and nice food.
i've been going to canton for over 20 years. always good food and fast service.

i've been going to this restaurant since i was a kid. it has been a family favourite for many many years now. it can be a bit cramped sometimes but just think of it as part of the charm. the food is great!!
horrible experience. never in my life that go to a restaurant served cool roast duck. the customer service is really bad as well.
it was okay, not spectacular.

i went there because i was craving baozhi/buns but they were really bad, warmish, way too much bun and the filling was small yet alright but not as tasty as i'm used to. and the staff was not really welcoming...
we went there for bubble tea and it was amazing! good price, friendly staff and great tea!
service is quite slow and not too friendly staff. overall classic milk tea was okay but not outstanding.
nice drinks but use a lot of plastic and overpriced
rude staff members and very slow in making drinks
brown sugar milk tea is a bit too sweet (can't adjust the sugar) but good and taro is a good classic. i stop by every time i'm in london.
too slow 20 minutes waiting after ordered .... and error on my order.

really long queue only for an incorrect order. when i told them it was wrong, the manager of the shift got upset at me. so many great places on this street - just choose a different one across the way.
my favorite bubbletea

today i ordered one taro milk bubble tea and  brown sugar milk tea. the brown sugar is super super sweet, but i know some shops put too much brown sugar on it...but the taro milk tea was unacceptable...the colour of taro drink was not purple, but light brown...and the taste was awful...i really not recommend to anyone...

i love their bubble tea! i've taken some of my travelling malay friends here and they've enjoyed it too. service is really friendly and patient. only downside is i never know if i need cash or not; sometimes they take card and sometimes they don't.
tea latte with fresh milk
long queue and not worth it. doesn't taste anything better.  asked for regular sweetness and it was super sweet, i ended it throwing it away.
great stop off for some bible tea. watch out for the wonky table
long queue but very nice milk bubble tea. they could do with a better and more organised ordering system, but we will be coming back here.
my niece told me about "bubble tea" and bought one from here. she likes it a lot!
good bubble teas~
i always go chat time whenever i go london since back at my town we don't have it. it always taste great and never disappoints with a variety of flavours to choose.
amazing bubble tea, ordered milk tea and a taro! both amazing, would definitely recommend with the tapioca pearls
my daughter loves their bubble tea
nice selection of teas

we've been at this place in vancouver, toronto, la, miami, singapore, jakarta, and now london. they have all been pretty consistent in taste and quality. best place to go to wherever they are at if you are craving bubble tea.

very poor service! you ask for tea with no ice and you get with ice! once you realise and want to replace it, you get horrible response! basically, i had a very unpleasant experience more than twice in that place and thus not because of of their products it's because of the staff treating customers unfairly. such a shame!
my bubble tea tasted like fish sadly, the tapioca pearls were great but could not out do the taste and fishy smell of the tea. i have tried the peach green tea flavor and am unsatisfied.
great bubble tea! however very inefficient with orders. took half an hour to get my order. the big reason it's always busy is because they move slow!
love this store. staff was very friendly, the bubble tea here was soo delish :).  my new regular bubble tea store.
i would recommend everyone to try this amazing bubbly tee from taiwan. i've been there for the first time, service was fast, tea was superb and for reasonable prices.
decent bubble tea not the best but it's okay
the bubble tea feels diluted. the pearls are a little too chewy

nice and authentic. the foam drink was too sweet though. you can get their online app, order it and just collect it there. however, they forgot my order so we waited for a while. they were very busy so i understand but we waited for like 40 mins.
was served by a young girl called ruby, such a lovely girl! i was so pleased by her amazing customer service and she really made my day. great girl! great service!
this is the most popular bubble tea joint which has all the collaboration tea's like hello kitty's. for me too much sugar - make sure you get low sugar if you're over 13
very friendly staff.  we left our shopping there accidentally and they saved it for us.  great tea and super design.
even though it was a busy day, drinks were made quickly but still really well. definitely will be going back soon.
one of the best bubble tea you can get in london!

tried their chatime x sanrio tiramisu milk tea. it was very sweet - since i opted for regular sugar (which was a mistake i made on my behalf) - but nevertheless, it felt like i was actually eating the dessert. would love to come back and try their other flavoured drink from the collab series.
friendly staff, tasty bubble tea
one of the best places to get various flavours of boba. love it!
my families trip to chinatown is never complete without a boba from chatime. you could say it's tradition - lol  they almways make quality milktea

good place for bubble tea and i would say still the best of amongst all the other places. the queues are very long though as it does get very crowded and the staff struggles to keep up with orders so minus point for that.
nice atmosphere with an amazing selection of beverages
affordable price and good quality drink
nice options but the service is without a smile. looks like some forced labour people are working
really liked the lemon cooler.
this is a terrible franchise nobody makes any money, they just keep putting up the prices, it is impossible to make money
quite a popular place in chinatown.
great tea and consistent service every time a++
amazing chai and bubble teas. i loved the black sugar pearl tea.
young girl on the till today was incredibly rude and condescending today. left bad taste in the mouth, pardon the pun. taste of the bubble tea was below average as usual form this branch.

terrible customer service!!! they were very rude when i asked about certain flavours (like i would know the difference between your 3 different honeymelon drinks) and got evil, angry-face stares towards myself and our kids. this is not a kid-friendly place. there are other boba places better than this. it's chinatown!
great service and amazing products!

rude people, kept laughing talking chinese and i clearly dont understand. always on their phones clearly dont care about the customers or their business. over priced too. would not recommend!! other bubble tea places are 100% better, cheaper and tastier. avoid!!
average taiwan bubble tea
very good!

nice tea
best bubble tea in chinatown but always has crazy long queues.
love the roasted milk tea
good for all bubble tea lovers!

over rated
usually very packed but quick service.
a great place to get a nice taiwanese drink!
it was good. too bad they don't have seating area.

wow, could find our favourite bubble tea at london.

awesome stuff
their people just don't know how to smilevery unfriendly
terrible service and hard tapioca pearls
really tasty but there was a long queue
we asked 3 things on the menu, they didn't have them and answered rudely. i'm sure i won't visit again.
good shop
bad experience. my bubble tea wasn't mixed well. they didn't accept card payments which is unusual in this day and age. won't come back any time soon.
serves the bubble tea cravings. pretty standard though here
takes too long time to get a cup of milk tea
great drinks
great drink
average bubble tea

basic bubble tea outlet. pretty smooth operations and very centrally located in chinatown. a lot of options so read the menu before queueing up. the queue moves quickly and you don't want to be holding up others. you can get in and out of here in 10 minutes.
noice
good tea
bubble tea shop
very fresh
why they like to change the order instruction by them own?
a wide selection of bubble tea and always tastes great but when busy it can get a bit to crowded.
staffs are extremely rude. the drinks are just ok. definitely don't recommend it to anyone.
staff was so rude! the customer service is soooo poor, they speak their own language with rude facial expression in front of their customer.
apart from the service, i would really recommend the second bubble tea listed there(oops! forgot the name) but tastes so nice!
decent bubble tea. but the place is often crowded

a group of snobbish and rude hong kong shop assistants. they do not know what 'service' is. terribly made taro milk tea which is with disgustingly sweet flavour and impossible to drink. we threw it into the dust bin.
peach milk tea with tapioca pearles - lovely! .. a refreshing change from drinking normal leaf tea. plenty of choice here, massive queues during the weekend

the customer service was very bad. i ordered my drink and only changed the ice option before paying and then the cashier throws my ticket on the table. my hand was out to receive it, but clearly she didn't like me...the drink selections are good, but maybe can have a list of recommendations to help with selecting something new.

avoid - i feel sorry for the employees, but since the recipes were changed back in 2014, there's no point coming here (drinks watered down). this place is usually packed due to the location, and is horribly stuffy.
tapioca pearls weren't cooked properly and terrible service
one of the best bubble tea in london
loooove the peach milk tea boba!
loved it!
yummy!
love the drinks in here, they are great and so was the service. i dont get the negative reviews, my experience here has been very good. love the bubble tea....
real real real bad service. staff made so many mistakes when ordering. and she did not admit
the first time i tried bubble tea was here, and it was okay. i thought it was just too sugary for me towards the end!
chatime is the best time , great drinks , hot and cold ....love those pearls...

bubble tea in china town existed long before this cafe but this cafe brought in the punters... worth going in and finding a drink but since its opening there's been many more and some i might say are doing it better...

chatime is usually excellent. this one is terrible and not worth visiting. the taro milk tea was very watery which tasted like regular milk tea. they also put in the wrong toppings in one of my drinks.
lovely place to pick up a bubble milk tea however it can get extremely busy at times especially at the weekends. the price is ok for london and the drink themselves is fairly average.
a large bubble tea franchise. as my initial description states it, the quality and consistency is just not to the level i would except from a large and experienced company.
extensive menu, chaotic queuing, great tea.
great place to get bubble tea

coming from canada, and already in the midst of experiencing the obvious difference in drinks - we were pleasantly surprised by the familiarity of the drinks from this chatime and the one back home.unfortunately the drink selection was a bit lacking and tapioca pearls a bit hard and flavourless for our liking.
nice bubble tea
love this place, nice staff and great service! the only problem is the massive queue all the time but that just proves how great this place is!
rude staff, and drinks are never consistent. plus this chatime only give a regular drink on the free drink stamp which the other chatimes will do a large drink. always busy and not worth the wait.
feels like literally the only bubble tea place in europe. efficient but get in before they run out of yam.
good bubble tea!
rude staff and powder in my bubble tea so much better places in chinatown
always a line when i come here. however, its quick service and i never have to wait too long. best bubble tea on the block.
good bubble tea with different varieties and variations of sweetness. would go again
loved the tea!
a relatively crowded branch, but still nice flavor~
i have been to several chatime from manchester to london and got the worst experience here because of a very impatient and rude employee who deserves zero star.
coco is better.
i always come back for more! worth the long queues.

i swung by when i saw an opportunity when it was the least busy. ordered a jasmine milk tea and got my drink quickly. might have been a fluke but my milk tea lacked jasmine flavor. i'd try it again the next time i'm in the country.
just not very good
the bubble teas here are good but the waiting time is long and service slow

rude staffs. repeated my order twice to this chinese girl staff and still order my drink wrongly. asked for exchange and she said repeated my order to me in poor english yet ignoring me a very bad attitude.
queue was very long. product was similar to other tea places.
just rude.
a lot of the popular drinks had run out so there was not much choice available however service was good and quick
the queues can get really long here, which is weird because imo its not the best place for milk tea- even in chinatown.
long queues always,but nice bubble tea.
good place for bubble tea but unfortunately they tend to run out of stock very frequently. last couple of times i have been they didn't have pearls,  or only had 1 flavour left!
it's nice that they started accepting card payments. best milk tea around! can get busy at times tho
extremely rude staff. glared at me for no reason whatsoever. what's wrong with them? bubble tea is just okay. definitely don't recommend here to anyone.
great service i hope they dont discontinue the stamp cards in favour of their annoying app
can't beat a classic milk tea! service is very friendly.
great staff, great choice grear drink. if you've never had bubble tea before this is a great place to go for your  first time.
good tea but the staff were so rude! hate bad customer service
lovely day , topped up with lovely food.x
bad slow service.

extremely rude workers! i dont know what happened to those workers that make them cant speak politely to customers. they even threw the changes to the customer in front of us. really really rude! i would never go there again
not only give the wrong size but the wrong item!
the service is really good and friendly and although the place gets busy quite often, the line is fast. also, the drinks are amazing. favourite: chocolate milk tea

the girl staffs were very rude and made the wrong order! heard from my friend that she had a really bad experience buying bubble tea there too. was just simply giving it a try, it was an extremely bad experience! first and lastnever going back!
average level in asian but famous in london
yummy bubble tea
very nice
big queues and a bit chaotic. enjoyed my bubble tea.
not a fan of the tea here
the best bubble tea in chinatown and perhaps the most underrated. it has a richer tea taste than its rival biju. try the roasted milk bubble tea with grass jelly and pudding topping!
awesome bubble tea place! :d
this place is so busy all the time but that's why the pearls are consistently fresh and chewy :)
the classic chatime milk tea is always a favourite in this place. fast and friendly service.
great selection of bubble milk teas but they stopped serving coffee jelly....what gives?
fast serving tea. if you are in hurry you should visit here. you can get your drink less than 3 mins
queue is often very long and the staff is not very friendly. the drinks tastes good but definitely not the best for their price range.
extremely bad services! would never go there again!
classic bubble tea - really popular with people from outside the uk. impressed by customisation of the tea
one of the best milktea in london. despite the long que during afternoon everything is great!
delicious food from a comprehensive menu. friendly staff. waitress enquired about food allergies etc  enjoyable experience in a cafe style atmosphere.
staple bubble tea place
taro milk tea was way too bland and diluted. bad customer service.
lovely bubble tea shop
amazing bubble tea. great variety of options.
fine bubble tea. queue is way too long
very good quality. very busy. sometimes out of some flavours. cash only.20 times the price in taiwan!
great bubble tea...what more can i say!@
as a taiwanese, i would say their bubble tea is the most authentic ones you can get in london. though the queue is crazy and it's not exactly cheap either.
really enjoyed the roasted milk tea with pudding
bubble tea! if you like it, or its variations with different fruits, milk or anything else. a small and cosy place, service was quick enough even with the line here.
a nice bubble tea and the most tea tasting one from the shops around. a good place, a shame that it is cash only.
awesome, yum!
worst bubble tea i ever had... but i give 2 because my friend liked it.
bubble tea here tastes great with loads of options at reasonable prices. my only complaint is that often they sell out from the different flavours which leaves limited options for your order.
one of the most well known bubble tea chains worldwide. there is always a queue here as they are quite slow in brewing but the taste is always consistent
nice drink but very small and long waiting.
rude staff and always in a rush to close up.
staffs need to be more polite and patient.
lively and lovely place to select bubble tea- a speciality in taiwan. choose ur own flavour drink and decide whether you want pearl bubble or grass jelly!
pretty disgusting, they use water to dilute drinks just to fill the cup instead of adding more of the base
excellent boba in the entrance to chinatown. a classic joint.
a proper taiwanese bubble tea cafe. authentic in taste and variety. unpretentious.
pearls always taste great compared to the other nearby bubble tea shops. the milk tea is pretty decent too.
i keep going there again and again for a reason.
a place that u can meet famous people. not to expensive however only 60 min session
excellent centrally located venue
nice place
wonderful mix of guests in a cool place
friendliest venue
beautiful well managed venue. always pop in when passing to see  what is going on in this exciting becon of chinese culture 10/10
very grand and beautiful
central location and friendly stuffs
excellent talks at the china exchange - do check them out
ok place for events in the heart of chinatown
a brilliant venue run by brilliant people! amazing events, exhibitions, talks and activities. i adore coming here!
must visit when in chinatown london

i discovered this little gem on a photowalk with london_only (check their instagram page )this is a charity aiming to get people to discover chinese rich culture. often organising events, some of them for freethis weekend there is a free photo exhibition from chinese new year.tickets are available from their page
been to some of their cultural events and always received a warm welcome.
it's a middle to high level venue for any form of gathering such as meetings, conferences and seminars. have a friendly environment ease of access.
small  but friendly place. interesting to meet new people with different cultural points of view.
a venue right in the middle of chinatown
a good location to host an event of up to 60 people in the middle of china town.

i'm not really sure what the china exchange is but we had a good time there! jdrf had booked it as a warm-down venue for runners after the london marathon so there was a great bunch of people there, sharing experiences and eating great food.
very good for all parties
great location and resource with very useful events.
great space in the big city
delicious, well priced

butter chocolate biscuits...nothing like you have ever had. i buy a packet every single week. expensive: 4.20 for around 13-15 biscuits but definitely worth it. their cakes are fluffy and have a great balance of sweetness and savoury.
decent and really interesting pastries. my favourite place to go for cakes in chinatown.
i got food poisoned from their sausage bun and reported this place to the authorities. avoid this place at all costs!!!
a no-nonsense self-serving bakery where they have sweets made of beans and you can buy them for pocket change. what more can you ask for in life?
decent chinese bakery but wouldn't say it's the best. feel a bit touristy.

probably one of my favourite places in london and definitely my favourite bakery. great selection and decent prices and there's always something new to try. the staff is very efficient and everything is delicious. you should note that purchases under 10 have to be paid in cash.
absolutely gorgeous bakery. the bread and buns are delicious. enough choices to grab some food for traveling.they don't accept amex, but most other cards are accepted. minimum 10.

this bakery truly is a gem in london! it has variery of pastry choices and prices are more than reasionable. i would strongly recommend the wife cakes, egg tarts, coconut buns and the mooncakes. the only downside is unfriendly staff, but i get it, this place is always crowded and it's probably hard to keep up with that pace
fantastic range of delicious cakes!
love the egg tart and coconut bread so much!

nice place, nice people and fabulous food. mmmm the little carps and their creamy filling, as well as the rolls, freshly made, efficient and fast service. better taste than those on the other side of chinatown.
amazing quality and value.
good taiyaki ice cream.  had the matcha and vanilla mix.  matcha was light and not too strong, complimented well.  also great that the ice-cream didn't make the taiyaki soggy.
not impressed.they got some standard chinese bakery, but not the good ones. the price was pretty good but the pancake was a little cold.decent store in general.
very good selection of asian bakery products
very tasty buns, go here often when in london
great variety of sweet and savory bakes! excellent celebrations cakes
amazing selection of baked chinese snacks. love the pork buns. had the cream and peanut bun for thr first time today and it was delicious. great value for money too

pricey and bad hygiene. it's not very clear on what's what because the labels are crammed all together. the lady is way to tired and there's no rapport being build. they seem to be traditional baked goods but it doesn't have a great energy
favourite chinese bakery in london.  their egg tarts are fantastic and the buns are buttery and soft!  mochi balls with peanut have a lot of peanuts so those are a favourite as well!
they have all sorts of yummy cakes and savory treats

cute self service bakery offering very affordable oriental pastries and cakes. the mini custard taiyaki are delicious as are the bbq pork buns and custard buns. it can get very crowded and difficult to navigate but the store recently expanded to double the size.
i'd keep going back for the taiyaki alone, but the bakery items are also good
great cakes at great prices. i recommend the huge, light, and fluffy pandan cake (or anything else that takes your fancy, they are all tasty)
i go here every time i go to london and the food is amazing (i really like the sausage in a bun)
love the custard fish and pandan cake
very yummy breads. taste of home.
amazing, absolutely affordable prices. anything below 10 will need to pay by cash. i recommend the vanilla chiffon sandwich and fishes filled with custard!
great cakes and pastries but staff are so damn miserable and rude!
staff members can be a bit rude/unfriendly but i don't come here for pleasantries. bread is a lovely reminder of growing up in hong kong. extremely busy and they do say to watch out for pick pockets.

good selection of cakes etc. price is reasonable.  food is freshly baked. taste good. if using credit card you need to spend at least 10 otherwise cash.staff are ok. typical chinatown staff attitude.  they are friendly tourist but can be rude to the locals.i would say this is one of the bette bakeries in the chinatown area.
always visit this cake shop when in london,  the cakes are of the finest you will find
taiyaki fish matcha ice-cream is so yummy. only 4 for a big dessert meal.
great selection of bakery. always busy
best egg tarts i've ever had.
the staff was awful. therefore their food wasnt cooked properly . never try this place
very authentic bakery!
yummy
yes, just yes, pork buns...oh my god
pork buns are the best
fresh and tasty
shame can't eat it all
food is nice
deserts and baked goods are just so so
the only bakery in chinatown that i will go for hk pastries!
very nice but the opening hours on google are wrong, it closes way earlier than midnight!
i liked their bakery but the staff might be rude sometimes

wide selection of delicious pastries.
you have to try the waffles fish!
sponge cake!!
best bakery in chinatown
quality
nice buns
great taiyaki! closed a little early but good desert after dinner.
bakery has a lot of great stuff! recommend!
great place to have a quick bite

very messy bakery , you dont know where is the line ? the cashier dropped my cake in the paper bag on the floor & was asking me if i still want it ... allo gurl of course i need a new one and she did with no smile bye i will never return to this awful shop next ! cakes are not so good compared to hong kong
very rude girl working at the cashier and seems she doesnt like her job may be!!
now with the extension looks even bigger and better. staff could be a little more accommodating though :)
unique and tasty chinese pastry.
yami
heavenly pork bread buns.
very special and tasty! every time worth it for a visit!
a good selection of flavoured buns and cakes
delicious food.
chinatown's best-kept secret. you *have* to sample everything in that bakery
great stop for some fast food pastries on your way to the theatre. sweet and savory.
yum! so tasty and lots of choice
very nice selection of sweet and savery buns there. it can be a bit crammed at times but it is typical hong kong style so love it even more.
excellent selection of chinese bakery classics and they are done well.
nice selection of sweet and savoury chinese baked goods nice custard tarts
my favourite chinese bakery! i like the pork bun, pandan chiffon cake and custard bun. taiyaki also lovely though a bit expensive imo.
it's cute but it's meh. but it's cute.
their taiyaki is the best i've ever tasted.
they make some really cute looking snacks from sure
nice lovely place service is great
so good for fresh, hot baked goods.
great food with a quick service

so nice

decent pastry decent price nothing amazed
great for chinese green tea / taro / meat floss pastries and really nice cakes too, good price and service.
try fish shape cake, it is yummy
lots of choice, cheap and all tastes fresh and good!
good buns.
very rude staff!
nice fresh soft rolls
unique desserts for a cheap price

great little china town bakery serving plenty of authentic hong kong classics such as pork floss buns, red bean buns and pineapple buns. having visited hong kong many times the standard here is pretty close to hk. freindly staff willing to recommend of you are unsure. the pineapple buns are especially good. recommended
good fresh food here and simon always happy to help.
serving great breads and cookies
i always stop by this place when im in london for some chinese baked goods!
i bought these on sunday evening and this is what happens monday
delicious pastry!!

fantastic bakery with so much to try. it's cash only for under 10 so make sure you have some before trying to pay, also it's a small store so can feel busy even when there is only a few people inside.
i absolutely love the freshly made fish!!! just watching it being baked is fun. sweet buns you can't buy anywhere else. definitely a must when visiting chinatown in london.

great baked goods offering. higher in price but freshness kept coming from the back. custard was great, so was whipped cream. barbecue pork was delicious and always a fan favorite, especially when you need a pick me up from walking all day.
my favourite place for bakeries when in chinatown
so tasty
nice verity of cakes
i love this place!! nothing has ever let me down.
chinatown important key bakery. grateful it is always good. watch the machine in the window, perfect pastries and you can pay with a card if 10  minimum spend.

awful customer sevice experience. i asked for a bag to put my purchase and they told me to use the tray without paper... i replied why they didn't want to give the bag and told use the tray they are clean which obviously you don't know. the products are good but they should review their customer service.

this place has so many good deserts and savoury options. the custard filled fish made fresh to order and to do for as well as all the red bean filled deserts. i really like the pork buns and custard buns. as you can guess i've been here a few times so hopefully that is enough of a recommendation
a good selection of baked goods at reasonable prices. definitely worth a visit if you're in chinatown.
i love their fluffy cupcake, very light and not too sweet i can easily eat 2 and not feel guilty:) they have a nice selection of sweet and meal type bread. dont forget to carry cash.

bought the vanilla taiyaki, but was let down by a sour soft serve ice cream. spoke to the staff who dismissed it, who tried a fresh batch and said it was fine. they refused a replacement or refund. would never buy from here again, would recommend wonderful patisserie round the corner. far better.

their buns are really great. it is better then what i expected.  the chicken floss bun is moist but not dry and the bread itself is fluffy but will fill you up. can't complain the taste. the only downside is i can only buy them in london chinatown, which i can stock too many everytime.

delicious chicken curry buns and fried dough sticks.  the custard fish are to die for! the bakery is self service, its quite easy to get carried away and start piling on the breads as soon as you grab a tray and tongs. the prices are good for the quality of product and your items are packed well.

all your favourites. fresh and delicious.very popular. buns and pastry are quite large.self-service (as you will have a tray in one hand and tongs in the other, beware of pickpockets when it is very crowded; such is life in the metropolis).
a little gem i found, super yummy pastries and cakes right in the centre of london and not expensive at all!

love this bakery! the buns here are fabulous and there's a large choice of different cakes, buns and other baked goods. well worth a visit, but be aware it's usually pretty busy and is a tight squeeze as the store is small.
expensive but worthy

the taiyaki are a real treat. the cooking mechanism is very interesting to watch while waiting for three treats. but mind you, if they are just baked, the custard inside is extremely hot. be patient and then carefully enjoy.
i love it!
fresh fish shaped pancake bites are rather delicious
very tasty and fresh
this little shop of heavenly foods is awesome, especially the sticky pork buns. if you can wait till they do a fresh batch , it will be totally worth it as they melt in your mouth.
brilliant chinese desserts

the bakery has a tradition feel, as well as delivering high quality products. however high priced for amount received. also there should be some redevelopment to expand as the store is too small to capacitate large amount of people.
a great selection of chinese cakes - we visit every time we are near china town!
good chinese pastry. i'm now munching on a peanut cake, yummy
very fresh and good quality buns. roast pork bun my favourite
delicious soft ice cream but the price is a little bit expensive.
so good, classic chinese bakery ! worth trying
if you are into customer service, this is not the place for you. there are no niceties from the staff, but the everything in here is absolutely delicious and a must try if you are around chinatown!
amazing set of cakes and fish shaped custard filled sweets in the window. great if you like pandas, moon cakes, coconut or asian cakes in general.
worth a visit to watch them make these delicious fish shaped cakes filled with (very hot) custard. children love peering in the window watching them cook... dont forget to buy a bag!
a good selection of baked treats.
love the choice of rolls here: kaya and red bean being one of my favourite. only downside is that they only accept cards with payments over 10.
really bad customer service, avoid
my usual go to bakery place in chinatown. this time i got some egg tarts as well in addition to my usual buns. both were fresh and delicious. can't go wrong getting baked goods from here.
best bakery, i always visit when i close
very good. fresh, wide range, tasty breads and cakes.
always a great selection of different things to try. always an interesting experience and good treats
grab some matcha swiss rolls or red bean buns amongst many other chinese bakery items.
bbq pork buns are so yummy...thanks to who introduced it to me. also the sweet bakery smell when you walk in is so nice.
favourite chinese bakery in london
grab a fishy lil treat for a bargain
darn, those pork buns are amazing. very time i am in the area i need my pork bun goodness. love getting my goodness from here.
tried their  tai yaki and it's delicious; freshly made.
decent asian local bakery taste. soft breads and cute cakes
a true taste of hong kong, in food and prices too!
small selection of baked goods but very good quality, tasty and fresh. egg tarts when fresh are amazing!!
cheap and cheerful, a great place to grab a snack.
nice chinese bakery

really love their custard buns! their cream buns, lotus buns, red bean buns and spring onion and ham buns are also tasty! it can get busy at times, but it isn't too bad unless you go during the holiday period or during 6pm+ on the weekends. the staff aren't the friendliest but they arent super rude or anything.
loads of choices. great food. good pricing :)
love it! we always buy loads of stuff whenever we are near. buns are so soft and fresh. one thing not to miss is the fresh baked hot taiyaki from the window!
great selection of buns, breads, pastries and cakes
there's a a huge variety of beautiful treats, from savoury buns to egg tarts. well worth a visit.
nice selection of cakes and pastries. minimum 10 pound card payment
really great selection of chinese pastries! it seems to be popular because it was crowded the whole time i was there. everything was so good, i would definitely come back here again!

lovely little bakery in china town. its quite popular with the locals and tourists alike. lots a different treats to choose from all with an authentic chinese taste. items are also reasonably priced. only issue is that if your purchase is less then 10, you will have to pay with cash.

we've been here to buy birthday cakes for friends a couple of times, we love the cakes here. we also buy most of the other products at various points through the year. probably my favourite chinese bakery in uk.
tasty treats

very cheap chinese bakery with a good selection of sweet and savoury buns. they have japanese fish cakes with sweet bean or nutella and some pretty decent coconut buns. the queue was long but it moved quickly.
you can smell the taiyaki from around the corner.very busy, self service bakery. simple chinese bakery delights - great for a snack or a little treat.

an asian-styled bakery shop located in the china town. suit for pople who wanna escape from a british bakery selling in the supermarket. my favourite goes for the shreded pork bun. the price is reasonable as the portion size is enough for a meal.
best pork bun. a man who doesn't eat pork bun is never a whole man.
such amazing baked goods. will definitely be re-visiting and taking friends
great place. buns are sweet, fresh and delicious. although the place is small and can sometimes get crammed it is worth it for the luxury pastries.
yummy! that's all i can say. visit, try some and enjoy. the cakes are not as sweet as you might expect.
love this place! it's my favourite chinese bakery

this is one of the most over rated places! staff is incredibly rude! with this attitude the only reason to be still in business is the top tourist location. top tip: be nice to your customers, they came in to give you their money!
it was ok. slighly chaotic and quite expensive. there are better alternatives around.
great selection and fair prices. the buns taste amazing. the staff were very friendly, too!
mmmmmm
good quality and i would go back again.
they produce those kinds of bread and buns which my grandmother bought me when i was in kindergarten.  they are rare in china now and i couldn't believe i found them here now.

super authentic and decently priced baked goods. you'll be stoked with anything you buy there. i especially loved the "burrito" looking pastry on the right. it is filled with a red bean paste and when warmed up, the best thing in the entire world.
good selection of asian style cakes and desserts.
very very crowded. pastries are delicious but not the best. price is affordable
fun bakery. tasty cakes.
love this place! i have chinese inlaws and our nan tuned 100! so i suprise her with a beautiful selection from this bakery!
best place for peoper chinese baked good.
watch you cakes being made but be careful as. they are very hot in the middle
love these custard cream filled fish shaped cakes from here. cooked fresh and warm. 4 for 2 which is a bit pricy. but they're a nice little novelty to try.
love this place, always go there whenever im near by. if theres one thing you need to try is the pandan cake... literally the most soft cloud like sponge cake ever. also the prices are so very cheap.
cheap, delicious, fresh. good variety of sweet and savoury

this bakery has all the essentials of chinese baked goods and theyre all high quality with reasonable prices. this is a great place to grab a filling bite to eat for the broke college student. i recommend the pork bun and a custard bun for dessert. only 2.70 pounds for both bruh. incredible.
always come here for bread but it's always jammed with people so be careful of your belongings!

such a finding in central london, very cheap but very good! had some taiyaki (fish shaped cream cake) and then had to go back the other day to grab some more salty and sweet treats! the smell on the street really pulls you in.
amazing buns and baked goodies. got a chicken curry bun, and a few others things i had never tried before and they were all incredible. such a treat and really affordable.
fresh bakery.
we come here every time we visit china town and are always impressed with the quality and taste of the food.
one of the best patisseries in london, cream buns are the best
lovely chinese bakery, can't go wrong, best you can get in central london
great buns and cakes.
my favourite place in chinatown

awesome bakery with all the essential chinese baked goods you can expect. they sell hot fresh little japanese fish cakes (forgot what they are called) in the window, 4 for 2 pounds. in the back is a diner/small eats place with a pretty solid selection of hot foods. it's a bit hidden and definitely worth checking out.
pork bun was heavy on the bread and light in the filling. not a very big selection. if youre used to nyc chinatown bakeries youll be disappointed with this one.
fresh and tasty baked goods. the freshly made, cream-filled fish-shaped cakes in the window are 4 for 2 and absolutely delicious.
best buns i've ever had
delicious & fresh chinese bakery at reasonable prices.
the tiny fish waffles are so cheap and good
i like pork buns

bakery was lovely, had those fresh cooked fish look a like sweet sponge cake stuff. they were yummy, cant remember when had anything this nice and soft, and the cream inside is marvelous.definitely going back there to get more.
avoid! by far the worst chinese food and dessert outlet i have been to. just the worst experience. very rude staff, rubbish food and saw mouse droppings on the floor. reported to council.
not bad, but nothing too special. fresh pastry, tasting fine. a bit pricy.
yummy cakes

to be honest, the shop not provide a good service for the clients, my friend was waiting to pay for the small dessert, but the staff ignored her even she have said three times.  at the forth time, the staff even shouted at her. how a shop treats their clients like this!!! i will never visit this shop.
good value bread, cake and snack. would recommend!
the recently made fish-shaped cream sweets are worth trying. best bakery in chinatown.

after a nice meal....i always try to pass around chinatown bakery to buy myself a round of custard fish...so good when hot. their pastries are also very good...and so cheap! its simply amazing. the staff is okay. xie xie!
love it specially the custard buns
delicious taiyaki warm and fresh out of the cast iron
loads of choices
i always come here for chinese cakes and pastries. delicious!
bread 4 stars! soft and yummy. service 1 star! as expected
absolutely amazing bakery. fresh and delicous buns, tasty sweet cakes. a must visit place!
very busy but worth it
bought a cake. was happy.
i love this place the bbq pork bun is to die for
my daughter loves coming here for the taiyaki. good selection of chinese baked bao. yum!

nice selection of chinese baked goods, probably the best in london.
love the red bean buns! good prices

can't wait to go there again!it's great, simply great and very delicious
really nice bakery. with a great selection of pastry's and cakes.
the best bakery in chinatown . i love the custard bun .
not bad, but not great either. you pay for the location rather than for quality

delicious buns and cakes and very cheap. no seating inside, but i don't find that to be a problem
love the pineapple buns here - it is cash only though!
