a variety of jumbo-sized chinese/japanese/asian baked goods, eg. pandan cakes, egg tarts, pineapple buns. similar prices with the ones sold in supermarkets.
the best bbq pork buns and pasties in chinatown
very nice service. the taiyaki are very tasty, and very popular among the passer-by. unfortunately card payment are only accepted when the purchase is more than 10.
lots of chinese baked goods. it could get really busy at peak hours. love the freshly baked fish shaped cream cake!
delicious cakes and chinese bakery at amazing affordable prices!
i always come here when i come to chinatown. the baked goods are so fresh and tasty, its worth it to brave the busy peak times.
tasty,  try something new. though if you don't like chinese baking, keep walking.
don't been pull in by the window pastry gimmick. take a look at what's on the shelves. generally tasty although can get a little sickly. everything is super super sweet.
lots of very tasty and delicious pastries!

busy, popular chinatown bakery. their taiyaki fish-shaped cake is ever so popular. smart sales assistants have placed the oven at the front of the store.. the  smell of freshly baked taiyaki hits you full on as you walk into the shop!
the hot cakes are very tasty. i'm from taiwan myself, i'd say it's pretty authentic. people could be more polite though, normally we're not that rude lol.
cheap, great selection and amazingly delicious products
the buns and cakes they sell are delicious; both savoury and sweet products are available. it can be a little expensive though and it is always crowded.
the custard tai yaki were delicious and the cakes look amazing! the staff are friendly.
not good
great buns in different flavours. super fresh and delicious. highly recommended

great little bakery.  smells delicious.  incredibly popular with chinese and tourists alike.  worth a visit for a treat

love the tayaki!!! probably the most authentic ones you can get in london! and other pastries look amazing too- just like what you would get back home.

rude, unwelcoming staff.
delicious treats!!
amazing green tea buns as usual!
delicious!!
really delicious! i like the red bean buns.
the good food in there amazing. 5 stars
great to see the iconic gate!
really beautiful, special place.

been there twice and i really like it, good customer service and quality, very fast too.
didn't have the ombre but enjoy my lychee black tea and white peach oolong!
really nice place

grear bubble tea! quite a long wait though ... usually busy.

would recommend good tea

second boba. loving it.
fast service, even when super busy
one of the best bubble teas in london. also slightly better value than other bubble teas nearby.
i like the white peach oolong
best bubble tea in london! i would recommend the caramel milk tea with taro bubbles.

great one but the queue is just unreal. 30 mins for a bubble tea lol
delicious but i am not sure how healthy it is.
fantastic service. delicious products. i could live in this place!
took half an hour and 10 for two drinks, not worth the wait.
is a busy place, but is nice

i have a feeling that the quality has deteriorated somewhat since the first time i tried it. service has gone slightly worse. i stopped getting extras. it takes longer to get my order. overall, the place is still decent though.
good tea, but they are slow like hell

i like that you can choose the sweetness and the amount of ice. milk tea is a little bit bitter than most bubble tea places but it still suited my taste. usually less busier than the other bubble tea places around and inside has a nice atmosphere.

probably one of the best bubble teas you can find in london. you can always notice that their recepies are considered great even by those that are more picky in their bubble teas  their original cuppacha milk tea with tapioca is incredible!

the tea is lovely and it's great that you can customise the amount of sugar and ice that you want. the amount of options for different types of tea is vast too and you can choose your own toppings so you can truly create whatever you want. the staff are friendly and service is efficient even when they have big queues.
the best bubble tea place we have ever been to. theres a line out the door for a reason! we will definitely be back here every time we come to london.
best bubble tea around, personal favourite: honey dew milk tea less ice 50% sugar and tapioca pearls.
bubble tea was good but serving system not quite right, had to wait several minutes to order & then more minutes to receive the drink.

if you've never had bubble tea before and don't really have a sweet tooth, try the original cuppucha milk tea (it's asam tea) with slight sugar (just one up from no sugar. these things get really sweet, even with half sugar), with pudding (smooth and subtly sweet) / tapioca pearls.
my favourite bubble tea place! love how the sugar level can be customised as i find some bubble tea very sweet.
amazing bubble tea definitely reccomend. love the variety and the staff are really kind. a bit hard to find but definitely worth looking for.
solid, wide range of good tea. rapid service. limited space inside.
taro root bubble tea, yum!
the milk teas here are so thick it's amazing
nice choice of oriental teas

very small so constantly being bumped into by people and expensive for bubble tea! tapioca pearls are even charged at 50p extra which should come normally at no extra charge. paid 4.30 for a regular drink and was too sugary despite asking for less sugar. won't be going back
it's taste alright among the other bubble tea shop
yummy must try rose milk! best bubbletea in london. ombre tea very pretty. taro okok.
haha i had the ombre bubble tea which tasted great. they charged me 5 pence for a bag which they didn't really make clear ...
great tea with many options
very very friendly staff. the tea is absolutely amazing! tried the ombr and my oh my! a must!
has a variety of flavours and some flavours are really nice. meanwhile, some flavoured bubble tea are ghastly

there are a variety of flavours to choose from and you can choose your sugar level which means that you can opt for lower or higher sugar. the staffs are also very friendly and the price is very reasonable for the quality and flavour of the tea.

i am addicted to this place!!! i have tried few bubble tea shops in london but when i visited cuppacha i knew i was going to visit them more.the tapioca were soft and chew. they have plenty of flavours to choose from and the staff very friendly.

my favourite bubble tea place. prices have risen by 10p recently. theres a large menu of different flavours and toppings. standard drink includes tapioca unlike chatime which charge 50p on top. it can get very busy and you will need to queue on weekends. they also have a loyalty programme.
great tea, great staff. always go for a bubble tea when i'm in the area.

they have a great selection of bubble tea flavours and topppings and allow you to choose the ice level and the sweetness levels as well. the fruit teas, especially the qq teas are the best and are just soo sweet and tasty here
you have alternatives but cuppacha has something special for me. a lot of choices, from hot to ice cold drinks, flavours and toppings.
delicious milk tea in the heart of chinatown
delicious! had real grapefruit in my tea, whose zest was not very delicious unfortunately. otherwise, very cool shop.
great selection of bubble tea options where you can select how much ice and sugar etc.
a very very busy shop has long queues if you don't mind standing in a line for a while, then this place is for you

friendly staff and good selection of toppings. grass and fig jelly are a good alternative if you don't want to carb up on tapioca pearls. hot options are also lovely on a cold day. queues can be a bit long.

i had a lychee tea and it was so sweet it was absolutely disgusting and basically undrinkable. and i usually like 100% sweetness if not more! i think perhaps maybe someone screwed up my order because it was ridiculous to the point it must have been an error.

i know bubble teas are so bad for you but these things are so addictive and i must have had more than 10 drinks here! my favourite so far is the matcha green tea with red bean. most of the time the queue extends out of the store but service is pretty quick so you should be in and out in 5-10 minutes.
just a normal bubble tea shop, nothing special about the drinks.

they have a great selection of flavours (that are not always available depending on who is manning the counter) however service here can be incredibly slow and does anyone really have 30 minutes just to wait to get a bubble tea?
one of the best bubble tea places in london, it has all the right stuff - vast number of flavors, hot or cold options, and amount of sugar. prepare yourself for a long queue.
great taiwan bubble tea in chinatown! the staff comes and goes so the quality varies a little - most of the time is good but sometimes unfortunately will be a bit let down.
the matcha bobba is one of the best.
best bubble tea in london

delicious bubble tea, coffee jelly with milk with a tea underneath but a revelation was my friend's matcha with that tapioca topping! 50 p difference between a big or medium size makes decision easier and customise sugar is an excellent choice. almost 30 minutes waiting in a queue was a downer, avoid weekend peak times!
lots of variety. very tasteful
passion fruit tea with passion fruit popping pearls
good bubble tea!
i normally go to t4 for bubbletea but when i am around chinatown, i will go to this shop which is still good.
the best bubble tea int he world!
good bubble tea.
15 minute wait.... ! for 1 tea.
the four season tea is awful
best bbl tea place in china town
brilliant and great service ... just bring back your loyalty card
best bubble tea place in london. beats bubble magic and bubbleology by a mile.
great variety of tea. especially pure tea for those who are conscious about their sugar intake.
amazing bubble tea!
i love this place whenever i'm in london i will go out of my way to get here - the drinks are soo good!!
the absolute best place for bubble tea in all of chinatown. quick and very helpsome and friendly staff.
good offerings with a friendly environment where you can have a short stay to enjoy your drinks
large, cold hazelnut milk tea with tapioca pearls, less ice, half sugar. not for sharing!
great choices, queue moves fast, friendly staff, japanese snacks also for sale at counter.
incredible bubble tea. there are so many options for flavours, bases, tapioca pearls, jellies, size and amount of sugar. definitely worth a visit.
great selection. tasty bubble tea and friendly staff.
crowded, but tasty and interesting bubble teas:)

service is slow even though there 3 people tunning the shop floor. ordered two drinks,  one was overly sweet, and the other normal milk tea tasted weak.  i think i can understand why happy lemon has the larger queue of customers next door when they both sell sort of the same stuff.

waited only and few minutes and the staff were very friendly. i had a milk tea with bubbles (tapioca) and crumbled oreo biscuits on top. super tasty! get with regular sugar level or it will be far too sweet.they also serve steamed buns and loads of other bubble tea flavours and different "bubbles". will return!
bubble bloomin' tea. why not!
great bubble tea well made.
lovely bubble tea and lots of sugar customisation options. if you choose regular sugar option it might be sweeter than you expect..   no blueberry or lime option.
nice teas, but too expensive
not the best place for bubble tea
favourite bubble tea spot. have been getting my bubble tea fix from this place for five years. haven't found another place as good as this. so happy that they've started selling steamed buns too.
best boba place so far i know in london.
one of the better bubble tea places in chinatown. their fruit teas are superb for hot weather, their chewy tapioca balls a bonus!
soo many options and you get to control the sugar and ice in your drinks but i wish i got to do it for the specials drink i got because it was too sweet
i guess if you like waiting 40 minutes for a cup of tea, then this place is your cup of tea
best taste and value for money around the chinatown area
a great tasting selection.
love the shop. go in most evenings. could do with being bigger or having and in door and out door to better deal with queues
one of my favourite places!
better variety of flavours & toppings vs the other bubble tea shops nearby.

friendly helpful staff, loyalty scheme and amazing bubble tea! the price is also decent. this is my go-to place when i am around chinatown. it is definitely worth waiting in line for an amazing bubble tea!
babe bubble tea in town. definitely try honeydew in hot milk flavour it one of the best ones they have
amazing bubble tea

love this place!! so many flavours and varieties to choose from and lots of toppings too. brilliant that you can choose your sweetness levels and amount of ice. great, helpful staff and fairly priced. the mango milk tea is fab and the lychee popping boba is delicious :)
one of my favourite places in chinatown london! a must go! you need to try the milk bubble tea! delicious! sometimes has a queue but it's worth the wait!
lots of options but the first two ones i ordered they didn't have. but when i ordered one they had it was great. very busy, so a bit of a wait but it was worth it!
service isn't the best but the bubble tea is nice
my go to bubble tea place. gets very very crowded. has never gotten my order wrong. limited seating.
really enjoyed drinks here, a wide variety to choose from.
a definitely good spot to have a nice bubble tea. lots of customization options : size, sugar, ice, "toppings" and flavour
best bubble tea you will get in london, hands down. it's a shame there isn't another branch in the capital.
speedy service!
love the matcha milk tea, not too keen on their version of milk tea though. queues are long during rush hour but served quickly.
classic bubble tea place
best place for bubbletea
my (joint) 1st fave bubbletea place in london - lychee green tea for the win!
incredible bubble tea

here ive tasted bubble tea for the first time. it was great. i felt in love with this tea flavor. so every time i drink bubble tea i remember this place and its atmosphere. highly recommend it to those who are still wondering what this tastes like.
good plum bubble tea
queued for 45 minutes on one occasion and no wait on another. this place serves pretty decent quality bubble tea and isn't too expensive. a good alternative to chatime.
decent bubble tea but not the best around
best bubble tea!
love this place so many different options
fanciest bubble tea ever
nice staff and good ice tea :)

amazing bubble tea! i really like this place and stay loyal to this shop as i believe they do the best bubble tea. the choice is big and staff always helpful. it's really worth a visit. at times it gets busy and people even have to line up outside the shop, but that's usually in the evenings.
no sitting room but great variety. always busy and there is a reason. a must drop by if u love bubble tea
there was a queue  but served very quickly nd then didn't have to wait long for the delicious drink, friendly staff
cute place in chinatown, next to another drink shop! has a wide variety of teas, add-in toppings, and customization options, and no card minimum. a nice stop for a drink in chinatown after a meal.
cheap and normal taste
best bubble tea place in london, forever returning.
been here 3 times so far during my london trip and i've had three different drinks all of them tasted amazing!
cuppacha has a wide range of bubble tea to choose from. i always have a classic bubble milk tea at all time.
very good but very hot because non air conditioner in shop.
lovely, delicious tea, however it is quite busy, but that shouldn't stop you from trying it. we had the taro tea with tapioca which was very very nice, would recommend.
great service and delicious tapioca pearls
always go there when i am around piccadilly circus, bubble tea is great
taro milk tea with tapioca bubbles are amazing. they don't contain any gelatine either so perfect for people with halal diet.
by far the best experience for my first boba tea

uff some nice bubble tea ranges here, it was a long wait till me turn but the waiting time after delivery was less than a minute despite getting orders via phone queue etc bags cost 5p. no toilets a waiting room is here quite small but very busy in the heart of west central london
best bubble tea place in london.

i used to really enjoy cuppacha - great bubble tea and my boyfriend is happy because they do proper tea with popping candy and tapioca! unfortunate recent experience where someone barfed all over the floor and the staff did literally nothing about it which is rather disgusting.
one of the better bubble tea places in london.this one is always consistent and their taro always very good
thank you to the kind cashier lady who complimented my tattoo. always a good service.
absolutely love their bubble tea.

tea is good and staff is nice. i specially liked morgan for hiz patience and his smile. it's very busy so there is almost never a place to sit and there is no place to stay and enjoy your drink. no toilet facilities available.

best taro milk tea i've ever had, it's smooth and creamy and perfectly sweet, staff are really nice and helpful despite how busy the store is! i also had soy milk because i can't have dairy and the flavour was amazing! really glad they have non-dairy options

for someone that loves bubble tea i always come here when i'm in london. especially love the strawberry milk bubble tea! if your new to cuppacha and don't like your bubble tea too sweet i'd recommend having less sugar in it.
great place to get a cup of bubble tea. wide selection of toppings and flavours

i ordered ombre tea with blueberry flavour, it was very sweet eaven though i ordered it less sugar, in general it was quite good for its price, the shop itself was really and the line was so long, that it continued eaven outside of the shop. the service was nice, and quick.every 10th tea is free.
very long wait for a disappointing boba milk tea. was hoping this would be a great boba shop, but ended up with a watered down milk tea. look elsewhere

good bubble tea. fast efficient service - we ordered the cuppacha pearl tea which was good, reasonably priced and took about 5mins to arrive after ordering, seats available for waiting. can pay by card. conveniently located near leicester square tube and chinatown. takeaway shop.
tons of different flavor options. hot or cold, different sugar options, ice or none, different bubble and jelly options. they also sell steam buns.

hands down the best bubble tea in all of london and quite possibly all of england. i never go to anywhere else as their quality is hard to beat. have been a loyal cutomer for many years now and always go when i get a chance.
bad bubble tea :(
waited so long for a drink and it was super sweet, couldn't finish

a sloth could serve drinks faster than they did. 20 minutes and still waiting. thought they were doing this deliberately to create a queue, but they're just super slow... they probably made 1 drink every 5 minutes?
wow delicious bubble tea, the busiest in the area
tasty. always busy, long queue outside. but it's worth it :)
brilliant bubble tea shop, would recommend but avoid going for chinese new year, it gets very busy
pretty good bubble tea. all though i had better tapioca . definitely worth a try
quite good. loads of variety. not too expensive. great for bubble tea lovers
yummy! fast service, friendly staff - busy but always a good sign!
only thing i have to say is how much money they would make with a shop in orpington or bromley
gotta love a good cup of bubble tea
lovely bubble tea with lots of options. there may be a queue  of peope waiting, and sometimes they don't have internet to pay with card, but still worth it if you like this type of cold tea.
tasty and most probably the best bubble tea in london
loud music which gave me a headache for the next 2 hours. felt incredibly rushed to make my order even though i'd never been before and had no idea what i was doing.
love their bubble tea.best place in london.
excellent customer service by kobi, who patiently took the time to help me decide on what to order with a really positive attitude
almost as good as in taiwan!

i decided to stop by this bubble tea store and it was a great experience bar the queue, but you can expect this at a popular bubble tea store. a great menu and i'll be coming there more often. thank you to vicky for serving me and providing excellent customer service.
loved the place so much. the lady who served me is such a sweet person and the bubble tea was amazing. thank you!

intriguing place.took forever to be served. the woman serving me took a few minutes to work out how to give me 85 pence change for a 5 note.i ended up receiving 50p in 5p's and 35p in 1 and 2p's.the drink took such a long time to be made too.2/10 - won't go again.
nice place to hang out.. nice tasting bubble tea.. it was really good.
if you like bubble tea you'll love cuppacha, it's a small place with a big choice and great service.
great place my fav bubble tea don't get reg sweet as it's too sweet
small space and quite crowded but great selection and quality. totally recommend.
great boba! staff are also super nice. yet, service took too long. i had to wait 20 minutes for a single cup of boba.

love it as per usual! took a friend from manchester who also liked what he got. been multiple times before and will continue to go! can get busy and the waiting time can be slightly long but that's expected in china town and central london.
excellent bubble teas. the tapioca pearls are always perfectly cooked.
tasty bubble tea just near the leicester square.
very poor bubble tea. cold when chose the hot one, and grainy matcha flavour. when told it wasn't hot, and asked them to remake it, they just added hot water which diluted the tea.
best bubble tea in london! highly recommended.
my favourite bubble tea spot in chinatown! theres usually a queue out the door, but it moves pretty quickly so dont be put off.
best bubble tea in town, and on top of that the staff is lovely! i go here almost every day.
good bubble tea but had to wait 15mins to make it
great service! luna was really friendly and super helpful!!
italy look small but it is a fast working shop
consistently delicious bubble tea with a huge amount of choice. line is always long but it's definitely worth it. my favourite bubble tea place in the uk.
always a queue even at night. good bubble tea love the range they have.

came in really late and it looked like the girls were packing up but they still took orders from me and my cousins. delicious bubble tea and friendly smiles from all staff. i highly recommend the taro bubble tea, one of my faves
woeful service. more than happy to take your money but youll have to wait 30 minutes for a cup of tea...

my niece loves bubble tea and particularly this place. there are so many bubble tea places but  this one seems to have the longest queues.they only had one member of staff serving, which considering the popularity of the place is just silly because it took aaaages to get thr bubble tea.
good bubble tea, but waiting time 30mins+
absolutely terrible. the boba tea was watery and trash. do not go here.
i had a mango drink of some kind and it was great
good taro bbt but way too sweet (i got half sugar, will try 20% sugar next time)
terrible. waited almost 30 minutes for 1 cup of bubble tea. the staffs were messing around and not doing their job
i go all the way to chinatown every time i'm in london just for cuppacha. love it so much! they let you personalize your drink down to the last drop.
good bubble tea, but extremely busy hence expect a long wait!

very nice pearl milk tea. one of my favourite in town. went with my friends. some of us love it, some other a bit less. is a convenient location and has affordable prices. not a very big shop, but big enough for chill a bit.
bubble drink was lovely but waited 10 mins for it.
best tasting bubble tea ive had in london so far
the drinks are always good here and always collect stamps! the buns are also worth thier price
i always eat here! noodles are always fresh
i regularly crave their mango milk tea, but they lost one star due to loooong lines and slooooooow service.

excellent bubbletea with a wide range of flavors. they don't just have the regular milk based ones, they also have water based and more lemonade like ones, with jelly, bobba and popping pearls. only downside is that it's a small shop that's very warm and you often have to wait a while, but it is worth the wait. prices are good too
love the bubble tea. it's become a ritual now. everytime i go to leicester square,  i do end up visiting cuppacha for a bubble tea. a good variety of flavored teas.
excellent menu of bubble tea and speedy service. highly recommend.
if you like this bubble tea, its very good place ! there is line to wait, but they make it very good with a lot of combinations.
delicious matcha redbean tea. big variety of fruit tea.

the bubble tea is food but they are outrageously slow for mediocre tea. i really like their bubble tea but not worth the wait. also... i think their pork bun gave me extreme diarrhea so be weary and ask them when they were made. the pork bun was delicious but made me really sick that night!

loved this pub, belgium beers are my absolute fave and this bar does not dissapoint. lots of different beers to choose from both on tap and bottles.place feels warm and cozy and there are quite a few places to sit. bar staff were very helpful if you needed advice with beer choices.will deffo visit again :)
good selection of beer and lagers and way more than you get in most places.  but 6.10 for a vedette lager isn't worth it though, the place is just a pub after all.

busy and popular central london pub with a great selection of belgian and dutch beers. dutch bar snacks are also available. upstairs room used to be available for comedy evenings, but i have no idea if that is still happening.
great beer selection
always a good friendly welcome. good beers and friendly bar staff.
great beer selection.
had a great time, but ended with delirium. today, the pain is real!
amazing range of drinks
lovely traditional english pub with a huge dutch influence. great continental beers to boot.
great pub for drinks and sports!
great selection of beers and nice pub. only downside is the two flights of stairs between upstairs where the majority of space is and the toilets.
one of my favourite pubs in picadilly/chinatown area. such nice crisp pilsners!
cozy ambiance, wide variety of beers, kind personel

love this pub. very casual, very dutch, massive beer selection. don't go upstairs though, has the reputation of smelling weird upstairs and went i went to see (smell) for myself, it was true. but all is great downstairs. they also have traditional dutch food, both bar food and proper meals.
mooie bar! really enjoyed the experience apart from them replaying netherlands beating england!
the place to get the elixir of life, fruli

fantastic place - we went there for the belgium vs tunisia world cup match and loved the ambience created. we received free (great quality) belgium t-shirts that we have kept and now wear for every belgium match and the beers there are bloody amazing! staff are very friendly and accommodating - overall great experience.
great beers, but the staff don't pour the beer for you. this is supposed to be a dutch bar, but they just give you a bottle and an empty glass.poor service.
great selection of belgian beers on tap. open til late and quite friendly staff. note it gets quite crowded on weekends.
service is really bad. staff have no interest in serving you. forgot our order 3 times !!!!
great beer, good snacks, nice atmosphere , good service, beer not cheap but for quality belgian beer it's ok
good selection of drinks and durch food! good atmosphere in what is an already atmospheric area.  like hems!
great bar with loads of european beer options and food available
they have all the beers
great bar with beers usually not seen in the uk
busy dutch pub in chinatown, decent selection of dutch n belgian beers ++. worth a visit if you're thirsty

i love their beers, though they are expensive. however, as it's beers you don't normally see in your local, then that's perhaps the price to pay. food was nice, especially the wonderfully indulgent katsu chicken burger.
a great pub with so many type of beers to select
very good pub in central london with a great variety of belgian beers.
great little pub with an upstairs. not too pricey for a london boozer
good pub for centre of london
wooden panelling helps soothe away the pain of paying 7.50 for 2/3rds of a pint. as does the 7.2% abv speciality ale you accidentally ordered because you can't pronounce any of the names. 5/5.
nice sushi
food range of beers and bar snacks in a cosy setting.
good selection of beers!
we love de hems and always try to visit when we're in the west end.
unique london pub steeped in history with dutch connection good snacks and large range continental dutch  / belgian strong beers.tv screens for news and football depending on fixtures.
nice beer selection, good atmosphere. owned by dutch owners. food is nice but a bit pricy and not huge portions.
good place to meet in chinatown. out of the ordinary beers. friendly staff.
great place in the central london. great selection of beers and great atmosphere
awesome food and beer! great ambience too
pne of my favourite bars in london. great range of continental beers and friendly service
very good range of craft beers
a nice and cozy place, with a lot of types of beers
authentic, bustling, vibrant. no place for wallflowers (but you knew that already i think). always a great night here!
hadn't been to this pub for ages until recently, still a great west end boozer
great  selection. hard to decide xd
very happy with the food here. good quality, staff were fast and attentive. very impressed, beer was also sublime!
located in china town. it's a good spot to grab a beer. besides, they have the best strawberry beer ever !
fun night out. good drinks and food menu. just completely avoid the nachos: tortilla chips served with mayo and sriracha (!?).
very lovely place. amazing selection of dutch drinks. but a bit crowded and no table service. you have to go to the bar every time you want to order. and i wish they had a smoking area.
lots of great beers, and frli on tap!
we love de hems! such great sevice! big shout out to amy for going the extra mile to make sure our nights at the hems was always pleasant! we will be back for sure!

slightly pricey but very good original dutch beer selection as well as many other choices. it's a cosy pub with larger and smaller tables and a great place for a drink between meals or for food. great for groups or small parties.
nice place!good beer!nice people!
great selection of beers and frli on tap!
nice atmosphere giod beers.
one of the best craft beer joints in central london
it gets crowded if there is a game on so book in advance if you want a table. good atmosphere. prices were reasonable. service a little slow.
a great selection of great beers
decent beer selection, few places to sit.
real dutch beers, great for watching the footie, perfect for a post beer nosh as right on china town. luv it
nice food, good atmosphere, lovely service.
favourite bar in london,  great beers, great place. love it.
ok bar nice atmospher
my spiritual home when i'm out and about in london.
one of the few pubs in london that has belgian beers (even a witbeer) on tap. the bar staff is friendly and helpful and the atmosphere is laid back - highly recommend!
good beer, great atmosphere. bar staff very nice people
good food, nice people

awesome dutch bar with loads of excellent belgian beers. some on the expensive side but not many places serve these. has a selection of dutch/belgian food as well in addition to the usual english pub fare. good atmosphere any time of the day. cool inside on a hot summer day or has 3 tables outside in the sun.
very good beer selection (and even delirium on tap)
really good place to go and see football. they got on first floor a big screen.

stood at the end of the bar for 20 minutes waiting to be served when it wasn't even that busy. whistled to the barman who said he would not serve me for whistling at him, so i went to a proper bar to spend my hard earned money. i will never enter this joke!! of a pub ever again!!!!
great place. lower end of london beer prices, for really nice selection of european beers. seating and second bar upstairs, somewhere quiet when matches are on downstairs.  really friendly staff.
great range of european beers. lively atmosphere
good atmosphere and great choice of beer.
beers and more beers. you get lost on so many and how rich they are. it's a bit of heaven on earth.
love the beer and the pub too
pretty good selection of european beers and dutch bar snacks with a fun atmosphere of 90s and 00s music. great place to be in central london on a weekend. can get very busy!
the food is delicious and the staff welcoming and friendly. a great place to while away a couple of hours.
very well decorated, good choice of drinks and lovely staff

a unique pub, how many other dutch bars in the orbit of london's chinatown, theatre district and gay scene will you encounter? good staff, a really interesting range of dutch beers,  and that location .
watched the football in comfort with a fairly pricey but tasty fish & chips with leffe.
nice unusual beer selections, good atmosphere, good pub.
great ceramic. great beer. terrific place!
good pub but annoyingly use ikea like pint glasses so there's no head in any of the drinks. would have preferred it if they used proper pint glasses.
interesting place. amazing range of beers
very typical, nice atmosphere, many kind of beers
packed as usual but great beers. fruli on tap.
great place to watch football just off of leicester square, great vibe.
great pub good choices of beers. recommend bitterballen if you fancy a snack it yummy.
one of my favourite places near soho area. good selection of beers. food is ok but expect a typical pub food. nice to see some sports on occasionally.
unusual choice of dutch beers, was able to find a seat upstairs!
nice bar very busy best early
great selection of beers. fab place to meet

fun pub in the heart of soho! good selection of beers bottled and on tap! great for watching the sport, gets quite busy but has people evenly spread over the two floors and has a great atmosphere! it's oddly deceptive in size.... don't get lost.....!
awsome, so many beers
friendly professional service. great selection of good quality beers.
outstanding dutch beer. friendly, helpful staff. great atmosphere.
great place to have some beers with friends.
lots of continental bottled and draft beers. can get lively
great meeting place, nice and central on the edge of chinatown. prices as expected. can be busy but service is usually pretty quick. if you arrive after 9pm you can usually get a seat.
nice bar for.somemnice beers
best hieneken outside of holland

very rude staff who failed to mention to the 15 of us the kitchen would be closing early for a function. one person managed to order and the rest of us had to watch them eat it. it wasn't even 7.20pm when the staff snapped "kitchen closes at 7.30pm". you've lost a big group who won't return now

if you cant wait to go back to the netherlands to have dutch food, this is the place to go. i highly recommend the frikandellen speciaal. for a moment i thought i was back in amsterdam. please open up a branch in south east london. i can not wait to return. dank je wel!
great range of dutch and belgian beers with friendly staff

a good place perfectly located. a lot of belgians and dutch go there to see sports games from their favourite national teams. very good belgian beers... they have delirium and even white vedett on the tap! delicious.
nice little pub.  good beer and a small outside area to drink and people watch.
good atmosphere and a good choice of beers
shame they dont do kaassoufles or flgel anymore:(, beside that always nice to have a little bit of home close by! and love the beer selections, would be great to have heineken 0.0 as well:)
spacious pub showing football in soho. if you're near soho and want to watch football it's your best choice. good size with multiple screens. and right beside chinatown if you're hungry too
unusual beers on tap. busy during peak times. more room available upstairs. worth a visit for beer or two.
good knowledge of beers and a wide range to choose from.heading upstairs is wholly recommended.
the bitterballen are nice, and a lot of the employees are dutch. ended up not having a dutch beer because of the inflated prices though. my favourite beer is 1,95 back home, here 6,60.
belgian beer on tap in london! this makes me happy.
amazing selection of dutch beers, a little bit on the pricey side, but it is as central as it gets.
always a great experience. was a busy lunchtime but service was friendly and fast. food is delicious and prices are great for the area.
cosy pub. usually quite quiet so you can always get a seat
a great bar with a wide selection of beer and good food, but can get v busy.
decent pub, often quite busy. wouldn't suggest it for a 'dutch' experience. is more like a regular pub with some dutch beers on offer.  because of being so crowed, we left pretty early on.
my favourite bar serving a wide choice of draft and bottle belgium beers in a pleasant continental style bar. also serving excellent continental food.

this pub has been there for years! always good selection of beer and lager and good-humoured bar staff. no pressure on us either to buy more or to leave. nice chips, fiercely expensive (though maybe not for the area).

fantastic choice of drinks. many of the beers are unusual, belgian and dutch, some of which are very strong as well as being very tasty. staff very knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. comfortable and relaxed atmosphere. definitely visit again.
a really nice dutch bar in a very central location. very nice ambience and atmosphere. it was especially good to get a pint of lindeboom, not a beer i have seen for a while.

to feel like a dutcman in london, you must come here. great selection of dutch snacks and artisan beers. this two level pub offers both mainstream pub atmosphere on lower and great intimate space on top floor.beer is cold and bartender girl is hot and very professional, do not miss understood her gorgeous smile and red lipstick.
cracking place. loads of tasty dutch beer (yum!) and decor is lovely inside. could easily spend all day in there, especially with the stronger beers!
good place for belgian beer and some dutch snacks
great beer choice! the best place in the city to have a cold pint of leffe.
best (and only) dutch pub in town.
good beer selection but the music tends to get unnecessarily loud
great pub with loads of really nice beers and friendly staff :)
love this place, my mum met my dad here over 20 years ago and no i go here with them age 20!! crazy
amazing selection of beers and great screens for the football. loads of space and seats upstairs if it looks busy downstairs.
some good beers, but there were some notable missing beers from the bottle menu.
unfortunately they didn't know what a 'bittergarnituur' was. maybe as dutchies we expected too much of the dutch experience. drinks were good though!
just awesome! great selection of beers, and their vegan beyond burger is out of this world! great vibe and great service!
friendly staff. not super packed considering it's location. amazing selection of beers.
as dutchman i really like all the special beers they have. it feels like coming home in a bath of alcoholic goodness.
always fun to be in london and visit a dutch pub. nice athmosphere.
fantastic bar with lots of dutch and belgian beer choices, i'll definitely be back again

some superb dutch /belgian beers, though difficult to work out what they were going to be, so we did a selection. late opening on a wed night so perfectly set up to go on to ronnie scott's afterwards.
one of my favourite pubs in central london! seating area upstairs is brighter and quieter than downstairs too.
nice enough pub, good selection of beer. quite expensive but expected for a central london pub
the beer is strong here. be careful ok. but god i love their choice in music!
i love this bar and the atmosphere and food and choices of beers and slap bang in the city

i think my granddad has been here during the 2e world war. he was sailing between england and holland as a captain for the dutch "koopvaardij". he never told us were he realy stayed but i like to thinks that he drunk his beer in this pub.now my son lives in london and this is his favoriet pub. it gives me a good feeling!
love this place! so many delicious belgian fruit beers to try. and great food too :) try the kip sate
great bar great choice if beers. great for watching sports.

they were objectively racist. i have never written a review, but at a belgian pub, i was refused drinks (as is their right) without any clear reason (if you are passed out or throwing up you should be refused), but lucid it is shocking
quirky, noisy but still a good place to kick off an evening

what a great find and a real treat for central london! hosting german and belgium beers, this place would add an interesting and playful dimention to the casual 'meet and drink'! the prices are decent, especially for being so central, and staff are friendly and helpful.

cool place, great vibe, fantastic selection of dutch and belgian beers. also serve food. it's a shame they only have one non-alcoholic beer in the whole place, and even that is not dutch. please consider increasing your selection for those of us driving!

great atmosphere. great drinks. lovely employees. especially when ajax or the dutch national team play football this is the place to be. home away from home for dutchies. but also a great place when youre not dutch.
this is the best pub in london. great beer, great location and always a fun atmosphere. this is my local, even though i live in zone 5/4
fantastic venue
great beer selection!
the place is full of character, the choice of beer is amazing and the strawberry-blonde bartender with the thick dutch accent made it feel even more authentic

perfect selection of dutch/belgian beers. very crowded on a saturday night, maybe a bit more room upstairs. knowledgeable staff and just perfect location in the centre of everything. recommended visit whenever british ales just don't feel satisfying enough.
loads of european beers
been a good pub for years. always a nice pint
great beer with the added bonus of a brilliant atmosphere
little london gem. always a pleasure to come back there
best selection of beers on tap in london! relaxed vibe with lots of space to sit.
reasonable price and cheerful.
everything was perfect until we were kicked out before letting us finish our drinks in peace. you don't call last round to not let people finish it!
one of my favourite pubs in london, serving a good selection of dutch and belgian beers.
decent selection of beers from holland and belgium. wasn't too crowded for a friday night given the location.
really like this bar. great beers and good atmosphere.
great ambiance and they are showing eredivisie games!
a little gem of a place. primarily continental beers, food looked good. has history linking the bar to the dutch resistance during ww2, recommend you pop in for a pint of good continental beer.
amazing place, great selection of beers
pricey but some great beers. last few times i've been sat outside and everyone seems to smoke. bar upstairs less busy and serve god grub.

really nice dutch bar in the heart of soho. the beer selection is very extensive with scores of different beers from holland and belgium, the fruity ones among others.  this bar is also very popular during sports event when the netherlands team is playing as its a place where many dutch come to watch wearing orange colours
great pub. check out the upstairs bar - apparently it was used by the dutch resistance. oyster shell walls are amazing. love the dutch nibbles they have.
one of the best pubs in chinatown. really excellent selection of beers, loads of craft beers and a nice venue. such a refreshing change from a lot of the very touristy venues in central london.

i got hooked on this place. the best bartender ever who really knows the selection of beers they have (90 something of import beers). if you ever experienced  good dutch beers you will find one, like me (le chouffe). don't worry if u have no clue, the bartender guy can offer something that will  blow your mind.
all good. very nice beer and tasty food
good selection of dutch beers, can be a bit tricky to get a seat at times.
excellent selection of beers.  always friendly.  staff here are excellent too... very professional.  particularly fun on kings day.
overpriced, flavourless lager, disinterested staff
a classic old pub
a lively and very dutch pub with great choice of drinks
varied beers and ciders. good atmosphere.
dutch themed pub in the middle of london. fun place to try new beers.
gets very, very busy. but easily the best pub in soho.

good solid pub atmosphere. prices are reasonable with solid 100+ beer selection. staff were friendly and recommended a great new beer for me. food was recommended by a friend but i find it a bit average. prepared fried cheese and meat. would go back to the pub again but not for the food.
great place to catch up with friends, nice and central if you live in london. good selection of beers!
been there last friday. food was great!!! i had fish and chips it was lovely! highly recommend to try it.
lovely cup of coffee and friendly staff.
great for dutch people who like to get a taste of back home. also for people who like to taste a real dutch beer. also a friendly barman
great atmosphere. expensive beers.

it's a nice pub in that there us a decent choice of beers and is not unreasonably proceed given its location. however, it absolutely stinks of chlorine as they use a cleaning product that is far too strong and chemical. this is totally overpowering and really spoils the pub experience.
great selection of beers from the continent, friendly and knowledgeable staff. can get a little busy, but we'll worth a visit.
delirium tremens on tap! dangerous.
mice old pub on the edge of chinatown.
a quiet boxing day visit. lovely bar, plenty of continental beers available. can't see any casks on but there are a couple of pumps. pleasant welcoming staff. right in chinatown, worth a visit.
nice pub. struggle to ever get great service here, but that's cental london for you. it's a dutch pub with many belgian beers. but also does dutch food.
very nice pub in china town. very good beers from holland. very comfortable inside. very busy at times but i tend to go there outside peak times. recommend watering hole.
fabulous atmosphere for the football. we reserved a table and so glad we did as the pub was full be kick off. there is a good selection of tasty food and a fantastic choice of beers.
awesome selection of dutch and belgian beers .. worth visiting
nice place, wide selection of beers to choose from.
one of my favourite places to grab a drink, this bar has an amazing location and an even more amazing selection of beers i really recommend trying out different ones , you'll be surprised
a nice normal pub with a great selection of beer, including some dutch favourites. also a great selection of authentic dutch snacks and bar food. worth a visit!
huge choice of brilliant beer.
good beer. good vibes. good staff.
how have i only just found this gem? takes me back to the land of the windmills and canals, with dutch footy on the box, dutch booze in the glasses and dutch food on the plates. pass the mayo!
best pub in town. for dutchies anyway
nice quality pub, friendly
to the general manager who attacked me for breaking the furniture that i did not break: check cctv before attacking me and making my friend cry. that was just shocking and disgusting!
i enjoyed the great selection of belgian beers they have! the food was great as well
tasty dutch beer
very helpful barman. didn't have the beer i wanted but had a tasty similar one in his fridge upstairs.
wonderful atmosphere and really good service. the beer isn't bad either.
great range of belgian beer in this place we had duvel
yeah it's a good bar to go to, with a central position. beers were reasonably priced and good atmosphere at night time.
decent central london dutch/belgian there car, good beer choices
nice place to grab a beer. any beer. affordable prices. good and friendly personnel.
great beer and service as usual
fantastic institution for beers, snacks and football in the heart of central london
it was amazing
fantastic little pub with great history! good selection of beers but can get a little crowded..
large selection of dutch beers on tap.the bitterballen are home made and taste differently from the ones you would typically find in the netherlands.
food was cold and had two hairs! the staff were mostly nice, apart from a few that were really patronising and hostile! over priced. don't go!
great pub with a good selection of wines. it's a central london pub so naturally it gets pretty busy at times. but it has great character and the staff are nice.
come here if you want to meet fellow dutch
loved the place.  a fantastic pub right in the middle of the westend.a great choice of beers but unfortunately some work needed in regards to service by some bar staff.
if you want great dutch or belgium beer this is the place. comfy setting and friendly staff. one i spoke to even was duch himself :)
perfect place for watching dutch football, have a variety of dutch beers and snacks.
a tradeoff between a tourist place and an oppotunity to drink belgian beer on tap
always busy, sometimes takes a while to get served becos of this
lively bar selling good range of dutch beers and craft ales.

been here with friends in a rainy afternoon. the place is really nice and cosy, with tables on ground floor and 1st floor. we had a good cider and a very good mixed plate of dutch starters (sausages and croquettes) as a shared snack. multiple big screens were present, showing current football matches.
one of the very few places that you can get leffe on tap. great pub, shame about my hangover.
have to be the best doughnuts i've personally had in london, tad bit pricey but one will certainly leave you satisfied
beautiful donuts but slightly overrated. i'm a simple girl who likes simple donuts.
amazing doughnuts, dont know the name of the chap, but customer service was brill and with a smile
not the best donuts. overly sickening. very expensive for bread and icing.
fab donuts and love the novelty names! david hassle-biscoff... yum
delicious and incredibly clever. loved the names and flavours of the doughnuts. bit pricey at 4.50 each but it's an experience.

( no gluten free doughnuts ) i went all the way there, because i read the previous post that they have gf doughnuts but they don't. so please anyone will post a review you must be sure about your information, otherwise this will happen again for others!
doughnuts very tasty and fresh just a bit doughy.
really impressed..i got the red velvet and it was so savory. i will definitely try other types as well.
sugarrush. is the word to describe it. coviniently located by the busstop. missed three buses trying to decide which one to choose.
my fave lotus vegan donut

the doughnuts look tasty and very picture worthy although when you bite into them they are quite bland and stale. also very pricey. can recommend to go and take a picture of the collection but not sure if they are worth the price.
the donuts looked way better than what they actaully taste like, prefer dunkin donuts, sorry.

when they first opened their doughnuts were amazing. lately though ive found theyre always dry and stale. its basically like icing on a dry cake ring.  for better value youre better off with a krispy kreme from tesco.
so good, so big and have vegan options.

this place is one of my favourite places to visit in london. there's no sitting in, it's literally just a take away option, but the range of flavours and toppings are incredible. me and my partner have been twice and each time we have not been let down. the prices are excellent considering how large each doughnut is.
first visit and definitely won't be the last

love those doughnuts. i used to get them back in australia with friends a lot. having said that however i was shocked by the rude staff member who basically ignored me for 5 minutes and then only said 2 words in total. kinda ruined my excitement of getting doughnuts.

love the names of these doughnuts. definitely makes you look twice and want to get some. sugar overload but actually quite good as i had feared the visual and names were compensating for the taste. kept on seeing many people near the shop with the boxes so must be popular too.
small stall rather than a shop but that works in its favour where you can pick the doughnut you want and go, friendly staff aswell
stylish donuts with all types of flavours.if you need a sugar boost, thats the place. worth the taste and a comeback. there is a classic option as well. well behaved staff and baked at the place.
small shop but great doughnuts
their doughnuts are absolutely delicious. they are also huge, get ready for a lifetime of sugar in your mouth!
frieny and easy to get too
they look nice but they are so sickly sweet that i only managed one bite. also the kinder bueno was a basic chocolate donut with pieces of kinder on top
this store does accept cash which is good, the attention was on point, but now talking about what is important, the doughnuts really amazing, is bigger that the average and original.
the doughnuts are delicious but it's a bit pricey.
amazing donuts, don't worry about the calories.
nice looking place in a great location with great branding, but the doughnuts weren't that great. the two we got were very sickly, not all that tasty and very expensive for what they are!
the most amazing doughnuts i have tasted and to know they have vegan options that taste just as great, would highly recommend
had these incredible doughnuts in their native australia, overjoyed they have made it to the uk. the best doughnuts in the northern hemisphere.
yummiest doughnuts ever, small shop, lovely and friendly staff, lots of delicious flavours, loved the kit kat doughnut the most!
amazing range of doughnuts. loved by many. i had the robert di oreo one and it was great. cannot wait to try the biscoff one!**update: tried the biscoff one and it's my favourite!
never had a doughnut like this before. it's massive, it's delicious and overall massivly delicious.
dont miss out on the nutella or rolo doughnuts, by far the best, i have tried them all :)
artisan doughnuts to die for, if your in the mood for doughnuts give your taste buds a treat and skip the krispy cremes and go straight for these bad boys instead
i really wanted to like this after the first donut i tried, but subsequent ones i've had were quite horrible.  they are also quite overpriced at 5 pounds a donut!
tasty vegan doughnuts but little bit expensive
the donuts are nice. however, a fiver for one donut it is too expensive.
below average doughnut covered in an excess of store-brought flavours with a cute name and an excessive price tag.  not good, not worth it, and the staff is rude!

if i was going by i'd get a doughnut but wouldn't come specially. they are a bit overpriced. i wanted a sugar doughnut, don't like fillings but they didn't have it so had the nutella one... lots of nutella inside. this is just a kiosk, so you can only takeaway or eat it on the street.
may be a bit pricey but for the size of the doughnuts and the variety it's defo worth it!
they do percy pig doughnuts. well worth the trip!
lovely little hole in the wall for doughnuts, i found them absolutely massive and full of filling. do good deals on the more doughnuts you buy.
really good donut! one of the best in london, thicker than crosstowns and almost reaching chicagos best ones
bit pricey for a doughnut but bear in mind they are huge. i got the nutella filled one and it was delicious.
4.50 for one donut and it doesn't even have much flavour, other reviews are good but this was not.
quite possibly the best doughnuts. great selection with the funniest names. give it a go

doughnuts look fantastic, however i found that they selected a doughnut from the front shelf - dry and stale. you really need to be providing customers with the freshest specimens - so would not recommend!
the donuts look way better than they actually taste, dry and stale. a low average donut with fancy decorations on top. no idea why people queuing for this. totally overrated and pricey.
tried their christmas red velvet doughnuts its tastes and looks so delicious! will buy again for our christmas tea dessert
great doughnuts but you should probably share one with a friend because they are big!

ordered online the day before, very easy pickup the next day! vegan doughnuts were delicious, the best tasting in london! doughnuts were already neatly packed in a box and presentation was perfect when we got them out later
if you want a doughnut in the west end, head here for instant carb satisfaction.
so delicious
great doughnuts! had a basic jam doughnut and it was done really well. prices decent and staff friendly. loyalty card available.
if you love doughnuts then this is the place to go. forget the pretenders (krispy kreme) as doughnut time is thy king or queen to the sweet treat you can't wait to eat throne.
this place is literally a hole-in-the-wall and was literally heaving with people.  the doughnuts were extremely sweet and really way too expensive.
amazing! love this place!
amazing doughnuts. had bueno mars. tasted delicious!
amazing doughnuts way better than other doughnut shops, wide array of flavours and so filling. if you arrive just before closing expect a limited choice of doughnuts though.
too sweet and full of suger
large doughnuts... very good tasting!!
my favourite place in london! been a couple times an dloved it every single visit
if you love doughnuts then this is the place to go. great taste.
pricey but delicious doughnuts at this booth-like shop. expect long queues at weekends!
great selection of doughnuts, with different coatings and fillings.but prices are a bit excessive.
a bit of an expensive treat but these doughnuts are amazing!

i am giving them 3 stars for innovation, variety and size (huge donut). i tried 4 different flavors and all were bland and donut dry (not fresh). its a shame after all this hype! they could definitely do better especially that they are charging 4+ per donut!

really fun little kiosk a short walk from china town.yes the doughnuts do appear a little overpriced but wow! they are huge! we really enjoyed the ones we had, each probably contains your daily calorie intake but oh well!they also offer a loyalty card which is stamped for every doughnut you buy.
i love this place. the doughnuts are amazing, - so so yummy! and they do vegan ones which are so tasty.
most incredible donut
some of the best donuts i've tasted around the world.
great doughnuts

amazing been wanting to stop by this place for a long time, got a selection today and i ate one and cant look at the rest there massive, top quality, highly recommended, would definitely call again when am back in london.

phenomenal doughnuts that manage to be grand and ott without being all style over substance. the doughnuts are light and fluffy, filled well, and not too sweet at all. very happy with the pricing and will be coming back again for more
fantastic doughnuts and friendly staff.
the filling of the one called robert d'oreo (or something like that) wasn't good. the lotus one was quite good. the second time i ordered kinder and that was reaaally amazing.
not cheap buy good selection and tastes great
the doughnuts are great and very big, the only gripe i have is they need more amazing variety to choose from.
just amazing!

the doughnuts are plentiful and customer service is superb. there is a lot of choice and they even offer vegan doughnuts for those interested. the bueno mars doughnut is sublime and even just one of them will fill you up.
creative doughnuts, interesting flavours.

indulgence at it best! such an enticing selection of doughnuts, had the 'bueno mars' and it was amazing. doughnuts are huge so they can almost serve as a whole meal if you have a small appetite ^^ very good quality food, full of sugar sure, but a little extra never hurt anybody, just please yourself and enjoy a piece of pure happiness
oh so delicious.  ice ice bae bae forever!
amazing selection although, not as fresh as they could be!!
yaaaaaas! the vegan option is absolutely delicious.
i go here to buy the delicious vegan doughnuts though they sell non vegan as well. they are huge!

tasty 'bueno mars' certainly get a lot of icing outside and filling when you're paying 4.50 per donut. second time been now and got a loyalty card when purchase 9 get 10 stamp free donut. the flavours and pun names are creative, though they don't feel like luxurious high end.
i'm glad someone recommend me this place. the hans solo and ice ice baby ones were amazing. i mean it's worth the massive spike in blood sugar. i will be back, would love to see a  cream egg one.
tasty doughnuts...
poor quality doughnut batter which is super greasy and with sickening sweet toppings and fillings. i would not recommend the current recipes.
i live for these doughnuts. holy moly, so good.
a bit pricy but very delicious
great doughnuts with lovely service!

the doughnuts are absolutely massive and look delicious, but unfortunately neither myself nor my partner thought they tasted like much at all. very bland and overly sickly sweet. not worth the 9 we paid for 2 at all - stick to krispy kreme.
the doughnuts will amuse you. believe me! one doughnut costs 4.5 which i believe is more than worth it!!
they have very delicious doughnuts!
nice staff and a quick service! it's a shame the biscoff one was sold out (which was the one i wanted) but seems like it sells out quick.if you want it, go early afternoon! i will.
very instagrammable! doughnut was a little dry this time compared to the last time we had it, when it tasted very fresh
the nutella and the lotus are the best
nice doughnuts, very large but still too expensive in my opinion. however was a nice treat.
every time i'm in london i go here and absolutely adore the doughnuts. one piece of advice: don't eat them sitting in the bus stop by the shop... it gets very messy!!
best doughnuts i've ever eaten! they have a great selection of donuts which cost around 4.50 each. whilst the price seems high, the donuts do taste amazing.
products are great but the customer service needs work at shaftesbury ave.
sweet, sweet doughnuts. homer would be in heaven.
loved their vegan donuts
my fave doughnuts.  every branch ive been to the staff are super friendly, the doughnuts are always so fresh and tasty
takeaway service only!but, the doughnuts are amazing! a must try, beware they only have a few flavours and they sell out quick!
great looking doughnuts and tasted good, a doughnut costs 4.50

loved this place! the doughnuts are huge, i couldn't even finish one. great selection. it's around 4.50 a doughnut but if you buy more some deals are available. everyone should try this place even just once. i hope i'm near by again soon!
these are great go when you can. always can not wait to go back

i love donut time! its awesome and just made for social media. the donuts are delicious and i don't feel to guilty as they are gluten free and vegetarian! if you ever go i suggest you pick the "stranger rings 2.0" if you're a chocolate lover and a fan of the tv show stranger things. but it would 110% if they added a seating area.
definitely on the pricier side for dough nuts but so worth it. best donut i have ever had (vegan red velvet). they have a vast selection of vegan doughnuts as well
best doughnuts around! amazing flavours especially the stuffed nutella one!
best doughnuts i've ever had. can't stress this enough: do not miss.
cracking doughnuts
it's quite good (to look at and & eat)
fantastic doughnuts with great names
great doughnuts and customer service - highly recommend chocolate orange
very expensive!,  and nothing special.
expensive for just a flour with an icing on top
i tried 2 types of donuts , they were good and instagramable. but they didnt have any filling in them . if you like the sugary old style donut u will love them , plus the crazy topings on top.

my ability to get healthy is constantly thwarted by the most amazing doughnuts that doughnut time make. i'm going to have to ban myself from soho if i want to survive because they're just too delicious to say no to if you're nearby.
great doughnuts, just wish you could eat in!
great doughnuts! you dont know what to choose actually. we had one filled and one not. both so tasty!
delicious, huge donuts with funny names. not cheap but well worth it.
well what can i say i work in leon next to you guys.best customer service. best doughnuts you can eat anywhere.once you have the first bite you don't want to stop.i love you guys a lot xx
yummy

the most amazing doughnuts you will find not every season is the same you will find the doughnuts rotate its a london thing and maximum respect to the customer service if you have love for doughnuts and in the city make sure you dont miss out
i believe that this place and crosstown doughnuts are the best in london
doughnuts were much too large and hard to eat, nothing really exciting about the taste and quiet expensive as well. i only got one as i had heard they were good. will prob not visit again.
yummy doughnuts, great flavour choices!

i absolutely am in love with their doughnuts. thank you to the lady also who called us to say they ran out of the doughnut i ordered and asked if i wanted a replacement. great doughnuts and even better customer service!!
the best doughnuts
delicious doughnuts!
best doughnuts ever. the names are punny and full of joy. they are pricey but massive and tasty. big love. fair dinkum tasty
these are just great tasting doughnuts, well worth the price, they are massive, loved every bite...cant wait for some more....
sugarcoma!  amazing doughnuts

prepare yourself for a queue, luckily it goes fast. innovative names and even more innovative looking doughnuts might confuse you to thinking that your eating something else than deep fried flour and sugar. if you want to slash +4 on that, this is definitely worth it. if you just need a sugar hit, go to anywhere that sells doughnuts.

we passed this counter several times while walking the streets of london. we caved on the third pass, and it was worth it. we tried the chocolate orange, the nutella filled, and the cookie dough. while a little pricy, the doughnuts were large, and the staff was very friendly.
these doughnuts are to die for!!! a little pricey but you get what you pay for and this is london so it's to be expected.
vegan option are bangin'!!!!!!
best doughnut i've ever had, very expensive though.

the donut names and selections are really fun (shout out to snicki minaj and notorious p.i.g.). but i found the taste quite lacking overall, after having tried three different flavours. the really big size of the donuts actually takes away from the "donuty" taste. fun for a visit but the taste is nothing special.
nice variety of donuts but not your typical store bought donuts.
fantastic doughnuts but no seating. so beware.
they have fixed doughnuts! everything i tried from here was amazing especially the snicki menaj and the red velvet
great doughnuts.... tasty
great roadside kiosk with a variety of tasty options.

this shop doesn't have seats. it is a takeaway shop. their doughnuts were quite good. i tried ice ice bae. it was huge and extremely sweet. but i still loved it. i felt the price was a bit high but it's ok to try once in a while. they do have some offers for purchasing 4 or 5 doughnuts together.
excess! and then some. i'm not a vegan, but don't be deterred by the vegan label on some doughnuts, they are just as amazing as all the rest.
vegan doughnuts. yum!!! awesome  selection loved eating these krispy who?

randomly found it on a while walking through london, not only are the doughnuts big and tasty the flavours are fun and silly which is great. the girl in there was really nice and helpful as well making my selection for me when i couldn't decide... if you happen to see it, thanks twix one was a great choice
i'm fat now but it was worth it.
spectacular doughnuts
overpriced and bland - very disappointed
ok, this place is legit. great donuts with a variety of flavor combinations. you could split one easy.
meh..................... something is off with this place. australia still had the best when they where open! heavy and stale unfortunately
best doughnuts. i love these guys
nice treat now and then
not bad doughnuts, but they are very big and clunky. you are far better served with crosstown, which have in my opinion a more polished and delicate flavor profile than this.

the bueno mars doughnut was the best doughnut i have ever eaten - and i've eaten a lot of doughnuts. of all the ones i tried i was impressed, huge, amazing dough, generous fillings, ridiculous and unique toppings... best doughnuts ever
so worth the wait, so delicious!
doughnuts are absolutely delicious, my favourite was a red velvet cream cheese one but they seemed to have doing this one last time i was there. also have vegan ones
possibly some of the best doughnuts in london
went there really late at night, sadly there wasn't much choice but the two doughnuts i had were amazing can't wait to go back to london to try more.
ive been here a few times now. excellent merchandising, but this place is very hit-and-miss. the donuts generally arent fresh enough. too bad.
stranger rings donut . filled with nutella. definitely a two person operation to finish. amazeballs.
best food i've ever eaten in my entire life!!!!!

i love the donut time in old street, i came to the piccadilly one with my sister after dinner and was so excited but there were flies crawling all over the donuts! it made me feel sick so we instantly walked away!

one for 4.5  a little bit too expensive , i order the one with chocolate crumble on the top and with some ganache dressing without stuffing inside . its good but not great , i will say it is so so and maybe other flavor will better.
best doughnuts in town imo (also i love the puns)
the best tasting doughnuts ever.
the first time i went i had a jam doughnut which was good. the second time i got a nutella doughnut, which was very dense and dry, and a snicki minaj which had better dough but was way too sweet.
5ver for a doughnut...dont need a meal after it.
side doughnuts packed with flavours. they should open a coffee shop so you can have a coffee with the amazing doughnuts.
very tasty fast and efficient. only thing no napkin as very sticky
beautiful little store, could do with a few more flavours but not complaining as the doughnuts were delicious
amazing
simply delicious
quite expensive for a doughnut, but when i got home to eat it, i could absolutely appreciate why. very delicious if you're in the mood for a fancy doughnut
excellent donuts.
easily the best doughnuts ive ever had - amazing range of doughnuts and friendly staff!
second time visiting here, always a queue and for good reason! amazing doughnuts!
nice doughnuts. should try the chocolate one with oreos!
great lady serving us on sunday,
love the nuttela stuffed doughnut  prices from 4 and above good size
very lovely, staff are nice and the doughnuts, whilst expensive, always hit the spot

funny seeing 5* reviews when the shop had not opened / existed in this location...also, shop was closed within its opening times - with no indication when it would be open, so it's roll-the-dice if you are paying a visit.
delicious doughnuts! emma was super nice and told us lots about the different flavours :)

oooo these donuts! so for me the veruca salt (salted caramel) donut is a winner - fluffy donut and super tasty caramel (i could easily eat a bowl of that caramel) also the donuts have fab names, and are of course tasty :)
the filling tasted off and the staff were very rude. crosstown or even krispy kreme is much better.
as homer would say... "mmmmm doughnuts"you'll see the place as there'll be a queue. i'd recommend the whole doughnuts so you can enjoy the fillings.good options for vegans too!
lovely donughts sterp price about 4-6 each
awesome dougnuts. vegan options
expensive artisan doughnuts for the connoisseur
love this place!!
cute and delicious!
limited collection of high quality doughnuts
great vegan doughnuts, downside... they always tun out of them!
tasty donuts very good quality
nice place, a lot of vegan options

by far the worst doughnut i've had in my life. it was so hard and stale and just decorated with twix and made to look delicious. tasted like a 2 week old doughnut...then charged me 4.50 for it in stratford westfield!
awesome, but not cheap!
delicious doughnuts!!! could have better prices though
huge am super delicious doughnuts
amazing doughnuts. each of them is a piece of art. and quite filling.however, be ready to pay 4.50 for a doughnut...
fun and funky. one doughnut is enough to share between 2 or 3 people, and extra large doughnuts are available too!
some were quite good but others might be a little too sweet. could you launch some less sweet choices please? (e.g. dark choc! )
perfect doughnut everytime i go , i only get once a month now cause it a tad pricey for a 4 pack but nonetheless still deliciously good.
great doughnuts and very interesting flavours. friendly staff.
a fantastic selection of vegan donuts! i suggest they get some string to tie the boxes so they can be carried securely and easily.
forget about the price, forget about the calories and enjoy one of the best doughnuts in town! - nice selection of fillings and great names...definitely recommend this place 5

had a pb & j.lo, big, ugly, below average. heavy dough, cheap tasting jam and peanut butter, 4 each, so extremely bad value for money.  rather have a krispy kreme at a push or even better paul's chocolate doughnuts/beignets, no instagram needed there.
sickly, just lots of sugar and over priced for doughnuts
it's always gay time doughnut is the best one!!! highly recommend

brilliant shop! not the cheapest but anything bought here is certainly validated by its quality and uniqueness! products change regularly, but always a goid variety. i chose the houston, we have a biscoff, which was amazing! go out of your way to get here, it's a must visit.
amazing donuts
overpriced and not nice soft serve
amazing donut. i had the creme de la creme and wish i could have tried more. the bitter sugar on top offsets the sweetness of the filling.
so glad i dont live in london otherwise i would spend all my money  here and get really fat. best doughnuts ive ever had. when i visit london i always get a six-pack
the best doughnuts ever. theyre massive! (with a massive price tag) but sooo worth it. best ive ever had. there are so many vegan flavours and all sooo good
best. doughnuts. ever. seriously this place is awesome, used to buy back in melbourne and so happy it's here now. staff are super friendly and helpful too.
disappointing. look better than they taste. krispy kreme much better.
delicious doughnuts - very sweet and sickly so probably a good idea to share.

had the nutella. overpriced. tasted old and refrigerated. not saying they were... maybe they're better in the morning after not being store the whole day... the doughnuts are more of a dense cake, not soft and warm like freshly made traditional ones.
overpriced. overrated.
huge and delicious treats.
delicious but pricey! definitely more of a treat rather than a weekly snack. i bought the doughnut with the ferrero rocher and it was delicious! also cost about 4. friendly service.
delicious donuts. takeaway only here.
great dessert place
i cant get over this place. best doughnuts going
amazing doughnuts. like kk on crack.
who don't love a doughnut!?
prices are ok. but it's not the best vegan or non vegan donuts i've had. a bit of a disappointment. i've even gone to another doughnut time and had better donuts.
my favourite is the'pump up the jam'. good way to end a night out.
authentic
too much thick filling. the bueno bar on top tasted like it was 5 years old.
one of the best dumpling restaurant in china town!
excellent!
lovely dim sum
the best dumplings in china town!
always a winner
wow. just wow!!!!!
pretty good food, but closer to average. service was good, nice vibe too! enjoyed the tap beer and spicy dishes(szechuan beef and hot soup).
great food. very busy and service not the fastest. but was chinese new year weekend, so maybe the reason!  not sure how fast usually. great food, kinda worth waiting for. staff friendly

the dishes are good and some are very tasty. however, i've been consistently let down by the service. they've forgotten my order a few times and they can be quite rude/defensive sometimes, even though it's clearly written that i've ordered the dish. i've had to wait over an hour for a dish even though it was not crowded.

get you in, get you out.... pretty much sums up the service here but that's not necessarily a bad thing. you come here to eat a lot and enjoy your comfort foods not sit down to a poncy meal. fyi the food is very good
clean and spacious seating by compare of others places

really good food. especially their dumplings, as you would expect. if you crave for some delicious chinese - definitely pop in or order online. probably would have ordered online if i didn't live that far as it tends to get a bit noisy in the restaurant.

great if you're out late night in central london and you happen to be near chinatown. dumplings are fantastic and it's pretty cheap. this is not a fancy restaurant though so see it as a casual place to eat. kitchen usually closes at 2am.

i had sour soup (starter portion) and pork&vegetable dumplings. both meals were very tasty. service was also very good and quick. pity that the place doesn't serve any desserts after 11pm. my friend and i really wanted something sweet.
dim sum here was wonderful! it really hit the spot, one of the better ones in london. service was prompt, nothing to fault. prices were pretty reasonable.
not impressed by service, quality of the dumplings were not as good as we expected
food was great.you should try the crispy duck
food 4*, service 3* at best.
good fresh dimsum made on site. love their xiao long bao and large har gau!
service is great top notch management
average food.... some staff very off hand
awesome dim sum but poor service
great value and great food!! loved the dumplings!!!!

food was ok. service wasn't the best. they're in a hurry to rush through what you have to ask or say and that resulted in us having to ask for things multiple times! we only went here cos it had a high hygiene rating.
v friendly attentive service.
it is okay
great food and great service. i'll come again.
