food won't blow your mind, but it's a bit cheaper than other chinese restaurants in the area.
very good and authentic food
best dumplings ever and delicious food
best place for dumplings and just before chinese new year. attentive staff, overall good service at the busiest time of year. even gave a discount when paying in cash.
only for lovers of chinese food.

dumplings are the best thing about this place. great options and full of flavour. everything else was a little bland. spring rolls tasted frozen and the rice added very little in terms of taste. dont try and be clever here, keep it simple and go for dumplings
good chinese food with dim sum as their speciality.
good prices, quick service, so many options on the menu!
i love this place, i always go here when i visit london, their soup dumplings are fantastic
loved the prawn dumplings, scallop, and minced pork bun. bbq ribs would not get again. will go back. good service and delicious.
nice and very happy to have dined there
beef hofan was good, curry is so so, the only restaurant open for late night super on that street
great food. bad service. we found a stone in our food and the staff was very rude and accused us  of being dishonest. had a really bad experience, will not return.
great food, funny staff, open late, good atmosphere, 5*
really great dim sum at reasonable prices
food was fantastic but service wasnt great. best chinese food i have had in a long while.
service wasn't great and i've had better dumplings at home. i guess that legend was that they were decent.
wonderful dumplings, just be careful how you eat them when they first arrive very hot!
this place is amazing. i must stop whenever i'm in london. i have only been for lunch i may add. the sister restaurant down the road is just as good
the food came quick and it was absolutely delicious
open late at night. seriously tasty. plus you can see the cook folding the dumplings. oh, and the crispy duck is indeed extra crispy.
food was delicious, the staffs are friendly. coming back again here for sure. thank you for the warm welcome.
yestarday i went for the first time and i definately come back!!i ate spicy beef noodles soup was delicious! dumpling as well!just made,really fresh!good portions and reasonable price!
good food, not very nice service
the foods were tasty especially the seafood hofan.  it was delicious.  all those sims dishes were good too. do not know what reason i have diarrhoea all night long.

tasty food and very good value for money. doesn't have a big dim sum menu if dining in the evening, but there are some options you can choose from. food is bought out quickly with an efficient service, a good go to place for a quick bite in china town where you won't be waiting very long for a table.
the quality of the food was nice.
dumplings are very good. the silken tofu with minced pork was amazing.
the food was bland and service very poor, it felt like our presence was an inconvenience. if it wasn't for the fact that we'd had a long day and were tired we would have left.
great atmosphere, nice decor and best of all the food! a great range on the menu and traditional and the dumplings are to die for, hence the name!
great dim sum in a down to earth setting. the ordering process is a little confusing for the uninitiated but the quality of the food made me want to return, and i have a few times!
awful service. waiter completely ignored us when we said our food was cold, after they brought the rice out 15 minutes before the mains. wont be returning

my favourite guilty pleasure in london! definitely my favourite dumpling restaurant in china town, delivering consistent food quality and good pricing, look past the decor and fast paced service and enjoy their xiao long bao.
enjoyed a massive shared meal with family and friends. couldn't stop eating. such lovely food and attentive staff

located right in the heart of downtown london. prince charles and camilla, dutchess of cornwall dined there. food was great. so good i forgot to take a pic before we began eating. will definitely go again
fairly expensive, takeaway quality food. probably fairly priced for the location, though
good value for money and good quality xiaolongbao!
good dumplings, a bit pricey but good.
great dumpnings! i had to ask for more!
lovely place p
going back soon
tasty!
rushed into deciding on menu choices and were not given change after paying the bill.
best dimsum in china town! no frills, just great food. 100% recommend handmade prawn dumplings, they are incredible. prices are great and service is quick.
the dumplings were lovely, but there was something lacking ... maybe the ambience and i don't think i'll be rushing back.

this place is pretty chinese and really good. it's more local than most of places you can find around. the beef with turnip is a must!they are very generous with vegetables and try the beef noodles as they have several ways to do them.
loved the food! great location. efficient staff.will be back (very soon!)

it was okay, all the dumplings we shared tasted the same. nothing out standing but the only restaurant that was open after 22:30 on a weekday which is great ( they open until 03:00) service was quick.
wow way too salty. pushy staff. i'm not part of a restaurant conveyer system. first time for me and my date. without doubt the last.
decent quality, very fast service, i would go again but next time i will try the dumplngs.

xiao long bao (excuse the spelling) is so fresh, it can't be beaten. expect your food to come very quickly, and your check to come quickly after.the variety of dishes is well executed and tasty with generous portions.

brilliant food. service was a bit slow and all over the place with multiple servers asking the same things. tables were crammed in quite tight so it felt like we were on top of the tables either side of us.
lovely place reward for not using cards great food
value for money, quick service even though it was busy.
good food, nice staff and good prices too.  open late. great find.
the soup inside xiao long bao seeped out right after serving. so the soup was all over the table instead. hope they fix this for food quality.
get there early and definitely try the bao! absolutely delicious!

busy restaurant with lots of people turning over all the time but food is just great and it is good value. the service is fast and not particularly friendly so ideal if you just want great food. try the dim sum range or the sia long bau which are very fresh and done by in the kitchen daily.
really great food and service was ok too. would highly recommend this place.
good portions and great service for nye!
dumpling were excellent. portions are biig so be ready.
quick service and they arent joking about being dumpling legends!
quick service, nothing special on dim sum

if you want an authentic oriental taste experience in the heart of china town, then this is the place. just take a look at the menu, they have rabbit!! i must admit that it's not for the faint hearted but everything is absolutely delicious and full of flavour!!!
good dim sum, but cramped sitting space and grumpy staff.
the best chinese restaurant ever.never had a bad experience and i have been there 20 times now.super efficient and amazing food all the time.

famous for its lovely dumplings. we didn't prebook and there was plenty of space. if you are after a huge plate of vegetarian noodles, ask as they are off menu and prepared specially. helpful staff, tap water offered with no fuss on a warm july evening. meal for two was 35. service included.
lovely food and good value for money in a great location.
i have eaten at my fair share of chinese restaurants and their egg fried rice with prawns was amazing. their dumplings were good too - i recommend the pan fried pork dumplings over the soupy ones.
great service, warm and friendly staff, nothing to much trouble and explanation.  dumplings excellent as usual.
good standard dim sum. solid not spectacular.
wasn't disappointed but not wowed either. with every other restaurant in china town doing the same thing there is nothing to make it stand out.
food was great! restaurant nice and bright, staff very pleasant
love the dumplings here. best in chinatown.
easy chinese restaurant, tho really push to move customers through
solid, traditional chinese. a good shout for china town
friendly personnel, large portions food for a good price. dumplings weren't that great though
delicious dumplings, busy restaurant but quick service

this is the one restaurant i return to time and time again. beautiful soup dumplings. staff are efficient but not personable. this is not something you should worry about as when you've queued for 30 mins to get a table you appreciate the efficiency of the place. service is charged on all tables. they served tap water. food is great.
daytime dumplings ok but not served in evening. bit of a rip off joint - the hurry you off the table and whack 12.5% service on the bill without asking. many much better places nearby
the staff are not friendly but the dumplings are so fresh and the food is damn tasty. a staple in chinatown and highly recommended
dumplings here are always supurb. they are handmade on sight. this is one of my favourite restaurants in london. highly recommend the xi long bao - soup dumplings
the food no so great! poor service and awkward atmosphere

the staff where extremely rude. overpriced disgusting food and we where insulted by the staff. we eat out a lot and have never been so disappointed. we paid, but shouldnt have bothered.. rip off.. how they can get away with that type of behaviour and food is beyond me....

staff are watching you all the time. considering they had over 10 waiters at once, it makes the atmosphere a bit uncomfortable. pls look into that otherwise, the dumplings were very nice. a bit pricey, but overall okay. bare in mind there is a minimum expenditure per person!
omg best chinese place about. food was amazing. you can bring your own alcohol too
we come here every christmas and love the food. the dumplings were great, and the main course was equally tasty. be prepared to queue at times!

the vegetarian menu was disgusting. really disappointed. i could have made nicer food at home. a lot of it was tasteless. fried spring rolls with no vegetables inside, boiled broccoli with some mushrooms on top. really don't know why it's so popular. will never come back if you paid me.

very pleasant meal here with 4 others, sat up stairs. food arrived quickly. id recommend the set menu and some dim sum. good choice of beer and wine. and amazing a la cart menu as well. look forward to coming back. portions are big, so go hungry.
our favourite place to visit when in london. our trip isn't complete unless we stop here. love the food, great value and fast service.
good service. fabulous food, especially the dumplings. reasonably priced. lively atmosphere but not too noisy

we have long avoided this as it looked like a tourist trap but have been twice now and are hooked. prices slightly above average for chinatown but service is above average too. interior is well layed out and not as cramped as many of the other restaurants too. food was great which is always the key. will be back.

dumplings' legend was recommended by a couple of friends, so we went there for lunch on a friday. the atmosphere was pleasant and service we extremely prompt; couldn't ask for much more. as for the food - sublime. some of the best dumplings i've ever had - and reasonably priced. an all round great experience.
very good service. gourmet food. i recommend ordering sets, you can try a lot of things then. the best dish lemon chicken
superb food with very good servcie
winston and his staff are amazing.  thanks for the best food in uk outside of asia.robin lloyd
absolutely brilliant! great authentic experience.  the service is really quick and efficient.

delicious and fresh dim sum. service was fast and good seating area. waiter staff helpful and efficient but not anything additional. not a problem. food very tasty, recommend cheng fun and prawn dumplings.

let's make one thing clear, these dumplings are not legendary. the other food we ordered was tasty hence the three stars but unfortunately we came for dumplings and were ultimately disappointed. i'd give this a miss if it's dumplings that you're after.

one of my favourite chinese restaurants. pretty much everything i have had there was good, specially the dumplings and the green beans with mince pork and chili. the only thing i would complain about this place is the staff trying to kick you out even before you finished your food...
rude staff. disgusting food. they deserve to be bulldozed. worst meal of my life and expensive. when we complained we were answered abusively.
absolutely the best outside of asia! we loved the spicy pork ones and the shrimp one!! really really really really good thank you!!!
food taste good, but customer service isn't the best part here.
quality dumplings with  wide variety of choice.recommend the spicy dumplings.
yummy. service is not very keen on helping you but the food is amazing. it can get very busy so just try it at odd hours.
always busy so don't expect to be allowed to chill here for longer than it takes you to eat. however the food is excellent, such tasty fresh dim sum at a pretty good price (considering its location).
it was really good with a diverse menu. from spicy to sweet overall good food and really nice staff.
favourite place, everything on the menu is amazing. spicy xiao long bao is incredible. accommodating to kids. prices are not that expensive!

a tad disappointed given the excellent reviews. ordered a mixed platter of dumplings  but they were all prawn. ordered something else but wrong food came. then long delay for the right food, and very rushed service to get you to leave quickly so they can seat the next customers. when the right food did arrive, it was nice
an excellent dumpling restaurant that is our favourite in china town. excellent quality with good prices.

dumpling legends earns name. has the perfect dumpling to prawn ratio. highly recommend the soup dumplings - so flavoursome. vegetable fried rice is also delicious. service was fast. i like how you can watch dumplings being made and cooked. also loved the music - very atmospheric. 5/5
i just love this place! not particularly fancy but love coming here with friends during a visit to london.

extremely rude staff. when we complained that there were no vegetables in the vegetable spring rolls the manager accused us of lying. complete rip off. unpleasant experience and expensive. they should be ashamed of their poor hospitality.
loved it!! went there with some friends and we had the most amazing buffet of dumplings! can't wait to go back!!

good selection of vegetarian dishes. got seated right away and we were 8. very quick service. vegetables seem very fresh and crunchy. not greasy as many other places. a bit on the expensive side thus one star off.
good food, but how can they get away with such rude service! like another person already mentioned on the reviews, it's only acceptable because it's in chine town!so hospitality 1/5, food 4/5
when it is dark and cold and nothing to eat... it was ok, but i would not recommend this place. nothing special about it.
food is very good and cheap. unfortunately, the service is terrible
food was excellent and service was of good speed. a special big thank you to the owner / manager in the smart suit for being so accommodating and understanding!!
the food was delicious and at a great price!
the food are wonderful
amazing dim sum
good to have this place in london
good dumplings but a long wait to be seated
amazing. absolutely love their soup dumplings.
probably the best dumpling and dim-sum restaurant in london. a huge range of variety, good quality, always busy. a bit overpriced.
basic chinese food, nothing special

great selection of vegetarian dumplings , buns and bao, probably the only place in the world where i have had vegetarian long bao and they were utterly delicious. a bit pricy and 12 percent service charge is applied. but you get a ten percent discount if you pay by cash. so thats nice
speedy service, tasty food. great for a quick lunch in chinatown.
great food, best friend rice

must order the prawn dumpling, it is very delicious with thin skin and rich fillings (2 prawns in each dumpling). dont order the custard buns as they are even smaller than the dumplings.dont order porridge, as it is kinda plain.egg tarts not bad.yep basically all you need to order is dumplings.
large and super quick turnaround time, more elegant than many other places, large tables available
love the food here, a regular saturday lunch for me.only downside is sometimes the serving staff could be a bit better, but aside from that all good.
place is ok  great location

not bad!!! came for dim sum everything was good and fresh. the har gow stands out as is big and 'sooghn' if you speak cantonese means has that fresh crunch thing going on. noodles and rice were standard fare so suggest sticking to the  good value dim sum.  our service was fine but note we are a family that speaks cantonese and chinese!
our go to place for dim sumgreat service huge choice only criticism would be to allow more time to finish drinks and food before bringing bill.

we had the xiao long bao, prawn cheng fun, xiu mai, and custard buns and enjoyed it all. xlbs were fantastic and the custard buns were probably some of my favorite ever. fast service and good prices. very extensive menu will make you come back to sample more.
delicious siu long bao (soup dumplings). has the breezy, slightly impersonal air that many chinatown restaurants share, but it's good food served quickly and not too pricey
ok! i don't think i will go back.
tasteless, unfriendly and overrated...by far. avoid, especially when surrounded by so many other better options.
the dumplings were sticky and the pastry very thick. they were not light or tasteful. would not recommend anyone to eat there
amazing soup filled dumplings
food was decent but service was quite rushed.
great food. staff is nice and happy to help. would definitely like to come again. dessert dimsums are delightfully light.
very good ratio quality/price. fast service.
went two night ago and service was excellent. went back today and were basically ignored while 5 staff members stood there doing nothing. walked out.
busy but efficient service not a relaxing place  but excellent menu.
busy, but did it's good, b and the staff are really friendly, would have supplied a picture but we ate everything
highly recommend dumplings' legend. especially the spicy pork long bao.
lovely food and the service was fast. they need to improve customer service by smiling once in a while and not hurrying people out. that said, i'll go again!
amazing food great service
awesome dim sum. can't wait to come back
great set menu. very delicious. super fast service.
amazing dumplings!! with delicious feeling inside it was meat and bulion melting in your mouth.. good price for such a nice restaurant in the middle of china town.

totally overpriced for what you get. service is rude and only focuses on making profit. we were provided with the bill right after we were done with our main course. the atmosphere has a really cheap impression and the food quality (especially the dumplings / baozi) has been a disappointment. definitely cant recommend!
ignore the other reviews, take it from somebody who spends alot of time in china town - this is one of the best. get a load of dim sum and definitely make sure to have the schzchuan wonton.
food was good and reasonably priced. service was a bit slowwe had to get the staffs attention anytime we needed anything.
dim sum was fresh. king prawns were lovely. totally worth the price i paid.
dumpling  good not worth the wait but if i were in area and there was no queue would get again :)
siaow loong dumplings and volcano signature custard buns worth a try
very rude restaurant.dont go here.much better in the area.
a nice spacious place with friendly staff. good food, but a bit overprised. they were a bit eager to get rid of us after finishing the meal though!
the food is amazing. so delicious and fresh! we will be back.
dim sum was decent but the service is poor. however when you come to china town you don't go for the service so would recommend. xiao long bao were soupy and the spicy duck dumplings were good too

the soup dumplings was ok, the dumpling dough was too thick so it takes away the taste of the broth and meat. the giant soup dumpling was disappointing, it was just dough with soup, the meat was almost non-existant. the service is quick and good and the dim sum shrimp dumpling was very good, big shrimp portion!
wonderful fresh dumplings are made there!
place was dirty and the food quality could be improved
perfect stone bowl full of premium seafood & silken tofu!! love it. soup dumplings are very cool:))
decent dim sum if you are around chinatown area. as good as it gets in london
perfectly prepared and seasoned food at reasonable prices. amazing bao!
excellent and friendly service. prince of wales and camilla ate there in 2018! wow what a recommendation. see photo on their wall.
nice food chinese!!
best soup dumplings ever!!! make sure to make reservations and make sure to have enough time to taste all the delicious dumplings they freshly make on site! the soup dumplings were a great discovery!

been to this place about 3/4 times. every time the food has been delicious, and the service is prompt. the menu is very long, i could go every day of the year and end up with a different dish!the dimsum in particular is really good. will definitely revisit. no need to reserve as there is usually lots of space.
excellent service. great food. well priced. lovely selection
great food and it's open till late night early morning
great customer service and good food but a bit on the pricey side
quick service, quality and selection excellent, staff were friendly and helpful..
food was good. the waiters were really rude.
i'd give it more, the food was pretty good but to presume the tip is compulsory is wrong.
steamed frozen dumplings instead of fresh made.
excellent chinese cuisine, enjoyed the lobster & dumpling dish. we had our dinner in a private room. the restaurant was very busy due to eve of chinese new year
there are many places around this one that are similar. i am glad we chose to go here. everything i ate here was awesome. staff was on point. excellent.
they have the funniest, most beautiful fishes! you can find them as you go upstairs. food was good, though the duck arrived at the table rather cold, so we had to ask them to reheat it.
great place to find the touch of cantonese food inside chinatown.
fresh, delicious food  and fast service.
great dim sum! went at noon on a saturday, we were seated immediately. when we left about an hour later there was already a small queue
amazing dumplings, great service, extensive menu, buzzing atmosphere

great dumplings, i wouldn't say rude as you have to speak to be rude. sat in less than 5 minutes. food was really good. unhelpful waited a bit long to be able to order. i wouldn't go again, but glad i experienced the awsome dumplings.
fantastic dumplings. nice touch is that you can actually see them being made. try the fresh crab roe which is #1 on the dumpling menu.. delicious !

the food was decent, but when i orderd soft drinks they came luke warm, and when i asked them to bring me some that was cold they said that they didn't have any. the place is also way too loud and the staff is not very polite.
the place for delicious long bao
fantastic dumplings, fast and friendly service.

the steamed dumplings were pretty scheisse and the "fried" rice should've actually been fried. also, the chicken with pineapple seemed to be lacking the named pineapple, but the dim sum and the duck wraps were satisfactory.
great dim sum. i love the xiu long bao! the overall atmosphere is a bit sterile.
hecking good, been here several times
this is the go to place in china town. quick in and not expensive. not a friendly or unfriendly place. if you want good food quickly this is the place to go.
a very good first experience.highly recommended.+reasonable prices.+efficient staff.-staff rushing you to order, eat, pay the bill and leave.
nice dumplings. service is brisk and not with a smile. would go back for dumplings though.
great place with large variety
friendly and efficient service. the food was delicious
fabulous service and the best dumplings i've had outside asia!
cheung feng ftw
bloody beautiful food!!! love this place
great food and quick service

enormous overwhelming menu.  ordered the soup dumplings the crispy duck appetizer with scallions. spicy spinach with ground pork which was actually a chinese green vegetable.  all yummy!  i'm stuffed!
very nice chinese restaurant! reasonable prices and fast service.
the waiter who is a black man of medium height wearing glasses beated customers and the manager did not care. we have called and reported this online to the police. do not go to this resturant.

i enjoyed the 1/4 crispy duck, crystal prawn dumpling and spicy xiao long bao for 2 people. service and food was quick and enjoyable. i especially enjoyed the crystal dumping which was much bigger than at other restaurants
incredible dim sum, incredible drinks, and incredible staff.
probably the best dim sum in chinatown
the only 1 handmade traditional dumplings in london, the best dumpling in london area.

great restaurant, they're food is tasty & dumplings are fresh. however they rush you on the weekends because it's so busy. bring people to the table before you've even put on your coat. did it to people on the table next to us and the tried to do it to us also, didn't like that at all.
best dim sum in london ! th xiao long bao are just super and the honey barbecues pork stuff is a amazing good
absolutely amazing. the food is so nice and the staff are brilliant. we recommend 100%.

delicious food and fast service. the dumplings are delicious but the other food is also great. you can see the dumplings being made by their cooks as you enter the restaurant. the staff were friendly and very accommodating, especially considering it was a very busy day and we were with a baby and pram.
poor quality food and poor service too :(
visited here during sunday lunchtime.  there was a bit of a queue but we only had to wait 10 mins to be seated. dim sum was nice, service was quick and the portions were a good size. enjoyed it!
the best dumplings in london always busy but quick service
very good chinese food

nice dumpling experience in chinatown. crowded but friendly fast and efficient service, price range a bit more expensive than other chinese restaurants offering dumplings in the area but they discount you 10% if you pay in cash. i would definitely go back for those fresh dumplings and the tasty fried rice. recommended
good dumplings, but a bit overrated
great food at really good prices - always a safe bet in china town.

in a dilemma to give 5 or 4 stars. it could be judged as good due to the fact that it is located in the uk. could have been better i think, especially if they could serve it with sweet sauce and chilli sauce, like how the authentic hong kong's dim sum is.
amazing food and immaculate service! will definitely visit again.
they serve good dumplings
dumplings are freshly made and you can taste it. recommended
very good dim sums and wan ton soup
incredible xiao long bao
very good food, very quick service
highly recommend. fast service, friendly  and very good food.

great chinese food all round, the soup dumplings obviously a speciality, but all the classics we tried were very tasty. not overpriced. have heard stories of poor service but it was ok when we went. went as part of a birthday party, two large tables of 10, and they coped pretty well.
delicious food,  great service,  all the wow without pretentious stuff.
delish roast meats.

we enjoyed the food here but the service was a bit of a let down. we had to wait ages for our dim sum order and then we were rushed to order more dishes within our alotted time frame. recommend knowing what you want before you arrive as it is not a relaxed experience. dim sum platter was definitely the best dish.

one of the best in china town. wicked food for a good price. although a little impersonal. they want you out as quick as possible to get the next guy in. would have been good to chill with a beer after!
great food.  tried something for the first time, soup in a dumpling. had lots of dumplings in soup before so it was interesting the other way around.busy place but food comes quickly.
great traditional dumplings.
good chinese food by london standards. most of the food would pass for good in asia. however the xiao long bao do fall short of din tai fung back home.

avoid at all cost. very expensive but low-quality dishes. ordered the fish with pickled veggie and fish was absolutely not fresh to a point that it made me gag. the pork used in the dishes and soup dumplings is also not fresh. overall a very expensive but miserable experience.

service was fast and good. food nothing special. given the name i would expect a larger dim sum offer. dim sum we tasted was good though but the duck was the driest i ve ever had. even my partner comented how much better is the one i buy to roast at home (it comes within a kit with pancakes and hoisin sauce for about 6 pounds!).
we visit about twice a year. love the food. quick visit today for dim sum and tea. service never overly friendly, but in my experience straightforward and professional. thoroughly reccomended.
1 - for fast service2 - for portion size3 - opening hours4 - friendliness
good food, the staff were professional and the toilets were very clean. worth visiting.
a nice dim sum place.
friendly staff and great authentic food. would highly recommend the sichuan chicken and spicy beef noodle soup. perfect crispy duck and tasty tom yum. would love to eat here again!
great food! authentic taste, service can be better, but let's be honest: if the food is that good, i'm willing to compromise on service.

we went there for dinner last night and it was really disappointing, mediocre chinese food / dim sum served by rude staff. one family had a major argument with one of the waitress as she was extremely rude! the atmosphere is not nice, i think they are serving for tourists, who will never return, rather than londoners!
food was not great at all and service one of the worst i've had ever
can't beat it for a late night chinese craving. service was efficient and friendly and the dumplings were fantastic.
for a dumpling restaurant, there are very few dumplings to choose from.mixed platter was just a selection of prawn served in different shaped dumplings. fun atmosphere. lovely security guard.
i have a european pallette, but i ordered one of their "must try" items and regretted it.
fabulous food ..very authentic. great service
my favourite restaurant in london. great food great service.

sorry it's awful. the only reason i give 2 stars not 1 is becuz its london. if the restaurant is in asia, not even close to 1 star.the cabbage with chili and vinegar, sweet and sour pork ribs and glass noodle....these three dishes....i can only say...i'll kill myself if i were you.soooo disappointed. also the service, horrible.
soooooo disgusting, for the food, and also for the service,especially the boss.not recommend for anyone
amazing pork and chef hot hot hot
i have been here 4 times! and i met zhang hanyu here once! good place!
tried the nice-boxes hotspot, very spicy but tasty

weve decided on something spicy for dinner tonight and picked szechuan. this restaurant did not disappoint. the dishes were tasty and surprisingly authentic ! the  or szechuan boiled fish is one of the best ive tasted.
excellent food!

amazing dinner!truly great, mouth-numbing sichuan. highlight kidney with black fungus. also very garlicky cucumber.  we also had crab + pork siu mai, amazing green beans, lamb cumin skewers. squid, pork & chicken dishes not too shabby either!will definitely be back!

i have eaten here a number of times now and have enjoyed it on each occasion. i love spicy sichuan cooking and the food here really hits the mark. the service is warm and friendly and the prices are reasonable. i will definitely return.

we were there on a monday night and the place was pretty full after 8pm.  it didn't look like many were tourists. the menu is too large to do more than sample in one go, but that's part of the fun.  good ma po.  large portions.  will likely go back if i'm in the area.

brilliant - amazing spicy dishes and a really adventurous menu. lovely, sleepy atmosphere - especially deep into the back of the restaurant, a very cool place.quite expensive and they tried to add service on card when they'd already slapped it on the bill - cheeky cheeky, so lose a star for that.
this restaurant is fantastic, love the decor. we enjoyed the food, very tasty and some great spicy dishes #hotpot #sichuanfood

the hot pot here is amazing. we ordered a spicy and non spicy soup. the order came with meat, seafood selection, vegetables and tofu and mushrooms. the price per person is a bit expensive but when is all you can eat then is a good price for london prices. the staff was attentive. good experience overall.
excellent sichuan food. cannot complain about that. why not 5 stars? they charge 12.5% service charge automatically and then sneak in an optional tip when you pay by card... not cool
genuine and very tasty sichuan food. if you thought chinese food is cannot be spicy, come here. great dishes, menu offers a very nice picked selection.
good food. just refurbished and modernised
the spicy spare rib noodle soup is great, better than what i expected,  recommend!

the hot pot was generous and good, even if i'd been surprised that the food arrived still frozen... and it was quite pricey : a bit more than 28 pounds per person, when you include the service charge. anyway, it was a nice experience.
the hot pot was pretty good, go for the spicy one.
decent service and food. not sure its value for money. they have a karaoke area downstairs that can be hired which is good fun after a dinner meal.
crispy duck recomendable. spactacle for chinese new year celebration included.

er mei has become a tradition for me and my boyfriend and we're trying to come at least monthly, when we start missing the taste. everytime we say we'll try something different but we end up having the same dishes because they're too delicious. i also love the changes in the menu and decoration. good job guys. keep it up
three stars doesn't do this place justice. this food is killer as long as you like a bit of spice in your life.
great authentic sichuan food and portion, fair prices, would definitely love to go back!
the worst experience in my life . the woman in pink was so rude...  i would not recommend to anyone to go and waste your money and time
delicious food, and excellent service. a short wait for a table was well worth it. so glad we waited. (10 -15 min)
for szechuan hotpot and boiled beef, the best place in london. my first choice for hot and spicy in china town
vary tasty food. good restaurant. staff is very kind and available.

this one's my favourite place in london. we go there once or twice a month because it's a bit pricey but the food is delicious and the staff is amazingly friendly, something rare in london. great work, guys.
the food is just so so and doesn't match the price they charge for it. the staff in the restaurant is really snobbish. will never go back again.
very delicious food and good service. authentic chinese dishes. must try.

really superb food served in very pleasant surroundings. very much not your cheap and cheerful average chinese restaurant. we both love sichuan food and paid a visit late one evening. will come back soon. highly recommend.
nice food and price.
this restaurant is so gross, the onwer has 2 menus with same dishes but different prices. they would offer the cheaper menu when you order, and show another menu when you pay the bill
very good for the price. quite authentic cuisine. only let down was the staff's lack of english + quite important when serving authentic dishes which are not standard.overall, highly recommended.

i really enjoyed my experience here tonight. the staff was very helpful and tried very hard to make sure everything was just right. i loved all the spicy flavours & the twice cooked pork belly with outstanding. . everything was very fresh. it is very easy to find just off of the main through fair. it has easy handicapped access.
taste is fairly authentic to sichuan food. make sure you like spicy stuff before going.
fairly cool and stylish bar, but overpriced. 71 for round of five g&ts. doorman accused me of "dancing" and told me to leave. very rude. wouldn't go back.
amazing drinks! difficult to get a good spot.
meh. over sugared, over hyped. there are much better options for a good cocktail.
name is misleading. not experimental.
food was not worth the money
delicious cocktails, great view, unpretentious and friendly staff and the music was ace (funk, bit of latin, funk and more funk)

great bar with amaizing artisan cocktails! nice atmosphere with very good service ! good is music and relaxing. this is a good choice  if you are looking for high quality drinks and cocktails in the heart of chinatown.
you'd never imagine that place is hidden there. the view and the atmosphere is the perfect scenario for a date. the staff is so cool and will definetly help you to choose a suitable cocktail for you.
this place is very small and just okay. dj was good.
a place you have to visit in london
a place to go for new cocktails experience...
nice cocktails n ambiance
superb secret bar, exceptional cocktails in china town. conspiratorial, speak easy vibe.
change your staff.
hidden gem. cocktails are fantastic.
best cocktail bar in london, amazing drinks! kim always made my visit excellent!
staff are rude and insulating. someone gave their name as errold as opposed to their actual french name which was rude and unwarranted. would not visit again
hidden top place

experimental cocktail doesn't mean it's good, be careful when ordering food, some of the portion are not the same size as said on the menu and even after complaining they will still charge you service charge
loud, nowhere to sit, crowded, good cocktails not not amazing
excellent atmosphere coupled with excellent drinks & service

would give this 5 stars, however music inside was unnecessarily loud (and that's coming from a student) and my partner and myself almost felt intimidated by the atmosphere, especially given off by the staff. other than the it was a very nice bar to be in aesthetic wise and the drinks were amazing
delicious cocktails in a fun venue

good cocktails. price is in line with other high end cocktail bars. staff (at least those i have encountered in my two visits)  let the place down. all the decor in the world won't atone for bad service. ruins the ambience. certainly a missed opportunity...better service and this place would be awesome.
really cool hidden bar through an unassuming door off china town.
cocktails (st germain des pres!) are fine but come on a sunday or school night and you will have a much better experience.
definitely gone down in quality. which is a shame. but lots of good new bars in soho.
atmosphere is amazing really nice staff and drinks!

speak-easy style venue. a narrow house full of winding stairwells and nook like comfortable seats. usually crowded and full of dance music and people standing around.vibe is probably hip rather that suave. the music and dj seem quit loud given the fact it is not a dancing place. drinks averaging 10-20 pounds + table service.
great vibe and cocktails.
great
great atmosphere and vibe
great hidden speak easy on 2 floors with a recognized cocktail "savoir faire". easy music to keep the speak easy vibe on
probably the worst cocktails ive ever had, all 4 of us had different ones and none of them were nice
one of the best cocktail bars ive ever been to. great cocktails, great music. a bit dear.
great atmosphere and novel cocktails. music was a bit too loud for me to recommend it as a first date venue, but the "in the know" style makes it one to keep up your sleeve.
great hidden cocktail bar, quality bartender and super service!
good cocktail and if you like to be seated with strangers in the dark go for it!
great tasting cocktails and a real experience to see them being made. nice atmosphere, really enjoyed the experience
great tasting cocktails at reasonable prices for london. brilliant atmosphere and was a perfect place to start my friends hen night!
was good.
fine drinks
very rude staff. not worth it.
the best cocktail bar in the world. (if you can find it!)i absolutely love this place, and will come every time i go to london.

this place remind me many memorable nights. the bar is set on two floors with vintage decor. the selection of vintage cocktails and own creations are regularly updated. great place to finish the evening.
best most delicious cocktails in this area you just have to book or sneak in an early table!

proper cocktails in a hidden spot.very good cocktails on offer (not run of the mill stuff) with some quality nibbles (olives are great).two rooms over two floors, overlooking gerrard street.a great place to spend an hour over some quality drinks.

we wanted to have few cocktails, but alas, door staff refused entry and were fairly rude about it. no worries, it's london, so we went to mr foggs - doorman was very welcoming and we had an amazing time there. avoid this place - go to mr foggs.
no! it's not a brothel through that door, it's a great cocktail bar. different menu every time you visit. good value too. not too busy.

decent place with great location in chinatown. i little difficult to fine but i suppose that's part of the appeal. staff and service where both great but the cocktails where a little disappointing. by no means bad but i have had better for the price. will go back as the place is nice.
great cockatils ans atmosphere

the place itself is just staircase converted into something called bar. quite dark and loud inside. quality and quantity of drinks is low. not much space inside. i can't really think about any pros of that place.
drinks are certainly creative but i wasnt that keen, and the prices are very steep

the door staff would not let me in because i had pride sequins on.  on pride day in soho. was told to wash my face before i could go in. they dont want to associate with pride. really in soho on pride day. you should be embracing pride. i have been before on two occasions. needless to say i wont be going again.
great cocktails and nice decor, but very crowded and noisy. not the classic speakeasy atmosphere

tasty and unique cocktails, accommodating service, speakeasy atmosphere, dimly lit, each table has its own air of privacy. a nice place to unwind for a late night drink, but not the place to be if you're wanting to be loud or on your phone. i'm told they're open til 3am most nights.
love it here

don't bother turning up without reservation. the door staff is super uptight and borderline rude. the have some tasty cocktails here. i have had pretty good fun times with my mates whenever i've been here. staff are friendly and happy to help decide on drinks. they do also go off menu.

awful employees!they will make a mistake on your drink. rather than apologise and excuse the very loud music as an understandable reason, they get upset with you and insist that you pay for whatever they made. never go unless you want to deal with very snooty, snobby spoiled brats as your bartenders.

i like the bar, they do very good drinks in a cool atmosphere. it is hard to get in; there's rarely space for walk-ins (so book ahead if possible) and the door is not obvious (but that just adds to the charm). overall i like it, just been turned away a few times too many!...maybe i should book...but spontaneity is more fun!

love coming here!! cocktails are great and it's the perfect place for a chilled out drink away from the tourists in chinatown. you don't need to book but you do have to answer the door staffs questioning with a bit of confidence!

this is a fun place to check out.  the cocktails are bizarre, sometimes in a great way, sometimes in a not good way, but for me, that's part of the fun.  you wont find drinks like this anywhere else!  i would have given 5 stars, but i think the staff could have been friendlier.
nice and hidden! a bit pricey though
love this little hidden away bar. very small and cosy with unique cocktails

we only had the cocktails here and they tasted great. the service was really good. the entrance was so hard to identify that we walked past it twice. its in between 2 chinese restaurants in chinatown. i cant say for anything else on the menu but based on what we had and the atmosphere, i give it 5 stars.
so beautiful and atmospheric. if you can find it and you like a good cocktail, and don't mind paying a bit more for it, i highly recommend it. the staff are so attentive and the music was great.
was so drunk cant remember it! must have been brilliant

rocked up last night to a little tiny door with bouncers who just acted like we were dirt and had some of the worst interpersonal skills i've ever seen, even for bouncers. 5 entry to a cocktail bar where all you can see is an ugly door and two rude bouncers on the door. there's better places locally.

well theres a surprise! a two storey cocktail bar tucked away behind a very small door! a wide range of cocktails make it up or off the menu, you choose! upper floor is quieter than lower. two bars, one on each floor, so service is excellent throughout. usual london prices.

exciting, tranquil and ethnic cocktail bar. sublime experimentation which leads to some world class cocktails. great atmosphere and bar staff was brilliant. one girl with blonde hair in particular made the night for us. door staff were a bit up themselves which is a shame but i guess that's why they work on the door....  ;)
excellent service, excellent drinks, excellent ambience, excellent live music.

cocktails are good once you get them. not that they took long to come once ordered but ordering in the first place was a bit of a struggle. all the food we also ordered came as we were about to leave a good hour and a half later, though it was tasty. just need a few more staff members.
such a great find, well hidden!!
i really enjoy the athmosphere. cocktails were top too
cocktails are a little out there for my taste. very hidden location
hidden cocktail bar with 3 floors and an excellent selection of cocktails. gets fairly busy on the weekend but always fun to visit.
excellent service and great quality
they accept walk-ins but after 5 minutes they kick you out because they need the table for a reservation. the cocktails are just okay, nothing of experimental
wonderful hidden place
overpriced and tried to charge me for more drinks than id had. i tried to be reasonable but they wouldnt have it. no semblance of customer service. dont bother.
clever cocktails and a lovely atmosphere.
expensive for what they serve. nice music
cocktails are surprisingly good, better than average. nice environment to talk and feel the music. i cannot make sense of the 5 pounds entrance fee though, kind of off putting.

the staff here are incredibly helpful and i love that the cloak room is free. the cocktail list is not massive but it is imaginative and well thought through.  i don't think there is a single cocktail i could recreate at home. well worth a visit - if you can find it!!!
the staff were pretty rude and the music was so loud i had to communicate with my friends by whatsapp
amazing atmosphere
cocktail is just basic, prices are the way more exspensive with what you got! not really recomended. visiting at night just aware for extra charge.
really great bar, with nice drinks and atmosphere. however, it may be difficult to come in .
great atmosphere and cocktails.  candlelit bar over 2 floors with a 30s vibe. stockholm syndrome, le montrose, smoke the rhino all v interesting. expensive but worth it.
always good service here. this speakeasy is hidden behind a door in chinatown, located in the basement. this is your classic speakeasy.
well made cocktails but not experimental by any means
a hidden gem of a bar. old school prohibition era, the drinks are incredible and well worth a visit
it used to be my favourite place but after the last visit i got very disappointed...  all wrong!  bad cocktails, bad or no service at all...  pity
a secret place in dark atmosphere , nice old fashioned furniture with drinks that change in taste while drinking them.
high quality cocktails in a speakeasy atmosphere. expect to be turned away at the door, however, if you show up at peak time underdressed/without attractive company!
a slightly different scene then i'm used to but amazing drinks and friendly staff.
one of the best hidden bars in london.  cocktails are original but very pricy
great for good cocktail and quiet atmosphere but very few seats
great speakeasy style bar, tucked away in chinatown behind an inconspicuous black door. hidden gem!
decent joint but their cocktails are not to my taste.
fun
unfriendliest staff ive ever seen ... except the doormen and barkeeper.
brilliant cocktails in a very exciting venue
great cocktails and fun speakeasy vibe
a great gem if you can find it!
very similar to opium in terms of cocktails, price and location.if you like opium, you would like it here.
i was quite unimpressed by this place. the ambiance was good but the doorman was really really rude - not what you expect from a place at this price point.
it's going from great to meh... some of their best bartenders left.
showed up on a friday evening only to be turned away by the doorman
cool, soho hideout. cocktails are amazing !!!
bouncers are arrogant and rude. shame.
experimental cocktail club (or ecc) is a hidden cocktail bar in chinatown on gerrard street with great cocktails and service.
great service and a great find. though a little pricy and the cocktails are a bit on the small side. but unique ambiance and location.

nice drinks, getting in can sometimes be a bit of a mystery but i am yet to have been turned away - perhaps simply down to good timing. nice cocktails but quite pricey and very busy and cramped seating.
love the cocktails and the environment!
a very busy place on especially on we with a youngish crowd. good atmosphere with a wide range of choice for cocktails.
expensive but good fun and great cocktails.
sophisticated cocktails. best to book to get good seats. a bit tight otherwise.

if a bustling bar & standing shoulder to shoulder & getting your drinks knocked over isn't your thing, this might just be the place for you, to have a quiet moment with your lady & enjoy her company over a good glass of wine.
a bit difficult to find, the doorman has a children's colorbook and stands in front of the building door. the place is tiny so book ahead. the cocktails are all yummy!
used to be more quiet than it is now, good hidden place to go to impress if you're on a date
great place to go have a cocktail in an upscale, speak-easy setting
cocktails did not disappoint. staff were friendly, service was prompt, and the atmosphere was great!
nice cocktail bar hidden in between two restaurants on china town. managed to get a table without a reservation despite was some other reviews suggest.
nice cocktail.
decent cocktails, a bit cramped
crowded, expensive with a well dressed touristy vibe. cocktails are delicious and service is pretty efficient.
excellent location to enjoy a few cocktails with friends. the service is impeccable and the atmosphere and drinks are well priced.
similar to opium, worth a more relaxed atmosphere and cheaper drinks. smart green of a place
excellent little cocktail bar in soho
bit tacky. way too dark inside. friendly staff. gets crowded pretty quick. not many seating available. reserving in advance a wise thing to do.
average cocktail bar charging double as you'd pay at club49 just around the corner ( way better venue )

blink and you'll miss it, hidden behind an unmarked door-ecc is a charming gem in the heart of london.  amazing drinks selection and bartenders are very attentive & helpful-will accomodate to needs easily.  def recommend!
great hidden spot
great drinks and a fun vibe
nice place, service is really bad, such a shame because all other eccs ive been to are amazing
secret and late night great
this is a nice club although i like the location in paris better
great cocktails in a classy bar, but it get packed very easily so that it's hard to find a table after 11.
my favourite bar in soho! i love the cocktails and dcor set in the prohibition theme
mezcal coffee bean drink was excellent. nice atmosphere but mixed on staff.
good drinks but it's absolutely crowded always, not your place if you are looking to sit down and have a conversation.
nice cocktails but pricy, about $12-20 each. excellent service and friendly staff. cozy but loud music.
this hidden cocktail bar is dipped in depth. amazing made cocktails and awesome vibes
hidden behind an anonymous doorway on gerrard street. great cocktails. friendly staff.
high quality drinks in a very small place, so be prepared to get closer to whoever you are going with!
nice and creative cocktail, although seating arrangement can be more comfortable
staff are rude, space is limited, expensive... cocktails are nice but over priced. not somewhere to revisit and if you have not been save your money.
not the most friendly or welcoming door in london, but the cocktails are excellent. try stockholm syndrome!
great secret, gorgeous cocktails.
very cool place with nice cocktails
great cocktails using house infusions
one of the nicest places for cocktails in central london
quirky bar with exellent cocktails
great drinks but difficult to get in
poor cocktails, expensive drinks and entry fee. not coming back.
hidden gem, nice private cocktail bar little pricey but worth it
great vibe and brilliant mixologists!
no issues with door staff if you bring girl dem
excellent cocktails
try and find it! i've been here a few times and i still struggle to find it, but it's worth it once you get in!!
nice cocktails and service but small
inventive cocktails in a chic, unexpected locale
super tasty cocktails, pretty expensive, but maybe worth it.
ok cocktails in a cramped and very loud environment.
good cocktails, placed not too crowded even a friday evening, a bit too noisy and expensive.
excellent cocktails, reservations needed
fantastic the best  luv the place
the 50 we had to 'donate' to the bouncer to let is in was not worth it, even though the cocktails were good.
cool cocktail bar, nice hidden spot
excellent plae and  retro atmosphere
extremely rude and arrogant door staff, ruined our experience. will most certainly never go here again.
expensive,  but worth it.
encountered the obnoxious doorman mentioned below, no complaint on the staff inside but his behaviour both arguing with the staff and then us on our exit was not a pleasant experience
very trendy, good drinks
genuinely interesting and delicious cocktails
cocktails ok, horrible cheese platter. bar staff not that nice.....
absolute cool
nice atmosphere, too cosy to be comfortable
you should experiment with changing the door man. what a joke of a man.
average and overhyped probably because of the location. 13 pounds for a cocktail... interior design was nice though.
great cocktails but not the best atmosphere
extremely nice door staff , he is very handsome and nice .
great cocktails, great atmosphere.. i feel the staff became not so nice lately though.
cocktails are very good. i've heard they can be a bit arsy on the door though.
great drinks and music!
the whole package, must-do.
great experience and great cocktails!
my spot for the whole summer, happy times
there are no signs at the entrance! be careful you don't miss it!
great bar great drinks, just be nice to the door man
it's grim
great bar, great service and awesome drinks.
great atmosphere, great music, simple selection of high quality cocktails paired with side food. must see.

real effort to get past the door staff. attempted to make a reservation a few weeks beforehand. no reply after 3 chases.4th chase, was told no reservations taken on a saturday. show up to be told by unpleasant door staff that we must have a reservation. not for want of trying lol!
cozy atmosphere, good drinks!
expensive but really good cocktails. very crowded on friday night but friendly staff and good vibe.
not bad at all but a bit overpriced!
wicked
speakeasy with nice cocktails, shame about the rude service
rude doors staff. tasty cocktails
something different in the heart of china town.not the cheapest place for a night out but worth every penny.

i went on a saturday night so it was the typical crowded west end vibe. artisan drinks - all ice no liquor.  not enough seating.  however, table service is provided if you do get a table and there's a free clock room.
great cocktails and amazing atmosphere. however, it is usually hard to get in without reservations!
always a treat to drink here. cocktails are the best.
great cocktails, a little pricey

turned away at the door on a wednesday evening around 11pm, no questions asked. despite the website stating 5 cover, there is no reasoning to be had, nor favors to be won.  as a single individual, surely there was room for one person, given that the website states 50% is held for walk-ins.
rude door staff, delicious, but overpriced drinks.
excellent. thank you to every one there.
extremely busy but great atmosphere and decent cocktails

love the theme they went for, as if gatsby meets grand budapest hotel. something charming about the place. goo cocktails but a little cramped. think the whole 'secret' thing is overdone with a scary man at the door. i would expect more exclusivity when you enter.would go back though!
ridiculous prices
always a safe haven for great drinks.

crystal is the entire reason id go back. intelligent staff. open. great cocktails. get yourself a kota.a cocktail that takes 2 days to make. get to the door and say the place was recommended. well worth the time and money.
out this world cocktails and service
try spotting the entrance first time round... all very secretive and exclusive. great cocktails and sophisticated atmosphere. you get what you pay for...

have been here few times, always ok, last time is a downer. the lady at the bar was rude, the drinks were not served for a long time (and she brought them from another bar in the venue, although we were sitting at the bar she was in), music is very so so.
the best cocktails we had while visiting london! this hip bar feels like a cool speakeasy. i would strongly recommend the experimental cocktail club for a post show drink (near theater district).
loooooovvvvveeeeeeeee

behind an unmarked door you find one of the best cocktail bars in london. busy on peak days but if you go at a less conventional time you'll find it very relaxing and a fantastic place to enjoy amazing cocktails and chat the afternoon/evening away.

you have to know what you are looking for, otherwise you won't find it. inside it is stylish and across the different floor you'll find a spot to sit. staff is very knowledgeable and cocktails are 5*, but maybe just slightly overpriced. but it'd definitely go back

they know their cocktails, and if you ask for a classic that's not on the menu they will make it. i recommend an old fashioned! it's a bit pricey but well worth it. look for a bouncer in front of an unmarked brown door next to the four seasons, a hidden gem in chinatown!

i like that ecc is hidden in the middle of chinatown, where you would least expect such an establishment. from my experience it's fairly easy to get in on weekends too, if you're a group of 2-4 people. i've been to this place at least three times, and cocktails are consistently excellent, albeit over-priced for what you get.

nice "hidden" bar in a speakeasy style decor. great selection of cocktails, with a combination of both good classics and inventive house cocktails. all cocktails ordered were very nice, however they are a bit pricey.

this has a bit of a 'secret door' vibe as there's no exterior signage.  instead you need to 'find' the doorman and have him let you in.  cocktails were fantastic, but the interior was a bit dated.  i'd go back, but i wouldn't mark it a must-do.

quite pretty inside and possibly better than milk and honey in that regard. cocktails also tend to be yummy and feel like they've been delicately prepared. however the novelty seems to outweigh the actual overall experience. the door staff can be unfriendly and rude and the cocktails aren't quite worth the hype.

it's a bit of an adventure to find this small unmarked door along gerrad street but negotiate your way past the guarded door and you'll find two floors of a great speaking easy style bar. the cocktails are finely crafted and there's usually some decent music being played further upstairs. good fun and a nice place to bring friends.
06.11.2018: good cocktails, but worst service ever! super unfreindly, would not recommend to go there!

great place to kick in a party, with fairly good cocktails. expect a lot of people, loud house and electronic music and just a few tables. ordering can be challenging. rated three since they charged us 5 to go in and cocktails are 11 average, hence not that cheap.
pretty good and not much to fault although, a bit small and pricey.
nicely surprised, not cheap but decent drinks
great cocktail bar with a really cool opium den vibe interior. the service was great and the cocktails where made with real care and attention to detail. i will 100% be coming back again.

some of the best cocktails i've ever had in london, which is saying something as i drink a lot of cocktails in london! don't be intimidated by the shabby doorway, the staff are friendly and the decor is beautiful. definitely worth a visit for a treat or celebration!
cute speakeasy tucked away in chinatown.

from the random doorman outside the small unremarkable door to the dark insides this place oozes charm and it finds a good crowd with the young and well-dressed. one thing to watch out for with this "mystery" place is the high prices! the strong drinks probably make up for it in this regard however.

ive been going to this place for years. but now the novelty has worn out. also they discriminate. i was outside queueing, they turned away a older couple, they said sorry we are very busy, then two minutes later they let me and my friend in. absolutely out of order.
not so secret anymore, but still thoroughly enjoyable.
great place for a few cocktails.  so many unique  drinks on the menu.  service was really good as well.
speak easy style bar. no jazz in site. cover charge to get in, absorbitantly expensive drinks. rude door staff. some of the wait staff were perfunctory. it was absolutely rammed.
great music and cocktails. great place for an intimate night out
felt rushed even ordering a bottle of champagne as they wanted to turn tables quickly on a saturday night
delicious cocktails. try the one with pandan leaves...
best laphroaig old fashioned: "sky is the limit"
excellent cocktails, worth the money. reservation essential.
cocktails were very poor and while waiting for me to finish me drink my mate ordered a quick beer, that set him back 7!! and a i had a broken chair
nice looking place and friendly staff, but the menu (refreshed daily mind) was rather simple and a bit disappointing for a specialist cocktail place - not experimental at all!
great drinks, the atmosphere was slightly peculiar but after a few of their delicious cocktails i didn't care. we will return when we're next in the area
excellent drinks. can be packed at time. large groups difficult to get in.
cool drinks, cool place, 101% suggested! crowded on saturdays!

extremely rude door staff.  would not myself and a friend into the bar,  with no valid explanation ,  my friend was black. i have entered the bar previously,  but will not return to bar with what i can only assume are racist door staff.  avoid.
great cocktails. place is rather small and can feel crowded. overall a good experience and would go again for a drink
very cool bar, very hidden away in chinatown. quite a struggle to find it which was half the fun!
lovely cocktail and my guest absolutely loved this place.  friendly clientele.
it's ok. very odd door to get into the place with some guy waiting outside for customers. very expensive drinks! other than that it's ok.
nice cocktails in a relatively chill atmosphere.  i appreciated the 90's music the dj happened to be playing as well.
great cocktail bar! intimate, friendly atmosphere, good music & top notch drinks. bar manager wilson & his staff were all excellent. highly recommend epp.
cocktail bar in the heart of china town playing relaxing vibes
really cool atmosphere and interesting drinks. when we were leaving they were just setting up a place for live music - very nice!
decent cocktaillist
nice bar behind an anonymous door. original/good cocktails. go on a calm night, tends to get corwded otherwise

the way they make the cocktails is a work of art! a little more lenient than your typical speakeasy, so it gets a bit crowded. but the drinks were super tasty and worth the only slightly premium price tag.

love the idea of a speakeasy that's difficult to find, but when asked where we would like to sit, we were then told where we could actually sit.... and the cocktail that was recommended by staff as being sweet was actually quite a bitter, coffee tasting cocktail... very expensive for what it was!

unexpected trendy bar, right at the heart of chinatown. look for an inconspicuous door that's under guard by 1-2 bouncers. the bar is split over two floors, can get very busy and drinks don't come cheap, but hey it's a hidden bar on top of chinatown - so it's worth it.
i love this place. does get too busy on friday evening and weekends, but on a quieter weekday, it's perfect.
quite hard to get into, bouncers only allow in couples. once in, it's cosy and drinks were lovely but expensive. atmosphere is good but be prepared to have to talk quite loudly.
the cocktails being expensive is expected. the small bar is best visited on one of the quieter nights to avoid loud music and consequently able to have a conversation.

very rude doorman, let a couple in before us without asking them for a reservation yet asked us if we had one, which we did.  then when we got up to the bar and the same couple are on our table!!  drinks were good but this place is not worth the hassle or hype, will not be coming back here again.
terrible,was expecting a better service from a place pricing itself to be a well to do establishment. was not allowed to sit together as a group of people due to some silly policies... rude staff

host just decided to randomly  charge entrance fee. when asked why, he decided that people are not worth respond and asked next people in queue to come in. i was a regular client and i am never coming here again... poor poor service...
great cocktails in a private and discreet bar with a classy ambiance. i liked the la medicacion and the get the buck in here drinks. it gets crowded after 1230.
very average drinks and then charged the optional 12.5% gratuity. youve gotta do much better if youre going to call yourself a cocktail bar.
nice but super expensive!
things we are get used to since we were young. if you would like to go back in the oast, please come. also there some new things.
always great at 2am.. enough said
love the food, staff very friendly, the best in china town!
nice food , good size portions but pour service.

the bakery is the best value, the dim sum isn't anything spectacular and the chilli oil tasted old. the toilet wasn't maintained - there was pee all over the seat and the floor and there was no soap, makes you worry that the kitchen is equally overlooked.
as authentic as you are likely to get for the price. average fodder of the shanghai variety

service is typical chinese, fast, efficient, no frills. we enjoyed dim sum, vegetable noodles and took home a box of tasty baked good, red bean sesame buns and sponge cake. delicious for breakfast the next day.
such disappointment! the noodles were so plain. it was not worth my money.
decent bakery, loved the flavours.
had the fried rice noodles and it reminded me of home.
the best chinese in london
best eat
tea ist nice.lady,s nice...snacks. taste. nice ; )
this place gave me food poisoning. within an hour of eating here i was throwing up my insides. i had seafood noodles. never eating here again. please avoid. i was violently ill for days.
food was ok but the staff were horrible! worst service i've ever had. two young women were incredibly rude and put me and my friend off the rest of the meal.

rip off!! i went here at 2am to have a small plate of black bean chicken, only to find they over charged me by about 10 they charged me 20 for this i realized the next day! stay away from these greedy people.

nice small chinese eatery serving simple but very tasty food. huge portions and really good value, great beef noodle soup. quick efficient and friendly service and always busy. says a lot. highly recommended.
delicious pork buns, youtiao and wan tan soup. cheap eats

absolutely mega dim sun and let me tell you, i don't take my dim sun lightly. i remember the first time i had dim sun, it made me weep salty tears of joy as i gnawed away my woes with a porky ball of happiness. far east chinese dim sun made me cry with such happiness i got thrown out.
gems in london china town, small place with few choice, but all are great, i try both congee and noodle, taste is really original.plus rare to find place serve  baozi in ukhighly recommend....

was here today around 11:00. poor food and really bad service

great chinese food with great material and very good cooking. great quality in dim sum and ali foods. i recommend to all my friends.

normally quite busy during lunch, especially weekends. food is good and they have a good dim sum selection that seems to be always available. dim sum prices are comparable with other places but other dishes can be quite pricey. i would recommend it if you want some dim sum.

nothing special but expensive, the best was the soup the main dishes were not well tasting. i would not come again.

a proper chinese dim sum place in china town, london. the price isn't expensive, service is good. special fried rice a little bit dry, but delicious. will be back again.

reviewing all the reviews and it's maybe bad for a lot of people. at the same time good too. i would truly recommend not to eat there.

tried by chance on as visit to london. we had dim sum and everything we had was very enjoyable.

quite possibly the worst chinese food i've ever had, bland with a complete lack of authenticity. dishes fail to even in the slightest resemble what they should taste like. would be shocked if the chef has ever treated an authentic dish and if he has then he should be utterly ashamed. expensive rubbish.

not great, not terrible. randomly picked from the intimidating number of restaurants in chinatown. the food was average, although quite greasy. it was super busy, and the service not great because of it. it wasn't terrible but i probably wouldn't go back on purpose, nor recommend it.
great rice, decent spring rolls, average noodles, poor service.
nice deco with a gold fish pond as you walk in. staff friendly, good sense of humour and strong knowledge on menu. reasonably priced, tasty food and large portions.

always good food with good atmosphere.

good food freshly cooked. fast service. located in chinatown.

customer service varies, communication is difficult sometimes...i recommend the dim sum but it ends a certain time so beware. food is great, sometimes they bring the wrong area, make sure you check before eating ! they put bill as a total rather than itemized. service charge always added.
excellent food and excellent service very friendly staff
very delicious food! the best hot and sour soup! the service is very good. everybody is friendly and smiling! the ambience is simple but nice. recommend!!!

food is always freshly made and tasty.  average prices.  came in for dimsum which are served until around 4pm.
delicious food, fast service and great location, would recommend.

perfect place, very good taste

steamed dumplings and deep fried dumplings were the best in soho. staff were friendly and welcoming. service was quick and efficient. the only drawback were the custard steamed buns got a bit messy as filling is a little too runny. apart from that they are the best restaurant in chinatown by some distance.

rip off !! avoid. i am asian. they thought we were tourist so begging us for tips although service charge was already included. they told me 'that the way we do it here' lol. if this is the way this restaurant is managed, management should be ashamed of themselves.
quick stopover for delicious dimsums & noodles! love the seafood ho fun
excellent food, quick service. the only thing i would say was you feel rushed as they try and get you out to reuse your table.
very picturesque

our favourite dim sum place!
dim sum very good and service good once seated although had to wait about 45 minutes for a table when told it would be 10-15 minutes. this was a sunday at approx 1pm though

food acceptable. totally unacceptable service. cloth was removed at the same time as the plates were taken. no questions regarding dessert or coffee. bill and payment directly. then they wanted gratitude! got nothing, then they got even more rude. avoid! plenty of others in the area.

mediocre food at best with ok service. totally shady unitemised bill and they very insistingly tried to collect service twice. only when we insisted, they showed us the itemized bill and claimed that the 12.5% is part of the food price
best cantonese restaurant in london

delicious and authentic. do not expect european-style service. the staff are directly to the point in their aim to quickly serve you and remove dishes your are done with.
great food, great service, great place

its a restaurant situated in the heart of chinatown and were came here for dinner.. so many people recommended it to us but in my opinion the taste is a little weird probably because im used to chinese food in italy
amazing dim sum.
lovely food and staff.  good value
high quality authentic chinese dimsum corner. service is fast despite the restaurant being packed to the brim.
gorgeous food and lovely staff. friendly atmosphere and reasonable prices too
adequate buffet
love this place.  the staff are very attentive and the food is just something else.  defo worth a visit if in china town
amazing chinese restaurant! the peking duck was awesome and the garlic shrimp was so great.  i highly recommend it!

have been coming here for years . food v.good. service v.good. service charge= 12.5%. waitress told us tips were separate from service charge. this was wrong and therefore won't return as my local chinese does not do this.

good dimsum joint and well priced. will visit it again.
bad food. told server i did not like a dish. nothing was done to accommodate.
very busy chinese restaurant.
rushing us to finish up and limit us to  one order and still charge us for non-compulsory service charge, our bill was 24, they charge 3 for tips. the one star is for the food
wonderful dim sum place. my husband and i had a big lunch for 22. the duck fried rolls and egg tarts were fantastic. plenty of chinese people were having lunch there as well. i highly recommend it!
