best beef curry ive ever had!only negative is the space which is very neglected.
lovely restaurant

food pretty good but quickly in and quickly leave- a bit hecti. warning- some items such as tsingtao beer are not priced on menu . check your bill (and prices) in this restaurant please! items on the bill are listed but only the total is written on the back of the bill.
poor service, food average and pricey..
adequate service but no character and disappointing flavourless food.  would not recommend or go again.
amazing food at a good price in a well decorated restaurant with professional staff and a good atmosphere. would highly recommend!
my favourite chinese restaurant in chinatown.
lovely service and friendly staff. food was quick and very tasty.
we didn't find this food any good. chicken in rice dish was rubbery. everything tasted pre-made and bland. so many options in area, silly to waste your time here.
fast, delicious and looks very nice!
food not great. avoid the set menus. read the small print regarding service charge. duck was good.
lovely place. whenever i come to london i always pop in here for really delicious king prawn dumplings
great food. been here many times and have always relished the food. very friendly staff & good customer service.
always excellent service and food.
great service food good visit every time i go to london would recommend
i do enjoy this yumcha place. it is definitely one of the few decent ones and affordable!! it does get quite busy.
it was very good, fast service, well cooked, very generous portions, with a menu for 3 we ate well 5 of us with good appetite. worked out better than a buffet in terms of price.
food very nice, staff miserable and unfriendly. 12.5% service charge added so staff don't be happy and helpful for that reason i guess
been here twice now and had a very good meal and service on both occasions
the food is extremely delicious. staff is good very presentable .. i recomend all should try this place..
the vegetarian dim sum was delicious! well seasoned and didnt need an ounce of soy sauce. service was quick and waiters friendly enough
rude staff, dirty we walked out
great place to eat, fast device and tastes great. would definitely come again

worse customer services i have ever come across!!!  the girl who handed our bills should be sack!!  damn rude and grumpy.  am surprised the business still going having employed people like her.  and whats this 12.5% is a must??? i thought its up to the customers and not the management?
food was ok but less tasty than at a prior visit. service was rushed and not attentive. we were disappointed. they used to be much better.
huge quantities, absolutely delicious. very friendly staff taking good care of you which is rare in big restaurants like this. very short waiting time, was a really good experience !
the service was excellent the food amazing one of the best chinese meals i've had

great food. good price too. i only give 4 stars because the service was more like fast food than restaurant, they didn't even ask us if we want desert or coffees, they were still cleaning the table wile they brought the bill.
very bad food and old material, expensive  ,unfriendly,rude,personels,
best chinese food i've had, huge portions, only bad part was staff were all rather miserable never once cracked a smile
awful service from the staff, were very rude!! would not reccomend to anyone and will 100% not be attending again
amazing chinese food in china town
poor service, rude staff
when u think there is nowhere to have something to eat at midnight or even later. this place is always open and food is really good.
food was ok until they spilt sauce all over our table and my leg! wont be coming back again.
very good food, especially tim sum

i come all the way from australia for this chinese.  (well sort of).  on trips to london i always make this the first stop in my itinary.nice food, with the main menu like a good old british chinese takeaway and an "authentic" chinese menu.rather busy at times.
a very nice chinese restaurant in london's chinatown, with a large and interesting menu. great price too.
really great dim sum, roast duck and noodles.
excellent chinese food at great happening place
yummy food for an affordable price for sure. portions are of a very decent size and the staff were quite efficient.
disappointing food. the vegetarian dishes were barely ok, but my boyfriend's meat dishes were really terrible, chewy and flavourless
good food, good service, always busy though so get ready for a wait!

terrible, terrible food, rude staff, and tried to sneak a 20% service charge onto the bill by providing only a final number (with no breakdown) and then on top asked for another service charge! do not go here. there are so many much better places right next to it.

food tasted horribly of chemicals, i was sick after i had a few bites of an unidentified meat in dim sum, and the service was extremely poor. no itemised bill either. never going back there and actively discourage people from going as well. this place ruined my day.

waitress tried to subtly add additional service charge on top of the 12.5% discretionary charge already on our bill when we asked to split the bill  among ourselves. dim sum was ok but wouldnt recommend due to dishonesty.
so good i've actually been here twice in an evening. relaxed chinese dining with speedy service, friendly serving staff and tasty food! get a crispy duck for the table to kick things off.
fast, medium priced food, the sauces are too sweet for my taste.

disgustingly dishonest restaurant. tries to charge extra during payment because of supposed service charge and vat (on top of included vat and s/c). carefully check your bill. or take your money somewhere else. avoid!
it is relatively cheap in london. good food reasonable price.

food was average, the service appalling... very rude. waiter literally complained that we didn't finish all of our food and it was a waste... thanks, but we paid for it. then stripped the table before we'd even stood up to leave.
attentive staff and not too greasy food! good value for money...
very busy restaurant and good food. if the bill can show the price of what we ordered, that would be great . we were in a rush so didn't ask for a detailed bill
lovely food and busy staff .we have been before and service is as good as last time we went.
they overcharged you on the bill. avoid going there. they don't show you the list of items. and they rush you out as well and paying 12.5% tips
good value for money. dim sum o.k. perfect for a quick lunch.
best dimsum i've ever had
staff very friendly but food wasn't as good as it used to be won't be rushing back.
great food, great value for money. i must for amy one who likes chinese food
felt as if they wanted you in and out, dated and cheap feeling!
amazing food!! must try
the food is great, one of the best chinese restaurants in china town and it's always full.  they charge 12.5% service charge but still the waiters ask for their tip. i thought that was illegal!

really enjoyed the food here. i had the shredded chicken noodles and they tasted really great! also had home made icetea which also tasted really good!the vegetarian food looks good aswell my friend says it tastes really good aswell

the dim sum was lovely! and if you go with a group of friends, you will be able to try so many types of them at a reasonably cheap rate. i had a chance to try over 8 types and it cost me just almost 12

if you can, try to get a table downstairs. it's like a whole new world down there with dim lights, music like karaoke and great atmosphere for couples night. their dim sum is something to look out for at lunch time. i do find that they have better options on the menu for that.
do not order chicken fried rice. practically no chicken on it. or anything else for that matter. no flavor and poor service.

service charge which they inform you about after you have order yours drinks . they should inform this before you get your table . i don't have a issue paying service charge if you get good service . but don't like to be informed if you don't pay service charge we ask you to leave as this is part of our wages .
terrible rude staff and food
wonderful day out. full of life/activity!crowded..lots of places to eat/ shop
great restaurant, but gets very busy, had a 25 min wait to get seated. food was nice.
i consider this to be one of the best chinese restaurants in london. quick service, good food, and a feeling of being welcome.

i was asked to leave the restaurant because i was not gonna spend a minimum amount that they required with the excuse that it was sunday and they get a lot of customers on weekends even though there were a lot of empty tables.
lovely spot for chinese food, loved it.
really nice - staff a little pushy but normal for china town
plain decor. rude staff. okayish food.

awful toilets, no itemised bill and scammed my pensioner mum by saying she gave them a dodgy 20 note so she gave them another.  when confronted they were rude and aggressive. definitely swapped her good 20 for a fake . avoid at all costs.
check your receipt...
fab food and hospitable servers. worth every penny
my order was delayed mored than 30mins. paying to  the counter for me is not right no itemised to the bill only total it end up i was overcharged of 1 order of the dimsum which is i felt bad.
super quick service. right in china town. great food. good prices. staff are very efficient and friendly.
tables a little squashed on a saturday night and you are probably going to have to queue but well worth the wait. great food, good vegetarian selection and friendly attentive service.

really good service...not like other restaurants i've been in. i also asked the waitor if their food contains msg or flavour enhancers. he went inside and the manager came out to assure me that they do not use msg in their food. amazing
bad service, waiters who blame customers for their mistakes, we did not receive the food we order, they took from our table three double taxes, and double tip. i will not come back again
ok the food is fine. but i said i wanted crispy fried noodles with chicken and vegetables and when they gave me chow mein with bean sprouts.. i wasn't happy. but they refused to change it. not cool.

best restaurant in soho. i have been going there on my every visit to london for last 5-6 years, its always very delicious, affordable and fast & friendly service. try, you wont regret it ! keep up the good work guys!
very quick service, food was delicious

oh my god.  the food is substandard.  either very salty or very greasy.  the staff is greedy and pushing for an extra tip even though the service charge is included.  gerards corner, will you see me again?  i dont think so.

food was ok but they tried to steal my friends phone. after leaving the phone at the restaurant they claimed it was not there and only returned it the next day after being shown gps tacking that it was still there. very unprofessional bordering on theivery
food was good but then they included, without saying, over 25% in tips. receipt said nothing. staff were also in a rush - not very friendly.
good food. little bit more expensive than some of the nearby restaurants. beer and some spirits available. usual grumpy staff expected in china town lol.
good food but a 12.5% service charge with no itemised bill provided
one of my fav restaurants in chinatown. never tired of going there for dinner
high quality to price ratio

this place is really good and the food is delicious. don't believe any reviews that tell you otherwise.if you don't want the waiters constantly bothering you when you're eating then this place is great.this restaurant is definitely the best meal in china town and i would recommend it to anyone who loves chinese food.

food was amazing - had prawn toast, beef with black sauce and chili, fried rice and aubergine/tofu with prawn in it.service was poor, but expected - made reservation at 7, wasn't given a table until 7:20, inattentive staff but the place is busy hence understandable.
not my first time here and this did not disappoint. crispy aromatic duck was great, other dishes also above average plus very nice jasmine tea. i'll avoid the house pink wine next time.
superb meal, thank you

food is good however there is a 12.5% service charge and then the waitress tried to get us to give her a tip on top of that. apparently the manager takes the 12.5% service charge! also they hide it by not giving you an itemised receipt, they give you a piece of paper with your total.
best chinese in london. just becareful. they add the tip in to the bill at the and do not tell you. then you add more not knowing. but good chinese
surprisingly good restaurant in the heart of china town. we've had a pecking duck, dim sum, and some sides and everything was very good.
we were told we could only order once so they could keep turning over the table. the food was ok but not spectacular.

i had a better meal here ages ago. it's a pretty basic chinese restaurant. the taste for the dishes were fine, but the portions have really diminished in size.within 5 mins of paying our bill, we were asked if we could vacate the table so they could bring in more customers- never a good way to impress anyone.
not good, food is below average, better choices in area

been here a few times now. it's our 'go to' place for chinese food when down in london and in the west end. food and service is acceptable. still think our local chinese takeaway in glasgow,  the cathay cuisine is my favourite!
awesome food. great service. if my hotel had a microwave i would have taken the rest of my food with me. i was so full but didn't want to let it go.
dimsum is really tasty here and the prices are reasonable compared to other places in china town. there's quite a lot of seating which are not tightly packed together.
they dont give you an itemised bill so you dont realise they already added 12.5% service. then when you go to pay they suggest you should gove a tip.very sneaky
service was pleasent and quick. lots of asian diners. loved the chicken feet in black been sauce. special steamed dumplings were enjoyed as well.
like the dim sum here. the  here really will .
great place. reasonable prices

be aware - price scamthey will charge you additional 12,5% for eating in without telling you (on top of the 10% service charge). it is not mentioned in the menu which is deceiving. the food is ok, however i would strongly suggest to give up this intransparent pricing methods in the future. until then they wont see us again.
excellent food as  before will come again

disgusting. overcooked and over fried dishes it seems like eating cork. perfect if you want to eat bone and don't really have taste. we waited 65 min!! for the dishes and there was not a simple apology. of course, a 10% extra because their good job ;)
great dumplings....staff were very attentive

this is the first time, i have tried this restaurant, the food was delicious, quick, waiters are good. hostess are very polite and friendly. i will definitely recommend this restaurant to my friend. i will come back soon, thank you very much guys, well done.
best chinese restaurant i've found in london! good staff, large menu, and the food is delicious! highly recommend
super busy! dishes are small portion and taste ok
good food, not the best service. had an experience where a staff member tried to force a service charge on the customer, considering it is not legally required.
only been here for standard dim sum but it's pretty good.  it's not the best i've ever had - not even close to be honest.  but it's consistent and i always enjoy it.
the worst service of my life
absolutely terrible. horrible service. small portions. and they tried to charge us before we ate our food because i simply asked about the service charge of 12.5%
speedy & friendly staff. tasty food, but a little bit too much sauce. overall nothing to complain. went there twice during nye, though there were a lot of people we didnt had to wait too long.

a very bad  experience, the service is awful and cold.expensive chinese food for zero quality.not recommanded.

love it, delicious dim sum. reasonable price.
little pricy but the best chinese i've been to. 4 stars because the staff are efficient but not really engaging with customers enough, had to ask twice for another diet coke.
over price and cold food. poor service in the bottom with toilets.

amazing food and service, never had a bad time here.
delicious freshly made food

really like this place for a night out on the beers. get a set dinner and they fill you up with loads of food. for london it's well priced and they find you a table pretty quick every time i've been there even though its always busy.
expensive, probably because it is in a tourist area. food wasn't great and service was quite unfriendly and poor
i love this restaurant. i've been coming for years. the food is really great

superb food ! very quick, brilliant service. all team members are nice and funny. recommend
chinese restaurant for dim sum.
the food was great and it was fast. service was good.
everything was slimy , average cheap food, lobster was gelly , service very basic . not raccomended ! very touristic place
terrible service and duck was overcooked and dry

average chinese restaurant, service was ok as we found a seat straight away.
very good service. friendly staff and very very good food. the atmosphere is also very friendly and prices for food are low.
great customer service, amazing food and cocktails

the food was very good but the restaurant is a bit old

food is good, but the queuing system is a total mess when its busy. i feel bad for the staff running it because it's so stressful, but also, its only so stressful for everyone because the organisation is terrible.

they never give an itemised bill. adds extra items on the bill. happened three times this year. each time they removed the extra items and said mistake was due to them being busy. imagine the number of people shy to question the bill. not going any more. watch out if you are three or more persons.
great chinese restaurant, huge menu, great service
terrific food, but slightly too busy
late night meal after evenings hard work. splendid chinese food, immaculate service, good wines, reasonable prices. lively even after 11pm.

we were with friends from france who couldn't speak english well, then they tried to rip off from us. fortunately i and another friend knew the price usually, but if we were tourist we wouldn't have noticed. after this experience i am careful in any restaurant in china town, and needless to say i never go back here.
gone downhill a bit. too many tables squashed together, service bit slow, but it's a busy restaurant.
food was lovely but unfortunately staff were quite rude, not people persons! afraid we wont be going back....
a favourite!  nice and busy, friendly staff, good food.  service was really quick on a busy saturday evening!

standard chinese in london china town, service is quick and after you eat you give table back lol

so disappointed, to expensive for nothing, waiter very unpleasant.don't go here! there are many better ones around !

a great place for a bite to eat or a feast.  my friend and i got dim sum and noodles here.  bathrooms were small but clean. the waitress was very fellowship with suggestions.

really homemade traditional authentic chinese food.. good tastes.. not great environment as a decoration and staff is rude.. but i guess it is the way chinese culture is that makes me thing they are rude.. they might not be but i just felt they were. i would recommend and visit again for food and only

1 star is too much. bland food and incredibly rude staff. being barked at by the lady up on her pedestal looking after the till and waitresses pushing children out of the way. horrible way to end a great day in london.
very low food and service quality, staff wasnt helpful. they accept only cash payments god knows why!! stay away from this place if you wanna enjoy your food.

always hard to find a decent restaurant in chinatown as you need to be careful of the food ratings as some are 1 out of 5 and some seem not to gave a rating.this restaurant is a 4 and was the busiest and so we chose it for lunch. we had the set b menu inc service charge for 43 and there was more than enough for two hungry blokes..
a lovely, busy chinese right on the corner of the street. always busy, food always amazing and friendly, attentive staff.
excellent, well priced dim sum!
was recommended to us and it was amazing food. good value for such great quality food. i always walk up and down chinatown looking for a decent place to eat. not anymore.

it's okay food, but very expensive for relative quality and have exceptionally questionable receipt processes and struggle to process multiple card transactions at once.
unfriendly waitress, bad service. im sure there are plenty of better restaurants in china town

nice food, friendly staff

lovely food, duck was delicious

food is good lovely service
good food nice service

awesome.
nice food, generous portions and decent prices.

great !

my favourite restaurant

as good as ever

food was not the greatest. sorry to say

amazing chinese food with really fast service. pekking duck is incredible.

great sort of menus, amazing food and nice service

good food!

maybe i didn't pick the right dish, it was ok. i've had better and cheaper in chinatown. friendly staff and quick service, can't fault that.

one of the best restaurants in chinatown.
great food, good atmosphere!
huge portions, good atmosphere

decent delicious food. came very quick and staff were polite and friendly. not bad for a dim sum

the food is not good and neither is the service
always the best place to get pork belly. all the food is fresh and amazing. don't be caught out by the enforced service charge though.

great chinese food. had mainly dim sum which was excellent.  fried rice and main dish of monks veg was very good too. (the loos could have been tidier: the bins were overflowing with paper towels - it was a very busy sunday! apart from that it was an enjoyable afternoon in a busy,lively restaurant )
i took some takeaway there it was yummy and not so expensive.
very good food friendly staff its slightly pricey but its good to come here every now and then
poor food, didn't seem fresh, very expensive and better restaurants available
always a stopping point when visiting london. old school style dim sum restaurant with freshly prepared food.
really nice food and service

fantastic food helpfull staff made to feel wellcome good value

service is great

premade food and simply warmed for you. the white rice was cold. the water i was given was warm from the tap. a server came 30 after i opened the menu. than another 2min after. their manners weren't very polite either including the arrogantly served food.
don't pay the service charge.

me and my partner got the same meal but one cost more than the other.the waitress thought i wanted my pork and rice separate so she charged me 4.00 extra for my meal. made up an excuse to why i had to pay more. gave in as we didn't want to fight in the middle of the restaurant. will not be eating here or recommending this restaurant!

this place is the worst restaurant ever

superb atmosphere inside with a good menu. food is very tasty and very reasonable in the price. limited in the beer they sale but still worth a visit. i prefer here then crowded china town anytime of the year. recommend.
had dim sum. for some funny reason the dessert came first. so it was stone cold by the time i worked through the other dishes.
great food, better than average. lovely staff and great service

worst service ever!! been treated like dogs. ordered various dumpling and they literally threw the food on the table and nobody bothered to even tell us which one is what. when tried to ask someone about the remaining order they were really rude. we had to cancel rest of the order and eat in another place.
good food.  nice people. not touristy.
not as good as the one in colindale.we asked for water repeatedly, they only bring it over if you order it with sonthing or pay for bottled water. ive stopped going here as a result.
my favourite dim sum restuarant in china town
visited yesterday evening and food was delicious. wait time wasn't too bad either even though it was very busy. would definitely visit again.
best dim sum in london!
good food, quick service (considering how busy chinatown is!), reasonably priced. looking at about 25 per head for a hearty feast
one of the best restaurants in china town with a good selection of dishes
the most unfriendly staff i have ever come across. doesn't hurt to smile you know. food was not great either.
bad expensive . not pro. 2 persons i a chinese resto. 95 pounds.
great quality price ratio.one waitress kept checking her face (spots?) on one of the mirror next to us. she did it like 15 times during our time there. very disturbing.
large restaurant on several floors.  good for large groups.  friendly service,  good food and reasonably priced.
best dim sum in china town and an authentic yum cha experience
come here everytime i visit china town
on chinese new year they were welcoming enough to accommodate us on a busy event, however my entire family got food poisoning.
we always come here when we come to chinatown. the best!! amazing food. friendly staff. what more could you want.
terrible service, unbelievably slow and miserable staff. used to come here a lot. the food is good but i won't be coming back because the service never improves!!
stopped for supper before the theatre. very good. flexibly changed one soup for another in a set menu. good service.

since my old favourite dim sum restaurant closed down this has become my regular go to. not for the decor or atmosphere but for consistently good dim sum. it's noisy especially on a weekend but it's good value for good dim sum. recommended.
excellent place helpful staff and brilliant food. nice atmosphere. will be going there everything we go to chinatown.
great food.....worth visiting
went there for a wedding banquet. great food and atmosphere
service was not very good. they charged for tea but would not give us two pots of different teas.
good dim sum and bbq pork
friendly staff good food
decent value for money and friendly staff
quality of ingredients is good here though slightly more expensive than others in the area.
very good food. 12.5% service charge
good food plenty big potuons

the food is not bad, but service should be more polite. toilet rooms are very tired and smelly.
good. service not that good. its not unreasonable to ask for a receipt so dont take an attitude just because someone asks for one.
went to eat dinner here with a friend, we were going to share a dish since it's fairly big but we were told we had to order separate food, even though the place was pretty empty, so we had to leave.
great with children, good value for money and choice of food.
food so so. horrible service. and was asked to order minimum spend of 10 per person which was not stated at entrance or menu. disappointed.

overcharged us without providing any better service in return. even wanted to charge for hot water -- life's essential ingredient! forgot one of the dishes we ordered, keeping us waiting nearly 20 mins. food, once delivered, was average.

food was actually very tasty, however order was wrong and drinks didn't arrive. they are very busy and language obviously plays a part, worth going but don't expect a unique customer experience. as i said, the food was actually pretty good

dim sum not bad

good pure food

didnt enjoy meal was too much of the slimy stuff on
good food and good value!
delicious food and great place.
still good

great selection of food, well priced and consistent in quality.  can't really go wrong here
nice chinese restaurant in china town london big place with good food.
one of the best chinese restaurants in soho!

i recommend the dim sum menu ! very good, the soup as well but you can share it with one or even 3 other people ! i think they are quite cheap. didn't like the stir fry noodle and for the service not too bad but they are not very polite.

some one recommends me this place but food was so bad, food quality is worse then the average chinese takeaways. i thought i would get authentic chinese there. don't recommend this place to anyone

really delicious genuinely chinese food, good-ish value.

fun place. the heart of chinatown.

always a pleasure.. great food after meeting with friends

must try dishes..garlic prawns...lobster...steamed fish...egg fried rice ...it's my family's favourite go to place

varied menu with many traditional cantonese dishes. the menu has clear english translations and photographs of the dishes you were concerned you won't know what to pick. fairly priced and good value given the quality.
booked a table, seated for twenty minutes late. service was poor but the food great.
food is delicious but quite expensive. service is fast but the servers arent very friendly but not rude
the food is ok, but we got the really bad boiled rice, smell so worse, definitely been cooked for a long time. wont come back again, not recommend.
great chinese food and service

mediocre food, price and service quality. the chicken and duck in black bean sauce not recommendable.
busy as and well organized. food was great and well worth the wait.
very good dinner! but there was eggshell in the rice

great place for dim sum. always a queue for seats even though it's pretty massive inside. a testiment to the quality of food and quick service. we had a fairly short 15 min wait for our party of 7. well organised.
amazing foooood. fast service. great placee
good cantonese food including dim sum. reasonable price and portions. friendly service which is refreshing for china town
did not like the food that we ordered. basically we wasted it

i just love china town,the atmosphere is really buzzing in the evenings and on chinese new year they even have the chinese dragon out, the restaurants are nice but just look before you go in and eat.not all the eating places are good but a few are.
beef dish loaded with fat ;(  average food

delicious authentic dim sum restaurant. came here for lunch and it was packed. the dim sum is made to order so the food was fresh and hot. all of the dumplings tasted great, as good as dim sum in hong kong. also tried the duck and it was great too. service was pretty good and attentive. food was also served pretty quickly.
great service and food...the wait staff took a bit to warm up to but, once they did super friendly
great for dim sum. sundays are very busy and quite family friendly

the food was pretty good, it tasted nice. the service was unfriendly as all heck.i will admit that it just kind of felt like they were trying to turn tables. not alot of effort was put into caring about any of the tables while we were there.
food hair in my food. the service was terrible! wouldn't recommend at all.
one of my favorite place
good chinese cuisine

this is our go to place for dim sum. the food here is pretty good. the queue can be a little intimidating, especially on sunday, but the wait is never too long. however, to get a seat, you'd have to talk to the host and put your name down, you can't just wait in line.
a very good chinese option. good value for the price you pay. reasonable comfortable and good a nice staff.
awesome food. especially the crispy duck. friendly staff and interesting selections. overall this is a must visit when in london.
the food quality was not great but a good ambience in the middle of china town. staff talk to customers  with a lot of attitude. i don't  think i would be visiting there again..
love the cold dimsum menu and good place for kids and family time. good price. quick services. can be long queue due to popularity of the place
good food pleasant  atmosphere good service too
nice food but need better employees
good service, attentive staff and delicious food.

the queue was very badly managed and the staff were rude and disorganised. didn't bother waiting for a table as the service seemed so bad while merely waiting that i dread to imagine what it was like if you were actually trying to eat there.
atrocious. went here with the family for dinner - meal was terrible, service embarrassingly bad and to top it all off, was forced to pay a 10% service charge. avoid at all costs.
the food was too bad the chairs filthy to crowdy service zero..not came back again
good service and open late.

authentic asian coausin experience
service was ok, main course was lovely  however the dessert menu did not exist!
decent chinese restaurant in the heart of china town london. they have a good variety of food in the menu and most of all yummy food. well priced too.

terrible food. loud place. customers treated like cattle. would rather be hungry then eat there. honey prawns i had were okish but chow mein sucked. same for prawns in ginger sauce. atmosphere truly bad. like in a loud shopping centre.
every dish was fresh and flavorful! don't expect quick service, though, it's definitely worth the wait.
great food and service during the meal. a bit slow getting any form of bill and paying it. still surprised that the only beer on draft is heineken not a chinese beer.

wow, the waiters are unbelievably rude. it was comedic. we had a good laugh about how they blatantly did not bother hiding their disdain for customer service. shockingly bad! the food on the other hand, was really delicious and well priced. recommend if you don't particularly care for service/ambience.
the food is really great! i am chinese, so i do know if the food tastes fresh or re-cooked or fried too much, i would write it here. but everything i ordered was   i will come back!
great food. great service. amazing prawn dishes. well worth it. went for 40th birthday - impressed.
busy place. can have wait times 20 to 30min turnovers.  book if you can. beef tender food tasty. food came to the table in an odd order. other than that nice food

it was okay. good customer service from her waiter who made helpful recommendations on what to eat. i found certain meals slightly too oily but my friend was okay with it. good seating available. would be nice to update the linen.
salt

friendly staff and fast service. food was good quality (i had the chicken in black bean and chilli sauce). cosy atmosphere.

simply disappointing & dishes being served were not reflective of any merits of true chinese cooking! i couldnt believe within 5 minutes after making our orders, 5 different cooking styles of dishes were ready which was truly impossible & something was definitely wrong! no need to mention the tastiness of those dishes!
good food great service!
good food at a decent place. quantities are quite large and the staff was accommodating to allergies.
this is a medium sized restaurant in the heart of london's china town. the welcome and service was great, and the food very nice.
authentic food, good flavor.  services are better than my expectation.  will return.
nice food and great service
end to an annual event with friends. this place didn't disappoint.maybe a tad salty but good portions and tasty food.

place was okay. food was quick and most of it was good. lemon chicken was terrible. our waitress was extremely rude. she then left and someone else served us our food. plates were cleared away and waited for 20 mins afterwards to get the check. furnishings definitely need an upgrade
great service, food did not meet expectations.
the dim sums were fresh and tasty! although service was slightly abrupt, despite that i would definitely come back again.
food is excellent and the service is quick. quite authentic cantonese cuisine at a fair price!
food was ok. however was disappointed by raw beef served. the beef dish was supposed to be fully cooked unlike steak.

possibly one of the best chinese place in chinatown london.

good is great and staff is active highly recommended!

my fave chinese restaurant. friendly staff and nice food. been going here for years.
great food (all dim sums were fantastic) and speedy service! not the friendliest staff but all very efficient!

horrible greasy food. horrible toilets. but the most horrible thing there is customer service. there were 2 out of 6 (or so) waiters who were okeyish, others were rude and unhelpful. shame that in this place tips are already being taken into your bill, if it would be complimentary i would not leave them a penny. avoid.
great lunch with friends. happy chinese new year. amazing food .
a great restaurant in the heart of chinatown.. great atmosphere.
great food. quick service reasonable prices

food was great, authentic chinese style. the service however was shocking, plates were dropped onto the table in an aggressive fashion while the chopsticks were basically thrown at you. if they polish up the service this would be a top joint.

always come here when in london to buy buns for the next days breakfast. will always get a  (sausage bun), and they never fail to disappoint.the cakes are also very soft and fluffy, without being too sweet.
friendly service and good prices! never disappointed!
amazing
my first purchase yesterday! omg! so sorry for me as i've been missed on this little cake shop in soho for last 16 yrs. just delicious! i think i will keep coming back!

awesome place get all birthday cakes done here

top. i recommended

yum pastries and cakes. go for the food not for the service!

the best chinese cakes in london
very ordinary
delicious

absolutely delicious. best bakery in town.

outstanding cakes! ordered wedding cakes from this little bakery. taste great looks good.
the buns are so tasty
delicious! especially the bbq pork buns. the egg tarts are good too
my favourite bakery in chinatown, i love the chicken curry bun

very tasteful cakes and bakery food! our fav spot to visit when we're in the uk

the best pastry i have ever tried, awesome cakes and delicious.best oriental cake shop in london.

finally some bread quality that is at least as good as the average ones in north american asian bakery in london. though, the use of overly saturated food colouring and sense of art on cake decoration seems something of the late 90s. i would not get the cake but will def come back for the buns.

i've been going here since i've been able to walk as a child, there was always an old man there who gave me free egg tarts! i still go here on occasion and its just the best cakes and buns in china town ! their custard buns are to die for and their fresh fruit cakes look amazing!
best pork buns in chinatown. a small shop but really good food. highly recommend.
tried the sweet moon cake today, surprisingly good. going to buy some savory ones next week.
loved it china town great pastries

this place serves up reasonably-priced chinese and asian pastry, breads, buns and cakes. quite a wide variety as well. prices range from 1.20 - 1.80 and portion of a bun is large for a person. worth a visit and is perhaps a lesser-patronised bakery unlike other bakeries in chinatown i.e. chinatown bakery.
best bakery in chinatown. pork buns, custard buns all great. it does get busy, so be there early
wreally amazing and goodfood that i partly never saw before also pretty affordable pricese10/10
hands down best bakery in chinatown. cheese tart is good. bread are super good
very good cakes and authentic too.

love this shop. it's tiny but the staff are efficient and are happy to answer questions. i would advise a little research into their baked goods before you go in so you don't stand there like a lemon trying to decide, great choice of traditional and modern bakes. i recommend the pineapple buns.
very good friendly servicethe cakes are very nice
fruit cake tastes terrible and i got food poison plus next needed to see the gp.
lovely cakes and bakery foods at a great price

best cakes in chinatown! heads up though they only accept cash, so hit up an atm before going. so worth it! my faves are the chicken kare pan, the triangle sponge cake, and the fruit cakes
delicious handcrafted cakes!
i really loved the cake and it looks so beautiful and so tasty and fabulous
amazing food. quick service. super clean.
dim sum were tasted like microwave ready food, but that charges you 7 pound, that you could buy 14 times the same amount in the asia market. fried rice was poorly cooked. overrated price.
have been here twice, service very good. food was nice and speedy.
top class chinese food and good service. don't miss it on a trip to london.
just warning. its 23 pound for 3 portions of rice on xmas.
expensive, rude service. food just about average grade. last time visiting there.beware of the added service charge!
loved the friendly ambiance, polite staff and great food. great for a china town, london experience
yeng was superb absolutely an outstanding waiter. the food was amazing we have visited two new years eves on a row and would recommend
great find, particularly at chinese new year. good value/variety nicely cooked with super dim sum (best steamed) so arrive before the crowd is our advice
excellent food and plenty of it. very pleasent and helpful staff. we tried one of the set menus and could not finish it all. will be back.
delicious food and great service - we said we had time constraints and our food was on the table within 15 minutes. the setting of the restaurant was lively and overall was a fabulous experience.
food was rushed, tasted grim, overpriced and staff were rude. overall i would not recommend anyone to dine in this restaurant.
surprising great food. nice atmosphere in china town. service was just as good. would definitely return and recommend to others.

restaurant is beautiful. staff is fast. food also comes very fast! however the size of food served is out of proportion... extremly big. and one of the dishes we had tasted burned. and i had some crab-bone in my squid dish (?!?#?!>%#)

prompt service, excellent food and good value. had set menu b for 2 people @ 28 per head. generous portions. pity they dont serve draught lager, bottle of tiger beer 4.30 a little pricey but thats london prices for you. would definitely go back.

could not believe how miserable the server was, she had no interest in being there as was clear from how she threw down on the table the oyster sauce. wrong drink came out first, then the food arrived which was ok but expensive. would not recommend, expensive and bad service
has good weelchair access and a good vibe for all goot food too

lovely food,. but very expensive $$$$ wouldn't be so much of an issue but staff are literally on your back to leave when done, trying to take plates before finished eating, pressuring to by drinks, english isn't great and slapped wya service charge. thanks guys!

to be honest 1 star is extremely generous!! they deserve 0 stars - do not eat here!! poor customer service, dirty dishes / glasses, hard rice (if they can't even cook rice right, then you can only imagine what the rest of the food is like), stale spare ribs, everything tasted bland / unseasoned.

it's not drastically dissimilar to the other places nearby, but it is good.  it's clean, fast, friendly and the food is very tasty.we had an enormous dim sum lunch for around 15 pp which, for the quality, i think was pretty good value.
the worst chinese food i ever eaten! the food was the scum of the earth! absolutely no recommendation. the staff was very unfriendly too!
good qualities dim sum and other dishes from the menu restaurant. highly recommended
great food and our waiter was really good, have only given 4 stars as the maitre d was a bit grumpy
an alright restaurant, really good waiting staff with alright food

diarhea!! was good at the time tho. bbq pork was good. the ribs were ok but served cold. prawn toast was awsome. soup was soup but good. peking duck was dry and the pancakes were extremely dry and flour. mixed dim sums were pretty good. service was quick and nice.
the worst service i ever experienced! the waitress were so rude, you cannot even imagine!
nice food. good quick service. lots.of.choice

we came here for a lunch on sunday. it was so rushed and felt like they wanted to kick you out all the time. it was barely 45 mins, they brought the bills and asked how we wanted to pay. our waitress may was very rude and it was not a pleasant experience
my favourite chinese in london , great food great atmosphere and unusually clean for chinatown  your feet do not stick to the carpet !
very good tasting food will definitely be going back.
randomly picked this place. great food, good service. would return.
great food. a tad bit pricey but very good food

tasty dim sum and efficient staff. they have a handy little tick sheet so you can remember what you are going to order and it also helps people speaking different languages convey what they would like to eat, just be careful to tick the correct box.

it's very busy on most of the occasions i've been there so the service is a bit slow but good food, and the dim-sum and dumplings are reasonably priced and portions too... so my recommendation is that decide what to have from the menu outside and order asap after you have been seated...
nice cantonese cuisine to enjoy in a rather charming ambience
very good food.

we had some fishy stuff. some crabby stuff. some veggie stuff. and some noodley stuff. all of it was jolly tasty. very busy chinese restaurant, set over three floors. in the heart of london's chinatown. well worth a visit. good.
favourite in london. deserves a 10/10
good quality food and service.
had a wonderful dim sum there. food was exquisite and rather affordable.
amazing authentic chinese food in london.
basic food. nothing remarkable. service was initially slow, but improved. there are better places, but also worse. we will not likely return.
excellent roast duck. it is better than your seasons
service was unfriendly and unimpressive food. poor value for money.
fast service - low quality food - bored staff
i enjoy this chinese, food is great eaten in or taken away.
fantastic food at a price that i was surprised at the quality of the service and the meal far eceeded ecpepeetations the staff was very friendly and helpful nothing was to much trouble
dim sum was priced similarly to other places, the dcor inside was nice and the service good. they do runny custard egg buns which you don't get everywhere! i'd definitely visit again.

honest service and ample portions not our first visit, won't be our last on trips to london

marvelous lobster chinese style.

great food, service was great as well! loved the dim sum.

always delicious.
very tasty food, a little expensive compared to others in the area but really nice atmosphere and decor.
excellent food, particularly the dim sum.

good food moderately priced
nice place. duck  is nicely cooked.

great food amazing service
stop finning sharks
good food. :)

really great food- a little pricey, but proper good. the servers are all pretty grouchy and don't smile, but they're quick and attentive and your food comes quickly, so who cares? again, great food, my favorite in soho. amazing sauces.
very good quality but a little rushed unfortunately as we were near closing time as we had been to the theatre
amazing dim sum

not really impressed. food came fairly quick but the staff weren't friendly and the place didn't do chips! imagine a chinese not doing chips? anyway had a chicken curry it was average, best thing about eating there was the nice fish tank they had. oh and spent a fortune and no free prawn crackers?! wouldn't go back.
would go again. we had a good selection of dishes.
loved this place loved the food
love the food come her for lunch for dim sum when i'm in london
over priced and didnt taste good would not recommend
very rude staff and compulsory surcharge added !!  overpriced!  wouldn't come back .

do not go here! worst chinese ever. food was so rushed it must of been reheated! very rushed service. waitress may was lovely. cucumber was the nicest part of the meal! soo over priced. we paid 120 for what i can only describe as the worst chinese ever. do not go here
food was good but not hot dont like cool meat

best dim sum in london hands down. fairly rude staff but thats what you get in lost chinese restaurants in london, and youre not really coming for the service. youre coming for the food!bbq pork is excellent and well as the soup dumplings. prices are very reasonable for central london.would recommend

the portions are huge, which makes sense given the price. the waiter could have done a better job explaining the food questions we had asked . i was glad  to have waited before placing my order. food itself was fine,  nothing mind blowing.
very quick service between harry potter parts 1&2

i come here exclusively for the dim sum, a bit more dear than other restaurants but the restaurant interior is beautiful, great ambience and photo opportunities. typical china town service, ride and quick to hi k you out as soon as you pay the bill. food does arrive quickly! women's toilets were clean and spacious.
rude staff and compulsory surcharge added because "the staff show you the menu and bring you the food". average food. wouldn't come back .
4 of us took a chance on this restaurant on sat. very pleased, good fast service, polite staff,very nice clean and food too class. will eat there again
very fresh dim sum. siu mai pretty tasty
lovely seats in the toilet but the bar maid overcharged me big time for my third round of drinks.
the food is ok but too little to feed my stomach
five star! delicious food, friendly staff, fast service. staff went above and beyond to make sure we were happy. food was 5*

the food was good but the staff were not. they were closing at 10 and we were seated at 9.30 but we were not informed of the closing time until after we had our bottle of wine . then they rushed all of our order to the table at once and we had to ask to have our main meals reheated . . much to the staff's dismay . would never go again
lovely food and great service!
this is a beautiful place to have a chinese and the staff are very friendly
this is one of the best chinese restaurants in the area, the food (only ever tried dim sum) is glorious, staff courteous (such rarity in china town!) and the interior stylish.
high quality authentic chinese restaurant in the heart of chinatown london.affordable prices, recommended.
our familys go to resto in chinatown. tasty food and although the prices are a bit high its what you would expect for such a busy area.
was good food, a little more expensive than other options.

1 star.... i would of given none if i had the option! this restaurant is so overrated and over priced!! 20 a dish which was unbelievable as definitely was not worth it! as on the train home i become dizzy and was sick in train toilets as a result of food poisoning! we will never be going there again......
shocking service. awful food. don't bother 80 for an awful end to our evening
it was nice
good taste
bang average chinese, 18 for quarter duck..
awesome food
the food is exactly the same as the local chinesse restaurant, but the price is very expensive and the waiters are so not polite.
very good dim sum. little prices than average. ca 25 gbp / person. also service charge added. this is becoming a recent standard in  chinatown.
staff was pretty terrible. food was eh ok.one of the staff started yelling at me because i couldnt understand his terrible english.
nice food,a little on the expensive side but guess it is chinatown after all
very poor service. and the pork belly was inedible. i would not return. and would advise to all not to visit.

walked in. a table was pointed to upstairs which we sat at.... for over 10 minutes without being offered a drink or anything. staff looked miserable and one waitress just staring into space. walked out eventually and went elsewhere. avoid!!
food is great but i'm not sure if it compensates for the bad service.

very nice chinese restaurant which offers an abundance of typical chinese dishes. luckily there are a range of menues to choose from, which makes choosing a lot easier. the range of dishes are quite diverse and actually all tastes good or even great.
i loved the food and the service. the waiter was really helpful with suggestions. will definitely visit again.
good food..good service
very nice setting. the food was okay. we had dim sum and some dishes.
great food, friendly staff.
very pleased with the service.  great food and very friendly staff. highly recommend.
really good yum cha at a reasonable price
it was very slow service. staff not interested.. asked for more sweet chilly sauce and he brings soy sauce!!! didn't understand english very well? dim sum was good ..
terrible service. the staffs were very rude. food taste below average. there are so many better choices in china town. don't waste your time and money.
excellent food and great service.

love this place. my favourite restaurant in china town for both dim sum and evening menu. if you come here try the 3 types of meat (duck, roast pork and crispy pork). the atmosphere is amazing here aswell.
pretty decent restaurant in china town for dim sum. my colleagues and i have visited this restaurant a few times and the food quality has been consistent.
starters are very good. portion sizes are very good. staff are not very smiley but they're very efficient
dim sums are just so so.  some of them were not very warm when they brought to the table. its definitely not our must go places.
serving up a very typical chinatown menu, the food does seem slightly better quality than most of the others ive been to. very expensive for what it is with many basic dishes being 20.
dim sum are very good and not expensive. highly recommended.

the dim sum here is pretty good for chinatown, not on par with plum valley but better than lido. when paying by cash youll need to remind the staff about the change as they always seem to suffer from amnesia during this particular moment. ... #dimsum #cantonesefood #chinesefood #chinatown
terrible customer service. food basic. portions large.
great food, service quick, a bit expensive!
solid menu, good sized portions good for sharing, good food
food was good but the service was very rushed very unfriendly, no pleasantries.in and out within 35 mins.did nothing to win my business going forward.

extremely busy, but then it's in the middle of chinatown. staff were making an effort to seat everyone quickly, service was fast and food arrived quickly, but weren't made to feel like they wanted us straight out the door again.food was good with decent portions and seemed freshly prepped.
our first experience of china town.wow we wasn't expecting a bill of over 70 for 2 people!!! and not very good either.avoid if you want to save your money

the service was bad, and the dishes came cold.. we asked for some steamed rice and we recieved it after the diner.. it was a really bad choice to eat there, because there are a lot of better restaurants near them.the prise otherways was okay.
huge restaurant over three floors. food was tasty.
good service dim sums amazing
excellent dim sum. friendly attentive staff.
excellent meal.  friendly staff.
food is bad and the service is worst. there are plenty of places there avoid this place.
really like this place. we were later in the evening after the theatre so could only have one course but then that's understandable. very nice.
decent price, service is not that good

terrible, forgotten four of our final sum dishes, when enquiring about missing items,they blamed the computer error. lies, no doubt our dishes went to near by tables, as i can see the m eating the same things we had ordered.
great food experience
went with some chinese friends and according to them the food was proper cantonese. lots of interesting options, don't miss the spicy duck tongues!
for a restaurant in chinatown, the servers are efficient and polite. the best part is you don't feel rushed dining here. it is our go to place for dim sum in london!
lovely restaurant good food friendly staff. most recommended. few minutes wait to be seated
the best peking duck i ever had
not terrible but just overpriced, no choice with a tip as a surcharge is added to the bill. there are much better places to go in chinatown
two words, "dim" and "sum". loved it. i recommend coming there before 1 o'clock. 12:30 seems optimal.
fun and lively place.authentic chinatown flavour.
food excellent, pleasant surroundings, trouble communicating with staff on order

we have been here several times. the first time we loved the food although the service left a lot to be desired. visited again and despite the great food, we won't be going back. the wait staff are so rude. drinks orders had to be requested 3 times and we were made to feel like an inconvenience. not good.
great cantonese food and friendly service

christmas and they are charging more than double, which is only acceptable is the food is edible. however, that is not the case! loom at the egg fried rice! and the fried beef noodle, it's tasteless! what more? 45 minutes wait for this kind of quality.
good food and very reasonable pricing
great food, good staff and even the toilets are clean. the food was great, i recommend the hot fried squid.
great food great service
very quick service, tasty food
excellent food and drinks
cannot say how this place is so good  greatvalue for money   great staff and good service
marvellous authentic chinese cuisine.  my chinese friend recommended it and i wasn't disappointed.
i loved her against reason, against promise, against peace, against hope, against happiness, against all discouragement that could be.
great meal service super quick
very good dim sum, and great value for money!real deal ;-)
your trash at fortnite  stop shark fin soup or you will lose all your v bucks  and all your skins
decent food at decent prices
fabulous food and service would definitely go again
amazing food, quick service me and my partner loved every second
very good lunch. dim sum and other food. enjoyed the family meal.
great food , quick service! bit pricey though.
nice dim sum choice, always busy, price is above usual.
delicious food good service
we had dim sum lunch and the selection was generous. the orders were quick to be served despite having overwhelming customers. be sure to ask for the chili oil as it complete the flavors.
great service and a huge variety of dim sum
lovely food, swift service
food was amazing, however they did not give me the dessert menu at the end, they just handed me the bill-may i mention that the restaurant wasnt busy and so there was no need to rush us out
this is an honest say that the staffs are liar and rude, food container was dirty and food is expensive and not good.

i normally go here every weekend, wont be doing so anymore. they wouldnt seat us because 1 person in our party was 5mins away. but they let a different party to be seated without their full party being present... (they may not have known i could speak chinese and understood what they were saying to the other party).
had great expectations, but was let down with the quality and price of the food. that was during the evening service. been told the lunch service with dim sum is much better.
id say that i had a great time here! some dishes i ordered twice because they are tasty. it normally crowded at noon but the service is fast.

food is good but you won't find good service here. it can take forever to get someone's attention. not very friendly either, you never feel welcomed here. decor is amazing though, very beautiful and a lovely fish tank.
very friendly customer service. dim sum excellent. love the roast duck. manager do not smile a lot but very attentive. some waiters need to be more attentive but overall they are very good.

extremely rude staff that try to intimidate you, especially if you are caucasian. impossible to have an adult conversation with any of them, also served diced mushroom instead of diced duck. horrible service, avoid avoid avoid!
great dim sum. service is functional.
excellent chinese food in london! loved it!
delicious meal however watch out for 10% service charge! didn't see it mentioned anywhere!!
food is good, but a bit touristy...
love the food! good dimsum. free parking. pretty busy on sundays for dimsum.
best chinese cuisine in london

got a table really quickly despite the length of the queue. bit disappointed with the food for the prices. maybe we should have expected the tourist trap as there are far better restaurants at lower prices away from here
good dim sum

just had v nice dimsum with family at this place. service was efficient and food hot. would recommend lobster noodles and seaweed wrapped king prawns. for the adventurous try the stewed ducks tongue! reasonable prices for chinatown.
dont eat chilli dry chicken.
enjoyed food, service good as are the prices.
excellent food. all round very good. about 23 a head for set menu. lots of food for your money.
food is amazing and service is good. waiters/waitresses are very friendly
quality food, friendly staff.busy place but remains chilled.also worth noting tables are not too packed like you can find in other restaurants.
absolutely amazing food! we always go to this one. great and friendly staff too. 5
dim sim didn't disappoint, good portion sizes and food was hot
if you like chinese you will love this place. you might have to wait, depending on time and day of visit, but worth it
food very average and not worth the high prices
great service and food at reasonable prices, thoroughly enjoyed our chinese new year celebration. also! great vegetarian and vegan options which are fairly priced!

once and never again. the food is very expensive with low quality. hidden prices like rice for a menu, which was not included and also the 10% fee added up to the charge.plus the service was very unfriendly.not recommended!

rudest staff ever. took our order whilst staring at us the whole time with the nastiest look on her face taking out her note pad with such effort only to be told that my friend and i's order wasn't enough? she then said 'bye then see you next time'. such a beautiful restaurant with such tragic personalities.
amazing food very busy staff could be friendlier
really good dim sum and a lot to choose from.  it does get very busy, but there are plenty of staff and service is quick.
very tasty food. very nice place
probably best, chinese dim sum restaurant in west end china town!
in rather a hurry to hustle us out, food ok, not especially good.
food is tasty, though a bit on the expensive side.
really, really bad place. avoid at any cost. rude staff,  bad food, horrible service, high price. this is all you need to know about this restaurant.
nice decor, good air con. din sum was ok, good selection

the man at the door was a miserable bugger, the waiters were all solemn faced, pretty much sums up this place and it's food. i ordered crispy chilli beef, whatever the meat was that turned up certainly was not beef and it was absolutely stone cold. i left here just as hungry as i came in. disgusting

this is my favourite chinese restaurant in chinatown. the interior design is very nice and new. the food choice is great. the lai wong bao here is better than other places for some reason. i always go here if i want chinese food in central london.
pretty good but also pretty pricey.
third xmas meal brill every time.
delicious food and great service.

i had dim sim here recently and the food was nice. the dishes range from 3.5-6.00 and there's a lot of dim sum to choose from. the service was a bit rushed but the atmosphere of the place was pleasant. i would eat here again, however there are a lot of places to choose from in chinatown which are just as good.
decent dim sum so cannot complain. just don't expect a brilliant customer service - typical chinese service as you'd expect!
an authentic hong kong yum cha palace in soho.  all the food was excellent, the service was fast and friendly.  if they had packed the doggy-bag for us they would have got the 5th star.
overpriced and not worth the money. service and food was not very good overall.

the golden phoenix provides authentic chinese cuisine in an atmosphere that is not cramped, and a cut above most of the other restaurants in the area. you may have to pay a small premium per dish over others prices, but in my view, it is well worth it for the comfort and quality.
scrumptious food

i popped in here on chinese new year. to be fair this place is geared to turning over alot of people. we didn't book but managed to get a balcony table after a couple of minutes. the food was nice but i have had better take aways. however it's a great location in chinatown
large well decorated restaurant right in the centre of chinatown. tables are well laid out meaning not cramped on your table. food is reasonably priced and over all very good.
noodles weren't crispy, food overly salty. service was chinatown standard.
dim sum can be nice but dinner is a bit too salty and pricey....dinner is dim!
lovely food,  service could have  been better!
good food but pricey.
service is very slow. once we ordered our chicken serviced cold, send it back and once again t arrived cold. really would not recommend eating here the staff are always in a hurry.
do not go. the food is awful and the staff is basically angry that you walked in. this was a big mistake. do not make it as well.
fast reliable , quite good shanghai soup dumplings.
good food but expensive
i would recommend this over most other restaurants in china town
good food and atmosphere.

absolutely awful response to our daughter's allergy.  waited until after sending tea order before listening that we had a nut allergy.  refused to serve her and then charged 8 for the unconsumed tea.  we were embarrassed and forced to leave.  never seen that before.  how mortifying!
very nice and friendly staff. food was nice. didn't have to wait long for food. overall a nice experience for our first time in china town
expensive and rushed service. food was ok but nothing out of the ordinary
is this authentic cantonese or not? i couldn't tell, but the number of locals eating in was encouraging. very efficient personnel and very nice food. not expensive at all.
best duck ive had, and cheap
wow fantastic place to eat food is  yummy  prices very good staff friendly, clean
amazing food
expensive . fast service . but much like a canteen ! food not bad
good food, not as cramped as the other restaurants in china town
dim sum s ok.

unfortunately, i really cannot recommend this place. what we had was not good, for example,  my dish hat a boiling hot broccoli and cold peas in it. most disappointing was the service, all of them appeared annoyed we asked something, even suggestions on how to combine sides with some main dishes. we felt totally underappreciated
good food but like so many places in chinatown these days not cheap due to the increasingly high punitive rents charged by commercial landlords in the area and the punitive business rates.
preferred restaurant for the chinese community. excellent service and great tasting food. lovely
had a very good meal here busy but not annoyingly so reasonable pricing for london
good foods and services ....
its was excellent quality. the best chinese food i tried in uk

let's start with entrance it is not easy if you have a pushchair or a wheelchair to get into the restaurant. staff looks a bit serious maybe becuase they are so busy . menu doesn't have any picture so for who doesn't know about the chinese food is very hard to choose. food quality is above-average.

worst experience. we have ordered sweet and sour chicken and we got half chicken half beef. the soup i ordered and the noodle chicken was tasteless. i would have paid only 3 pounds for it but unfortunately real price was 32 pounds for 2 main dishes and 1 soup.
this place does/did sell shark fin soup, it can kill you because of the heavy metals
great service. excellent food
amazing!! great dim sum. lots of choices.
nice enough place for the price. wouldn't recommend the lemon chicken and in general the dishes were quite sweet.
very busy but good food
the food was okay,  i've had better. check your bill as they tried to charge us for a glass of wine we didn't have
the food was average but the bill came to 120 for a few prawns and spring rolls. i actually couldn't believe it !!
large and in the heart of china town. has a good selection of dim sum plus the usual staples. probably somewhere you'd only go as a tourist, but a reasonable find.
probably my favourite in china town
lovely meal

all though the lobster in spring onions was vey tasty the rest of the meal not very good. duck in blackbean sauce too oily and fatty  the chicken in lemon sauce was dry and was not fresh. very disappointing. they did change it for me to something different. very expensive poor quality food
rude staff.
been here a few times. had some good food but last couple of times service has been poor. items just did not arrive. even when chased they still did not arrive.
good place for dim sum and excellent chinese food
average food, over priced, poor service and awful crowd. avoid.
love the dim sum
great dumplings, good price, and big enough portions to share food
very tasty popcorn chicken. had seaweed and cheese powders.
must eat food when in london.. love it!
the best bubble tea in town.

love it! i recommend the popcorn chicken and fried sea food. you can choose your own seasoning on it. really good taiwanese snack place. queue can be long at times. the chips were disappointing though.
love this place so much, the plum powder on the popcorn chicken is one of the best. don't get me started on the chicken slab, simply amazing and worth the price
i tried the popcorn chicken and the fried chicken.  i let them pick which seasoning.  a combination of tomato, cheese, and garlic on one was excellent.  it was very busy, but fast service.
most of the chicken taste good but would not recommend the large drumsticks; they are quite bland once the skin comes off.
be careful of the chicken breast. i took a hard bite and some burning oil went up my right nostril which left me crying for 2 minutes. otherwise good tasty chicken with a wide selection of seasoning.
terrible work condition but great chicken.
so tasty! bit of a wait but you get a good portion for the price. will definitely be coming back.
delicious chicken, not greasy, very tender and juicy. also i had the taro cold tea with boba and it was delcious !
the popcorn chicken is great

the chicken meat itself is disgusting, i cannot pinpoint the pungent smell.. the thigh tastes like innards and overpowers the fried crust. i shudder to think where they source but the price is daylight robbery for such poor meat.
their fried chicken is perfect!
the crispiest chicken i've ever had

amazing chicken! the different selection of deep fried chicken or seafood coupled together with the different sprinkles options you can get make this place a must go for chicken lovers.look out for the sweet potatoes...they're huge!!!!
very tasty good selection
one of the best chicken popcorn ive had, great money for value and made on the spot. perhaps a little less salt seasoning for me next time.
good fried chicken, nothing else to say but you must try it.

it was okay but ive heard a lot of rave reviews that im not sure it warrants. i had the popcorn chicken, which was a bit dry. the seasoning powders were nice but i needed to ask for more as you need quite a bit for it to be flavoursome. i probably wouldnt bother going again.
good deep fried chicken with great seasoning options. busy but fast service
big piece of chicken and big pieces sweet potato. excellent herbs and spices selection. seating is limited.
properly good fried chicken. had the breast with plum and garlic seasoning.
really good chicken. theyre always busy and its made to order so may be a bit of a wait.
quick service and halal. nice to have halal place around china town
amazing portion sizes, with an array of flavours that can be added like curry and thai or just plain salt and pepper. was very hot when served. definitely recommended.
excellent chinese fried chicken. get the popcorn chicken and the chicken breast, plum or spicy numbing chilli seasoning. a killer dinner.
a different place to try
was hesitant at first due to the price but i didn't regret it. a really big slice of chicken seasoned however you like it. the chicken was very tender and juicy. i will order one again soon.

really enjoyed it, it lived up to my expectations! chicken was delicious and boba was great too. be warned, there are almost no seats, but i ordered popcorn chicken and didnt have any problems with standing :)

best fried chicken ever. the batter is the best, the chicken is also freshly fried. the seasonings are large in range which helps diversify flavour. the pricing is pretty good although it is increasing slowly. their bubble tea is also really nice, although i would not recommend the fruit teas compared to the milk teas.
popcorn chicken here is amazing. golden and crispy !
food fired chicken. slightly expensive. i recommend getting the plum seasoning on your chicken.
amazing juicy fried chicken. good portion size, many different seasoning to suit your taste. always find myself grab one when i pop into chinatown
loved their chicken popcorn, different seasoning available, and their volcanic chicken stuffed with cheese sinful and yummy

service was poor and chicken wasn't that great. really dry and packed full of msg. not really worth the money and didn't taste like the authentic version in taiwan. good for a first try but i wouldn't really go back.
it was basically unseasoned fried chicken with then some flavoured salt sprinkled on top; so the real winner here is the salt, some real good salt :)
just make sure you ask from the chicken skins to be extra crispy

amazing value for money and a good selection of taiwanese fried chicken. my only problem is that they oversalted our food massively (but the salt is only added at the end, so you can always ask for less)
love the chicken, that's all i have to say, its always so busy which is a good sign for a place to eat. always go whenever i'm in the area

my favourite fried chicken shop in the capital. tasty taiwanese, popcorn chicken is awesome, forget the stuff you get in kfc. plum and chilli seasoning gets those taste buds wanting more. only negative is the lack of seating and tired interior.
the fried chicken is nice but wont recommend the lotus root.

i love the popcorn chicken here.  nice blend of chicken and crust.  i ended up stopping by three times during my trip.  their boba is kinda bland but the tea was good.  overall, try the popcorn chicken.  its awesome.

this place is amazing!went into here after a night out near china town and wondered in. the food quality is very very good and you get to choose youre seasonings. staff was also very friendly and helped as i was unsure about what to get.
amazing popcorn chicken, fresh fried and then a choice of like 10 different flavoured powders to sprinkle on. very crispy and good fried chicken and good value for money!
the fried chicken breast is the best with spices along with bubble tea. best combo ever !

amazing chicken with a variety of seasoning. a little bit costly but totally worth it. my boyfriend won't stop talking about going back to the place. they have a bunch of fried options like chicken (obviously), tofu, veggies, potatoes, chicken skin, etc.

taiwanese style fried chicken with flavour shakers. it's good and i think lately they've been adding to the menu to give it some return custom value. it's good if you wanna try some taiwanese chicken.
tasty fried chicken but service always very slow!

awesome fried chicken. had the popcorn which is a good sized portion which small pieces of fried chicken dusted in a seasoning of your choice. plenty other options on the menu which looked good too. to try next time. good quick bite spot in chinatown

oh my gosh! we went there last sunday and bought two boneless breast fried chicken! they were unbelievably delicious  i didnt take any pictures cause they were too good  loads of powdered flavours to choose from and they are halal!
having been a loyal customer here for years. never been disappointed. always friendly staff and generous portion. perfect bit size fried snacks and bubble teas. highly recommended!

this chicken was delicious! it was juicy and crispy and a generous serving - theres two pieces in the bag. i also like that you can add any of the seasonings - i got chilli and seaweed which were so good!(nb: minimum 10 for card payments)
very good fried chicken, some options can be a bit dry. flavourings are amazing bit service can be a bit...brusque. still, if you're after a quick snack, you'll be more than satisfied here
good simple taiwanese fried chicken. perfect for a bite on the ho. have varieties of flavoured powders to choose from. price is also reasonable.

good portion for 8 in central considering is a non traditional fried chicken place right in soho. nice batter, no sauces available but a lot of different seasonings. good for a snack after partying or a casual quick lunch. bubble tea was pretty good too.

we were walking past and were drawn in by the lotus stem crisps on display - it did not disappoint! i've never eaten lotus stem crisps before and these were simply delectable. you are given an option of 10 different seasonings, i went with the garlic and thai seasoning. absolutely yummy- cant wait to go back.

really good decent fried chicken, would definitely recommend. got the popcorn chicken (a massive bag full) and bubble tea for 9 - you can choose your seasonings too once they fry the chicken. would definitely come back again. i would get this over any form of takeaway any day.
oof, really good fried chicken. lots of flavour shakers to add on top. everything is deep fried so it's not healthy but yeah, really tasty...
great crispy squid. this is take out only though so be warned. fast service and flavoursome food.
longest wait for popcorn chicken!!! waited for 20 minutes... popcorn chicken was good but staff is rude! no place to sit and eat. only take away.
never had it before but would go again. had chicken fillets with seaweed and loved it. don't be put off by the queues as service is very quick if somewhat chaotic.

not quite up to taiwans standards but this is serviceable for london. would avoid coming here for the bubble tea, it does not appear to be top notchedit: popcorn chicken is good, chicken strips are not so good

a nice surprise in china town, london. just stick to ordering the fried chicken steak, no other pieces taste as good there say as a good popeye's chicken, but a good option for  trying a different assortment of sprinkled spice toppings to try on a fried chicken steak to go. surely, a must try in central london.
loved the chicken popcorn and the sauce, best when served hot, halal place in london
my fave little fried chicken shop in the uk. fairly cheap for london as well.

bought a boneless chicken thigh, which was lovely so went to buy some more. decided on popcorn chicken and they sneakily decided to give me chicken which had been sitting there quite a while and had gone cold. so i was quite disappointed the second time round unfortunately.
crispy chicken breast is good and the strawberry green tea is really nice!! win win.
great food, they need more space for people to eat in.
