tiny taiwanese fried chicken shop, which sells chicken, but it's oh so tasty. the deep fried chicken skin and the deep fried tofu are my faves but it's well worth taking the time to try everything out
very bad place.all food just deep fried .king prawn ,chicken strips.even chicken skin dump in flour.
good friends and good chicken. 5/5
yo, best chicken out there. korean chicken wise
the popcorn chicken is a hit. you get to choose the different seasoning from 5spice, plum, cheese, garlic and few more.

my favourite chicken place in london! it serves the best, juiciest chicken with a huge selection of seasoning. the fact that it's always busy is a sign of how amazing it is. can not recommend this place enough for delicious fresh fried chicken!
we had bubble waffles from here for pudding they were so good but very sweet and sickly could only just finish it and i like sweet things.
great fried chicken and tasty matcha bubble tea.
bubble tea can be improved, but popcorn chicken are very tasty
beautifully tasting succulent chicken and other goodies at good prices
quick fast food, really good fried chicken (best i've had), great other options (including the bubble tea). price is very acceptable for what you're getting.
fast food chicken taken up a notch with the plum seasoning!
pretty expensive. 5 for a bag of popcorn chicken? it wasnt even that great. for that price i can get a full delicious meal at kfc..... i must be missing something..

nah not that great as reviews would suggest. pricey as well. 10 not enough for a meal. chicken was different but really just breadcrumb chicken with flavours sprinkled on. wouldn't recommend as there are loads better places in the area

super excellent. there are some clueless reviewers here complaining about the chicken breast being big or not cut up for them. ignore them. if you like your chicken juicy and delicious and aren't snobby about eating without a fork and knife, this place is excellent.
absolutely disgusting. you should not eat here. the food is so delicious that nothing else will ever taste the same. should be banned.
tasty chicken and crunchy plum fries! i love that i can add flavour once cooked with different seasonings. definitely check it out if you are in the area. halal friendly.
delicious chicken - exceptionally crisp, tender inside and tasty flavours to choose from. really friendly and helpful service too
it speaks for itself. london needs more of this.
best breaded chicken breast in the world, seriously...
amazing popcorn chicken. good value
fresh milk tea is really awesome! no other bubble tea shop in china town can compete to good friend
so juicy, well spiced, tender, fresh! devine! yummy yummy yummy! thanks to my taiwanese friend who showed me this place.
juicy tasty authentic taiwanese fried finger foods!
super delicious fried chicken breast.
excellent fried chicken at a decent price.
lovely popcorn chicken
large portion, really flavourful, wasn't too spicy
great fried chicken. excellent service.
beautiful food and an array of choices
amazing fried chicken snack and very good prices. nothing like it in london.
taiwanese fried chicken. best fried chicken in london. taiwan number 1
great taiwanese fried chicken. good for a snack of the go.
who ever thought of "chicken bone".  great tastewould be 5-star if i could pay with card
great seasoning and breading on both the popcorn chicken the chicken breast fillet. you may have to wait a while for your order to come through though.
quality fried chicken. interesting toppings.
8.50 for tasty chicken breast and bubble tea. not bad for central london considering the tea could cost 4 quid alone elsewhere
i don't know how to describe how good this place is.
amazing fried chicken!,  unlike other places. also good bubble tea!
so addictive! chicken breast is to go for!
good after drink snacks.
nice steamed buns
pretty legit taiwanese fried chicken. you even get to choose your seasoning!
a bit costly but tasty fried chicken
really juicy chicken
it is really good place, and have really good food.just the bad thing is that is a small place and when they are a lot of people it is really crowded
food was tasty but front staff has this bad attitude (rude) comes from no where.
nice tasty chicken.
the best fried chicken takeout in central london. quick, cheap and sooo tasty.
the best fried chicken in london!
good taiwan style fried chicken. mediocre milk tea
delicious spicy chicken!
good fried chicken
good taste.
tasty, fast and affordable
this location is now closed, they have renamed and moved down the road to number 14.
solid crispy chicken
best fried chicken in town!
taiwanese food is awesome
best fried chicken
london best taiwanese fried chicken
chicken is very tender and cheap but for me lacking in a little flavour, which is a shame cos i had the big breast which was both soft and crispy.
just like in taiwan
yummy
nice home bites and snacks.
definitely one of the best chicken in my life!!
juicy fried chicken with reasonable price
superb chicken
super tasty fried chicken and squid!
below average chicken: not juicy, over cooked and far too greasy. stay clear of the quail eggs - they verged on the inedible.
it's fried chicken... it's good fried chicken.
really nice
best chicken shop in town
it can be more hygienic.
not really for me.but family seemed to think it was ok.
good food and quick service. pricey but that's a given for london...
best fried chicken in london!
the perfect taiwanese comfort found right here in london!
taiwanese snacks - almost tastes as good as it is back home.
super average.... but only one in london this convenient
good for a quick bite.
excellent
super basic but insanely good  - excellent!

taiwanese-style fried chicken is the best. the main attraction is essentially giant chicken schnitzels coated in a batter with plenty of umami.i also thoroughly recommend the popcorn chicken and deep fried chicken skin.

great taiwanese chicken! the chicken breast is extremly juicy, tender and fried to perfection. popcorn chicken is amazing aswell. the staff is friendly amd helpful. thr bubblr tea is great. the only minus is no toiletts and the seating area and floor was dirty.
i love you.... you complete me.
food so good and cheap - check it out
everything you'd hope for in a fried chicken place. cheap, crispy, juicy, and flavourful. very limited bar seating and no ambiance: take away.
just about the best fried chicken place in london. not the best but it's in the top 10...

good, fresh and succulent chicken with a variety of dry seasonings to take the flavours to the next level. there is plenty of choice and it is a better alternative to many other chicken pages nearby.i would recommend the cheesy volcano chicken.
great little stop off spot on the fringes of chinatown for a quick and fulfilling snack. go spicy for the best flavour!
super tasty fried chicken skin and popcorn - get it with chilli/wasabi and plum seasoning. i've had the squid once and it was a letdown.
value for money.

one for the best pieces of fried chicken i've ever had. we got the chicken nuggets and chicken drumsticks (2 pieces) and the portions were quite generous. they fry the squid and the chicken separately but do check. highly recommend checking this place out.

okay, so i didnt think fried chicken could get better but out how wrong. the selection of favourings turbo charge the taste and blow your mind. quick and tatsty. the staff have a great sense of humour too.

it's fine, i just don't get all the hype... the chicken could be juicier. the sweetish batter has a good crunch and it sets off nicely against the salt & pepper (and tons of msg).at 6 a piece you pay a novelty premium for fried chicken.
this place is halal. certificate displayed on the wall
decently priced and tasty, best fried chicken in china town. if you spend 10 or more in cash then you get to choose a free can of soda.
service is not great but the food is fast and tasty!
tasty chicken! don't order too much.
good quality of chicken. worth to try

it's okay, if you want to eat something quick and the bubble tea is actually quite good. i was expecting similar fried chicken that i've had had in taiwan, but it's just not nearly as good. the batter is flaky, the chicken isn't nice and moist, and the sweet potatoes weren't all cooked through and were simply in too big wedges.
loving the squid and prawns. plum chips too. can't speak for the chicken options they offer but they do tasty tasty fast food
i was born and raised in china, but i have to admit that i had the best fried chicken here in london.  very authentic taiwan fried chicken.  i'm so gonna miss it when i'm back to china.
a bit expensive for what it is
chicken breast crispy hot and fresh? check!bubble tea cool and refreshing? check!i recommend going again. staff is friendly and service is quick.
very tasty fried chicken indeed

the chicken breast is really tasty and not at all greasy. i also bought the drumsticks but the chicken breast is really the star of the show. it is on the pricey side but it is located in central london.i would definitely come back here again.
best fried chicken. try the different flavours.

fried and seasoned. i bought the deep fried squid and it was great, the squid was very soft to eat and it tasted great. i tried my friends popcorn chicken which was equally as tasty. the prices are okay considering the shop is in london.
absolutely delicious!
best chicken ever !
fried tofu is soo good. reccomended.  large portions and cheap.
my favorite place to grab a bite in central
good but not outstanding fried chicken place with a plethora of spice options. represents decent value for money. don't expect a seat - it's very cramped and best suited for takeaway.
barebone taiwanese fried chicken place. unfancy and delicious if you know what to expect.
how chicken shops should be.
amazing fried chicken. i had mine with plum and chilli coatings. perfectly crisp and grease free
really good fried chicken. get the xxl one. volcano cheese was good but a bit too chunky.
really good value for money, portions were pretty big. really tasty as well. best fried chicken we have had in a while!
whenever i'm in the area, i always try to see my good friend.
one of the best bubble tea i have ever had. they sell various tasty snacks too.
yummy fried chickenthe milk tea is also good. i also like the fried sweet potato.
very tasty food.
the best fried chicken you will ever put on your mouth..... forget kentucky,  taiwan is the place for the most amazing chicken!
crispy batter, juicy and flavourful fried chicken! :) only downside is the limited space and seating.
poor...very poor service...the staff is so rude and aggressive
you have to go here to fond out how much you actually like eating fried chicken skin.
i loved the crispy tofu but they need more vegan options.
i ordered the popcorn chicken and the supreme boneless chicken, the first was amazing but the later was not as flavourful.
love filthy fried chicken! one of the best!
quality fried chicken, the squid is tasty too
never leave chinatown without devouring their chicken fried goods! love this place. yummy, generous portion of chicken.
the drumsticks we're too salty. prawns and quail eggs we're good. go for the spicy flavored salt!
delicious chicken, but pricey.
my girl just told me that i liked it. so, five stars
lovely spot for a tasty chicken to go. i was happy to see a local alternative to kfc and this one does the job.
love chicken skin.

the chicken wings are great! get them. the squid is also delicious. the signature "30cm" chicken breast is actually kind of dry and not that great. that's why they lose a star. get extra cheesy powder that's the best one.
absolutely love this place. it is the place to go for taiwanese fried chicken in london - the highlights are the 6.50 deep fried chicken breast and the 3.90 popcorn chicken.

delicious fried to order chicken! they have a great and simple menu with a bunch of different flavour toppings for the chicken, my favourites include their pepper and curry seasonings. they also do super yummy sweet potatoe fries.
good place to eat nice food
taiwanese snack, deep fried small pieces of chicken with various topping/sauce options. nothing extraordinary
authentic taiwanese style fried chicken.
very expensive with mediocre food.
the fried chicken breasts are great.
try their fried tofu
customer service was good and the place looked ok. decent variety to choose from. the chicken however wasn't very pleasant; tasted rather off.
lovely staff and amazing food. i often crave the fried sweet potato from there. the bubble tea is really good as well. cute small place!
great crispy chicken. it is good just because it is the most easily available one in central london-if you understand what i mean.

if you do come here for anything, try the volcanic cheesy chicken. its expensive (like the rest of the chicken) and takes a while to prepare but the oozing, molten cheese is amazing inside the juicy, crispy chicken. ive yet to try their bubble tea but friends have recommended it.
delicious chicken. you can see they make it from fresh chicken, not frozen one!
the quality of the chicken is rubbish. the chicken tastes likes it's gone off.
fried chicken, bubble tea what's not to like!?! i have to go again to try out the different sauces/flavours! :-)
one of the best fried chicken place in london. perfect for a quick bite
took 4-6 to get your order done. the fried squid with seaweed flavor is delicious walaupun kurang mecin :))
great taiwanese fried snacks.  loved the fried chicken strips and fried prawn!
so damn good!
good fried chicken!
by far the best fried anything! the popcorn chicken and crispy squid are delicious! i recommend having your food sprinkled with the seaweed and plum seasonings - yum!
nice chicken, very large portion's for the price. must try!.

yummy, finally found my way here, had chicken wings, prawns and plum chips. all good, just enough between two. staff friendly despite what other reviews have said. pitched up on a stool and chatted whilst eating. i'll be back!
popcorn chicken, i love you as much as a man can love fried chicken. 10 minimum spend for card is a bit annoying. at least put a sign up.

look, i am not proud of my fried chicken love but you know in the name of research i had to go here. simple and delicious is the way i would put it. get a flattened chicken breast that is delightfully coated and crispy thanks to the cooking and choose what salt you want et voila! 6 for some delicious fried chicken? i'll take that.
plum seasoning on all the chicken and chips plz
addictive and delicious juicy chickens
great fried chicken, with wide range of available spices

the fried chicken is amazing! flattened chicken breast so succulent and freshly fried when ordered! flavour powders are used to enhance your chicken experience even further with my favourite combination of : cheese, chilli, and salt and pepper!
lotus root chips are genius
quite like this place, but expensive for what it is. also, they don't take cards for a spend less than 10 which is quite inconvenient
unbelievably yummy chicken. plum fries were an unexpected pleasure.
very nice fried chicken. very juicy. i would say it's better than kfc

visited this hidden jam for the first time, i had the calamari and my husband had the chicken, loads of seasonings to choose from, delicious and crispy, look forward to going there when i'm next in the area.
really tasty chicken, generous portions, ramshackle setting. a good find in a hit and miss part of town. would really recommend the popcorn chicken.
seriously good!
incredible chicken paired with amazing taste powder
the fried chicken breast is my favourite especially with chilli powder, also recommend plum powder or seaweed powder for those who cant eat spicy!
gem
orgasmic chicken.
bubble tea
good selection of chinese books. convenient pick up from online purchase. good service.
lot of chinese books. but a lot of them are out-dated.
great bookstore if your learning chinese they have everything you'll ever need
amazing shop, amazing staff!!

lovely little shop with great books in chinese and for learning the language. some  other typical chinese things can also be bought! lovely person who i guess owns the shop! genuinely interested and a warm person!!! will visit every time i go to london from now on! !!
lovely little chinese bookstore. i was looking for chinese painting instruction booklets and found them to have a nice range. the staff were friendly and helpful.

i was looking for chinese books to read to my 4 year old daughter. this shop has a great mix of translated european classics (pinocchio, wizard of oz) and classic chinese stories (monkey king etc.). i walked 45 minutes to get there, and ot was definitely worth it!
good calligraphy supplies
wonderful painting courses available!
amazing selection of learning materials, chinese books and other interesting
great little bookstore and centre for chinese arts an culture.
great for chinese exercise books particularly for non-chinese speaking students learning mandarin.
this nice chinese book store / art shop has moved to 123 shaftesbury avenue. they also do occasional art and calligraphy classes.
very helpful and professional
great shop for all your hanzi learning needs
very nice selection of chinese literature and oriental art materials.
very average food.
pricy but the.quality of food is exceptionally good. the broth we ordered is excellent

i have always eaten asian food but this is the best restaurant ive ever tasted in my life! everything was delicious, i dont know how i will deal with the fact that this restaurant is not in my country!

staff is fast and nice (of course its a thai restaurant!). they provide to get you a table asap if the restaurant is busy. food is delicious, i get the traditional chicken pad thai, spring rolls and their cold tea for a total of 23 pounds. highly recommended i will come again
incredible hot pot experience, you cook your own food and there are plenty of fresh ingredient and sauce options. the broths are amazing!

if you are vegan/vegetarian do not go here. they don't have a separate vegan menu as it says on the website or on their menus. when we asked them what was vegan they assured us that they could make a vegetarian dish vegan. however, their vegetarian (labelled) curry they advised had fish sauce in. obviously they have no clue. avoid.
not worth the hype. especially if you want to try some other things than the hot pot dish
excellent food and great service. food served quick and fresh. the restaurant is very clean.
highly recommend the hotpot - 2 compartments. the kimchi broth and mushroom broths are gorgeous
fresh ingredients love the hot pot! green curry also very good.
authentic thai food, good taste and value for money. and easy dishes for quick lunch. all in all surely returnable place for fantastic thai food lover.
best thai coffee around the area, i will definitely recommend.
the best food i have had for some time now. very authentic thai taste and a reminder of the thai street food we ate. we were recommended by friends and it was the best! thankful..

a hidden gem in soho, amazing home cooked thai chinese food served. interiors are much cleaner than what you expect from a china town restaurant!! and prices very affordable. i will recommend this to my colleagues at work!
food was great and tastes authentic. the hot pot broth was better than i've had in malaysia.
amazing and our favourite hot pot in town!
a great choice of restaurant on a busy day, thai food was great and service was also!
highly recommend !amazing. a few of us dropped in late on a saturday and luckily they had space.  a good spicy kick too. the staff were lovely too. everyone i was with loved the food too.
good lunchtime fixed menu. highly recommend the hot tapas dishes.
very good thai food in china town, big portion and price inexpensive.
nice, fast that food. good but not awesome

the hot pot is very delicious, ingredients are served fresh. we tried the best tom yum we ever had, the green curry also tasted very authentic. it is a thai restaurant but hot pot is chinese/thai taste.

good quality hotpot but can be a little pricey. you have the choice of two soup bases. meats are high quality compared to many other places i've been to in london. expect to pay between 20-30 on food.

the food here is so delicious that it's my third visit here. my kids really enjoyed the food as well(do try the green cury it's so tasty ) we were served by alroy, i must say his service was exceptional as he was able to explain the menu so well. the staff was very welcoming and the food is fresh. must try this place at least once!!
the food was way too oily for me. and personally think they went overboard with their service. get back to me when your food is as good as your service.
very very friendly staff but the food is pretty basic. i did not try their speciality the 'hot pot' though.
lovely restaurant and romantic booth seats upstairs! delicious hot pot and thai food.
this is my favourite thai restaurant in london. delicious and good price.
had an excellent meal here, the food was just amazing and they were so busy-they seemed a bit understaffed. nevertheless it was delicious. taste like thailand.
amazing experience, very authentic. we have had hot pot in taiwan and this was a very similar experience and taste.
the biggest hot pot i have ever seen. tasty food, but a bit pricey - soho - tourists etc.
had an amazing lunch here with my gf. that's what we love about china town you find these great eateries by chance.
traditional hot pot. the ambiance is not amazing for the price.
amazing tom yum soup and mala flavour is authentic. good combination food recommend to try it.

we will never go back there. the amount of food was very little, the waiter has forgotted some plate and gave us a wrong one. he even made us waited 40 minutes to give us the right one and poorly apologised. the waiter clearly didn't care. a very terrible experience..
therere varieties of soup! really delicious shabu  ever.
the best food here, thai food is delicious loved the pad thai and the hot pot soups is very fresh with all ingredients! will be back here soon.

great dinning experience. good food and expansive selection, reasonable prices for central london. the staff are really friendly and there are plenty of guides on how the concept works if you have never had a hot pot before.
went here with my wife: was recommended by a few friends to try their thai food and was fascinated. prices was good for value but the food blew us away- excellent food will be back!

visited hot pot with my gf on monday night been wanting to try this restaurant for a while now- the restaurant was very busy. food was great, service was on point. we really enjoyed the thai food here. we saw the restaurant has great reviews so decided to check it out and saw it from instagram.
celebrated my birthday here as a surprise from my husband. just amazing service and delicious food.
food was very good, make me miss home food!
delicious food and good service

much better than i expected. tried the hot pot for the first time but we were unsure whether if we should try the a la carte dishes but the hot pot chicken broth was very tasty, my friends also loved the mushroom one.
nice food, pleasant experience
amazing food, very good value! big portions. pad thai was the best i've had!
hands down the best hot pot in london! the collagen soup is the perfect dish on a cold daymore pics on instagram: @rozarioemma
we had the pad thai and the cashew and chicken- delicious and no long wait as per some reviewers. we would return
everything taste just amazing

the food was less than satisfactory.  the amount was tiny.  we ordered the veg option and we got exactly three tiny cubes of tofu,  one floret of broccoli,  one leaf of pak choi and half a carrot.  all of this amazing experience for central london prices. only go if you want to starve.

i would say hot pot london offers the best quality of ingredients with varieties of broths compare to other hotpot restaurants i have been to. staffs are friendly and provide exceptional service. also you can't miss those authentic mango sticky rice and pandan pancakes as desserts to boost your dining experience there.

the food was lovely but the service was quite bad. we came on a tuesday night and the restaurant wasn't particularly busy but it took so long for the food to come and we had to keep reminding them that our food had not arrived yet. they forgot our vegetable too.
wide range of soup and tasty hotpot sauce
very nice thai food.
slow slow slow/ no staff. underalcoholed drinks and chaos. quite tasty food, but wouldn't go back.
not great. waitress never smiled once. waiter had dirty fingernails. average food costing quite a lot. 12% surprise service charge also added in the end.
good quality hotpot with a choice of broth/soup bases. vegetables were very fresh - enjoyed it thoroughly. excellent service.
staff were among the friendliest of all restaurants in central london. food tasted fresh and presented well. felt like dining in another country!

we liked everything on this place. elegant decor, with nice atmosphere; attentive and pleasant staff, and fresh food full of taste. we didn't try this time the hot-pot but would like to on next occasion. being in central london the price seemed reasonable considering overall value. thank you guys at the restaurant.
great quality food, and lovely waiters/waitresses
service not that great had to ask to order  , for cutlery  not asked if we wanted more drinks but food was good.
great food, great service, excellent experience!
yummy food. thai food. chinese food in china town. very good price not expensive.
premium quality meat at an affordable price. great location, only a short walk from the nearest tube. fantastic service. variety of sauce available for selection
excellent food, first time trying hotpot was delicious. ingredients fresh, staff were nice.
the best thai food, atmosphere is vibrant with all the hot pots steaming up!
price very nice. pad thai and red curry was excellent.
my third time in 2 weeks!! excellent thai food and service.

had a real decent meal. service was a little slow although it was saturday evening so can't complain too much and the veg broth was a tad bland but the tom yum broth more than made up for it as it was absolutely fantastic. great selection of sides and sauces as well
good food, but poor service.
food very nice, tom yum and collagen soup i recommend! service was average to good, but the food fresh.
great traditional chinese hot pot experience we chose a split pot with chicken and mushroom stock with veg and meat platter  plenty of food for 3 people. good  service and very attentive staff
we will be back soon. authentic hot pot amazing for the cold weather especially when you have a cold!
very good service and food. my recommendation.
the tom yum soup is authentic!! just like in bangkok, had the chicken green curry also tastes real. a great local restaurant.
had a quick dinner here trying their thai food and the pad thai was the best we have had ever! will recommend!
great service! food was great. would suggest the curry broth.
decent service. hot pot is nice but waaaay too expensive for the portion size, they were tiny!
delicious food. price is cheap for london.  excellent thai green curry.
first time visiting here. and definitely will come back again and recomend to my friends. excellent service, super yummy food, and nice ambient
thai food was fantastic staffs very helpful.
love the ambience of the restaurant.the soup base was good  the staff will not hesitate to assist us with the topping up of the soup.service level  very friendly service rendered
we enjoyed our meal (thai dishes) and the fresh juices, which were delicious and beautifuly served.
we left after waiting for our food for an hour and 15 minutes, ruined our lunar new year

i am an avid fan of hotpot chinese cuisine, having visited many restaurants in chinatown over the years, this restaurant has topped my list. the food is outstandingly fresh and service is attentive and personal. would definitely come back again cheers!!
great food good service. and food is quite cheap. here the second time now.
loved it all. great food, great service...
excellent food, halal offerings are available also.
one of the best hotpot in london! i love the spicy mala soup and chicken soup. they were able to satisfy my taste buds. nice experience cooking and dipping in the various sauces
food was ok to good. service is slow.

ive been here twice and both times have been a really nice experience for me and my friends. excellent service and the food were really yummy! i highly recommend the pineapple fried rice. we loved the atmosphere, it was like we had gone back in time! would definitely come again :)

amazing thai street food, very authentic and the best i've been to in london. i've been twice and is impressed by every single dish. highly recommend and hope that the quality doesn't drop because otherwise i'll have nowhere else to go!

our pork platter looks a lot less than 2 other customer's platter. also, menu makes it sound like the restaurant donates 10p to charity, but it's a forced donation added ontop of customer bill. waitess did not tell us about the sauces.
excellent place! great food, awesome service, can order songs and have fake birthday!
this restaurant has the best of both worlds serving hot pot and super delicious thai food!!  my new favourite thai spot in london. i will be back for the hot pot next weekend.
the best claypot noodles. my new favourite restaurant in china town. food taste like thai people cook. tom yum hot pot also delicious.
the food was awesome . very yummy homemade broths. the waiter was very helpful with ordering and provide excellent and enthusiastic services during my dining. highly recommended !
rubbish service and rubbish meal, no taste. save your money and go elsewhere
amazing curries and pad thai was delicious. quick and easy lunch done.
food was delicious, but service a bit slow. will come back but hope they improve it. weve been to a lot of restaurants in china town but this one clean and food was really good.
good quality hotpot. lots of choice.

excellent food, tapas menu caters to entire family....they have started hot pot again... need to come back again for this... the selection looks extensive and moreover no need of standing in the queue for a table... antonio.. thank you for the amazing cocktail...

ordered meatlovers for 2. this is the place if you are hungry and a company. this was an overload of food we could have been 4persons for this. food was amazing, best part is mixing your own sauses. great service. my best recommendations

not many great hotpots in london, but i can't say the same for this place. the ingredients are fresh and the combination of different sauces as well as broths caters to multiple taste buds and cravings. staffs are kind and the service is exceptional. will definitely continue to dine there.
its our second time here. came back for the thai food which was amazing. probably the best thai food ive had in a long time.
great thai restaurant in london. fresh and quality. will come back to try the other food soon.
good thai hot pot. the sticky mango rice is highly recommended as a dessert. it usually gets busy late evening, so make sure that you book in advance if you don't want to wait.
good soup base especially japanese
just grabbed a quick lunch visiting chinatown, food is fast and good value. love the green curry.
very good hot pot place, soup bases are the best in london.
the best hotpot restaurant in london. fresh and great ingredients. also the service!i recommond you try mala soup! yummy
compare to number of hot pot restaurants that i tried in london for the past 2 years, this place has been far better - the fresh, clean and soup broths are excellent (i had tom yum and collagen)
amazing high quality food. the place is really cozy and nice and great for big companies and small. great service. def go there again!

the place used to be a great place for hot pot, the soup is original soup, and it was free for top up but not they charge for it. and the service is always up and down. its always difficult for a restaurant to remain good quality. the food now is less and not as better as last year.
only thai restaurant in china town. love the food a lot
this is the best and my favourite place to eat in china town the food is amazing and very affordable, friendly staff and comfortable seats. will be back soon!
i usually don't write reviews, but the food was fantastic, came here with my wife. the service good, the food probably the best asian food i've had. we will definitely be back soon!
i'm very glad i managed to book a table, amazing range of cocktails and dishes were nice and unique, not like what you would find in other thai restaurants.

one of the best thai restaurants we have been to. came here last night there was a very long queue and i can understand why. my fiance loves thai food and she was impressed by the quality - taste is authentic. we recommend the lamb shank massaman curry and the pad thai dishes. will return soon.

yummy food and nice decor. the food is very good and up to a high quality. the restaurants signature dish is the hot pot where you can cook your own food in broth. we tried hot pot for the first time and the waitress explained how to enjoy the dish very well. we had a great experience.
authentic thai hot pot experience
yum, love the food here, thank you for great service.
best hotpot in london. so impressed by the authenticity and freshness of every dish. staff were lovely. perfect place to go with friends and family!

nice seating and a novel induction ring set into each table where they give you broth to cook food yourself. looked great. we picked from the normal menu as we didn't have long before our theatre booking. the food was great and nicely presented. staff were efficient. prices were reasonable. i would recommend!
the staff are wonderful and polite and lovely and welcoming. the food was absolutely incredible. plenty of very creative combinations. so tasty!!! i fully recommend it.
terrible choice to move away from hotpot and into general dining... a real shame this place had the best hotpot in london... one day a week is just not enough.
great food, great vibes, bring great company. what more is there to ask? ive never written a review for a restaurant before, but figured this was worth giving 5 stars.go for the tom yum soup. ;)
the food is good but the portions are tiny. the service can be much better, ive been twice and both times meals arrived before the drinks, they forgot stuff, etc.
very nice location. typical thai food. we have to wait some time for table but also without reservation we get after.. 10 minutes. also great stuff, great restaurant!!!
the food is insanely good and the service is super friendly
messed up order and rude staff who refused to correct mistake
a hidden gem in soho. food is really delicious. if you like hot pot or asian food, that's your place. the pad thai is amazing. staff are friendly and polite. highly recommended.

it's my second time back here and the food is delicious, service could be better this time but overall was still good. but it is the food that is outstanding, its the best hot pot place for sure in uk. the mala soup is so spicy and better than in some in china. tom yum is my favourite one.

the food is nice, the service was waful and the prices are too high for what you get. small dishes. plain rice near the dish (why doesn't it come as part of the dish)?? is 3.5 gbpone dish was very hot although it was not marked as one.
fresh food and no msg in the soup.
very beautiful and comfortable restaurant in china town london. thai chinese food is great.
nice food and friendly staff but watch the bill small extras added at the end
amazing thai restaurant, dropped by here before the theatres with husband and the kids. we all enjoyed it a lot. will visit again when we are back in london.
i cant recommend this place enough. authentic thai flavoured dishes and service was lovely.
this place ia closed!!!!
unfortunately it was closed and the restaurant gutted.

delicious food, with impeccable service! stumbled upon hot pot restaurant by chance last night, it was super busy but the staff were very friendly and explained the menu to us and showed us how to eat. the price is good for the quality of food. the pad thai was also the best we have had ever.
nice food and service was good. we will recommend others to this place.
best hot pot restaurant in london and thai food. service is nice and taste authentic like home.
the best hot pot as soup is very good, the chicken one... also the ingredients are fresh. hot pot is one of my favourite we used to eat it a lot back at home. good way to live a healthy lifestyle.
pooor service!! it took more than an hour and the food still not coming, so we decided to cancel it!

what a stunning place! great service, delicious food and beautiful setting! i had the standard pad thai meal, and it was definitely the best ive ever had! loved it! i also loved the concept of the sauce and topping station - fantastic idea! really authentic place!

appalling service. well-intentioned, but a catastrophic evening - exceedingly slow, and forgetful. claims of being short staffed, but restaurant was not busy. food was actually alright, albeit meat for hot pot was sliced too thick. very unfortunate
a very wholesome meal! beautifully presented authentic thai food and amazing vibe to have lunch/dinner with friends!! would highly recommend to everyone craving hot pot!!!

firstly i must say that the food is amazing !! and the staff met all my requirements as im such a fussy eater.there was a manager on duty and she made sure that me and my party were catered for the whole time of our visit. i will definitely be returning as the food ,management & service was spot on and met all expectations.

hot pot's pretty awesome. me and the wife got a variety beef and the variety vegetable and it was way too much for us. also the spicy broth that they offer is way spicier than you might think. proceed with caution .

great food, and efficient service. thai food fresh as always. one of our favourite restaurants in china town. we have been here three times already. this time the food took a little longer, but the food was delicious so its fine.

excellent hotpot experience. price was okay but the quality of meats and seafood was fantastic. we had the beef lover platter, seafood platter, and vegetables platter. plenty of food for four people. we also chose the spicy and hot and sour broths. beware the spicy broth is incredibly spicy. service was great.
just amazing food. such great value. couldn't recommend it highly enough.
great food and service. we had sharing platter to start and then i had the chicken green curry for mains..... the curry texture was excellent! will definitely visit again
had a quick lunch there. the pad thai chicken is the best ive had in europe. it has a sweet but salty and fragrant taste which makes it taste authentic. will bring more friends here!

great food, very nice atmosphere, heart of chinatown in soho...only thing keeping it from getting a 5 star was the delay in my order...ordered spring rolls (easiest/quickest thing on the menu) and it never came...i even finished my main course
simply love the food
great selection of asian soup for hotpot.  enjoyed cocktials decent price

waiter ask me 4 times if i am alone....i had tom yum kung soup with prawns, very good but the bowl comes half empty... one minor think also is that the bolted down tables are so much against the wall that you can't move an inch !
great food but staff were too busy to give us prompt service
enjoyed the food, authentic thai. next time want to try the hot pot but didnt have time- the waiter said it would take at least 1-1.5 hours. looked amazing!
excellent food and service. highly recommend this thai restaurant in china town london.
great atmosphere, good service and gloriously delicious hot pot.
hotpot just like in my home country. best one in london for me. food was fast but staff can be a little more attentive.
great experience overall. id prefer if the restaurant were a bit cleaner, but hot pots are really good and staff were very friendly.

meats were frozen to the point of which the texture changed. service pretty much non existent, needed constant reminding.priced at a premium compared to the more local hotpot joints, which i recommend highly.
when they say hot. they mean hot! a really fun dinner out. lovely service. and they had a lovely dry rose on the wine list too. worth a trip....

this is one of the best hidden gems in china town. food is fresh and clean unlike other restaurants nearby. the staff are friendly and actually smile. i had the sirloin steak pad thai which was beautifully plated, while my partner had the chicken katsu pad thai. it was amazing.
frozen food, awful.

walked into this place by surprise because it looked the nicest out of other restaurants in china town, i loved the sushi sandwich. price was good. very impressed and i recommend, saw others eating some hot soup, but we didn't have time so will try next time!
first time to china town, blown away by the food here. portions are good size and great value. looks much cleaner than other restaurants around in china town.

fun place. also serves other thai dishes but we tried the hotpot. you choose your base broth and then a selection of vegetables, seafood and meat to cook. easy to do and kids love it too! staff are friendly and its a nice relaxed atmosphere

this place gives a lot of food for what you pay, its definitely worth it. had the couples special, loved the hot pot and it came with sushi. food was excellent, staff could be a bit more attentive but overall a great visit.
was recommended here by some of my friends. good food, great location! an amazing dining experience..
my boi sean liked the hot pots very much
excellent choice of thai food, also will try the thai hot pot upstairs.
service charge was stupid especially when they forgot half our orders, making us late for the theatre.drinks were ridiculously expensive again with the stupid service charge.

excellent and delicious restaurant, came here with my wife and kids for dinner. it does get busy very quickly so do make a booking. the pad thai was the best i ever had, my wife loved the chicken katsu curry. it's very affordable compared to other restaurants in china town. we will visit again soon! thanks.

great place to try out thai cuisine.... love the signature menu (hot pot) and the choice of fresh ingredients just makes the dining experience fantastic ...... great servers a bit over crowded at times.
my wife and i ate here on our way to the palace and were blown away. we loved the food and the excellent service. stop what you are doing and come to hot pot.
clean n fresh sea food here for a good tasty, top for soup n others menu, i really want to visit for the other time
good food, good service! very nice hot pot and thai food. love china town!

i went with a friend who is a regular customer there for years. so everyone was super nice and attentive. food was excellent and very exciting. drinks were yummy (lychee and rum? ). we loved the whole experience and the chrysanthemum tea was great!

amazing dinner, went today before watching the show. we are from san fran and have had a lot of hot pots but this one their ingredients are definitely the freshest and the broths were very tasty. keep it up!

friday night spent well in, before theatre show, it was getting quite busy but food was served quickly, service was good. we really loved the hot pot- the green curry broth with rice was amazing. the meat and vegetable was fresh. coming back for my husbands birthday.
excellent food, but service could be better. food came a bit slow but it was really tasty. we understand as it was a very busy night, all the tables were full.

read other reviews and understand why the feedback is good. the food is very tasty. the price is also very affordable. found out they are part of a thai based chain with more than 150 restaurants, so they know what they are doing! hope they open one near where we live in croydon.
i had much better thai food before. the ambience upstairs is good. i had much better thai cuisine when i've stayed in shanghai
high quality and fresh hot pot similar to what we tried in taiwan. service was also very good! staff were friendly.
mediocre food, expensive bill, wiping your table even as you're paying

the food was very below average and really overpriced. the belly pork was really fatty, there didn't seem to be any beef in the crispy beef, and the rice was cold. the crispy squid starter was the only good part. it came to 45 which is a massive rip-off for such low-quality food. will not be going back.
it was delicious!

good tasty food but i ate beijing duck that was suppose to be for two people alone and it still wasn't enough for me. the portions of duck could have been bigger and this is the only thing that brings down the one star.
we have seen the sign specialist of peking duck. but the roasted duck was not like the one of golden dragon. we want to try something els. service was oke only they have to improve there english.
friendly staff and great food! their dim sum and duck are both very nice. i have no idea how they got some of the bad reviews.
food was good and serving was nice. however tables are crowded. there is even a table under a bar

hubby and i were craving dim sum, but weren't able to go during the daylight hours.  we walked by this place after seeing a play and saw they had a late night dim sum menu with the main staples. everything we ordered was delicious, and service was quick and friendly! we will come back here the next time we visit london!

very rude waitress. told us to leave when we were still enjoying our tea after our meal (we paid 4 for the tea). she told us many people were waiting downstairs and we had to leave. when we went downstairs theres no queue, in fact theres no one waiting at all.
very good food, only missing szechuan duck ont he menu, otherwise perfect

food was amazing had starters mains and deserts and the custard dim sums blew us away, staff were friendly and very attentive will definitely be coming back when in london, coke was slighty expensive for my liking though all and all was a great visit and a lovely restaurant.
decent dim sum. very busy atmosphere. fun people watching and meeting strangers if you are up for that sort of thing.
average food, average service.
amazing.
good food.
nice chinese!
very good chinese restaurant

we really enjoyed the food/meal that we had in the restaurant but found the service appalling. staff we too quick to try to take away food not yet finished & bought out some of the meal far too quickly.
best duck ever!
excellent dim-sum!

meant to be the place to go for duck in chinatown. dont bother. we ordered half a roast duck which came out with gravy poured over it with the skin limp and just not edible. stir fried mixed vegetables were also bland and when i bit into a mushroom there was a hair attached to it.
ok, same as the rest of the chinese restaurants in town. have yet  to find one that's extra special aside from the one in nuneham courtney.

awful experience - very poor food, rude and argumentative staff. should have known better when i saw how filthy the kitchen was on the way to the loo and left straight away!lots of good restaurants nearby... avoid this one!
lovely restaurant, the duck & pork were fantastic, glad i stopped in
great food, good service, great atmosphere!! tried their duck, mixed meat egg noodles and coconut prawn soup(the last was out of this world), strongly recommended!!
great dim sums!
in a middle of the tourist mess of the london china town :)inexpensive. fast service.feels like 4*- or rather 3*+.but tastes more chinese. maybe because of only chinese ingredients used.
good food, friendly staff.
very tasty. nice experience to eat in chinatown.
their dim sum is really good
service and attitude are bad but still cost you 12% service charge.  food is cold. chicken is raw. coca cola is expensive cost 3.
tasty food, good value and service.
best handmade dim sum in london chinatown! good service and very tasty food. i will definitely be returning here
the roast duck is not very good,  some older bits mixed into the portion, and not cheap.

overrated. i've visited multiple chinatown restaurants across the globe, and was very excited to eat here. outside of the spicy pork dumplings, everything was disappointing. save yourself time and money, and go someplace else.

popped in here with a friend for dinner and ordered the crispy duck sharer menu. everything was freshly prepared and absolutely delicious. perfect crispy duck, sumptuous dim sum, and two meat dishes to finish. plenty of great food for a great price. absolutely recommend.
not worth the price plus they only give you one scallop which is ridiculous! waiter was rude also but the noodles were alright
the porridge / congee was good. we also had some vegetables/ seafood dimsums. my friend had the roast duck. maybe a bit pricey; for what it was.  food was delivered fast though
my most favourite chinese restaurant in china town. very good roasted duck, not too sweet sauce.
if u're ready to wait outside like 25min, come !food is great, and generous ! a bit expensive though
good value for central london. portion sizes are average. the meals themselves were generally quite tasty although nothing special.
decent food. liked the crispy duck and the dim sum. waiters are hectic.
good dim sums,  crispy duck and veggies.
delicious foods. my favourite place in china town
we had booked another restaurant before a comedy night but it was closed and needed to eat quick. walked into chinatown and found this gem, we had a set menu which was fantastic and good value.
mmmmm we got the crispy duck, it was amazing!!!! we got a bunch of other things too and it was all delicious. great service.

2 stars because the food was good. but with poor service, add stuff that you never ordered on your bill which they need a couple of tries to sort it out and then they force you to tip them without giving you any heads up before you order. i mean why would they care about good service if they force you to tip them anyway?
quite nice dim sum in london. soup dumplings were almost like the real thing, great flavor

used to like this place as it has good food and never too busy. now the service has gone really downhill to a point they are just plain rude to customers. in chinatown there are plenty of other places offering the same food with better service. i'll not be going to this place ever again
amazing crispy duck and crispy beef. authentic flavours. good pricing and nice staff

great selection of food. good service. got a table as soon as we walked in. it was after the lunchtime rush in the middle of the week though. a little pricey for just two people. the more the merrier i think. i think they have some tables upstairs setup for larger groups. well worth going just for the steamed sea bass.
we loved it here! every dish ordered tasted simply delicious. the duck and dim sum was amazing. the staff were brilliant with children and it felt so christmassy inside! thank you
nice, clean restaurant. staff were accommodating and helpful. food was nice, but not a huge nunnery of options for vegetarians/ vegans.
good food, good service, good price, best in china town.
really good food and great service
really tasty and value for money
amazing menu and attentive friendly service - but unfortunately the quality wasn't what i would have hoped for in chinatown.
chef's menu is much too expensive for what it is worth!
excellent food, good service & very pleasant
starters are a bit small in size, maincourse is decent in size and taste, service is below average.
very nice chinese food - had the set menu - was a lovely selection and very good value - superb duck
prices are fine for what servoce and food you get. service is fast and smooth. definitely worth a try if you crave for spm asian food. and the food itself is rich in flavour.
below average food and decidedly poor service. rice served on plates rather than bowls seemed odd.
ok food. good place for tourists.
very good food for affordable price
it was busy and a little later so we tried it as it was busy, but i would avoid it if honest. everything was over-cooked, crispy/dry or tasteless. not the worst i have had, but far from the best.
not a place i would return to. not very welcoming
food below average standard and not fresh either like take out from fridges, fairly overpriced for dishes. was charged 1 for water.

like all things in chinatown, it took some exploring to find this place, but it is very good. prices are pretty reasonable and the food is great (gotta have the duck!). best advice i can give is go in a group of 3-4 people max - you would be waiting quite a while if you go with more than 4
espectacular roast duck dumpling and glutinous rice in lotus leaf
really good food, but cramped setting.
quite nice peking duck! staff is very helpful
used to be best in chinatown. really gone downhill. lots of michelin stickers on door but food is really poor

food is quite good here. price is reasonable if you know what to order. the usual hong kong based dishes will be fine. the food will be up to mark. can't expect much for this price range. service can be improved typical of chinatown (except for high end) restaurants. it is just beside the 2 four seasons restaurants at gerrard street.
great dim sum just watch oot if ypu are english you get the right priced menu.

been a regular here for a while and definitely the best dumplings in china town. they're extremely authentic, the sizes are perfect and all of them taste so different. faves are the cheun fung (prawns and the pork) along with the crispy duck. will forever be my go-to place in china town!
great food, good service and reasonable prices for the area. dim sum in particular is well worth trying.
valentine for love happiness just showing my happiness
amazing food in an amazing location, went for lunch, was in and out in 30 mins (which is great as i only had a lunch hour) and never flet rushed at all. food hot, quick and very tasty!
sezchuan chrimp was good and also the sweet and sour chicken, add some chinese brocoly and your good to go !
one of the better dim sum places in china town.
highly recommend the set meals that they offer, you get so much for your money
average food.
fast service, great food and great value!
they were supposed to accept taste cards on a sundays but when i visited they refused to accept because they'd rather save the tables for customers who didn't use taste cards.
set menu food wasn't bet good.
great place!!!!
good cantonese dim sum , general dishes for dinner ok too , a tad dearrr service charges comparing to other nearby competitors
outstanding. simply the best chinese meal i have ever had .. and i've been to china!
aromatic crispy duck and satay crispy chicken all very good. nice service.

haozhan,worst restaurant in china town. hostile staff, overpriced dishes, and looooooong waiting time for food. taste average. will avoid this place in future. there are many better restaurants in the area that i would dearly recommend, but not this one.
always good dim sum at a good price. best to go with a big group and sit upstairs.
very tasty food. try the peking duck and sweet and sour chicken.
tasty and varied. a good range to suit more or less adventurous palates.
food was okay. not very good though. bit overpriced.
always eat here if i'm in chinatown. great food. good, quick, no nonsense service.
delicious food, amazing atmosphere and reasonable prices.

worst experience i have ever had. first time i have given a review too. the waitress was very rude, dumping the food on the table and walking off constantly. would have received better hospitality at mcdonald's. never smiled, much better restaurants in chinatown.
really good restaurant for authentic chinese food. the roast duck is great. will be back for more...

food was ok-nothing special. service was good but then they try to scam you by adding service charge which is a discretionary 13.5% but charged at almost 40%!! may work for the unsuspecting tourists but not with me so pulled them up on it!
great and refined food. horrible service. we were pushed out of the restaurant.

the best place to eat at chinatown: the food is delicious, especially the chicken and the dim sum; the staff is fantastic and the place is clean and cozy. i have become a regular and i am always welcomed with a smile!
we had the couple set and it was too much. i wish we had ordered just the crispy duck coz that was really good. the rest was nothing special.
food is not freshly cooked...the raw vegetables are tired.

christmas!!!!out of the sudden they dont accept credit card anymore but only cash and triple / double their price!!!!chinese tea for 7.00 when they normally sell it for 1.00 !!!!not to mention the worst waitress ever !!!!! i met it there.
genuine chinese. try the crispy duck
the chilli soft shell crab and mongolian fillet beef are superb. great service too, very friendly staff.
got right royally ripped off here they brought us a dish we didn't order and got all shirty when we told them.60 lunch for 2!go elsewhere.
friendly staff (unlike a lot if restaurants in chinatown!), good food, reasonable prices.
great set menus
i entered the restaurant because there was a michelin sticker at the entrance.  but the taste and service are normal
imo best duck rice ever tasted
i'd recommend the crispy duck and sea bass here. food is good.
average
so good!
roast duck with rice yum :) tables a bit close together and staff distracted by their radios when taking your order but the food was good
new owners and not the haozhan i used to know
expensive place to eat
just excellent amazing
highly recommend.
ok, not bad
lovely sweet and sour bean curd meal
fantastic roast duck
noting special, average china town fare.
incredibly yummy food and definitely feels a lot nicer than many of the places in china town - however that does come with a price tag!
fast delicious food. slightly cramped.
average food. the sign outside said optional 12.5% service charge, though we were told that it was mandatory. also, we were charged 3.50 for prawn crackers we didn't ask for.
good food, nice dim sum.
cantonese restaurant serving main dishes and dim sum. price is fair but not really authentic in cantonese cooking style.
the food was okay. they want you to go to the cash point to pay cash. this is the first option and is pushed as the payment method. they only got card machine when asked.
fairly average food, fairly reasonable price
best aromatic duck we have had in years!

the 1st time i went there it was marvelous, however the 2nd time is a bit dissapointing. food is expensive and i was expecting more. you can use tastecard here but from my observation, portion is a bit smaller.
excellent dim sum at any hour.
very tasty food, good service
best noodles in soho ever
nothing special but not bad for what they do..
love the crispy roast duck here. need to try to appreciate it.
food was ok. service was average. service charge was high and not optional (even for a party of two).
very good noodles. soups are not bad too.
yumm yumm
ok nothing too special, food and service is only average i'm afraid. better restaurants in the area.
good chinese, great duck and the deep fried crispy squid starter was delicious
restaurant in china town. good value and good food. everything is quite fast especially when they are busy. that's good of you have other things to do.
good for theatre break. loved the starters in particular.
best dumplings ive had outside of australia.
damn son, that's good dim sum!
great 14 set meal , highly recommend.
decent place. affordable price. roast duck was definitely not the best.
the crispy duck is one the best i've tried. the beef curry is delicious too. i've been there a few times and i'll be back.
food is nice and fair price. service is so so.
the crispy chili beef is so tasty - with saffron rice, great pork rib soup and egg tarts to go!
food was average, but the staff and service were very bad.  i wouldt recommend it.
did anyone else eat here around the 6th march 2019 and everyone got sick?

i have lived in asia for more than 10 years and this is the best duck i've ever had! the other foods were pretty good, as was the service, but the duck was outstanding. highly recommended if you want duck.
really awesome experience here. very authentic and tasty dim sum. don't forget egg tarts!
delicious!!! quick service with good staff, duck excellently cooked, crispy chilli beef the best i've had..crispy and melt in the mouth. very highly recommend this place.

worst restaurant ever\ a viter absolumentbad service, bad food,  rude and agressive staff. they took back the food before we end it. and when they serve us the second type of food they told us that we only have 10 min to eat before they close the restaurant.
sometimes i come to pick up a takeaway container of pork belly. its quite tasty and the sauce they provide with it is a good accompaniment.
a bit dark,tables are very closed to each other,nothing special for yum cha.
excellent service and food. if you're an american, be prepared for a real experience as this is nothing like the "chinese" food to which you're accustomed, in a good way.
it's delicious foods up there
nice quick cheap chinese meal in china town.
fantastic food, great service and reasonably priced. must go of your on the area!
good szechuan food, dim sum at lunchtime
over priced for what you get. bit of a tourist trap. people serving were not welcoming or helpful. we walked away hungry and disappointed.
just amazing
i just love the mixed plate with char shu, chicken, duck and white rice. with the sauce on the side it is to die for.
nice place in london chinatown, they do really good deals.
they kicked us out when we are still drinking tea, what a lovely service
great service.
in love with the crispy aromatic duck. the food was so good. this place is not the cheapest one, but it worth it.
great cantonese / chinese cuisine. been there a fair few times now and dishes seem to be consistent.
highly recommend the roasted duck and bbq pork
great food great value
overall food is okay. they really dont know how to make dim sum, especially soup dumplings just falling apart. raised it with the water and the new batch was as bad.

the roast duck was delicious - although it would be better if the sauce wasn't poured over the ducks skin to preserve more crispyness. the chinese broccoli with garlic sauce was nice but could have used a little more garlicy flavour.
food is good but service was lousy. not just bad. really awful.i went for the duck reviews. i won't go back.

our party of 5 enjoyed a tasty and timely pre-theater dinner of crispy duck with pancakes and several vegetable sides with a slightly updated edge.  the waiter was gracious, knowledgeable and respectfully helpful.  while a bit more expensive than others in the neighborhood, the quality and consistency was well worth it.
not all staff are very fluent in english, food was decent but nothing special
lovely food, nice and warm friendly place

nice dim sum and congee. too much mei jin makes you thirsty. a little disappointed the restaurant charged me gbp4.8 plus 10% for a bowl of plain congee. this is supposed to be cheaper than a bowl of plain rice.

great cuisine in the heart of china town.  there are many choices, but glad we selected haozhan.  if you like duck, they specialize in duck.  we ordered a variety of dishes and enjoyed each of them.  portion size and price were good.
so delicious
best duck in the world!
the duck was a bit dry and the waitress unfriendly. would not recommend.
not bad chinese food for the price but not outstanding either.
excellent. been in uk for two years. among the better chinese restaurants. in contrast to four season and goldmine, service is way better. roast duck is comparable or even better!

very good if you go for ordering dim sum to share. same price level as the restaurants around (even though the prices aren't posted on the menu outside, you will see them before ordering).much more cosy upstairs than visible from the street, so try to sit there if possible.
very delicious. the crispy pork is amazing.
amazing restaurant with the best dim sum in london. the staff is efficient and you get your food very quickly. love it!

before entering we said we have a tastecard. while asking for the bill the cashier was the rudest woman i have ever met and denied the use of the tastecard, said we must speak to her before.horrible experience for a paying customer. avoid at all costs.
i thought it would be better. i had great expectations maybe.
stopped in for a set menu meal on our way to a show. great food at good value. excellent place for a quick pit stop.
all was just simply ok, will i return no thank u.

it's impossible to try every dish in one sitting so it could be hit or miss. but with the roasted meats displayed in the window you can't go wrong. the chicken, the pork and the duck, over plain rice, are outstanding. will be back to try more dim sum and hopefully add to this review.
any asain foods you need get it here !
great chinese, dumpling platter was fantastic, great duck pancakes too. also pork belly was very tasty and i'm not normally a fan of mains. good choice if you are in chinatown!
crispy duck? more like boring dry and uncrispy... expencive
one of my favourite places to eat bbq crispy skinned duck. i would go just for that!
really like the yam and sweet potato pearls!! what an awesome creation.
not bad. i prefer bubble tea then fruit flavour slush. service was fine. :)
however the que system is not very good and at first glance you dont know where to que its all worth the wait. i definitely reccomend the lemon green tea on a sizzling hot day.
super cute little shop, great milk tea
the service is fast. faster than a bullet train.  and milk tea was delicious as well. i ordered the mango and orange green tea which i recommend.
loveee happy lemon! my favourite drink is warm milk tea with tapioca and pudding.

their bubble tea is more creamier tasting, and less of the 'tea' taste if that's what you enjoy then go for it. recently they've brought out some new snacks and cakes and they're amazing! make sure you try the crab floss cheesecake/sponge cake square thing. (i don't know what its called)

my favorite milk tea so far in london. but i hope they allow their customers to use their own reusable cups. i asked before but was told it is against company policy. if coffee shops allow it, why can't they?
better than coco which recently opened 5 minutes away from here.
always the first place when visit london. iced bubble tea was good. staff were nice.
i love sugar cane milk at happy lemon, it's sweet, tasty and so refreshing.
i enjoyed my bobba! it's was really good :)
i only like one drink here. the classic lemon jasmine tea cold drink. its so refreshingly delicious for afair price. the place is too small and not comfortable for waiting.

such a shame that this cafe is so behind the times with its plastic use. not only do they sell their drinks in plastic cups with a non recyclable lid and straw but they also hand it out in a plastic bag!its awful. especially when you see that their customers leave their empty cups in the street.
the tea was sooooooooo sweet nothing like chinese happy lemon, and the waitress was very very rude, no smile at all, wont go there anymore.
love it!  great little bubble tea shop, i shall be back soon.
way too sweet. i was not asked the dose of sugar or ice unlike other brands. the waitress was not smiling at all.
was very tasty. just like bubbleolgy but i got bits of mango in my tea. didnt like that.
love love love! very nice bubble teas!
my personal favourite bubble tea joint up town. more fruity and a sensible amount of sugar!
good bubble tea! they have interesting flavors.
strong lemon flavour almost like lemon curd. was really nice just wish i lived closer.
too expensive, but good!
dirty bubble tea....

was a 5
corrected my order with no fuss and no extra cost after i forgot to ask for tapioca pearls. very kind! also the bubble tea hear is top notch!

everything is just a bit too sweet. tried the milk bubble tea and didnt have a say on the sweetness like other places and also tried the crepe cake. unless you like your crepes slathered in whipped cream, its nothing special.

i have tried the classic bubble tea with tapioca which was really nice. the service was ok but i was quiet disappointed with the amount of ice that came with the drink. half the cup was filled of thick ice, no wonder it finished so quickly, that's not very good practice. i may give it another try without ice this time.
lovely milk tea and tasty, soft and chewy tapioca. i only wish they added more tapioca pearls to my drink! service is fast and friendly.

they got my order wrong: i asked for a taro milk tea and when i got it the tea was not purple and tasted like a normal milk tea! if theyd ran out id have rather been told than given one i dont like! service was fast however i wasnt asked what sweetness/ice level i wanted,
loved their brown sugar boba, perfect amount of sweetness (for me). small place but fast service. we had to wait 15 mins because of the queue but it's worth the wait! surely coming back.
tried their oolong roasted milk tea and added pearl. the drinks was good but i find the pearl somewhat lacking. it will be great if they improve on their pearl

me and my sister visited this place in the summer. taiwanese bubble teas made from freshly brewed loose leaf teas and using fresh organic milks. vegan-friendly soya, almond and oat milk options available too. we had the tea with the tapioca balls.
i have been going to happy lemon for as long as i have been happy. i am truly on my way to achieving eternal happiness.
i'm always getting the cheesecake when i'm here, absolute treat! milk tea of all sorts are also great. a go to whenever i'm in london.

a good choice of bubble tea on offer and the price is normal for london's bubble tea shops. the snow/cream cloud is delicious. if you like cheesecake, get it since it gives that kind of savoury/sweet taste.
a great place!!!
no trip to china town would be complete without a stop off here. great teas always busy but worth the wait

went three times while in london. the red bean matcha smoothie is amazing and my favorite!! i recommend, however, this particular tea isnt for everyone but there are plenty of other options available.

always have a long cue whenever i come by but everything is worth it once i have my favourite drinks.

great place

foods are so so yet the staff were super duper rude. we required to change our hot water to cold water. we were just trying to ask them will it possible to change and didn't force them to change but they mad and treated us rude and don't even want to serve us the water.

text: as i know, hong ning clinic is the earliest chinese medical center. dr. luo is a skin expert.  i have indroduced many patients to see her and everyone has got good results. thanks to dr. luo. the staff in this clinic are also kind and helpful, always giving detailed consultation and nice treatment. will definitely recommend!
place: Hong Ning Clinic 康宁中医诊所

we loved this place. don't go here for traditional japanese food. go here for a relaxed atmosphere, great music, lovely staff and deliciously interesting modern japanese food. the hot udon with karaage was super tasty and everyone loved the crunchy veggie burger. highly recommended if you want something different.
great decor, tasty food but a limited menu. had a tasty burger but was slightly overdone. one kids option (a burger).
