we were lucky to have lunch during the lunar festival. got a great view of the lions chasing out bad spirits from the first floor. for food, i recommend the chicken karaage, gyoza and the popcorn shrimp. portion sizes are good and the staff were really nice!

amazing designed restaurant. the space downstairs, in particular, is stunning. very quirky  decor - feels very unique. quite a simple menu, nothing crazy exciting but all good quality - quick and tasty. great value considering the location and the restaurant's premium design.

this place despite not actually being an authentic japanese restaurant, it was a great fusion place. the wagu meat was great and you really cant order wrong on the menu, it was a descent price too. there was an amazing dish that can only be described as a cheeseburger in a spring roll that was so innovative and creative.

the food here is great, as are the cocktails. really good quality, the toilets are great too! the only downside is service was very slow. however staff very good and accommodated my surprise cake idea for the hen
wonderful restaurant with a great ambiance and friendly staff. the cocktails are amazing and so are the burgers. if you get a chance, try to visit the lower level.

you would not suspect how cool is the inside. all the decoration looks like you are japan with traditional tables etc. loved the food but thought it was a bit pricey though. would definitely recommend!
really happy with the food and service! wow gluten free crispy chicken! amazing. thank you lizzieee for being so wonderful and clued up on my allergy
i repeated my visit many times. amazing vibes and friendly staff! you should try out the burger if you love asian food dont forget to order gyoza veggie!

fast service, cool space. the food is fresh and flavorful. my only (small) nit was that the tempura chicken noodle dish was actually served as a soup. that didn't really work. noodles and chicken would have been much better if served "dry" style.
i cannot recommend this place enough! food is a treasure! every bite is scrumptious! service is excellent. greeted beautifully and polish girl waiter was a treat.....atmospheric too

the food here is brilliant! came here with my partner last monday to enjoy a lovely meal. great music, great atmosphere and great staff! our waitress lizzie, was very enthusiastic and bubbly, made us laugh alot, and the food was delicious. overall great experience will definitely be back!

great japanese place. cozy and the staff is friendly. service is very good and the food is top notch. the wagyu burger was very tasty. would recommend this place if you want a quick bite. bare in mind you will need to book in advance during peak times

great food and friendly staff. the food is definitely the highlight of the place. the ambience is super cozy and full of quirky items from japanese pop culture. i can see myself becoming a regular there. service was fast and the team there was very courteous.
nice busy place. good menu. it can use more drinks selection.
great sushi. great design inside
the food was beautiful. we sat downstairs this time, it was wonderfully decorated and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. definitely my new favourite.

i went to ichibuns because it was classified as one of the best restaurants in soho. indeed it did not disappoint. i would 100% recommend it to anyone that looking for a cool place to eat with great food! excellent customer service as well. i would suggest the mochi for dessert!
great place for a quick bite. burger was recommended... medium, the star of the show. noodles with chicken was a safe option.
great atmosphere, very trendy. food was great a nice mix. we were in a rush as i had a show to go to. the food came out very quickly.

the food is a blend of burger and japanese food. you could argue that neither is as good as a pure burger or japanese restaurant, which is true, but it kind of works. the food is tasty, the atmosphere is trendy and the service is quick.
food great. music great. staff great. atmosphere great. must experience. highly recommended. will visit again.
it's a restaurant with really good atmosphere but the food was 3/5
miniburger/spring roll hybrid was delicious.
superrrrb fun place for lunch very nice food. also had dinner with friends the dj really made the place so live. must try their burger spring rolls and sushi so insannnne
interesting, bit takky but fun atmosphere. nice drinks and ok food. the shrimp popcorn are very tasty
food and staff were great. my wife was the only one that had chicken, she said it tasted strange, then spent most of the night being sick in the hotel room.
great ambience,  nice sicely set up. burgers were delicious. good veg options too.
by far the best burger ive ever eaten, such a cool atmosphere.

what a great place to go, loved the food it was to high standard full of flavour and well presented. enjoyed the theme/styling of the decor and seating arrangements.  all six of us enjoyed our food and felt is was good value. thanks to lovely tia for making the arrangements.
good food, had an issue with our order but was quickly sorted out by management, was a nice touch.
don't order the wagyu burger! they completely overcook the meat (some parts were burnt). complained to the waiter and they explained this is the way they do it. what a waste of good food!

this is one of the coolest restaurants ive been to in the world. its in the heart of chinatown in london and a very good late night place to hang out and get delicious food. the price is reasonable and the service is excellent.
so wonderful interieur and very delicious drinks and food. also expensive but worth it
very nothing special food in the middle of china town. if you are in china town there's too many nicer restaurant is way better.

really cool restaurant near china town. we had the wagu beef spring rolls and the burger both of which were fantastic. staff were helpful and friendly when we wanted to sit upstairs. well priced and would definitely go back!
loved the food and the design of the restaurant. downstairs there's a very cool pub isle.
used to pack more flavour. burgers now have to be fully cooked to satisfy the local authority.

wrong order, expensive, small portions. very simple food. the menu is very short. when i told the waiter that my order was wrong, he told me that i was wrong and he was right. i won't come back. the place is flashy and looks like a nice one, but it's a travellers trap.

such a coo place, interior design is fantastic, down to the lavatories. clean and well looked after. food was great and the service very friendly. great venue for business lunches or parties. will definitely come back, thanks to my friend patrick who reccomemded and showed me this gem in london's china town.
a tad pricey for the food. the small bits pretty good. the buns are not as exciting.
food was amazing, atmosphere was so good and the staff were so friendly and always on the ball! don't have a single complain about this place. definitely go here for a great meal
went here for a work christmas dinner. the sushi was nice, but i found the burgers to be a little too oily. the cheeseburger spring roll was surprisingly nice!

loved this place, they had a really good service and helped us to good sake. meal was really tasty and if i get back to london in the future id come here again and id recommended it to anyone who comes here.

the hostess, i believe her name is katy, was very rude and unwelcoming and was irritated simply because we asked for another table. for this reason we would not return. however the food was nice and our italian waiter was really nice and looked after us well.

not worth your money. burger and bun were super greasy.  67 for two burgers, soup and two appies. i get this is london but the burger was pretty small. trying to be trendy but failing.  much better places to eat.
japanese fancy place, cool music, great cool service and  tasty fusion japanese food. i do recommend at all.

great food! the shrimp and chive gyoza were amazing. and the ume cocktail was a delight...even if i had them remove the egg white from the mix. on that note, they were happy to make substitutions, which is rare enough that i should mention it.
great restaurant in the heart of chinatown in london. good food and service.
great venue and decor.  food was just ok
very nice food.
delicious. great atmosphere, delicious food. highly recommend the ichiburger. pricing very reasonable too considering it's central london.

yum... really liked this place. initial seating wasnt great but moved to upstairs which we enjoyed. crispy rice and spicy tuna roll was yum but had to ask for wasabi. cheeseburger roll was nice... different but nice

the decor was the main reason i went, being a fan of showa era japanese things, the retro vibe made me excited. it was very nicely decorated. however, the food was... alright. my coke was flat, and i felt the ramen rather lacked vegetables and flavour.
the food was amazing but small portions for the price. great vibe and funky decor!
great food and vibe!
fun and great food, i enjoyed it
i like this place because is something different! the burguer rolls are amazing and the prawns are something else!

it was a wonderful experience eating there. of course it wasn't cheap but what can you expect restaurant in the middle of china town?atmosphere - splendid!food - delicious!even though, my meal looked tiny, this filled my stomach.definitely recommended!
awesome authentic japanese food in a great location
beautiful food in a trendy atmosphere
one of the best restaurant experiences i've had ever! worth a visit

this place look really cute, but the food is too disappointing. they mixed japanese food + western style, and its not very nice , i was expecting a good japanese foods cuz i been to japan , but no , very disappointed
nice decor. great service and very helpful staff. unfortunately, the udon dishes were too salty.
great food, good cocktails, friendly staff. prices are a bit spices but within reason. 10/10 would eat again.
the food was great and the desserts were delicious
cool interior and they have toto toilets in the bathroom.  food is average but a large range of dishes.
great asian food. friendly service. good cocktails. fantastic atmosphere and top-notch beats! ps: you must check out the bathroom!
absolutely loved it!!! the sushi was the best i ever had, the cocktails too and their decor is lush, a great place to go would definitely recommend!

i gave it 4 stars because the service wasnt that great. i ordered my burger well done it was burnt from the outside and still pink inside. its expensive for the quantity and the quality. i dont think ill visit again.
so good. really cool inside

great ramen, good sides, amazing burger. if you're going for the food you won't be disappointed. don't expect to sit and have a quiet dinner though there is loud music and a dark room for the dining area.
all four burgers well-done no where near medium rare

been here twice now and love it! had the most delicious veggie burger!! will definitely be back for more! very cool vibe with nice decor, cool music, lovely cocktails so great place for a date. toilet seat upstairs was heated which was a cool experience! love it!
very nice place to eat a bit on the expensive side but worth the money. i recommend the udon:
first time in this restaurant and we will come back! the burgers and the japanese beer were very good. the place is beautiful, colorful. the staff is really friendly.
good service. nice food a bit more complex and tasty very good sake very well balanced
nice waiting stuff and delicious food. i also liked the decoration.
good service, food and music
best japanese food. try the cheeseburger spring rolls, they are mazing.
lovely food. need more in menu!
best sushi place in london, high quality rice and friendly staff, the upper floor is amazing too!
something different! if you have the chance visit the basement 1, you will be surprise, good vibes! wonderful place and amazing staff! thanks specially to josh who made our visit even better!
very mediocre food. on top of that, they have a ridiculous security rule that you cannot pay with apple pay over 30!!!

it had such lovely decor! if you're a fan of anime/manga or japanese culture this is the place for you. the menu is simple but the food is very tasty and hot. the food and drinks came so quickly after we ordered so amazing service. the toilet was very lovely too. overall great experience. i shall be back!
the food was very delicious specially nikoudon , cozy place with great service
love the decor! and even the toilets are japanese! would definitely recommend here to eat. dynamite shrimp and prawn tempura maki we're delicious
amazing burgers and ramen. the decor is to die for also. loved it all. great cocktails too. a must try. unique!

loved this place in the heart of china town. food was great and so was the service from a friendly bunch of staff. there was sixteen of us and despite such a large group the meals were all perfect. highly recommend a visit.
the foods excellent and the place gives a japanese vibe
love this place! food amazing, atmosphere amazing! music playing is great. decor is fun. drinks are generous!

veggie burger and chicken karage burger really good. hearty and delicious. prawn gyoza was too salty, but tasted good. service was fast and friendly.interior is very nice, with a decent amount of seating. toilet is so cool! japanese style electronic one.
table hosst or whoever this guy is... killed my experience, customer service is bit like in kfc.. food and interior amazing x
5 stars only because the ichibuns burger is the best burger i've ever had in london
great beef wagu ramen, friendly and good service...!

would give 0 stars if i could. expensive (50+) , and i got pretty bad gastroenteritis from eating their gross tasting noodles, which they clearly must have cooked a while ago, set aside and then warmed back up.
great food, fun environment, friendly waiters, a must go place
yummy food. good service
very good udon noodles, great interior and friendly staff
love love love this place. great atmosphere and music downstairs, much more chill upstairs but with that street food vibe. must try the spicy tuna roll and the wagyu ramen!
this buzzy, funky japanese spot with a retro vibe features wagyu burgers and inventive cocktails.
great food but a bit pricey

ichibuns is one of those rare places in london - simultaneously reasonably priced, serves food til late, and has great decor.  perfect for a 1 am feast when you don't want to go home but don't fancy any more drinks.  very tasty too.
best udon ive had in london so far. i highly recommend the yasai tempura, its amazing
amazing gyozas ever bless up kingbetter than in japan
super nice food with polite stuff
tasty ramen & nice atmosphere

overpriced and not worth it. go to any other resteraunt around here. avoid at any cost. seriously, go to the bakery accross the street and a few doors down. get yourself 2 green tea ice creams in a fish shaped cone. you will be happier and only spend a few pounds.
fantastic design and delicious food!!!
japanese hipster vibe cant cover for the average food, gyoza decent but the chips smelt awful and were clearly fried in very very old oil which made them taste off.
expensive but totally worth it. food and decor are amazing
slow service on a weekday and the wait was not worth it for some pretty bland udon noodles.
sushi was decent but the fried chicken karaage burger and ichibun (wagyu) beef burgers were amazing! it is a must try!
great food, nice atmosphere and very polite staff!
the restaurant is awsome, service is super friendly and i recomand the ichibun burger, its probably the best burger i have ever tasted.
fun place to eat out with the family
kind staff, tasty food, awesome mochi! it is not really cheap, neither expensive, you usually dont pay more than 20, but it really is worth it.

def not up to basic udon standards. ordered veg tempura udon, the noodles were so old and overcooked that they had no springy texture but mush like porridge. it didnt help the fact that the tempura were too greasy like they were cooked from old oil. would never pay 12 quid for that kind of udon again
love the details of this place. retro japanese inspired vibes. their best orders are sushi rolls, burger and burger spring roll.
weird door guy had us waiting outside with an half empty restaurant. food was ok, at best. looks cool though.
the food was alright, im just not sure how i feel about the patty in the cheeseburger harumaki, or dipping it in the cheese sauce.
great food, cool venue
food was great but felt a bit rushed to finish
get the dynamite shrimp, it was amazing. really nice feel and the toilets are amazing.
great japanese restaurant. lovely interior and amazing staff. the burger was surprisingly good and prawn tempura maki was lovely too. definitely go back again to try  new dishes
the starter was lovely. nice atmosphere.
great service. great food. great drinks. all at reasonable prices. would go again in a heartbeat.
good quality but poor menu choice (visited at lunch time, not sure if there is another menu at night)

one of the best burgers i've eaten in my life. the music and ambiance are great for and intimate first date or to hang out with some friends before going to the club. the staff is very nice and helpful.
best ramen ive ever had!
good and fast service, nice atmosphere.
delicious gyoza and yummy veggie burger ! nice selection of beer, although it'd be great if asahi was on tap
great surprise ! the atmosphere was great , the food was modern , fresh and with a twist ! definitely recommend!
we got seated very quickly and enjoyed nice service. however, the quality of the food was rather average - there are many more places in the area with much better and more authentic food.
good food quick service reasonable prices
tourists trap. very overprice with very small and tiny portion and quantity of sushi for the price of a 45 pound menu. will never ever go there again.
great atmosphere, music fun but not too loud, food absolutely lush! great service too.
great food, great staff
overrated. food was very average. good atmosphere
great restaurant and interesting food. we ordered lots of starters which were delicious. the main dish noodles were excellent too though the portion size could have been bigger.
enchanting interior, energized staff, elegant dishes, a refreshing addition to the soho scene. i hope they're sticking around for the long run to spread the word of authentic sushi done right.
very obliging staff and great food. lovely atmospheric place. will visit again when in town.
great food, great service, masimo really sold it to us, great guy.
this is one of my choice for dinner & drinks with friends in soho! good vibes and love the combo sushi + meat buns!

doorman was really rude. didn't greet us nice. lets you wait outside. say they have a table ready. yiu come inside. they ask everything all over again. food was mhoa. noodles didn't have a lot of tast. burger rolls were tasty!
best restaurant in london so far, i recommend their chicken karaage burger

the biggest mistake you'll ever make is ordering their burgers anything more than medium, but i'm a midrare guy myselftheir sushi is great, one of their rolls aren't even on the menu, called the dragon roll, best one there in my opinion. i haven't had the noodles but apparently theyre really good i've heard

wow, just wow. friendly service, great internals, the burgers are from another planet. there's some kind of japanese udon meets american diner thing going and it's done perfectly. definitely one to seek out if you're a burger connoisseur.
great atmosphere, great food, great for groups.
food on point, ambience lively! quite a few fried options- which suits me well!
amazing food! atmosphere is good... just a bit loud and you can't have dinner co creations really. the decorations however were astounding. definitely would recommend.

very nice found, food very tasty, good quality for reasonable price. polite and friendly service and awesome design in restaurant you can  feel japanese atmosphere.  we definitely comes back for more . totally recommend thank you
food and drink is great, but music is too loud. its like being in a night club - not really what id call a dining experience. cant hear any one else at the table with you.
great japanese fusion food
the food was fresh, tasted great & served quickly. portions could have been bigger.
had a wonderful time here. delicious food and friendly helpful staff. would definitely recommend.
must get the springroll cheeseburger

it was for the company's christmas party, the atmosphere was great. we had finger food which was delicious but also enough to get full, and the cocktails were very refreshing. a big thank you to the ladies in service they were very attentive and always with a smile on their faces. ichiban team you smashed it thank you!!!

nice venue with retro decor and friendly staff. food appeared very saturated with fat (chicken bun). we also got charged twice for the desserts which were included in the kids meal offer, luckily we noticed it!
terribile service upstairs except the lovely black girl at the door. she was amazing. food was ok. too expensive, though. location and ambience was beautiful.

wow! this place is absolutely superb! food, cocktails, service, design and music! attention to details is just out of this world!we have been there twice in the last few weeks and it blew my mind away both times!thank you!
28  it was good

this place was a miraculous find as a tourist, and offered an amazing american-japanese hybrid experience. from cheeseburger spring rolls to traditional karaage, i loved every bite. the atmosphere and music was also fantastic, will definitely visit again next time i'm on that side of the world!
my fave restaurant by far!!!! love the yuzu cocktail and literally every appetizer is to die for.
great food, inexpensive as for london
original and very good, although kind of overpriced (but nothing unexpected considering the area). do not miss a trip to the loo (they're japanese-style toilets)!
really beautiful environment! the food was all delicious and reasonably priced. the sushi rolls are really small and you might need two orders, but they are wonderful!
great burger. really delicious
absolutely love this funky restaurant! perfect meal with the wife and their milkshakes are awesome!!
vegetarian udons are amazing.would recommend this place !
went with friends and thoroughly enjoyed it. the atmosphere and decorations are very nice. well presented food which tasted pretty good. i would recommend it.
great service, nice food.

the food is great however the staff aren't treated good enough with only having a short break after 10 hour shifts! i think management really need to fix up and consider their employees more as this is against the law. they get less than half an hour breaks for long shifts and this is unfair.
great spot in soho. nice vibe and authentic menu
good sushi , loved the cocktails! a bit pricey due the location im guessing.
well greeted by a friendly staff. food and drinks are outstanding.
menu was okay..not spoilt for choice. a bit pricey too.
food was amazing and staff very friendly
i discovered this place few days ago and i have to go again because i'm obsessed with edamame!!! food is good , i will be back for trying sushi.
the place has a unique design, great food, great atmosphere and very good service!
had a fantastic experience at ichibuns with lizzie as our waitress. she was wonderful and made the evening even more special. lovely restaurant, great food and fantastic service. thank you lizzie!

loved this place! the restraurant itself was soo well designed and fashionable. and cocktails and the food was excellent, but the sushi took everything. it was mind-blowingly delicious!! one of the best restrauants i've ever been one of the highlights of my trip in london!
great food great atmosphere and the service is great. always pop in when i get the chance.
sooooo delicious. haven't had such good ramen in awhile. and i had the vegetarian option - broth was still very hearty. tried one of the crispy rice dishes - yum! would make it a point to go back.

i took friends there with two young kids. great atmosphere, fun decor to distract the kids while the waiter was ignoring us most of the time. food was very good, excellent burgers and fries. i recommend to sit upstairs.

honestly one of the best restaurants ive been too. service was amazing, food came out quickly. the vibe was great, such good music too! food was absolutely delicious and so reasonably priced, i couldnt fault a single thing. i recommend booking a table as in the evenings there can be queues.  10/10 would go again!
i love this manga place, the wagyu habaga (burger) is delicious.
ichibuns is great#! come in and try! fun + food enjoyment, and nice staff, quick service...

had a great time catching up with friends. perfect environment, perfect vibe, delicious food. we were served by lizzieee who was the absolute best, even though we took about 40 minutes deciding what we wanted!
the ichibun burger is ichibomb! the cheese/sauce was amazing though some might find it quite oily. 13.5 for burger and fries. good atmosphere and decent staff. would recommend the kirin beer!
last time i was there was a year ago (loved it) and the new menu they have is missing all the dishes & drinks we came back to enjoy.
served by maria, great food great service. dope atmosphere, would return
delicious food and very fast service. we were in a rush and got in and out in 45 minutes. will spend more time there next time
good food, good prices for chinatown
incredible melt in your mouth dim sum, try the aromatic duck in net fried dim sum. the staff speaks poor english but it is expected from such an authentic experience.

sitting next to floor entrance door. it was drafty. very noisy private rooms close by with plenty of singing.however, the service was efficient, quick and food was very good.overall, a good night meeting and eating with friends.

the flavour of the food was good and fresh orange juice was perfect. the service however was extremely poor. the dishes for each course were not served together and the order was not taken correctly. the standards here have dropped considerably. won't be going back.
ive been to this place many times in the past, its always been quite good, but food in my recent visit was extraordinary. everything was

i've eaten here four or five times now, one of the best places for dim sum in china town. the staff are always friendly and attentive, food always tastes good. i especially love the soft shell crab! i would thoroughly recommend this place.
green beans too salty and peaking duck was a bit dry otherwise was ok but probably wouldn't specifically come back.
nice event and food
not the best menu and it felt a bit rushed. but the food was ok.
nice building. food is ok. but its very expensive for food and drink. was 150 for 4 people and still very hungry when leaving. much better value places in the area.
the stuff here was extremely rude and he did not understand english very well. the food was cold and dry looks like it's been made for a while. i do  not recommend this place
this is the yum cha place to go to in chinatown. consistently delicious food and high quality

great place - could do with a revamp, but the menu (particularly the chinese regional dishes hidden at the back) is great.  it's the only place in chinatown i've been to more than once, and i've probably been back a dozen times over the years.
great food, lovely little fish pond/bridge sets it back from the busy streets a slightly hidden island of calm in the city centre
went there for a dim sum lunch for 3. food was excellent, but we were a bit shocked by the 50 tab. food, tea, 1 coke + service.
reasonable value for money nice atmosphere
this certainly is one of the best chinese restaurant i've ever been.food quality is amazing, and the staff is very kind and professional
friendly staff and incredible food.

great selection of traditional cantonese dishes served by friendly staff. enter over the pond into a smart well layed out restaurant with big tables and comfortable chairs. really enjoyed the total experience

we ate here with my friend, service was poor, theres this one semi-fat guy who hardly smile, and always in a hurry, and very rude, when we ask for the bill theres a 6.50 service tips and the food has too much ginger. not happy!

a classic of china town, particularly good for weekend dim sum brunch. this place has been doing what they do - well - for a long time. service is professional and efficient though it could be warmer.

food was nice, service wasn't the best our drinks came after our starter which we had to remind them for, had to ask for extras several times, didn't see interest in our order as we were just young normal people
very consistent, from the food to the staff. great for large group events, with a very reasonable dim sum menu. i'm partial to the various dumplings, but almost everything is good.
the place looks beautiful, food was okay but the  staff made us feel unwelcome
quality of food could be good one day - another day bad
great chinatown choice
a lovely chinese whose food is delicious and varied. it comes straight to the table hot and fresh. the service is polite, professional, friendly and knowledgeable.
great food and good service
good choice of dishes with our selections being delicious. excellant service in a relaxing atmosphere. i would highly recommend.
fantastic food excellent service at a sensible price. highly recommended.

i came here with a group of 7 and we had the set menu b3. starting with a selection of dim sum, then some shredded duck with pancakes followed with a selection of other dishes. the food was delicious. the only slight down side was the cost of the tsing beer (4 for a small 330ml can) which quick bumped the price up.
came in for dimsum. got seated almost immediately. ordered and food came out quickly. efficient service. cheap bill. paid and left stuffed and happy. couldnt have asked for a better value meal
worst experience ever in chinatown, great food if it ever shows up and truly horribly rude staff that literally were yelling at us after we waited almost an hour for starters. never again
amazing food at a reasonable price. we ordered several dishes and all of them were delicious. easy to recommend.
good food, but expensive, can get the same quality in other restaurants in chinatown for less . check the bill,they charged us twice for 2 dishes .

came in for dimsum today. couldn't have asked for a better experience. attentive staff, quick service and tasty food. 11 dishes which came to just over 50 pounds, which was more than enough for me and my partner!  would recommend anyone to give it a try
good dim sum but not much if a selection of bigger dishes
lovely service. friendly staff, good place to take oriental style pictures, and the food is really really tasty. i recommend

were in london for a visit to the theater, thought we would try chinatown for a meal. picked imperial china. unfortunately the food was at best average and sadly they put it on cold plates. when it arrived it was  warm and very quickly became cold. wouldn`t recommend the experience.
usually good but today was very poor - waited for an hour and got chewy, bad food. very disappointed.

really good food at a very reasonable price. service was attentive and quick though we had to ask for soy a few times before it came to the table. regardless of that little mishap i will definitely go again.
the food is good although expensive and service once sat down is pretty bad.. the young wait staff are not interested...
beautiful place great food excellent staff
always good for dim sum or a duck
been here countless times so much i'm recognised by staff when i go in. terrific dim sum proper good chinese. big and spacious - karoke upstairs . but need to book

a very good restaurant, great location in london's china town. at the entrance there is a cascade with a bridge and a small pond with colourful fish that transpose you into the chinese atmosphere. the restaurant has cantonese specific and you can eat a great variety of delicious dim sum.
solid food, lots of choices. also a cool little koi pond at the entrance
food was yummy, service was nice... just took a long time to get drinks. even though they were non-alcoholic, they had to wait on he bartender to fix them. cost was very reasonable.
nice dim sum :))! unfortunately only available as a starter for diner ! delicious spare ribs
used to be one of my favourites, but i think the standard has dropped somewhat. my last meal was very average.
great freshly homemade dim sum restaurant in chinatown
only complaint is they didn't take amex.
good spacious chinese restaurant. excellent array of dim sum and chinese dishes good selection of drinks. friendly service.

although it is not cheap, i've never been disappointed eating here. great dim sum and my favourite crispy pork belly.the staff are helpful and graceful even when things get extra busy. it is well decorated and clean, elegant and comfortable. over the years consistently a good place to eat.
typical tourist trap asian food. avoid.
great food, service average.
okay good rude staff had to ask four times for prawn crackers
waiters were a bit rude. food was delicious.
tasty dim sum and attentive waiters
lovely service
poor service, no dim sum available when we wanted some, despite being advertised.
always amazing if you want dumplings and clean tasty chinese food but it's not sichuan so bear that in mind when choosing a restaurant in china town
lovely chinese in the heart of chinatown
delicious sunday dim sum, would absolutely recommend!
the restaurant staffs are friendly and the foods are great too... will definitely go there again
radish puff, fried dough cheung fun are my favs. bbq pork bao, cuttlefish cake, chicken feet, egg tart and turnip cake are good. the rest ive had are satisfactory. siew mai was disappointing

it may look small from the outside but it's wonderfully spacious and decorated inside. there is a lovely koi pond and bridge by the entrance. normally very busy but can get seating. dumplings are very good and the sweet and sour is excellent. the noodles are average. rather pricey at about 50 for two people.

lovely restaurant.. ...the staff are amazing. the food was amazing. the staff got into conversation with us and discovered it was my partners birthday.....and surprised us with a scoop of ice cream with a candle. she sang happy birthday with me and took pictures for us. lovely atmosphere!
great restaurant with an excellent service.
fine selection of dim sum. service and price could have been a bit better.

very disappointed at their service!after finishing the starters, we waited over 20 minutes for the duck, only to be served cold duck and cold pancakes.the other dishes were cold on the outside and barely warm in the middle.what a shame, as weve always liked their dim sum!
good wholesome chinese nosh. went there for my leaving do, so guaranteed good company.
terrible service, for which we paid a 12 service charge. food was average at best. avoid!
food was really good...i asked for a coke and it turned up when i got the bill at the end of my meal.  service could be better given the amount of choice in china town.

food is always good... but after ordering the pepa tofu once and getting pork in the sauce, i asked for it without the pork the second time there as i dont eat it. the waiter assured me it had no pork in and when it came, it did - can you please not mislead customers as some people strictly dont eat pork.
very nice food and customer service
worst noodle, never had this bad one in chinese restaurant. very rude service. good dimsum but rest was shockingly bad. don't understand how this place is rated well..
had pork shar-siu, pak choi and beef with black beans
fabulous dim sum. friendly service.
great dim sum. really good quality and price. good service. typical chinese food. very fresh and home made
no booking but seeated immediately fantastic food fast service would highly recommend
great service for large gatherings (10+) with some kids.
clean place the staff are polite food was okay
waited 55 minutes for a meal with 2 children and then only half came out and was luke warm. not good by any standard
pretty good yum cha

went in around 13:00. seated right away. took a while to get our drinks, and even longer to get our food. the sweet and sour chicken was cooked to death, but the dumplings were right on par. really good. the staff are okay. a lot of them seemed like they struggled to understand english.
food can be good until you order an expensive lobster noodle dish and find a cockroach. and then the waitress tells you it is not.
one of the better chinese restaurants in soho
good food! recommended!
quick business meeting over dumsums, service was quick, staff was pleasant and food was great.

: only go if someone else made plans & be mindful of what you orderthe pecking duck was fair however the other dishes (char siu, hot and sour soup, chinese broccoli, and pak choi) fell very short of the mark
easy location to get to, decent enough food the service wasnt to great. may visit again when next in the area.
nice place tucked away off the main walkway which makes it more private and quite.good food but not cheap but if you like a little privacy in the busy china town area worth a visit.
good grease
best dim sum i've had in london. it seems to have got better over the last couple of years too. xiao long bao was excellent, exactly the same as in shanghai! all dim sum very reasonably priced too.
reasonable food.. good prices at cntre of china town

the food is good but not worth the amount you are paying-quite pricey. staff were friendly and gave us an extra dish free of charge when they made a mistake (gave us the sauce after we finished eating it) with the original dish. nice ambiance compared to other chinese restaurants.
reasonable chinese food, but service is somewhat rude. its plenty big enough for many people though, so you are safe to get a table.

i hate to say this, but this chinese restaurant in the heart of china town has seen better days. i remembered it as been nice cozy with good food. but now food is so so and not particularly hot, in fact cold. not good.

a bit of a find behind a subtle entrance. full of native chinese which is always reassuring. however, the food is hit and miss with only some dishes being good. needs a refresh, has become a bit tired.
great service, amazing food choice.
lovely entrance into the restaurant, the food was very tasty and it was nice and atmospheric the night we went. would certainly recommend!
good food nice deco enjoyed my lunch
reasonably good for dim sum in london chinatown on the average budget.
very good food and friendly staff
food is tasty
it was not what i expected
usually i don't enjoy chinese food.  this is the absolute exception
the imperial is consistently good. it has been around a long time but never fails. the dim sum is excellent and very resonable. i always recommend a tsingtao beer with dim sum.
love the dim sum. always go there when i am in london. quick service and clean surroundings. recommend it for dim sum.
nice food, friendly staff and a bit more up market than other places in china town.
good dimsum, attentive service.
lovely meals
dim sum here is exquisite.an absolute must.viva la dim sum cart!
food was tastey, but service was poor, never got all our dishes and they tried to charge for them. so check your bill!
we popped in for a pre-show meal.  we chose the roast duck and aubergine with bean curd.  omg. amazing.  if near shaftesbury avenue / china town. this place is a must.
good dimsum, a little pricey
no dim sum available, rude staff
this is my go to place in london for dim sum. served until about 4 ish.  after then they just offer a few basic dim sums.   the regular chinese food is ok but nothing super special. also great value.

great food, good restaurant and the entrance is set back with a bridge and indoor pond with some huge koi carp. i've been coming to this restaurant for several years and i've never been disappointed yet. it's the only chinatown restaurant i will use now because out of the others i've been to, this one is miles ahead.

really bad and bland food. i ordered a beef dish with cantonese sauce and what i got was literally pieces of beef in ketchup.also ordered a rice and chicken dish, the rice was ok but the chicken was the blandest thing i have ever tasted, just straight up water boiled peices of chicken, no seasoning no flavour, nothing.
good variety, bit too heavy handed with the msg
the best for dim sum in china town. a little pricey but worth it.
great food,service and atmosphere.

went in and it looked really nice from the outside. great selection of dishes on the main menu and there is a separate dim sum menu which was incredible. slightly pricey, but the quality of the food balances it out. good selection of wines available too. would revisit again for sure.
great for dim sum, friendly staff
authentic, good atmosphere, nice surroundings and excellent food, service was friendly although staff were slow to engage and take orders.

food was ok, as well as the service. nothing special. the majorly negative thing was that nobody has warned us in advance that they dont accept contactless payment, so we couldnt pay with apple pay. this is not acceptable in the modern world, where you can pay with apple pay wherever you want.
been here a few time and the is consistently good! nice chilled atmosphere and we had a nice bottle of sake!  staff were great also!
a set meal for a party hit expectations. most dishes were tasty & fairly priced. the staff are friendly & the place looks ok.
fantastic chinese cuisine.

if you are looking for authentic chinese food, this is the right place for you. really welcoming atmosphere, kind and attentive service. every dish i tried tasted really good. nothing to complain about, probably the best restaurant in china town.
delcious and hits the spot after a strong night on the tiles. don't dilly dally, closes before midnight.
popular restaurant ideal for groups.serving the usual favourites, perfect for feasts!

my favourite chinese in chinatown for the quality of food. the portion sizes are smaller than usual and prices higher than usual, but both are acceptable for the quality of food. the service is ok for chinatown but would be considered poor for the price in any other cuisine.
chaotic service. mediocre food. stuff turns up in person and on your bill you didnt order. ok wine list
that was the softest most delicious roasted duck i've ever tasted, i take off my hat for this extravagantly delightfull meal!
great here. wide range of chinese food. very nice cosy entrance with bridge over fish filled pond. cost atmosphere inside

a good place in chinatown for reasonably priced good food. i have had dim sum as well as dinner here numerous times and it has never disappointed. the small bridge and fish pond at the entrance also lifts the overall feel of the place, setting it apart from some of the other dingy and sticky chinese restaurants around.
the food is really good. not cheap but worth the money you pay. service needs polishing but all in all a good restaurant.

the best chinese food that i have tasted in london's chinatown. the food is not only good, the environment is comfortable and the service is excellent.  highly recommended.  listed in michelin guide 2017

solid chinese, slightly away from the crowds of china town this is always a reliable find, not least as it has 3 floors wait time is low. sign of a good spot is normally majority of people in their are chinese, and service is efficient if a little unfriendly. also v good value.
great food. not so great service. they forgot the rice and soft drinks were flat.
food superb
delicious food amazing quantities, have gone often
nice food, 2nd visit and very fast, authentic and dim sum is yummy too
the food was pretty average but the service was great and staff was very friendly

decent place for dim sum. is deceivingly small from the outside, but once you enter there're three floors of restaurant space which means even very large groups can be catered for. slightly upscale and quite fashionable decor compared to some of the other chinatown restaurants.
always been there with at least three people or groups. old style food and generally tasty. just a slightly salty and greasy. others are ok.

terrible experiencerude staff, found myself having a stand up argument with a waitress during dinner! main course served before starter and then told it was our fault!dishes extremely small for the price wont be returning
excellent food and great atmosphere . i would recommend the half braised duck from chinese new year menu.
not the most tasty chinese food but decent for the price
yeah very authentic tasty chinese
nice chinese restaurant on the site of an old coaching inn. good service and good food. the wine is expensive.
excellent food. a little expensive

great location. and delicious dim sum menu. easy to read menus available with pictures. staff were very helpful. well presented traditional foyer area. good value. just a little outdated seating, which was on the dark side.
good food and fast service
karaoke machine had very few english songs from this century and no japanese ones. food was mediocre. some of the staff were friendly, some not so much.
my favourite chinese restaurant in chinatown. have been going here for years. love the roast pork! they did not deliver but i enjoyed going there to pick up some takeaway.
2nd time visiting and by far the best chinese i have ever eaten. little more expensive than other places chinatown, but definitely worth it. one of the few 5 stars i have given.
great food, great vegetarian options and very generous portions! good find in the heart of china town

my bbf took me to this restaurant. you won't see it unless you're in the know. my bff is chinese , she knew what to order , all delicious food like peking duck , we had about four dishes . names of the dishes ? i have no idea.

dim sum has lost its tradition here. you just cannot have fusion dim sum - it does not work. also you need to sort out the waitering service...which was lousy. and buy your chinese tea leaves from a new supplier, the po-er tea was substandard. not on my recommended list of good eats in soho this year.
one of the best places for dim sum. its busy but that just means its good
food is good n service is efficient..price ok
hen party.. lovely food..man who waited on our table was very friendly and helpful.. will go again..take the train next time..had to drive .. parking no no.restaurant had parking..but at 8.an hour
was ok..i mean food was good but no more then other chinese restaurant! will i go again,  yes!
net work meeting and lunch. very good food. our annual pest control meeting.
crispy  is absolutely fantastic! great place and friendly service.
lovely food good service fair pricing ... definately visit again
can't comment on the food, decor was lovely but the staff made us feel unwelcome as soon as we entered. felt like an inconvenience and orders were taken with irritation. left out of discomfort.
favourite chinatown restaurant. no drafty doors, consistently good food and service.
one of the best chinese restaurants i have been to and considering it is in london the prices are very reasonable .
not a big fan of chinese food (had too many bad ones!), but this place was good. food was tasty, the ambience, the entrance was beautiful and service was great.
we have been to this restaurant three times and have been impressed each time. definitely will be back
great food for a reasonable price, efficient service
minimum spending 10gbp "we are not a coffeeshop or bubble tea", worst service ever
my favourite dim sum place in london. friendly staff and delicious food.
went for chinese new year, delicious dim sum and cantonese duck

nice chinese restaurant in the middle of london serving mainly cantonese cuisines and dim sum. try its shrimp dumplings, egg tarts and pork buns, they are tasty. prices are moderate and service is good as well.
amazing food, excellent table service. prices aren't too bad. really nice eastern aesthetic
dont bother. over priced greasy tasteless food. might want to change the oil occasionally! grumpy service. definitely go somewhere else. very disappointed
another great dim sum experience. never disappointed at the imperial
great place, nice interior, lovely food and kind staff!
pretty good chinese food. very pricey for what it is though.
one of the few chinese restaurants in chinatown which isn't a open-and-scam scheme. it's as good as four seasons. that alone is a 4* rating.the extra * is from not immediately assuming i'm chinese
nothing to complain about the food. but service was worst ever i had. beware of the woman with short hair.
best chinese food in london
excellent service and friendly staff.  food was lovely
best restaurant in chinatown. i'm a huge fan of dim sum there. highly recommended.
it was definitely better 10 years ago. even if the chicken soup is not very tasty, all other dishes were very good. service a bit chaotic but i guess we will still come back!

love this place, i've been 4 or 5 times and it's never let me down. the dim sum is excellent and very reasonably priced. only been for dinner once but it was with a large group and the food came out in very good time, no issues with wrong orders etc that you'd normally expect. highly recommend.

very nice chinese restaurant. beautiful food. uniquely decorated, with a bridge over little river and fish at the entrance. there were christmas parties in smaller rooms and people seemed enjoying themselves there. we had a lovely dinner. the waiter was very friendly and helpful.
amazing looking restaurant. helpful staff but could have been a little friendlier. food was good but didn't blow us away
love this place, been coming here for half my life. never had a bad meal.
delicious food and super-fast service.
love the food there super tasty!
average. no effort made to keep you happy
taste asian food great service!
the food was nice, but got told there was a minimum spend of 10 pp (there isnt it turns out) and the waiter made us both feel incredible uncomfortable. could never go again. disappointed.
great food, authentic location

there are lots of chinese restaurants in this area, but i chose this one because a friend recommended it. the service was pretty average, the steamed prawn dumplings were good, but the wanton soup was less than great. im sure there are much better chinese places on this strip. give this one a miss...
amazing food and amazing service
atmosphere is excellent. food is generally good. the peking duck was disappointing, and the oolong tea was less than stellar. very good otherwise. the szechuan prawn is specially good.

really lovely experience, have to walk over a little bridge with you carp in to get into the restaurant. service is good and the food is lovely. quite expensive though. there were 2 of us and we ordered 3 mains and 2 sides with an alcohol drink each costing just shy of 65
the best dim sum place in london.
good food at good price. recommended.
food was great as always. really good place and have done work events here as well. staff are great and look after you. highly recommend.
it's ok. nice atmosphere
some of the best dim sum in town. nicely hidden from the street so is a great place if you find it

we have been to the restaurant many times and generally the food is ok and i would gice it a three star. but the last visit was very disappointing. food came very late and was very chewy. they told us kitchen is busy because of a wedding - ideally should have told us before we sat down !

came for dinner. location is central in china town and convenient for leicester square. the food was only average and chicken kung po was quite tough. crispy duck pancakes were okay. service was lack lustre at best.
the dim sum were fantastic !
we love this place, been coming for years for the dim sum, great service and great dim sum
love this place , food is authentic and generous.  service is always attentive
great staff and service. try the dim sums they are amazing!
a great place! wonderful ambience and lovely food. enjoyed special bbq pork bun for chinese new year menu.
lovely settings. off the main bit of china town but close enough. delicious food
pricey but the food and service was spot on. definitely reccomend and would go again!
a reliable west end chinese restaurant. food good. i like the water feature at the entrance.

been to most dim sum places around china town and this is the best.  you may pay a bit more but you get that back in quality of food and a nice restaurant setting. clean toilets and staff are reasonably friendly and efficient.

elitist establishment with terrible service. when we dine as large groups, we are treated slightly better but the establishment is overpriced and motivated solely by making money. we won't be going back.
food is below average, very expensive. service is good, won't go back again.
food was good but service was very, very poor.  rude staff, no complimentary prawn crackers (when asked, the waiter got snippy), used plates not cleared away.  would not recommend.
good food,generous portions,careful before ordering,wasted a lot ,was a bit upset about that
my favourite dim sum / yum cha in london. tasty and fresh food that's not just the typical you get. my go to!
as ever, good dim sum

if you would like to experience one of the worst comustomer service experience ever, please make sure you good to this restaurant, where the staff will laugh at your face for the amount of food you would like to order and the sequence of it.
not great. have eaten here at least once a year over many years. felt it was off the pace. better restaurants on the main street.
excellent atmosphere, great food and the service was good too.
lovely place for food and karaoke. vegan options available!

great place to enjoy good, authentic dim sum at lunchtime. the service is fast and the food is very reasonably priced. however i find their evening menu to be somewhat run of the mill and nowhere near as good as dim sum.

incredibly rude staff- forced to order as soon as we sat, were pressured to finish quickly. whole experience was really stressful- like a boot camp meets a restaurant. treated like a fast food in and out, but they are happy to charge higher restaurant prices. food was also average so there's plenty of better choices in the area.
unfortunately both dishes were very bland and not like chinese food at all.

was there for a birthday party. poor service and food quality for 37 per person. the food was the quality if a cheap hamburger st fast-food restaurant. the only exception was the private dining room, which was a nice size for 60 people and tables covered in acceptable linens.
bad food, bad service, use to be good but alas no more
a large menu with a good variety of dishes and they also offer a dim sum menu. portions are quite large so don't order too much.
rude staff, bad food
delicious yum cha (also known as dim sum in the uk) at a reasonable price. ive never had an issue walking in without booking.
gorgeous chinese, easily nicest i've ever had in china town and not a rip off! will be back when next nearby.
excellent place. dim sum is great, good service and reasonably priced
good food...nice restaurant..poor service....i had to get up and ask for drinks...second beer never came.  my sizzling beef fried with onions came in a bowl and was cold.

very good food (especially the dumplings) at reasonable prices. i was surprised how big it was inside. the entrance is definitely a lot nicer and raised my expectations for the interior. however, it's very basic inside. it's clean and i don't have anything negative to say about it but don't expect a fancy interior.
various dim sum dishes for lunch. recommend crispy prawn dimsum. also hong kong style duck is very tasty.

the service was average, more hurried. the food quantity was good and the pricing was just about ok, unless you went for their set menu... in which case it was good! the only reason i am rating them 3 instead of 4 is because of their drinks menu... priced way over
excellent food
the 5 stars are purely for the dim sum, best in london in my experience. love the atmosphere, staff could be friendlier.

although the food we finally got was good, apart that is for the crab meat and sweet corn soup...we were not able to have the food we had originally ordered as the kitchen had run out...a tad sloppy at 6.30pm  on a saturday...so no pork...?
great food and great price for dim sum during lunch periods. staff not fluent with english, but as long as you know what you want it's fine!
no frills place to grab dumplings. you wouldnt sit down and have a lengthy meal here but its great to just grab a quick, cheap meal.

honestly? skip it... the dumplings are good but the skin is incredibly thick! order the wonton noodle soup and youll get instant noodles... seriously? instant noodles in a restaurant?! i could do better at home!
whenever i crave dumplings i always quickly stop by here. they always taste amazing. the only thing i don't like is that you can only pay by cash.
really tasty dumplings, i recommend bejing dumplings, fried squid is also really good. the food is usually served really fast and the prices are affordable.

this is a perfect spot in chinatown for wonton soup and dumplings (fried, steamed, vegetarian, duck). i normally don't go for the other options because i just love the soup. they do a nice pearl tea if that's your thing.
sadly food is really cheap, but prices high. dumplings are very poor, vegitarian ones tasteless. noodles bland.really pooravoid

enjoyed visit here, though crowded inside as weather very cold that day. excellent home made soup, bread and cake, simple food, all at reasonable london prices with view of the serpentine. took some time to get a table, the only downside. in the summer time i . don't think this would be a problem.
some good food
nice place for dumplings.
i liked beijing dumplings.
it's so good for the dumpling n their wonton soup, wishing u be success
best value for money in bahrain. the chef is out of this world.order shish tawook, bahraini tekka . grills in general are good. forget about there sweat .. unless you order a freshly prepared konafa
good dumplings! but not too fond of the other dishes on the menu
hand made dumplings, make sure you bring cash.
cheap and cheerful dumplings, boss old lady service
loved the drinks, the sushi was ok
nice little plate of fried dumplings for 6-7. no alcohol, cash only.
excellent coffeealways crowed though. victim of its own sucess
amazingly flavorful. the dumplings, spring roles, and iced teas were especially delicious. i dont often leave reviews, but this place should have a much higher rating, so im trying to help it out.
although a dumpling place l enjoyed noodle and vegetable soup. also yuanyang? coffee with tea. delicious. friendly staff
come here for the dumplings.
great food & amazing service! we enjoyed the friendly staff here and how prompt the food was, rare for london!
been coming here for years, easy, friendly, nice food at good prices
homely, cheap, good and relatively healthy choices
tasty and fresly made dumplings, it is tiny space, not expensive and worth visiting for beijing dumplings.
if you really like chinese food, then this place is for you. classic and delicious dishes with wonderful service. jen's is the top of my list for places to dine in leicester square.
dumpling very nice and made infront of us

best place for authentic noodle soup and dumplings - i've been here numerous times. you can only pay with cash, and don't expect table service, but the owners / staff are really sweet once you become a regular.

after the hype of the dumplings i expected them to be really good, but the skin was too thick and stoggy. we ordered eat in and they claimed we said take away and tried to kick us out of the restaurant for eating it in. also they have upped their prices from 5 pound for 8 to 6pound for 7.disappointed for handmade dumplings...
reminds me of hong kong, best dumplings in town. noodles are instant but who cares, it tastes good man.
absolutely rubbish dumplings for the price you pay. rude staff - said that i asked for take out when i clearly didnt. definitely do not recommend.
best things to eat are the beijing & veggie dumplings (always get steamed), the fish ball soup and the teas. meat and rice are ok, but the steamed dumplings are the star.
its amazing and highly recommended to everyone who needs a break
not the best dampling i've eaten but very affordable price. and the service could be much better

there's no words to describe how tasty the dumplings are in this place. they'll be prepared by hand right in front of you! i love how fast they'll serve you and i always enjoy their selection of non alcoholic drinks. not many seats unfortunately, and remember, this is a cash only restaurant
absolutey loved it! fresh and delicios dumplings!
amazing food! try the wonton soup and the fried pork dumplings, you will be delighted.
good british fish and chips.
there was chicken popcorn and it was really good the food yummy place
very nice dumplings and most needed roasted duck noodle soup. only cash though!
very nice staff. very nice food. small place.
good customer service and perfect tea!!

if you don't mind sharing a table and the lack of basic customer service you'll love this place.  the dumplings are awesome and the ribs are epic.  enjoy!  ps you'll also probably have to queue, you can't reserve.

ive walked past this little eatery so often and always wanted to step in for a taste, but today i did and the dumplings are gorgeous, the pakchoi is savoury, the satay beef meatballs with noodles are delicious, and the shredded pork with pickled veg soup is yum yum!
very nice reasonable chinese food
nice
ginger tea very good..belly pork delicious.. otherwise a bit mediocre

the dumplings were very tasty and authentic. my friend's hot and spicy pork noodles weren't actually spicy unfortunately. the iced milk tea was good as well. pricing is 5 for 7 dumplings (not too bad for london).
just walked past i'm afraid
best dumplings
food good but not stunning

i love this place. amazingly tasty dumplings. it's cheap and cheerful, so don't expect doting waitstaff. but find a table, order a bowl of dumplings, eat, and feel happy... and then get out to make way for the next customers!

staff are friendly but don't expect a smiley face to great you.the foos however is next level.you don't expect the flavors to burst in your mouth when you sit in the cafe but he foods amazing.the place does need to have a refurb as its a bit tatty
my go to place for dumplings - order one fried and one steamed. they are so good.
cool, traditional, not expansive, good fresh food, downtown london
freshly made dumplings. no fuss authentic chinese food. love their dumplings and fish ball soup. must try.  bring cash though, they don't take card payments

good dumplings (from what i've heard, don't order anything else). but then they ask if you want some greens (not on the menu). i said yes and then the bill came that a side of broccoli was 7. i challenged the waitress who said that was the price, but can't help feeling this must be a way to gouge the unsuspecting.

worst chinese food i've ever had... we had quite a few dishes including the dumplings, the rice dish with bbq pork and duck. all the dishes we had were so bad... very poor quality.. however, service is fast but not worth it to go there... will never go back..

appalling customer service. walked in and didn't even bother to greet or sit us down. food was horrible too we ordered jajeangmein and a rice with pork belly and roast duck, it was incredibly salty and hardly any meat
tasty handmade dumplings  does what it says on the tin !

had their dumplings both fried and steamed. the dumplings are well made and delicious. however, the portions leave something to be desired and i definitely left hungry. perhaps not the worst for the price range but i'd recommend ordering 2 or even 3 portions if you actually want to get full.
it was not my first time here but now never again! poor food, 50 cents noodles sold for 10 pounds, half a liter of water 3 pounds !! thieves26/12/18
try the lemon chicken, it is out of this world.
bad service, expensive food. dont recommend this restaurant.
excellent service and food
good dumplings made in house in front of you , very authentic, interesting expirience and fantastic value for money
great place for eats.
poor service, below average food for the area. perhaps worthy if it was half the price, but you're so much better off going somewhere else nearby. like anywhere else.
good food
during my meal a beautiful well-groomed woman came in and the staff refused to serve her based on the color of her skin. deeply disturbing.
not allot of chooses, cash only is an inconvenience.
i finally had a taste of home in that restaurant. it's all affordable, delicious, and they'll find you a seat anywhere. don't forget to bring cash, or they'll turn you away.
good cheap chinese food
great food, interesting menu system and friendly staff. should be able to pay by card though.
nice food but my hubby had a very bad tummy after his, was ill for 2 days, not sure if there was a spice etc that didn't agree with him?

i ordered a takeaway but i was told to wait outside for nearly half an hour in the cold (winter time). although i understand they are very busy at sorting out the orders, the dumplings i got at the end was undercooked. wish it would turn out better next time as i saw they make great dumplings.
ribs here are a joke. small portion and filled with bone. tea tastes like water.
i liked the vegetarian dumplings, but my family wasn't impressed by their food. over priced and not obvious that it's cash only.
just have a quick noodle is good. taste are fine.
our food felt like it was microwaved. pretty sure this place doesn't have a stove. don't get fooled by the dumpling making in the window
hand made dumplings were decent. everything else was below average. but fast service you may need to share tables with others though.
angry staff food was of poor quality overall bad experience here will not be comming back
staff are not friendly, and food is a bit pricey
not impressed with the beijing dumplings, the wrappers were thick and stodgy and the filling was bland.
fresh dumplings made in front of you. great bubble tea much better quality compared to over sweetened colourful drinks you find at bubble tea bars in the area.

cram yourself in there and enjoy the dumpling prepared just now on the table next to you. you can have bubble tea if you really must but it is far from the best around so dumplings, dumplings and more dumplings, preferably fried. they are quite basic but definitely fresh.well worth the wait for a table corner.
absolutely lovely
need up dating

i met my wife here 12 years ago! :) if you only have a few pounds in your pocket, the desire to have a nice, simple chinese meal, and no desire whatsoever to meet someone for any sort of romantic relationship, but then get married and have a couple kids with them... this is the place to go.
great food, the dumplings are highly recommended. be prepared to share a table this isn't a high cuisine restaurant, just great dumplings at a good price.
amazing dumplings!!! a must if youre in the area
the beijing and fried dumpling. both were ok. however, i definitely recommend the honey bbq pork and rice.
service is horrible and rude, they don't even understand english. the worst food in china town. it's totally disgusting. be careful.
one of the most delicious and familiar restaurants in london, i love

after coming here a few times i came to the conclusion that the dumplings and soup are the only thing i like here. meat is more bone and skin. fried dumplings are good.and really like the won ton soup.

amaizing dumplings thats true and yeah they microwave the food,yeah the service can be rude too but is something about the place and the food i dont know, when i go there i know what to spec and i always have a good time

so i followed the advice given in the other reviews and just tried the steamed beijing dumplings. i am no expert in the field, but i liked them. i went in the evening during a week day and i did not find any queue, which was fine. it makes a good option if you need a quick and cheap bite when in soho.
it's ok
excellent beijing dumplings.

one thing i love and absolutely love is their fu qing fish ball soup!! its fishball with minced pork inside. this is the only thing that keep bring me back to this place and i highly recommend this dish!!
wonderful food, amazing duck and great dumplings!
9 fr 6 small dumplings is terrible value for money. charge far less or give better sized portions; your dumplings are good, but that price bracket is despicable.
the best dumplings i ever ate. so what if it's not got a fancy layout. go for the food
love this place - hustle bustle and so authentic. no frills. delicious.

great dumplings prepared everyday right in front of their customers, fast service, and a great location (imho) makes this one of my favourite places to grab a quick lunch. it's not fancy and service is not top notch, but that actually adds to its charm as far as i'm concerned.

i've only had the dumplings but they were very good and fresh. the place is certainly nothing special decor/service-wise but it's a great place to pop in for a few plates of dumplings and get out quickly.
these hand made dumplings never disappoint! be ready to share your table with strangers.

poor cantonese restaurant selling bad quality foods. ordered char siu rice and wonton soup but it is either good at toast or authentic in cantonese style. just a restaurant in a good location that attracts innocent tourists.

i never leave reviews - but thought i would this time to save a life. i actually wish i could give no stars instead of one. the food and bubble tea is absolutely disgusting,  and the wait staff is horribly rude. will never return to this place again.
i love this place ! so cheap! and it feels authentic. the staff are super nice. just be clear with what you want as there is a language barrier.
great little cafe, with comfort chinese food at low prices. recommend the handmade section (noodles and dumplings)
dumplings specialist. it is a fast food ambience you would find in china. so don't expect service with a smile. that said the quality of the food is much higher than any other fast food.
did not go to this place.keeps piping up for feed back!
rubbish food and service. i'm literally paying 5 for frozen squid rings and lemon water (which they call lemon tea).
not the best food but no pretensions.  friendly service (in context)
just perfect
great for fresh dumplings
slow food serving with very very bad customer service.
don't bother! go to another place!
great food and drinks!!
the dumplings are really nice!
delicious and authentic dumplings (beijing-style and vegetarian) for a good price.
friendly & polite, really nice food!
quick pit stop for some handmade dumplings is always a nice experience here! get the fried ones for extra crisp! cash only and you will share a table with others. not intended for longer stays.
best dumplings i ever tasted. very cheap but quality ingridients. a classic.
cheap, quick and cheerful - don't expect super doting waitstaff or silver cutlery, but the beijing dumplings are excellent, as is the shredded pork and pickled cabbage noodle soup.
great dumplings! friendly staff :)
dumplings were ok - wonton soup was good.
food somewhat good. portions are small. the place is small but cosy. pearl tea/coffee - no no.
great food, but eat pay and leave.

one of the worst chinese joints i've ever been to. dumplings overloaded with white pepper and spice to hide poor meat quality. bbq meat is also poor quality and drowning in sauce; meat does not appear to be fresh.
had dumblings there, it was the worse dumblings that i have ever eaten. thicker skin with untasted fillings. i would not recommend.
great fresh made chinese dumplings made right there in the window.
one of the best places in london
i love places with michelin star/s. this one is not like that.but five stars for authenticity, home made dumplings, very reasonable prices.
good just for the dumplings, really top class dumplings. bad customer service, al the rest of the men is not very good.
dumplings are probably some of the worst you can get in chinatown. nice people, terrible food.
very poor chinese restaurant . dumplings re-heated in microwave , broccoli in the flour . the lady in the counter is very rude , she was speaking badly to customers .

one of the best chinese restaurants/cafes in london,  cheap, fresh with noodles and dumplings done fresh all day long. service is not the best and is not the most spacious place,but the quality of food is amazing. and the possibility of eating a delicious healthy meal for less than a tenner is impressive.
fun
very rude staff and you're not made to feel welcome at all. in the end we only ordered drinks and not food, and my drink was lukewarm. would never go there again.
their duck noodle soup was ok. but very good dumplings. definitely will come back for that.
i found their dumplings to be very tasty actually!
been here once and never again. quality of the ingredients is very low and costs hardly anything. they use magi noodles and charge 7. as one of the supposed cheaper eats in chinatown, its a rip off.

they should use chinese rice instead of long grain
dumplings are not that good and the whole place stinks, the one and the only positive thing i can say is that it's cheap.
i have not eaten there, but this is the place to buy your dumplings!! either uncooked or cooked, vegetarian or with pork. they are fantastic!
rushed and not great quality... look elsewhere for better wonton
decent food, but poor service and atmosphere. exactly what you can expect from a chinese place.
quite basic, but does the job for a quick drink or some dumplings. i had the grass jelly drink, 3 and it didn't taste of anything.

decent food at reasonable prices. dumplings were of an ok quality

simple and good value. relaxed and home made feel. great beijing dumplings - nom nom.
good food, done quick and not pricey. don't expect to have a long leisurely meal there as they'll want your chairs for the next lot
do not expect michelin star service or gordon ramsey presentations. this place is just glorious for its rough and simple atmosphere and the excellent quality of food.

i honestly don't know how everyone raves about the dumplings here... it doesn't even taste great, but gloopy, laced with vinegar ir chill oil to mask the 'taste', service is so rude as well!!the only good thing about this store is watching someone make dumplings at the window. this you can do from outside.
the service is totally not nice driven by old people, i did not have enough cash to pay 6.5, they tried to keep my phone until i withdrew money and pay by cash.

not worth it. the food was fine, if not bland, and its price too high. we were served water in dusty, plastic, cups and i found bits of a plastic wrapper in mine. to top it all off, the restaurant did not return our change despite our protest. will definitely not come back!
a scam! the food was okay. but, when we paid, they refused to give back the change.

so cute and lucky to have this! good hotpot!
pretty decent food, but amusingly questionable service.

best hot pot in london by a stretch.  great broth, great ingredients, excellent value.  dumplings are better than those at almost all dumpling restaurants in london.  and are included in the price of the hot pot.
food was amazing!  super busy so be ready to wait
authentic hot pot option in london conveniently located in china town. service typical of restaurants in china town and if you're just interested in the food you should definitely try it!

nice hot pot. good food
what a great place to eat hot pot. very nice people to help and support you.

faultless noodle dishes, especially the wuhan noodles and bizarrely, the excellent laksa. the chef i was informed, is malaysian. service is better than the usual chinatown tedium.
there have all you can eat hot pot around 24 per head, taste not bad and the staff are friendly.left one is tomato soup and right one is pig's stomach with pepper soup.

food was ok, nothing special (i didnt have the hot pot which looked good). our waitress was ok but the rest of the staff seemed a bit rude and threw our dishes in the table. toilets wouldnt flush and there was a used sanitary pad in an open bin in the mens toilet. wouldnt go again.
great service. food was delicious! highly recommended.
bought a take out.quite a wait but very worth it. wonderful food.

awesome staff and service. will recommend if you are craving for an all-you-eat buffet.

great hotpot all you can eat for 25 and customers are mostly chinese. the soup bases are really good and the pork stomach soup base is highly rated! beware that there is a time limit- be strategic!
great food, but restaurant is bit old and not very nice. however if you wole like to eat delicious food in decent price - you should try!

foods were very yummy although service was the worst i ever had in china town. i told them it was very nice foods, no smile or thank you but annoyed face. they don't even bring you plate if you don't ask. we loved the foods but may not go back.

love their hot pot, money for value is good, taste is nice as well.

friendly staff and very good food
the staff was very friendly and helped us with our order :)

the best place to have hotpot in town. only 24 for all you can eat. the soup bases are really rich and delicious. there is a wide range of ingredients to choose and they are all fresh. love the fish particularly. when i feel like a chinese hotpot, this is the place i always come.

really tasty and good service. my favorite place to do hot pot in london. but i do find it a bit expensive for the quality of the hot pot ingredients, and the service is authentic so you have to flag down your waiter (not necessarily a bad thing). careful that it gets really busy!

great oriental sichuan spicy food!!!

great unassuming & unpretentious chinese restaurant serving astoundingly tasty hotpot bone soup all you can eat cook yourself food. service was attentive and helpful helping us through our confusion which turned to delight as the mountains of food arrived and consumed with lip smacking groans of pleasure. highly recommended.
best chinese hot pot in london! must come! definitely visit again soon!

always liked the macha mille crepe when kova used to just have one location at soho. also like the sea salt lava cake. the new cheezo tea caught up quickly. will be better if it has some sitting but i guess its hard to come by in such an popular area
