great hot pot place
today i went to this restaurant it was really tasty the lamb was very fresh and the vegetables were very good as well and the waiters were very nice will be coming back again

all they want is making money from us. we ordered lots of stuff but then they just gave us less than what we ordered. but the bill still charged all even we didnt have it. the price they put on the bill is not clearlynever come back again!

my girlfriend and i tried the "all you can eat" hotpot here. the service and the food are amazing. the waiters are friendly and kept reminding us when their kitchen was going to close, and they were very efficient. the meat and seafood were fresh and good. highly recommended.
staff were rude, obnoxious, poorly organised, struggled with the food order, over charged. a generally unpleasant experience.
so good i'm returning with more friends: )
good all you can eat hotpot. get the house sauce!
really bad service,  rushed us out after 2 hour!
got tummy upset even before leaving the restaurant:(
friendly staffs, decent food
very good food however very pricey. me and my friend paid 40 each for buffet hotpot which was supposed to be 26 each.
good food.

great hot pot in central london. there is an all you can eat option which has plenty of choice. we choose three stocks for the pot and we ordered a large variety of meat, fish and vegetables. the price is reasonable and the service was friendly, i would recommend.
amazing hot pot. best place to go in china town for spicy food. the staffs were polite and service was phenomenal. the food serve very quick.
i visited little lamb yesterday, the hotpot was delicious, the restaurant location is very close to picadilly circus, chinatown. i spend only 25gbp for one person. very nice.
too bloody expensive. the staffs were not very greedy. poor services for new clients. never coming back again!!!
this is the best chinese and also mongolian hotpot in chinatown. we really loved the food. it is not expensive.

definitely the best hot pot restaurant in london, nice services, great menu choices and really decent food and at reasonable prices. my friends and i have been here many times and it has consistently exceeded our expectations.

the best hotpot restaurant in chinatown!!! they offer a variety of food for the hotpot and it was delicious, the price was reasonable and the staff was very friendly and approachable. i enjoyed my time there; the place and the atmosphere was a great place to relax and eat. very recommend it

went on sunday to eat hot pot with friends. amazing food and great customer service. the tall female host was incredibly nice to us and made great suggestions on what to order. definitely will return. would recommend to all!
food was very average. the prawns were bad - not fresh and sticking onto the shell. long wait for food after ordering.
no desserts.. would not ket me  charge my mobile, food was authentic.....
booked this restaurant through opentable. restaurant cancelled the reservation without letting us know in-advance. totally recommend again dining here.
dont forget my order:)

nice authentic chinese restaurant, unexpectedly delightful. we ordered the fish in chilli oil which was just perfect. definitely have it with some rice and greens to offset the intensity of the chilli oil.

i got noodle soup takeaway but they didn't give me any cutlery like chopstick and spoon, in addition, they use box rather than bowl for the takeaway soup, make it very difficult to eat. the food was not impressive as well, will not visit again.
good food and decent service for chinatown.
almost walked past htis place but glad i didn't... very yummy tasty food, it's simple but very good!
i really enjoyed visiting this place. everything we ordered was impeccable!! the food tasted delicious.
the menu in london chinese restaurants is often so predictable. here the food is much more exotic. a very tasty meal for a good price  - washed down with a decent house white.
i've already been here three times. the spicy dishes are quite good. chinese bbq sea bass is one of my favourite .

small and simple place in chinatown, but the food came fast and was excellent and fairly priced (had chongqing noodles and dumplings). our waiter spoke little english,  but went out of her way to help us.  this might just be a little gem we found here, we'll definitely be back.
great food and nice atmosphere. a must-try for spicy food lovers. authentic sichuan style!
nice restaurant. many choice and good moment after theater piece near of there
great
really great food at reasonable prices, with space to sit upstairs and downstairs.
very tasty and rather authentic food (and i'm native chinese btw). and it's easy to book a table even on busiest days because it's a bit hidden away in the road parallel to main china town street.
ok
good but expensive.
proper spicy stuff. reasonable prices. not children friendly. staff seemed a little rushed.
order correct but dishes lukewarm... we can forego the discussion on taste and presentation
rude and bad service. they even lied that they don't have place just because we were not big group and they want to offer table for more people so that they can earn more money. never gonna go again
looked nice and tasted nice until getting severe stomachache after the meal...will never come back again
good for the price
great authentic chinese food
very nice chinese restaurant
nice food, nice staff
diarrhea and vomit from food poisoning after having a dinner here.
worst food i ever ate
never been
rude waiter
never again
26.5 per person buffet. limited choice. fish and fancy meat need to pay extra money to get. a lot of rules, not like buffet. but bbq are really nice!
great taste at reasonable price. staff was very happy to help us customising the order. will definitely visit again.
inadequate service

all i can say is that dont give me the attitudes. just put on some damn smile and serve as you were supposed to. gosh. i wont go back in there again for sure. i wouldnt give the star if there was an option. horrible service and average food.
great food and experience!
taste is average but price is much higher than average.
decent place for lunch, i think they have changed to some sort of bbq setup now which i have not tried.
very clean and nice environment, staff were friendly, polite and welcoming. food were fresh and tasty, amazing chinese bbq, the service was brilliant, prices were very competitive as well.
small and surprisingly quiet place with friendly service in the middle of a busy city center. portions were very generous. enjoyed the place a lot!
best grilled squid in the town. the highlight of london in terms of grilled meat with modern decor. it brings color to chinatown restaurants
i found out about the chinese grill in instagram. very tasty meat and food. service is luxury. we enjoed so much!
i love the special bbq technology and taste was really gorgeous!you can chose different flavors and i will come back again soon with my friends!
best ever grilled place in china town with fancy decor. must-try restaurant in london! great taste, friendly staff and reasonable price. will recommend to everyone:)
they have a new restaurant, new furniture and super delicious chinese style grill menu. it was delicious expierence! i will invite my office colleagues to little wooden hut again.
amazing! i love this place. the food was seriously awesome. price was more than reasonable, compared to other seafood and grill restaurant in london. will definitely be back again.
i was taken here by chinese friends and was not disappointed. the chinese bbq was delicious, as were the cold korean noodles. helpful staff and good food.
delicious chinese bbq, friendly staff, and cozy atmosphere. i like here, highly recommended!
excellent food!good service !not expensive !

seriously. the food service is so slow. i could eat a cow. a whole cow. a party of 7 on the second floor. we waited 30 mins for the cold dish. another 30 mins for a hot dish. 35 mins for a bottle of wine. 45 mins for the second hot order. ....... enough says. never return.
food quality was great the first time we went there when the restaurant was just opened. however, now its trying to save budget and the food quality is reduced somehow...a shame.

omg. this is one of the best barbeque restaurants i have ever visited. i suggest you try the spify cabbage as a starter, it's so nice and succulent! the meat was very good as well, so juicy. all in all, the service was great as well. with the servers helping us with our meat.
first time chinese style bbq with my friend in little wooden hut. fresh ingredientseco-friendly barbecuespacious dinning environment. five-star recommendation. you cannot miss it
went there with 2 friends and ordered a lot of bbq. the lamb bbq is so juicybbq squid is a little bit spicy. all in all- 5 stars!
way too expensive for this kind of food, not worth the money.
this is the best bbq restaurant what i have been to.also a very fantastic place to have a party there.new technology for bbqamazing!

the staff is quick and helpful. they do speak barely english so before you go to this place try to learn some mandarin. we had dumpling, they were quite tasty but avoid pancakes. it is some matter full of oil.

good place to chill or spent time with your colleagues ,family and friends,been there twice since it was refurbished and reopened as a chinese bbq house last week, tasty original chinese style, cold noodle soup etc, highly recommended!
this place is too pricey, compare to other restaurant in china town. food is ok but most are overprice. the quantity per order was tiny. do not go to this place when you in london.
great foodi think it is the best grill lamb in london. next time will bring my friend together.

i really don't get all the negative reviews. this is such a lovely place. very tasty chinese food, one of the most authentic i had in london. service was quick and the young lady was kind and enthusiastic. we will definitely go back. oh, and dinner for two was 25 with service, for this area it's more than reasonable.
they changed to become a grill bbq place and its not for the better. staff are confused, the menu is too pricey for the quantities you get, and the whole place could use an exhaust fan. go elsewhere.
the dishes are okay, but not the attitude of the servers. they show little kindness and hospitality. i feel like i'm not really welcomed. the other chinese restaurant is better than this.

very tasty, spicy chinese, helps to know some mandarin when ordering. reasonable prices, clean and they take cards. beef tendon cooked to perfection, spicy honeycomb to die for (it doesn't contain honeycomb btw! :)will definitely visit again
better to avoid the crowds in gerrard street and dine round the corner in here. don't be put off by the seemingly plain, functional interior. the food is fabulous and generous in amount!
loved their original menu so much, used to be my favourite place in london for food. however, they recently changed their menu.

i really enjoyed this place! they accommodated to a dietary restriction and were very concerned with whether or not i liked the food. they did a fantastic job, and i hope to return here next time i'm in london!
best chinese in town. enjoyed every meal i've had here. dan dan noodle is my favorite. you can't go wrong ordering here. the lunch special for 2 is also a good deal.
the prices are good and the food is so, so fresh. there is a certain mystique to heading down that street knowing there is good food there
always the best!!!
cheap, authentic and tasty. they sell all kinds of cheung fun, noodles and turnip cake as well.

they make everything on the premises, including fresh ho fun, glutinous rice rolls, cheung fun, radish cake, various buns and other dim sum food. prices are cheap, quality is very good and unbeatably fresh.so, if you like to cook chinese food and looking for fresh ingredients then this place has got to be on your shopping list!
been here for years and years, cheap freshly made hofun and choung fun for 1 hidden down a dodgy alleyway but all good. fresh and yummy for great home cooking.
1 fresh noodles und surprisingly friendly for chinatown
this place is great. get a huge slab of turnip cake (lobakgo) and bags of buns (chasiubao) to make dim sum at home.
best noodles in london and also try the dumplings which are amazing after 5 minutes of steaming
love this small shop
thumps up
the secret shop in the middle of chinatown, cheap ho fun that's fresh and still soft to handle, yummy bao also available. all so cheap. it's amazing what you can find down a dark alleyway.
this hidden germ sells the best chinese tapas,  such as char siu bun.
a noodles factory hidden behind all the flashy chinese restaurants in chinatown. this is a true hidden gem that sells fresh noodles, in big bags and low prices.
cash only

a fresh noodle factory in the heart of london, pretty much unheard of. grab the bags of noodles for a few pounds when you want to cook them, they aren't as good within a few days as fresh (no shelf stable food here!) check their fridge for other extras, you'll find some dim sum favourites.
here's the menu incase you wonder what they got
love their products. always get cut rice noodles,  and sheet noodles for my ho fan and cheung fan. i love their turnip/radish cake as i cut and pan fry them. delish!
amazing fresh ho fun - perfect for making dried beef ho fun. massive portions as well for a pound. i would definitely recommend a visit to this wonderful establishment. pork buns are a winner too!!

i bought rice noodle rolls from here. i really like what they make. but.. the place can be easily missed and the surrounding area is really dirty. the place itself is very very compact and not exactly appetising.
best place for fresh noodle. note you have to use them the day you buy them
got the best radish cakewhy are they closing:(((

been visiting for last 16 years , price always remain the same for the ho fun 1/lb weight. freshly make every days, lot softer and tastier than those purchased from supermarket shelves. this is the best place to buy ho fun in united kingdom, there's no place like this and quality of the noodle can't be beaten

a hidden gem to find chinese rice noodles (hor-fun) priced at 1 a pack. also available are fresh cheung fun and various baos to bring home to steam. this is a small shop in the back alley of dansey place - just look for the little sign atop the door entrance and go inside.
simple, authentic, cheap and delicious.
honestly, get in before is too late!
best place for noodles and pau buns!

small factory with a tiny shopfront selling fresh rice noodles, turnip cake, various sweet and savoury baos and dimsum at the friendliest price! 5 mins in the steamer and you have all the dimsum favourites at less than half the restaurant prices!
sadly i've heard this place is closing down due to high rents. really tasty fresh noodles, 1 a pack. will be a shame to lose this fine establishment!
all food was of excellent quality
tasty
fast service, tasty food, very popular and clean environment. not expensive. good selection of chinese dishes available. credit cards accepted including american express.
great food, some have also good prices. one of the best chinatown's for sure. everything is pretty high quality
terrible restaurant. the ribs tastes like days old, ziran lamb can't tell if it's lamb or pork.
top
nice restaurant, nice food
no don't waste your money tasteless food poor quality
terrible service, dull atmosphere, bland food. i would not recommend this place to anyone.
love this place, a must visit for the food and atmosphere too.
manchester chinese town is better.. both is surrounding.. okay if you use public transport.. don't bother driving there..
you must visit! good is amazing.
some good dishes, good service. the ambience is just fine. the sweetsour prawns where very tasty and also the crispy duck. it was also good the starters plate and the won ton
very tasty good price for value
good place for meeting up with friends.

at the london chinatown restaurant you can find fresh, handmade dumplings!! the place is correctly famous for its fried dumplings, which are pretty delicious. don't get anything else, it's not worth it. bad customer service, but hey, that's part of your chinese experience!

food wasn't too bad but it was the staff that really let this place down.rude manager and the rest of the staff were very miserable and all seemed in a rush to get your money and get you out of there.
loved it. the best restaurant in china town
great selection of food.  my only issue is when there is a sign saying 'street food here', which points you inside a restaurant.  if the food is off the street, then its not street food.
i like this place
staff very rude and abrupt
very good customer service
bad food, bad service... not sure how this has a 3.9 rating. it was relatively cheap however.
lovely place very busy
very nice place. first tried it with a spontaneous crowd of my own followers, the staff were very helpful, food was great.
poor service and food was okay, nothing special, have had better takeaways
what a wonderful little place that serves traditional chinese food
loved the food at golden phoenix.

the food was mediocre at best. the chicken with chili and black beans had no taste whatever, the  spicy pork strips were thickly coated in flour and deep fried western style till it became hard and chewy. the peking duck came with pulled duck that looked and tasted like it was yesterdays leftover and the service was abyssmal....
great dim sum! comparable to dim sum found in hong kong restaurants!
nice one super hotel
great dim sum selection. freshly cooked, all reasonably priced. smallish restaurant fills quickly. friendly staff.
well, i am a chines food fan but to be very honest one can find better chines food at other places then so called china town but yes should visit once & have experience of your own.
great food hear. very busy. constant supply of fresh food to the buffet! for the price i personally think that it's great value for money!
fantastic part of london. authentic food, very reasonable prices. great night or day.
worst restaurant i have been to. rude and unpleasant straffmy stomach hurts after
great meal, we were really satisfied

china town is found amongst all the good things that are to be found in london. in the heart of touristic london it is energetic and colourful. it also has high quality and incredibly affordable food. choose anywhere, you can't go wrong.
awesome +wow
very nice

i would put zero stars this place is completely rubbish. the waitress we had was rude she gave us wine that tasted of vinegar and when we asked her to taste it she said it was fine and told us to taste vinegar is we wanted to drink vinegar.
great service super quality food, highly recommend. great atmosphere and very friendly staff. will go again.
one of my favourite dim sum restaurants in chinatown.
mediocre. overpriced. not actively unpleasant but not good either.
well quite a good restaurant for the prices

not bad, went on a monday lunchtime and it was quite quiet. shanghai dumplings are better at jade garden and generally the food is good but there's nothing outstanding. even though it wasn't very busy there never seemed to be any waiters around when we needed. the booths at the back look cosy.
best place in the west end.
tried chinese noodles + roasted duck here. superb taste. can't guarantee on other items, but you can definitely try these.

tiny portions that were completely overpriced. staff rather unfriendly. food came out in 5 minutes but was cold, felt like it had been reheated. very disappointed! local chinese takeaway was much nicer for a quarter of the price!
good for a fast lunch staff could smile a bit more
my favourite dim sum establishment in chinatown - the most authentic flavours and staff are friendly
fab food and great service, we had the duck and singapore noodles. good beer selection and some great set menus
chinatown in london is small, only two/three small streets. but its nice to see it and eat in some cool restaurant.
very typical chinese shops and food. some weird massage places but charming ;)
london's chinatown is a wonderful place to be, with genuine quality asian cuisine spread over a couple of roads. favourite restaurants include the lotus garden or dumpling legend
the choice of food exceeded my expectations. there is a lovely walk around and a good selections of restaurants ...try more than one place ...
huge choice of oriental places to eat just off leicester square.
not much atmosphere, food served very quick as is rather simple.it was all well cooked, but a little over priced.
superb place, had an amazing chilli beef
tons of aging chinese (and a few japanese) restaurants. some great chinese stores. good photo opportunities
yummy ribs, lemon chicken, friend chicken wings and fried rice. great service and they never rush you like some other places.
cheap & cheerful chinese buffet. always busy, great place for a quick meal.
who doesnt love china town! its fun and fragrant. i got to try different cakes and desserts.
weird staff not very friendly. i had stomach ache after eating there. not coming back for sure.
love chinatown

always busy, always crowded but i love it. you can choose fron a lot of restaurants. and also in love with the food stores. i bought a lot veggies and fruits  to my thai dishes. bit pricey but absolutely worth it.
the set lunch at 18.50 was great. lots of goodies and far better than any other place in chinatown at that price.
chinese new year is always great in chinatown even when it's pouring with rain. lots of food and entertainment on offer.
great food and loads of little shops to buy asian food supplies.  you must try the kowloon bakery for their pastries
nice food and service!

having seen a few chinatowns around the world i have to say this one is not bad.  it's got a number of grocery shops, chinese medicine, bakery, shops with a bit of everything and asian restaurants peppered throughout.  and it's right amongst it in the west end.

china town is a must visit area of soho, try to head down to chinatown during the chinese new year festivities for a really good time.lot's great restaurants (not so good if you don't like oriental food i guess!) and some excellent shops and bakeries.

chinatown is definitely the place you have to visit if you want to try either chinese cuisine or buy chinese food. various food choice, dim sum, hot pot or common chinese cuisine. most of the restaurants are good, however the services of some of them are really bad, and the food was way below my expectation.
very good place...try the lon don china special noodles
authentic chinese dim sum for a good price.
popped in for the all you can eat buffet. some selections were ok, some not so good. very busy and noisy but can't complain.
delicious food, good service at moderate prices. best dim sum in soho
good delishes,good service
if u very hungry its great place to eat and have good time
good food, rude waitresses and gross toilets. wont be back
located close to piccadilly circus, chinatown is teeming with people and activity as expected.  if you're looking for good chinese fare, this is definitely a place to visit.
lovely selection...delicious....cheap.
an experience, fantastic food
lovely food ,decor & staff !  but stay away from set meal deals not a lot of food for 30 a head !!!

one of my favourite places to be, all those chinese restaurants provide my country's food, some are with original taste not the kind suitable for british, heehee, if you like to try the real chinese food-new china is one of them.
mediocre food at cheap price. you pay for what you get. mostly quite dried out, and obviously reheated.
food ok. customer service could be better.
decent food. good price.
been here for dimsum and had a good time. but mix hot & cold in balance so you can lighten up your afternoon for a fair price :)
if you like chinese food the variety is good. i would recommend the new world on gerard place for its excellent dim sum

a great environment, full of great places to eat, from cheap buffet bars to more upmarket restaurants. super market sand corner stores selling chinese food to take home. the cakes next to the kowloon buffet are great but you don't want to eat them as they look cute wit the hand made pandas sat on top!!
very bad service the waiter was very rude and aggressive after we did not understand what he said..i will never get back to this place because of him..food was nothing special on top of it..
good customer service
ordered 20 lunch meal for two. ended up costing 22. small portions and very rude staff with mediocre food. avoid - better restaurants around.
they didn't provide a proper bill despite multiple insistence.
traditional chinese dishes, large restaurant space, great food.
typical chinatown restaurant, food okay, service okay, neither outstanding.
horrible! very unfriendly stuff! cold dishes! overpriced for that kind of food! horrible toilets! definitely not recommendable!!
food was good service was terrible
have been my favourite place for food :)
very nice atmosphere and very delicious!
lovely food, but waiting staff seemed like it was a chore to work there. would come back, but front of house staff let it down
decent food but rather expensive
great choice of dim sum . fabulous food service was quick and pleasant. will be returning soon.
not too good better options available in china town.
very expensive for common chinese food not worth the money
food was pretty good and service was fast.
horrible service. went there with chinese friends that said food was mediocre. for me food was ok, nothing special.
terrible, the food is full of msg...
amazing food. good portions. 10 pound special for crispy duck set. would recommend for great british chinese food
it's a busy restaurant in london china town. ok but hectic
another chinese restaurant in london chinatown. bit expensive, food is ok
the food is good i don't really like chinese and i'm scared to try new things but this was the best food ever but the minus of the restaurant is that your orders get messed upb
i guess it requires renovations, a bit more cleaning and a better distribution of tables. we were all packed in a tiny place - but i was there for chine nye -. food quite good

never have i experienced such rude service. from the start. food was ok, but not at the cost of arrogance. i went here with friends, but they seem to think being in a tourist 'hot spot' gives them the right to treat customers badly. thankfully people read google reviews and don't bother with this place.
my favourite chinese restaurant in the whole of china town in london been eating in there  for 30 plus years  great
fast service and good food.
great food. great service.
been going to this restaurant for years. usually have dim sum about every 6 weeks. love the siu mai, kai lan with garlic, prawn toast, stuffed bean curd rolls and yam croquettes.
good food and good service. nothing special though like most chinese restaurant s.
decent food and decent price.
standard chinese food that is fast and reasonable
worth trying
their vegetarian noodle is good so is their tea. their wc is not clean.
had the most amazing meal, china town has atmosphere and a real buzz

horrible service. the staff was rude to my friends and i, and the waiter did not want to explain the dishes to us. the food was ok, but i was turned off because of the service i received. there are far better restaurants in soho with nicer staff that i can spend my money on.

ive ordered won tan soup and fried won tan...the fried won tan was ok but not something you expect to get in a chinese restaurant...the won tan soup was ok too but still not that good...friendly service and ok prices tho
unbelievable that in 2019 we still can find a place serving shark fins in central london.
love the food!!
food glorious food.. good eating all around.
excelent food,  quick service, lacking atmosphere due to busy location
my favorite chinese restaurant in london
just ok dim sum. thick cheung fun. very oily deep fried veg rolls. all party must be there in order to get a table.

a great place to visit in london, easily accessed by leicester square tube station. i love how easy it is to navigate as the streets are pedestrian only. so many restaurants to choose from - a fabulous choice of dim sum from 12 noon onwards.

worst service in london... with hundreds of people constantly crowding chinatown the staff at this restaurant could care less about service or if you walk out -  someone else will easily walk in. the food was decent at best.
terrible dirty bad mannered staff and the amount of oil in the food was rediculous
it is not a huge china town for example such as china town in thailand but it is a nice place to visit in london . also it is near piccadilly square.

decent food, depressing service. the staff didn't look at us when taking our order nor when receiving payment. we enjoyed the food but not the rest. the mandatory service charge was definitely not deserved. wont re-visit; i'd advise you the same.
i always love have dim sum at this restaurant.
who is the head chef?
nice place... good food and excelent customer service
sad place indeed, food very mediocre and staff are just rude. dont waste your money and pay that bit extra for a genuine experience.
excellent food, great service, good atmosphere and comprehensive menu. one of the better ones in chinatown.

fantastic japanese food at relatively reasonable prices and a great selection of sake, we had a sparkling sake that was easily the equal of a good champagne. the bar downstairs is pricey but refreshing quiet for a friday evening.
try the duck, or at least the half duck

good prices, enjoyed the chefs special. food was tasty but nothing to write home about. service not bad - a bit perfunctory but they were busy. not a romantic spot. lots of locals and families. always a good sign.
went here by accident the foid was great! would recommend
nice place , good food and drink
too much vinegar in duck with ginger and pineapple and overally i can't tell that i enjoyed it much. the serving was smaller than i expect from chinese restraunts.
lovely foodgreat staffwell worth it!

if you're accustomed to american "chinese" food, get ready for a real experience. this is like nothing you've tried, and as authentic as you can get outside of china. i love london's chinatown restaurants and eat there every time i visit
long queue and food was over priced
good chinese restaurants
so far so good. staff always chatted together ignor customers request.
chinatown has to be on anyone's list. great food
very busy place. no halal restaurants. had a nice time with family members. children love the bakery and toy shop and nice shops for presents.
we were 9 did not book a table they accepted us great food
food is delicious, but smaller portions than i'm used to, and higher prices. very nice asian ambiance.
love it here.busy
always come here for delicious food when i miss home in london. such a vibrant and nice community. always worth for a trip if you want to experience south china culture:))
try china noodle there..is really different

bought whole roast duck takeaway this evening.whole duck chopped and packed into two tiny plastic container. very oily. stange enough,cant find any drumsticks in the two containers. definately wont go again.
fantastic place to eat
lovely grub, eat till you burst.
good quality food
my favourite dim sum restaurant in china town but only if you want traditional dim sum. might not be best for people who are not used to having traditional dim sum.
great dishes at affordable prices

the most unfriendly stuff and service, very bad experience. the crispy duck is very dry, looks poor, the beef tastes old and dry too. we ordered 3 persons menu came with only two set of saurce, can't compare with real peking duck. will never go again!
food was poor and staff slow
good service and good dim sum very tasty :)
wonderful place... loads of chinese restaurants... love the bakery there... amazing stuff...
i love chinatown food a bit to expensive but very tasty
very tasty and cheap chinese food

my favourite restaurant in chinatown. best service; one of the few chinese restaurants that does not rush you to finish the food and pay. price very reasonable. dishes are healthy and not too oily. i come here to eat almost every week!
first time to chinatown and a great first experience! the chicken dumplings + chicken fried noodles was exceptional - will definitely come again!
tasty chinese meals
very good food, people are alittle rude but it's worth the food
to many time go there getting bored. but it's good place to visit if you are visit london
i will often eat here when in london. food good, service fast, one waitress a bit direct and comes off as being a little rude but a good place to eat overall.

a very busy but exciting place to visit. chinese food here is different (but delicious) from chinese food served in the usa.example, chinese fried rice in new york is fried with soy sauce to give it a distinctive light brown color.  in london and france the fried rice was white.
brilliant food
absolutely stunning great experience

i would give this place a 0 star if i could.  the food is not only not authentic chinese food, it is also not cooked well.  the pork strips tastes like something that is better served in a mcdonald or a wok-to-go place.  the beef is stringy and not cooked properly.   the rice is stale.

i spend a lot of time in and around this area when i go to london. it's always bright and vibrant. a shame i haven't got the money to comeback and live in london. lots of happy memories of the west end!
yummy! really excellent food! i recommend this restaurant

for central london, you can get a very reasonably priced chinese meal here. situated right in china town its really easy to find. a large menu with good value set meals (probably the best way to enjoy your visit). food quality is fine and it's served piping hot. some of the staff are a bit dour but others pleasant.

the food was good, but the venue was very old og tired. the staff was extremely stressed,  so the leve of service was not good at all. er hardly got to order out food before the waitor rushed away. when we were almost done eating, they cleaned  out tables and asked if de wanted to pay.
great idea of all inclusive restaurant in combination with chinese cuisine. disappointed a bit that price at the entrance is different than inside (guess higher or lower)

good food, pleasant service

speedy service, very friendly helpful staff, delicious food, huge helpings!!! very reasonably priced. see you in april when we are back!!! (review by the teachers )

the food and the wine was great but the service was poor (the table next to us provided much entertainment with the service they got). the dim sum was a little expensive, there were only 4 veggie options and a lot of that menu had sold out.

food was great, but it was super busy and we needed to wait 10 minutes for our table. after all, stuff was pretty rude and we felt that we need to leave quickly our table because there is a pressure from people waiting for the table. i didn't feel that welcome at all.

locate centre of china town. busy place, but service is quick at the start of our meal. food tasted good and price is reasonable. ambience is good. but the bill took a while, i have to stand in front of the counter to get my bill, so have to take one star off. i'm sure it will get better though so hopefully i can rate 5-star next time.

very good food, need to improve their service. also, majority (not all) staff is a bit rude

value for money,but nothing special, buffet has no test after food can stay for hours waiting till it's finnish,and bring new cooked food, it's good whenever you are hungry, it's eat as much as you can.

good supermarket but small space can get really crowded it smells bad and be aware of pickpockets in the shop and on the town.
just fantastic shopping, so many great smells, just go and try something new
new layout is better but it is still crowded
spring rools
good oriental grocery , fast lines and they have durian !
very authentic and loads of choice. i love coming here for fresh food (vegetables, meats, fish).
well stocked oriental super - great for those homesick expat chinese. packaged soup bases are a godsend. the exotic veggies dept on the ground floor are worth exploring
one of my favourite asian markets. it does need some refurbishment though. always very busy.

i've been coming to this place since i was a kid, huge selection of chinese food, vegetables and drinks fresh fish and meat, and some kitchen ware too. they now also stock some japanese, korean, malaysian and other oriental foods.
i always buy meat from there xd
it's one of the most popular chinese supermarkets in town and often crowded.
brilliant range of asian shiz
great chinese supermarket,  lots of food and ingredients found here,  but always busy as very popular
huge selection of oriental food products packed into 3 floors
probably the most well known asian supermarket in london as they carry products from all over asia
good place to buy chinese style foods that u cant get anywhere else. does get a little hard to move around sometimes
well stocked and organized. don't like the smell coming from the butcher section.
great asian supermarket
got loads of nice produce and veg at very good prices and its in the best area for asian food dumplings noodles etc..and most are busy.
amazing asian supermarket! where you can find many things! love it.
you can find almost all the goods from china

after all these years i wonder if they're owned by the same people. generally more squeezy, but prices are strangely 5-10% less than across the street!! yes. for the same soy sauce or frozen dumpling, it'll cost less. so just squeeze abit, and know what you want.
sells a good variety of mainly chinese products/produce, but they also have other asian foods; korean, japnese and thai. it is quite cramped for space, so avoid busy times.

the largest chinese supermarket in london china town. there is even a butcher within this store. be aware that it also means the smell in this store may not be pleasant. the price is reasonable and customary. you can find almost all the ingredients you need for preparing your chinese cooking.
a great variety of asian groceries. be aware of long queue.
retailing humble chinese foodstuffs, new loon moon's gerrard street store has expanded exponentially since it opened over 40 years...

one of a few chinese supermarkets in the area, loon fung is generally better for fresh foods, having a large butchers counter stacked with beef, pork, and delicacies like chicken hearts. others are better for dried, frozen or snacks though, as their selection here is pretty small.
good range of ingredients at reasonable price
friendly staff a lot of range food good price
decent selection of essential asian ingredients and snacks. it is, however, really crammed inside
fantastic asian market! they have everything!!!
a well stocked chinese maze. very crowded on the weekends.
everyweek supply point, at the heart of london china town.
good selection of chinese and east asian food.
a goos place to buy chinese groceries
a good selection for its size at reasonable cost ! well worth a look !
dirty and overcrowded place
best oriental food shop in central london.
this place is not in the same league as see woo and its pricier as well.
sells a good range of asian foods etc but definately more targeted towards tourists than locals
you can pretty much find anything here.
smack in the middle of chinatown..nice selection of asian vegetables and food.a little pricey though
loads of nice foods to buy. fruits , vegetables, cakes and noodles
superb for all things asian and more besides. very busy and isles narrow so not the place for small children or buggies!
great place to find anything asian. a bit too packed.
great selection, can pretty much find any asian foods here. the isles are quite narrow and busy so try not to arrive with a big backpack on
good selection of fresh produce
great place to buy all kinds of ingredients
great for chinese food supplies but beware there is que from hell when you want to pay for your goods.
superb chinese supermarket selling everything possible from fresh eels to dried mushrooms.
good selection of chinese groceries. usually a wait for the checkout though.
very wide selection on south east asian groceries including fruit, veggies, meats and some alcohol. i shop there regularly. recommended.
they always have what i need.

great variety of fresh & packaged chinese ingredients, despite always being super busy, the staff are always smiling & incredibly quick to serve you. always loved this place, make sure to pick up a loyalty card!

better than most asian grocery stores in terms of inventory, but still limited selection of japanese products. poor selection of sesame oil, for instance. the meat section stinks something fierce. prices are cheaper than tesco but not as cheap as they used to be.
sometimes can buy some nice meat and fruit from here
you can get many things from here.
good, tasty, sizeable portions of food and loved the seaweed. sadly, the food that was served was mostly lukewarm. a little warmth would have made the food taste even better.
if you are stuck in the area and need to visit a chinese supermarket this is a good place to visit but realistically you are probably better off visiting one further out of the city.
i've been to 3 asian supermarkets in china town and i think this one is the best. a great selection of noodles, frozen dumplings and alcohol.
well stocked oriental supermarket. fresh meat, fish and a a good variety of veg all reasonably priced.
everything one might need for chinese cooking.but always very busy
i always shop with them,got good stuffs
terrible staff..ill mannered,unhelpful..esp the ones at meat counter.wont go again...
utterly delicious
i would love if i could talk to someone in the market to check some receipt tips! really good to find everything you need for a chinese dish.
very rude staff

very very long queue, till operators are very unhelpful. no customer concern at all. really bad. the worst chinese supermarket in china town, london.i will not go back to loon fung in china town branch again. the other loon fung branches are okay.visited on thu 26/4 6pm. really bad experience. bad management.
a very busy and small but this supermarket is one of a kind. all asian foods and you can have most stuff from here. good costumer service as well....
good selection of asian groceries. there's also a chinese butcher which is hard to come by in london.
its quite smelly yet you can find almost any asian food here.
my go to place in london for chinese groceries. always great stuff to buy. queues can be hideously long during busy periods
always packed, never able to find anyone to help you or answer questions. but it has a ton of products and the prices are very reasonable.
great shop in china town, much to choose from and very affordable. good!!

awesome supermarket in the heart of chinatown and a hidden gem for lovers of good meat since it's in a very touristy area, many londoners may miss it. the selection of asian food products and a few household items for a good asian meal makes this place a great location for your s grocery shopping endeavour.

better than it was. prices have become more competitive than they were. service .. there is some now.. that's an improvement. stocks a slightly different range of brands than competitors. we find ourselves in fung a lot more frequently than a few years ago. maybe i'm paranoid but .. the hygiene standard of the butchery could be better.

loon fung tends to be my go to supermarket in chinatown. anything i can't get at lf i pick up at one of the others. it has a good range of fresh produce. the aisles really could do with being wider, so you can move around easier.
a busy oriental supermarket with a very diverse stock level
not great

food quality was ok, once the order was made and then corrected twice!  then had to send two plates of noodles back as they were cold.  had to ask for a plate for a member of the party so they could actually eat.  extremely poor service standards, and attitude bordering on rudeness.
cold food, cold room, bs staff tried to say food was correct when i pointed something out. i've been going to china town weekly for 40 years your bs does not work. 3 out of 5 on the hygiene.
one to avoid. terrible service and takes ages to get any food served. better off heading to wai chai corner further up gerrard street.
superb food, good portion size. would happily go again. i can recommend the sweet and sour prawns.
good food served speedily so could make the theatre on time. reasonably priced
unfriendly staff - decent quality food.  no space between tables.  recommend to avoid.

they forgot our order, there was no apology, staff were rude, chucked food down on the table after we chased it up and didn't say a word. all in all not an enjoyable experience and would not recommend.
unfriendly, incompetent waiters

the worst chinese i have gone to in china town, would advice not to go. service slow, staff don't understand english and walk around as if they are dead. the chicken i ordered did not taste fresh, it had a stale taste to it. over all the restaurant did not look clean  stay away even if you are hungry.
very delicious food! it's not salty like some other restaurants. it was clean and customer friendly. the stuff answered all our questions. all of the meals were on the table within 10 minutes.

this is the worst restaurant in chinatown. actually it's the worst restaurant i have ever eaten in. if i could have given it no stars i would. staff rude and unhelpful. food dreadful. restaurant not clean. do not eat here
lovely dim sum, only disappointment was the wait due to staff shortage.
dumplings tasted like not fresh and had been frozen. staff not attentive to anything. wouldnt go back but my experience may not be a common occasion and others may love it.

terrible service, so unfriendly. no smiles, pleases, thank yous, let alone is your food ok? or why did you not want to pay your service charge? - we waited a long time for our food, with no apology for it.  very expensive for average food & extremely poor customer service - do not waste your hard earned money eating here...
if you're very picky about service, then this might not be for you, otherwise the food is amazing. this is our go-to chinese restaurant. my personal favorite - beef brisket noodle soup.
good food but a bit rude service. would be 4 stars if staff were nicer
good dim sum and lots more seats than it looks like from the window (all 3 floors)

first of all i was afraid to choose this place (because just 3,1 stars) but surprisingly everything was good. staff maybe isn't very friendly but polite and attentive that is more than enough to enjoy a dinner. prices are too big but portions were good, fast delivery.
we like slightly scruffy looking places that surprise you with good food. this is one of those. we had dim sum and really liked it. so-so service, but we kind of expected that. good value.
really enjoyed the set menu, food was lovely.  service not as bad as reviews make out. they did forget our prawn crackers though. i left happy
service was slow but good. the food portions were decent. the food came out hot and fresh.
decent food. special pricing on christmas was a bit unfair. prices were double the normal price. understand its christmas but thats a little outrageous. service was efficient. 20 for fried rice??
great food. great customer service.
disgusting food. will never come back again. extremely unfriendly staff.
delicious food and fast service.
poor quality food, poor service and dining areas filthy not recommended
authentic chinese dining experience with great quality dim sum, but be prepared for your seating to be a little squashed and for decor that needs a revamp. food quality makes up fir the surroundings.
they serve really authentic dim sum even from a hong-kongers perspective. gotta try their crunchy custard bun which is well-made. will definitely re-visit next time.
not very flavorful at all, especially for how expensive it is
alot of choice and alot of food which was delicious
good food at sensible prices. nice location. try a window table.
pass off chicken cooked in soy sauce as kung pow chicken  extremely poor. i won't ever go back.

i have visited this restaurant in china town a few times and have been happy with the consistent quality of authentic chinese food. one of the very few real chinese restaurants in the china town. not a tourist trap! if you know to order you will not be disappointed. friendly data offering good and courteous service.
the service was bad.food was too salty and weird.

pleasant enough place with efficient staff. the food itself was slightly above average for the area. while most of the dishes were fine, the shanghai dumplings were disappointing as their skins were too thick.
excellent dim sum but normal dinner is quite expensive.

this restaurant chinese food is average. but the service could have been better.  the waiter put in a wrong order first. the he forgot one of the orders. we also waited a long time just to get some white rice. by the time the rice got here, the other dishes were cold. the waiter didnt pay much attention. may be they just didnt care.
best chinese food in london always go here when in london and never dissapoints leaves me wanting to go back weeks later. drooling whilst typing this lol
very noisy and staff should smile very bad staff particularly her name is ying

average support. food just not tasty as for this price. the sweet and sour chicken was hard. in singapore rice noodles more additives than pasta and in addition too much salt. definitely not recommend!

indifferent customer service. food okay although served on cold plates. service charge included, even though customer service was almost non existent. food hygiene rating only 3 out of 5. poor value overall.
i could not finish the meal. everything felt plastic and soggy. we had 2 different meals and it seemed both had the same poorly cooked ingredients in just a different plate. boring and disappointing.

unfriendly staff. staff does hardly know any english. the wine we had ordered never came. the roasted duck was salty and more bones than meat. expensive for what they had served. worst chinese restaurant i've ever been at. when we made a remark the guy started arguing... 1 star is too generous

worst chinese in china town, poor service, food purely grease and cold. it is over priced rubbish. when i was there 5 tables arrived and left again staff were pure rude. i wont even feed it to my dog. if i had a choice id give it know stars. stay away.

food is good, great portion sizes!! however the staff aren't particularly friendly or welcoming... was a bit awkward to order because it seemed like they really didn't want to be there  but the food was really good

excellent food and service. aaa

nothing special, just your standard chinese fare. we went for a team lunch. we ordered lots of dim sum to share. good and efficient service and everything went well. just nothing special really.
food was pretty good but i do not think that it justified the price. prices here were definitely on the high side, but the location is inside of china town so it kind of makes sense.
decent priced dim sum

food was pretty standard at the time but had stomach upset afterwards, not a good sign. i don't recommend it, there are tons better places around that won't give you food poisoning. i had the sweet and sour chicken.

horrible service with disgusting food. will never come back here again. most of the waiters do not speak english and feels like they do not want to serve you at all. waste of money and the evening is ruined.

dimsum was great. the main dishes, not so much. service was even worse. waiters have no clue what they are doing, garbled english, and the toilet floor was covered in urine as the urinal was leaking. stay away!
bad food and even worse service.
great food and excellent service
standard food and extremely awful service!!!!!! the worst experience in london. never visit again and will not recommend this to anyone who wants to dine here.
great dimsum
terrible fried rice and mean staff. do not recommend. the fried rice was not fresh, service was very very slow. also not enough restrooms
food was good but way too expensive. service was absolutely terrible. we used to come here every couple of months but this was our last time.
service non existant... but charged for it....food was okay... nothing special for chinatown... 300ml bottle of chinese beer is 5 quid (after service charge) ..

it was the worst experience. the waiter was very unfriendly and unpolite. my pregnant wife asked for a table away from the ac the waiter said, she should put her jacket on!! the atmosphere of the restaurant was from the beginning not very nice. i would definitely recommend to try another restaurant. its a shame of china town london. :/

this has to be my favorite chinese restaurant ever, i try to get here for lunch whenever i'm up in town. well frequented by chinese nationals is always a great sign. i ate there yesterday and the duck with ginger and pineapple was as tasty as always. treat yourself and make a beeline for this place.
i always choose here to eat dim sum as i know it's the best for it and reasonably priced for london chinatown
our go to place for yum cha (dim sum). great selection of items for not too bad a price. service is better than a lot of chinatown restaurants but dont expect too much.
nice meal. service was ok for a busy lunchtime. ideal if you want a leisurely lunch rather than a quick bite.
excellent service and food. can't wait to return.
overpriced mediocre food. they invited a group of drunk guys in who were loud. the outside is nicer looking than the inside.
.wonderful service and food

food was nice i did send back two plates off food as i did not want chicken but the lamb meal i orderd was to hot and they was fine about it did not put it on bill i was very picky and staff was really good about it was not rude and understood
horrible food. not sure how it's still going

centrally located, fast service, some food is good, some only average. i would recommend the beef brisket soup noodles, it was excellent. price is reasonable. ambience is good, the restaurant serves a variety of locals and tourists, both were treated the same which is good to see. will try the dim sum next time, they looks delish.
slightly cramped place particularly upstairs. food is good and reasonably priced. staff is okeyish.
amazing selection of dumplings... our favourite chinese place in china town

shocked to see such bad reviews. we went a week ago food was amazing and the portion sizes were great. very relaxing atmosphere and great to do some people watching i would definitely recommend and will be going back
good food, but a bit stressful enviorment (part og the experience)

one of the best chinese restaurant in china town. when ordering allways stand and bow with hands together. say " ha soo" you will be greeted and treated with much more respect. must recommend the duck 10/10 the beers are quite expensive but then again your paying central london prices. see you soon bruce lee.
lovely food, reasonably priced drinks, fast service. an excellent place for a group get together!
excellent dim sum. really enjoyable and super cheap.
terrible place avoid at all costs.take a look at tripadvisor if you dont believe me that this place could be so bad.....it is truley the worst place ive ever eaten, then been sick after.

beatiful

do not pay with contactless here.

bad service, really stressed out waitresses. we had a table just beside the dishes that where really noisy. the food was ok at the best and extremely over priced! avoid this place at all cost!

beautiful as always
i tend to believe it is a bit expensive and if you want to enjoy a quiet time to not be kicked out sooner you finished - then avoid to go between 5pm - 9pm.
one of the best places for dim sum in london. n.b. service is average
good food, quiet place and nice waiters.
i always feel like i'm back in hong kong whenever i come here.

there dim sum is a must. especially the one with peanut and hoi sin sauce (can't remember the name but love the food)
great food and good price
disgusting

dim sums are decent but slightly inconsistent, with the siu mai being a particular highlight. service is quite typical for a chinese restaurant, being busy and efficient ratger than welcoming, so don't expect tpp notch services. for a place for dim sum however, this is definitely a place worth considering in chinatown.
worst restaurant  in london
really good dumplings
great late night noodle stop (go for crab or brisket!)
actully quite nice, its good standard. enjoy dim sum a lot and we go there with friends alot.
excellent satay chicken skewers and spring rolls and the best duck curry i have ever tasted
tasty.  great services and reasonable price

worst service ever. i ordered two dishes for me and my wife. mine came first and the other one never made it before i finished my own one. i asked a few times to chase it, eventually we cancelled the order and left. when we left the place, i saw number of chiefs just smoking outside, not preparing dishes for customers.
over priced crispy chilli beef 11.20 for that and its soggy complete rip off

we are here on christmas eve 2015, the food was ok, service was ok, but when we got home that evening i felt nauseous, but luckily wasn't sick, felt better the next morning, my wife however had diarrhoea all day. maybe a i've off but i'm afraid i just wouldn't risk rating here again.

horrible food, horrible place, horrible service. very low quality food. the food arrived 1 min after we ordered it, it looked bad and the taste was even worst than it looked. we didn't eat, we paid and we left straight away

excellent
sat upstairs and got dim sum. was very nice and came back. also works out much cheaper than you initially expect so win win.
superb dim sum (served at lunchtime only i believe). i really don't get the bad reviews here, was excellent on my visit and i want to go back soon!
great staff, ok food.  but reasonable prices.  the floors are a bit sticky too.

the food here is amazing (i recommend the three meat roast). this place is always busy and for very good reason the staff are great although a little stressed at busy periods (helpful and nice all the same).

the food was very low quality, vegetables had no flavour to them and the noodles were dry.service was also terrible. our food came at different times, and the waitress just kind of dumped it on the table and walked off without a word.
not too bad a place to get your midnight eats
wanted to bring our 15 yr old on a chinatown experience in london as we are international travellers, very rude staff unless you are chinese don't seem to want to know you, would not go back again
the food is delicious.a world taste of chinese food.
if i could put 0 stars, i would. terrible food.i'm sick of it how the food is awful, plesse avoid it!
pretty good beef ramen, also a very nice variety of dim sum. unfortunately the chef made a mistake and made us the incorrect dish but it also tasted nice.
basic but tasty lunchtime special of meat and rice (you can chose what type of meat), tho no veg, at a very reasonable price.
good place to eat!
we had an amazing lunch here. ordered about 8 or 9 dishes between 3 of us

good quality chinese food at reasonable prices for london.
amazing authentic food, staff is quite rushy
the best food and dim sum in chinese town.
i always visit here if i'm in china town, the best crispy duck great prices

better than expected - will be back for dim sum for sure.

dirty and run down
waiters hover about too much.
excellent food excellent service friendly staff highly recommended
the set menus are good value and a much nicer alternative to the buffet type set ups in the area. you also can get a pint of lager which seems quite uncommon in most other places in the area.
good food..very slow service.
great food huge portions
don't order two meals and two starters for two people, there will be enough for 5!!
i found the rice to be to undercooked starters and mains arrived at the same time and the beer was flat. there is a lot of choice in chinatown will find somewhere else next time.

i ate dim sum at around 4 pm, so your experience during the busier later hours might wary! the staff was quite quick in my experience, and they also kept answering whatever questions i had about the food whenever i called them to my table.the food was also super delicious.pretty sure they forgot about my sauce, though..

horrible service and so so slow even when they are empty it took 45 minutes for some dumplings for 2 people. :( they were delicious but horrible service and wait times. (i've been twice and can confirm it wasn't a fluke)
not so clean. wouldn't risk it.
mass produced food for profit, no interaction by staff, food very bland. not worth the money and premises in need of refurbishment.
excellent food for an extraordinary price. definetly, i will visit it again!
food ok but nothing special compare to some other restaurants in china town.
nothing special, standard chinese food
very good dim sum place is a bit quirky but great food

good dim sum menu, fast service and child friendly restaurant. reasonable prices and decent portions. central location right in the middle of chinatown, a buzzing place for tourists and foodies. within easy access to london underground.

really awfull. the terrible food was only surpassed by the horrible service. i have never experienced worse service anywhere in the world. we had five different dishes and they were all undercooked, overcooked or simply missing any taste.
did not like the food. had some stomach issues after eating there. the staff does not speak english,  so you can ask about the dishes and make your choice.  will not return here again.
terrible service, they bring us food which we didn't order. we ordered few vegetarian dishes and all tasted terrible (even rice).
deseptive, its at least three floors high. very busy, large portions, big menu, fast service and reasonable prices.
good and quick service. good food.
really good dim sum.   peking duck average.  quick service but barely polite
excellent all round
great dim sum and excellent roast meat. the noodle is tangy to the bite ( perfectly al dante). however the the skin of the wonton noodle soup is thick to the bite.

it was my go to chinese in chinatown, but i have just got back to mine with a very funny tummy :(  do  not order the salt and pepper chickenalso i think its gotten a bit more expensive. service as you would expect in chinese tbh
interior was a but old.dimsum was very good. the duck and cha sieuw with pork was served cold. but flavour was good.

i ordered food they brought me the wrong food then told me that he didn't have the food i ordered when i said i didn't want that food and i wanted to leave it said i have to pay for the food rude staff very disappointing
not very tasty and quite expensive
prices are reasonable, great food
great food and really kind and supportive staff.
average food. good place for a private chat as most of the staff can't understand english. she followed me from the w lounge.
food is not even average, duck had a lot of fat, the rice was not anything special, and the prices are quite high for the quality. avoid, there are many other great options around.

such impolite and rude waiters, one of then didn't listen to me when i was asking questions about the menu, he got pissed and start to say "oh my god". i love chinese food and the restaurant is lovely but we are still shocked about the rude ambiance ....
a pleasant and convenient stop to eat before the theatre.
worst chinese food ever. unfriendly staff overprised and absolutely tastefree

this is mine and my friends go-to place if we want to have a big and cheap chinese meal! service is typically chinese, if you have been to china you know what i mean. the food is amazing and it always comes fast and hot! this restaurant does not disappoint at all! authentic chinese food for reasonable price!
the food was cold and tasteless ... i will not mention the toilet
had a lovely dim-sum meal with a very big selection of food!worth going once with a very big group of friends! very friendly waiters :)
avoid! i wouldn't even give this place a star if it would be possible. the worst duck i have ever had. rice was completely without any sauce and the duck was just bones and fat.

came here for lunch and had the lunch special: 3 types of roast meat with rice (roast pork, bbq pork, and roast duck). service was quick and the portion was huge. would definitely come here for lunch again.
currently our favourite restaurant in chinatown (gerrard st., london) for dim sum. always freshly cooked (though no trolly - select by tick list :photo & english). great value. fully recommend.
dim sum was nice but not served hot. also dont order their taro coconut milk dessert its not real taro :/
delicious food, unpleasant service.

distinctly average. between the two of us 50% of our food was pretty tasty (if a tiny bit cold), but the other 50% was not at all good. avoid the barbecued meat dish unless you like fatty inedible cuts of pork on plain cold rice.
