a filipino ice cream/dessert place in chinatown. this is like my comfy place in london where i get to eat my favorites
amazing place to try unique ice cream. the calamansi juice is sooooo refreshing. even in the middle of winter!
great desserts, the ube shake was really good.
the guyabano ice cream (no dairy though, great for vegan or lactose intolerant folks) teleports me to my childhood. its so good and fresh  :,)
amazing authentic filipino dishes/dessertscannot recommend this place enoughsmall and cozy, with affordable prices

so yummy! the ube ice cream cake was really nice. it was really busy though and barely enough seats but i think that it was worth it! a bit pricey.. especially for what it is. but its got a really cool vibe about it so its a fun place to go!
something very different and great to experience the local filipino desserts. the desserts provide a lot of colour and texture.

very busy and it seemed like only half the staff were doing anything so it was very slow. the flavours arent really my thing so it was quite sickly, really more an instagram opportunity than a desert i would rush back for

it's a nice ice cream especially the ube ube ice cream is a must try flavour of ice cream they also have ube bilog which is their best seller i recommend it to anyone who was looking for good dessert place.
got the halo halo and the ice cream bun, was good.  although we couldn't finish the halo halo fast enough so the ice melted and watered it down.
best filipino ice cream especially if you wanna try ube! halo-halo is a must try!
feels like home. they serve the best philippine ice cream in london :d they have bilog and halohalo.

you can find authentic filipino desserts here, you can find it a little bit pricey but its all worth it. the ube and queso ice cream was the best with also the bilog which is ube ice cream inside a warm pandesal bun.
is a little cool store, full with history and sweetness. the attention was polite and the treat in point, good presentation and flavor.
amazing dessert place. would recommend the ice creams
so tasty! i fell in love with ube after this very messy but delicious milk bun filled with the smoothest ube ice cream! love it, been back twice already
first shop in london that i have tried halo-halo!  and its good, except for the ice they are using. because theyre quite big. but the ube ice cream is soooo good and cheap price as well.
loved it! the ube bilog is amazing

very pretty deserts and drinks and for that i give them 2 points. the seating area is nicr as well. however, we did not enjoy it at all and all the various deserts we tried we could not have after the first few morsels.perhaps it requires a different pallet
i had the bilog with chocolate ice cream. i definitely recommend it.

authentic filipino food thats done with a twist and unique way. its as good as it looks. noticed its always busy because it must be really good. having said that though they move line pretty well with a system.
everything from this cafe is amazing, make sure to get the ube bilog and ube shake!
pricey but amazing philipino desserts, the taro (ube) ice cream is amazing.
the milk bun was a bit sweet and doughy. ube ice cream great though.
having never tried bilog before, i was entirely blown away by how soft and warm the milk bun was. it went really well with the ube ice cream i got.
nice vibe, milo ice cream with a milk bun was nice. a bit too sweet for my liking, seating is a bit tough. i'd say priced 50% higher than real value, good nevertheless.great music.
magical ice cream. it was great to try something from the philippines, something not as commonly found as your normal ice cream scoop. the staff was awesome and the shop is so cute!
well worth experiencing dirty ice cream! i had a fantastic coconut variety. reasonable price and good service.
nice selection of deserts. enjoyed the tart the most. if you are a matcha fan, then a must go place.

not your usual ice-cream parlour. unique flavours from the philippines and other filipino deserts such as ube brownie, buko pie and halo-halo. excellent service and a clean environment. would definitely recommend if in chinatown looking for something different!
the ice cream was outstanding! i had the purple potato and charcoal coconut. both delicious!
love mamasons, they really know how to utilize ube and i would highly recommend the bilog as a lovely post dinner treat.

overall great ice cream, with their speciality flavors being purple ube and black coconut. the taste is very good but definitely pricey. 4.5 for two modestly sized scoops. seating is plentiful but cramped and the shop can get very crowded. worth a slight detour if you're in the area already.

some of the best ice cream i've tasted, fast efficient service and really polite staff. this stuff is strange looking but far exceeds expectation. give it a shot, i'm sure it'll surprise you. i'll definitely be going again very soon!

this ice cream place is very interesting. it's not your usual ice-cream shop. the flavours they offer are quite unique, and the ube bilog is something i was very pleasantly surprised by and would definitely recommend it.
i love this place, it was magical. the ube ice-cream in the middle of november was such an experience! loved it!

amazingggg desserts, especially if youre a lover of ube like me! each dessert was 6.50, the halo halo was good, very filling good for sharing. ube brioche bun was good too! a must try in china town :)

when i miss desserts from home, this is one of the places i go to. though the halo halo should have *more* ingredients, it still tastes like halo halo.i then tried the bilog, and it wasnt too bad, guess the price was a bit much though.it's a small place so it's hard to find a good seat.
aesthetic is amazing and wow their bilog was great and the ube ice cream is so great (first time ive ever tried either) id love to return
ice cream in a donut. nuf said.exotic flavours, colours and friendly atmosphere! decent sized scoops too, makes it all the better
staff were not overly enthusiastic to serve us and prices are a bit high for the products received. not bad but wouldn't rush back.
this is a must to try when in chinatown. the price was about 10 if im not mistaken.

nice cosy place for a quick dessert in chinatown! the ube bilog is an absolute must, with a great combination of the warm milk bum and the cold ube ice-cream. (which isn't too sweet!) so delicious! friendly service! would go back again!
sometimes too sweet, but really interesting flavours!
nice ans original. very much on the sweet side though and very filling.
my friend and i tried the ube hot chocolate drink and it was unappetising. the cream was lovely but the warm drink under was gross.
the ice cream sandwish was deliciousand the halo halo was very nice. would definitely go back.
great customer service, the ube ice cream was too sweet but it was nice. the ube coffee latte was really good too.
busy but delicious and worth the wait!
lovely decor, great selection of filipino desserts, great flavours and large portions. guyabano bilog is my summer flavour.
pricey...but it was a good one off treat.
filipino ice cream flavors on point! so so so good. doesnt get any better than this.

pretty much an ice cream filled donut! what's not to love  this filipino desert is found right near chinatown, don't miss out! i recommend trying the ube flavoured ice cream (native filipino purple yam) and defintiely get a bilog!

i've had the ube bilog and it was amazing. soft milk bun, toasted and filled with your ice cream of choice (they focus on about 6 flavours)! may look intimating at first but it's well balanced between bun & ice cream, hot and cold and overall yummo.
amazing! friendly staff, brilliant clean and vibrant flavours! my new favourite pudding without the guilty feeling. love it!

this ice cream parlour is quite small...and it's popular..so if you want to sit down you may have to wait.  i had the halo halo which was excellent and comparable to ones i have had in the philippines.
very busy,orders being taken but the preparation of the orders not keeping up so long waiting times.
the bilog is worth a try!
the best delecious ice cream. try coconut flavour   simply the best
great deserts quick service and funky interior design.
the black coconut ice cream is the best i've ever had
coconut ice-cream in a soft hot bun. yum. perfect post wong kei.
delicious and unusual philippine ice cream flavours (and a few other treats) served with great charm in a pleasantly unpretentious setting.
im obsessed with ube. ube doughnuts, ube bilog, ube coco, its awesome!
oh my goodness, the ice cream was delicious! already sold out of black cones though so i am going to have to go back
food is great but space is very tiny and you can't fully enjoy it due to having to eat standing. pricey. very very busy at some point.
the ube is delicious. very unique ice cream, definitely worth a try

so being a filipino of course my expectations are high. the halo halo they make here is genuinely the best ive had. and im eating all the ube ice cream to make up for distance between here and the phil. i cant stress enough how bloody amazing the ube ice cream is! its a little pricy but man, its so worth it.
love the ube icecream!

i love this filipino dessert bar, especially the ube bilog (ice cream filled milk bun) and ube donuts. they do great coffee as well. the place is beautifully decorated and the staff are always friendly.

flavors that will rock your head and will not find these flavors anywhere else.  had a taste of things on the menu and will definitely be visiting soon.  loved the fact the deserts were not to sugary.
one of the best dessert places in london, ube bilog and ube brownie are especially excellent!
now this was the highlight of my full trip to london. don't miss out the halo halo drink & the bilog. the aftertaste is still on my tongue

small but niche place, few seating options and staff were clearly very busy but very helpful and patient. although a filipino location the food doesn't represent all filipino food completely. maybe because of some ingredient changes...

best ice cream ive ever had. it took me back to the philippines in the first spoonful. absolutely delicious...and you wont find these amazing fili flavours anywhere else outside the philippines! please go to mamasons. ill definitely be back soon x

bilog with ube flavored icecream! it was my first time to try out some philipino desserts and it was a delicious experience. the portion is quite big (well, considering the value you pay for it, it should be like that). its better to share the piece with your friend! the ube taste was quite rich, totally to my expectations!!
we went in to try their bilog for the first time and it didn't disappoint! absolutely delicious!
loved the milo bilog
nice, but hardly got to try much as machines were not working and ran out of goods. shame really
really delicious drinks and icecream
both ladies were so helpful and friendly. ice cream was incredible (try the queso bun) the girls and i loved it!

lovely little cafe serving really tasty and interesting asian-inspired flavours of ice cream and other desserts/drinks. i tried the bilog bun with ube ice cream which was delicious. and you can ask to taste a little of the flavours if you are unsure!

i enjoyed the dessert and the decor is hip and trendy. their staff were very friendly and accommodating. i will definitely recommend this ice cream cafe to anyone who fancies different exotic flavours such as ube, calamansi and black buko.
come here for all things ube (purple yam)
really interesting asian flavours of ice cream and efficient service. will definitely return to try the other flavours.

i love mamasons, they have the most interesting flavours in london. the kentish town spot is better, but the chinatown location is more convenient. all the flavours are great, and the space is fun, but seating is limited.
great variety of filipino ice cream flavours served in plates made of coconut fibre. tasted yummy, service was good and the shop is lovely!
a delicious filipino dessert stop.
halo halo is good but a bit western version than the usual filipino taste. a bit expensive.
lovely ice creams, favourite is the black coconut one - best one i've ever had
delicious ice cream, generous space with table and bar seating. friendly staff :)
very nice but a bit expensive!
the best ice cream for me in london. i just love the coconut charcoal...

super delicious bilog and ube brownie! brownies are only available on the weekends, definitely a must try! if you like something sweet then go for the brownie, if not the try the ube bilog! they also play good music there. try to come early as the bilog is usually sold out at 8.30.
the bilog is pricey but absolute heavennnnnnn!
its a good place to reminisce classic filipino desserts. they retained the classic taste but added their own modern twist to it. everyone should go.
i can't describe how good the ube coco is, you should try it for yourself.the place has good interior design.
nice to see filipino businesses prosper
interesting filipino ice cream joint. we tried their sweet potato flavour and that was pretty nice!
love love love the ube milkshake, although is a bit too thick at the end, but the first few sips are excellent.
those buns. nuff said.
ube bilog, ube doughnuts, i love ube everything
loved the halo-halo and the black ice cream
best ube ice cream in london...
finally somewhere to get ube ice cream! great spot for ice cream & their calamansi lemonade is good too!
delicious. expect a small line. not a lot of sitting room but worth the experience.
a must try. amazing halo halo, love the lemonade ... the ube doughnuts are great too!
top
the bilogs are
very tasty love the ice cream
heart ice cream and friendly staff!!
the taste of philippines
must try their ube, kind service.please look after your belongings too.limited seating area and long queues are expected. no toilets.
delicious, but be prepared to not find room to sit
it's not easy to find ube ice-cream in london, now i know where to go to get my fix.
amazing
lovely exotic desserts and friendly staff. try the queso ice cream!
great desserts and good service.
very good ice cream
original ice cream a bit pricey

great place obvs. in chinatown second branch in kentish town. great filipino icecream in the heart of london across the road from leicester square station. specialising in ube, halo halo, pandesal bilogs and barako coffee.
delicious desserts! tastes like home.
the ube hot coco, calamansi lemonade and bilogs top 3 for me, rest of the menu is pretty good as well! oh and the ube donuts on the weekend
great icecream
fun and exotic.
amazing as ever '
nice little ice cream shop
the ice cream favour is very special. really like the cream cheese favour
delish! the halo halo is superb!
the creamy ube flavoured bilog and refreshing halo halo is so delicous. staff members were so friendly and explained all the flavours to me. the shop interior is perfect for taking pictures.
ube (taro) and black buco flavour ice cream
friendly staff and great ambience
had the bilog bun with ube ice cream. freshly made and tasty. beware it can all get filling quickly.
best of the best ice cream ever
interesting take on the traditional philippine halo-halo. great use of local ingredients that are very similar in flavor and texture as the traditional ones.
loved it so good !!

a filipino dessert shop where you can have barako coffee, ube ice cream, mamon and the all time favorite  halo-halo! a must try for someone who hasnt tasted ube. the place is a little bit small and people are coming in and out  especially its almost summer time.
perfect black ice cream with bread
i love the icecream there and the staff are really nice
ube ice cream in pandasal. tastes just like in the philippines.
amazing - had the best ice-cream sandwich there. ube ice-cream was really tasty and the bun warm and soft.
i love the halo halo it's open a new spectrum who knew ube ice was so good over a nice float.  at the bottom of the glass palm coconut seed and young shredded coconut.  it's an amazing experience.
i don't know what it's called but i had some donut stuffed with milo ice cream and it was damn good..
delicious ice cream ! the flavours are creative and the staff is friendly. definitely recommend !
so good! i recommend the ube bilog

excellent place for a pit stop and a cool dessert. had the ube flavoured bilog, which is like a hot ice cream sandwich, warm on the outside cold on the in.my only comment is, put some mango flavours options and maybe a plain coconut flavour
this is the difference between light yellow and white guys... ive wasted 3 for nothing....
can only give a 3 star currently as didn't stay too long or try enough from the menu. however what i did try (the ube hot chocolate) was delicious and really helped on a cold day
delicious and interesting desserts can get very busy so be patient, it's worth the wait

amazing ube ice cream! very rich and creamy, with still a nice amount of the ube flavour. would definitely recommend the "bilog" which is effectively an ice cream sandwich, using their own take of "pandesal" - when served, bread is still nice and warm that perfectly goes with the ube ice cream.
all i have had is the bilog (hot ice cream sandwich) and it is amazing. both milo and queso flavors have been excellent. that hot sweet bun with cold ice cream is a fantastic combo.
quick service and delicious ube ice cream dessert. we went at a fairly quiet time, so it wasn't crowded with people, which made it a nice, quaint place to chill at.
the flavours they offer are quite unique, and the ube bilog is something i was very pleasantly surprised by.
delicious ice cream stuffed in to a freshly cooked bun
amazing! love the purple yam icecream!
love this place amazing delicious dessert and milkshake

very cute little filipino ice cream parlour in china town - with unusual flavours and servings. tried the ube and guyabano ice cream and it was delicious. will definitely return with more space in the tummy to try the other stuff. the staff was friendly and the place was jam packed! thumbs up!

super small shop but full of big taste. the decor is fun and cozy and limited seating . i walked in blind not knowing what to order so i asked the staff for recommendations and they definitely led me in the right direction .
ice cream was tasty, shame i couldn't try the black buko and ube flavours as they were out of stock when we went there in the late evening.

beautiful little shop where a lot of filipinos congregate- and no wonder, since the desserts are delicious. definitely try the ube and white chocolate coco if you pass by, its amazing. i havent tried the halo halo yet, but ive heard good things.
good service. great vibe. but the milo tastes like chocolate and not milo but the rest is really good.
enjoyed my experience there.  staff was helpful and friendly, service was good and efficient.  i liked the bilgo with ube flavour.  though i did feel it tasted a bit bland.
great to try and would definitely come back again!
as always amazing food experience...i always recommend it as an authentic food place in london.
definitely worth the visit

one word: bilog. the black buko ice cream inside the warm toasted milk bun dusted off with a generous amount of icing sugar is my go to.  staff there are all pretty nice and chill and the atmosphere of the place is just cool. can't wait for my next bilog visit
toasted pandesal with ube and the ube donuts are amazing!
ube flavour ice cream is real yummmm  not really like the black colour coconut ice cream thou, was too sweet. really cozy place so would rather recommend take away
it's pretty good, but pricey.
amazing halo halo and bilog and its a cute little cozy place
unfamiliar flavours but worth the risk. delicious.
bit too sweet.
ube and coconut flavor. the scoops are sooooo big

i really like the mamasons in camden so perhaps i had hoped too high for this location, but the service and ambiance were both lacking. the treats are still tasty, but somehow less sweet when served poorly.
enjoyed their yummy doughnuts icecream so much, as well as their brownies and the shake
had haircut in last three years here. rly good even i am not living in london and i was always coming to london to do haircut in this store. but sometimes the time to wait is a bit long
best hair cut ever!
went there a few times for a haircut it was ok but the last time it was absolutely horrendous.
veronica is super nice and professional! will definitely recommend for waxing

veronica and her staff were fantastic- very thorough, detail oriented and welcoming!  i was very pleased with my shellac mani/pedi and look forward to a massage next week. highly recommend maple salon!
great mani and pedi bought a voucher on groupon and really enjoyed it!
nice lashes, if not a little too dramatic. i don't think the practitioner understood my request.

would not recommend for waxing. it was particularly painful (small patches of hot wax applied 5/6 times on the same area), and when i came home- i noticed there were quite a few hairs left after brazilian hot wax, as well as after strip leg wax.
i went for a thai oil massage and i was very happy. i will come back for sure. very professional and friendly stuff, also very clean place. i can definitely recommend that place.
great eye lashes, she took great care and attention in making sure they were a high standard. super natural and great quality. i would definitely go back

great central and convenient location to find and very clean and chic inside. i booked a massage through groupon and was well worth the price and quality, felt wonderfully relaxed afterwards! highly recommend
staff very very rude and unprofessional. they cancelled my appointment 90 minutes before without apology, then charged me for it and refused a refund/ reschedule.
elaine was super nice and great at spotting my pressure points. simple and no frills, but one of the best places for massages in london.
best lymphatic drainage massage ever! very professional sympathetic and above 10 stars
went for a treatment with groupon voucher, and once started was very good and calming.  great conversation too.  good luck there

great salon just few seconds from leicester square. i had a deep lymphatic massage and i felt so good right after. i am going every week for different treatments and it is worth it. staff is amazing, especially 'c'. very professional. highly recommended
good, my barber you moved from elegant to this place. still with the high quality service
amazing prices, big portions, incredible taste. highly recommended!!!5 stars :)
cheap and cheerful japanese diner, big hearty dishes,  cash only!

as someone who is half japanese, i can confirm that this is not japanese food. however, everything else is great! the food is cheap, tastes good, comes in massive proportions, and you'll get it no more than 10 minutes after you order on a busy day. you can eat for 8 and it won't come to 70! a great place to go to with friends.
amazing sushi & very good prices.
very cheap but nice food. highly recommend
great food long que
best place for good cheap food
good price good food in the centre of london
very nice japanese restaurant well located in chinatown area with very reasonable price!! highly recommended if you have a crave for japanese food
i ordered chicken katsu curry. food is cheap which come in a large portion. food is nice too. the staff there is friendly :) recommend

really good value japanese food in...chinatown. you're definitely not paying for the atmosphere or service but the food is pretty good. had a chicken katsu curry and a drink for less than 10. not bad at all for central london.
amazing food and big portions too!

terrible experience:we asked for a kare to share in 2 people. the dish was reasonable, however the establishment has a minimum consumption rule of 5 pounds per person and our bill gave 6 pounds. we were extremely ill treated and forced to ask for something else we did not want.

the taste of food was great, but the women's toilets were nasty. it is about overall service, not just the food. for that reason i'm changing the review and taking two stars down. please improve the cleanliness of the bathrooms!!!
very cheap food which is tasty. i always go for the chicken katsu curry
very tasty, good portions, great price!
delicious food and drink
just cheap but not great food nor experience
excellent food! it can get really noisy, but the food and prices beat everything.
excellent food.
price worthy.
best best best japanese cheap eats in london. cash only

not quite the same anymore compared to 10 years ago... food remained cheap, portions still large, just quality gone backwards a little since... hope they could improve as misato does bring back some great memories...
very nice food but not for the stuff
excellent service and the food is very good!

the rice was soggy. the fried chicken wasnt crispy, just exceptionally chewy. they charge service charge, which is crazy considering the level of service. they wouldnt even give me a second spoon, when i ordered soup and rice...the sushi is pretty good, and good value, which warrants 3 stars.
great little resturant. prices have been great so the quality and the quantity of the food. highly recommended!
one of my old time favourites! if you are into japanese food, this is a place to visit. small seating area, so be patient..
probably the best japanese restaurant in london.
lovely place, great food.
very good fresh food.we were family of 5. our check was 42gbpthe food was very good fresh and tasty
cheap food with large and delicious servings.
food was decent albiet a bit bland. service seemed was nice despite our group being loud sometimes.
good portion sizes, tasty food and reasonable prices for central. there is sometimes a queue that leaves the door during busy periods, but wait times no longer than 15-20 mins in my experience.
great service for reasonable prices. though the queue to get seats can be long depending on the day.
been coming for 10 years. it hasnt changed one bit and that is a good thing.
very good udon!
had to give it 5 stars when a violin cover of despacito started playing. gorgeous food at a great price, look at all these reviews!

tasty japanese curry - we went for beef curry rice and chicken katsu curry rice. decent portion of main dish as well as side salad with not too much rice. service was fine. waiting time was short enough at 19:30 on a weekday. highly recommended. will definitely return to try the udon.

great place for amazing japanese food, served fast and very reasonably priced in central london. waiting is normal for this place, always packed with dinners but isnt a long wait. leave when you finish, not the place to linger which is most restaurants in china town. bring cash and enjoy!
best curry and noodle soups.
veey tasty food, nice staff and great value for money. inexpensive gem in london's chinatown.
big portion, good food with affordable price. highly recommend.although you should eat your food slowly. they will stare you down as soon as you finished.
yummy and good for value
fantastic hidden gem, good size portions so good place if you are hungry.
got seated quite quickly, food arrived quickly and portion sizes are good. only downside was the chicken was slightly more undercooked on my katsu curry
authentic japanese comfort food, soul food. and soooo cheap! don't expect luxury but the service is courteous and the food takes me back to home food in japan
had good sushi here. it's a really busy place but the service is very quick, i had my sushi in 10 minutes from ordering at lunchtime. one of the best value for its price for sure.

this is just a quick eat restaurant.price is cheap and taste is just as you paying for.they accept only cash and charge you 12.5% service charge as i dont get any good one.its average around this area. i might come back one day.
cheap nice japanese food
the tori karaage with rice tastes great with a really reasonable price! i also ordered tempura and it's also good. the staff there are also friendly.
solid 3 star restaurant.good price, good portion, average tasting food.this place is definitely not a 4 star restaurant, but not a bad place to eat.

love this place. ive been going since i was young and the prices and portion size havent changed much. its got a simple menu but its so tasty and affordable so theres always a long queue during peak times.
massive portions & so delicious! only reason i didnt rate it 5 stars is because its cash only but a small price to pay (literally)! will definitely come back again.
one of the best restaurants in chinatown. cheap & delicious food with a very fast service. there might be queues sometimes, but its worth the wait.
amazing value for money near leicester square
high quality sushi for a fair price.
perfect japanese restaurant in central london. great value for money!
good fresh sushi for a reasanable price
great food. fast service. low prices and large portions. an awesome place to try.
i went here for my birthday and dont regret it! left with a full stomach without breaking the bank, will definitely go again :)
good food on a budget. very generous portions.
they have the best sushi in my opinion!!!and the plate is huge! i can never finish it!
great japanese food in london and the prices are so reasonable. highly recommended.

i always come here because it is so cheap and the food is so delicious! i got the tanuki udon for a clean but comforting flavour and the chicken karaage as a side. i highly recommend it to everyone that wants well priced japanese food, but do keep in mind that there's usually long queues for this place.
great place with good food portions. authentic. chicken katsuyama teriyaki was delecious
really good food.. decent prices.. cash only...
best place in the area. very very cheap and excellent food quality.
very busy little restaurant.  good value food, but nothing fancy.  cash only
it's a great place to go to if you wanna stay in your budget. i would give it a 5 but they don't accept card payment.
affordable but the place needs more ambiance of a japanese restaurant..needs decorating the wall..
very good food at a good price.
nice food and it's no expensive
cheap and cheerful! portions aren't the biggest but very quick service. can get very busy around 8pm
great value home japanese cooking.
reasonable prices for food and drink in central london. place gets busy and usualy a queue.  place also shuts early. recommended.
cheap and cheerful while being the best sushi
tasty. fast service, feels like a real life japanese restaurant.
nice food, good portion size and reasonable price
great food, huge portions, relatively cheap
good value, tasty food
the food and service was excellent.
great food, great value, great location! o famoso bom, bonito e barato!
cheap
the most delicious food around. we are returning customers. portion sizes are huge and the price is great!! clean and fast service
love this place.its got a simple menu but its so tasty and affordable so theres always a long queue during peak times!
best japanese restaurant in london
best japanese restaurant in london! the food is amazing and the prices are really low. sometimes there's a wait but it's well worth it. the food is so good, i highly recommend going here.
good authentic japanese food with a reasonable price. they do add 12.5% service charge but even with that it's still a good price.
good portions and value japanese food.
great food place; dishes were large and filling and food was of good quality and quite creative.
quick service and nice food!
had tempura udon. noodle were very good, the broth was a bit sickly but it's very cheap (i think 7) and you're definitely full afterwards.
best cheap eat in soho....ive been here literally hundreds of times. the katsu curry is awesome :) remember its cash only
great food and decent prices...
food was so nice for their cheap price. and also very allergic friendly
i just love the katsu curry. huge portions and the prices are really decent.
excellent japanese food
always love the food & for once there wasn't a queue when we arrived.
best value for money mealshuge portions for low prices
amazing sushi,all the portions are so big and probably the cheapest japanese food for the quality in central london i would say! enjoy
the food is really good and really cheap too! people sometimes line up even outside to get a table (including me and my friends sometimes too :d) but its definitely worth it :)
close to the main attractions in london, misato is a very good value for money! perfect for a quick but very good meal!

small but cosy restaurant with good cheap food. at the time of eating there, i loved it, a lot of flavours, however, when i got home, i had really bad diarrhoea probably due to bad food quality. furthermore, they only accept cash so paying was a struggle. i would probably avoid.
yes, there was nicer places than this but they have all gone. somehow they have amazing prices and food today. i been here 10 years and yet i find myself here today.

this place saved my life when i was studying abroad in london!! best food with very affordable prices. i tried a variety of dishes and all were very good. definitely coming back here if i ever come back to london.
nice, quick japanese food. not expensive. food come out quick.
loved this place written i first moved to london. needs some paint and a little tlc after visiting yesterday. absolutely dirt cheap though!
always my cheap and yummy place whenever i can't decided where to go ...... always delicious and very well priced almost always a line ... but never too long worth the wait

like find a gem in the heart london! tasty foods with a great price. the foods only cost arount 4,5-7,5 pounds, and you will get a huge portion. the service was good and was fast. however, it receives cash only, and some staff need to be more friendly. overall, two thumbs up and recommended!
i love this place. freshly made tasty food, served promptly.the staff are always respectful and friendly. keep up the great work guys!

restaurant is small. food came out quickly, almost too quickly in my opinion. staff was ok, nothing special. for us "come and go" experience. pork was a bit dry, but the curry balanced it out. udon was small, but not bad. not sure if i come here again in the future.
udon soup was a small portion. curry was mediocre. service was okay. the food came out right after we ordered, making it suspicious to whether it was freshly made or not.

best place in london have been eating a few times here while i was in london. the sushi is amazing, we took them as a take-away a few times. today i finally tried a bento. really enjoyed it. it was very full but this is because its so popular. the staff was very friendly.
excellent value and big portions. fast service and courteous staff. tables are quite crammed together, but for a quick meal it's comfy enough for a tasty meal
had the pork katsu curry rice! come with salad. large portion. great value! amazing. will come again.

absolutely value for money. had just the sushi which was satisfing. not the best sushi but for that cost, you get what you pay for. inside is not the greatest but i think for the cost for central london you really cannot complain. i have had the main meals here in the past and the portion will definitely fill you up.
great place when you just spent so much money in the city centre that all you can afford...is misato! great food for extremely low price. remember to keep some cash on you tho

nice place to grab something to eat with your friends. food was quite tasty (all excluding the soup - too salty & without original chinese taste). everything was hot,  ingredients were fresh. we haven't waited for long.
what sushi should taste like, one of 2 places that knows how to make sushi in london. rice cooked the right way sushi to die for. cheap too. please don't steal my seat though
quick and easy japanese one-dishers. my favorite place since i was a student. the price is very affordable and the food is not bad at all.
this place is a gem. cheap and no frills, but tasty generous portions of fantastic food. honestly don't want it to get too popular, so i can keep it to myself
big portions, cheap prices, good quality food, nice staff. only thing to say is watch out for the long queues. best to go at an irregular time.
one of my favourite japanese places in chinatown. well worth the wait and make sure you bring cash. the portions are good value and they have a few vegetarian options too.
love this place. could of been a 5 stars, only down fall is cash only. would love to see card payment, would make it more flexible.  it great food. staff are cool too!

japanese cafe just off leicester square. basic decor (cash only) much loved by students. excellent food at amazing prices considering the location so expect to queue but service is fast so it's worth the wait.
great food. good portion sized and good price. have to wait for your whole party to get there before getting seated.
good food, good location, excellent price and quick service. excellent local to stop for a short break not taking a take away food.
amazing food, portions were also great, and overall friendly atmosphere
cheap, tasty, fast service, good option in chinatown

had to wait for about 10 minutes before we got a table...but had to share the table with random customers...awkward...gave up making conversation with my colleague and just indulged in the food without saying a lot to each other...great food...the chicken katsu noodle soup was my kind of soul food...
easy eat and more flavour of chinese cuisine with a lot of fried choice than real japanese.... they don't even have sashimi on the menu
amazing restaurant! cheap and so good!
giant portions, great price, and delicious food
i'll admit it doesn't good that great from outside but the food is great, good price and staff are friendly.
this has to the one of the cheapest and filling chinese restaurants in china town. the restaurant is cash only. the portions are huge, definitely bigger than you'd expect for the price.
one of my favourite restaurants in chinatown. good price and quality. they only take cash!
both my wife's meal and mine were delicious, with lots of flavour, and arrived quickly. and the price was very reasonable. cramped seating, but overall a great experience.
never ever disappoints. best japanese food and reasonable price! remember its cash only.
correct prices, waiters are efficient, the food is tasty, but the place is dirty and greasy
amazing food, and the prices are really good for the portion you get.

this is one of my favourite restaurants in china town. food is always fresh and delicious. tendon is my favourite dish which i recommend to those who love seafood. the service is fast and the staff was very friendly.
so so cheap, decent portions and tastes good. really cosy little restaurant in london china town. strongly recommend for those hungry on a budget.

very good, the food is very tasty and it's for sure one of the thibgs that i will remember for the rest of mylife for the fact that i ate salad whit chopsticks! lol... the table service it's normal but the food comes pretty quickly. the price is fair for the food!
tasty japanese food large portions at a great price for central london.
big tasty portions,  quick service and good value..
tasty food but they only accept cash..
can't recommend this place enough.the portions are humongous and the prices are great for central london
nice food for the price but it is cash only.
one of the best cheap eats in china town. the katsu chicken/pork is one of the best. the udon in a broth with prawns and veg tempura are also recommended

it's good but it's hit and miss. one of very few places in london where affordable food can be had. generally good food and very fast service but once or twice i've sat down and seemingly been forgotten about.
tendon was so delicious and also so cheap! its real japanese food.
perfect cheap delicious fresh, try chicken katsu curry .
good food, clean establishment, fast service.

chicken katsu curry very good value. discretionary 12.5% automatically added to your bill. didn't think much of the chicken soba noodles. fast and efficient service. definitely not the place to have a slow relaxed meal.
large portions for an affordable price and very good quality
cheap japanese food. great student dinning. chicken katsu curry. your welcome
vey busy restaurant, food is okay, but fair price in city center, will visit again.
amazing and large dishes for low prices
amazing value for money
down to earth, unpretentious but more importantly, delicious! my favourite lunchtime venue when i visit from out of town.

i would not reccomend this place. portions of rice dishes looked big but the quality of the food was as bad as the service. and my "soup" was just water with the most exciting thing for me to eat being the odd accidental spring onion that was stuck to the bowl before filling :d. i added soy suace to give it colour and full flavor.
incredible taste!
fantastic place had a great meal and service was perfect
not sure how it has a high rating. i unfortunately agree with another reviewer that the ratings must be based on large serving size. food is mediocre.
good value for money. youll end up with both your belly and wallet full. its good, do not expect anything fancy thou.

handmade japanese udon, delicious ramen and great menu..excellent value for money! it only accept cash and it's not possible to reserve a seat, but it was never a problem for me, sometimes you just need to wait 15 minutes to seat.
excellent value. large portions and delicious food
good food and at a good price too!!
the best japanese restaurant in soho amazing food and greatest stuff
really nice massive plates of food and as cheap as you could get

great food for affordable prices and nice staff! we didn't have to wait long for our food at all. it's just that they don't have that space for larger groups so you'd have to wait a while to be seated. we were 6 people and waited around 15min with no line in front of us.
amazing sushi. fresh, tasty, very cheap. simple restaurant, no decorations, no fency bs. great food. highly recommend
can't go wrong here. cheap and cheerful japanese food. always a queue here but try and come before or after regular dinner times to avoid queuing!

cheap, fast, large portions and tasty. well worth the money and most of the time, the wait (unless you have to wait over 15 minutes, then ya might as well find someplace else). not many places sell that cheaply arouns chinatown. not recommended if you're going out to eat with more than 4 people.
good costumer service, yummy, good price for nice quantity yay
very crowded long ques
one of the best places in south london for sushi.
the restaurant and facilities are really dirty.looked up hygiene rating and discovered they only scored 2.
cheap but delicious food!
i love this place, been eating here for 9 years and it's always been fantastic!
misato is always great value for money. the bento boxes are fresh. the other dishes are very well sized portions. make sure you have cash
always happy with the food quality whenever we are there, fast service!
it's been close to a decade since my last visit here. the katsu curry once again didn't disappoint. huge portions at a great price. enjoy!
love this place. great food at great prices. never disappointed
ben to boxes very good and reasonably priced.
it's very good place for people in a budget. large rice dishes tasty and cheap. keep in mind that it's a bit crowded though
economy japanese plate of choice of rice or udon noodle
good place to dine
brilliant food, quick service, better price!
i wish misato was my neighbor, best place ever and so generous with portions!
best katsu curry i've ever had (especially at 6.90), and i've had loads
amazingly good katsu curry, large portions and affordable prices. highly recommended.
very good quality and price is more than reasonable
i have always loved this place for its expansive japanese menu for a great value for money. cash only.  very popular so be prepared to wait in line at times.
small place, no-good looking floor space but to ignore. cheapest japanese food in whole london, full plates, great tastes and flavors. cash payment only.
great food at a great price, environment is more homely than contemporary and impressive but warm and friendly nonetheless. is cash only.
a great place for a quick and cheap bite. the food comes fast and in large portions. highly recommended!
great, cheap japanese food. will need to queue at busy times.
the food has remained the same. excellent at great prices. however the customer service has gone downhill slightly. new staff are not as friendly & welcoming as the previous.
great resturant, with really good service, will for sure be re-visiting.
cheap and cheerful. can get very busy but worth the wait.
nice staff, very helpful. food is amazing. oishi!

cheap and good for a quick bite. can recommend getting katsu curry or rice dishes as the dish is massive. can't recommend the usual noodles as it looks and tastes rather cheap and poorly made without much ingredients. the sushi is nice but again looks often rushed.
really enjoyed their food! we had to wait for a few minutes to get a seat as it was pretty busy, but clearly this is evidence of how good their food is. we really enjoyed our menu and would go back
we loved this place! the food was awesome and great portion sizes, the prices are reasonable and the service is super fast. highly recommend
one of the best value for money places in the area. pretty decent food. recommended.

cheap, really cheap!! the food is not bad......wouldn't say it was the best japanese i have ever eaten but at the price you can't complain.what the place does need is a very, very, very thorough clean. it is grim. you wonder how some places get away with it to be honest. filthy.
would definitely recommend this place. excellent food with good prices.
one of the best japanese places in london and you can tell as there is always a queue to get in

the food always tastes good and is cheap! everybody typically gets the katsu curry which is a great choice but i also reccomend the curry udon and tempura. the sushi is good too but not the best i think.
the best budget japanese restaurant in london. and it's cheap too. what more can you expect?

i don't know how i didn't know about this place! awesome place for chinese! for what you pay for you get a lot more than you bargain for. the quality of the food is delicious and full of flavour. the staff are always about so you will be served in no time. i highly recommend this place as the food and service are great!
expensive for what you get but very nice all the same. green tea ice cream sounds honking but is actually really nice and worth a try.
amazing menu and prices, although lacking in vegetarian options
amazing food

thus place is popular with japanese, usually a good indication the food is authentic. the prices are great and the servings generous. cash only and there can be a queue out the door to be seated but it's worth the wait. the decor is down to earth. favourite restaurant in london.
great food, bento box delish, fast service, cash only

staff friendly with decent quality food reasonably priced. around 7 for large portions of classic (though not convincing) japanese dishes and 3.50 for 500ml can of sapporo. cash only and expect to queue as restaurant is quite small.
cheap, but will not go back. they need to step it up, very run down in every aspect. had a fish, feel something going on in my stomach all night, thats not ok.
really nice and cheap japanese cuisine!
cheap for a big dish
one of my favorite places to have cheap japanese cuisine ! dont get my wrong, the food is amazing!
awful. the beef broth tasted flavourless. aswell as this, the staff are rude and clumsy. one dropped a whole meal on my bag and thought it was funny and laughed it off. never coming here again.
you can feel it was cheap):
cheap, cheerful and quick - good quality food
very tasty, fresh, healthy and quite cheap food. friendly staff. sometimes it's necessary to queue for a few minutes because this place is very popular.
excellent place for couple and family to eat out

consistently the best things about having to travel to london on business (and one of the few things i miss from the city!) amazing food, great prices - just be aware it is cash only and there may be a queue (well worth the wait though!)
i like to eat there, i've been a few times i love the food
big servings for a cheaper price
watch out for a "recommended service charge" which they try to enforce as mandatory.
rude staff. no manners. poor cleanliness and long queuing. no queue management
my favourite japanese restaurant in the whole city. been going here for years and recommended it to countless people. keep in mind, it's one of  london's last places that is strictly cash only
poor food quality
the food was really nice, the service was good. the restaurant is ok
fast service, good food
good portions, friendly staff,great  prices
incredibly cheap (for london), yet their dishes have deep flavour. the only downside is that they only accept cash.
localised japanese food. reasonable price in london, but cash only.

my favourite chicken katsu curry in all of london. fast service, excellent prices. wouldnt recommend for a romantic meal if you are after that, but for delicious food in a bustling environment misato comes highly recommended.
the best authentic japanese food i ever had! reasonably priced and big portions.
garbage place with selfe service. have to wait at keast 10minutes untill you come yourself and order finally. at least the prices are fine.
i am delighted with this place!  i'll come back here for sure!
good value, big portions, tasty food. nice staff :) no frills interior
the food was nice.

great quick-food japanese restaurant! it's not fancy, looks a bit dodgy, staff is a bit overwhelmed, but the food is just amazing! amazing! just great! again, be sure you go with the right expectations there
cheap and great food, one of the best places there, and staff is super nice!
cheap, tasty. not too posh but that's a good thing. efficient service. big queues.
very delicious zaru soba and tempura.fast service and friendly staff.
used to be good. now they arrogantly make you wait until your party is complete. food no longer what it was. very disappointed.
very nice place, good prices, big portions and delicious food.

the food is okay - good price for the portion. staff are polite and friendly. the downfall is that the restaurant is pretty dirty: floor, dust on sides, dirty walls. note: you can only pay by cash, and they add a 12% service charge however, you can ask the staff to remove it.
good quality and big portions for a very cheap price, one of the best places in london!

pretty much my favourite place in london. the food always picks me back up when i'm feeling down, staff consistently lovely. i bring people here for dinner all the time. dishes are huge and top quality, especially considering the very low price- would really really recommend!
favourite place for a reasonably priced set of japanese food. the place is not pretentious but the food and portion size are great.when in soho it's always top of our list of places to go.
huge, delicious, cheap
very affordable and delicious japanese food. large portions that are sure to leave you feeling satisfied!
good food and great prices for where it's situated. be prepared to wait if you go in the evening though. oh! it's cash only.. be prepared! :)

udon noodle soup very boring. sushi supermarket quality. and service without a smile, or any kind of interaction really. and then they expect you to pay the 12% tip which is already conveniently added to your bill. don't reccommend.
my favourite restaurant for last 6 years. nice food, great, friendly staff. thank you imani for serving us, you have great customer service
fantastic cheap eat in the centre of london. highly recommended. be ready for a bit of a wait if you are going in the evening. amazing katsu curry.

nice little family run japanese restaurant. accept cash only. used to be the cheapest in town, not anymore. still reasonable pricing. staff are friendly but maybe the lady that serve me my drink could have stopped looking at her phone while serving me. otherwise its all good. friendly staff.
good value for money, servings are very large also. we came at 6pm and just beat the queue. i thought the match teriyaki chicken was amazing. will be back for the pure value of the place!
very cheap and big portions. flavour is unique.
good food quality, nice staff, quick service, cheap, well located. me and my boyfriend love this place. they make us feel as at home! highly recommended!!!

for me the best japanese experience in london. not glamorous but very functional and delicious. for big guys the best portion of food per  in town! amazing prices. can get busy. cash only!! 25 years ive been eating here and it has barely changed. family run i feel the vibe.
big portions, tasty food.
exquisite. wonderful service. excellent food.
interesting place with good food. felt rushed with no atmosphere
very good value.
good quality of sushi. main plates are enough to be full. you need to wait long to find a table on saturday night's. in weekdays, it is ok.

it always has a queue so this time i jumped in too. very tight spaces so if you don't like sharing or sitting right next to other diners avoid. short budget friendly menu. not amazing but it was fine - had the cold soba, tempura platter and chicken katsu.staff were friendly on my visit.
great service, amazing price for food. can get very busy so be prepared to queue, but that's always a sign of a good place. only takes cash
the best japanese food i have ever had for such a good price in london.
i love the place and their food. the waiters are quick
i love this place and the food is so worth it!

text: tasteless, too oily, and somehow undercooked. not similar to what youd find in taiwan unfortunately
place: Monga Fried Chicken 艋舺雞排

text: not good for vegetarians

cost us 24 2 adults, 1 child, all you can eat, can't go wrong in centre of london for that, sat downstairs though, not quite sure about fire safety regs, you'd be pretty trapped down there if something were to happen upstairs, food hygiene seemed good and was tasty xx

no wait ? seriously ? been here for 1 hour and kept saying 10 min, they offer more discount for the 2 hours wait. what a bad offer , which i could give less star if i could give. very bad experience

got recommendation from my colleague and came here today. the staff are really warm-hearted and welcoming. i really love the fish here, as well as beef cushions. with the cute price, ill definitely recommend my friends to come.

very expensive,  cheaply produced, overly sweet food. the filet steak dish had the consistency of dog food, the noodles dry and tasteless. this place definitely takes advantage of its location.  much better places to eat in the area.

good food and quick service, despite having so many other customers to serve.- toilets could do with some work but its a small price to pay in exchange for the food here.
sadly the chinese crispy belly of pork was very over cooked. i have eaten here many times and this was the first time it's not been good.

we went for a sunday lunch as a family of four (kids 5 and 9). the ground floor was cozy and quiet. staff was friendly and helpful. we had a peking duck and dumplings. both were delicious. prices were reasonable. most importantly, the toilet was clean!, assuring sign for the restaurant's cleanliness.
cheaterno student discount. rubbish taste. pocker face on the staff
mixed experience. staff were all great and service was fast. free wi fi. however, price was a bit steep and too much msg in the the stock. other ingredients tasted nice though.

i've been twice here for dinner and sat downstairs. once for hot pot (first hot pot ever!). food was very good and staff friendly but price could be a bit lower i think. it's not so well organised but both times i got table and food not waiting much. it's an informal family restaurant, worth a visit.
went for the hotpot deal and it was great! quick service, friendly staff and a good range of food for unlimited hotpot
really authentic chinese. like in china. not the typical european chinese restaurant. hot pot is a big yes too. not too expensive for the quality.

perfect pub. rock music and beatiful atmosphere. join it. absolutely amazing!

went one the way to the theatre

great ho fun

(you're welcome!)

nice spot for a quick and easy chinese meal. good value for money, at least for london. the duck was good!
the best chinese food ever, worst customer service ever as well, waitress all rude and angry.

the food was trashy, unsubtle and overpriced. the waiters were un-attentive and the minimum 9 spend was a frustrating gimmick that was forced rudely upon us. there are far better value, tastier chinese restaurants in chinatown. keep looking.

extremely rude waiter. requested for apologies, waited almost 20minutes before someone else took slight interest in approaching the situation. the owner apologised later on but it hardly changed the fact that all our appetites were lost. waiter in guilt didnt attempt to apologise. terrible service, extremely disappointed. avoid!

most other places were closed at 11pm sunday this wasn't. we ordered set meal b for 2 it was truly excellent. bill arrived front sheet of bill was just a  figure, 2nd sheet itemised the bill and it was 10% less, so my message is, enjoy your meal but check your bill

extremely rude service to asian customers. sit all white in ground/first floor, and all yellow skin in the highest floor which requires climbing steep steps. shameful! i will never come to this place again.

not sure why so many negative reviews, food was excellent and very quickly served. i agree that they could be more friendly but that is just standard chinese mannerisms, since the food was great and served amazingly quick i have no complaints.

asked for no nuts because of allergies.got told no nuts were in any of the dishes we wanted, and it should be completely safe.ruined the rest of the day, as there definitely was nuts in the dish - non-stop throwing up for hours (normally a sign of peanuts, which in other cases could be deadly).completely unacceptable, stay away!

they charge 2 for extra fresh cut chiliseriously? such a rip-off! it was taken off after our protest. rice is stale, dishes are average. you will be hassled, and waiters rude. typical cantonese canteen style. not that clean.
great food, get the off menu item, its called lse it comes standard as pork but you can ask for the chicken

great place to go when in the area, food is always very good. and stays open very late, so even more perfect to go after a night out!
roast meats are not bad, other dishes are so so.
the go-to place for late night meal

had the crispy pork belly, which was excellent, although the rice was over fried, a but dry and hard in places.partner had the beef noodles which were delicious.food is very good, and served moments after ordering.the place itself isn't anything to look at, it's purely functional
i don't recommend this restaurant.not worth spending mony herevery unfriendly staff ruined our holidaythere are bunch of other chinese restaurants in soho better than here

good to chill with drinking

yes service is bad - so bad that the waitors want to scam you of paying more than is the actual price, had this experience when ordering take-away and the waitor pretended to not have known what he had done - shameful staff here, if it continues this will be reported to the food standards agency

it was utterly disgusting. the amount of salt poured into every dish can raise your blood pressure easily by a hundred. every dish is an abomination conjured to rip your taste buds out of your tongue. proceed to eat at your own risk.
some of the best tasting chinese in chinatown - not the place to go if you are looking for friendly service, however.
i was here back on 2015, and back again right now. i spent here like 3 times dinner during the past 2 weeks. foods is delicious, fast service, and good hospitality. feels like at home

one of the best chinese restaurants in chinatown. i'd recommend getting the salted egg wings or squid and their hidden dish ''lse fried rice'' which is their special fried rice served with tender pork smothered in egg sauce and topped with a fried egg.
the food was good but the waiters was so angry and aggressive. i felt like they were there to act mean. and they were throwing the cutleries and being rough

very rude staff and below average food. what makes it worse is that they try and overcharge you! there are much better restaurants to go to nearby but if you go here make sure you remember how much your meal actually costs otherwise they will try it with you too!

hands down the best customer service ive experienced. the food was great but the level of service just took it to another level. i think rick was the gentleman who served us. well definitely be going back
if you want to eat good chinese food, this place i will never recommend
five star purely for it does what you want. late night chinese food, pretty much a life saver if your after real chinese food late at night.

the food here far exceeded my expectations. excellent good, fast albeit a bit gruff service. they forgot one of the dishes i ordered and i had no way to tell if it was on my bill because it was hand written in chinese script.

service was just bad! the waitress was so rude and agressive. we didn't want to pay the service charge because of this attitude but she did not let us and told us to just takeaway next time. additionally the food served was cold. not coming back.

be cautious with compulsive extra 10% fee for the just ok service.meat with rice(without any vegetables, except for 2 slices of cucumber) is good and delicious, but you can get the same things with vegetables in other store with same price.lemon tee is a bit bitter, quality of the tee could be better.
dont even deserve a star.

not the best tbh.. soup was cold and noodles  were tasteless..  had to even ask for chilly. and additional charge was applied on payment desk..

since i moved to london. this place has beenbeen and favourite place.
great food in this small but busy chinese. brisket was nice and they go out the way to help you. very good

my co-workers and i order from here every friday to cure our hangovers, or just because we feel like being naughty on fridays. i recommend the beef ho fun noodles in black bean sauce. on my two occasions in store, service was fast but very basic. don't expect to be engaged or pampered much!

ordered chicken fried rice... nothing was fried in that dish and chicken was simply raw. when asked to bring a cooked meal they brought the same plate after microwaving it for a few minutes.. but hey, at least i'm still alive

busy little place. ordered the hainanese chicken rice. it was good but the chicken was a bit too mushy for my liking, although i am used to more elastic chicken. huge portions. head downstairs to the toilet and you might just hear some energetic chinese music being played in the kitchen!!
we have two wontons noodles..the fillings are lovely..its not cheap 31..small seating areas most of the time have to share a table with someone else's..
not attentive waiters, even wrongly took three orders and didn't want to take responsibility. the food is good but the service is cringeworthy.
it has a secret menu lse fried rice which is really good. other dishes are ok.
this is a one dish restaurant, we only go there because of the salt & pepper crab which is extremely tasty, but unfortunately all other dishes fall notably below those available in china town
an overpriced chinese eatery. food is mediocre at best, even before taking into account of the exorbitant prices. skip it unless its the last one standing.

great for late night after party feasting.

great food all the time 24/7 greatness

very oily food and taste so so. service is slow. wont come back again.

really bad hygiene conditions. ordered a bubble tea and discovered a hair in my drink. the staff was also rude. food is okay but i'm never coming back. there tons of better places in china town. stay away from this one!!
fast service and open late. best wings in london!
wow.amazing food and a late closing.my new favourite chinese restaurant.

ate here with 3 friends last night and they were all instantly sick after eating the food here. not only that but the bill came in chinese not english so couldnt understand any of it, and we were massively over charged. wont be eating here again
good food, quick service but definitely on the pricey side. 60 meal for two vegetarians at a low end decor/ takeout chinese restaurant!
staff are rude. they do not care if you are waiting. the food is okay tasty. the service really lets it all down. no culture barrier included
rude and terrible service, food not authentic

average  food. more expensive than others around the immediate area. charges extra for anything extra including fresh chilli. not worth it in my opinion. also rude manager who adds the bill up in chinese so you dont exactly know what your paying for. go to the place next door
best chinese in london for 3am dine in noodles.
very good service and food 10/10

i can't believe there's such a ppace in london like this. so third world, attitude's unimaginably uncivilized. the management's so ignorant of londoners' customer care. my friend and i tried to understand the behavior but it was so offensively boorish. it was a mistake dining there!
overcharging, tourist trap.
