rustic looking vietnamese decor but all tables very close together and feels claustrophobic. service was friendly but felt rushed. the starters were fairly good, but i wasn't impressed with the beef pho. altogether not a bad place but nothing special.
good but not as good as some old viet places around hoxton station
tasty tasty! mains and starters were fantastic
great cozy little place for lunch . service was fast and friendly and the pho was sublime .deffo up there with the best pho iv had before .
we found this little place by chance last night. we loved it! and i've still been thinking about the burger today. can't wait for my next visit. great food friendly staff and affordable
lovely food and helpful staff.
sweet and cosy vietnamese eatery on shaftesbury avenue. the food is really tasty and well presented - and it arrived swiftly. interior is rustic. staff are helpful and obliging. well worth a visit.
excellent. order from the theater menu for good value
friendly staff and very tasty food. good quality/price lunch menu.

get together among friends.. highly recommended, book a table if four or more as you will be seated down stairs, restaurant is cozy but the vibe can be loud depending on the night and guests, they have a la carte & set menus.. lovely dishes, ambience & most of all customer service :)
i dont think waiting for a bun for over 20 minutes is reasonable
nice vietnamese restaurant serving decent pho and good spring rolls

tried a few vietnamese restaurants on a trip to london, and this place was by far the best one. both bun bo hue and and bun thit nuong was really tasty. the interior of the restaurant is nice and service was good.
amazing food , great service

friendly stuff and really tasty vietnamese food. i tried vietnamese food for the first time and waiter helped me with my order. price is also good. only disadvantage is the space. not that much inside.
very good pho, taste is quite authentic and quite a good selection on the menu. price is also reasonable.
so far, it is the best vietnamese food that i tried in london. try the pho and the bbq pork. the soup was done in 24 hours. the taste is so great ..
great restaurant for vietnamese food. the pho was very delicious. a little bit cramped inside but the staff were excellent.
nice to try, bought as a present on groupon for me, great service but over priced in my opinion.
service is bad
ordered a bao bun as a delivery, and was extremely disappointed. the bun was so unloved, i removed the contents and replaced with odd bits i had at home. poor experience
amazing, food is of high quality. recommend to reserve. i always go for the tiger prawn burger and sweet potato fries. usually costs around 20 per head with a drink.
i enjoyed the starters over the main. i feel like the presentation was more important in their dishes over taste and portion. great atmosphere but the food isn't amazing.
top!
amazing food.  in fact we enjoyed it so much we went before a show then after the show for 2nds and dessert. coconut snow. honey roasted pork buns. yum.
good food and friendly staff
the food here is amazing. best flavours i have tasted since vietnam. great atmosphere and the staff are very friendly and efficient. fanny
i really liked the food, the staff we're friendly and fast. i would 100% eat here again. the pho was excellent, as were their burgers.
taste: 3.5 because it's not quite authentic, need to work on the texture. decor & staff: 5 very nice concept.
good tasty food with decent portion sizes. they seemed to be having slight issues with the timing of he food but the staff were very apologetic and helpful. definitely worth a visit.
tasty dishes - good service

for me as a pho-lover is this restaurant one the best places i've ever been in london in looking for how does this vietnamese soup tastes. pho was so delicious with loads of fresh ingredients. i could feel more comfortable if tables were bit bigger.
i had avoided this place, maybe because its hard to find a good vietnamese restaurant, but the bun cha there brought me back to hanoi
the staff were friendly and attentive. the prawn pancake was amazing and the pho was fantastic. definitely one of the best vietnamese restaurants in london.
one of the best vietnamese cuisine in london!!

when you get a set menu the starters are small but they do taste good. mains are very tasty . i may come back for the 3rd time soon. service is not great if that was quality then maybe they could reach 5 star
the pho  is the star of the show, cooked over 24 hours.
really good meal with our kids. surroundings a bit cramped but that is reflected in the price. food excellent.
delicious food, reasonably priced and the service was great too.
lovely food quick service
amazing staff!!! very helpful and very clean
good food, reasonably priced but too many tables crammed together for comfort on street level. probably better downstairs.
very nice vietnamese food. pho (beef noodle soup) is 80% authentic. the other dishes are excellent, especially the very special steamed bun burger!
the pho broth wasn't as complex as i expected it should be

i had the crispy tofu pho and for about 11 a pop, this is a good stumble upon place for the next time you're in central london and need a quick bite! generous servings and well done broth, we left feeling pretty satisfied. the desserts look like they're a winner too - somethings to try next time perhaps.
pleasant food and customer service. although the place is quite small and had to wait a bit, it was a good overall experience. perfect for anyone who wants quick but good food!
best pho you will ever have
inexpensive pho restaurant. spring rolls were amazing!
really nice food. good atmosphere. great selection. courteous staff. friendly vibe.
nice place, good food, friendly staff
will be back again, and again, and again.
food was lovely but the table service was not so good. shame because we both really enjoyed the food.

delicious and well priced. the tofu bao burger was a little bland, but oh my lorrrrd, the vermicelli with crispy tofu and the spring rolls were divine. i only wish they offered vegetarian-friendly pho (currently you can only have it with a meat-based stock). will be back!
delicious veggie pho and great value lunch menu
nice viet food. papaya salad and steamed burger from the lunch menu were excellent. some might find it small but i think its good size.
pho-ood was absolutely lovely. delicious pork belly and sticky rice
great little hidden gem, great service and also fast. vegetarian options also great
food is fine. good value. service could be improved.
very good food. friendly manager.
the best vietnamese restaurant in london. great service, fresh ingredients and amazing cocktails.highly recommended.
great traditional viet, nice location and nice staff.
one of the best tasting beef pho i've ever had. noodles and the broth were on point. however this restaurant isn't for the hungry or big eaters. portions are quite small but super delicious

finally went to see what the fuss was about with this place. good food and good atmosphere so we weren't disappointed at all! would certainly go back. it is worth looking on some table booking websites as you can get set menus that aren't advertised through the pho & bun website where you get better value for money!
nice food and place, portions a little too small
vietnamese restaurant serving pho, buns and fried dishes in an authentic style. tastes are fresh, prices reasonable, service a little patchy, but definitely worth a try!
excellent food and service. great value.
staff were friendly enough but some of the food was fairly standard. pricey for quality
love it, great food and service

the food ace delicious the right amounti had so much fun they became my personal dj voluntary playing music and free deserts to make my birthday extra special (they knew it was my birthday last minute) yet still out of good will they celebrated with me. thank you staff you are awesomeworth it guys
easy to walk past, but i recommend you don't if you are hungry. great simple examples of vietnamese street food. full of flavour and an accommodating staff to add to the experience.
chicken pho was not bad, the spring roll and the fried rice was so so. the tofu pho was a bit bland.

exceeded our expectations , honestly it was my friends birthday and apart from the food being so delicious. it was the customer service that really blew our minds . when they found it was my friends birthday they went out of their way to do a birthday treat for her . i will definitely come here again !
amazing set menu and great service! couldn't believe how cheap it was for such good food
nice authentic vietnamese food. and quite affordable with lunch menu!
love the food. i wish the tables and stools were wider, not a lot of space between people.

hot, tasty pho. i asked for no coriander and they did as requested. their cold vietnamese drip coffee was super tasty. uses lemon instead of lime in the pho which is unusual. the sweet potato veggie curry is delicious!
wonderful place ! really kind people and tasty food. good prices. special thanks to the nice greek server  our son enjoyed his birthday !

its such a shame as i never even got to try the main dish. was told had to wait 20 minutes; 30 minutes later i was still waiting and no update. asked them how much longer it would be and they said 10 minutes. asked for the bill, total came to 4.46 and had to pay 5 because it was the minimum by card. terrible service
comfortable vietnamese restaurants based at chinatown. set lunch only 9.95 (main course with starter), and they got serve for vegetarian food as well. friendly service and taste good
good food slow stuff
cocktails were great but staff were pushy in trying to turn over tables. it was a busy saturday evening, but so rude to make us leave when we were about to order dinner!

small restaurant that does a vegetarian and non vegetarian set menu. the quality is good, but portion sizes are a little small. the tables are close together so it can feel a little cramped. more seating is available downstairs. the staff are also polite and helpful. booking is advised for dinner later in the week or at the weekend.
cozy, nicely decorated, quick service, and the food is goooood. the chilli squid is fantastic and the beef  bun is absolutely delicious. try the flan if you still have space for dessert.

went in on a busy saturday, was shown to a table and given menus. 5 minutes later a waiter came up to us, we assumed to take our order, only to be told that someone had already booked the table and would we like to sit downstairs instead? given service like that we chose to leave and eat elsewhere altogether.
great service, not too expensive, authentic cuisine. loved it!
the set menu is awesome. so is the pork belly bao. i love the waiter that just took some initiative and brought us more beer when we had finished the first round.
nicely decorated for a small place, seats were a little uncomfortable but food was good and set menu is good

it was one of the worst meals i had in a while. the aubergine taste like it was dipped in the oil that was used 5 times over. the pho  broth totally lacked flavour. there are better choices out there for good vietnamese
bbq short rib and chicken japenese bun is what i had. it was lovely will definitely go again for quick eat

food was delicious. had the ribs and beef rolls. lovely. took about 25min before we got our mains. the steamed bbq honey pork bao burger was delicious.  would deff go back. the time out offer is only really worth it in the evening, otherwise you can get 2 course for 10 during lunch.
great spot in soho west end/theatreland. amazing 4 course meal super experience and attentive staff - check it out
lovely food great service

went for the chicken pho to take away. service was really slow - ended up waiting 20min when originally told it would take 5. broth and noodles are ok, but you only get a few scraps of quite dry chicken so the 8 price tag doesn't really seem worth it. will avoid in the future.

food was absolutely lovely and our waiter was very pleasant. it's quite small as you walk in, but there's loads of seating downstairs if it gets too busy. i'll definitely be trying out the new restaurant opening in oxford.
amasing food. good portions. gluten free.
used to be good but now the portion sizes look much smaller and the new staff are grumpy and rude.
lovley restaurant with great staff and testy food.
they have a secret room downstairs so even if it looks crowded ask for table you will propably get one.
very tasty food, great service and quiet place to have a late evening dinner !
love this place,small but perfect.
delicious,fresh & fast.really good flavours,& not too expensive.yum!
very good authentic vietnamese food. i go there few times a month. strongly recommend
great pho soup with beef at a very reasonable price

so good! we tried the crispy lemongrass tofu, tofu summer rolls, the grilled aubergine and sweet potato bao burger, and the tofu bao burger. ive been a vegetarian for 16 years and this is some of the best tofu ive ever had! the summer rolls were also delicious and refreshing. i wish i lived in london so i could return frequently.
very nice ambiance and excellent food. around 20 per person including drinks.
food is nice, a bit expensive. lots of rice based food, so it is a good idea for gluten free diets. but contactless doesn't work ;(
good food but quite unattentive service
great week day lunch deal ... 2 courses for 9.50. good service. great food.
definitely satisfied my pho cravings since moving to london from sydney. the soup was absolutely delicious. will surely try more off the menu next time!

pho and bun is the best vietnamese i've had in london. the meat spring rolls are fresh and delicious, the bun is tasty, and the pho was the best tasting broth since visiting vietnam. the decor is pretty trendy too.
the buns were amazing. big in size and tasted great. slightly disappointed about the sweet potato fries as they weren't crispy.would recommend checking it out though!
the pho is really good! we were just back from a holiday in vietnam. didn't expect to find a pho restaurant with such authentic favor in london. well done!

very cosy and yummy restaurant. the burgers are delish, and the vegetarian version comes almost guilt free (all considered a light meal). i almost had food envy looking at the person in front of me with a bowl of sticky rice and pork, that must have been amazing!
friendly service, good food, great cocktails, restaurant is small and tables are a bit cramped.

the food was very tasty and they offer many gluten free options too. one of the best vietnamese restaurants i've ever been, with very affordable prices. perfect location in the city centre and cosy environment. staff was very friendly and helpful. highly recommended.
stick with their pho, the rest wasnt that good. we had the mango salad and calamari, both pretty flavorless.
lunch here was the best!
absolutely fantastic food across from queens theatre.

the grilled pork vermicelli is highly recommended, tasty and the taste brings you to vietnam immediately. other dishes also taste nicely. well done! reservation is recommended for them to arrange you the seats.

had a wonderful meal, cannot recommend the tofu enough! we had the summer rolls, crispy tofu, tofu bao and aubergine bao, everything was incredible. service was prompt and attentive - we were seated quickly and never kept waiting.
absolutely delicious! fresh and clean flavours, defiantly going back! really reasonable as well!
excellent food. very reasonable prices. recommend.
fantastic vietnamese street food restaurant. good value especially if you find a tme-out voucher.  the seating is very squashed, but as to a friendly atmosphere. delicious food.
best pho in london, great atmosphere and very friendly staff
delicious pho
tiny little restaurant but absolutely lovely food.
good value for money with one of the many vouchers available. that said, food was only average and was waiting 30 mins between courses despite it not even being peak time...
good food and nice service
pros: delicious food, great staff.cons: small portions for the price, toilets could be a lot cleaner.
best pho in london ever tried ~~
delicious food and polite staff.
really surprised by how good this was. great photo and amazing grilled pork. will go again
really good quality food, nice cosy little place, would definitely recommend!
great tasting quality food for a great price 10 for a starter plus main meal 12-17h highly recommend the bao burger with cheese!

dripping coffee wasnt show up at table like a  dripping coffee, they serve a cup of vietnamese coffee? pho pao taste good, nice pho and tender rare slice beef, soup is the soul which is a bit sweeter than the average.
amazing bun  perfect pho
great food and friendly staff - i will be back

awful awful foods and staffs service isn't nice, but they include 12% of service charges for the bill. i don't understand how they got five star ratings. there are lot of good vietnamese restaurants in london but not this one. definitely not going to recommend here to anybody. yikes
nice pho
delicious food, very friendly staff. could not ask for more.
really good vietnamese food. big choice of dishes. the pork belly was delicious, the pho stock is on point, lots of flavour. nice atmosphere too with attentive service
good food very small tables and staff more interested in chatting than serving the people who pat their wages. all down to sub standard management
mint tea and pho! recommend recommend recommend
fantastic, great food will definitely go again next time i'm in london. set meal deal was great value for money.
good food and friendly staff. the pork belly burger is interesting and the stir fried rice noodle is something special!

such a wonderful viet foodbeef soup of the noodle was great! its deep beef taste and noodle also cooked well pork noodle tastes amazing as wellive had satisfied dinnerjust one thing theres no air conditioner indoor, therefore its a bit unpleasure to stay in and have hot food in the summer time
excelent braised beef pho soup
2nd best pho in london. the crab spring roll is quite good too.
the male servant did not respect me, did not bring me tissues and chopsticks, although we went first, very distinguished
service is bad. we went in and the waitress was so rude, she just told us off that they didnt have a table.
great food at reasonable price

cute place in soho, serving the best bao bun burger i've had to date. very cozy place, friendly staff. definitely a spot you can't miss for quality vietnamese cuisine. the sweet potato fries side were very crisp and delicious.
great food, fab service, would highly recommend
my first experience with vietnamese food and i'm happy about it! pho&bun is a cool restaurant and the food was really good!
good food, friendly staff, great location.
not bad, reasonably priced.
good vietnamese option in central london. normally have the lunch special with pho. great price and very tasty
get the very nice coupon deal! food is good and stuffs are friendly. the reason i get 4 star is stuffs seem not know their food and table is very small.
very small place, but great, flavourful food.
love the food! that is all i can say!
very good food and gentle stuff. will definitely come back!
lovely place with really tasty pho, been here twice and not been disappointed yet!
delicious food!!! the ribs and sticky wings (appetizer) are excellent!!! affordable..
very nice spring rolls and the vegetable soup was fresh and nice! the place always busy and the staff are excellent!
very reasonable and nice - i loved the dessert!!!
friendly and fast service - and super tasty bao burgers!!!! big recommend.
tasty food in modern place with ok prices. young people. a portuguese worker there is top
often go for lunch when in soho. they have added more veggie / vegan options. food is good but staff can be a bit unattentive - be firm.

visited pho and bun for the first time 18/6/19 and found the food to be delicious. we chose the 4 course set menu priced at 16 and was very good value.friendly staff,great atmosphere. will definately be returning.
food was lovely but staff wanted to clear us out before we'd even properly finished our meals. felt like we were on a conveyer belt.

i was pretty disappointed with the food. not particularly flavourful nor fresh. the platter to start was just all over-fried and there wasn't very much of it. the crispy duck was probably the best part but was still only ok.
i would say foods are nice. but... staff are awful. you guys need to be more careful when you serve.  please be nice. i am happy to go again. but won't pay for tips never ever.

was recommended by a friend who said it was one of the posher places in china town. wasn't impressed with decor, service was poor and slow. food was cold and only adequate, came out a random times including one starter coming in different parts over 30mins. price was very high for such a standard of food. wasn't happy at all.
this is the best chinese in town! excellent service and awesome food... the bill does not hurt your pocket at all!
very tasty chinese food! the dim sum was great!
very smart restaurant in chinatown, london.
the chinese stuff are not nice to the customers being very aggressive
great bef and broccoli.
favourite place to eat for malaysian-chinese!
nice food but not much atmosphere

very unfriendly staff. they would serve dishes on your table without saying a word and throw the bill to you without even saying thank you. and they charge service fee. food is alright, not exactly delicious. would never recommend this place

cozy asian restaurant in chinatown with delicious small plates of authentic food. service sometimes better than on other days but still o.k. large variety of dumplings on the menu, reasonably priced for centre of london. good quality food.was there twice, would go again for sure. reservation recommended

extremely slow, dishes are served cold. asked them to microwave it, they delivered 15 minutes later cold again. stainless steel wires in tofu! they took back to redo, but never delivered again. even rice was not delivered. terrible service.
amazing selection of dim sum and very cosy place
pretty good food, but really really slow had to wait nearly an hour between when the first and last main dish arrived xd
one of the better restaurants in londons chinatown
good food and nice swrvice
nice place and decent enough service
fabulous food
nice food and very quite atmosphere
tried the evening dim sum here. they don't do chung feung and the dumplings and other dim sum are quite dry. no beef balls either. i would prefer normal dim sum to this.
been here a couple of times now these five stars are for the dry ribs they're amazingly tender!! food is tasty don't need to add anything to your rice for flavour
good dim sum, very busy in the evening but managed to find us room without a booking. i think the busyness let's it down a bit in terms of service, given the price.
i think this is the best eatery in chinatown.
nice authentic dim sum. go there before 5pm for the lunch time offer.
even one star is not worthy for them. the most terrible service i've ever had. staff were totally unhelpful. i couldn't finish my food as i was in very noisy, uncomfortable seat. it is total worst
for chinatown, it's a step up from most of the other joints. i'm pretty happy here and will return.
very nice dimsum and not too expensive
great food.  attentive service.  karaoke selection a little limited, but had a great time!
peking duck...delicious
horrible services
sooo delicious
karaokes fantastic. a bit expensive tho
food was lovely. service poor. had to keep calling the waitress ov er for help as it was our first visit. not helpful.
most dishes were good, but expensive. horrible service.

the food here is really good, especially the xiao long bao. unfortunately in my experience the service was bad to the point where it deters me from returning. if the service improves i would not be surprised if clientele doubles.
5 star food ... and setting ...staff need some work ..

this was *the* food highlight of my visit to london. ask for the dim sum menu (if it's not too late in the evening). the scallop dumplings were the single most delicious thing i've eaten in recent memory, although the peking duck was a close tie. everything arrived quickly and the service was great.

faboulicious! great value for money. this is a real chinese cuisine restaurant with fresh ingredients and hand made dishes. big portions. suggested to avoid the crowd of the more common restaurants of china town.
nice place, tasty food... must try
best dim sum for the same value anywhere in china town, and lovely atmosphere. other dishes are more expensive, would recommend getting dim sum meals here.
first visit & over ordered base in the set lunch meant for big eaters and you could almost hear the waiter sniggering our poor choice.chinese food for non chinese.
have been here 3 times dumplings are fresh and very authentic but too bad that they don't serve cheung fun in the evenings. has atmosphere

this restaurant does the best dim sum with a fusion. such as crispy black roe, wasabi dumplings, fried crispy prawns decorated as rabbits and much more. it is well decorated and stylish and the staffs are all friendly. excellent for a great meal with friends and family, dim sum is available during the evening too.
they changed they menu. the once amazing vegetarian 'chicken' is no longer so great :/
called regarding a reservation but wasnt able to ask for info as it seems the receptionist doesnt understand english.
good food if a little expensive. very good service
home of the best turnip cake in london
amazing dim sum top 5 in london , quick service , good prices , steamed dumplings are amazing
modern clean atmosphere. ok food :)not the usual yum cha experience that you would expect in chinatown, it was a quieter space with modern decor. not too busy on a wednesday afternoon.
food average, but expensive. staff horrible! please be a bit more careful with ginger pieces, piece like scallop is too big
awful! tourist food, salty and with nothing of chinese cuisine!
great food tastes lovely
rude staff, mediocre food
the dim sums are absolutely delicious and sophisticated with a modern twist to yet. the price are fair, too, so definitely good for your money. i would recommend it to anyone.
this is our favourite dim sum restaurant in london and our chinese friends always takes us there which should mean something right? not too expensive either.
nicest meal i've had in chinatown for ages. well worth a visit
excellent chinese restaurant, lots of choice on the menu and very well priced in chinatown.

palm valley is an outstanding restaurant i strongly recommended for anybody and everybody to go the food is on another level possibly one of the best chinese restaurants in the world very elegant and classy chic establishment fantastic service
awesome  chinese cuisine.
very good fusion food. crappy for authentic chinese dishes. good place if you don't wish to queue on a saturday noon. quite pricey but not mind blowing like hakkasan. nice ambience.

went here for my wives birthday with a party of around 20. they let us being in a cake of our own and did not charge us to serve it. the food was good as was the alcohol but it was not the cheapest place in town nor was it the best.

place is fine to eat. lovely furnished, staff are very helpful. the only thing that bothered me was the setting. the lights were very dim and you couldn't see much. but other than that price are reasonable and the atmosphere is welcoming.
the food is interesting. not so classically chinese place.
dim sum heaven
honestly speaking, their customer service is horrible and when you see a hair in your food while you eating which means at least it is not a restaurant should 12%service fee.

not worth even 1/2 star. food tasted frozen and staff was rude. have u experienced some one saying, if you don't want to pay tip don't bother coming back, that too on your face. if not go and experience yourself.not worth going even once.
busy restaurant but service is fast, really good dim sum variety, everything we ordered was delicious. would go again.
not for chinese, only for
great food. you just need to order everything

very lovely food and drink menu. lots of vegetarian options and there were items on the menu which i tried whilst i was over in china which tasted just as good over here. it was also a reasonable price. i particularly recommend the red lychee tea and the dim sum.

the prawn and wasabi dumplings were nearly as good as the dumplings in hk, and the congee has a definite authentic taste to it. the maitred was fabulous and didnt give us the gweilo treatment. good sake menu too! definitely one of the stronger places in london for authentic canto food!
excellent food, good friendly service, what more can i ask for. jc
such amazing food, reasonable price. nice atmosphere and opens late. would definitely come again!
not the cheapest place in chinatown, but absolutely worth it. everything we had was really, really tasty. portions were reasonable and service was friendly.
not amazing food bug really honest. with a good service and good price. if you want to eat correct chinese food for cheap go there.
not bad if you're looking for a slightly more upmarket joint in chinatown.
food was fine, speed food came out was fine. speed drinks came out very poor. they did not understand much of what we said, trying to order was painful
average dumplings. service is slow. interior is nice.

very delicious dim sum, service is very friendly and very fast buti got served my dessert before my dim sumand:be careful prices are 2-3 pounds higher than they say on the website or on the outside hanging menu, high prices for the portions still very good food
not up to standard of previous occasions
delicious dimsum in a lovely atmosphere

cosy restaurant for friends and family in the heart of london chinatown. quite spacious seating area. food is nice but can be considered expensive. can get dim sum for dinner! didn't get much service here as they only came to take our order and give us the food.
one of the best dim sum place in london, exceptional service and top atmosphere, to be visited?
amazing cantonese food, dumplins expectaculars.
food was delicious, waiter for the night was extremely helpful and friendly!
excellent dim sum restaurant i come back regularly for lunch
great restaurant in chinatown. ask for dim sum menu - it is great but they don't always offer it straight away!
riqusima comida, it's not to expensive dishes from  3.20

the food was absolutely amazing and the staff were so helpful and patient as it can be a bit of a challenge when you go with a big group. definitely recommend trying all the different dumplings they have to offer. oh if you feel brave i highly recommend the chicken feet.
tasty dim sum but unimpressed customer service! why they charge 12.5 % service charge is beyond me! won't be visiting again!
as always wonderful....
great place in china townfood is very nice, staff is friendly. i've been coming here for over 6 years now most of the times i'm in london and i hope to come more often

very modern looking chinese restaurant in the heart of china town. a little dark inside but nice atmosphere. their crispy duck with pancakes is delicious and their plum sauce is the best. reasonably priced for london. friendly and very helpful staff. will definitely come again.

their customer services could be better. the waitresses will place your food on the table without telling you the name of the meal and whos it is.so you are sat there trying to figure out what the name of the meal is and who ordered it.some of the meat that they served was brown on the outside and pink inside.
excellent food and servive. open until after midnight so great choice for after theatre food.
nice and reasonable prices for the area. food is alright too with a good variety and taste normal
yummy dumplings- dim sum menu was good. bit dark inside, atmosphere was a bit dull. seating area was a bit compact but the dumplings were good- love the pork and spring rolls

the food was so nice, definitely will go back next time!!! the prawn and chives dumplings were delicious, definitely recommended!! the balance of the filling in the dumplings are just right and the flavour is yum!!!
beware cash onlythe food and service were great, until we had to pay. turns out, their card machine broke and they did not have the courtesy to inform us prior to eating.
lovely restaurant, great food nice staff

always my go to if i am around in china town, nice decor and  the staff are always smiley,  friendly and polite the menu is vast, always spoilt for choice, but what ever i choose never lets me down also a nice choice of wines.
adored the food and very impressed with service. staff had difficulties with 4 mysoginistic drunk men
great food and service. i will visit again and recommend
lovely food and friendly, helpful service. amazing decor and atmosphere.
the best dim sum!!

competition in chinatown is rife and so the slightest things that aren't right are noticed. such as cold food and mistimed service. food overall was good but other places offer better value and the service we've come to expect.
most dishes tastes ok, but the radish cake had no radish in it.

very over priced from atandard dim sum, nothinv spevial, kept delivering us the weong orders, messed up bill, ignored us when we questioned some of the dishes. music was aasian fusion which was funky. not worth the hype unless we bought the wrong dishes.
best ever

dim sum all day, reasonable prices compared to surrounding restaurants and well worth it- high quality, well cooked and scrumptious dim sum with some original chef-y additions (quails eggs in the steamed prawn and pork siu mai, for example - delicious) and a classy, contemporary environment. we'll be back. recommended.
great food and friendly staff
read the extensive menu, order a few dimsum esp turnip cake. order more as you need. huge portions. great flavour. def will be back for more

came here twice for just food, and another two more times for karaoke and food. food is fantastic, especially the dim sum (a bit pricier than other restaurants but its worth it). karaoke rooms are great, songs are a little dated but perfectly reasonable with a very wide selection.
well presented dim sum at good prices.
reasonable price. the waiter serving us wasn't having it! :) go with very little expectation. food is good
food is ok but are the staff rude. they seem to think they are doing you a favour by serving you!
amazing food and really friendly staff. they have a karaoke room upstairs.shame they charge for extra chill oil
very nice dim sum and friendly stuff !
had a fantastic lunch here?!

wider variety than other restaurants of my favourite dimsum and some tasty variations. excellent presentation.  the manager always make sure we have  a table big enough to accommodate all of us on the top floor.
excellent food, nice atmosphere, and great service
dark environment,because of dark lights...high price with small portion of food...salty food and not well done meat
might be my favourite dim sum place in chinatown. good quality food, friendly staff, nice prices and nice classy dark ambience. a cut above the other choices in the area.
the food was very nice and portions were generous. the staff was friendly and happy to explain the dishes on the menu. will definitely come back again.

you can have dim sum even after 5pm which is good. but the service was not the best. waitress was yawning, beer was served without glass. food was ok but not great. tea was served for four of us prior to our order and we found it costed around 10gbp? we probably go different place next time.

i've taken chinese parents from mainland china here and they were impressed. london locals come back here regularly despite the fact it's in the centre of china town. the dim sum menu is phenomenal and available all day so ask for it
good food and dim sum is available all day!
the best chinese. we travelled 100 miles to eat here.
if you want to eat the real thing thats the place to go in china town , great food , fresh items nice stuff and good atmosphere .the picture will speak better than can i write this time .
good dim sums

probably the best place to go for classical and unique dim sum in londons china town.what they serve here is unique and so its definitely more than what you would expect to get in a chinese restaurant.try the teas too!
good chinese restraunt

staff were rude, the system they use to communicate with other staff gives the impression they are not listening to the customers.  this was confirmed when one of the dishes we ordered did not arrive and we had to reorder.
cosy place with great food and fast service
it was expensive but we enjoyed our meal. the food was delicious.
great dumplings!

trash karaoke, bad smell, bad  equipments, but the worst is the staff, a young man, kick us off when the time is not reached, never smile, no service! fire this stupid guy, otherwise your restaurant would be worse in the future.
not really for vegans and vegetarians. the waiters laughed at me when i asked for vegetarian options
great dim sum, intimate atmosphere.  recommended.

food was good but,we saw him write our order on the paper and stuff was still missing that we had to ask for twice after which was a long wait. didnt pay any attention to us and only really spoke after we payed : /

came for dim sum,  really bad service, the waiters were really rude with some waiters just ignoring us and overall not very attentive. had to ask for our drinks four times, none of the dim sum we ordered came with the sauces so had to ask multiple times. even though food was pretty good the service ruined the experience sadly.
smart and more expensive end of gerrard street's range of chinese restaurants. some dishes excellent, others less so.

great dim sum, served all day. dim sum noodle and rice dishes not on par. good service.nice contemporary looking restaurant.dim sum 3 to 5 average.family of 5 65 with soft drinks only.would recommend the wasabi dumplings, paper wrapped spring rolls and garlic prawn springrolls.
always a good branch
terriable service

plum valley is my favorite asian restaurant in chinatown, best quality price. to whom wish to discover, i recommend the shared mix platter to share and the roasted duck. high highest and amazing and qualified staff
dim sum is very good, but i waiting for a long time to get my foods, so cant come sunday.
good chinese food. friendly service.

cheap and so full. dim sum is one of my favourite food!if i can, i want to order 10 plate of dim sum.daily lunch is between 12pm and 5pm.so better to go before 5pm. if you are group, booking is better. the prawn dim sum with special sou sauce, it is the best ever!!!!
great ambience and lovely staff. the food was scrumptious as well! great cantonese cuisine!!
quality of the food was not as good as expected, the karaoke private room are very nice though
there are better (and cheaper) places to yum cha in chinatown. honeycomb tripe is pretty good though, but lo bak go very disappointing
terrible food and terrible service, even for china town low standards

went for lunch on a saturday. big table for 2 of us and friendly staff. had 6 dim sums plus teas and soft drinks for 30. food was excellent and all had a unique taste and looked better prepared than other places. would recommend.
very nice dim sum, staff were helpful and reasonably priced. i would recommend this restaurant to others.
great food. best in china town. it's a little pricey but well worth it. great stuff too. you have to try the aubergine tofu hotpot.
great food and nice customer service

this smart restaurant in the middle of china town is lovely. clean and modern which is the first draw, but after that let the food do all the talking. we had some chicken noodles and several of the dim sum which were all delicious in their own way. thoroughly recommend the place.
best chinese i've had anywhere, fantastic dumplings.
having dim sum around the world for years. well prepared, good selection, good service, quick (2pm). price/quality ok. will come again
decent dim sum place in chinatown - before 5pm at almost half price which is good value - nice setting, though a bit dark for during the day

really good, slightly more up-market chinese restaurant in the heart of chinatown.we had the evening dim-sum menu and everything was fresh, tasty and just the right amount of heat.well worth a visit if you're looking for somewhere just that little bit special.

a lovely place which serves very delicious food and dim sum also in the evening. the interiors are elegant, service is fast and efficient and the food is delicious and served nicely. you get to circle your order and you get it served. prices are good. i would definitely go back.

keep coming back. great food and reasonable prices. great for work events as well. we go mainly for the dim sum but the mains are delicious too. service can be hit or miss sometimes but overall we're there for the food not the pleasantries :d
very nice food and good customer service
amazing..great place

6 of us dined and every dish apart from one was below average. we sent back 3 dishes. the dumplings were stone cold and the pork belly was simply vile. the sauce tasted off! all the dishes were dry and tasteless. maybe the chef was off that day? nothing upmarket here except the price!

really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere. very friendly staff that took care of us and was always there if we needed anything. would definitely recommend this place for everyone wanting to get chinese food.
great singapore noodles
the foods were very delicious but they were not kind. if you think only important the taste, there is very nice.
food was utterly delicious, a wet walk around london culminating in finding this little hidden gem! i could not recommend enough! amazing
love the crispy duck breast!
expensive, gorgeous roast duck, tasty dumplings.
chrage 2.5 for some chopped red peppers just 5g.   they explained  chilly peppery in london  is very expensive, but it is 1.69 per pack 100g in next china market.   liars..

one of the very few places that serve dim sum in the evening. good selection of dumplings, fair prices for the location. not my number one choice for dim sum at lunchtime but definitely one of the better places for an authentic cantonese experience.
scallops and spinach dumplings and rice paper wrapped prawn are the best! plus the staff is super nice.

went to eat here when it wasn't busy yet the food took so long to arrive and some of it was cold. it was obvious it had been left to one side whilst the other dishes were being prepared. the poop sack hadn't been removed from the prawns. it's a shame can't understand why on a quiet day the food would take so long to arrive
nice clean restaurant with elegant modern design. tasty dim sum.
poor service and rude staff. good food.better options available in chinatown with much more polite attitude.
good chinese food in china town london. liked the shrimp and the pork buns, dumplings could have been better.
ridiculous gratuity factored into the receipt! staff are not the most friendly.
good place for dim sum but make sure they give you the dim sum menu as well as the a la carte menu. quite dark downstairs but brighter on the first floor.
best cantonese dim sum in london. great atmosphere, nice service, fair prices, especially at lunchtime
food was good as was service, recommended
pleasant restaurant in a very busy part of london
great restaurant, love the atmosphere. we sit upstairs and was very pleasant nice staff staff and the food was great.  love the orientl lychee red tea!
what a lovely find. great food and really helpful staff. would recommend booking or getting there early as it gets busy especially on weekends
really good tasting food. service was a little lacking compared to previous visits, hence 4 stars. starter was served after the main with no explanation, but didn't take away from the great taste.
amazing food and karaoke
the food was good, but slightly overpriced and the service could be slightly improved..
food was good, including vegetarian option. service was okay. bit expensive.
dim sum was excellent. definately going back.
absolutely loved it, looking forward to my next visit.
excellent food and nice private rooms ideal for special occasions and birthdays. we ate a lot and only paid 16 pounds.
the place is clean, service is gread and the food is amazing. highly recommended
great food! food was tasty, service was quick and efficient and staff friendly! atmosphere was quiet too so you could talk with your dinner company!
good chinese food at reasonable prices. service was also excellent.
lovely swanky restaurant, relaxed ambiance, very attentive waiters and waitresses and very quick to rectify any issue. thank you so much for a lovely evening
beautiful malaysian/chinese cuisine and great dining experience
superb dim sum and dumplings in london's china town. would make it my favourite place to eat if i lived in london
the average price of the dishes ware 1-2 pounds highe4 than other chinese places in china town. but the price is very reasonable and all the foods were amazing. strongly recommend

excellent quality food, service could be improved but sort of expected on a busy friday night in a multi-storey restaurant.karaoke rooms are also available for booking in for food/ drinks during your session.would say that prices could be a tad bit more affordable.

perfect for lunch. tasty dumplings in a huge selection. colorful doughs with juicy fillings. the shrimp rice cake crepe is also great. fresh jasmin tea is served in pretty teapots. lunch is quite cheap but dinner is pricey. friendly and attentive staff - recommend this place! :-)

the best dim sum in chinatown! tastes really good for a good price, and the staff are really kind. if you order a lot or too little they'll let you know, especially if they can tell you're inexperienced with dim sum. i've taken many friends here for lunch. i haven't ordered from the main menu though, so i'm not sure how it is.

amazing staff, really nice food that was cooked well. the menu has a good variety with some interesting dishes if you really like sea food. if you like cold tiger beer you have to ask them or you get the warm bottles at the front of the chiller

the food here is amazing! everything was bursting with delicious flavours. the price was decent too, so we're the portion size too. if you haven't been, then definitely go! i know i will be visiting again
i've been recently to plum valley with few friends on sunday to have a lovely dim sum lunch. the food was delicious and the atmosphere was great. one of the best chinese restaurant in gerrard street.
delicious dim sum, hot and fresh, excellent flavours. great service, and nice decor and atmosphere. good prices too. even the toddler loved it!
looks nice but tastes awful. never go again. there are so many better chinese restaurants in china town. wanted to try a new restaurant today but it turned out a big mistake. disappointing.
probably the best chinese in china town. highly recommend the dim sum and noodles. flower tea is a must try.
dim sum - superb. plus the noodles (110 on the menu) i recommend to anyone

second time in my life i went for dim sum and this time i had an excellent guide. staff very polite and friendly. we ordered six plates of dim sum and a turnip cake. all arrived quickly. the turnip cake dish was the highlight for me. i would definitely recommend this place to others.
tasty aromatic duck. nice modern style and decoration.

very nice interior, tasty dim sum, and above average service. having eaten dim sum all my life i highly rate this place. the price is very affordable too! note that i went during lunch time, not sure what its like during dinner.
good dim sum (also served in the evening). much cleaner and better service than many local competitors. portions not that big for the cost but food is good quality. would recommend.
great variety of dim sum.  really enjoyed.  try the eel!

great experience. the service was fast. the menu was extensive and the food was excellent. the peking duck was definitely the highlight. make sure to order the sampler and try lots of small plates. it takes numerous visits to even make a dent in the extensive menu. definitely a great spot for dim sum. highly recommended.
top notch dim sum.

really great food but a tad expensive. about .5 to 1 pound more per dish compared to the 2 other dim sum restaurants i visited very nearby. but the atmosphere was great with the seating being several floors high and only 6-8 tables per area so it doesn't sound like you're in a crowded protest.
lovely food and good service.
food was delicious, friendly staff
great dim sums and baos!
food is okay, a bit overpricedthe service is horrible. like the waitress hates us.
great yum cha, fresh and delicious. friendly efficient staff we would return again.
really nice dim sum for a reasonable price in central london

we waited for a table for 5 minutes (which isnt a compliment thats understandable) then we went down stairs to our table. waited 20 mins to be seen and then ordered our food. we got dim sum and we got 4 - 5 dishes. all were over prised and tasted horrible.
great service, delicious dim sum!

really loved this place but for the past few years the taste seemed to have changed and the portions are much smaller than it used to be which is a shame because it was one of my favourite places hope they go back to the old taste and portions.
a bit pricy than it used to be. great eating in london's china town nonetheless!
food was excellent but gets two stars as they basically told us to f off after we paid but where still finishing our wine. #rude

delicious, quick, friendly. ask for the dim sum menu. between than the the regular menu we were a little overwhelmed by the amount of choices but everything we ordered was wonderful. we were a party of 5 and ordered a bunch of plates to share and the portions were great for sharing. very tasty, would highly recommend.
very rude manager who said no dine in at 11:15 pm although their google site says they close at 12 midnight. she (manager) wasnt kind when i showed the website timings
one of the best place to enjoy laksa
nice food in here, very authentic malaysian dishes! recommended!
tasty, flavorsome cafe style street food.
very nice, authentic malay restaurant, great food and fast service. very busy place!

lovely small but very busy restaurant. service was fast and prices very reasonable. i ordered an apple and mint drink and the prawn samba with plain boiled rice. i thoroughly enjoyed my meal. the portion was a good size for me but i don't like big meals. i would go again just to have that dish. worth a visit if you are in chinatown.
really good food with friendly staff
the food and the servers are really nice! even though we had a complication with the food, the people there were more than happy to compensate with drinks (which are stellar)
got the lor mee it was amazing ... great food and fast service
probably the best crossover restaurant ever
price expensive n the food was ok2
great location- in china town. food is flavourful and service is great.

friendly place run by singaporeans. nice food. bobor hitam much recommended. not many veg options, and the dhal for the roti canai was so-so, hence the 4. but will go back to try other dishes, and maybe come back and increase my rating....?
great food. rendang is awesome! and good service. thanks for the rendang fix lol
ok for quick meal desi

small, busy and good halal malaysian restaurant. it's not all that cheap but the food is good, and portion size is good too. it is a bit cramped for seating, so privacy can be a bit of a factor if you're with  friends or something. prepare to queue if in a modest group.
decent food, just be wary of cutlery pots on the table. ask staff for fresh cutlery.
one of my friend got no food at all,   very disappointed, food  was too salty, waiting too long for food, still goes wrong !

went yesterday and the service was awful. ordered beef randang and it arrived after 3 mins. reheated cold beef and starters were off poor quality. overall not impressed even though they reheated the beef it was dried up and tasted bad
the food in this place is super good!! highly recommend it - very very tasty and great value for money.

did a takeaway yesterday. had high hopes but was disappointed. the hainanese felt precooked, the chicken wasn't tender. the roti in the roti canai just want up to the mark (gopals corner does a much better job) and the chicken curry though delicious was very very oily.
if you want to try some singaporean/ malaysian dish but want to keep it light and mild, then the hainanese chicken rice is the one. simple yet flavourful.
comfort malaysian food that hits the spot.
amazing food, great service. cozy atmosphere... worth finding this gem. outstanding flavors.

got recommended this place by a malaysia friend, and it really didn't disappoint!! authentic singaporean and malaysia dishes!  reasonable prices and quick serve. one of the best places to go when you get your asian fried noodles crave!
nice food, busy tho. halal option in that area.
my singaporean girlfriend loved it, definitely taking her again.
beautiful food. unimposing but great.
the raffles laksa noodles tasted of dish soap. we complained and the waiter just smirked and left.
the service was decent and the food was delicious. the amount was decent and the taste was nice. very busy and popular

lovely food, very authentic flavours. their raffles laksa is full of flavour, really well done. beef rendang melts in your mouth, and the assam fish curry is also incredibly tender.quick and polite service too, well worth stopping here if you're in china town
super good, lots of variety, super tasty, off the beagen path experience!
we all absolutely loved the food. great pricing. highly recommend
fantastic service and food , just like when i used to live in malaysia .
very tasty malaysian food. fast service. even at lunch time. clientele is a mix of local brits, local chinese people and tourists. very reasonable prices. delicious. will have to visit again soon.
great casual malaysian place; i keep trying other malaysian restaurants in london, but they are never quite as good!
the starters are awesome! for main courses they serve quite big portions.
good food but crowded
not really for those who prefer more spice in their food. very crammed and staff don't seem to give full attention to their customers.
food is amazing and portions are big for the price
ok malaysian fare. good range of options but the taste is hit or miss.
tasty authentic malaysian food. fairly priced as well. will definitely go again. they do delivery as well.

the satay wasn't really satay.  it was fried chicken pieces on skewers.  you cannot taste the honey in the marinate. so either improve the dish to be more satay-like or otherwise just state in the menu,  fried chicken pieces on sticks....
always love this place.
kangkong is good. beef rendang way too salty. nice atmosphere just like home.
proper malaysia and singapore food
malay cuisine.... delightful

just discovered this great place. halal malaysian restaurant with an amazing menu and great tasting dishes, friendly staffs, modest atmosphere. speedy service as its very busy. a great place for a fulfilling meal for the locals and visitors alike. reasonably priced. try their beef rengdang
first time trying such food. was definitely good food. halal too!
nice malaysian food
great food. love this place.
great food. very noisy fun place
they have the best chao kwai tiu in the world, i mean it!

went there with my mum. loved the nasi lemak coconut rice. ordered char kuey teow however slightly disappointed. tasted too salty and the flat noodles too thick n chewy. surprised that it has wok hei which is hard to find in other msian restaurant. will come back again anyway.
excellent indonesian - and they got seven of us a table.
great value and delicious food
delicious. crispy roti, great prawn gravy mee. carrot cake on point.
very slow service. took me one hour to get my food!
staff was very friendly and menu was reasonably priced. would highly recommend!
very slow service. even my coke took nearly 15mins to arrive! i ordered lor mee and it was the worst i've ever had! the only good thing was the helpful and friendly waitress
it's fine but really singapore raffles laksa. and seriously fried chicken with lor new err wattt
cafe style restaurant, fantastic food, good service, great mocktails !
great staff, very professional and time efficient.excellent menu. a must place to eat in chinatown.

the food was ok. contents of the laksa were a little scarce compared to the same dish i eat in australia, it was also a bit bland. we had to queue outside so it's popularity was obvious. not sure i would eat there again if i found myself in london's chinatown.
always wanted to try this place out and finally had a chance. the nasi lemak was creamy and delicious. the hainan chicken rice was flavourful. i wasn't disappointed at all.
one of my favorite places to eat in london. they are quick and efficient with their service.
great restaurant. delicious food and great service. alice lee is a sweat heart. we will definitely come back.
great food, great service, little cramped and the alcove we were sat in was a little low ceilinged (my fault for being too tall though). will go back...!
friendly workers and the portion was generous however the food lack taste and its quite blend.
good food, good service. very small and tight space. especially if you are going with 4+ people
it's not that easy to find great malaysian food in london - this is the best i've had here so far.
wanted to try the laksa but unfortunately it was sold out so we ordered the beef rendang. it was delicious and not too pricey. i miss home!

really good asian restaurant with a wide array of delicious asian dishes that are freshly cooked and served with the best ingredients and with the help of a very friendly and professional staff as well.

food is good. service is good. price is okey to be a bit pricy as it is in china town. the awkward thing is the way they put table for customers. if you order more than 2 dishes, definitely you will be struggling for spacing. and the tables are very closed each other and felt uncomfortable for customers.
halal malaysian food; tastes really good. would suggest you to make reservations because can be full and no seats. definitely would go there again:)
outstanding service and very tasty food.but i order laksa when food coming is it warm and ingredients was freezing like just take out from fridge.after i request for microwave service.
my food (soup noodle dish) tasted of absolutely nothing. other members of the group enjoyed their dishes, but be careful what you order.
quite authentic asian food. i've had beef rendang and it tasted as good as in malaysia. busy little restaurant, bit dated decor but fully acceptable because food is nice and meals are below 10 :-)
had an amazing time and good quality food. the service was amazing from start to finish. thank you alice you looked after us well.

the food was amazing. it was served in huge portions with reasonable prices. the customer service was quick too and they can accomodate huge families too as they are a 2 floors restuarants. food taste near to authentic and definitely would love to come here again if stop by in london.

my humble opinion on their malaysia food is just an average. it is not bad but not as delicious as the review by others. in term of their service wise, can be improved better because of their staff comes across less friendly and a bit fierce. to sum up, this restaurant is a bit over-rated.

in the heart of chinatown, quite busy from the afternoon right until late night. be prepared to queue. and youll have to wait for your order to come, the service is polite and efficient. the interiors are plain and simple and the food is good, but not great - both in taste and presentation.

food quality is outstanding! however, due to lack of staff customer service was lacking. there was more than 20 minutes difference between the serving of each dish ordered and had to remind them too. overall, the restaurant can easily be a 5 star if the customer service improves as the food is always fantastic.
so delicious! fantastic food that reminded us of our old life in singapore - and such friendly helpful staff. good value too - you must makan here!
halal restaurant. beef rendang and nasi lemak was fantastic! desserts are to an acquired taste but nice still.
delicious roti. not enough canai

we have been regulars here for about 6 yrs now. the good here is the best and very reasonably priced. the best stuff to try here are: chilli crab, prawn mee goreng, beef rendang, chicken satay, arguably the best chinese, malaysian restaurant for food in soho..
the best laksa that i ever eat in my life
their food is too blend and the portion is too big. it's a bit dissapointed!
good food. fast cook

large servings so although a main dish might be say, around 8 or so, it will fill you up. i love the char kway teow - no clams too. i've always hated clams  bandung is lovely. always a busy place. if you miss singaporean or malaysian food, come here to get your fix.
staff were friendly and helpful, but food was over rated. it looked good, but lacks in taste.
food is very good and authentic.the dowside is that you will probably have to sit too close to strangers. but the price that that you have to pay for good quality food for a very reasonable price.
unassuming malaysian dishes in a cheap yet cosy setting. the carrot cake stir fry is a must. avoid the satay.
amazing place. it was muslim friendly and had amazing food. would definitely come here again.

the food here is authentic and delicious and the portions are generous. service is really efficient and the place has a lively atmosphere with lots of noisy chatter and happy faces. we had to queue on a friday night to get in but they were attentive and got us in quickly. it's cheap too - we were delighted when the bill came!
great malaysian/singaporean food, reasonably priced. halal. casual dining place but clean, great staff and fast service. highly recommended.beef rendang is to die for!
excellent food quality for great price. i've not been to malaysia but my friend who i went with had lived there and says this is the first place in london that tastes truly authentic.
a bit of a wait for my 6 people family to get a table (quicker for small group). food is ok for malaysian taste.
food is good, horrible service, they forgot my wife's food and didn't even apologise. shame
service was underwhelming and food was just ok. ordered chicken curry and the food came lukewarm and potatoes were pretty much cold. nothing really stood out.
really good, the staff is really nice !
very nice hot lemon tea and stir fry carrot cake.
best malaysian and indonesian food in the china town and quick service with friendly staff and but spaces are only limited.
really good malaysian food in the heart of chinatown. they offer 2 and 3 course meals for a great price (15 and 17 pounds). will definitely be going back.
taste authentic, don't have to wait for the food and the dish is enough for two.

been coming here for years. used to be really good. recently menu changed and signature nasi goreng is not what it used to be. also pots of tea off menu. service was so terrible last time we left before ordering.
i love rasa sayang, i always get take away from here, fried carrot cake is great, roti chennai, there's a good atmosphere it's often busy because the food is very good
great authentic malaysian food, great service and lots of tables on the basement level, though there are tons of people so it might be good to book in advance. definitely will come back again!

malaysian restaurant in chinatown. great location. standard malaysian food... nothing exceptional... very average... small portions... expensive for what it is... surly service from disinterested staff. avoid.

excellent food and service for reasonable prices. food is malaysian/indonesian and singaporean, can be quite spicy and very flavoursome. not a chinese restaurant but one of the better chinatown restaurants.
malaysian food! halal! and scrumptious chicken rice  what more can you ask for?

i have been going here for a few years. food is consistently good and authentic malaysian. there are always malaysians eating in there so i am sure i am not alone in thinking how good the food is. it can get really busy so be prepared to queue for a table.
love the rendang!!! missing cendol today though
four of us ,me and my husband and my brother with his girlfriend had an amazing time! service was excellent and food was delicous!
went hear 5 years ago and the food and service was average. my most recent visit was a much better improvement. food was lovely and service was quick and polite. would definitely come again.
genuinely authentic malaysian food!
definitely worth going. go for wat tan hor, its my malaysian comfort food.
another delicious meal with quick service and at a good price.
the beef rendang and chicken satay was superb. especially if you are asian and have spent more than a week in uk. we dined here 2 days in a row.
a good malaysian restaurant
having lived in malaysia for 12 years, to go here is food heaven! really authentic malaysian favourites. lovely friendly staff. highly recommended

great food. always fast service of food. you don't come here for the ambience or friendly wait staff. because it doesn't matter. good food that is affordable, a contradiction to london food and pricing.
very yummy chicken rice! (although i do agree that their soda serving size is annoyingly small!)
delicious food and very friendly staff.
food's ok. i mean some of it it pretty nice but some of the soup lacked seasoning. not a place i would go back for south east asian.
excellent restaurant, order the nasi lemak. you can't find good malaysian food like this in london. typical chinatown restaurant busy and quite crowded. very good customer service and quick food.
busy busy here. food fantastic. staff friendly and helpful. loved it, back again soon
excellent food and service!
best place for quick and tasty food. recommend the hot tea milk and roti canai
truly authentic food, and really popular with folk from southeast asia.
my favourite malaysian restaurant. the seasoning and portions are faultless. really friendly staff and a fantastic atmosphere.
prawn mee taste good with a mild heat but the prawn and squid were slightly lacking in flavour. fast eat out with decent prices though.
as a malaysian myself, i must say the fried mee (mee goreng) different from the authentic malaysian taste. however, it tastes good as fried mee.
excellent! delicious food  and great service. will definitely return.
excellent value for money,  good service (we were going to the theatre so didn't have much time).
never been before but loved it. all the food tastes amazing. expect it to be busy but we were seated quite quickly!

genuine malaysian restaurant. our favourite place in chinatown. style reminiscent of food available in thailand as well (we used to live in thailand). wide choice of meals, drinks or desserts. generous portions so good value for money.

one of the very few places in london that serves good quality laksa. happy with the quality of food, however the place is super cramped and noisy with bad acoustics. relocating to a more spacious location would make a lot of sense.

fantastic little singaporean eatery located in china town. cheap and cheerful is the order of the day with seriously tasty laksa, nasi goreng and other culinary treats of the malay peninsula. destined to become one of my go to places in soho
great food. typical china town service
service by adwin and edmund was excellent! food is also exceptionally excellent for southeast asians who miss food away from home.
yummy fresh food, roti with dahl, mee goreng is my favourite so far. the lime and mint juice is delicious....had 2. would definetly recommend.
really nice food in here!
malaysia favourite

restaurant of a real malaysian-singapourian cuisine. a soup with scallops and noodles was very delicious . for a european it may be a bit too spicy but tastes too good not to try. a dessert with tapioca was nothing special however. among all the restaurants in china town i consider this one as one of the best ones
their curry laksa is very tasty just a bit too oily...

this is my first malaysian food so i don't know how authentic they are but the food i  had was very nice and would eat it again. the only complaint i have is that some of the waiters/waitress could be more happy when facing their customers. a little smile would help.
didn't really liked the ambiance

a halal malaysian restaurant in china town. portion is huge, if you are not really hungry consider to share few plates in your group. price is in the mid-range and ask whether the menu is spicy or not if you are not get use to asian spicy food. quite popular amongst malaysian & indonesian residing in london.
this place is no tourist trap! the food is delicious, the staff are friendly and efficient and the price is right. highly recommended.
delicious eastern food. would certainly return.
really nice place where to taste original malaysian food. small rooms and sometimes a bit crowded but worth it. good quality/cost ratio, wide menu with lots of dishes.

probably the only halal china town restaurant in london, if you want to treat your friends who are keen on halal food, it is a good place. prices are not low or too high, yet reasonable given the quality and portions.
they might have changed their cook in 2018. it is not as authentic as in 2017 (speaking from a singapore perspective). not necessarily less tasty though.
everything was very tasty and good value. we tried two classic dishes, the char kway teow and the roti canai, i would definitely recommend both.
authentic malaysian food. good service.
love this place. har mee, chicken satay skewers and oyster pancake are my staples & they hardly fail me.
good service an tasty dishes, like beef randang, but dissapointingly the satay chicken was a poor imitation of the real thing.
delicious authentic malaysian/singaporean cuisine. hard to find in central lodnoni thought id never see pandan cake outside of singapore!good value too. three adults 40 quid and we are overly full.
very yummy malaysian food eat in or take away....
most importantly is its halal. food nice but bland, a lot of varieties though. good if u missed home cooked. very popular place.

great local place for quick beautiful taste of malaysian/singaporean dishes. the food is traditional and reminiscent of typical diners. the staff are friendly but be warned they are incredibly busy. good quick service, great food. the laksa is a gem.
our tastebuds were celebrating!!!@

small place with excellent food. bit steep for a beer but food itself is well priced. beef rendang was amazing and they made a seafood-less laksa for us because allergies weren't the issue. roti canai was a beautiful taste of being back in india/malaysia! i will be back.
good food, decent price, bit cramped
racist and rude
lovely place and very nice food. excellent customers service buy every one and specially alien.  would love to go back and recommend it to every one to try. thank you rasa sayang
: go if youre in the area & and youre not sure what else is aroundcomfort food which reminds me of singapore
good restaurant, accommodated for our large group even though we had no reservation. helpful and patient, thank you.
the laksa is incredible! authentic food.
good food, but poor service. restaurant was quite cold, luckily my food kept me warm! some issues with returning accurate change if paying by cash.

we came for the first time looking for something similar to ramen, however the experience was different and attractive. the food has personality and the flavors are intense. the atmosphere is vibrant and even though you have to queue most of the times, service is fast and attention is perfect.
the foods are delicious! i like the nasi lemak.
honest decent tasty malaysian food. its hard to find good malaysian food in london but this is definitely the closest.
outstanding food and great service
best authentic asian food & reasonable price. staff are polite & helpful too.
solid choice for malaysian food most of the time.

loved the food! beef rendang was excellent - maybe the best i've had, and my mother in law is singaporean, so i've had a fair bit of rendang. but don't tell her i liked this one better! strongly recommended!
hectically busy restaurant offering malaysian cuisine. try the seafood laksa and the pulling tea. also simple but lovely desserts
amazing food. very tight and small restaurant
serving big but taste..still spore style is much better.. pricing too high
more of malaysian taste than singapore but still really good
indonesian food very good typical of indonesia
excellent food and good value for money! restaurant is a little small but all is worth it for the food...
very quick service. great food
the best malaysian restaurant in london by far!
never fails to disappoint and they have yet again added more dishes! great service and portions were definitely value for money.
incredible service, delicious food
lovely food! very well priced also
awesome food
fast service, authentic food.  well priced.
nice halal food

no words!!!..well amazing yummy spicy ..... service is still very good ... family run and the younger staff are friendlier.... anyway we came for the food and they never let us down everytime... love love love this place.
the food was amazing. the noodles, milkshakes and satay was exceptional! i rated it 5/5 because the food was mind blowing. i recommend this to people who love malaysian/singaporean food.

to be honest we where party of 3 and none of us enjoyed the food. allot of fish paste used which was overpowering any flavour.  the lemon ginger juice was great. the only reason i went in because it's halal resturant. the staff was great,

it was very nice place. i can say the tastes are equivalent to what we have in malaysia/singapore. its just that the gravy was not spicy. everything else are superb.standard breakfast set for the local malaysian. nasi lemak + teh tarik. awesome!
i normally have the ipoh hor fun which i always enjoy. today i also tried the sago gula  melaka for dessert. it was slightly too sweet but still yummy. service is quick and friendly.
food is nice but could be better. portion is . service unfortunately is not very good, its like they dont care. still, i love me some halal malay-singaporean food!
food great, price ok, service a bit grumpy
very bad service. food never comes.
yummie indo foods.. but please make the correct cendol drink ala indonesia.. thx
amazing authentic malaysian/singaporian food.
great food, tasty and spicy. a little gem between all the bland fried noodle places.
delicious food, good service, great restaurant
i had the char kuay teow and sadly it was really bland and unevenly heated as if it was warmed up in the micro.
foods are tasty and in very big portion. price wise shall be say reasonale down here. ownef by a malaysian boss, should support. ha..ha
good cuisine. this was my second time and very pleased with the staff and of course food
jimin, jungkook and jin were here
the best char kuay teow in london, always go there to when i have a craving. definitely recommend!
best meal of 2019
went for food there last week and got e coli, still in bed recovering! do not go here!

excellent food and customer service!! i went with my boyfriend and we ordered one menu and a couple of plates more, the lady who served to us was very kind and friendly even though they were kind of busy that night. i recommend it and we will come back for sure.
amazing malaysian food. authentic to say the least.
one of my favourite asian restaurants in london and worth the trip across town to get there. haven't tried a dish that wasn't delicious. mee goreng outstanding.

i was scouting a place for roti canal post a trip to malaysia. stumbled across this gem! the lamb, nasi goreng and roti canai is incredibly good! good value for portions. i can't wait to go back again! note: they don't take reservations.
if you fancy singaporean or malaysian cuisine this is the right restaurant for you . so many choices and great taste as well. value for money and good service.
delicious spicy crab noodle soup!  great value and quick service. yummy, must visit!!!
great food!!! very friendly staff. normally there is queue but it's moving fast.

been here many times, love the mooli cake and laksa. friendly staff, quick service. cant sit inside for too long as they are always busy and would expect you to leave when you finish your food. but food wise they are honestly great!
quick service decent food and decent price
the dumplings are so good! went in there randomly on a weekend and it was the best malaysian place i have been to!
always go everytime can not decide where to eat in china town :p the food is good and not expensive
food was ok,  but cockroach walking on the floor was a turnoff. will not be going back
food was super tasty (esp curry dishes) and the portion sizes were great. overall i would go again
nice food asian style in china town soho
delicious food, affordable price, and friendly staffs
nice restaurant with interesting food. the crab is delicious even if a bit of work to go through. the other dishes felt rather ordinary but good for a quick bite while in chinatown.
really nice food.great
excellent food at a reasonable price. staff was very nice, and take great care of guests with allergies.
not need me to tell u what to do if you are malaysian here... order all the food...amazing malaysian cuisine
great tasting chineses food for a decent price, a very busy place but well worth the short wait.
absolutely outstanding. i frequently go to malaysia and am half malaysian and the food here is authentic, great value and extremely good. the nasi lemak is
food. service. best cheap eat in china town. love it everything i go.
good spot for authentic malaysian cuisine. price point is decent for their serving size.
love their laksa and their nasi lemak is amazing! also, its all halal!
my first time at a malay restaurant. the food was full of flavours and spices. definitely going there again.
delicious malaysian food at a relatively low price

love the food! my husband's most favorite restaurant in china town so far :)the place was very crowded when we went there, yet the service was speedy and nice.the prices were relatively affordable.we visited this restaurant twice in our last london trip and will surely come back again in our next trip to london next year :)
yummy food! absolutely worth the wait
in and out thats there best way to describe this little place. food comes very fast and its tasty however a bit stingy on the meat.
lovely and cosy, service was good and food did come quickly and tasted great only one on the dishes was only not hot enough.
singaporean and malaysian verified. (nasi lemak, roti chennai, satay can be improved, else laksa, cha kway tiao all good)
