first time trying here via uber takeaway. we had:char kway teopan fried carrot cake (actually made of mooli)chicken satayroti canai with curry sauce coconut riceeverything was very nice and the portions were huge - doesnt look it in the picture but the noodle and mooli were huge. highly recommend.
please. don't hire amateur waiters. and customers want authenticity. not hard to get right.
food was delicious, with good customer service. food came soon after order with generous portions. will visit again.

excellent, traditional malaysian food. you have a craving or just came back from malaysia want some good authentic food, then this is the place for you. the staff are very lovely, the food is amazing and the prices are very reasonable. be prepared to wait during busy times, the secret is out and tons of people want to eat here now.

the food was microwaved i felt sick for 2 days.i had rice noodles with different types of fish ,the water where the noddles were served in had the same consistency of gravy,the fish was really rubbery,the leaves they put on the plate felt like slime,it was just awful.
food is really delicious, i always go for the singapore laksa soup which is so filling. service is generally good and the prices are very good for the portions
authentic malaysian and singaporean food. got the approval of our fussy children too!!
the food was discasting

portion sizes vary greatly, my portion size could have fed 3 hungry people and my husbands just about filled him up. customer service is good, my food was delicious but i didn't enjoy the chicken my husband picked

while the prices here were about 5x the price in singapore, the taste of the chicken rice and char kuey teow reminded me of singapore! it was nice to have a taste of singapore food again, and i would eat the chicken rice here again! the har cheong gai was quite dry though... for me at least.
not sure if i ordered the wrong dish but the lor mee was underwhelming. broth had hardly much flavour and lacked any depth. dishes are fairly priced though. would re-visit to try other dishes.

food was too bland despite requesting them to make it a little spicy. staff one of the waitresses wasnt very polite. girl who took the order was really helpful. i was asked to pay for extra peanut sauce for my chicken satay, i requested for it as it was really dry.

nice, fast and quite cheap malaysian restaurant in chinatown. it has the maximum rate of food hygiene something to take into account as other places nearby they have a very low rate. nasi lemak didnt seem very authentic with curry chicken so i went for some noodles and they were nice. they have vegetarian options.
very lovely restaurant with nice staff.the food is not only very delicious but also very filling and friendly on the pocket.
pretty authentic curries for a malaysian restaurant in london
bad service, rude staff and the foods was not really nice.
taste good, reasonable price and generous portion! decent asian restaurant in central london.
great food, great value as ever

the food is really bad by any standards. their signature dish (nasi lemak) - rice was undercooked, curry chicken was bland. do not order the orh jian (oyster omelette). it was awful. the marmite chicken wings were overly salty.  34 for 2 pax for 3 dishes with 2 teh o kosong (black tea with no sugar). bad bad bad. never to return.
the hainan chicken was very disappointing, it did not live up the hype that i have heard from my friends who have visited singapore. the satay chicken was pretty good
nice halal chinese place. i'd recommend the me goring
this place is fab. the food is excellent - we loved the fried carrot cake, the prawn mee, the sambar okra is delicious! highly recommend!!

do not choose this restaurant for delivering food, if you taste the food on the restaurant is okay.but! but! if your order the food from their restaurant by deliveroo. it is the rubbish ! its the food totally out of the fresh !
good customer service, clean environment and great food!!

good service, great quality food at very reasonable prices just off shaftsbury avenue (near china town).lots of choice on the menu, tried a few things so far, and have liked all of it.recommended by a malaysian friend, and haven't regretted it since.
loved it great food fast service nice people.
really nice restaurant for authentic malaysian food. great for a family night out or a quick lunch. pricing is decent too.
the food of the nonya and baba, served in a small but sympathetic eatery in london town
great placw for peoper malaysian meals.
there's a lady called linda and she does my hair all the time. without a doubt she knows what she's doing. 5/5
good service
delivers consistent haircut quality. recommended.
not the most fancy looking salon but had a quick and good haircut here. decent price too.
very friendly and helpful hair dresser. gave some really good tips regarding my hair. of course, the hair cut was really good too!
best japanese place i have visited so far in london. you have to wait sometimes a bit to get a table, and the service is not the fastest, but totally worth it!
lovely food and so much attention to details. looking forward to coming back.
love the food! small place and always a guarantee queue but worth the wait.
their kinako bing su is great, recommended.
great place if you fancy shaved ice. best quality and not pricey at all.
delicious and unique snow balls texture!
i really like the bingsu here; it's the best dessert on the menu.
the shaved ice desserts are amazing. a bit pricey but so tasty, and lots of different flavours to choose from! i recommend the matcha bing.
might take a long time for waiting but it's worth to wait. however, please remind that the restaurant close at 10.30 pm because sometime they might not mention you about the time of last order.
bit expensive but worth it! would only go for tea time and their shaved ice! their shaved ice is the best ive had in london yet
the only place in london that serves proper korean desserts!
the best place in london for japanese snowflake ice cream, but that's about it.
all about the shaved milk desserts!

best dessert place i have visited so far! tried the strawberry, mango and matcha bing and my favorite is the mango one. everything is really fresh, and the shaved ice tastes creamy but fresh. recommend this to anyone who's looking for late night dessert as they open till 11pm.

chinatown's most famous bakery, they do sweet desserts as well as savoury buns. my personal favourite is the bbq pork bun which is only 1.30 each, 2 will fill you up for lunch and they are generously bursting with sweet char siu pork! best value thing in chinatown, definitely worth paying pilgrimage to! :d
the atmosphere is chill and the desserts are delicious. never gonna regret coming!
the bingsoo here is the bomb.
authentic and delicious food, great portion size and amazing deserts!
normal chinese style dessert, actually they say it's japanese dessert. no service, but charged me service fees. i asked for the bill, but they told me go to the till and pay.

nice service and cozy atmosphere for afternoon tea. it's very comfortable  to have a chat with friends and enjoy bingsu. on a slight negative note, i wished there could be less shaved ice and more strawberry on the strawberry bingsu.
pretty place, reasonable price, amazing food and great service for a place so busy. will come back
honestly the best sushi i've tried in london and the people are soooo nice here . also the shaved ice i recommend the mango one
been there for sushi as well as the desert. lovely sushi,but now my main reason for a visit is the shaved ice.
very nice ice flakes. not expensive. flavours get boring after a while though. price is adequate.
ive been here way too many times but by far the best bingsoo ive ever had

i had a lovely dinner with my friend on her b'day and the food was delicious. i tried for the first time taco yaki and i loved it. the tea was yummy and the ebiten roll i devour it in seconds  i enjoyed the atmosphere and the food, the staff is really nice.
the bingsu was great. would come back to try the rest of the menu... and have more bingsu
their desserts (the shaved ice and cakes) are out of this world. i highly recommend, although the place is a bit small so you may have to wait before getting seated.

nice service, hot waiters who almost melt the matcha bingsu haha must try the matcha bingsu really! and the soft shell crab roll four stars only because the waiters are kinda impatient to wait you to finish the food and almost wanna grab the food away whole we are still eating it.
bing su is amazing. come here and get bing su. the katsu curry is also one of the best in london. bing su.
very good food and nice friendly service, i didn't give 5 because it is not impressive looking place at all

the most expensive tea ive ever had. we got a small cup of hot green tea for 2.50 and a small cup of hot hoji tea for 2.95, should be pot or refillable. so disappointed! feeling rip off. however, we had matcha bingsu and mango bingsu, both were nice.
like the bing su
great bingsu and matcha swiss roll.

waited for a table for about 10 minutes, asked to place an order beforehand and they took our order. fast forward 30 minutes of sitting in a cramped seating area we asked about our order and they told us desserts take awhile, but we later found out they never took our order. 1/10 would not pay for this ice again.
slow service,  but the food is worth waiting for.
best place in town if you're looking for a traditional chinese bakery.  they're freshly baked in store and they're everything is generously sized.
i always go for having dessert. the frozen milk flakes are delicious.
correct.
delicious desserts! pretty packed for a small place. if you come for dinner expect que!

yummy chinese delicacies - especially love their chinese cookies. even though i have moved work base from holborn to tooting broadway, i still make a detour on way home at end of the week to get my fix of my favourites.
really fashionable style and good staff although waiting times were not good. the shaved ice was especially amazing!

i really loved this bingsu.. or in japanese: kaligri (shaved ice cream)! there were matcha and anko (read beans paste).. so tasty!!! even if it was a small one it was hard for me to finish it! i really recommend to share it with your friend or partner!

i have been looking forward to go to this resturant for ages. the food is very traditional japanese, the set meun tgis is a unaju which is good with some real favor in it. the price is acceptable and the staff are welcoming.
the best mango bing in london!
the best bingzu in london but hard to accommodate many people for same table.
nice food but small place (need to wait for seats!)
the special bing dessert is probably one of the freshest and nicest desserts to be imported into london. very popular choice

expensive, tiny portions of food and limited menu. one of the waiters kept on sneezing and wiping his runny nose while preparing food in our presence. tiny space, canteen atmosphere. there are plenty of much better restaurants nearby.

not so pleased with the service waitress was like not there our drinks came after we finished our food and it was just bottled waterthe sushi chef was not present so we did need to chose other foodoctopus was off had a bit of a trouble after this lunchdo not waste your time and money there is better places in soho
always big queues, their milk snow deserts are good, but nothing special.
small place and a bit expensive but very well maintained and good service
love th food and dessert served here. slightly small so the queue can be long, but if you need a table for 2 then it's usually quite fast.

great little cafe in soho, was craving bingsoo (shaved ice) and got a massive serving! value for money with your fave kpop tunes playing in the background. nice atmosphere and staff #flowerboys lol. would definitely go back :)
great cake and good prices (the fruit sponge is the best). their other stuff looks really nice as well but there's only so much one person can eat!
very tasty! lots of unique and interesting dishes.
expensive but tasty shaved (milk) ice. not to burst anyone's bubble, but the mango is not fresh but from a can of aroy-d mango.
great bingsu: shaved ice milk. you can split a small (6) between 2 people; i recommend the mango.

wonderful place! wide range of shaved ice dessert and my favourite is azuki latte (japanese red bean), the only one star short is for waiting area too small and sometimes have to wait outside. but good thing is the staff won't force you to share table like other japanese restaurants do! :)

they serve shaved ice which is a milky liquid that is frozen and shaved very finely that it resembles snow. the  one we had was made with strawberries and had japanese  strawberry short cake in its. the drinks here a good as well, gets busy and serving times are abit slow.
great place. long queue.
the restaurant is quite small, but the food is good.

went here for my friends birthday and it was amazing! we had some edamame and sushi as starters and some delicious noodles! and of course some crushed ice after.. definitely worth all my money i spent! good job guys!

a place where you can enjoy bingsu, or an ice flake dessert, originally from korea. would recommend you to start withtge strawberry one. you may also have japanese foods at the underground floor. but the queue for desserts is quite long and you might need to wait outside.
awesome place! sushis are good! everything looked so good and tasty on the menu! i could have got everything :))
shaved ice is yummy but how can they take 20mins to serve a bottle of beer and 25mins for 1 shaved ice after 9:30pm?
it was delicious though bit expensive.
great shows ice deserts
their saved ice desserts are amazing!!! both price and taste!! brought several of my friends here and they all loved it
ok you come here for the bing su - yummy!
great little place. quick and friendly service. lovely food about what you'd expect to pay in the area. could do with a little tlc to spruce the appearance a bit but enjoyed it a lot.

this is not a real japanese restaurant. the japanese food in here was not good. on the other hand, the bing su in here are really good. so if you are looking for japanese food, this is not an option. but if you are looking for bing su, yes it's your place.
very nice food. especially love the bingsoo.  the service is excellent what makes it great so you always wanna return.
the fluffiest snow ice i've ever tasted - get the kinkako (soy bean) with azuki option, you will not regret it.
excellent restaurant. visited japan a few times and this is a great reminder of the great food i ate there. highly recommend.
delicious bingsu and definitely worth your money as even a size small is enough to fill your belly!
i came for the bing su desert was amazing, almost tried all their flavours

good spot for dessert but it's always busy on weekends especially. you might have to queue for a bit to get a table. they have bingsoo (shaved ice) which i love and other selection of food, drinks and dessert
decent bingsoo

i frequent this place for their bingsu. i recommend the matcha flavour but if you're not into that then the mango is superb as well. the rest of the food is average. four stars because the toilet is not very clean and it is very small, hardly any room to move.
the best bingsoo i've ever had is from here. highly recommend the kinako flavour! it's just a shame that it's so hard to get a seat here.
the bingsu was very nice but the staff are a bit slow in serving and taking orders

oh so heavenly milk bingsu! soft as powdered snow and melts on your tongue with a subtle sweetness. delicious! highly recommend the oreo bingsu and the ichigo (strawberry) bingsu. staff are efficient and polite.only thing to note are the long wait times due to small space in the shop. a must visit despite this!
best place for shaved ice dessert!!
great food and great service!

usually come here for the bing dessert, only place in london with the snow ice machine, a must try! the curry udon is very good, but slightly overpriced. lots of customers every hour of day, you will always need to queue. service is slow/snow machine is slow.
good place although lacking a bit of character. the food is good but not memorable. the service is fast and pleasant.a little on the pricey side with regards to drinks.
went here for dessert. good place to go with friends. the bings were refreshing.
very tasty!
reasonable prices, very delicious bingsoo but the waiting is a bit long
excellent!!

as close to a hong kong style bakery you can get in london, the cakes here are delicious, the custard tarts are fantastic. everything freshly baked. prices typical of chinatown so well worth a visit for a sugar rush
normally full of people and need to queue. taste is good although a bit pricey. a place for both a full meal or dessert.
well i've only tried their dessert and have now been back twice!! it is brilliant thumbs up!!! definitely recommend.
a bit expensive but the food is amazing!!!!
always have something lovely to eat and drink here.lovely service too

the bing desserts are amazing! i went in there with friends and we each had a different flavour and they were all delicious. the service was a little slow as we were waiting quite a while for just three desserts.
one of the best japanese restaurant in london! very tasty food. excellent staff

we went here for dessert, the shave ice was very refreshing, matcha roll cake was really nice too. i took one star off just because the place was a bit small and you might have to wait for a bit if you go with a group larger than 2.
very good food, nice atmospher, food can sometimes take longer than expected to arrive
it's absolutely a pathetic restaurant because the staff are flippin korean instead of japanese and the restaurant should be worked by people from their country's tradition.

beautiful small restaurant, we ordered the classic red bean bingsu(classic one) and the mango bingsu. it was absolutely refreshing and was beautiful. this was the first time trying bingsu and i was not disappointed! it was so lovely and will be coming back soon, great customer service!

i love it. one of my favourite restaurant london, when i'm hungry for japanese food. the food is lovely, the staff nice. some people just come for dessert, you have you try they special frozen milk dessert.
one of the best japanese places i've ever been to. noisy and lively in the best possible way, with absolutely cracking food right in the heart of london.
small place, a little pricy, but the food is so good! great service and friendly staff!
amazing fresh food! the girls were very lovely and respectful. best salmon i've eaten in my life. try the rolls.
definitely have to try their bingsu it's amazing!

had a small shaved ice. i really love how fine the ice is and the kinako powder goes perfectly with it. even a small one was too much for me near the end, so perhaps sharing it between 2 would be alright.
very good bingsu. we tried the matcha bingsu, mango bingsu, and chocolate oreo bingsu. the shaved ice tasted milky and the texture was amazing. would recommend!
love those snowy ice desserts.

the desserts they serve are something i would come back for. unfortunately my most recent visits have been less impressive than my first one. the attention to service provided has been appalling especially since there was only one other table when my group of friends came.

delicious and authentic japanese. save room for their desserts - i would recommend the kinako bing. the small is massive and can serve 2-3 after dinner. can get busy with a long line on friday evenings and weekends
really yummy food just love it
great food, the bing su was much better than expected - a must trygreat quality sushi  - a bit pricey but would go again
great bing. the miso aubergine was also surprisingly good.
very nice food. good service.
very nice korean/japanese cafe! loved the special dish korean spicy chicken
i loved it!!!!!! it's such a great place for soups...you can chose a base...add toppings...it's a completely customisable order!!

i had the best mango bing i have ever tasted. with generous proportions and a perfect balance of sweetness, it's filled with hidden mango pieces buried in the milk bing. highly recommended, not sure about the hot food tho.
the place is quite small and there can be a queue. but the menu offering is decent
small place but the desserts are good. bit pricey for what it is though.
amazing place,  good food if you are open to try something new
the food is delicious even though the waiting was  pretty long. a bit pricey. lovely staff
absolutely disgusting attitude. slow and rude. food took ages and when it arrived was not what we ordered. no apology nothing just a blank expression on her face. avoid at all costs.
matcha snow? it can't get any better!
amazing place, everything is really fresh, tasty and really affordable
manga shaved ice is so refreshing i felt born again
snow was great but the sushi was below average. considering this is supposed to be a good japanese restaurant i expected better from the sushi. go for the snow but skip the sushi.
the still water is amazing, the little slice of lemon is a nice touch, totally worth the 2.50. i'd give it 10 stars if i could!
too small and not that yummy
place is small. waitress tmd ccb hen l 7 rude
very tasty, prices absolutely ok!
their icecreame is very good
delicious fun dessert! great bingsu flavours available!
amazing bingsu, reminded me of the countless times i visited sulbing () in seoul... and this rivaled, or maybe bettered, the flavours!
i love desserts and its definitely a good place to go. the left one is amazing. the mango one seems to be too sweet for mewell so is frappuccino of starbucks), though my friend disagrees with me.

mostly dwelled by locals, this japanese casual diner and dessert place specialized in kakigori also offers a small selection of typical japanese caf dishes (tonkotsu, curry, noodles) and a few sushi and donburi options. the overall quality is good and the staff is friendly and polite. very good value for central london as well
berry good shaved ice thingies
loveable but very tiny japanese place. food is great. definitely try shaved ice if you have never had it.
delicious bingsu! a bit more fresh fruit would have hot the spot :)
amazing desserts! had the mango and the matcha kakigori. have not tried the hot food, but will definitely be back to give it a go.
best bingsoo you can find in london! the flakes are milky and creamy, all ingredients are fresh!
quite small but dessert and food is absolutely amazing. however they charge service charge.
great for shaved ice, good portion
quite small and basic, but really good rice and delicious sashimi! quick service, friendly staff, great find near west end theatres
tho its been sometime... but i pass by here so often so i gotta say last time i was here was shocked by the mochis price and there was a small rat at the bottom floor.... :(
the best japanese in all of london, so say everyone! incredible food, cute little venue.

gorgeous desserts of shaven condensed milk and fruit. i absolutely love them. had never had the food but it looks great too! only problem is, the place is very small and usuay have to wait long times to be seated. but recommend to try!
staffs are very rude and bad attitude especially the guy at the front. the food quality has been dropping aswell for at least a year now. the food and desserts was very good a few years ago.
love the strawberry, matcha and red bean bingsoo!

cute as hell fluffy fat pancakes. not super sweet so didn't feel too naughty. not a big seating area, more like a bench so don't expect to spend too much time here. the fruit teas were also super interesting with loads of fruit and coconut jelly in. worth stopping by!
nice and cosy place. food was good too. not ideal if you're claustrophobic.
excellent japanese/korean place for dessert, the shaved ice (soya flavour) and the macha roll is so yummy! its not too sweet and feels very light. i would recommend this place!
the shaved ice xuebing is great as always. what a nice place for desserts or afternoon drinks.
shaved iced bingsoo is nice, place a little small but overall great.

ichigo bing, came here for dessert and was delicious. will be coming here again during summer. was a bit disappointed a chef wasnt available to prepare parts of the menu but this dessert was very good
love the bingsu herethe espresso bingsu is stunning would have given this place 4 stars but unfortunately they always run out of the espresso bingsu! have not had one in my last 3 visits
absolutely a must visit place in soho. watch my video on youtube . soho london mominnz
good service but the most average sushi i have ever had:(
dirty place with very rude waitress who spilt condensed milk all over the floor and me! didnt apologise or even mop up the floor. would not recommend.
the perfect lunch break during our excursions around london.
authentic japanese. family loved the strawberry bing which we have tried for the first time. will definitely come back here next time we visit london.

i have yet to try the food but i always come here for my favour shaved milk! very tasty and obviously cooling. its quite a big bowl so if you're not a big eater then you night consider to share, but if you're greedy like me then one each is always the best option!
amazing strawberry shaved ice (bing)
my favourite place in chinatown, especially for their shaved ice desserts and sushi!
food pretty good...service slow
bingsu is cheap and so good!! they also do some cakes, which are as amazing

best bingsu ever!!! (im from an asian country yet i feel the bingsu is one of the best) they dont just use ice for the bingsu. we tried the peach (momo) bingsu, and the peaches were very fresh and tasty. the interior is very cute and great for a chilled hang out.
cosy & good service
very friendly waiting staff, tasty food arriving very quickly. four stars as it could you a little bit of interior design to bring out some more japanese character.
only had the tempura udon but it was really top notch with both shrimp and vegetable tempura, so a great deal. the shaved ice looked great as well.
the matcha red bean bingsu was super delicious!
best bingsu in the area. highly recommend the mango bingsu. it comes with condensed milk and 3 blocks on mango.i have yet to try the normal menu since the bingsu is such a great purchase.

amazing small restaurant in soho with a homely feel. staff is very nice and is quick to tend to your service! selection isnt the biggest but isnt the smallest and i would reccomend anything on there as its amazing! definitely reccomend the bing su! can get quite busy so waiting takes around 10-15 mins
excellent tasty dishes (well at least for what i usually order ). very clean as well and polite staff. could do with more space for customers.
fantastic japanese restaurant (we had sushi) just a little bit around the corner!
very good place. nice food
great food. great deserts. great staff. been here 4 times. never was i disappointed.

best shaved ice
great cakes love this shop

after a long tiring class, i headed here to chill~
i iove mocha and mango
the mango bing is great

really nice japanese desert solve there but a bit expensive. i would not mind to go back from time to time.
good for an impromptu tea and dessert, loved the shaved ice dessert
i love the shaved-ice dessert!
matcha roll is super good.
best bingsoo in london
cute staffs and tasty bings.
really tasty food!
lovely sushi roll and professional, friendly staff
lovely japanese food and the dessert is to die for!

very nice food. shaved ice is fun if just a tad overpriced.
i really enjoyed the bingsu although their service was quite slow and the restaurant is write crammed. i would have preferred to have more layers though.

surprisingly good sashimi and bingsu. my favourite hole in a wall but expect to queue at busy times.
great desserts which is always fill of people
you must try the bing! it's unlike anything i've ever had.
tiny, tasty, cheap chinese bakery with no space, no service, and halfway around the world from the golden gate (san francisco). frequently sold out of items, so pick from whatever is put out.

amazing little cafe!the chawan mushi, sashimi salad and yuzu tea is my go to order, always makes me happya little pricy for china town, and it's quite small go in the daytime as it gets very busy in the eveningsperfect for casual dates
had a kinago and matcha bing and both were delicious!
the matcha one was especially good!
i like the ice bingsu
oreo flavour is the best!!
descent shaved ice!
delicious dessert
nice japanese restaurant.
great bing su

amazing food(normal prices for this part of the city), the staff are extremely nice-we asked for forks, but we dropped one of it, before we pick the one from the ground the server was already on her way to get us another one recommend!!!
food no good, i shaving yes!

food was good. only problem it took ages to arrive to the table. there was only one person in the kitchen on a saturday at lunch time and we were desperate waiting about an hour (if not longer for the food).
the shaved ice cream was really good. i had the or so one and it was amazing. the amount you get for the price you pay is good too. like there was alot of it.

ordered 1 bottle of beer & 1 dessert.the beer took 15 minutes and a complaint to arrive. the dessert took nearly 30 minutes.tasted ok but definitely not worth the wait. would not go there again or recommend.
mango bing and kinako bing. 6 each with generous portion.
amazing ice cream! really fast service and was quite cheap as well
i love bing su !
small cozy japanese place, serving yummy desserts and also main dishes; only tried kakigoris and they were yummy. wished they had more toppings though!!!
i always bring my family here for their tasty shaved ice dessert. this is our go to whenever we have dinner in chinatown. i always recommend them to my friends.
was seated in the back which isnt the nicest area. sushi was alright.
price is a little too high for me. food was great though. the hotate is *out of this world* and the shaved ice was surprisingly really good! very smooth, creamy and melty shaved ice.
very tasty
super tasty shaved ice i love the matcha flavor one definitely come back ! small size is quite a lot for one person .

had good experience there
nice cosy place in chinatown london. had the bingsu. portion sizes were big and bingsu was good.
great place for matcha red beans shaved ice, recommended if you have never tried before. the place is small but boutique

a small restaurant with a cozy family vibe. friendly service and yummy food. i shared the momo (peach) bingsu with my gf and really appreciated the way the peaches, sauce and condensed milk were layered.
amazing place for bingsu dessert, i have had all flavors except for oreo as i don't like to indulge in chocolate. best bingsu ever.
little tokyo in london!
we waited 25 minutes they served everyone else except us so we left unfortunately because we really wanted to try the ice cream white snow with strawberries
very pricey yet very yummy.
this place is expensive af (i mean unagi for 35!!) but the food is good. the best part is the kakigori, if you dont have anything else, you need to try the kakigori
excellent japanese food in soho, one of many great japanese restaurants around soho, leicester square and shaftesbury avenue popular with students and theatre goers
really nice milk ice-cream, the best i have had so far. there is a slight waiting time but the staff are very polite and there is a great atmosphere.
they do not providing authentic japanese cuisine i think. just a restaurant in jp style. and it is run by korean.my friend's beef don was very sweet in taste and my udon was too soft.
my first time here, every single dish was amazing. will definitely go again
lovely food and bingsu
amazing and big sized portions. worth to go
love the deserts there! the portions can be quite large when it comes to shaved ice cream. worth every penny.
nice interior but very very tight sitting. not cozy at all. the red beans toppings could be more. #duchessonfoot #fishfingerofficial
this place is soooo good!! the service is lovely and the food is delicious. try the scallops in the starters!
one of the best japanese restourant in soho!
try the bing su! pricey but fantastic and very cute atmosphere

it was my time having japanese dessert and it was amazing. i had  the oreo choco bing su. i was pleasantly surprised by the shaved ice with sweetened milk. we also true the matcha set and the red bean bingsu. all very impressive. they need to make their seating area more attractive though.
amazing food, great taste and great quality, great service and great massive bills. all round a brilliant experience in a tiny little gem of a restaurant.

a very well put together restaurant with great quality food and good service. the general atmosphere is relaxed and the food is reasonably priced. one improvement would be to have a wider selection of dishes to choose from, other than that the place is perfect for a lunch or dinner, alone or with company.
narrowed supermarket selling chinese food and ingredients. sauce, instant noodle and preserves are in fairly good price but the frozen food does not. always a long queue.

yes see woo! this place is great! the produce here is so fresh and the variety of products (they even sell cute china!) is impressive. i keep hoping i will run into fuschia dunlop here so cross your fingers for me. buy your wok here, and all the bok choy and chili bean paste to cook in it.
a typical chinese supermarket in china town-a rich selection of chinese goods and not that good service. however, it should belong to the bests among its peers.
the best chinese supermarket in london. great selection
whole sale vegetables and food ingredients have been sale here. do not come alone. it is much cheaper to share with your friends.
my family were go shopping for the chinese  supermarket while they were shopping for the food
excellent chinese supermarket the heart of chinatown. they sell kitchen supplies downstairs too. by the way, it's the cheapest place to find a steel wok.
awsome experience. many rare vegitables and chinese made products

packed with a fantastic array of good chinese household food brands and some homeware items. perfect for stocking up on hotpots, teas, sweets and frozen meats. has narrow aisles and can get very busy. try to visit during less busy hours using the google busy chart in google maps.
great selection of chinese fare.  clean store.  very popular with tourists and locals.

great place for asian groceries...  shame you have to spend more than 10 if you're paying by car (although,  they have a little hide corner at the end of the shop with the cheapest oysters i've ever found in london,  0,70 each)
note : no card payment under 10. decent supermarket so long as you know exactly what you are buying and where to find it. asking for help when in a rush was hopeless :)

often very crowded, this supermarket in the heart of london's chinatown stocks many different chinese and asian grocery products. if you are interested in oriental cooking, this is definitely a place you want to visit.
better stocked and cleaner than other supermarkets in chinatown. quality products at decent prices.
loads of chinese products at reasonable prices

gtrat place to get your asian groceries, lots of variety in your typical asian supermarket fashion. staff aren't that friendly, and prices are london prices, but compared to waitrose, sainbury it's much better value for your asian foods. just a pity it's far away so i can only go once / week.
great range of asian food products on offer. note, cash only for purchases 10 or under.
very good selection of chinese stuff n they are slightly cheaper than other supermarket
great prices and have a ton of products and brand names - easily one of the best chinese supermarkets in central london. look out for the fresh fruit!
great little store with all the supplies you could want.  the frozen seafood is amazing value.  always busy.
usually has everything i want. could be easier to move around inside
good place for oriental food, some things are cheaper then wingyip
many chinese food
happy to shop there.
surprisingly comprehensive asian shop. broad range of frozen dumplings and seafood.
not the biggest oriental shops around but they have the best selection in my opinion
variety of food, some fresh vegetables, yet rude staff, no matter how good the food is, never going to buy from there again. they are big supplier and big business anyway. they don't care.

of all the supermarkets in chinatown, it's the best for frozen meats and vegetables. their frozen dumplings also tend to be the cheapest and most flavourful. canned goods however tend largely to have dents in them, so choose carefully. deliveries come in at all hours of the day, so try not to linger by the doors just in case.
good place for chinese shopping.
clean and tidy environment. cashiers are not friendly though.
i love it. they sell beautiful cups and everything i'm gonna go there again. is a fantastic shop
it's a good place to get specialist oriental ingredients and utensils. the new seafood extension is good - even if it did mean the loss of mr kong, which was the best restaurant in chinatown

always packed on weekends but it's understandable because restaurants and takeaways need to buy stock but combined with family doing their weekly shop its packed like hell. so avoid if you can on those days. all in all it has all the stuff you need from an asian supermarket without having to go to chinatown.
its ok

great selection of chinese food crammed in this shop. you will certainly find what you are looking for but you will continuously find that you are in the way.if you are in china town, well worth the visit, even if you are not there to buy anything.
got good selection of asian food, home stuff, fishmonger and butcher's. i think this is by far the best chinese supermarket in chinatown. always crowded with long queues though.
fresh,chilled&frozen asian supermarket.
good asian supermarket. great selection. staff a bit touch and go but that's china town for you.
get asian things here
your usual chinese supermarket- lots of stuff packed in one small area. good selection of stuff from asia

my favourite of the chinese supermarkets in london. usually come here to buy chinese greens, sauces, interesting mock meats, and other odds and ends. aisles are a bit cramped and the staff aren't always the most charismatic but i enjoy my visits here nonetheless.
excellent alternative to its competitors on gerrard st. as the aisles are much wider and it's much less crowded so you don't feel anxious.
standard chinatown grocery store with pretty much all you need. till system a little slow, which meant queuing in the food isles for around 10 mins.
good chinese supermarket.
they have some chinese vegs that are rare in england. a great selection of sauces too.
friendlier staff compared to the other competing chinese supermarket one street away ;-) and less crowding too, with fresher fresh produce.

efficient and well stocked supermarket run by chinese people with a great range of vegetables, fruits, cooking sauces, seasoning and frozen food from mainly china/hong kong but also from other parts of asia e.g. thailand. there is also a basement where they sell non-food items e.g. crockery and art & crafts.
very good range of products but always so busy and long queues - quite stressful!
this is without doubt the best asian supermarket in europe.
haven't found a better chinese supermarket in london yet!
great range. especially seafood
chineese, korean, japanese foods in good price.
fresh vegetable cheaper thia kau choi (chinese chives ), best frozen fish ball, careful with children very crowded difficult to move in the shop
great range of items and quick service at checkout.
had everything i was looking for even if not the easiest to navigate.
absolutely rubbish, rude staff! awful food
good quality chinese supermarket with some other kitchen utensils for sale.
excellent food store. good prices.
very well stocked
one of the better organised groceries in china town. some items on the butcher's counter were alarmingly low-priced...

expect a few of the typical chinatown clichs such as brusque service but see woo is still one of the best places to get oriental foods and ingredients. in recent years has expanded out of the original chinese goods to cover most areas of the far east too
good range,  decent prices.  shop floor staff appear to consist of manual labourers and couldn't help find items.
this supermarket has recently added some fish tanks for fresh seafoods.
needed wonton sheets ... and they had them. if you are into cooking oriental foods, this is the place to buy.
quite good chinese supermarket.

go here when i am in the chinatown area to pick up oriental groceries and sauces such as noodles and oyster sauce & chilli oil.  typically rude staff. most of the stuff can be bought in local supermarkets or amazon so the rude staff can be avoided.
come here for their huge range of chinese meatballs - really the only place i've been able to source proper beef tendon balls in london
located at the heart of london's chinatown, it is a great place to buy asian groceries and products.
good selection of asian goods.  now with a butcher and fresh seafood section.
they have a big range of fresh fish like live lobsters.
find all asian food here! all kind of instant ramen from thai to korea!
for a small seewo . it has everything you need for a authentic chinese recipe
great selection of genuine chinese products and fresh meat & fish.
clean and well organize supermarket in soho. live seafood available...
here have fresh meat and seafoods. nice quality dried shitaki mushroom. good service.
good range of authentic chinese foods.
bit overcrowded but plenty stuff to choose from. fast checkout
decent prices, have most stuff, however very cramped
for such a small chinese supermarket, this place is always incredibly well stocked with lots of diverse offerings.

always found the general chinese & special oriental delicacies needed in see woo. friendly & helpful staff. cashier queue may be long but it is a sign that they are popular with chinese & western customers.
great place for asian stuff!
great location. the price is higher and less food selections then the store in wembley

very chinese style, staff wasn't helpful at all,but variety choice of korean, japanese and china with private butcher too. price is market price not feel any special. purchase frozen food did not provide double bag, actually, i haven't been offer any bags. chinese supermarket smell full of the environment, feel like return china.

wide variety of food from asia and also fresh sea food, fish and meat. great selection of frozen dumplings. it's a clean place and price is quite reasonable. i'd say it's the best supermarket in china town.
one of the best places to buy chinese groceries in london.
great fresh fish

love this place, my favourite chinese supermarket, it's a bit small, but store is always quite tidy, products are fresh and priced reasonably. i love their fresh seafood counter.  always come here if i am in the neighbourhood to buy some seafood.
can get very crowded has a wide range of asian foods as well as fresh fish and meats
a repeat customer for over 20 years.still the best for all my shopping needs.maybe loyalty cards in the near future.
very nice asian food market. lots of varieties. yo should check the tea section
good place
great choice
always fresh and perfect!
affordable far eastern foods.
nice little chinese supermarket, the lowest price in china  town.

any food from china and southeast asia is possible to find here. there is a butchers area and a fishmonger the fish is fresh, really fresh. as it should be. there is a downstair area for pans and pots, obviously asian ones. the prices a bit higher compared with out of central london places but still the range is huge so it is quite ok.
very nice food
very crowded and there is always a long checkout line.
best supermarket for fresh ingredients. well organised and run.
offer everything you need for asian ingredients, fresh vegetables but small aisle to walk around
business as usual,  they had every thing i wanted,  especially there greens and fish tofu cubes.  is good place to source different types of dietary requirements.
the fish and seafood is amazing and well-priced.
the range of goods is really satisfying as well as the pricing. they even have pastries and a meat section.
range has improved over the years. most things can be sourced in this chinese grocery store
i think it is the largest chinese supermarket in this china town. i go there almost twice a month. i love vegetables and fruits here. it's fresh and high quality!
great store!

busy but great shop for fresh meat and seafood. price wise i am not sure if its better or worse than its neighbour loong fung, but for the one-shop shopping experience you cant beat this place. i love the skin on pork belly for 2. often i find one for 3.5!!! where in the world can you find something so fresh but so cheap?
a bit crammed as there is not much floor space, on the positive, very centrally located, reasonable prices and pretty good choice for the size of the shop
the prices is okay,  avoid night time and you will be fine.
always go there when in london.  it's where the.local community shops. you can get all you need to make any oriental meal
you can pretty much find everything you need for your home cooking. sometimes there may be long queue due to bulk buying from chinese takeaway shops.
one of the most comprehensive range of asian food suppliers.  you may find everything you need for preparation of your asian dishes. expect long queue at peak hours.
great supermarket in chinatown. has all the standard groceries items at reasonable prices. the shop also has a fishmonger as well as a large selection of cookware in the basement.
great range of stock lots more than other stores in china town.  well worth a visit!

one of my favorite asian supermarkets in london. the place is tidy and not as crowded  as long fung. the vegetables here are in good quality at a reasonable price. there are also exotic fruits from thailand and china.
i'm so happy with service x
if you are a durian lover you should come to seewoo, i normally buy the frozen one in the supermarket but surprisingly they have the fresh one there.
long established grocery shop specialising in oriental goods
came home to see items out of date. either lazy or deceptive. it's not popular, it's just cramped and narrow with a slow check out.
a really good supermarket and kitchen shop, very reasonable prices and good quality stuff.
authentic chinese products! but very crowded inside
busy most of the time, this is my all time chinese grocery store in london. plenty of choices. they sell fresh seafood and meats.
always too busy but carries basic needs of brands and groceries from china. don't expect much variety of other east asian groceries.
good spot to find real thai and chinese food ingredients
awesome experience for novel, healthy foods from far and wide. good lunch options too. a little pricey but for good quality items.

very good fresh produce including lots of imported greenery, fresh components for home cooking! lots of oriental frozen options, sauces, spices, dim san, etc. in the hidden basement you have a large availability of cooking wares and utensils.
the best asian supermarket

really good asian grocer in chinatown - they have most asian ingredients you need, but the main reason i go here is the fresh/live seafood! it's perfect if you're looking for pomfret, live flower crabs, tiger prawns, and even mussels and cockles. the prices are very reasonable too!
asian grocery which pretty much has everything! there is even a butcher further inside. so many snacks and frozen food. caters for every asian cravings.

decent supermarket that fills most of your chinese food needs. their frozen section is decent and they have some of the more unusual items. being on the back street of chinatown means that they're often less busy than the other two supermarkets. the fresh fish section is great, something not available at the other two either.

this is a little oasis hidden just outside the touristy part of china town. full of the most wonderful goods, this is a must if you cook asian food. freezer cabinets full too so if you want anything make sure you have a cool bag.
nice china supermarket
a bit weird, liked it though.
its very busy here but prices are lower than most chinese supermarkets around. staff are quite rude though and push you out the way.
good amount of choice
amazing prices and selection of goods, definitely a place to go if you like cooking and you're in chinatown
good asia groceries store but limited tolls which sometimes caused a long queue
need food inspection and rude staff who talked bad things in front of my face in chinese.the guy is floor manager in greenwich..he needs to be educated service mind.
good range of products....friendly staff, even though not everybody speaks good english, they will help you if you have any questions.
good place for shopping

great little supermarket with friendly staff.
great oriental supermarket

new fresh meat section is excellent. fresh veg section is excellent with labels indicating origin of veg. bit lacking in frozen and grocery section due to size of shop compared to some others but meat and veg are top in chinatown
love this place it has a huge selection of products and great service

they sell many asian veggies and goods. they expanded recently to sell seafood and meat.variety can be a bit limited quite popular on weekends. the cashiers are quick fastbring your own bag for groceries
very very poor customer service. old lady fall off and literally no help or response from staff members. staff members pushing customer who were waiting in queue.
always chaotic and busy but undeniably great variety and selection of chinese and south east asia groceries
dumplings galore!! a review and also a fine name for a bond girl.

this store has a bad smell to it and it was very tiny but packed with items. you can hardly walk through it, with slow workers who dont seem to be nice. also a bit overpriced, compared to the other asian stores nearby.

amazing prices! i come here for turmeric root and chicken/fish. prices are so much cheaper than anywhere else and one of the few places in london you can find turmeric root. amazing selection of spices, curry powders, coconut milk, nuts etc. upstairs is japanese/ korean and they have a lot of snacks.

fresh mean cut to order and fresh seafood. good selection of other foods and products. very good prices on 10kg of jasmine rice. we go every week for our food shopping. don't go in the evening after work as long queues to pay.
very good variety. but very busy on sunday s.
small shop can be very busy with tourists nosing about. well stocked shop for asian foodstuff
really well stocked chinese grocery shop with fresh meat, frozen fish, seafood, lots of dumplings and sauces. great selection. 10 minimum spend if paid by card.
good store, bit confusing since staff from the other shop come in.
great selection good price very good staff

i love this place. seewoo has a great selection of asian foods. they have a lot of variety and i always come here for curry pastes, tofu, frozen goods, sauces, etc. for vegetarians there are many frozen mock meats that you cant find at traditional supermarkets. they have a small downstairs section with home goods.

wide variety of asian food at reasonable prices. i would say even cheaper than it's competitor on the other street on most items. the fresh seafood section is a great new addition to the store too. the corridors are a bit cramped though.
you are will find quality seafood live lobster, crabs and fish the have all sorts of asian products also the best saffron!
good variety of asian groceries and i love the fresh meat butcher inside.
good value chinese grocery, good selection of fresh and frozen foods. but very busy.
good selection of chinese food. always busy, be sure to go at quieter hours

can't go wrong with shake shack. service was fast and friendly. this location is busy but they pull through. lots of seating area on first and second floor with views of the square.can be a bit pricy and it's often not too filling but the quality is among the best.

pretty busy but the food is delicious. wait time is around 15 minutes

simple, tasty and amazing.we order the original with regular fries and the seasonal fries with garlic mayo. after a while the garlic tastes a bit too much, so take this fries only if you are super into garlic. the burger has the perfect size and the whole experience is great.

i've tried the burgers and dogs, they're okay. what annoys me is that on every ocassion they mess up if it's a stay in or take away. i've always had to ask that my order be packed even though the receipt cleary says 'take away'.

the food is really tasty. like the idea of getting the menu on the entrance, however i waited for my food approx. 20mins and laides didn't work so i'm giving it 3 stars...
very busy but as usual better that 5 guys in my opinion
great food as always, way too busy though.
tasty burger, really nice, right up there with the better burger joints... but just didn't warrant the wait or price, especially given the size of the burger.
i enjoyed shake shack burger and their truffle fries
nice, quite busy though, but that is to be expected based on the location
food very nice, staffs were very friendly, helpful & accommodating...
don't always have everything available but - can't go wrong with shakeshack. gets understandably busy but never had a hellish wait in there.

so busy hardly place to sit.. considering what they are charging i want to eat in peace and enjoy it rather than keep getting looks by other customers who are waiting for people to vacate the seats so they can sit.

visited the shake shack and i am glad i did, the burger was nice, soft, juicy and tasty it was cooked well. the fries was also nice and crispy with that sauce on top. only problem is they don't have it back home in sydney.
loved cheesy fries. only chicken is halal. good customer service too.
our go to burger bar when in town...well worth the extra few quid.
the burgers are tasty, but fairly small for the price tbh
great restaurant, very friendly and open staff and, most importantly, really good food.
the quality of the hamburger was far away from the expected. it was clear that the number of people working was lesser than necessary for the area's demand.

great burgers! super fresh from shake shack. this place is open until 3am, go to after a night out & it's the perfect meal to sober up! just keep in mind it will be busy because of being in central london
i don't know why but i feel that ss at leicester is way superior than the one in covent garden and mansion house. the patty is more crispy and overall the burger feels more fresh.

nice.  a bit busy.  lots of seating space upstairs.   the entrance and the queue is a bit messy.  staff want to serve quickly and not recommend what to eat.   felt rushed.. but food was nice.  not as good as in the past but i prefer the covent garden ... smaller version.

food was ok, nothing special. had to wait an age to get the food. seating area was fine, only one cubicle in the gents bathroom is mind boggling for such a busy area. no toilet paper in the stall either (only realised when needed), pure luck that i'd a few packets of tissue in my day sack.
best burgers hands down

pretty good actually. not expected for a burger restaurant in a touristic area in central london. they serve halal chicken as well and the cheesy fries were awesome. it's much better than any other burger i tried in london

not a very good experience, the burger was pretty small and for the price it isn't a good value. the fries size was okay but those were pretty cold, please make sure you serve warm food! i think for the money you could get better value somewhere else!
terrible on many levels, food is basic and doesnt stand out from other fast foods, staff was disorganised and it took ages to get our order. i dont understand all the fuss about this place.
considering it was busy, they managed to organise the queue pretty quick with the buzzers notifications.  food was okay
strawberry cookies and cream shake was just a lot of whipped cream and a boring liquid strawberry shake. not thick, luscious and rich. bits of cookies were crunchy but could do with bigger chunks.
poor service, dirty tables and although food was ok it wasn't memorable for the price

hi, i had a burger yesterday and it was lovely and testy,the service its so welcoming and friendly specially the girl who took my order was smiling all the time well done guys hope to keep it this way!! many thanks
i love the chicken in my burger, it's flavourful and not dried at all despite the fact that it's breast part.
great food and fast service, bit pricey but you pay for quality!

so busy but i do like the cheeseburger,and the milkshake is the boss

friendly service and a good ordering system allowing you to get settled at a table ready for your food.  very tasty chicken and (mu)shroom burgers and the garlic mayo fries are excellent.  a good selection of beverages with, or course, the excellent milkshakes taking pride of place.
the burgers are delicious but the place is crowded at night

fairly busy at leics sq. even at about 11pm on a friday night. tasty burgers though. worth the c20min wait from queue to getting food. love the beef patties, bacon is dee-lish. not massively filling though is the only small complaint. at 13 for two bacon cheeseburgers - bit steep!
its basic. had shake and custard and its basic. nothing above the fast food standard, nothing to talk about.

while the food is good, you probably won't even get it. they take so long to deliver your order that people are rioting at the front of the queue, just to be received by incompetent and apathetic staff. avoid this place unless you're happy waiting >30m for your burgers.

very tasty. the shroom burger was really nice. original fries. it isn't cheap but it offers a superior quality and all the cooks wear gloves when making burgers and preparing food which is very nice too.

extremely poor. food is unacceptable consider the price you pay. one thin single burger with a slither of bacon 10. small handful and chips with melted burger cheese 4. well know fast food chanes are much better and half the price. the staff where very friendly

great burger joint. love going to shake shack. fantastic location and easily accessible. lots of seating and attentive staff. mixed experiences, the burger is always fantastic however the chips were served luke-warm.
absolutely delicious. the best shake shack in london town! i love the crispy crinkly chips. great staff too.

fries was warm but not hot enough to be enjoyed. the shackmeister ale was watered down. staff didn't seem to thrilled to be working. might have just been an off evening as it was pretty busy. but, for my first time visiting this place, it wasn't the best experience.

if you're really hungry and don't have a lot of time, i guess you can go... too expensive for fast food and the food is really nothing special. they're plenty other fast food places around, some with better shakes, better burgers, and cheeper. i still eat sometimes here..

stopped for late supper.  the service was terrible and food was bad.  lasagne tasted like they used beef gravy and vegetarian lasagne was runny.
ok but food was cold

really really bad not made to feel unwelcome. i am a 60 year old man. i was asked for id and searched twice infront of my family. would never go again. this was in the afternoon. security are completely over the top

2 for 1 cocktails
very dirty, sticky tables and bar. grossly overpriced  compared to similar type pubs in the area
good food beer wine

very good place to chill with friends. friendly staff and they serve food as well.
could be more customer friendly and/ or service oriented. liked my chicken salad though. desserts are okay.
nice atmosphere,  nice staff. was 1st visit
loud music and a little  expensive  no choice  of ale
pleasant and a friendly atmosphere.

loveley cocktails just coffee machine was broken
great got to go back.

wait over 30min to order food , even when i spoke to team he says is fine then manager game a long say no more food then she told same team member to serve food to some one else .... when i ask he said they book the table ... absolute rubbish

i have had much better burgers. i ordered the southern fried chicken burger which was processed chicken and quite soggy on the inside. the bun was not good quality and was in pieces at the bottom and just a handful of chips.the coco zero was almost flat.not worth the money in my opinion.
not bad value for money for center of london

good food and reasonably priced for central london.
amazing and beautiful and good price

disappointed to see my long island cocktail premixed in a unmarked bottle of i don't know what. big chain cheap misleading drinks

ordered the cheese and bacon burger,  with mushrooms.  the mushrooms were covered in black pepper so were inedible so were left on the plate. the bacon was burnt,  the rolls were broken and looked like basic cheap rolls. the burger was was warm not hot.  wouldn't eat here again.
i barman on and left after 15 mins and didnr get served
great for the 241 cocktails! friendly staff too
staff eager to accommodate you. there was 10 of us just wanting to drink and they made a table available for us even though they were fully booked. great cocktails!

food not good and what is this obsession with playing high volume music when people are eating and chatting.
without a doubt the best massage i have had anywhere. for sciatica relief no frills straight to the knots and pain points. have found my new local.
professional massage shop, kindly  lovely lady in the front desk, usually had body massage with male masseur, more strong pressure nd deep massage, foot massage definitely best choice here!
does walking past count
reasonabl price. no booking. walk in only if you go there on the weekend probably you will wait 30min.
great foot message!!! i highly recommend, after a long day of walk
great safe massage feet and body.   trusted staff.  excellent prices. simple place, no frills but best in soho by far.
i go here every time i'm in london. friendly staff, excellent job done by them.
fantastic foot massage.
amazing place for a foot massage!

i have been looking for somewhere that does great reflexology for a while, and so happy to have found this place. :)  they really know what they are doing.  it is a firm style of reflexology, so be prepared for that - but it is very effective... i have been so much more relaxed during the week after my treatment.

great place for relieving pain after a long day of walking. the massage is meant to be a little rough but its really effective. people complain about the masseuses talking in chinese all the time but honestly the price and effectiveness of the massage is amazing.

before the massage, my back was uncomfortable, but it was tolerable. during the massage, the pain in the whole shoulder was unbearable. the masseuse told me that my muscles were sticky and she just kneaded them open. results after the massage two days i can not sleep can not stand the pain. the experience was very bad
straight (absolutely no frills) reflexology place. i enjoy here but prepare to deal with noisy chatty chinese therapists who will happily chat among themselves.
the masseur wore gloves for the 1 hour reflexology session which meant the massage was not very comfortable

great to unplug and rewind. i have flat feet i suffer from walking even on even ground. reflexology is good way to relieve pressure to the feet and revitalised. this place is a no fuss professional massage and reflexology shop must visit after long day on your feet.
best value for money massage in central london. experienced staff and great back and feet massages. recently renovated, but still don't expect too much from the surrounds.

probably the worst reflexology i've ever had. they should just call the place a foot rub salon. they had no clue about real relexelogy points and used a stick instead of hand which is thai not chinese, and feels far inferior. the place was etremely unhygenic and staff rude and unfriendly.

without a doubt the very best reflexology in london. friendly team from 25 for 30 mins but i recommend and hour at 45. body massage in safe, trusted environment, both male and female masseurs available. i can't recommend it enough, i've been coming here for 15 years !
amazing  !!
nice place
not so great for the price you pay. very small rooms in the basement.
very good for a walk-in massage place!
non luxury but relaxing and authentic chinese massage!!

no info given

place doesn't look like anything special but the guy worked his reflexology wonder on my bruised foot and i came out 45 mins later almost healed.  would definitely recommend this place.
here is very nice massage shop!! i alway go there when i visit in london!! :-)
i have been to half a dozen british reflexologists in the past.  these guys are on a different level. absolutely recommended.
nice place

was here in june of 2015. my husband and i had bought brand new sneakers for our trip, with a ton of walking we broke our new sneakers in all at once. our feet were extremely sore. we googled and found this place and felt like a million bucks after wards. no wait, was lucky to walk right in and get a massage.
great good, real service with nice friendly people who really knew what they were doing.
great value, and the masseuses will tell you, no pain no gain!!
the best feet massage place in london!!! you must go!! you can be sure of effective pain relief!!

relaxed and friendly atmosphere.
great experience. staff was caring and friendly. this was the first time foot massage for our kids. they both enjoyed it very much.....after a long day of sightseeing.
to go place for a strong spontaneous no-fuss massage.
i love this place. don't go if you want lute music and decorative fountains during your massage. this place is not fancy but the massages are great.

no frills. great price. recommend having one hour.

dont get massage from lady very bad dont do feet massage properly. and only talks too much all massage just talking very loudly and very rude. not relaxing at all lady just talk talk talk. dont waste money.
very dissapointing: the masseurs talk to each other very loudly in chinese while doing the massage. heho i am the one paying! shut up!

nice little convenience store is the leicester square area of london.  they are well stocked and the prices are reasonable.  those running the store were friendly and helpful.  this is about one block from leicester square, three blocks west of leicester station and four blocks east of piccadilly circus station.
everything you need from a corner shop. personally go to see what special flavours of fanta they stock!
a tiny, packed and friendly newsagent and general store. hard to find in central london!
go here regularly,  good food and good service.
unadvertised minimum order of 15 per person. food was subpar and extremely oil. was pressured by staff to leave upon finishing meal. not recommended at all

the food was okay; nothing special, but nothing offensive either. customer service was okay too, but they forgot my food order and we had to orders drinks a second time to get them. the duck spring rolls and the dumplings were good though.

this place is a scam. first, they rip you off by charging 7 pounds a bottle of water and double charged on rice orders without informing the customer, food is mediocre at best (also served cold and at different times). additionally, service was poor with servers refusing or lying about price changes. avoid at all cost.
we went to this place multiple times and its one of the best chinese restaurant! superb service and super tasty food. highly recommend
amazing food and friendly staff
open late, food was excellent.

same food as a take away but 3x the price. still tasty. wrongly brought out 1/2 duck instead of 1/4 and refused to deduct their mistake from the bill. then asked for tip on the card machine despite already charging 12.5% automatically. the bill isn't itemised so they try and fleece you in any sneaky way they can.

great food, the steam scallops were nice and juicy and fresh. the stuffed bitter melon was great too! try to get a table at the rear of the restaurant as there is a glass roof and it is lovely especially lunch time. great value and staff are helpful. one of the better restaurant in chinatown.
service was friendly. but the food very pedestrian. house fried rice was okay. nothing special though. the ho fun was absolutely terrible. dumplings were fine. nothing that i would go back for.

huge disappointment on food & service. we were asked to leave as another guests are arriving after 1 hour. food was better when i last came here - the ma po tofu was not good, fried rice average, really pricey for what it is. not visiting again.

amazing chinese food, best i've ever had! a little expensive but the food is definitely worth it. we booked a table beforehand as we were a table of 10. despite being so many of us there were no issues and service was great.

just had a meal at tao tao ju this evening and i must say it was very tasty served buy courteous staff who went out of their way to please and even gave us half a glass of wine gratis. i would definitely recommend this restaurant as good value with nice surroundings and lovely staff. a gem in china town.

very slow service inside. its a running theme were food establishments in london seem to be hiring as few staff as possible. food was presented nicely. drinks were nice. but terrible service and thats nothing against the young man who served us, its management not hiring enough staff. food was mediocre.

this was a good find in the heart of the west end. good atmosphere and friendly bar staff. it's only downfall is the size of the bar which is tiny and you feel you cannot move inside
