lovely pub. excellent, friendly service in a busy area of london town. 5*
phil the manager is an absolute pleasure and really makes the pub an experience x
great venue and beer choice

newly renovated with great decor. they have a decent range of pints on tap. could do with a few more british as well as european varieties but maybe they rotate them. not cheap though at 14.75 for a pint and gin and tonic. bartenders were attentive and quick serving.
really nice pub and lovely padron peppers!

great beer selection, great cocktails, great vibe... live music and dis at times but always good playlists.  i also use the blue post for biz meetings as cocktail bar upstairs and dining downstairs makes it the perfect one stop entertaining location
great little pub. excellent band, the fallen heroes, also have a residency here each sunday afternoon
a superb central free house pub. great selection of craft beers, lovely decor, helpful staff. not enough pubs like this in soho!
the blue posts the best live music possible in london, the band the fallen heroes brilliant and band members absolute gentlemen
everyone friendly but waiting an hour for cold veg, mash and gravy spoiled it.

great place to have nice drinks/cocktails. the dj is amazing with the music. the best hits played during the night. we had a spicy bourbon cocktail and a pineapple rum cocktail. a must visit bar for a night out. the prices are acceptable, with an average of 12 per cocktail.
staff are really friendly and we enjoyed our drinks! classy inside and relaxed outside with cute spots to perch your drinks.
great sausage roll, good choice of ipa's....and cocktails
great evening with two of my friends.. great bar staff lady's very nice to talk to. service and beers and shots ciders all very tasty.

lovely choice of non typical lagers beers and for me a delicious cider. staff incredibly knowledgeable about their products, helpful  and friendly. good music and a welcome respite from traipsing around london
tiny & cramped but feels like it's part of its charm. good selection of beers, not sure i could stay for more than a couple of drinks though due to how crowded it gets
really nice pub, with a cocktail bar upstairs (didn't manage to get into the cocktail bar because it was full). staff were friendly and it wasn't particularly rowdy which was good
brilliant pub great team behind the bar a must visit when in soho.
nice place for drinks. john the bartender served some killer espresso martinis.
good selection of ales, though typical theatre land, central london prices!
fine spot for a drink in soho/chinatown. quieter and more refined than many others in the area!
always great beer and wine and love the live music on sunday's
lovely little pub in the centre of london - not too rammed but a good vibe with lots of tasty ales and cocktails to choose from.

i visited the pub for the first time in over 30 years at the weekend.  i actually worked in the bar during my college years , and it feels as inviting and fun now as it was then. great to see it remains constant. great bar staff..
friendly staff and a good range of beers on tap.
good bar with an interesting selection of beers and good atmosphere
nice little bar, does paulaner and has music on a sunday afternoon.
warmy place, nice guys. good adress
nice beers
awesome band fallen heroes ,play on sunday afternoons
fun location with good vibes and cocktails!
a bit of a boozer downstairs but upstairs is really cool
nice place, conveniently located, bit noisy.
cool
i love the new posts, looking forward to seeing what happens with the food...
beautiful little pub hidden away in a busy part of london. friendly staff and a good selection of drink. will definitely find this place again should i find myself in london!
terrible pub .outrageous high prices coupled with undrinkable beer. 12.45 p for 2 pints. a tourist trap for the unwary.
5 points porter. enough said
loved this little place. will retrun!
good food and music
it's a good pub, except on sunday afternoons, when it simply is the place to be.
hstoric alley of beetles
best pub in soho
head upstairs for amazing cocktails
cute little pub, great lager big wave on tap
great job by the palomar people to reopen it so sympathetically

`local pub` in the heart of soho.  random fight broke out here while we were there for after-work drinks, probably not that common, but gives you an idea of the kind of locals that show up here.  on the plus side - not overrun with tourists...
great cocktails at the mulray upstairs.
original atmosphere, good beer selection. this is what i like about original pubs. this one ticks all boxes.
love the pub staff are great,  mike the guv is a real gent, great band on sunday afternoons get there early if you want a seat.
a proper london pub always welcoming with great food and a wide selection of beers, michael & a are awesome hosts at the blue posts.
good place to meet friends
pricey pub but cosy with friendly bar staff.
nice place
like it. l'm sure i've been in here in a different life. proper rub a dub.
good beers and nice atmosphere
cosy and nice atmosphere. packed!
really good beers
amazing craft beers, great private snug area by the bar. love this place, will be back!
aka the mulwray, aka evelyns table. a pub, cocktail bar and restaurant all in one. most certainly the best pub in soho. no where else you need to go for all your needs and desires!
london is seeing a renaissance in accessible glamour; now even in our pubs! paris, eat your heart out.
great for a quiet drink even at busy times. the bar food is great as well...
great little place cosy atmosphere and live music (was on a sunday)

the new blue posts is starting to gain some character. good selection of craft beers, and a nice seating area upstairs. the live band on sunday creates a damn good atmosphere for some sunday daytime drinking.
gone down hill after refurb. shame.
tasty beer
great place on a sunday afternoon with the house band, the fallen heroes, playing.
loved the block party for pride
very slow and diffident service. pity because its a nice setting

great pub with a nice atmosphere on the ground floor, besides it, a very fancy and good cocktails place on the first floor which is mostly crowded on wednesday and thursday, but they started to be opened on tuesday from last week, it seems. great place to hang out after a play in piccadilly.
amazing little pub with the best pub grub you can find
very slick new pub in chinatown. lots of beer variety and craft ales. new restaurant downstairs and a smart cocktail bar upstairs. great place for dates.

we stumbled across this little hidden gem today and thought, lets nip in for a drink three hours later still here, so friendly customers and bar staff and phil are excellent! the live band were superb, thank you for a great night
disgusting bouncer.
cool little bar - walked by on a sunday and was drawn in by the jazz music. the jazz band is fab! definitely worth checking out!
great staff friendly and approachable able to allow sampling of beer before purchasing the one you like most
great pub (that new-londonets frequent) that's been around for years.  has survived it's recent face-lift pretty well!
they've done it up nice, great selection of beers and a cocktail bar upstairs, i think it would be a good place to bring a date. four stars.
great music every sunday.
great little pub with a really good atmosphere the staff were very helpful friendly and welcoming. nice little secret bar as well nice touch.
lovely place, great music, great vibe...great friendly atmosphere
new favourite boozer in soho. beautifully fit out, good selection of draught beers and spirits and good outdoor space for warmer evenings.
hidden gem in soho with a guest selectiob covering most tastes, interesting lagers, pilsners and ipa with friendly, down to earth staff and prices fair for the area
great pub very friendly staff slightly quirky we loved it.
cosy. lots of stools
beautiful ambience
cosy little place that would be only improved with some wood panelling. i came for the jazz but was told it's on daily except thursdays. recommend the cheese and onion crisps.
best of everything
cute with a great selection of craft beers (though tables can be scarce). the chic cocktail bar upstairs was a nice surprise too.
great selection of beers on tap
daria looked after two of my pals and i last weekend, she has set the standard for how i want to be treated when out at a bar, 10/10 for the light lounge as a bar and 10/10 for daria.
lovely cocktails,  a normal price for london (10 per cocktails)  and the option of happy hour which we were too late for.  the kiwi drink was fantastic if you like sweets ones
staff were excellent. recommend the lavender dream. good to start a big night or finish a big day.

the place is new and feels a bit soulless. cocktails looked nice but didn't taste that good. we frequently go to other cocktail bars where cocktails are same/more expensive but their quality and atmosphere is normally much better.
super cocktails ! excellent service.. great place to relax and just chill
lovely staff great cocktails
very relaxing and cozy place. great cocktails!
a little expensive but very nice place and good cocktails
fab cocktails, fab service. good happy hour, even on a saturday. highly recommend!
the best cocktail in chinatown, espresso martini must try!
great little place for a small party. great table service and ambiance
classy, inviting venue with great cocktail menu
went there between 5 &7 pm. music,service and cocktails were all amazing.
lovely tasting cocktails not too weak!!
go for the happy hour as it's cheapper than ku bar.the cocktails are amazing and tastyemployees are friendly and professional.
amazingly inventive cocktails in a relaxed and luxurious spot in soho. can't praise the staff enough, friendly and attentive, can highly recommend a visit.
phenomenal place, thank you zoe for a lovely night!!
superb cocktails & lovely, friendly welcoming staff.
great staff, delicious cocktails and great music!
refined bar with cocktails above ku bar. not the cheapest, but enjoyable and not lacking intimacy
great place for cocktails
great cocktails, in a stylish and modern venue in the heart of the busy west end. highly recommend trying this place staff very attentive and friendly.

what a rip off. we were told by door staff that it was 2 for 1 on cocktails so went in to be told it no longer was. decided to stay and ordered 3 pornstar martinis and a lemonade.  42.00. that's extortionate even by west end prices.  we will not be returning
london's newest and most stylish cocktail lounge, extremely friendly and knowledgable bar tenders serve up an array of new and classic cocktails made with care from the highest quality ingredients.
good environment, happy hour cocktails, attentive staffs
lovely place, spacious enough for a few friends to catch up and drink. rather pricey though.
really nice place cocktail barman is excellent
daria = wonderful service! 10s across the board!
classic yet accessible venue! great customer service and lovely background music, will be back!
the worst cocktails i have ever had. even with the 2 for 1 deal they were not worth it.id rather pay full price for a decent cocktail some where else.
went for a friends birthday. im sure its very nice when its less busy. lots of staff drying glasses, not many serving...
great service
nice venue and location to celebrate with friends/family.
no vibe . not what i was after on a friday night
sophisticated establishment. great 2 for 1 cocktail hour, awesome service, nice atmosphere and the drinks were really nice.
excellent service and cocktails. caught up with friends.
very stylish
very few people upstairs in the area i was in so it shouldn't have taken as long as it did to get a drink.
rude arrogant staff!avoid as they dont care about customer service!ignore you at the bar and then serve other people. disgusting attitude even from the manager
called in after a show with friends. great service and reasonable prices although we only drank prosecco!! great atmosphere with the dj providing the tunes!!
good service!
good atmosphere and good drinks
rude staff and customer service. the drinks are very basic
decent music and top rated staff putting 100% effort into making your night a top one. very good night
a lovely place to relax and have a beer, a cocktail or even just a coffee.very helpful, friendly staff, nice smart dcor. a well presented place with a relaxed feel to it.
fantastic place, great vibes, nice drinks and friendly stuff!
classy spot for some great cocktails and the steam buns are a must have.
it is a nice and comfortable place to stay in central london.

had a great night at light lounge celebrating our stag do on the weekend. the host made us feel welcome and made sure we got priority entry into the klub. reserving an area was incredibly easy for london (and no deposit required!). thanks to amy, stefano and the team!
this is a lovely place with great staff. they are always willing to help and are very polite. the decor is up to date and has a good vibe.the only downside is the drinks are very expensive.
great little cocktail bar upstairs with a great happy hour
the service is amazing. the hostesses make us feel special every single time.
good location with good music, really enjoyed it. the staff was very nice too. but the prices are too high, and i sometimes felt like being ripped off...
disgustingly unprofessional. amy mullen is beyond douchy. clearly run by people who have no business running such a place. such a shame.
nice cocktails and 2-4-1 is great in the early evening. good setting and great service!
nice little place with nice drinks - lounge around with friends
love this place

we had our christmas party at the light lounge. the staff were attentive, the cocktails were lovely. dj was perfect. the venue was beautiful and the perfect size. special thanks to nicola who was a superstar throughout!
modern and likeable decor. great ambience and very helpful, friendly staff. if you're looking for a bit of class in the the west end this is it

came in here with a voucher for cocktails, would let us use them all. for the ones we had we had the choice of only four! none of which were that inspiring.  didn't feel hospitable at all. wouldn't come again.. couldn't order anything using vouchers after 10,so left !! giving one star is the least i can give..

small, slightly hidden, but very chic-feeling bar. an intimate-feeling space with friendly and attentive waitresses and bartenders who know their business well. a decent-sized menu filled with delicious drink served beautifully. if you like floral, definitely try their violet gin fizz; violets are blue.
attentive and knowledgeable staff. comfy seating for groups, couples or singles. good 241 cocktail choice. fairly innocuous decor, but a wide range of venue uses available.

this is an amazing place. the staff are super friendly and very accommodating and the cocktails are all made with premium ingredients by expert mixologists. the happy hour two for the price of one cocktails are definitely worth it if you are on a budget and the full cocktail menu is a wonder to read.
nice ambient, cocktails are ok, small glasses though, music wasn't too bad.
good drinks
the best word for this? it's two, fizz popping. simply awesome, found it a week or so ago now been back again, chilled out yet smart and then there are the drinks. my new favourite.
great service. very relaxing. cocktails were fab
good cocktails list with very great staff. only issues are lack of space to stand when all the seats are gone.

staff are really attentive and friendly. i visited around 630-730pm and there are not many people here so has a chill vibe. the decor though... a bit like a strip club. but honestly comfy seats and a good bloody mary so a win from me.
nice places for cocktails, never seen it too crowded.
great place. drinks expensive but it was fun

great venue. quieter during the week, but plenty of space per table, you dont have to shout over music to be heard, staff are friendly and approachable, heated outdoor smoking area. got a complimentary round of shots for my birthday too <3
"award winning gay bar"  true or not, it feels that way which is kind of the point.
fantastic cocktails and the best service i've received in central london. i highly recommend this place. we booked a table during happy hour and were very happy indeed! :)
upscale gay cocktail bar with nice design and friendly staff. gets busy later at at night and the weekends. prices on the upper end. they make good cocktails. i had a long island which was perfect!
nice bar, enjoyed the atmosphere, the cocktails are a bit expensive outside the happy hour but they taste delicious
very nice atmosphere to relax and have a nice cocktail. the service is really good and friendly. take advantage of the happy hour for best value.
great staff, delicious cocktails and great music. always an awesome night at the light lounge
nice and tasty food in a relaxing environment. all the people from the restaurant were friendly and helpful. i will definitely visit again.
went for london restaurant week and had an amazing tasting menu. you have to try the kabouleh bread it is incredible!
great service and atmosphere.  the food was incredible!  we absolutely loved our dining experience.  thank you to their wonderful staff.
so delicious & presentation on point! loved watching them cook & plate the food.
wonderful food and service.
incredible meal, great service, amazing place!
i just have to add this to my review list to remind myself i need to come here every time i visit london.

brilliant evening at this middle eastern gem. lovely wine from lebanon, some of the best baba ganoush ive ever had, pork belly was delish. 6 dishes to share, more than enough. put our names down at 6:45 and got our table at 8:20 - had a cocktail next door. friendly waitress. nice vibe.

truly excellent cocktails and food (esp. the chicken livers with sweetbreads) and efficient service. unfortunately seems to attract a crowd of diners whose conversations involve talking loudly about their screenplays
great little restaurant. friendly service, hygienic fresh tasting food. recommend.
love this place. have been twice now and always blown away by the food. sit at the counter and youll have an amazing experience chatting to the chefs and seeing your food made. cant wait to return.

amazing israeli cuisine. was recommended to us by the deputy israeli ambassador. awesome recommendation. sat at kitchen bar watching the chefs create culinary magic. the beetroot was the highlight.go.
good food at reasonable price, great service and selection of drinks
absolutely loved the experience although it was quite loud, we didn't mind because the food was outstanding. will be back very soon :)
decent food, good ambience, terrible service

don't really understand the hype here. portions are exquisitely small for the price and really nothing special. service was quite disgraceful as well, reservation explicitly stated we have two hours but we were hurried out and restaurant wanted the table for someone else after only an hour
great food but a bit expensive and crowded

an absolute gem. this place the photos nor the reviews do any justice. you must visit for dinner, preferably book a table it's always busy. food is authentic, delicious and beautiful presentation. friendly service, great location and vibrant atmosphere. highly recommend.
absolutely loved this place.  we went back a second night and i bought the cook book.
fantastic food! feels cramped and seating is mainly at the bar in front of the chefs but i loved it.  would go back again
the food could not be better. the menu is fantastic. youre attributed your own chef who cooks in front of you. a bit pricy but its worth it! great wine too
great vibe, a little loud (no a place for a quiet meal) but the atmosphere is great. food was fantastic
outstanding service and delicious food - you must go.
amazing !! the food is crazy, the staff is beyond... just go ! it is pure magic! asaf granit is genius artist!
small but delicious menu, perfect portions and great staff.
my favourite place in london
not as good as their sister restaurant the barbary. service was decent but menu was rather limited.

my friend is obsessed with this place. the dishes are great, but i thought there wasn't much difference to well executed lebanese food. several dishes drinks and coffee, 70 a head.  atmosphere is fun and styling typical of a hipster haunt.

maybe the time of booking (6pm -  pre-theatre time?), but food came much too quickly, making it difficult to enjoy & savour the dishes. quality of food good, but portions are tiny (even for a tapas type menu) & expensive. staff friendly & efficient. overall, an ok experience.
loved it! very tasty food, wine and excellent service.  nice atmosphere too.  we shall be back.
good service and excellence food. the place is noisy but sup.
really interesting menu and fantastic atmosphere. brilliant food, charming service. definitely book ahead as the restaurant is deservedly popular and is only little.
great food:) very unique!

really good authentic middle eastern food with a twist, staff friendly without being intimidating. open kitchen situated in the middle of the bar and you can see and chat with the masters of food preparation. not easy to get a table so book in advance.

one of our favourite restaurants in london. the food is fresh and very flavourful. the small plates menu is exquisite with a wide variety of options. their vegetarian dishes are a must try as the chefs seem run a magic wand on some of the daily / mundane vegetables.

great place. jerusalem/middle eastern with a sprinkle of other influences.small place, probably best to sit at the counter if youre only two.small tables at the back, small space.book well in advance.highly recommended
great food. lovely atmosphere. absolutely must reserve as seating is limited and they are very popular

middle eastern style food, ideal for sharing. very tasty vegetable options which can be combined with either fish or meat. the home made bread is an absolute must! 35-45 pp excl drinks. service was very good, sparkling water is complementary.

sister restaurant of barbary, palomar in soho is as fun & friendly as its flavorful. grab a seat at the lively kitchen bar & watch the  create modern israeli magic  your  post-show spot in soho. we guessed our server roxis name correctly & scored free dessert!
went for lunch with my mom, the service was amazing and the food was interesting and delicious.imo best to sit at the bar and watch the food being prepared. for sure will be back :)
very friendly and helpful. lovely meal, really tasty. thank you

amazing and delicious .  took two different evening attempts to get in.  well worth it, highly recommend the bar seating where youll be front and center able to watch the kitchen staff do their magic - in a very confined space.  entire staff is very friendly.  best meal so far during our london visit.
lovely service, really friendly staff and delicious food. very happy customer.
excellent middle eastern cuisine  a lively atmosphere, staff where very good and helpful highly recommended
had a great night with great company, but i don't think any of it was due to the food and the bill was a kick in goolies. fun bar, over-priced and average food.
best food in london and vibrant atmosphere

always exceptional. you need to book well ahead or else go at unusual times, but well worth it. middle eastern food with incredible flavours. great for vegetarians meat eaters and pescatarians alike. fabulous cocktails. every mouthful is memorable. not cheap but excellent value...
superb food and excellent atmosphere, swift service and the staff is very friendly. overall a great experience.
food excellent, really really good. service and atmosphere not to my liking - noisy, cramped and claustrophobic.
great food, good service with staff passionate about their food and your dining experience. nice bustling atmosphere.
exceptional food, lots of small dishes all delicious but the pork belly was my favourite! staff were so friendly and a busy buzzy atmosphere. going to return 100%.
every dish was flawless. excellent drinks, and a fun staff.
absolutely amazing service and the food was excellent.
this place was great, coffee wasn't so good but a part o this all perfect

excellent and flavourful food in nice small portions. the octopus and scallops we had were perfectly tender and not overcooked. the ros was good too. and well, a busy place won't expect you to sit down for long chats, would it?
i am from the us and this was the best restaurant to me in london. thank you palomar.
the food was on another level, nice intimate atmosphere as well
this is one of the best restaurant ive been. the food is great the service is friendly

the best meal ive ever had in london. just make sure you sit at the bar - its lively, exciting, and a straight up party. the food comes out very fast so just order as you go. be sure to try at least one of their cocktails - its just as good as the food.
the kubaneh and courgette tzatziki were great. mains were average. service was amazing and quick but the place itself was very crowded.
fantastic food, sat at the bar and the head chef was so lovely and helpful. food was off the scale, octopus and the new chicken dish are a must!!
loved everything. cocktail, roasted aubergine, polenta, were delicious. not my favorite baba ganoush ever, but still really good.
great food and great atmosphere
lovely food and worth the wait. i am not usually fond of aubergine although the dish here was very tastey and the best thing i ate.
great restaurant, the dishes got better as the evening went on. the scallops were fantastic. the wine list is different, with hungarian and greek offerings. worth a visit
great food. recommend the polenta, the kebab, the  octopus and dips
nice food. will try again for dinner and then may upgrade the review.
small portion sizes but tonnes of flavour and i will be back soon
an interesting experience with delicious food.
been coming here for over four years and it's still as good as the first time that i've tried it. superb service and the menu keeps getting better and better.
amazing food, great atmosphere eating on the bar, lovely caring and professional service ... one of those places that you already know what and when next time.. again
nice food but very cramped inside
i really loved the sense of fusion this restaurant has. very good service, lovely staff .the portions are slightly small though. yet, that is how it is around soho, right?
the good was delicious, the portions were tiny. which would be ok if the prices matched. all in all: great food but not great value. will come again when i have more dollar!
excellent food. really good service and will go back
it's fun, friendly, great music and amazing food
great middle eastern restaurant in soho. it's perfect to go and share many different dishes with friends. make sure to book ahead. food is fresh, great spices, surprising recipies.
incredibly tasty food! but be warned, it's as good as it is expensive. the portions are really small, but if you want to impress with good eating out choices and money you should come here
modern fare from jerusalem meets a variety of international influences in mosaic and wood surrounds.
small, intimate place to enjoy middle eastern food served tapas style. food is authentic, fresh and tasty. bread and pittas are delicious as too are the seafood dishes. recommend early booking.
never had israel cuisine before and it was certainly a nice surprise. the fish is a must-have!  very lively place, great atmosphere, everyone at the kitchen was enjoying themselves.
amazing food and atmosphere! a must if you like israeli food. friendly staff and chefs that make the experience even better. a lot of vegetarian friendly options and a great wine and cocktail list.
make sure to sit at the counter if you are a party of two and watch the chefs preparing your food. excellent cocktails!
the food is exquisite, the staff is super sweet. highly recommend.
great food, great atmosphere, great concept

i was really excited to try this place but it just wasnt good... dishes were okay at best. everything seemed kinda cold. chicken plate was chewy. not sure if it was a bad night or if the hype is too high.
one of favorite middle eastern restaurants in london, will definitely recommend to everyone
nice food, small dishes, long line
phenomenal food. exceptional service.
great little dishes! fresh and simple.
simply delicious

a wondrous find in otherwise touristy area. friendly service, a cool zinc bar that goes for miles and the food! the food is an eastern med melange with israeli accent. all the tapas were delicious and fairly priced. a true urban gem!

brilliant night sitting at the bar/kitchen top. food is delicious and the head chef is very loud, energetic and entertaining - dont go there for a calming experience! waited for 2h to get in but the guy managing the list was very good at updating us while we had a drink elsewhere - well worth the wait.
amazing restaurant! sat in front of the chef. what a wonderful experience.  food was unbelievable! great team of chefs all working in harmony. very inspiring!
nice time
long wait time but its made up by the great service and delicious plates
great food but hard to get tables
food was a nice mixture of authentic middle eastern dishes and flavours combined with some innovative twists. the pappardelle pasta was really tasty and the sweetbread were especially good.
amazing food and awesome vibes. service is top notch. would defnitly cone back
always amazing food. love the service.

wow what a place! ate dinner on the bar with no booking! sat next to the executive chef and he was amazing! we had a lot of fun, from dinging the bell! to talking about his various dishes ingredients.

really excellent! amazing vibes especially if you are sitting at the bar in front of beautiful chefs that cook incredible israeli-inspired dishes. the sea-bass is outstanding, with a subtle taste of mint, parsley, lemon, time ... one of the best you may find in london i recon! also very good cocktails! can't wait to go back <3 ahava

food is incredible... favourite were the dips and breads which were faultless, closely followed by the broccoli and feta dish. we finished with the moroccan cigars, which were again amazing! to top it off service was great and the price was reasonable. will be back
always have a great time here. fantastic cocktails & atmosphere
one of our favourites in london. for israeli food, it's not too oily or heavy but still absolutely delicious. every dish is memorable and full of flavour
wonderful, uniwue and tasteful  israeli food
exquisite
yum yum yum food
staff is amazing. the food is alright but nothing special.
amazing food, service, drinks, atmosphere! everything. probably my favourite restaurant in london!
amazing food and cocktails - lovely service. dishes are unique and taste great!
one of the best places in london. i would highly recommend this to anyone who appreciates middle eastern food.
nothing special , and pricey
gooooooood foooooooood
excellent!
unbelievable food
small portions, very tasty
service was great, food wasn't too long, staff were friendly and chatty. customer service was outstanding and the food was great. i'll be coming back.
amazing!   food was outstanding. great cocktails too.  lovely atmosphere.  unusually for me i seem to have forgotten to take photos of the food...next time!

asaf granit, israeli chef at london. delicious heaven food, but very tiny ..... small portions.shakshuka is full of taste and... without eggs the ambience is business, food is business, talks are business,bathroom is business.the soul no longer lives here.
excellent food. prepared in front of you by a super friendly and fun team. eat at the bar!
fantastic menu and great staff, excellent food all along. cocktails are fresh and deliciously good

i feel awful doing this as the service is utterly 5 star but i feel the food was average when you consider the prices.  i can only assume the 5 stars as because it's the west end and a tourist trap.  some good dishes and some very ok ones , on par with something like meza in tooting.  soz guys are you're so nice
the desserts are fenomenal, especially the chocolate cake!
really welcoming staff, good vibes and flavourful dishes. everyone seems to be really knowledgeable and passionate about what they do . i loved this experience and definitely come back again.

i had a very poor experience with these people. be careful of the cancellation. it is not well advertised on the website. i called two hours before my reservation on a wednesday for lunch to let them know i wouldnt be able to make it. i was advised i would be charged a 60 cancellation fee. thanks guys, really appreciate it.
perfect! great fresh and tasty food, great atmosphere, happy and friendly stuff. highly recommended experience!!!

excellent food and service, though a tad overpriced. polenta was outstanding. other dishes were great. delicious meal, although paid the same as for a michelin-starred menu and this wasnt quite up there.
so far one of the best place i've ever been. lovely atmosphere, gorgeous food!
long wait .. but worth it .. best liver ive ever had

i am incredibly impressed with the staff who overly accommodated the fact that i eat vegan (and mostly raw). there arent many options for vegans but the options available were quite palatable. my meat eating friends also enjoyed their dishes. everything is incredibly fresh, packed with taste, and you can tell its authentic.
great food, service needs to be improved
this place is great! authentic flavours and good vibe inside.
came here a few weeks ago and it was delicious. service was a bit crazy but the staff were so friendly and helpful that it wasnt an issue. would come back.
very busy, book ahead if you can. i had an eggplant dish and the best falfafels ive ever had. very friendly and helpful service.

i keep coming back, one of my favourite places in london right now. deliciously creative food (israeli/middle eastern), amazing drinks and a wonderful atmosphere. great for dates, casual dinner, night out with friends. honestly cant rave about this place and the food enough. menu is constantly changing with more deliciousness.
a very dark uninteresting restaurant situated in the soho. food was boring & everything had the same taste.
the best restaurant, my favourite place!

food is well prepared, reasonable size sharing portions. israeli/mediterranean tapas style with well balanced flavours. hands down best tahini dip ive had, the octopus is tender and easily the best dish on the menu. if you can, sit at the bar, watching the action adds to the experience.
brilliant. authentic flavours cooked with love
everything delicious!!
the food, staff and atmosphere are amazing. would advice booking in advance as this place gets very busy.
some what crowded, food a little pricey,
top notch. sit at the counter. i live in nyc but when im in london palomar is a must

the food was just delicious. we came as a party of five and the dishes are well suited for sharing. the service was excellent. make sure you book atleast a few days in advance as it's very hard to get a table. you can also request to be added to the waiting list in case someone cancels their reservation.
i thought the food was average ,just like evey middle eastern countries. very over priced. my bug bearing was the waiter seemed very pushy to get rid of us. .
one of the best restaurants in the area. best to go with a few people and share a lot of starters to benefit from a variety of beautiful dishes.

we had such a fantastic time. the service and kitchen staff all created such a good atmosphere. we were sat at the kitchen bar, which was superb. the head chef, jeremy, explained the menu to perfection. the food matched the descriptions and was amazing. i couldn't speak more highly of the experience we received. strongly recommend.
venue is awesome. place is pretty cool. nice cocktails and great modern twist on israeli food

an amazing evening at palomar! sitting at the bar, enjoying the sight of all dishes being prepared in front of us was wonderful. the host was very friendly and having the opportunity to get chefs advice on what to choose from the menu was a true privilege. every dish was phenomenal!
this is my favorite restaurant in london! i love sitting at the bar watching the chefs prepare amazing food. great israeli flavors. great place
this place alone made the trip so much worth it!!!  thank you palomar (tons of times) for all those amazing flavors!  feel like i do not need to see anything else in london

amazing food and equally amazing service. we were looked after beyond expectations. i recommend sitting at the bar to see the chef and the staff create the magic. i d say booking in advance is essential. we will be back!
wonderful food, great atmosphere, very nice staff, a bit pricey (:
great scallops and chicken liver. super friendly.
excellent food, amazing atmosphere and the service was marvellous.
amazing food and service!!
delicious and fun

we were able to walk in and perch ourselves on the bar for an incredibly delicious supper. everything was cooked to perfection and the produce incredibly fresh and flavorsome. stars of the night was the crispy sea bream (you get a whole fish fyi) and tel aviv mix which were both divine.
it was good, but a bit over rated (vs. the hype)
great service, excellent food. love it
order the baba ganoush, beetroots, octo hmus and confit duck and you gonna have a unforgettable meal.
average vegetarian options,  quite overpriced with 5 pounds for just dips without bread. service was just okay.

casual, easy and great. great atmosphere, great food and great wine. relatively inexpensive compared to some other fancy restaurants in the area. just listen to servers here as they will guide you through ordering perfectly. always need the kubaneh to start and the polenta later in the meal but the chicken livers is not to be missed
incredible food, tasty cocktails, and attentive staff. loved everything we ordered (particularly the pita bread, spicy dip, and scallops).
good quality food, a little over priced and pretentious.

had such a lovely experience last night, sitting at the bar and watching marko, sam, kevin and alex work their cheftastic magic! our dishes were sooooo good, and the chefs service was amazing! best birthday present from the boyf. oooh, and try the mulled wine syrup champagne - so much christmas goodness!
totally my favourite rest in london! love the atmosphere, amazing and most importantly interesting and unusual food. the polenta is the best thing ever happened to humankind!
great food. good vibe. the layout of the kitchen area does a good job of connecting you to the chefs and your food. pricey, but as expected.
good food at a very reasonable price. the restaurant is a great date location.
great food and dining experience. excellent service
amazing food and atmosphere! the staff is great
good but feel like it's overrated
the food was mediocre. different experience then i remembered from my other two visits. service and the atmosphere was good.
experience top! top food! and first of all grande ilaria!
money-making machine with very little attention to customers. small portions. true, some undeniable creativity and know-how, but london has much more to offer. will not come back.
original very tasty delicious food at palomar. this place is very very popular and as it's such a small place it can be quite noisy. don't let this put you off though, the food is worth it.

palomar is a must everytime im in london. one of the top resturants there ..the food was so amazing.. orders are in small plates so you get to taste as many dishes as u can .very innovative yet simple ingredients, and outcome is outstandingthe staff are friendly and very helpful.
great food and lovely service. the space however is a bit crammed & it is a nightmare to get a booking.
great food. great vibe.. lovely place. wasn't an average dish .. would recommend
great place! the food is really good, the service is great and the jerusalem mess dessert is the best.
top experience! top food!
amazing atmosphere, cool people and a fun spot for tapas and cocktails. highly recommend!
delicious food, very welcoming staff.
food is fantastic but portions are quite small.
amazing food and lovely staff. a great experience.
fantastic food with great flavours and some unusual takes on some classic dishes. it can be a little pricey, but definitely worth it.
delicious and fun
absolutely amazing. great veggie dishes
this place lives to the hype. amazing food amazing creations and flavours. id recommend it any day.
my favorite restaurant in london. love the intimacy and the culinary experience! highly recommend the beetroot, courgette tzatziki, and the octopus hummus. reservations are a must!

i like the way we had to go into the restaurant all together for the sitting , sat at the bar and watched the chefs busy at work. great staff - very friendly and helpful. lovely meal, really tasty. thank you
very tasty food, friendly staff and attentive waiting service, will 100% be coming back with the family!
excellent food, but a noisy place.
amazing food! do try the malabi dessert
full of good energies, nice people and amazing tastes the best malabi i have ate ever!!!

the food was okay (some dishes were great, some were average), but its definitely very very expensive for the size of portions. you can spend 50 per person and still leave hungry. weve tried 30% of the menu for sure and there was nothing extraordinary
coolest restaurant i have been in london. high quality food, good price and excellent service. highly recommended.
really nice mediterranian mixed food. portions are small but carefully prepared.there is that pasta dish which we really liked. must try!service was excellent.a little bit pricy but worth it.

brilliant brilliant brilliant venue. the food was amazing but the experience of sitting in front of the chef while he did his thing was brilliant. definitely recommend to visit & try everything. its all so good. got a show around the place by the chef which made the whole experience extra special

i sat at the counter, and there's a fantastic energy there. too much of london is merely pleasant and polite---this place was refreshingly fun and alive. food and cocktails were excellent. i especially enjoyed the octopus but was dining solo so didn't get to try too many things. will be back!

had a mid-week lunch here - good sharing plates and options, jerusalem chicken has good flavor to it, but could have been more succulent. other dishes were average.  the bread and dips were fine but nothing to make this restaurant more favorable than other mediterranean ones in london.

one of my favorite restaurants ever. there is nothing on their menu that i tried and didn't like. i try to go every time i'm in london. i recently purchased their cookbook (they sell it at the restaurant). i am excited to try some of the recipes. service is fast and friendly. highly recommend.

one of my favourite places to eat in london.  you sit at the bar.  cant book so you need to put your name down.  i recommend doing this around 18:00 if youre prepared to eat later.  there are sittings for 18:00 that you can book in advanced if youre happy to eat early.
great staff with a lot of experience and good vibe. the food is tasty, we loved the scallops   and the cobaneh.

explosion of flauver from middle east with a fresh mediterranean touch.  the brioche bread is to die for, the israeli head chef knows very well how to play with flavours and spices. i loved it! i will be back

get a seat at the bar for a great view of the chefs and cocktail guys at work. great atmosphere and the food is wonderful. just returned to the palomar nye dinner and it did not disappoint! fantastic set menu great atmosphere and amazing service.

probably one of our favourite restaurants in london. the food is very tasty and the environment is quite nice. we absolutely adore the jerusalem mess (pictured). even bought the palomar cookbook, thats how much we love this place. slightly on the pricey side but you wont mind once you taste all that yumminess. recommended!

this delightful restaurant gave us an incredible meal. the staff were professional and very knowledgeable about the food they were serving to us. dips were incredible! this really felt like a family-run restaurant taken to the highest level of standard.

this place must be one of the best restaurants in london. the food was absolutely delicious. note that the place is usually fully booked. make sure you reserve your table at least a couple of weeks ahead. weve tried most of the dishes from the menu and each was simply wonderful.

excellent main dishes. the palenta and chicken livers were a standout. the restaurant provides a very intimate atmosphere in the back or a more active atmosphere at the bar. the appetizers were good and desert was decent. service was also great. highly recommended.

i just have to say the best bread, and hummus i have ever eaten. i still have dreams about it!the mains were not as good as the starters but that just maybe because the food is so so so good!love their drinks too!
lovely food. great service.  busy. recommend seating "in the back"
one of the best restaurants i have ever been into london so far. food was fantastic :)

i remembered every dish i had at the palomar. thats how memorable the food was. the dips, the bread, the fish, and the truffle polenta... all were prepared to perfection. they were so delicious that you wondered why would you ever want to eat anything else!
great atmosphere, funny and outgoing team, and tasty food and cocktails....strongly recommended!!!!
very good middle eastern food. decent service, nice atmosphere.
i liked the presentation of food. great services. food was flavorful. staff were courteous.
the dinning room is too small and crammed. besides, there was a nasty smell of drainpipe. waiters are rude and we picked up mistakes in the bill. food is good.

dishes served at paloma are small and varied, so choose a few for each person and take your time enjoying each one. palomar has an authentic mediterranean:middle eastern fusion which delivers a wonderful culinary journey.

great food and service in this trendy and busy place, prices are appropriate for the quality of food and flavor. dishes are made fresh and in front of you if you sit at the bar. you definitely have to reserve!
lovely experience, lovely food, lovely staff
excellent food and super cocktails, really worth the wait. difficult to get a table and not a kosher restaurant as advertised but really great tasty stuff.
amazing restaurant!  loved the dips, the octopus and chicken dishes.  would have passed on the lamb and pork in future.  still, 5 stars overall, great service and wonderful food!
amazing food and service. the bread is to die for. tree of life (whole roasted broccoli),  artichokes and sea bass also excellent.

the food never disappoints. try to get a table at the bar, its great fun watching the kitchen team whip up the dishes in front of your eyes. good options for vegetarians as well! try to book ahead as this place is popular!
great food experience in the heart of london.
excellent food. really struggling to think of anything negative about the visit. hoghly recomended.

one of my favourite restaurants in london. it's tiny so do make a reservation (or come late for standing bar seating). but the flavours are bold, the dishes inventive and the atmosphere charming and energetic. love it!
special sea bass was the best fish dish i've ever ate!

excellent food. amazing atmosphere, sitting at the open kitchen bar with view of the kitchen, bar and service areas. service was friendly and efficient. just wish we had more time to enjoy but we had to leave for the opera. only available to book for 1730 otherwise it's first come first served.
amazing place

great food, friendly staff and great price-quality! went here for lunch, definitely go for the harissa chicken. the spice merguez is good as well, but like it says it's spicy. ow and the burrata, take that as well!!!
incredible food and fantastic staff
really one of my favourite lately. the food is amazing, cocktails are delicious and the service is awesome. what else would you want?great location and super nice place. see you soon!
while israeli food itself wasn't my thing....the quality was good and the employees were all super nice and professional...
authentic middle eastern food with a gourmet twist. great friendly service too, sit by the bar for seeing the chefs in action.

unique food. cool vibes. as someone who's familiar with the source (in jerusalem) i have to say that it's a little overrated,  and not as good as the original.still, it's definitely worth the visit.just don't forget to either make a reservation of come early and get a spot at the bar.
very nice place to eat, no complaints at all, will be coming back in the near future.

this was a magical experience. went for an evening meal with family. everything from fabulous new food flavours and great service. plus you can purchase their cook book and i've already started making some of their delicious recipes.we can't wait to go back.
interesting menu, fresh tasty food, service a bit slow but with a smile
great middle eastern cuisine, small plates, great vibe. would recommend

just want to say that i love the barbary - the palomar's sister restaurant - which is why i was so so disappointed. it is of course a great looking spot and the service was good but i'll probably never go back. my advice, go to the barbary - cheaper and absolutely a sure thing.

super fun place with a very chill vibe. the chef and the staff are hilarious and are gleaming with positive vibe. the food is great although i found a couple dishes a tad bit salty. would most certainly return! i would highly recommend anyone to give this restaurant a shot!

highly recommend this restaurant. had the harissa chicken - tender and delicious. also try the beetroot and goat's cheese, the fatoush and the falafel. lovely flavours and attentive staff. probably the best we had on our london visit.

really different and new food, excellent service, a very special restaurant. don't bother with the menu, instead allow the charming staff a free hand in selecting a (large) choice of starters for you.  be warned that these are sufficiently filling to render a main course almost unnecessary.

it is a cool bar/restaurant with a lively bar counter and a separare dessert counterat the front and a seating area at the back. the food is mediterranean and israeli style. there are tapas dishes and also mains. service is friendly and the bartender fixes up a mean cocktail.
cant describe how good this restaurant is!the food, the service, the vibe!one of the best restaurants ive ever visitedmust come back

had a quick dinner of udon. it was okay but nothing special, price was okay but smaller portion sizes compared to other places. the katsu curry looked good and may come back to try other things on menu. service was good.
the best japanese in london. it's like a recreation of japan in london.
nice people and some tea is offered on arrival. however i discourage anyone from taking the noodle plate, served cold and tastless. inside is very small.
it was just ok but didn't think it was anything special. we like it that they ate sustainable though and don't serve tuna!
great japanese basics for a reasonable price served by friendly staff
great atmosphere, great food
generous staff, cosy place and nice food for having lunch. and, moreover, we can ask for more portion of rice. we will definitely come back again!!
food was very bad and service was slow
good food, at good prices, had to queue for lunch (only about 15 minutes). japanese menu. i would definitely recommend.
lovely food and excellent service.
simple good food. had a lovely experience
very authentic , friendly staff, great food, decent price! defiantly can't go wrong here. i will be coming back.
love this little place and have been going for years. always happy to return.
always a good place to eat, i would suggest having udon recipes with fish and vegetarian options if possible.their inari is extremely tasty!
authentic and tasty, staff not pushy
great place, with great food and good service
food is very average but pricey. cashier lady has a passive agressive manner and seems to want me gone as soon as i finish. very tight spaces and uncomfortable seating.
one of the best chicken katsu currys i have ever had, such a big portion and it is all delicious. very friendly service and free japanese tea.
delicious food, great prices, attentive staff, wonderful company
an authentic japanese experience. tipping not allowed.
lovely, great price  great food friendly staff
it was a nice experience. the food was good and the staffs friendly. we will definitely return to this place in the future!
the real deal! reminiscent of a real japanese izakaya or noodle shop near the station stop in tokyo or osaka. great food, atmosphere and service!
authentic, delicious and great value japanese cuisine. excellent service and a great atmosphere too!
tokyo diner daisuki.....cozy atmosphere and simple, heart-warming, and tasty food....i love u
friendly staff, good food and fast service :)
great food and fantastic prices
great service with great staff as well. would gladly again visit this welcome environment.
good food and very cheap
the sushi was very fresh and the staff super friendly
this restaurant is a diamond in the rough in london, incredible food and very well priced lovely staff you cant ask for more!!!!!!
good vegi food for cheap.
super quick and super tasty. try the katsu curry. best i've tasted outside japan.
japanese food with that authentic japanese taste and feel. wonderful little place that honestly is the closest thing i've found since my time in japan. if you love japanese food, its a must try.
a brilliant place to go and eat. great service, great food and really nice people to look after you. brilliant, and the bill was a joy to pay. must go there again soon.
we loved it. the service is very kind and the food is delicious. we are definitely coming back!

this was our second time that we came here to dinner and both pretty good.really japanese dishes, with not bad relation quality / price, big portions and also you can order and extra rice for free, nice service and globally a good choice in the area.
had a lovely dinner here, the staff is really kind and the food is great
amazing service. japanese style. free jasmin tee. food experience really good.
very friendly, food is good, hot dishes are full of flavour. gets very busy by 8pm so go earlier. a little bit pricey.
best sushi ive ever eaten here in europe ill definitely go back here

if you want authentic, healthily-cooked and tasty japanese food, this is the place to go to. from the multiple trips that i have made there, they have never disappointed. i also particularly enjoy the service there, as every restaurant staff exemplifies how traditional japanese restaurants treat their customers.
ive been here many times, authentic quick japanese food. in true japanese style, they do not accept tips
delicious food! had the katsu curry and sashimi meal - really tasty food and friendly staff. also great value for central london!
havent been here for years - and im delighted to say that it hasnt changed a bit. katsu curry rules...
small place and most likely you are going to have to wait for a table. the service is friendly and expedite. the food it was either excellent or normal ok japanese food.

pure delight. it's everything right about fast food. it's cheap and delicious. the sushi is simple and the small dishes like the agreed tofu are wonderful. it is fast though so plan a forty five minute visit.
authentic and decent price
tasty and efficient
amazing!!! so authentic. they speak japanese, serve you green tea and don't accept tips just like in japan. portions are huge. i ordered the tofu katsu ju. lots of veggie & vegan options.
the lady who took the payment was very rude.
good simple no frills japanese restaurant. fast service, goid value and tasty food.
efficient, no tipping. recommend chicken katsu don, miso soup and a sapporo lager. never disappoints.

great experience and not too pricey. it was a saturday evening, and we managed to get a table for the two of us. they have real japanese cuisine, so if you are not an experienced sybarite, you may have some surprises.of course, they give you some things to wait for your order and green tea.

had lovely tofu, amazing japanese tea and excellent sushi. their humble atmosphere and friendly service really makes it, first time i feel like ive eaten wholesome japanese food. will be coming here again
pretty much unchanged in 20 years
excellent service.
taste exactly like in japan
always in awe of how reasonable the prices are here for the quality. food is no fuss and homely with a menu anyone could find something on. try their chicken kara age side dish, especially great.
good food but not something special. a bit pricey for the portions served. i will give it one more chance and revisit.
solid spot to go whether in a group or solo. food is good & service is quick!
very good value meals. tasty food.
this is a famous japanese restaurant where you have to arrive early to get a table. the service is good and they offer the tea. i was expecting the ramen to be better though.
cute place, not the best i've had but it was nice.
lovely place. great service and super tasty food. wanted to go again but wife wanted to try somewhere else
went for salmon benton box, would recommend
tokyo diner is a fantastic spot for anyone looking for great japanese food in london. the chicken katsu curry was one of the best i've ever had, big portions and fair prices.
good prices and great service, with free tea throughout the meal. the food seemed a bit bland, but that comes down to personal preference.

one of my favourite japanese restaurants. we ordered pork katsudon  and it was amazing as always.  reasonably priced and super friendly staff. they give you different kinds of green tea depending on the season, for free :) and don't accept tips, just like in japan

authentic japanese food experience at a reasonable price in london? yes, please! no bookings available just show up and hope for a seat, but honestly tables free up pretty quickly so no need to worry!
gorgeous food in the most teeny tiny space
fantastic place, i always visit every time i'm in london

the place is cosy and cool even during a very hot summer afternoon. the staff are polite and food came really quick. my only disappointment is the lack of choice between noodle dishes and soups along side with the quality of the famous 'chicken katsu curry' which did not live up to its name.

i haven't been to tokyo diner for 6 years after moving out of uk, but it has always been a regular visit when living here for over 12years.happy to say it's still consistency good tasting food just how i remember! thank you, i'll be back!
nice place, good food
a true authentic taste of japanese culture!
really good traditional food with a generous price and portion, the owner is very kind and they promote safe fishing practices ( don't expect tuna to be on the menu)
excellent, traditional food with much more than just sushi. authentic atmosphere and experience.
fantastic food and great service. very accommodating to veggies

cheap and fast. tastes cheap and fast. not that it's bad, it's just not as good as japanese food can get. i had high hopes. but they did a great job with getting our food out quick due to it being an hour before a show. bento boxes look good.

huge food portion. the japanese katsu curry (crispy fries pork cutlet) is delicious. authentic japanese fast-food meal at affordable price. tucked away in chinatown. plenty of seating space in basement downstairs as well. fast table turnaround.
it is good to go to a japanese owned by japanese people

simple, straightforward japanese food. forget about the huge range of dishes of other japanese spots. this one has a small offer. their focus is on the quality. tried a million times. never disappointed.

great food, great service. what i especially loved is how they have a whole page of the menu dedicated to what kind of allergens are in the menu items! it could have literally been life or death for me here if i had ordered the curry not expecting peanuts but instead this whole place just gave me life. sayonara!
great food and terrific service!
yeah.  its worth the wait.
good value, straightforward japanese food
authentic japnese food

this is by far my favourite japanese in town. it is very reminiscent of japan's izakayas. the food is delicious and very well presented, the tea is lovely, and the service is good, too. it is no wonder this place is always busy.
this is an affordable place where you can eat propper asian food and they give you green tea for free

love this place. great service. amazing food. so authentic and so reasonably priced. if there's a queue it's worth the wait and the line often goes down quickly. lots of free tea! would highly recommend.

one of two places that serves katsudon within the area. great customer service, and the food was delicious! minus one star (i kid still 5 stars) for the pork meat being too hard, which i can understand considering the price point. i will definitely be coming back.

food is fine, but not fantastic. service is fairly perfunctory. we were a group of six and got seated in the basement, despite the upstairs area being relatively empty and ended up being on our own there for the entire meal. it had zero ambience - no music and minimal decor.

been there several times over the years. always really good food and service. plus it's really good value for money. it's our go-to japanese restaurant. we judge the other ones comparing them to tokyo dner.
great food, at a good price, with good service
good food and cozy space for a decent price.
always delicious ad fresh food. amazing staff
cozy little japanese eatery that serves authentic and delicious japanese food! service was quick and efficient as well. the only downside was the meat of my katsu curry was a bit too tough!

staffs and food were great and made me felt like eating in a japanese restaurant in japan actually... they don't encourage the customers to pay tips at all, which is kinda interesting to know in the uk.
been coming here for years, always busy but they never seem to be put out or impolite. sushi is consistently good but that's about it

wonderful place, very tasty, staff were awesome. true japanese vibe, they give complementary tea and snacks, tips are banned etc.we ate the curry and the katsu don, both were great, nice size and the gravy was excellent.
great and simple japanese food for an affordable price.with a lovely and authentic atmosphere as well
excellent food and staff along with a very traditional atmosphere
amazingly good! simple but authentic japanese food, with very attractive price.

amazing service and the food was very authentic! we had free snacks and japanese tea on arrival. i also liked that we were given our bill after we ordered so it allowed us more freedom to leave when we wanted.
the food was ok. although the portions were really small. i like the fact that they care about the sustainability (they don't serve tuna). also the webcam idea was also cool!
simple japanese diner serving sushi, bento, noodles and curries.
was ok. nothing exceptional. small-is portions, ok choice.
great food, cozy atmosphere, good prices, and quick service!
great value japanese food, quick service and friendly. always a favourite in the area.

superb food, authentic as far as i can tell. very friendly atmosphere. slightly small dining areas but added to the cosy feeling. and any negatives massively outweighed by the incredible tastes and textures. we all loved it!!
top spot for traditional authentic japanese food
absolutely lovely food and place to go with friends

a small but busy place, tucked away in the busy streets of london. the service is fantastic, and makes you really feel looked after, the food comes out fast but not comprismied. fantastic japanese food, with a good price and great service. strongly recommended if you are visiting london and in the mood for some japanese cuisine.
excellent food at decent prices. have been here multiple times.
very simple,  good japanese food.
quick service and great food! staff are friendly. picture is chicken katsu curry rice, and as a japanese curry enthusiast i can tell you that this is just right.
very simple but also very nice sushi. prices are extremely reasonable. i almost feel bad rating this place so hi for fear it'll get more popular and the experience won't be as good.
great food and reasonably priced, always enjoy their food. does get busy so you might have to wait a bit. service is quick and food is not michelin star, but very tasty.

in the 10+ years i've been going here, it never disappoints. excellent staff, great food. as authentic as you're going to get in london. it would be a crime if high rents and redevelopment ever touched this joint.
love the place and the price are not expensive!
great food, good service
great food and a good price for london will be returning again. this is a japanese style restaurant so they do not like you to tip.
the food is not nice at all. its presented in a lovely way but for the most part is cold and tasteless
excellent food. very kind staff. i saved the address !
this place is dripping with charm (check the menu entry for natto). the menu is very down to earth but you can't beat it if you're in the mood for a bowl of nice warm rice with some lovely toppings.
great food reasonable prices
friendly staff, good service, good maki rolls, very good soup, ok negiri.
i fell in love with this place. the food is absolutely delicious and the staff are amazing!

really nice fried chicken, fresh and crispy and very well done, and sushi was also fresh and delicious. however the rice bowls are bland with chicken over cooked and dry, dont recommend the rice dishes at all, you can find better japanese than here pretty easily
authentic japanese restaurant, great prices, delicious food.
fav japonese in soho ! been going for year !
best japanese classic range of food in town, reasonable prices and bigger portions for no extra cost if you ask. try the rice wine.
quick service and the food is really nice!
authentic japanese dining at sensible prices
great honest japanese food, good service and nice atmosphere
good food. run by family. unlimited japanese tea
love this place, been coming here 15 years and still think their teriyaki chicken is the best.
amazing japanese restaurant highly recommend

great authentic japanese cuisine. amazing service and one of my favourite udons.recently tried their sushi and sashimi, which was fresh and nice. not to mention complimentary snacks and green tea upon the arrival with refills
fantastic food, great environment, nice staff. would recommend. i go here a lot now!
very tasty maki and good udon. small seating area, may have to wait outside, but worth it.
i thought this would be a good place as its always full wen i pass by n it's been here years.but i think it'd just average nothing special at all not sure i will come back
nice soba noddle soup, the noodles werent al dante enough. a good salmon nigiri and not so good squid nigiri.
humble and good honest japanese fayre.  no tips policy just like japan and all the waiting staff know japanese.
felt like in a real japanese restaurant. good food in a reasonable price.
i ate real japanese food for the first time in london! staff really nice and good environment to practice your japanese.
one of my favourite sushi places in london. great menu and fantastic service. the setting is very intimate, and makes you feel like you are holed up in a real japanese izakaya.
it's right there in chinatown, the food is so good and i really like the vegan options. great service too.
lovely atmosphere...chilled even though it's in the thick of it. great service and food. don't tip ;)
lovely place with good quality dishes. straightforward menu with good dishes and fast service once ordered.
we went there on the 1st of jan, we four had a wonderful time with yummy food and excellent service. thank you guys.
it's the japanese restaurant to go to when you are in chinatown. the restaurant is there for years. always very good service. food is amazing. love it.
favourite japanese, come before any west end visit.
great chicken katsu curry. large portions, free tea, and authentic atmosphere.
good quick japanese food in soho
calm and quiet atmosphere, friendly staff and really good tasty food

fantastic choice of food and really really tasty with amazing service. staff are more than happy to answer any questions. more than enough even for a fussy eater like me!i had the vegetarian benito box and some inari. i would totally recommend.
excellent quality and great tasting japanese food. lovely service, would dine here again.
great food, fast service, no tips allowed. really great experience and will be returning
tasty, fast and not too expensive
have been going regularly for 6+ years and i never grow tired. i really can't find a better japanese restaurant in london and the curry warms my heart
cosy little japanese restaurant. excellent soba noodles.
expected a lot more. the food was pretty bland and had a nicer katsu from wasabi, which says a lot.
the website looks like 90's, the more reason to go and we were not deceived as the food was delicious ! all you need in a hot japanese cantina is here.
very nice genuine japanish food
fantastic japanese restaurant great food and friendly waiters
amazing food and incredibly quick service. really good value and a superb space for low key dining in a small/medium group. lots of veggie and vegan options! and very authentic. really lovely place!
very authentic and wholesome place. food is no frills but super tasty
love love love this place. genuine and delicious. what else?
not really expensive and great. free unlimited tea and very good fish. i strongly recommend
one of my favourite japanese food definitely recommended traditional japanese.
amazing food at awesome prices! will definitely be back again!
very cozy place. food is varied and not pricy. definitely worth visiting.

me and my friend went to the tokyo diner in soho a few days ago. was my first japanese meal since coming back from tokyo in may, and the food was incredible, absolutely wolfed it down! reasonable prices as well for central london. about 13 for a chicken katsu curry which was a good sized portion.
good food, friendly staff and fair prices. sushi didn't blow me away but would go again.
great place, amazing udon and soba and the appetizers are super good. they are a conscious diner and really nice. price is usually around 15 per person.
a very good place to dine. sushi is fresh and exquisitely prepared. mis felicitaciones al chef.
it's been our standing tradition to go here every time we go to london, and it's easy to see why. good food and pleasant staff in a very neat package.
excellent japanese service and setting. katsu curry and more. love the automated sliding doors :)
had some delicious vegan diahes (tofu catsu curry, vege bunto box, sides and more). great price. kind staff. quick service. thanks so much
cosy little place for a japanese dinner. my friend had a katsu curry, i had salmon donburri. nice food, great location.
very authentic japanese cuisine. very light soul food almost. do try chicken katsu don, it's legendary here. maybe chicken kaarage too. free green tea.
great food and very quick service. highly recommended
top quality japanese food with corresponding good service
my favourite japanese  restaurant! the best udon  in this area and delicious  sushi.
great place for authentic japanese food and atmosphere

i think i probably ordered the wrong food as i got the salmon don and it was just ok even for the price. most things are cheaper here but i guess i should try the katsu curry as its supposedly the best in london? it is very busy and they dont have enough staff but you can see they do try their best to get to everyone.

google tells me i have been here. i have walked past in on numerous occasions. maybe i stopped outside to tie my shoe lace.  please ignore the star rating as it probably does not reflect the actual ratings for the restaurant.
good. free green tea. mushy rice...perhaps overcooked. but main course and appetizers were tasty. nothing earth shattering but good food.
have seen this place busy many times. finally went on friday. it didn't disappoint. delicious chicken katsu and nice service and atmosphere.

this is a lovely, simple and reasonably priced restaurant. it was surprisingly easy to find a table on a friday night. the menu is interesting and varied, and the food was simple and really tasty. service was kind.

awesome little place just off of chinatown. food was great, acceptable prices, seating wait times and service a little slower than usual during busy hours, but food arrived quickly once sat down. overall a nice experience. salmon don was my choice!
great food. service could be better but still adequate. the queue is incredibly long.

superb place for food. authentic, served in a great atmosphere with friendly and prompt service. the menu is a little small, but everything in it is exceptional. the price is very reasonable for central london too; they will refuse tips too.
basic, clean, fast, quality japanese food.  fast service.  good value for soho. recommend for lunch or as a pit stop.

food is delicious and very cheap with a superb range on the menu. great for everyone. the place is usually full  and rightly so  but staff are quick to find a table. there are no complaints to be had about this place  its amongst the best around.
amazing food. i have not been for almost 10 years, and the food and service is still as good now as it was then. well worth a visit.

tokyo diner is very popular and it's not unusual to queue for a table. the surroundings are basic, but the food is generously portioned, tasty and very reasonably priced. with friendly staff, free green tea and miso soup with each dish ordered, what's not to like? definitely worth a visit.

small diner, seems very authentic, very good portion prices (you can ask for extra noodles or rice at the time of ordering for free) and quick service. don't take tips as customary in japan. be prepared for a little bit of a wait

delicious, authentic japanese food, friendly staff and a cosy atmosphere. the minimalistic menu is also a fantastic idea - everything is delicious and reasonably priced. looking forward to coming here again!
its a veey honest sushi restaurant that serves quality food at a pretty decent prices. they don't serve tuna as a way to protect and preserve it.100% recommended

authentic food and interior. food is pretty good at a very reasonable price. our waiter was not particularly friendly but this was near the end of her shift on a saturday so all is forgiven. overall there are definitely better japanese restaurants in london but this is a great alternative for a casual night out with friends.

watch out for your belongings and jackets.had my canada goose jacket on a rack behind me whilst i ate. went to pay the bill and the jacket had been stolen.restaurant has no insurance so could not help.be very careful here.
dont let 3 stars fool you. good hearty portions at a good price, could do with a little music maybe and please turn the heating on, good service. very tasty
good food and polite/welcoming staff. a nice change compared to the rest of china town. it's quite a small diner though, may be difficult to get a table.

authentic japanese diner with a simple menu, but amazing quality. having lived in japan for a while, i really appreciate proper japanese homey food and atmosphere like this. you might need to queue sometimes to get in.
great atmosphere and straight forward food options that always leaves you satisfied. definitely a favorite!

one of, if not may favourite japanese restaurant in london. i walk in here and i think of one of my favourite places to eat in tokyo, out of the way, lovely and homely. it is a bit moist in there during the summer. otherwise it's perfect for getting that classic japanese eat. would recommend any time of the day, any time of the week
good value for money for the area, nice clean place with friendly staff. would like to have had a full meal but only had time for starters  see you soon

best salmon tataki ever, amazing authentic japanese food. i had my doubts after visiting numerous other japanese restaurants in europe but tokyo diner did not disappoint. slightly pricey but worth it if youve craving asian food in europe!

i love japanese food and someone recommended that i try this place, so i stopped for dinner. i had the katsu don. service was friendly but i wasn't impressed by the food. the batter on the pork was soggy. the rice seemed too soft and wet (possibly overcooked?). flavour wasn't great.  i would not return.
japanese's chef graduates gaining experience overseas in london. done perfectly
the best! amazing food and like being in japan.
nice friendly staff and food is cheap and authentic. would recommend!

wonderful cosy restaurant. the service was very fast and the staff were helpful and friendly. the lunch deal is great (filling ahd good value for money). they also offer free snacks upon arrival and green tea which is a greatly appreciated addition. i ordered the katsu which comes with rice and soup.
authentic japanese food with green tea serves along with your meal. the staffs were nice and kind. they don't have service charges like other restaurants in london.
unique,fair priced,nice atmosphere, i've had a very good dining experience, highly recommend
cheap, fast service, excellent food.their lunch deals in particular are amazing, esp considering the location!
good value japanese food. straightforward surroundings, the menu offers a good choice of sushi and bento etc. no tips, just pay for what you order. will visit again if in the area.

can't rate this place highly enough! easily one of my favourite japanese restaurants in london. the service is great, they don't allow tipping and give out free extra large portions on request. the food itself is authentic, delicious and great value for money - an undoubted gem.
excellent food, great quality of meal, fantastic dcor, and for a very reasonable price. a real good find, this one!
if you like japanese cuisine, then you must visit. warm place and very polite staff
quick service, free green tea, free rice crackers, amazing food, no tipping. busy and buzzing little place in china town. there isn't a bad choice in the menu.
real taste of delicious japanese food. will come here if i am missing home. i like the katsu don!

love this atmosphere, will definitely go back. the waiters all speak japanese so it's nice for the people who wants to practice the language. the rooms are beautifully arranged and the food is really enjoyable. you can ask for am extra portion of rice for free if you're really hungry
in and out in 20 minutes flat - great pho and martinis just before the show at queens theatre. very attentive and friendly service. well be back!
