simply an amazing restaurant at an affordable price. from food experience to waitress personnel, everything was great.
bought ribs for a main and was only given 2 ribs
my favourite restaurant in china town. great food, value and service!
good value for money in the centre of london and the pho and summer rolls i had were delicious and service was good. take a seat at the window to people watch while you have a bite to eat.
great interior. nice pho. service was decent
well... if this is one of best vietnamese restaurants in london, thats so sad. both food and service were disappointing.
brilliant pho
food was great, though quantities were below expectations. staff were very friendly and service was great.

we were starving after touring the tour of london and really wanted something authentic. this place did not disappoint. i had the chicken pho and fresh spring rolls with prawns- delicious. the cocktail menu is insane and has so many fresh options. i definitely would recommend this place.
one of my favourite places. great food and the best pho i've eaten in london so far!!! crispy spring rolls and shrimp balls are highly recommended! enjoy!
great food, great service and reasonable prices! would 100% recommend going here!
great food, good service and a relaxed atmosphere.
first time for vietnamese food and very impressed.
great genuine vietnamese recipes food in a very welcoming place.
the most enjoyable meal i've had in london! especially their beef fried rice is heavenly!
love this place. it has some of the best pho ive had. the spring rolls and squid rings are also great. (i havent tried anything else yet)it looks a bit touristy, but dont worry about it.
delicious pho, perfect for a quick catch up with friends
beef pho is perfect!
i love this restaurant, the service is great and the food reasonably priced and fantastic to eat
this is not banh xeo! what is this?! salad is too small to wrap the banh xeo in. its like a cracker where you have to add your seafood on top...taste wasnt good either.
brilliant place.. excellent food and great decor  and atmosphere.. they have got everything right. i can't wait to go back..
throughly enjoyable experience..with wonderful company
best pho i've ever eaten.
quick service, delicious authentic food, very reasonably priced for the location. i recommend the bun and the summer rolls.
one of my favourite restaurants! it's appropriate for dates and going out with friends alike.the bar at the top floor is beautiful and the cocktails artists are spot on.go in, you won't regret it!
curry was mediocre, and the "seerloin bun" was not a bun, which was odd :)
even though the restaurant emphasise that no msg was added for the pho. but i personally think the flavour is not rich enough. but the beef is really good. full of flavour and tender.
cannot recommend enough! some of the best vietnamese food i ever had! the portions are big, so make sure to share and it gets crowded easily so get there early.
not good. don't go there
music too loud but food is delicious
one of my favourite vietnamese restaurants...lovely food, quick service and great value for money...all in the centre of london
love this place! mouth watering just at the thought of returning. very very popular- book a table! great service, worth every penny. healthy feel good food!
you know i quite enjoyed this place had a chicken curry
already a fantastic meal. the pho is especially great.
very delicous and very very nice personal. it was a greatful time to stay here
limited vegetarian options, but they are awesome. the place is lovely. lots of seating. ambience is great. had a great time.

good vietnam food with reasonable price. went with friend and had the chicken pho, which is pretty good. friendly staff and nice environment, i would recommend it if you would like to try some asia food.
friendly, attentive staff, great atmosphere, food was exceptional. prices quite reasonable for london. a must-have.

just finished eating here, the food was good i've been wanting to try pho for a long time. the restaurant is modern, but the only problem i had was when i was ready to order it look quite a while before one of them made eye contact with me
food was delicious and the staff were friendly and helpful, accomodating our large group by moving tables around. love the decor and ambience too.

this is not about the food, because we never made it in. the manager deliberately oversaw us twice to accommodate a bigger party which is unacceptable. pity, the place looked good but they apparently can choose their costumers as they see fit. we left slightly disgusted.
service was good. the food did not taste near as good as in thailand or even in new york. the place is clean and managed well.
delicious, clean, great service
small portions but good food
very tasty, fast service

overall very positive experience. despite we booked a table, we waited 40 min before getting the first available. portions are ok and the quality of food is good. prices alligned with the other restaurants in the area (chinatown). we asked for a discount for keeping waiting and the manager agreed :)
super food & great staff=  it was an amazing experience
11/10 recommend lemongrass chicken
great place. can pay by card. good food.
food good , many style .
pho tasted like pho but lacked some of the herbs. portions were pretty small.
nice ph, fresh broth, tasty chicken. service was nice and fast. good option if you are in chinatown

absolutely amazing. i loved all the food we got. service was very fast and very nice atmosphere. we arrived without a booking and got seated immediately. the best restaurant i've tried in chinatown so far.
excellent viet tapas, friendly and not too pricey
good service and best vietnamese food in london.. a place where you should stop by whenever im in london!!
delicious tasty food, great decor and friendly staff.  very cool indeed
delicious vietnam food ever! if you are around of this place and looking for a nice restaurant, try it! bon appetite!
i liked the food here. price very nice. recomended
very nice food, quick service and good price

superb vietnamese. lovely little cocktail bar two floors up to start the meal, then had a fantastic bowl of bun bo xao. the crispy spring rolls were the first spring rolls i think ive ever truly loved. well worth the visit.
pho is wonderful! a good place to have eastern food

i order pho but something inside kind rope. manager said they tie meat .. but didn't removed .. i felt so uncomfortable and also waiter.. when he served my soup i saw his finger inside my soup .. i don't recommend that restaurant. not friendly . ..
amazing cocktails! the last floor has a cute cocktail bar. the bartenders are super nice and make some slick cocktails. very wide and creative range, for all tastes.
nice food and restaurant. loved the bar at the top.

a new place we accidentally found. great service, very considerate. even the mocktails were great, bar tender explained us to detail about the ingredients used. :)food was good as well, especially the fish in bananaleafs. that was really a pleasant surprise.
very good vietnam food.
delicious vietnamese food, one of the best in central london.

best tasting pho to be had in uk at a price, probably.  felt happy to pay and smile! quick service, delicious food at prices that guarantee you'll come back soon. try to vary your timing as there can be a wait to be seated as it really gets busy evenings and weekends. adds to the atmosphere though!

perfect location, lovely ambience and interior, super sweet staff, not expensive at all and the food was! so amazing!! you don't even expect it to be that amazing! i'm never getting over the curry i had there
such a great and nice staff! loved the pho soup.
pho was too plain :( it was completely fine when i visited last time so i don't know what happened.
one of the best viet food i ever eat
exceptional food. great cocktails and lovely staff.
would definitely recommend making a reservation if you're planning to visit.
really yummy food and good service! theres also lots of gluten free and vegan options here! would definitely recommend going here

just had a great night here..amazinggg good quality food..excellent service..fabulous cocktails ..all 10!!  great atmosphere..will be back here soon..visit this when u are in london..irish girl from roscommon having fab pride weekend!!!!!
nice atmosphere. lovely food
great food at good prices. service is super quick and environment is casual, cosy and feels authentic. would definitely go back and recommend for a lunch date or quick bite if you're in the area.
never disappoints, food is awesome but you must book
rather noisy for conversation but excellent atmosphere
superb food with quick service
this is by far my favourite vietnamese restaurant ever. i love eating here. try the chicken curry, it's just amazing. there is always a bit to wait but it's absolutely worth it.
tried the new viet lounge upstairs... small plates with great cocktail selection. great food and super friendly staff. winning!
love this restaurantfantastic pho

shocking service- worst restaurant in london that i have been to. we only wanted a small meal but they refused to serve us because we did not spend 10 pounds per person. there were several empty tables at the time so there is no excuse for this. ridiculous, would not recommend to anyone.
food was fantastic. not super pricey and friendly staff members. i'm sure ill come back when im visiting london again :)
brilliant food and service. not expensive
always a brilliant dinner out. their new cocktail bar on the top floor is brilliant.
a very nice experience for my 1st time to london.the staff is so cool and the food is really delicious !decoration is very vietnameserecommand
authentic vietnamese food, good atmosphere, reasonable prices
veryyyyy tasty food, had the quail and beef and they were so fresh and delicious. portions could be a bit bigger otherwise really enjoyed. would definitely return.
amazing find in chinatown. food delicious and friendly staff

it takes me back to my time in vietnam. super authentic.  pho was beautiful. served correctly with all garnishes. portions are medium sized. if you want a larger portion you can add extra meat or noodle. will definitely add this to the regular list
good food and a nice bar at the top of the restaurant, but felt like the staff were constantly rushing us through
greta food, quick and efficient service... tasty, well priced and recommended

great staff and very tasty food. was here during lunchtime and it was fairly busy so make sure to come outside busy hours if you don't fancy loud planes. i ordered pho bo tai and it was excellent, although the portion could have been bigger.
the food is as good as the service!!
went there for lunch. lovely food. attentive and kind, if somewhat inexperienced, service, good prices. would definitively recommend!
food is incredible. first time i have had a vietnamese curry and it beat indian, thai, chinese...will be back
very fast service and tasty food. my stool was not designed for comfort though!
the food is amazing. service - excellent. the ambience quite cozy and relaxed. will definitely go again!!
must try. quality assured.
super interesting food!
great tasty food. reasonably priced and a refreshing change to the tired, run down and rude eateries that make up the rest of china town!
really good vietnamese food, good value for money for central london.
super nice food and the design i love it!
good food and streamlined service, theres never too long of a wait, even in the weekends
great place for a special night out!
oh my pho!!!
amazing food! went on a whim and had a delightful time :)
great food, the staff  arent the nicest but who cares the food was amazing. dont miss the fried rice. and the green sauce is incredible
really good service despite being super busy, very well managed and great food
love the pho soups there and not only! quick service and good quality food.
enjoyed every dish we had. well done
holy s***.  do yourself a favor and eat here.
best vietnamese food i tried in london! great variety of starters to share, and very tasty bns.
lovely lunch
the best and most authentic vietnamese food in london. fast friendly service.  if going in the evening best to call and book to save time. good priced freshly cooked food. love it!

first of all if you plan to come dine here i recommend you get there early because boy does it fill fast. the waiters are very fast and the food was pretty good, portion size was also bigger then expected and i definitely want to go back in the future.
troi oii ngon just like home.
wow! what can i say perfect place for lunch, quick and friendly service, not too many choices to confuse you. very tasty and modern!
great food. everything we ordered tasted amazing.
great place that has me going back. really fresh and tasty food, three pork bun is lovely l. very affordable for the quality and the area also.

when you walk in you already start salivating as the smells are mouthwatering! we didn't order a lot of food, but what we did have was delicious - filled with amazing flavours. unfortunately the waiter we had wasn't all that friendly, but that didn't bother us much.
foods mediocre, or below average. rice is undercooked, staff is cantonese speaking, what you would generally expect from a chinatown restaurant.

stunning, sublime and hearty vietnamese food. always great consistent quality and so delicious. the beef in betel leaf, chicken curry, grilled lemongrass chicken and beef fried rice always hits the spot.
pho is basic and good
amazing, authentic vietnamese food, lying just on the edge of china town. may not be good for vegans but meat and fish lovers will adore.
very nice food. but the way they manage tables and priority to sit down is a bit messy and stressed me out
great place for a nice dinner, pan-european menu with good wines. nice ambience for friends, family or private date night.
very tasty food. busy place so keep in mind that you might have to wait a considerable amount of time before you get seating. also food takes a while but is worth it.
always soooooo good. seafood omelette, chicken wings, spring rolls and chargrilled chicken, seafood ball are the best in the menu
first visit food amazing and services first class very helpful and amazingly polite
very authentic. great food. made me fall in love with the vietnamese cuisine!
wonderfully authentic vietnamese food at a fair price. excellent pho!
the food was extremely tasty and plenty of it. prices good for location
came here for a taste of vietnamese food was not disappointed, absolutely delicious. reasonably priced for london.
great place for delicious lunch. prices are decent and food is good!

arrived at a busy time and waited 15 minutes for a table, then ushered upstairs where we had a courteous, unhurried service from gentle and patient waitress. the beef bn was very good.  amongst the better of vietnamese restaurants in central london and good ambience.
amazing food! love going here
excellent dishes, attentive service despite being very busy. lovely thanks!
terrible, food were pre-cooked and too salty. noodle soup not vietnamese at all.
good pho and tasty cocktails. they have a separate gluten free menu which you need to ask for.
average food. hasn't got the taste of a good vietnamese, nuoc cham wrong, spring rolls wrong. nothing bad.

extremely busy and crammed but enjoyed the food.when we went there there was a major line and when we finally got your seats we were placed with other random people. the pho i had was very filling.the portions of the drinks were tiny so i had to order two, yet i was still thirsty. will try again soon.
amazing as always
good place in china town
a lot of bad restaurants around here so would recommend if you find yourself in the area and want some reasonably priced tasty food
nice dcor, nice branding, nice service, nice music but taste of food was a bit disappointing...
very delicious, nice ambiance. good prices for good foods
really good lunch!
the broth is good
the food is delicious and worth the wait. good service, not the best but good enough for a pleasant experience. a 5/5 for viet food!

modern and hip, perfect to catch up with friends over dinner with a few drinks the food was all super tasty with a good range of meats including us beef, lamb, seafoods, duck, etc. loved the pho and spring rolls - must try! servers were friendly too.
amazing food. "buns" are so well done
dont come here ! they asked us to come another 10 minutes but when we come there back they told us sorry you guys have no reservations and you need to book and sign

ok , so this place is look nice , but the food is terrible, too pricey for a starter, the noodles was over cook so is too soft and the staff is rude , like they just want you to eat quickly and paid quickly and go . my parents from vietnam and the way they do it make me feel like they disrespect my mother land .
cheap, fresh, yummy!
very good bun cha
delicious food with good pricing, and nice a nice ambiance casual enough for socializing where you can also have a conversation
smashing restaurant with great food. never had a problem with service and booking. always busy but always friendly
delicious fresh food for average prices, great atmosphere
service very fast and good vietnam noodles.  came twice.

just outstanding.  we had the vietnamese tapas.  rice paper summer rolls, lemongrass chicken, vietnamese seafood pancake, and bbq spare ribs.  everything was spot on tasty in an excellent location for people watching.

super cosy, excellent food & cocktails (may i suggest the smoked in the town?), it was just a little bit too cold on the ground floor when i came this winter :) (the door was open frequently thus a lot of wind)
second time at this china town restaurant did not disappoint! last time i had one of the phos and this time i went for the beef bun. both very yummy!
first time i chose rice and noodle menu, but the noodle without soup was not good. this time i ate these menu, rice and spring roll was perfect. don't choose cold noodle menu
brilliant! tasty food and such good value. better than anything else in china town
food tasted good (inauthentic but tasty) however portions were far too small, you'd think they were serving food for birds for the prices they charged!
amazing food !! fills the tummy without leaving you stuffed
2nd time visit.  food is tasty. staff are friendly.  venue is cool
the food was really good. so tasty. every dish was a mouthful of flavours. the decor made you feel as if you were in an authentic vietnamese restaurant in vietnam. very nice place to eat.
my favorite restaurant in london.pho is really nice and crispy spring roll is amazing as well
good pho. smaller portions than what i'm used to, but will be a good filler for a late night snack.

very interesting place in the middle of chinatown. there are several floors where you can enjoy vietnamese specialities along with non alcoholic cocktails people are pretty efficient and the food is really good.you can go there with no refraining ;)
they have some authentic vietnamese food which is cooked by a vietnamese cook. food tastes great and highly recommended
amazing cocktails, the ambience of the place feels indifferent in a good way.
lovely place! amazing autherntic vietnamese food, good friendly service and nice atmosphere. lemongrass chicken was superb!and so was my pho! highly recommend

the food is lovely. grilled lamb and lemongrass chicken were especially succulent. the waiters were extremely friendly and efficient, overall restaurant atmosphere is nice. would definitely recommend for people who enjoy asian/viet food.

beef soup was mostly water. when i asked for the bill i was told there was a minimum charge of 10 gbp to pay by card. nowhere in the restaurant did it say this. it seems like the kind of place that gets away with low quality (in food and service) because it relies largely on tourists.

this was probably my favorite meal in our two weeks in london. the staff is very service oriented and knows their menu and is quite helpful about recommending wine and cocktails.  delicious food. everything was great.

amazing place! loved the food, the environment, furniture, music, everything! staff very efficient and kind. the restaurant is split on three floor with bar at the top floor. very beautiful graffiti inside!definitely recommend (:

great vietnamese in the heart of chinatown! the pho is on the small side but delicious, reasonably priced too for london. the chicken wings also were quite tasty. the atmosphere was awesome, good to go alone or with a couple or two. ate here multiple days while i was in london.
delicious food, a few veggie options, the sea bass tasted more like tilapia! but still all very tasty food! definitely think i would go back. they were super busy and service wasn't fantastic!
the service here was amazing and the food even better. felt very welcomed and we were always tended to very promptly. loved my time in this restaurant and will go back again!
very tasty food, kind staff and good sized portions. it also has a very nice atmosphere and isn't expensive (pho are between 6.5 and 8 pounds). highly recommended.
delicious vietnamese food. there was a big line outside but that didn't matter. once you take your first bite you forget everything. very fresh food and they also have nice cocktails!
really enjoyed my experience. the food was lovely. the staff were really friendly. the decor was smart as well. will be visiting again when back in london.
amazing food and great staff. love it. the spring rolls so good i had them for pudding too. thank s!

i loved it , a friend invited me there for lunch and i'm now waiting for an opportunity to go again. very traditional always with a london twist , i love the sharing tables concept where you'll be seated in a big table with other people but of course they have separate tables as well.

really bad quality service. go in and out. they dispatch costumers. you can eat in peace. can't enjoy the food. if you go in group of 3 or more people they love you. if you are 2 or 1, you need wait out for 10 to 15 minutes until they tell you to come in winter.  in the moment than you finish they give you the bill to tell you good bye.
really good authentic vietnamese food. i would definitely come back. make sure to make a reservation.
im a ph fan and they are good at it. cozy restaurant and they keep it moving. id go back for sure.
great food and nice setting, staff were there for your every need. well worth a visit for casual dining
i've been here a few times with friend and we have always enjoyed our meal. very authentic. can get really busy with queue out the door waiting for a table. so pick your times wisely
definitely had my fix of vietnamese food for our visit in london. beautiful atmosphere and interior. we arrived at non-peak hour. service was fast and friendly. if only, i ordered something to go.

being a vegetarian!!!! food was amazing. not much choice but very tasty. they were very honest to say in which they had chicken broth/beef broth. service very good. if you like beer, dont forget to try hanoi beer!!!!
we had the tapas, we enjoyed all our dishes. my favourites were the chicken curry and crispy pork.service is very quick.
pleasantly surprised! what looks like a small place at first glance opens up to a pretty roomy, yet cozy restaurant. the food was tasty, fresh, and beautifully presented.
very good vietnamese food. we are traveling a lot. this place make us feel back to vietnam. thank you!

right down amongst the exciting and vibrant chinatown of london this is a nice friendly little place with great staff and a fantastic muni artfully prepared by their specialty chefs for your pleasure, definitely one of those places id recommend to anyone coming into the area for any duration of time, come here and try this!
great pho! a bit pricey but worth it! worth the wait :)
great pho and spring roll. and cocktails not bad.hint: bar in the second floor.
pho was just so-sosoup was hot but the noodles was not smooth and thinprefer cay tre much more
one of the best pho you can find in europe!
excellent service fast and efficient, the pho was delicious
nice food... loved the place!!
amazing!

pho and mushroom soup delicious! vietnamese pancake and fish balls were so so. overall i recommend the place, reasonable prices for this area, good and fast service. you just need to know what to order as the menu is quite lengthy.
great pho. very tasty chicken in lemongrass. definitely will get back here.
best viet restaurant in london. great bang for your buck and beats most of the restaurants nearby. i hope it doesn't get too popular cos it's a little gem.
i ordered shrimp salad. it was well presented but ok taste wise. staff were friendly
great food and atmosphere. interesting range of dishes.
always a great experience in viet food ! the best viet restaurant in london !
my new favorite vietnamise restaurant. i don't like london but i recomending this place for everyone. great foods huge selection friendly and very patient staff
lovely restaurant with not so well known cosy bar upstairs. bartender/manager makes amazing cocktail tailored to your taste!
had maybe the best pho ga i had very nice soup
fast service, pho delicious and prices very reasonable
really nice restaurant with a good welcome / service/ staff the service was quick the food is tasty and various choice various choice for the kids as well
best oho in london
terrific food. probably the best vietnamese pho and bun dishes we have ever had. came back a couple days later again. very much worth the visit.
not really a vietnamese place since it's filled with chinese people but it wasn't bad.. just not exceptional either.

this is a lovely place. we sat very comfortably in this nicely decorated vietnamese restaurant and had the best pho soup we ever had (after many, many places). absolutely delicious, cooked traditionally and without msg. the service was also great and the prices more than fair. we will definitely be back here next time we visit london.

an absolute delight to the senses. love the ambience, the viet garden cocktail, the scallop starter, the beef steak bn and the pandan and coconut cream dessert (and basically all tge rest of the menu).
great menu choice, friendly and professional staff, quick service. menu choose too big))

liked this place alot. only point to make concerns the pho broth. i was hoping it to be more flavorful. other than that it's a great haven for a break accompanied with some nice food in a busy part of the city.
not cheap, but definitely worth every penny. whatever you order, take the signature cocktail with it ;)

for me, all dishes i ordered are tasteless. this is the first restaurant in the uk i've experienced with the required minimum order (10 per person). i actually weren't hungry, but my friend was. so, i need to order one more dish.

happily got a seat on the lunar new years day. their lamb chops are a bit heavy but lovely, with a good price (9.5gbp). salad, beef soup are both nice. warm service. the staff i met are all chinese though. love the vibes. there could be a queue outside but the turnover speed is quite fast.

love this place. food offering is varied and are very good at fairly reasonable prices, especially for the west end of london.don't miss the bar on the top floor for intimate drinks with friends or loved ones. they also do good cocktails.
great kind fair staff serving superb value cuisine and interesting cocktails

the food was nice overall , location very convenient and cozy. prices are fair,.......but some a bit pricey. the beans were absolutely delicious. very tasty and crispy. delicious!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!the summer roll was not good at all. very bland in flavour and the prawn was not fresh..

for me, all dishes i ordered are tasteless. comparing with pho restaurant, i like pho more. also, this is the first restaurant in the uk i have experienced with the required minimum order. actually, i weren't hungry, just went with my friend. my friend first ordered 2 dishes but the staff asked to order more.
one of my favourite restaurants in london, great flavours at reasonable prices - i could eat here every week.
very delicious and homey vietnamese food. traditional and cheap with great portions!
great menu, but service needs to be improved. we were left waiting for a long time between courses.
really good vietnamese food. it gets very busy and the music is really loud so it's hard to hear but the food makes up for that!
you get a very good fresh cooked breakfast my take a while but hey saying that it is freshly cooked well worth the wait.
the pho was ok; noodles and broth were very average. not much flavor going on.
best pho of the world. really.
looks like  down stairs manger was very rude. foods was changed to (small portion) it was ok last year...but they don't use msg...so i 'll definitely go again someday.
great spot .. been 4 times since moving here. love it. fresh  food.. really nice staff.. inexpensive too. a must if you've a hankering for vietnamese food
great place to eat. best vietnamese ive eaten so far in central london.  nice atmosphere inside and good view if you sit by there window. can get busy and may need to wait for table. but worth it.
very busy vietnamese restaurant in chinatown. the food is above average with decent portion.
great tasting food and cocktails, very fun atmosphere and a lot better service than other restaurants in the area. would definitely recommend the lemongrass chicken.
right on the edge of china town viet food has a good selection of vietnamese dishes. great decor spread over 3 floors and very attentive staff.
great food, excellent atmosphere. the staff is a bit pushy as there is a huge demand, so when you are done, they will try to get you out. this place is not ideal for groups.
great food and service! we ordered the vietnamese pancake, beef pho, and shrimp spring rolls - everything was delicious and fresh.
the broth of the pho really tasted of nothing. which is a shame. the calamari was chewy and there were four pieces for five pounds. come on... you must be joking

5 stars to the bar upstairs and the amazing cocktails prepared. the atmosphere is so intimate and cool. the bartenders are really there to listen and to create something amazing, just for you! 4 stars for the food. the curry and soup i had were tasty, but a bit overpriced.
tasty comfort food at decent prices
they serve very delicious food and the restaurant is very busy.
food is excellent... the variety of dishes is great and the flavours in the food is amazing

amazing ! i am  a vietnamese food junky ! everywhere i go, i eat vietnamese! i was in london a couple of weeks ago with my wife and we order appetizers and main dishes and our surprise was great when we found out that my pork bum cha (vermicelli noodles) at vietfood is probably the best i tried !!! loved it
staff are friendly, the taste of beef pho is just so so and too little pieces of beef. the taste of morning glory with shrimp paste is good though.
a polished, modern take on vietnamese street-food fare, served in a bi-level, casually chic setting.
delicious pho in the heart of central london. try the cocktails too!
really good food, nice cocktails. i tried the pho and some beef that was really good
great vietnamese food, one of my favourites along with cay tre!
the broth was good but the pho was mainly rice noodles and a very few pieces of meat. i tasted good but a bit washed out, made for international guests. not a authentic vietnamese place.

a very nice restaurant, authentic, good quality food and delicious. the service is very friendly and efficient. will recommend to take several dishes on the table to share, as a portions are not big and also you'll have the chance to taste all the flavors.enjoy :)
food is very good, very tasty and the staff is very helpful with advice.
beautiful vietnamese food. fresh and delicious.
little bit food and less expensive in my opinion

food was ok. though dishes are a lot smaller than presented in the menu.seems like the restaurant tries to save on the amount of shrimps/fish/meet being served.the vegetarian soup was great.service is the biggest down side. waiter was so rude and unprofessional.

this restaurant serves us a nice vietnamese food with chopsticks which brings nostalgia our east asian culture. one of the best vietnamese food in london we can get. you need to try homemade fried prawn rice.

delicious!! we didn't have a reservation but they looked after us with no hesitation. the cocktails are amazing and the food is very tasty. would definitely recommend making a reservation if you're planning to visit. otherwise when we left there was a bit of a queue.
authentic chinese food in no-frills environment. chinese food as chinese food has to be. good service.
really nice dim sum, and not over the top pricing.  small but is a perfect place to stop for a quick bite while in london as a tourist or a dinner break.

this place has like 4 floors in total. the food is always good, range from dim sum, dinner or just a bowl of noddles for a quick meal. the service is good, it can be a bit slow when is busy. however this is the case for all restaurants in chinatown. price is considered not expensive.
great place for dim sum. it's mostly chinese families enjoying morning yum cha. staff were efficient and friendly. food was great and there were a few dim sum items i hadn't seen elsewhere.
very good dim sum and efficient service
great attentive service, friendly staff and delicious dim sum, of course. dim sum from 3.30 a dish. great value!
really decent chinese food for this part of town
great food at reasonable cost
lovely food and decent prices, not the nicest aesthetically but when the food is good it didn't matter
basic food and wont return
when you miss chinese food in londongreat timsumservice is excellent by chinatown standardgets crowded by 1230pmgood valuetaste like home
chinese mate's favourite chinese
food is good, their chillies dipped in oil is very hot.  attitudes of the hotel staff is typical of chinese restaurants, a little unfriendly.

i love wan chai corner!! decent prices, staff are ...as they should be in a chinese restaurant.... and the food is great. i recommend the beef ho fun and the belly pork in a hot pot. <3 <3 sometimes i come here for drunk food but even when i come here sober its great
great tasty food, large than it looks restaurant as over 3 floors. service ok.
nice food. service very poor.. they brought all the food together,  starters, mains and dessert
good dim sum.
expensive
i've been eating here for over 20 years always fantastic
with the help of chinese and cantonese friends i was introduced to a much more authentic dim sum experience. who knew chicken feet were so delicious!? service was fast and the food excellent value!
poor service and average food. everything was just salty.
very limited options for vegetarians hence the reason for lower rating. staff are friendly and accommodating. the food was decent though but not sure i'll come back again.
lovely food and good portion sizes. staff are friendly and welcoming.
awesome food, very busy, but worth the wait!

the roast pork and steamed rice was below par. the pork was not sweet. the sauce was just plain soy sauce and very watery. the duck was few and fatty. distincy lack of effort in the dish. however the service is quick and efficent the food is not the best.
lovely meal. friendly place
nice place and the food great
lovely dim sum. fresh and flavorful.
is damn good and original. and the scallops are very fresh. must try dishes. staffs are friendly as well.
its a nice small place, and it has a good food with great prices
visited twice. great and tasty chinese food, big portions, good value for money.
insdustrial food without any sense of taste and flavour...to be avoid at any time regardless the 4.2 on google reviews...
great dim sum.
great hong kong style food. good varied menu. eel in black bean sauce excellent.
the best dim sum in china town, it is our favorite and we always frequent this restaurant. shout out to benny who always gives us a good service and makes sure everyone else does too.
lovely duck in a very chinese environment!

my favorite dim sum place in chinatown!! for start its cheap af - and the second it's amazing flavour! always go for shrimp dumplings and all the delicious treats! make sure you go before 5pm for dim sum!

think it's better for dimsum during lunch time. had dinner there and noodle soup and vegetables were pretty good and quite big portions. but the bbq meat and squid weren't that tasty. the portions are pretty big though, ~ 10 a dish. and staff are very quick to serve
fast, cheap, decent quality. just the way chinatown dim sum should be.

like its sister restaurant, hungs on wardour street, wan chai specialises in old school cantonese cuisine. everything on the menu including dim sum is worth trying especially the prawn dumplings and roast meats. the service, for chinatown, is actually decent and friendly.
top quality each time and good portion sizes and excellent customer service.
excellent chinese go with friends every two to three months
i've had better dim sum but as far as london goes this is a pretty good place.
the food is great and arrives fast, and the service is really really nice. the staff is friendly. reasonable price.

i have been to this restaurant for the past 7 ,8 years and they always provide me the best service and the best food ever. we love this restaurants and this is the number 1 restaurant in the china town for sure!  even better than hong kong restaurant as far as i know:p

terrible old pak choi with no sauce and the green bits were cut off. stale beancurd and overcooked bad aubergine. the sizzling prawns were very few and the peking duck looked like cut up worms atrociousbibi
nice place for dim sum and food dishes.reasonably priced and friendly service.restaurant has up to 4 levels.
really good food from an extensive menu. staff are quite friendly for a restaurant in chinatown .well priced not too expensive.
i really enjoyed this place! my food was good, and the lychees were delicious! very friendly staff and nice cozy atmosphere.
food was ok, waiters and waitresses were hostile and extremely impatient. don't think i will come here again, plenty of similar restaurants down the road.

those who voted 3, 4 or 5 stars have severe brain damage. worst chinese restaurant i've tried in my life. raw bloody roasted duck. shame these rating systems work so bad. people have no perspective at all.
good food quick service

staff are friendly, speak's english,  chinese,  cantonese and others if you don't know what to order they can recommend.food are tasty. we ordered seafood dumplings and beef ho fun... devine. recommend people to come here
dim sum / cantonese restaurant , fair price good food , great value , very popular in chinatown
good cantonese restaurant

we ate dim sum and it's really good quality for a good price, plus great selection. the service is not good in any way (way too quick, brusque at one point even), but i didn't expect it to be different. very good place for lunch.
traditional and excellent dim sum place that i've been going to for ages. just perfect for lunch, with a big pot of green tea!
dim sum is good and reasonably priced
good dim sum, loved almost all dishes.
great dim sum. friendly and food was superb
nice food and got money off for being seated on the second floor, try the pork belly perfectly cooked. friendly staff. good experience overall would go back again
below average quality of food. won't return.
love this place - v. aunthentic
food and services were excellent
good traditional dim-sum, good prices, good service, can't complain
food is ok, price is ok, place is ok.
fantastic food!
cheap dim sum...average food standard

while in london don't hesitate to dinner in chinatown. britons retained the best from hong kong - chinese cuisine. particularly this place offers very delicious courses served by helpful and friendly staff. by the way, mind that dim sum is served until 5 pm
excellent dinner thank you
dim sum and beer. what's not to like?
love these cantonese-style dishes!!!
my all time favourite dim sum place in china town!
great for dim sum and dinner here! staff here are nice too!
good food frequented by chinese. always a good sign.
very good indeed.
good food good service

while visiting london i had the opportunity to enjoy lunch at this place. i had the sweet-and-sour chicken with some green tea, and it was one of my better food experiences in england.it was relatively small but comfortable, and we enjoyed a good service.

we always come to this place.the food is good and the price isreasonable .but today as we are making our order the waiter is very rude and impatient.i can understand if hes tired,but that doesnt give you reason to be rude.

i love a bit of dim sum and living in leeds we have little options on where to get it. im not convinced that this is world class but it was still very tasty.the highlight were the prawn and xhive dumplings.i would recomend this for dim sum. i cant comment to the rest of the food but the roast meats looked amazing.
extremely rude waiter swear at us and almost fight break out. avoid this place at all cost or otherwise you will be treated like a criminal. the most horrible restaurant i ever been in london.
the service was quick and the food was yummy.
really great food.
selective service, below average food. not as cheap as reviews state.others got served tea, i got nothing.others got fortune cookie, i got nothing.

nice food but service is really bad. the waitres are really rude. we ordered dim sum but they never told us there will be minimum quantity for theorder. good food but too bad the experience was reduced because of the bad service.
service is excellent. roast duck tastes really nice

i simply can't praise this place enough, mainly for dim sum. went there again twice, and again good quality, speedy service (the portly chief waiter is a full pro), great selection and competitive prices indeed. simply can't figure why some people are so critical.
very polite, great service! and the staff even helped us pack up all the unfinished food when we were paying the bill - at no extra charge for the take-away boxes and no compulsory service charge.
great food and reasonably priced. would recommend.
fast service and nice food.
extra extra successful food is very good ,price quality index is very acceptable
good dim sum

my first time to this chinese restaurant in london. their staffs are exceptionally friendly and nice unlike other typical chinese restaurants in chinatown. descent food at reasonable price. thumbs up to ken and wayne

amazing service from the staff and great authentic dim sum. i was feeling like i was back in hong kong!i highly recommend the jan jyu gai (pearl chicken) which was moist and tasty. also the shrimp fan cheung was great with plenty of shrimps! this place is definately worth another visit.

the foods are definitely authentic hong kong style and tasty. the portions are large and price is reasonable relative to the other restaurants in chinatown. the only thing could be improved is the cleaning of the floor.
great ,fast,  good portions
went for dim sum and noodles, the siu mai was a particular stand out. chunks of prawn and a great flavour. the mixed meat and seafood chow mein was better than the seafood ho fun.

the food was ok a bit expensive but the rudest waiter i have ever seen in my life, he got into an argument with another lady customer in chinese and started shouting at her and then just took the plate of food in front of her and threw it in the bin and kicked her out
very quick service the good was very very tastu plenty of space upstairs  but extremely pricey . i have been here before and i will return
overpriced food, a 9 dish is like 16 in there...
delicious food and really lovely staff and service!! takeaway options available.good quality ingredients
4 stars as was above my expectations (coming from hong kong) good yum cha, good service decent price for london but still expensive
good food with reasonable price
one of the best chinese meals i have had, friendly, good service and reasonable prices
the best little restaurant in chinatown x
top notch noodles and much much more
great dim sum restaurant
my place for a quick chinese meal. dim sums are good and so are the roasts. it also has a good range of special dishes too.
good food good price
best dumplings ever!
authentic taste, good prices, decent portions. even the service is so authentic that sometimes they may not be the nicest but they are definitely efficient. i have been going back for times.

worst chinese food i have ever tasted! questioned an item on the bill and got called stupid by a waiter which then lead to a fight breaking out in the restaurant between waiters. would leave a zero star review if possible; avoid at all costs
great food and reasonably priced!
pretty quick service, good food and reasonable portions
good service ,food okay.
great food, i recommend it for lunch. i also went once for dinner, which was a bit disappointing.
my favourite restaurant in china town.  food and service is great.  loved by my kids and grandkids.  our must go place for dim sum.

my favourite dim sum place in town!! i love wan chai corner! authentic cantonese food! try the yam dim sum, egg yolk custard bun, bifun and prawn/chive dim sum its the food that matters, manage your expectation for other things such as service, toilets, etc. though i think wan chais pretty decent in those other areas too.
far the best for dim sum - arrive early!
the best place for dim sum always visit when i'm in town. fairly priced as well. definitely worth a visit, be aware though it's always busy!
great food and service
currently the best  and cheapest  chinese  restaurant in london
great basic cantonese food. the roast pork, duck were excellent. the rep fried crab was  discovery and was very tasty. we had a great time. decoration is basic but food was excellent.

always have nice experience here. the owner and staff are friendly and always greet us when we come. my husband and i have been going here since we first met. the food is authentic and very tasty. definitely give this one a go when you're about in chinatown!
always go here for dim sum, all the old favourites, quick and efficient, although the congee seems to run out distressingly quickly!
enjoyed every mouthful of this freshly cooked dinner. would return as so good.

no doubt about service. door guy give me a nice view 4 sitting. if youre dim sum lover and like to hop around the world to try which one is the best dim sum. well! medium dim sum - great service & price. u need to try.
loved it. the food is amazing and with big portions, staff is very friendly. totally recommend this place
not a great experience, overpriced food and dodgy service. avoid this place.
so goodmust visit againchick feet is too spicy though....
nowadays we always eat here when we are in chinatown so that speaks for the food, value and service. there are 2 upper floors which are probably more relaxed than downstairs.

i have been here for many times, the experience is always good. not all of the food in the dim sum menu are good, but generally worth to try with the fair price. the manager and the waiters are quick to serve and super friendly to you. the best in chinatown!
great affordable chinese restaurant. service attentive and quick
super busy at lunchtime, you will probably have to share a table. huge selection of dim sum. our meal arrived quickly considering how busy it was. food was hot and tasty. i will be back.
really good. our go to place. decently priced, good big portions and tasty.
good food. but the waiter wasnt polite and hectic. and its expensive.

great food, we had a set seafood meal and it was one of the best chinese meals i've had in the uk. service was very quick and efficient, friendly for china town restaurants as well. definitely one of the best in the area
great dim sum, bit frantic for the waiters but they were very friendly. the food was great and some of the best i've had in london
the vegetable dumplings were excellent! overall very enjoyable meal in chinatown.
outstanding dim sum, and very fast and attentive service! just be sure you get in before 5 pm for the dim sum menu, if that's what you're looking for.
great dim sum. just good, basic dim sum, nothing fancy or fusion. there was a wait but we got in pretty fast. it has several floors and so is biggest than it appears. staff was nice and efficient.
staff were very child friendly, very courteous. very fast service. food was gorgeous. we will definitely be going back
this is the worst chinese restaurant ive ever been to. very rude staff. overly greasy food. i will never make the mistake of coming here again.
tiny portions. we ordered the fried fish in cream corn sauce and there was barely any fish..all deep fried batter. food generally lacked flavour. will not return.
great food, good price and quick service. probably the best restaurant in chinatown for price and taste.
traditional chinese restaurant, good quality for yum cha
the restaurant is a little shabby inside but the food was great and very friendly service
a very good restaurant and it gets 5 stars from me because the food was great and the service was excellent. a unique restaurant as it is set on a few floors.
good food and quick service. good value
lovely dim sum and one of the busiest restaurants in the road. one of the only ones that you have to queue for.the service is quick and enficent. food is so tasty.. but mega busy...
food here is good. the service is good. lots of options. tastes like a hong kong style cafe. would come again and again.
poor service, staff shouting at each other. setting up tables sounded like a warzone. stingy with condiments. expecting tips. food was okay, but i would definitely recommend going somewhere else.
we had good stir-fried noodles and vegetables but the roast duck wasn't up to standard. it was fatty and not so much meet.
foods was nice last time so i come to have lunch again and i and my bf have big stomach from food poisoning. i havent had anything else today. prob they used old oil or the foods was old
hung up on me 3 times when i was trying to book a table - rubbish service.
authentic, but below average food while it is very expensive and they charge a 10% service fee.

i love this place.. friendly staff. i personally feel that wan chai corner provides the best customer service for a chinese restaurant in china town..prices are reasonable and food is good.. i would highly recommend the dim sum..
great classic chinese cuisine with a varied selection of dim sums. includes the obligatory rude yet efficient chinese customer service.
quite surprised by the quality and authenticity of the domain dishes, for a place that hasn't been a dimsum restaurant. will visit again for sure.
nice and reasonably priced dimsum in the afternoon. there are quite a lot of seatings too, so we didn't have to wait for that long.
excellent chinese food
fatty food that is for hours in the kitchen, noodles overcooked, unfriendly service. never again
they serve down to earth asian cuisine - wanton soup, yang zhou fried rice, sweet and sour fish with rice, and stir fried noodles.had a great chat with the waiters and waitresses.

excellent food with authentic mandarin chinese service. frequently busy, but adds to the atmosphere and indicates the fact that it's a very popular restaurant. i would highly recommend the dim sum, hoisin duck and the delicious banana toffee dessert.

complete rip-off. rice box with roast pork takeaway cost 9.30 when everywhere else is 7. they are buying from another kitchen as they don't have the expertise.. packed with rice, and the meat isn't great. this also explains why their sauce is an unauthentic gravy and bland. don't bother imo.
absolutely amazing. dim sum was best i have every had. vermicelli singapore noodles...so tasty. unfortunately i didn't take any pictures to share. i would 100% be going back here very soon.
quick service, excellent food, friendly staff that tries to seat people as quickly as they can. if there's a wait, it's worth it!
food and service was amazing
busy chinese restaurant serving good food at reasonable prices.
i don't know what all the hype is about... poor service and bland food.

our favourite chinese restaurant that we are visiting for years. mainly going for the dim sum (served until 3pm if i'm correct) and its always delicious. friendly staff, quick service and clean environment. recommended big time.
good quality

great dumplings place in an authentic chinese restaurant (even the menus are in chinese). the service people are not the nicest, but the food is very authentic and tasty. we ordered a few types of dumplings and really enjoyed them. very affordable. booking recommended.
fast paced customer service. fast delivery on food. accurate. straightforward and nice people
good food nice atmosphere
fanatic dim sum. great value. don't be put off by the queue. it moves quickly.

excellent service all the way from booking a table until the end of the meal. very authentic chinese meals. dinner for two or large groups, no problem. set menu choices are varied and tasty and a good way to introduce the wonderful culinary experiences of chinese cuisine.
amazing chinese food. they sure know how to touch the spot...
excellent place to eat! great service and friendly staff too!
oh. my. god. sooo good. it comes in threes, so go in groups of 3 and split it, you can get a massive amount of food totally reasonably priced.
my fave dim sum place in town. went with 8 friends and had lovely meal
low quality dim sum. char siew bao, egg yolk buns, congee are disappointing. expensive, baby booster seat were filthy!. waste of money!
great food at reasonable prices. the lamb curry is exceptional.
good service and incredible food. with a large table the food kept coming with plates being replaced whenever there was space. attentive servers.
absolutely good food and dim sum. excellent waiter service. competitive and inexpensive prices.
overall a nice experience - the food was tasty, but the service could have been friendlier.
dim sum is much better than it used to be! good service from waiters and waitresses. also, it's very rare to see restaurants not charge the "stupid 10-12.5% service", good one!

easily one of the worst dim sum i've ever had...really greasy and limited vegetarian options (for my company), also, the waiter couldn't be bothered to return my 5 change...even though they charge table service on top of the bill...
the food was amazing, very tasty and cheap, with a lot of good options in the menu to choose those are completely affordable, like the pecking duck which was very good.
excellent food and pretty good service. would definitely visit again!
bit pricey. i would avoid buying side rice next time as it was 6 pounds. other than that food is great and so is service!
best dim sum i've had in the city. very polite staff willing to help. and an amazing selection of food on offer. would recommend always
it's a nice place. for two people eating it cost 76, but one of the dishes was the scallops and that alone for just two very small scallops was 10.40.

absaloutly brilliant food great with the family would recommend the bbq meats which are freshly hung near the window to show. i know its a bold statement but multiple members of my family all agreed that it was the best chinese food they have tried in china town!
nice hong kong style chinese restaurants, serving cantonese food.
good value for money.

i have been here a few times and found the food very tasty and freshly prepared as well as being reasonably priced drink menu limited but fine for the place the staff are chinese so don't expect too much but seem reasonably polite and knowledgeable it is worth a visit and see for your self very well positioned in china town
excellent dim sum, wonderful
super yummy food

excellent dim sum. very friendly service. arrive early on the weekend to avoid waiting for a table. restaurant is spread across 4 floors of the building so prepare to climb stairs to your table. the menu contains good pictures of the dim sum and order on the chinese style numbered order slip.
yummy dim sum! in the heart of china town. we arrived early for lunch; when we left there was a long queue outside of the door.

this place has 3 floors dining area. we were put to the top floor and the waiters there were all very nice. the prices were slightly higher than some chinese restaurants. we found the food has more homemade style taste.
great dim sum expensive for beer.
nice intimate dinner experience unlike the other big restaurants. dim sum was delicious and service was good
good food and well looked after, including 2 small children, for a good price.
excellent for value for money on dim sum
the food was very good. the service was extremely good and friendly. we were advised very well what to choose and what not. we will be back if brexit allows us.

this is a proper chinese food place. the peking duck set menu was perfect for the first meal staying in the area as everything you read about the expedient service is absolutely true. you will get you food and service very fast but you'll eat great. this place is a good choice.
very good food. the set meals have very generous portions. for normal eaters two set meals will be enough for four. but you can always take away what you can't finish. i recommend the lobster menu.
rude staff. dirty restaurant. walked out before i ordered any food
short wait to be seated on a saturday afternoon. siew mai was the highlight. decent salted egg yolk custard bunssweet, savory and thick filling.
fabulous the duck and pork crispy noodles to die for yummy yummy  plus the dim sum

not the best or the cheapest. we ordered 7 dim sums, 5 of them were below standard, not homemade and not very fresh. the other 2 and service are good. won't return again. fyi we are native from hong kong.
the staff was great, fast service and big portions... but the food wasn't nice. its flavour wasn't good or just tasteless . they need a better cook. it's rather xpensive too.
chinese food as you'd expect. good service. hospitable and accommodating to a large group of 7 of us with no booking. will return.
brilliant dim sum and very reasonable prices.. friendly and helpful staff.. brst place i know i'm chinatown for lunch..
the service was quick but food was tasteless and ordered a second dish which was not nice. staff rude and disinterested.  not recommend.
great experience. we thought we'd follow a family tradition on the chinese side but it was our first time alone!
really nice authentic chinese restaurant. the dim sum taste really great.
good dim sum and roast duck, my go to when im in china town.

we came in as they just opened so had to wait a bit long for the food. the waiter did warn us in advance so we didn't mind. after that the service was good and fast. the dim sum was tasty and fresh. we enjoyed every single dish ordered. would definitely come again.
one of the best restaurant in chinatown! you must try a duck here :)
probably my favourite dim sum place in china town

lived in hong kong for many years and this was a treat finding this restaurant in london, amazing dim sum, same about the huge fight outside restaurant staff were very professional and will definitely return
been eating at this place for a long time... great dim sum, noodles and chinese dishes!
always busy with a long waiting queue at the entrance it is a good sign for good food i mainly eat dim sum at wan chai corner with my family. yummy
we like this placeand go back time and again for their excellent dim sum. service is prompt, friendly and helpful, unlike many of their surly neighbours.
excellent dim sum
awesome restaurant in chinatown. i love crispy noodles with mix of meat and seafood, big plates, jasmin tea, tripe soup, crispy pork belly , etc etc., good service, very professional
stuffy. shifty staff. food came  lukewarm but the dim sum was nice. be warned - they add on 10% service charge  automatically.

walked in today looking for a quick dumpling stop and we were not disappointed! cheung fun with beef was particularly tasty. definitely would return if i am in the area! great flavours in all dishes we tried.

definitely has the best customer service in chinatown. very nice and friendly staff. authentic delicious cantonese dim sum at very reasonable price. we are regular customers and the food quality is very consistent. highly recommend

when i ate the food here, i felt back to china and felt familiar. i would like to recommend stir fried ho fun with beef to you mix 2 roast meats with steamed rice  is also greatevery staffs here are so nice

very good service. food came pretty quickly (in a good way). taste is just like hong kong. owner was also very kind to offer some roast duck sauce to take away when i requested. will definitely come back for more authentic cantonese dishes!
fantastic, authentic chinese dim sum. full of flavour. good service but expect to queue a bit. they do work hard to seat you quickly.

incredible dim sum and excellent service.  this is the best tea house in london chinatown.  didn't take too long to get a table even during busy weekend lunch hours.  food is freshly made as you order and promptly served.  would recommend!
awesome food, loads of it. fast service. really happy we ate here.
i have eaten at this restaurant on and off for 30 years and think it offers very authentic and good quality chinese food at reasonable prices. thoroughly recommend.

if you want chinese for dinner, consider somewhere else. too salty and i bet there are spoons of msg, my tongue feel numbed after the dinner. service is alright but one of the guy does not let me put my suitcase beneath the table even though this area is known to have pick pocket.

had a really yummy beef ho fun and salt and pepper shrimp. really good simple cantonese food, but fairly expensive considering the dishes weren't huge. 15.80 for the prawns, and 12 for the noodles. still yummy.
pretty authentic cantonese dim sum restaurant.  price is quite reasonable.  a very popular restaurant and most likely you have to wait for a table
great value. good range of options on the menu. delicious food.

used to always come here but today's experience was terrible. i ordered a portion of roast pork to takeaway but there was barely any meat. around 70% of the pieces were all just fat. wasted 11 on just fat. won't be coming back
been going here over 10years now and it's the only place i get dim sum from amazing
a great place for dim sum.

a disappointing experience.quick service, huge portions but that doesnt make up for the lack of flavors. the spicy aubergine hotpot barely even registered a shiver (in spice as in taste). even the rice was not up to the expectations of a chinese restaurant.

late night eatery and good to go get some chinese food after a large night out.  better equality can be had elsewhere but if you want something quick and open all good this is a good choice.  portion sizes are large and is reflected in the proce.  get the rice congee it's big enough to feed three people!
great dim sum at good value. sometimes you have to wait to get a seat but its worth it!
best chinese restaurant in whole of chinatown
delicious dim sum, would go back and order the whole menu :)
very good place with great food for a good price.

nothing special. think it's changed hands or changed it's attitude to dim sum recently. we went last weekend, there were very few items, many items shown in pics on this restaurant are no longer available (eg siao long bao). since closure of new world, we have been looking for another good dim sum place, and this is not it.
me and my friend we are 3 ordered 8 dishes(without drinks), all taste good and we paid less than 11. highly recommended!!!
best dim sum and peking duck. the service was fast and friendly.
very nice chinese restaurant in the heart of london. food was amazing and the service was good. the prices are also reasonable with respect to central london.
it was soso!! not bad!! not good!!
real chinese food. great dim sum. it's a place to go if you want to eat in a friendly environment. try it and let me know...
food was no doubt amazing ! but a lady was a little un professional. also its 10 min per person.
great atmosphere!
nice, but dead when we went
unusual pub with very wide choice of drinks
love it.will always will
fun place in the heart of london. love going here every now and then. good selection of drinks. huge place so you should be able to find a spot somewhere even if it's busy.
great place for a cheeky drink!!
never disappoints as usual
the place, very good. the staff , very very bad, i'll never come back.
incrvel
2 much people. music too loud. overpriced
special
great atmosphere for a big match. always draws a good crowd. lots of nooks and crannies to sit in. negatives: pricey drinks and zero phone reception.
awful customer service, won't be going back
food was a let down but place was really nice
great place. good ambience
veryniceirishpub,goodbeer,niceatmosphere,goodlivemusic.
food is amazing but drink is a bit high priced. good atmosphere.
great place, could have done with a few more people behind the bar but the staff were very quick to get to you. live band were good. xmas buffet took awhile to be served but was nice when it appeared

love this pub, went for work christmas lunch, was very reasonable lunch great value for what you got included, staff bit 'missing' at first to seat us and bring drinks but made up for it later. really cool decor and loads of floors and places to sit
it's quite pleasant
massive pub with a local vibe. 3 bars, big tv's (with sports) and great music.
irish theme bar lovely friendly bar maid from newtownards northern ireland,uk
love this place, doesn't look very big from the outside but is a like a rabbit warren. gets busy at weekends. had live music on, on the thursday we visited. highly recommended.
great atmosphere and authentic irish drinks and food. one of the best central london bars
great decor, friendly staff and nice environment. can get very busy so get there early. music was epic. despite the business we got served at the bar really quickly
as expected london prices but has a huge amount of character and always on the list of places to visit when in london
loads of charm.  sadly a bit dark inside but that may be ok in the long winters
guinness on tap and a friendly staff. decorum was very cool.
enormous quirky bar, good service and atmosphere. very big to be called a pub, more like a club, security etc nonetheless no stress no mess!

the place is just amazing inside, i cannot fault it and i would rate it at 5 stars if the burger which i had was at least decent. but it wasn't even that, it was tasteless and scorched on both sides the same as the pulled pork which came with it. i would definitely come back for a drink but not for food.
absolutely stunning pub!

i always loved the decor of waxy o'connor's...reminds me of church, irish pine and cave like... unfortunately...they did disappoint me this visit by hugging too many flags + even inflatable rugby balloon... i just hope " sports bar " look to go from it.
the best and the nicest irish pub in the world!!!!!
great pub with a fantastic atmosphere
im always amazed bu the layout of this place. it keeps going and going on different levels, each with its own bar. great atmosphere, especially in the days with live music.

definitely a place to see when you are visiting london. there is just something about the place - the way it stands out from the rest of the pubs, is certainly something, that makes it interesting. you should be sure to check it out, if you are going out for dinner or just checking out pubs in the city.
stopped in a few times in my recent travels to london.. great service and recommendation by the staff and an very cool atmossphere.
the best in the world
surprisingly big pub, plenty of choice of beers and ciders. usual expensive london prices
pours great guinness and it's huge, tardis-like, with 3 bars and 5 levels. staff are always great. it does get quite packed at the weekend.
place is fantastic. food is fantastic. bartender was fantastic.
great irish pub in the west end
awesome atmosphere for rugby food drinks also look for waxys little sister nearby also
really cosy place, loads of room and plenty of seats. sometimes has live music. great atmosphere.
very nice place, inside is lovely, only the service should be better
one of the best in london. cool vibe, nice music, unique interior creating the perfect mood

super fun irish pub! problemos: sometimes the music is usually too loud to have a proper conversation with a big table of people, even just afternoon/early evening. food is so so, but the selection of beers is great and deals are gucci
way cool place for an irish bar down a si de e street in the middle of the times square of london... cheap...good beer and irish whiskey and music.
feels a bit too commercialised, lots of tourists

beautiful downtown bar, feels like hobbiton.  staff is great, beers are well varied, music is good if a bit loud, so might be a good idea to have silence between musicians so wendon't have to shout all the time.
had a grand time at waxy o'connor's, music was great and so was the vibe
must try this place if you visit london. nothing like this eanywhere else
huge pub with live music.  very lively atmosphere at all times. highly recommended!
amazing experience, internal decor is incredible! love the music and live bands
lovely irish pub with great atmosphere and not too crowded on a thursday evening.
great pub , great loos, gets busy, great vibe , great interior with loads of levels well worth a stop for a pint
best pub in london
love this pub! its like a maze with lots of alcoves and levels which is nice as you arent on top of each other. great guinness too
magic place with live music and good drinks
most classical pub of central london
brilliant night!!!
the best design and guinness in a pub.
um pub lindo, comida boa!
always very busy, but expected for the location.  like a maze inside, and who doesnt love a pub with a tree inside!
it's far too dark inside. it looks like a cheap tudor film set threw up all over the venue!
pub estilo ingls com msica ao vivo e atendimento prestativo. decorao muito bacana e ambiente bastante agradvel.
excelente, principalmente pelo ambiente. uma experincia incrvel.
awesome ambience! amazing experience!
a great night and memorable experience.
great location. good drinks.
highly recommend this bar!
great atmosphere. great guinness
very nice atmosphere, lively place
beautiful place
great venue with live music but a terrible wine list.
lots of atmosphere in a big pub but music so loud you cant order a drink let alone talk.
bit too crowded
amazing place!!!
it's a beautiful place.
friendly staff. delicious beer and other drinks.
has an old dead tree entwined within the pub, plus you feel like you're in lord of the rings
nice atmosphere good food
great place. we just only had some beers. you must go if you are around.
awesome atmosphere
take a look yourself... nobody can explain how good the inside is... as in many places in london some people of the staff is not so friendly..food is toooooo expensive.. be sure you are not hungry...
love this place for a beer and a warm up for the night
wow
incredible experience with lots of small or bigger spaces inside in a multilevel bar. nice to hang out.

cool irish pub, worth checking it out for its unique interior. atmosphere is lively. i would prefer a pint where the head doesn't disappear after a few seconds though, because irish pints keep a good head. i'll give 5 stars if the pint was better. i tried the heineken.
always good but music just a bit to ..
always a favourite for a saturday night out in central london. have been going for 20 years. great atmosphere.
great place, full of lively entertainment.  will definitely revisit again!!
amazing pub with good value quality food. we will definitely be returning. plus the irish coffee is fantastic.
this place is a gem. it looks like the typical bar when looking in and when you walk in, a whole new world opens up. if you haven't been here before, please consider a visit.
waxy your always the best!

nice irish pub close to piccadilly circus. bigger than you expect from the outside. they have a nice interior.i can't comment on the food as we only had drinks with a conference event.the food looked good.
so nice pub. live music.
very good guinness. big pub. good music, but loud. good place to start a night out.

huge pub, and with all the different floors easy to even get lost in. very cool-looking place, but unfortunately on a busy night tends to be way too full and the music is extremely loud. kind of takes away all the fun. should probably try when it's a bit quieter and you can actually move around to explore all the hidden corners.
great place with a great environment.
great place! great music! great drinks! i love this place!
good place for late night boogie
live music with amazing singers. the environment is good and the decoration is different from other places. local beer and nice food to share.
good beers
great night out, fantastic venue, good selection of whiskeys i feel there's allot of history hereif you're visiting london waxys is a must
the best.
nice pub

even though its a large pub, space is very restricted when busy. staff wont let you stand anywhere near steps etc. they also woukdnt allow my 19 year old so  to stay as he wasnt 21.... better places nearby
interesting layout - lots of nooks and crannies
cool place. london prices though.
great atmosphere
noisy, rude staff, dirty toilets
one of the best irish venues in central
i love that there is a tree in the middle, the staff are very friendly and because it's so big we got a seat even on a busy friday night
good range of beers and whiskeys. food looked interesting although we were just there for a drink. most amazing interior with loads of nooks and crannies, galleries and alcoves.
great place, giant and some serious hobbit vibes. can get a bit busy as it's right in central but probably better than other nearby venues. decent beers and not terribly priced (for central)

good selection of beers and helpful, friendly staff in this pub that seems to have been a fixture in the west end for years.  liked the camden pale ale particularly.  it's deceptively large and seems to have lots of rooms and levels, but that might have been the effects of the camden pale ale....

waxy o'connor's is a very cool place. this pub is gigantic and kind of a maze. it's a nice place to go, but the heating is on way too high in this pub. the food was pretty tasty although we didn't order too much. i would definitely go back to have a few drinks.

lovely atmosphere. the musician on the night was amazing, thoroughly enjoyed the evening. some people were dancing and there was a very happy and lively vibe. just perfect.will go back for the sticky toffee pudding one day... 26/12/2019  20:00
amazing irish coffee at this pub!
this place is a tardis it goes on forever and on all different levels. great night, great music.
lively good mix of music friendly staff
decent irish pub..good for atmosphere..expect normal central london $
very nice pub, extra large with 5 different thematic bars and live music on a regulary basis.

multi floored experience. it was much larger than expected with nooks and crannies at every corner. the atmosphere was relaxed and jovial all night. the folk music was an added delight and helped to complete a good night out. prices were average for location.
the music was very good the live player was amazing and the songs he sang were very popular ones. the bartender was a really nice guys the service was quick and quality. i had a great time there
ridiculously huge and with a great atmosphere. went multiple times but you never get bored of it, easy to find a new spot.  live music was also really nice every time.
awesome pub, enormous from the inside but because of unique spacing and layering feels very warm and cozy. it was a bit of self-service for us, pricing was good and overall a good experience.
great place. eddie the bartender was an amazing person. amazing food, drinks, and people.

one of my favourite places in london. live music with amazing singers. the environment is good and the decoration is different from other places (it has a tree in the middle of the pub!). local beer and nice food to share. i really recommend it to go one friday evening, live music at 21:30 p.m
massively overrated tourist trap. waxys little sister across the road is better but even that is over crowded and expensive. the door staff and bar staff are rude. the wooden decor is nice though.
what an amazing pub! great atmosphere and space. absolutely loved it -
one of those great multi floored pubs you find in london with lots of interesting rooms and hidden bars. will definitely be coming back here.
nice service, friendly environment. exactly what you expect from a pub. the environment was unique and decoration is just perfect and unmatchable.
hidden gem, so much bigger inside and a lovely atmosphere and decoration. definitely my new central london bar to introduce tourists to!
super cool place to go for a drink! amazing scenery and a massive selection of whiskey  i went in the day time mid week and it was very quiet, will be back on a friday evening to see some live music
would be hard to find a better pub in london. something for everyone; quiet alcoves, great beer, amazing live music, mind blowing decor.
come once a year, as a group of us. always friendly staff and busy, but looked after. food nice and catering for everyone
very nice irish pub, lovely food and good service. cool interior. unfortunately soda coming from the tap not bottle :-(
great pub and wonderful decor. worth a pint just to walk around the 6 levels and 4 bars. lots to see. lose one star for the music that was too loud.
one of the best places to have a drink in the west end.  the bar staff are great. always enjoy going there

perfect guinness in london. well poured and great bartenders overall. food was decent, but i would say the atmosphere makes up for the decent food. multiple levels and i would recommend heading straight down to back bar. interior decoration is well done, music is fun and upbeat... one of the best guinness i have had in london so far.
beautiful pub very spacious. sometimes they have live music and it's really lovely. can be a little loud sometimes which i like but it's really down to preference. good food aswell.
this place is done up so beautifully, and any seat you pick you'd have a lot to look at, and there were lots of places to sit to chose from. really loved the place and the food was perfect too

loved this little maze of a bar! walked in and i really didnt expect it to be so big, multiple different levels underground with bars on all levels. drinks were all really well priced and i will degrade be visiting next time im in london
cool place. unexpected and interesting inside. easy to get a drink from friendly staff.
a magical place, good to have a good evening with friends.
great service, quick, the floor staff very polite, helpful, such a nice environment.
nice and typical irish place to have a beer with friends
