always worth a visit, huge pub but generally served quickly. nice staff and a good atmosphere.
great pub with multiple stories / bars. friendly staff and great atmosphere as well.
cavernous! great service. fantastic beer selection, probably my favorite place we stopped in london. caffrey's draft!
great pub, lovely atmosphere and exquisite decor.
atmospheric irish bar to watch sport. loved the guinness served to perfection.
super nice ambient pub. a must go!

fantastically lively pub. a great place for drinks after work, and particularly good to watch rugby. it's a maze with quite a few bars so be really clear where you're meeting your friends! i haven't tried the food but there's a good selection of beers. the guinness is always kept well.
this place is magical. this feels like the closest i have come to visiting hobbiton. i loved it. great great location

great huge place in middle of busy london. it gives a nice feeling of being transported somewhere else. the place is like a maze but bars in every corner you see do youre never far from spending your hard earned cash on some refreshing beverages. enjoy!
if you've never been in london, this is definitelly a place to go. at least for just ***one*** pint :-d . and especially from wednesday to saturday.
not as good as i remembered it but still a nice joint. bar staff were excellent, efficient and calm
ambiance is so nice and the tree inside the bar is amazing
lively venue but let down by the barman who seemed utterly clueless.
love this place, great customer service, i love the atmosphere and the celtic ambiance. must see!
brilliant place, lotz of boozy options :)
geat pub overall, staff friendly and food was good.
great big pub in central london. always full,  good fun, good music
always a good idea, great decor, needs to be seen. only down side are weekend visits.. too busy and door staff are... not always that welcoming to three or more guys visiting, but week days are fine.

this place is huge. we went during a womens world cup game. the service wasnt attentive. the food i ordered was warm not hot. i got the mushroom burger. it definitely gave me food poisoning!! have been sick for two days...
can get very crowded. slow service at times but nice environment
great location but i think some staff think that means service need not happen. especially the bottom bar.

this place is a spot we always come to when in london. my boyfriend loves it here, it's a nice atmosphere, friendly staff, very reasonably priced and ample seating. free wifi for those people who want to relax and have a drink and upload photos ready for more pictures of the sites.
large pub with many seating areas and good drink selection.
great irish bar with multiple different levels. always a great craic.
really neat irish pub in the heart of london near piccadilly square. every time i thought i found the end, lo and behold, there was another room! nice place to stop and get a pint of guinness.
great place for a quick drink and for a party with live music.
great pub! very roomy and very interesting design! recommend it 100%
it's themed and is almost like a film set in here! mainly wood with a very gothic vibe (see the pics). lots of drinks on offer so get stuck in.

cozy irish pub. warm and dark with a big tv up front for good futbal watching. good beers on tap. the bartender was hilarious (and sometimes difficult to understand with his strange accent). great place to hang before a show!
one off my favourite pubs around london. very characteristic and cosy, definitely recommended!
bar staff were very slow and unprofessional last night.  cant deal with high volume and generally, the venue is understaffed.
was back in london for 1 night and decided to stop in here. it was a great place with lots of character. my girlfriend absolutely loved it.
this spot is good! convenient rates, considerable dishes and the employees are regularly friendly.
spectacular pub. the best place to eat fish and chips
really worth a visit.  great spot ,with a welcome feelservice 1st class.lovely pint of guinness
good atmosphere and welcoming music. okay selection drinks and space for activities further inside.
too busy takes too long to get served. it's lovely inside
always a really cool and authentic atmosphere. really great music each week, especially fridays!
unique place!  love the atmosphere!  the food was great,  also.
great atmosphere, music and drinks!!!
great pub, my favourite in london, always loads of good, fun people and several bars dotted about the strangely laid-out interior.
nice place, services are good and fast but the prices are a little high
great irish pub in the heart of soho. deceivingly big as it looks small from the outside! a bit noisy for a quiet catch up but the perfect starting place for a big night out!
friendly people and staff, great music.slightly full but expected on a saturday evening at the time i was there.
very nice irish pub! good music and beer!
really cool pub! it's huge, with loads of different mini bars. very irish atmosphere.  lovely place to stop off for a guinness.
great music and great beer. we went there on a wednesday evening and it was not too busy. absolutely love the acoustic music
best irish pub in central london. amazing venue!
i know i love it as i csnt remember my night
a very modern pub. really good atmosphere although id say it was a tad too dark for my liking.
live music and always a good place to go out in central
amazingly quirky and really friendly staff, an great place for a drink with a difference
crowded but full of great people

great pub to go for a quick drink or longer stays. impressive selection of beers and spirits and good to watch sport in. it's bigger than you'd think inside and it seems to keep going! good history behind the building too, can get very busy and hot
great pub live music, great atmosphere.
great atmosphere, live music and quirky building.
good selection of drinks, friendly staff and a good atmosphere. only issue may be the volume the sound system was at for long periods.
i had a fantastic time and the singer was superb. well done
the decor of this pub is beautiful, but the food is a bit average
it's so pretty! it's a nice pub with a nice enough staff. the beer is also good. a great plave to go see sports matches with friends.
the live music acts are suburb! love getting down to waxy's!
huge place, nice music, lively ambiance. ok,  perhaps a 4.5. but nice anyway.
always a nice atmosphere, the place is beautiful!

been here a few times but disappointed to see the toilets were very unclean and full of people keying up on a saturday night. also lack of staff behind the bar meant long wait to get a drink. will give it a few years.

this irish pub is great! the location is central and it reminds me of alice and wonderland. there are so many different areas to be seated and several bars all on different floors. the food was delicious. i shall be back!
lovely place. prompt service.

spent a very enjoyable evening here, lots of different drafts available, and the way that this place is built creates several different "atmospheres" that you can choose from, if you want a bit more quiet. food is average but you come here for the suds anyway. great choice in london.
cracking irish pub in london with decent guinness, which is rare these days. great for the support too, tone of screens. great craic!
pub with a super style in london soho and it has a tree inside, super recommended!
always a great bar when in london to go to gor the vibe .
great atmosphere in there with very tastefull beers. perfect place to have a relax and chill with beer during rush a city. recommending!
great late night food. great services . affordable prices. a fresh and healthy food.
one of the most beautiful pub, you can get and a dancing time
amazing pub in centrale london. close to piccadilly ,leicester square and china town. the atomsphere is amazing. real trees inside the bar! variety of beer. wood everywhere. highly recommended!
love the quirkiness of this place, always a fabulous atmosphere. a must for anyone near leicester square

a hidden escape amongst the hustle and bustle of central london. with a whimsical ornate tree in the center of one room, waxy o'connor's has a fantasy feel about. it is much larger inside than the front door leads you to believe. highly recommend.
great as always. nice selection of beers on tap and lovely people
1st time going there and it was to see a live performance. this is in the back of the bar and outside. i liked it and would go again when some other performance comes up that i want to see!!

waxys is a great pub with a really nice vibe, the staff is always really friendly and drinks prices are in line with central london pubs. its definitelly one of those places you can take friends from out of town to for a more relaxed night out.

lovely irish pub, quite often there is live music. teh decoration is beautiful and the pub is huge. nice selection of beers and generally a great place for drinks so centrally. the only problem is that tends to be packed even on weekdays
omg you have to try the irish stew. cheap, full of flavour, melts in the mouth!! was lucky enough to be there when the irish band was on - fantastic!
really beautiful interior, and great gin&tonics!! but it is very popular, so be prepared - it will be busy and you probably won't find a free tabel if you don't have reservation. ))
really beautiful old school bar, 100% worth a visit for locals as well as tourists this is what a pub should be
i do love this bar! it's huge, it's got a great vibe and they play some cracking music.
was live music and really good atmosphere.  price are average, nice place and very big
great music and the live music is really gooddrinks arent too expensive and they have a wide selectionwould definitely recommend checking it out

a brilliant irish pub with an eclectic interior that takes you to a place far from touristy west end streets. come at 8:30pm on fridays and weekends to experience live irish music, dance and sing out loud!
...the plusses are all how it looks inside,  unique,  but there's no real ale... ignorant staff... (when l was there)... and you have to piss in a bucket.....
great place! love the irish music, cold guinness beer, brown interior and the kind staffthe atmosphere was great!
good selection of drinks, friendly staff. last time i was there there was live music. always a good experience.

from the outside the bar doesn't seem like much, but get inside and it's huge! with a bit of a labyrinth of different levels, and cosy nooks. great atmosphere, great drinks, bar staff are quick and everyone is having a good time.
huge watering hole, plenty of choice. great location for group get togethers
lively atmosphere with good live music. the drink selection is pretty god thought service was a bit slow when i visited.
great pub. great food. a nice break from the crowds in leicester square.
this place is amazing, great atmosphere, a lot of choice for food and beverages. live concert. this place is surprisingly huge and it seems like you are in hogward at first sight.
there is something special about this pub. the ambient is great, they often have a live music  and it is deffinitley one of my favourite pubs in london. a must go
a lot of stairs to go down for a drink. a bit dark inside. bar was reasonably quick. lacked atmosphere. toilets(hey) pic.
great atmosphere and impressive decor. good section of beers as well.

great irish bar that looks deceiving from outside, inside is huge with several levels and also has cosy nooks.  there was live music on and so was busy and thankfully we had booked the whole mezzanine area for our team & the food was excellent and everyone had a great time, though bar service could have been faster.

this multi level authentic pub is super fun. unfortunately they stop serving at midnight. dont take it out on the staff, it's a licensing thing. just go there and explore the many levels. too much fun!

plumb the hidden depths, it is worth the walk.  multiple levels, multiple rooms, a place for everyone.  great atmosphere!  especially in the church bar with live music (which is piped through to the other rooms).  food was good, but ordinary.
nice place, very nice staff...hello from luxembourgsee you next year

irish pub?  hahaha!  nice place to have a little explore around, though.  gets very busy and prices are (unfortunately) tourist/west end prices.  (december 2019 - a lager and a single glenmorangie was 12.)
great atmosphere, fair prices and nothing went wrong, what's not to like?
amazing place for chill out with friends, the staff is really friendly.
fabulous pub nice food worth going to see the inside interior amazing
a great place to drink a beer and listen a song with friends. it's decoration seems be a tree is fantastic.
definitely a place worth stopping by, the food is excellent and well prepared, the pricing is reasonable and it is always clean in here. highly recommended.

terrific pub with good atmosphere! it has a hole-in-the-wall vibe. watched women's world cup championship game and they set up additional screens for all the patrons. food was traditional british/irish but very good. they have many beers on tap as well as a good foreign selection.
pure irish pub, tasty beers, good vibes, amazing deco, and londonian food with 0 taste how we expected !
it's a nice worm place to spend a good night with friends and loved ones
good range of ales, nice vibe in excellent surroundings
not a bad bar but take a few pounds as it's not economy range
the kind of place on a saturday which only let's you in if you bring girls. we wanted to go (2 guys) and couldn't get in
very well decorated irish bar with a tree and old things inside. looks like a labyrinth with many corners where you can have more intimacy
one of the best pubs in london
best surprise ever ! walk deeper and deeper into this beer paradise. you have to order at the bar tho.
great service, beer and irish music... beautiful place.. i really recommend
nice hangout place with friends and catch the soccer game.

i absolutely adore this place. it is, for almost 2 years now, my favourite pub in london. the service, the food and the drinks are great, and the atmosphere is simply magical. and if you're lucky to get the irish live music...you'll fall in love
a beautiful hidden away pub - i love it!
touristy and crowded but one of the most unique bar interiors i've ever seen.
swift service and a friendly atmosphere would deffo visit again
huge pub with live music and beautiful tree decorating the main hall.
the atmosphere here is always amazing
it is hard to believe how huge this place is inside. one of the best pubs in london without a doubt.
unique place in center londonalways get my guests visiting the city in here.always getting the same such a cool pub!irish one
stylish irish pub in the heart of london. great spot to grad a drink or too, they also have a restaurant but i never tried it.
fantastic dcor, great selection of drinks and beers, gets really busy
walk straight in and down the stairs you wont be disappointed
one of the better irish theme bars
quirky, unusual and interesting with irish ambiance - just like it should be.

great atmosphere if you want to go to a place where there's a crowd of people having fun with really loud music. the live band is a special treat that you shouldn't miss out on.amazing to hang out both with friends and on your own. 10/10 would recommend
great famous pub in central, but way too busy.
lots of different nooks in this underground bar. pleasant servers. felt a bit unloved ... (seeing a cockroach on the wall as i drank, can have that effect!) ... decided to eat elsewhere as a result!
lovely pub and devoted staff!
great to place to have a guiness

one of the best places to meet with your friends. the decoration is very nice and the environment too.the price of the drinks is not cheap but it is understandable keeping in mind their location. did not give 5 starts because i couldn't find a place to seat down due to the lack of chairs.
the loacation is beautiful but the food is not. i tried a classic burger, the bacon was burned and the meat was too cooked. the location is 5 stars but the food is 2, maybe 1.
awesome pub, a lot of different spaces so it doesnt get too crowded and the music was great. really irish!
my fav bar in london!! i highly recommend it to people who like rock music!
great pub, underground with multiple rooms and bars. live music and there is a huge tree as an attraction there as well
great pub ,i  always go here on dates
heaving! great buzzing atmosphere. good barlady upstairs.

had a fantastic night at waxy's watching the 6 nations super  saturday.  amazingly crazy decor including a tree in the middle of the place.  i was one of just a couple of welshman there but the way the irish supporters treated us was fantastic, and i wanted to show my appreciation, here, for that.
dont like the west end. dont like this pub.
amazing pub! definitely one of the best places i've ever been in london.
very expensive, very busy. although it was saturday night i suppose, and it is soho, so what should i have expected? everywhere is expensive and busy on saturday night in soho.
really great !! live music and happy people.
perfect irish pub in the heart of central london. big space, great beer and whiskey selections.

unique experience of a huge tree in the middle of the bar and its deceptively huge inside. only downside is the mammoth trek into the belly of the venue makes it inconvenient for smokers. as the bulk of the bar is "below ground" there is also no natural light which may not be ideal for some.
good fun with live music
we had a lot of fun in the pub. the burguer was tasty. it is a great place to meet with friends and chat.
always taking friends visiting london in this place. very characteristic
one of my favorite pub.
such a cool pub, definitely one to pop in and check out!!!

great pub for drinks and live music. the food is average, so i dont recommend it for dinner, better places around for burguers or other options , but definitely go there for live music and have a great time.

great irish pub! if you have to go to a pub in london this is it. bar staff are great, nice variety of beers, ales, whiskey etc. be aware with the layout of the bar you may get stuck in here which is not a bad thing!
the only pity is that it closes a little early but is an amazing pub with awesome atmosphere
the best bar in london. nice atmosphere, beautiful people, live music, wide range of drinks and food. for sure i'll be back
great atmosphere, good prices, close to chinatown and theatres
characteristic pub with a tree inside.
is a fantastic place. music and board games
super great spot to watch rugby matches! slow service but good food!
good bar, nice drinks worth it of your into whiskeys
try a pot pie.  very good
a nice, maybe the best irish pub around central london.
love the pub has a nice atmosphere there! it's busy during the weekend so find space deficule although must say it's big there is 3 bars.

highly recommend if you are in the area , well worth a visit
great atmosphere, excellent staff
wonderful food and atmosphere

interesting place with a lot of nice eateries and street performers
great irish pub, you will be surprised by the size of it and its ambience, worth a visit.

i really enjoy the place with my friend's and deserve 5  and if you visit london i recommend waxy o'connor's!
brilliant, quirky place. staff were lovely.
relatively quiet downstairs area, with a wide range on tap at reasonable prices. definitely worth a visit
lovely irish pub if don't go your missing something special

subterranean irish pub in leicester square. reasonable prices though not cheap. food served, standard pub food. budget 20-30 for meals three big bars cater for all drinkers tastes in this huge maze like pub. social people. live music later in the week. someone seems to have planted a huge tree in the middle.
great atmosphere abit too dark tho
never knew about this maze of a bar but it has amazing atmosphere and great for the end of the night party!! such a typical irish bar!
lively trad irish band on sunday night's. my local when living in london and it's still up there with the best of pubs for lively nights out

the pub is located near soho in a street with many bars, it sits under an old church. with 3 bars and a large area you probably gonna feel in a tavern from harry potter. prices as reasonables, definetly worth the experience.

one of the place you must visit when coming to london. the place is a huge and very quirky. it is a church who has been transformed into a pub. they also have live music and the artists were great! the vibe is amazing. perfect for a drink after work with friends.
really nice bar with good taste of music

ingenious place, was completely surprised by the inside furnishing and uncommon room layout. very interesting setting (cathedral) with genuine irish staff. came for a pint - stayed there for the cozy atmosphere and chatty, interesting people. totally recommended!

awesome pub, unfortunately the staff at the bar ruined the experience. the woman down at the last pub hall was not bothering taking orders, was like asking her a favor. won't be coming back. shame as the pub is well nice.
traditional irish pub with s tree inside :). quite cool to show people visiting the city
nice bar, poor restaurant. this place is great for a drink, less so if looking for a meal. it is also much larger inside than you would assume from exterior.
too overcrowded, but the inside it's really cool, i love that place.

love this place, the beer is a bit pricey, but still been a nice experience.

great when they've got live music on

cool to pop in for a sec and look around but cut in finger from broken glass on seats and floor is not worth it. food was also mediocre

great location for drinks in london, shows the six nations and had a great dumb waiter upstairs which you can use to order.
nice pub. needs a better alcohol free selection.

i visit this bar purely because they serve caffreys however it's really hit or miss whether you will get a good pint of it or not which is why i haven't given 4 stars. if you are after a quick drink or two before a show then i recommend this as a venue.
stopped only for one drink on a thursday night. it has 2 floors, very busy. it's nicely decorated giving it a warm feeling.

a very nice quiet bar in a busy street with a friendly bartender. they had a lift system for the drinks so people can order from upstairs, which was pretty quirky and interesting to use.

love meeting up here with friends!

what a gem in the middle of central london! reasonably priced, nice rock playlist in the background and if you're lucky you get a good view of amusing street performers just outside the bar.

it's a large chinese cake shop (with  an anglo/french name) and they sell all manner of chinese cakes and pastries. sweet and savoury.the coconut finger thing was nice, as was the sausage bun. they have loads of different varieties and some quite unusual variations. worth a visit.

the only place in chinatown that sells kiki noodles. breads and cakes selections are really nice. the pineapple cakes are great. i have also bought  from them before and it was moist and the fillings are generous. the staff are all much friendlier than most other places in chinatown. very helpful and not rushing customers.
addicted to pandan cake! good prices and lots of treats to choose from.
their tiger rolls are beautifully made, just a bit pricey

amazing food and pastries..
good selection of foods good price

surprised by the negative reviews below. i've been to this bakery twice and have been very happy with everything---the green tea cake with red bean is so tasty that it has become my standard breakfast. the young sales person there is very polite, helpful and patient with me when i wanted to exchange the cake for another one.

really bad quality cakes, and even worse staff. they are all very rude and very unhelpful. the smallest request, such as a carrier bag, seemed liked an enormous chore and stroppy staff. will never return. avoid at all costs!! the cakes are extremely awful as well!!!!!! avoid

excellent cakes

tasty chinese patisserie different to european style.
lovely food for lovely price. for me,pensioner it's helpful.

one of my favourite restaurants quick no hassle it's like a a take out but you can sit in and eat and enjoy i suggest drink the green tea it's fantastic

an institution. fantastic food, really bargain prices. been coming here for 30+ years.

honestly, amongst the worst service you can expect at a restaurant. its the most consistent thing about the restaurant. the food is cheap but very average and really not worth the poor and very rude service.

if you have never been to wong kei, you have never been to london china town. reasonable price with free green tea(the other chinese restaurants charge 1.50) crispy belly pork is a must try, the restaurant's nickname is upstair downstair. there is a story about that. you gotta find out yourself
great portions, cheap, glib service is part of the charm
food was quite nice and service was quick. waiters however were really rude and disrespectful. between 1 & 4 o'clock is when the place has a queue out the door and it's very noisy and crowded
iconic. great food . portion n decent prices. not as rude as before.
20years i have been coming to wong key and still my favorite chinese."u here to look or u here to eat?"no point arguing about the sitting arrangements just sit and enjoy the food!
it's like being on the set of big trouble in little china. the food is fantastic, and very reasonably priced. the staff are hilarious, they stayed in character the whole time

brusque would be okay if the service was faster. the food was fine but we still managed to spend 30 on a meal for two, i feel that we could have eaten cheaper, better and friendlier elsewhere.

love the place if your hungry and like to eat chinese food then that's the place roast duck and crispy pork are the best dishes. good prices so the people that write bad reviews should not go there book yourself somewhere and pay double the price. for me it's good quality food that's cheap.
never disappoints this amazing chinese. food is always delicious, reasonably priced and speedy. the only drawback is that it is cash only. don't be put off by the appearance.

possibly the worst restaurant in london. but, it's renowned for that. treat this more as a museum for terrible customer service and it's actually the best, most authentic attraction in london. much love.

for singapore fried noodles, sweet and sour chicken - this place hits the spot. it won't hurt the pocket and tastes good! as a rule of thumb: if you see plenty of chinese people eat in a place and "slapping the food back", you know it is a winner.it is all about order quick, nyaam your food and kick out!
i love this place. food is full of flavour and excellent value. don't be surprised if you get put on a table with people you don't know.

fast service without any fuss, the food is great and is in large proportions - i couldn't finish mine & they kindly brought a takeaway box to put it in. although, bear in mind if you're going as 2-3 people, there's a high likelyhood you'll be seated on a table with strangers
very much improved on previous times. staff polite enough, service quite quick and food reasonable. even toilets clean!

i can't remember ever going to a restaurant where the staff are so rude and the service is non existent. i felt they just wanted to take the money and get rid of us. the food however is value for money

you've just had a night out in town, you're hungry, you wanna eat now, no nonsense just serve up... well you can share a table and get your food quickly. service? what service? that's why it's not added! notorious for the lack of service but that's the selling point. have to add the food wasn't bad either.
it's not that pricey. the food is fine. however, the service is not yet on point.

cheap food, tasty. be warned the staff are not there to offer you service. theyll dump you on a table, sling some tea at you, take your order and bring you food. no messing about. if you want a decent feed at a good price without pretences then this place is for you. if you want high dining and attentiveness then dont bother.

i'm giving wong kei 5 stars because the beef brisket noodle soup is always delicious and only costs 5.90 for a bowl (as of august 2019). the service is brisk, the decor is old school. love it.
good duck noodle soup. very affordable.

very decent hong kong styled wanton noodles. generous portions of the wanton & siew yoke. the dirw yoke is very tasty. noodles are tasty & springy too. all fresh. extremely good value for money. service only average but that's not importsmt in a place like this where you just come in for a quick bite & leave

nice place with awesome food. loved the crispy pork, the sweet & sour chicken, wanton noodle soup and their seafood with criapy noodles. the food takes a bit of a while ti arrive, vut it is definitely worth the wait.
rubbish staff and rubbish restaurant. the only people who likes this place are strange masochists. if you respect yourself even a little, don't visit this place, please.
fast cheap delicious food, don't expect warm service
the fried  prawns and rice the best i ever tasted
the food was very tasty, big portions and great value for money. the down side was that they could really do with cleaning up and refurbing the toilets, as they were not in a good way!!
a huge dining space in chinatown that is popular with orientals and occidentals. you might have to wait a while to be seated but the food is tasty and reasonably priced.

wong kei has been there for 30 plus years. it's as close as you'll get to authentic chinese as you may have once encountered in wan chi. three floors shared tables and load of free china tea. great food great atmosphere and great prices i love it. long may it continue
great food, amazing value, fast service ... its quite easy to consider their manner as rudeness when really they are super efficient!!!
looking for awful food combined with poor customer service? you have come to the right place. enjoy!
the food is unreal. my first time there tonight won't be my last. can't wait to go back.

relic of a bygone era in dining which i really hope doesn't get swept away by gentrification. come here for for cheap grub and plentiful portions. don't whinge about the abrupt, brisk service; that's all part of the appeal (as is the comically dated decor).oh and bring cash as they're averse to card payments.

i've been in london for ten years and wong kei is undoubtedly my favourite restaurant in london! from my university years to being pregnant, anytime wong kei is my top go-to place. i would travel from kent to wong kei just for the three-meat on rice. strongly recommend!!!!!
chinese fast foodvery good and a very reasonable price for london
average quality and quantity, but at an attractive price point!

amazing experience. the best thing about this place along with the food is the service. hilariously rude staff. come with a big group to get the best antics. no need to be overly difficult. the magic just happens on it's own. if you don't take it personally, you'll have an absolute laugh.
food good. service is basic and sparse depending which floor you are sat on. decor basic. go there if this does not worry you.
good value, decent basic food.

cheap, quick and easy food with a lot of it!! staff are ok, they are starting to make more of an effort, just depends who you get serving you and anyways you're not there for them, it's all about the food! best thing to get is crispy pork belly on cold rice, be prepared for a mountain of meat!
needed a good lunch fast, got it!
good food, reasonably priced. quick service. watch out though, it's cash only. easy to miss the sign if there are people looking at the window menu. not mentioned inside or on the table menu.
i love this place, my 4th visit was last night. king pao is the best!
superb food and great vibe
15 years and counting. best chinese food in london.
foods are okay. the service there is really awful, waiters are arrogant. definitely not going again unless the waiters change their attitude and services.

order, eat, pay, go.no faffing about.you are served with a minute of sitting down so know what you want beforehand as staff coming back to you will not be as pleasant a welcome.and their chilli oil, mmm mmmm. lovely stuff.

wong kei is the goto chinese 'fast food' palace. if your looking to come here you come for your food and you leave. cash only. staff are their to serve and serve only if you have any dietary requirements you might aswell forgot it as it'll be no help but aside it's great if your looking for a nice quick chinese meal

disgusting food, cold and probably not cooked properly. staff really rude and keeps on talking about customers in an intolerable way. complained to manager but she clearly doesn't care. do not ever eat there, you'll regret it if you do.
love the crispy pork from here
favourite place for a quick meal in chinatown. great value for money.
my favourite chinese restaurant in london. love crispy belly pork on rice.
very good quality food, fast service. not for a nice sit down, more for good food, fast service, and cheap prices
love this place. informal dining. you end up sitting at a table with other people and soon make friends. food is great. love chinese food.

terrible restaurant, food was not cook properly, very undercooked, very overpriced food for the quality, staff are very rude, i felt very racially objectified with me and my friends as we constantly was get into dirty looks from the staff
price is cheap for chinatown. but today, the rice served was very bad. felt like few days old rice.
very good food, big portions and good prices! the staff was a bit grumpy but it's fine!there are no tables for couples, all of them are at least for 5-7 people!
good food eg beancurd&green veg on rice & free tea & functional service
worst customer service ever on this planet, i wouldnt recommend anyone to go here. theyll treat your mother like a dog with no remorse with their rudeness and attitude.
classic london chinese restaurant. not many like it left!
service as usual but quick for a bite, sweet and sour chicken.
we love wong kei and frequent it often.  food is fast, fresh and cash only.  i havent had anything i don't like

fantastic as always.... took my family there ... after 20 years of going here passed the baton over to my son's who also enjoyed it.amazing value, good chinese food.... enough said....if you go please try the grilled pork chops with chilli and salt...

good food, fast service and reasonable price. the servers could come across as rude & bathrooms need work but the food is worth. beef brisket noodles with some chilli sauce is a must, heartwarming and soulful!
nearly always have the bbq pork crispy pork rice, great as always
excellent cantonese style resturant. good for value.
great value with good portions.
very tasty menu, great place.

in comparison with competitors prices are too high for the quality of food served. i would in fact expect to pay much less for this mediocre (at best) food. especially considering that service and appearance are lacking too.
nice food but they have the worst service. i am a frequent customer but im going just for the food
cheap, filling food. shared tables. we were lucky to have our own table. fast service.
really nice cantonese food. beautiful dim sums.
really good food. not long waiting time.

always great food and cheap, with quick service. as long as you don't expect service with a smile, this is a great place. its cash only, and you don't get a choice in where you sit or who you sit with as they always share tables, but for the price its great food
funny atmosphere ( service) but professional and very good food
*cash only* ok chinese food for the budget conscious diner. be prepared for rude staff (one of the things the place is known for), and a scruffy interior.
crispy pork amazing. chilli sauce v hot. be at who careful.
good food, lots of atmosphere, very quick service. we enjoyed ourselves. only takes cash which was a shock.
staff shout alot! food was ok i'm not sure if i would go back.
food tasty, lots of seats. custinwr service not too civilised
the staff have become too friendly, they used to throw people out 30 years ago. still good value cantonese food, best for groups and quick dining on ground floor for couples, students.

pls do not go! bad services! normal food! and they don't accept small changes! very bad experience ruined my day! i will not recommended anyone go to this restaurant because there are many other restaurants in the same street!

this place is a experience i was missing out on. i wouldn't say much as i would spoil it for others. although i would add, the culture and  variety within the atmosphere had been lively upon my visit.

delicious food at low prices. really love the wonton noodle soup and beef brisket noodle soup. saw others with some very large rice meals too which i will try next time. great for solo travellers (although you may need to share a table)!

the quality and blandness of the food and cleanliness of the dining area is indicative of the price. on removing my jacketing and realising it would drag on the floor when hung on the back of my chair i opted to wear it and sweat it out. but if you need to fill your belly on a budget and you want your food pronto this place is ideal.
do not go here for customer service. food excellent, service fast,  good value for the price. be prepared to share a table.
cheap and good quality - if you know what to order. need to ignore some of the rude, rural chinese who work here though. some of them are genuinely unpleasant, although others are helpful.
they were quite rude to me and my friends, and they even tried to charge us just for sitting down! absolutely ridiculous

this is my husbands favourite chinese. good food and price. not fancy dining but its always busy. service is quick and efficient. toilets aren't the cleanest but apart from that still the only place in china town that we eat
this is a restaurant i have been to for many years.the prices are very reasonable, and the food id good.the seating arrangements may not suit all, but overall a very good restaurant at the price.

the place was fantastic food straight away on the go you don't have to wait long house white wine is excellent this is the second time i've been there and i thoroughly enjoyed the food worth going to this place right into chinatown in soho

a multi-level chinese restaurant in london's chinatown. usually you share one of the numerous round tables with other diners. the food is tasty and the service is speedy, with efficiency taking priority over friendliness. hot and sour soup followed by chicken and black bean sauce is a favourite of ours

very authentic chinese restaurant that made me feel like i was back in hong kong. comes complete with ok food, rude staff, cramped walkways and table sharing with dirty cutlery.would recommend for anyone who wants the full chinese food experience.
value for money. quick meal.
good and cheap food. terrible customer service.
faster than fastfood joints, a whole lot better in food quality and equal in price. why elsewhere
the best duck noodle soup in town!

what can one say? if they are not rude, then they've lost the plot! so, cheap but absolutely exciting food and rude service is a perfect combination to get sober on a friday night! i never get disappointed with wing kei - over the past 30 years! a symbol of great chinese food in soho!

bad service and attitude, food was average to low quality. we were not allow to order 3 plates of main course when we come in a group of 4, we were forced to order 4 or more main course. what a waste of money.
famous for customers being told off by the restaurant waiters e.g. for sitting in the wrong place. fast and furious and recommended for quick, inexpensive hong kong food.
the food is always great. but the service is terrible! no chance of getting a tip.

right, so i had very low expectations of this place based on the reviews here but have to say that i was pleasantly surprised. prices are very reasonable for the location, food is tasty and authentic, portions are fairly good and service nowhere near as bad as i anticipated. make sure to try their aubergine dishes!

authentic and great taste even comparing to local asian standard! big portion and affordable, value for money serving. friendly staffs who speak various chinese languages. usually full but you can always get a seat soon as people dont stay long in the restaurant since it is crowded and packed.

it's probably more than 20 years since i was last at wong kei (back when i actually thought it was called  wonkey's ). the food is still fantastic and reasonably priced, but the staff are nowhere near as, er, "abrupt"  as they used to be. this place is great, and you should go.

food is good and tend to be oily though. portion is big. service is questionable. worth visiting if you're in london. if you've been to hong kong, then expect them to be loud. nothing fancy. just eat and go.
relatively cheap and the authentic food is  however this place does not accept card- cash only!!!!
cash only. very cheap prices, big portions and the food tasted okay. food came out really quick so its perfect if youre in a hurry and feel like a cheap eat.
food is great and price. quick turn over.

this is no posh restaurant but it is one of the greatest i've been too. free tea served soon as you sit down. orders are taken, food arrived within 5 minutes. this place is huge so can imagine how big kitchen is. food taste delicious! soup is amazing. only place i eat when i go china town! go here you will not be disappointed.
authentic chinese cuisine. the dish i had was scrambled egg, mushroom beef rice. it was very rich. decent flavor.

i discovered this restaurant 35 years ago. terrible service at the time but so good and reasonable price. just came back, much better service, and still good. if you look for a good canteen, that's the  place !! simple, cheap and good . what else?
the food is tasteless and i wouldn't accept those surroundings if i hadn't been with friends
great cheap food. superfast service. i've been going for 30 years and it never disappoints.
good food, rude staff with bad manners. i would still go back there to eat.

the food isn't gonna win a michelin star, and while i find the service endearing others may find it too gruff. but as a solo eater there is nowhere better in the area for getting well priced, very satisfying cantonese food. the noodle soups in particular are an absolute steal
love the food, nice and quick. still having a debate with the missus about whether the questionable service is actually an act

used to be charming with the rude staff, i know this is their usp, but staff on phones and chewing gum, leaning over customers to get plates and clearly ignoring some customers trying to get their attention. cheap though...
very cheap. food is filling. i can't use chopsticks.
we had to share a table. quirky... or just not enough space for everyone, it's that popular. food was ok.
great food but only food
affordable food, you have to share a table with others which is interesting. the staff are really friendly

cheap and cheerful stalwart chinese restaurant in china town. still here after many many years. i remember coming here around 35 years ago. seeing chinese people in the restaurant enjoying a meal is a good sign,  that's for sure...
cheapest eat in chinatown but do not expect high quality

cheap and easy but be prepared to be moved tables during your meal. we used to eat here a lot. the food is fine and the menu extensive. you might get put on a large group table anywhere on the three floors. it's an experience and you'l know if you like it or not very quickly!
have the crispy pork belly on rice qnd some garlic gai lan. done.

the prices have gone up but the service has gone down like, imagine low and then this is beneath it!the food is good though and that what brings me back to this place. the prices have gone up by 2 per dish recently. with this price range, i have more options around this restaurant now. conveniently located and lots of seating.
busy restaurant, that only takes cash. the food is reasonably priced. i would recommend trying this place out.
the food is good but the service is  well , one of the bazar experience the waiters are not appriciate that you come and eat.
cheap food, efficient service. staff weren't quite as famously rude as expected, which was a bit of a let-down.
great food, shocking service. apparently thats 'how they do it', but it's not right
food is not bad but unkindly and unfriendly quite rude
cheap food that tastes great
yun tuns skin is too thick. 4 stars for duck noodle, tasty and with amazing price only 5.9
totally agree with other reviews, great food, professionally rude staff. cash only, are you looking at this hmrc?
good food great price

i would say that the food is not good, even the service is not good, the staff is not smiling and polite at all. this is the most terrible meal i had in london, definitely not a good experience. would not recommend others to visit this restaurant.

horrible place very rude staff roast duck and  char siew served cold  steamed fish we waited 30 minutes and taste awful vegetables too oily and tastes disgusting  price is reasonable for budget conscious but will not recommend this place

my go to place for chinese food in london. this is a place i can go to for every meal. conveniently located in chinatown next to leicester square underground. reasonably priced, extremely fast (though curt) service and food appear almost magically right after you order.
if you like food and don't care about service this is the place for you. food is great, but to traditional westerners the service may seem lacking
reliable quality and quick service . prices good too.
delicious hong kong style cuisine
a good solid chinese restaurant, not amazing, mearly quite good
best roast duck and crispy pork noodle soup without exception, and at a reasonable price.
cheap no frills chinese food. love it
average food, below average service but very reasonable prices.  good for a quick meal

i m not a picky eater and usually eat everything but this was just awful. i ordered very basic wonton needle soup, very hard  to go wrong but it did. we were starving but left them untouched paid our bill and told the manager who didnt give it any thought. go else where.

i don't come here for fancy service. i come here for cheap canto food that does it's job of filling me up. the portions are a good size and the menu has a nice range. i've probably eaten at wong kei the most in chinatown as it's just so straight forward and quick to get a table. make sure you bring cash though!
but just remember staff are a bit rude, but they make up for it with the food!

great-tasting food at a reasonable price. this chinese restaurant offers an extensive menu and a quirky, no-frills, communal dining experience. located at the edge of london's chinatown and a few minutes from leicester square, this restaurant is a longtime favourite of londoners and regular visitors alike.
12 noon on a sunday and not too busy. lunch for 2. delicious beef brisket on rice, aubergine in black bean sauce, extra rice, 1 fanta and chinese tea 25

very good food, fast service, and reasonably priced. make sure that your expectations are set though, before going here. you come here for the food, and the bare minimal level of customer service. oh, and they only accept cash. highly recommended dish: braised beef brisket. absolutely superb.
great authentic chinese food.  communal dining at large circular tables.  excellent value for money
casual canteen seating, great authentic food. cash only
favorite restaurant in china town. cheap, quick service, delicious food. been going here since ive been in the womb.
if anything, the food here is great. it would be best to go for the food rather than a "friendly" conversation with one of the workers. let's say it won't go well if you chat with them...
food good, staff not so much.
classic chinese customer service, quick and good food, plenty of asian customer, which it's always a good sign.
never changes, cash only, free green tea and refills, does seem more expensive these days though
great food, unbeatable prices and no nonsense service. the best restaurant in china town
average, in czech reublic we have better chinese meal... and we dont have china town
not nice staff to say the least.cheap but not good.my suggestion is choose any other or simply select dishes you really know or extremely simple to cook
now a china town classic. top tip..more free tea? take lid if the pot. remember cash only
the food was delicious. i would give 5 stars but the customer service was very bad.
reliable, cheap fare. used to be incredibly rude - which was part of the deal - but for some reason have become strangely polite
an institution in london.    been going for years.   food is the best chinese in london.   upstairs downstairs!   a really great experience with a group.    fast efficient and not expensive.
cheapest food in chinatown, greasy not service and dirty. not recommend
legendary eatery, just don't use the loo's.
cheap and authentic, rough and ready eating house. staff not as rude as before, but that was part of the character! know what you're in for and this place his the spot.
food is very good but it's like a school canteen inside

they seem to have been here for years. the seats downstairs and at ground level are very "school like". the first floor is a bit smarter. if you want straight forward chinese then this is a place to go. it's not fine dining though. they only take cash so be warned. a meal plus a bottle of wine came in at 90.
cheap and cheerful , same for me since my first visit at christmas eve 1969! one star less for loss of entertainment value when you routinely got verbally abused... alas, those days are gone.
lovely fish ball noodle soup served within 5 minutes for 5.90 superb. poor decor.
the staff were very rude! and the food was terrible with a few hairs in it. i will never recomend to any one!!
if you are from eastern, it is really tasty and good price. this is sweet and sour pork and yunnan stew noodle. both of them cost about 8.
the food is very nice, but some of the staff are not very friendly
legendary for good value & bad service...

everything i've read about this place is true. they will put you on a sharing table. instant friends. they'll also change table covers while you're eating so be prepared as you may have to lift your bowl and plates as they do this.
very fast and food very good value
cheap and relatively tasty. good for a quick and fast eat but nit much more. greasy and lacking on quality but wont kill you either so decent overall
authentic and fast!!! it was worth a visit!

absolute hidden gem in chinatown. in a area not short of choice but this is one of the best spots to eat. won ton soup is my favourite and the duck pancakes. dont expect fine dining service but expect delicious food and an efficient service.
certain dish taste good like the roast duck with pancake, certain not...massive price hike trough the years, some ingredients has been westernized after the mighty old manager left...

the food and great and tasty and the tables and plates+utensils are also clean however the service is hilariously funny the waiters dont smile and they look like theyre dead inside . also you cant pay by card either of they would allow that they would definitely get more customers. would still suggest going for a good meal.
still the best value for money and taste in chinatown
excellent. full of character and characters. i have been coming here for nearly 25 years. here's to 25 more.

absolutely awful.  the place is renowned for being rude to customers, but tonights experience was worse than awful.  the useless waitress didnt even know whether their food had sugar in it. so they kicked us out!  avoid!
cheap and cheerful. good food and excellent service.
we loved our food here! so yummy! we had two children with us. the only thing i'd say is that the don't have highchairs.... but we managed! fast service and helpful staff! would go back.
some dishes are ok, some are terrible.it's very cheap indeed
great food- not as rude as they were 35 years ago  but still fun - try asking for a quiet table for 2!!!
absolutely appreciate this restaurant. value second to none.
a really nice environment with delicious food. the chicken and pork were particularly special!
great food, cocktails and decor. pleasingly small.
very good food, nice tea,  and great service.
has great sentimental value, would gladly go here again. staff were lovely and food was stellar. will become one of my restaurant staples. the decor was spot on for 1930s taipei.

i wanted to like this place but the food was appallingly salty - as if the chef added salt thrice. the food was otherwise quite flavourful, albeit small. like what others have said here, the service wasnt great but i dont really mind because i was there for the food, but it was kind of a let down. :(( i wont rush to go back.
what an extraordinary restaurant. every dish is amazing. seating can be a bit cramped but i am more than happy to put up with that for this food.

i like the interior, the presentation, the service. but the food is hard to say: there is very little that is taiwanese or even chinese about the food. unless you look at the chopsticks and some of the plates. for experimental cuisine, i'd rate it very good but not quite excellent.
great food well presented
food is intolerable. would never go again.
delicious and creative with a nostalgic ambiance and '20s music
great food, service, ambience, decor. just a cut above any other asian ive been to in london. feels a bit like a taiwanese gymkhana.
good food but the quality of service is not good.

started by people behind bao. i was here on the first day they opened. i was here again the first day they started their tea ceremony. i've had many taiwanese meal, nothing came close to xu when it comes to the quality and inventiveness. highly highly recommended!
seriously good food, everything is good but l would definitely recommend the eel!
great food and a great atmosphere. i'd highly recommend they're specialities very tasty and just the right amount so you don't overheat.
not authentic, very small portion sizes, overpriced :(
excellent menu, lots of dishes are not to miss. egg drop crab is perfectly balanced, taro dumplings and cuttlefish and prawn toast are perfect - don't miss out on the numbing tendon either!
great food, stylish decor 5 star service at a very good price. best value for money in a long time.
great vibe n excellent food
atmosphere, service and food just great! a bit pricy, but worth it
outstanding restaurant specialising in taiwanese food. the food is outstanding, service great and the interior very stylish. booking is essential!
expensive not really taiwanese food
my new favourite in london. excellent starters. love the ambiance. service 6/10

silly place. cool decor but the food is so expensive for what it is and is 98% salt. save some money and just pop next to door to chinatown and get better food for a lot less. this place is stuck between hipster-over indulgence and authentic asia. does both pretty poorly.
art deco interiors and interestingly good food. service should have been much better.
stylish, mannered and welcoming
expensive and boring
delicious. really tasty and innovative taiwanese food.

super disappointed. had been wanting to try this for ages. everything was far too salty. only thing i liked were the cocktails. but they were tiny. far too expensive for what was served. i would recommend bao. not xu. parents ended up refusing to eat the food so we went to chinatown afterwards
fantastic food and venue, only slightly let down by the abrupt and some what unwelcoming service. would have been a 5.
very good... definitely coming back.
amazing food, friendly staffs, also really lovely decoration that goes really well with the atmosphere of the restaurant aim to bring out.
incredible food. a bit pricier and more refined than your normal chinatown place but definitely worth it!
nice ambiance, quality interior decor. however, the food is overrated.

concept is cool to modernize traditional taiwanese style dishes and drink like taiwan high mountain tea infused gin to make cocktail.while food is bit too greasy with too strong flavor, the steam rice is too soft and sticky ahrd to taste the txture
nice restaurant, good service, ok food but quite overpriced
excellent food and service. well recommended

original in many ways, interesting and sufficiently diverse menu, excellent knowledgeable and attentive staff although it takes a long time until food gets served. cocktails and drinks selection ok but not great value for money or otherwise exceptional.
lovely ambience, excellent service. we ordered a variety of dishes but the highlights were the chicken main dish, vermicelli side dish, and the cold brew house tea which was exquisite!!
cozy space and everything we ordered was delicious!
good food, great interior. i love most of the starters and the mapo tofu was simply amazing..

taiwanese fusion, but tasted more like chinese fusion. i'd suggest adding more chinese waiters to add to the atmosphere. does seem a bit whitewashed for a taiwanese place. the tomato eel was small in portion with lots of vinegar, and chilli oil. the signature pork is pretty good, as well as the onion rice.
really happy with the food here, the ambience is lovely, with a 30s oriental vibe. the lardo lard rice is amazing and a must try, so is the egg drop crab.
wow!  this place is to die for!  the tea selection, all the dishes and a cool atmosphere
very tasteful taiwanese food and friendly staff. cozy atmosphere.

absolutely delicious food, different from the fare on offer in other restaurants in the area and each dish perfectly balanced and presented. add to this the beautiful interiors...a new london favourite!
three stars for the food and four stars for the venue and presentation. the cheese and leek pancake was good.
simply superb high end chinese / taiwanese... adored it, not cheap though...
amazing food and great service.

really beautiful interior, friendly staff and good food and drink.my only problem was, as another reviewer noted, the vegetarian/vegan options were limited and didnt add up to a feeling of having had a whole meal.
fancy taiwanese food i'm not sure if they are original since i never been to taiwan province but the environment was pleasent. and food are ok.
amazing find
the best chinese restaurant i've ever been to. a little expebssive, but the experience is worth evey penny.
stunningly good tea, friendly staff, great atmosphere
surprisingly average. lovely surroundings but have had better for less.
such a great place. food was amazing - from starters (prawn) to desserts (sponge). definite recommendation.
one of the most interesting restaurants i have been to. unique food in a unique environment which you don't often find in london any more
nice food but disappointing.

this is a really original venue and certainly feels unique. a gentle ambiance makes one feels we had stepped into a 1920s chinese tea house. the staff were good at guiding us through the menu. the food was delicate, delicious and well presented. definitely worth it for understated style and food.
tasty food, nice decor - went twice and there were both super positive experiences.

popped in for some drinks and dumplings. their taro dumplings (particularly the taiwanese sausage one) are out of this world. the bone marrow pancakes were also great, and the cocktails surprisingly tasty.
unimpressive, overrated, forgettable and wildly overpriced.

food was great but the potion was small. a nice interior and the food was presented nicely. the service can be improved : it took about 10-15mins to serve a cocktail (each time, we had to remind the waiter) and one of the waiters was not friendly. i wouldn't rush to go back,..

one of my favourite places in london right now. great value,  great service. the ma po tofu is a game changer.  also the xu reisling is an excellent wine. the staff are super knowledgeable and will help you through the menu easily. the lunch rice bowls are especially good value and the 39 set menu will leave you stuffed.
one of the best meals we've had in a long time. the set menu is fantastic value at 40 and offers you a generous selection of food. highly recommended.

reserve in advance or try a walk-in. the restaurant is beautiful inside with a luxurious feel. food can be a little spicy so be sure to put forth any concerns to your waiter. lastly dont start your meal without trying the cocktails.
foood was great, service was terrible.

delicious food and lovely service. not the cheapest but not expensive enough to ruin the meal. their recommendations were spot on too. the wine was really good but about 10 pounds too much. that's why i'm not giving it 5 stars.
great staff but food needs a update
lovely tea based cocktails! there's nowherr else liks this in london
recommend the tasting menu!
a second visit proved to be just as wonderful as the first. ingenious food and cocktails leave you more than satisfied in wonderful mid-century surroundings.
what a wonderful place. the food, the ambience and the staff, even the drinks. highly recommended.
really very good. had the dumpling tasting menu and some red date tea. what i had was very tasty. only thing left me thinking was for what they charge, i hope they get a star soon.
nice vibe .great service .good food
lovely decor - creates the classic taiwanese teahouse. had the suckling pig for two, the quail, the sweet potato dumplings - all delicious. lovely tea as well.
such authentic and tasty taiwanese food! love the old world charm of the interiors. vegetarian options are great too!
absolutely loved everything we ate here. the lunch menu is extremely well priced and very generous with what you get. just thinking of this meal, makes me salivate.

food was incredible, service was exceptional and the small cosy restaurant was the perfect setting for saturday evening out with friends. i would recommend the restaurant to anyone! we will visit again soon

would recommend this place to anyone. stunningly good food served in a luxurious restaurant. left feeling full, having tried new flavours and with a commitment to return. i quite liked it, can you tell?

great decor, the food was good although i felt the sea bass was a little bland. on the whole we felt that the dishes were too small for the price they were. favourite dishes were the crab with deep fried bao, tofu and mushroom rice. for starters i loved the cuttlefish toast.
we opted for the pre-theatre menu and were very disappointed in the tiny portions, oily food, and generally obnoxious service...avoid!
fantastic. delicious. great tea. expensive but worth it. upstairs is more beautiful. service great!
a really great experience, the first time i had ever had taiwanese food, and it was worth it for the price!
excellent food, drinks and service. we will definitely be going back
good food but overpriced
incredible food, cocktails and teas.
ma lai cake is quiet good. the rests, like char siu and mapo tofu,are not rly yummy even it is not called taiwanese flavorplease come visit asia for chef tour/training trip .

yummy, original taiwanese food in a lovely setting. i've been here twice and have enjoyed it both times. serving sizes are on the smaller side, but everything is really tasty. decor has a cool 1920s vibe to it, as do the sever uniforms. i'm sure i'll be back again.
everything was great except the food.
lovely looking amd nice staff but pricey and the set meal high tea has too little savoury food and too much desert to be a suitable lunch
wonderful tea room, lovely teas, good for a quiet drink while out in central london
intimate and well formed, this place serves up a great tea ceremony with a mix of savory and sweet dim sums. ask your waiter/waitress for tea recommendations.

i decided to try this place due to really good reviews. the decor was lovely and i really liked the theme of the restaurant. the food was a complete let down. was extremely salty and the portions were tiny. not worth the amount they are charging. i won't be coming back here.
amazing service, food and drinks! can't recommend enough.

a very fine dining experience. beautiful decor upstairs; art deco stream train themed. the cocktails were exquisite and the food immense! highly recommend the shou pa chicken, beef shortrib pancakes and the cuttlefish toast, though can imagine everything on the menu is divine.

timeless atmosphere. it feels like you are in a 1920's train crossing china. staff was very attentive and respectful. the food felt both authentic and high standard and everything was delicious. there are also single tables for solo diners which are very cute.

had the traditional tea ceremony. they do it for you the first round of tea and then you get to have a go which is fun. lovely selection of savoury and sweet, which wasnt too sweet. would definitely recommend if you find traditional afternoon tea too much
only reason for three stars ... lengthy.. felt like an hour between each course. food was nice.
amazing food, and very stylish modern decor, staff are wonderful 5 stars!!!!
delicious. really recommend this place original combinations.

everything here is delicious. come here and eat everything! what they do to scallops here, wow! the onion lard rice changed everything i thought i knew about rice as an accompaniment. this place is pricey but worth it. there isn't a better restaurant experience in london.

amazing food. some flavours i've never had before. i  can recommend the chicken and crab mains - both delicious. more fine dining than traditional taiwanese. only minor issue was the waiting for a table even though we had booked.
brilliant tasting menu
good food, service only ok, very tasty but pretty overpriced. good.
really weirdly intensely flavoured, tiny baby portion sized versions of chinese classics. defo go if someone else is paying

we werent that impressed with the food. our table was hidden away in the mahjong room which we werent too pleased with. very expensive for what it is, and we were definitely expecting more from this place.

we enjoyed every plate we tasted and there are not many places you can say that about. impeccable service, great interiors, delicious food and superb cocktails. perfect for a treat dinner as it's quite pricey!
great food, fantastic interior and the staff are amazing.  i'm always happy to spend an evening feasting here

absolutely delicious. the food was wonderful, the cocktails spot on, and the atmosphere is great - buzzy but not too loud and beautifully designed. somewhat pricey but not unusually so given the quality of everything.

i have mixed feelings about xu. love the interior design. excellent service. good cocktails. the food was elegant and refined, but it wasn't really taiwanese. maybe "inspired by taiwanese" would be more appropriate...
hard to believe that kale and tofu can taste so good. the steamed egg with truffle is also sublime. delightful ambience too.

visited xu in the afternoon and tried the afternoon menu. very impressed beautiful restaurant, friendly staff and great food especially the suckling pig. the tea was also very special and worth trying. overall i would recommend xu, it is on the more expensive side bet well worth it.

good food if a little expensive, but great service and lovely ambiance in the top floor room. we weren't convinced by the glazed sweet and sour aubergine, but all other dishes (the various types of small wraps/dumplings and particularly the pork) were great.
- good environment, really nice food!- ideally book online before going
london's take on taiwanese food. all the dishes we've tried are rich and flavoursome. they have their tea bar headed by their inhouse expert! the cold brewed tea is really fantastic and a must try.
complete let down, the pork was fatty and extremely salty, the portions tiny and the service slow. the location and interior was great but that is about it.

refined cuisine with a touch of glamour. decor harkens back to a bygone taiwanese era which i rate highly. teapots and teas were very fussy however and the table we were sat at was almost too small and crowded. would come back to visit the top floor if price was a little bit more reasonable for the portion sizes.

i had hopes this restaurant would impress. i gave it a second chance but unfortunately the food was the same as the first visit - bland. service was neither warm nor unpleasant. was quite disappointed walking out of there on both occasions.
very good authentic cuisine
brings me back to the memory lane of childhood street food. yum
classy and tasty but a little overpriced
amazing char siu pork and decadent interior reminiscent of colonial era taipei. interesting tea selection coming from medicine drawer counters
the decor is breathtaking and the food is some really interesting adaptions on some classic chinese dishes. they are delicious
food was very good but the portions were tiny and the service needs some improvement. also we were overcharged on the bill for an item we didnt order.
good food. different dishes and tastes.. but felt a little too pricey
we had an excellent dinner at xu. every plate was beautifully presented and came with an explosion of well balanced flavours. friendly but especially genuine service.we will definitely be back!
delicious taiwanese food. interesting cocktail list as well, abs a nice atmosphere. the tables upstairs next to the window are lovely.
fantastic food and service couldn't fault it at all
excellent service. our  server was very kind and was happy to recommend and help us with our queries food was lovely. loved the gyoza. highly recommend.

literally amazing!! the bao team have outdone themselves! the decor is luxurious. the menu options are unique and delicious! the beef dish is heavenly. and ... its all reasonably priced for the quality! get a booking here immediately!!
great place. felt very cool and classy.

nice taiwanese fusion restaurant with a good decor. entree and small dishes are good but very small for the value. the main dishes are good in flavour and presentation but also probably not good food for value. however would be a good place to try.
great food, - garlic steamed cockles to die for!!! very good service (with the exception of the main host) but very small tables and uncomfortable seating.
i literally had to puke after having dinner. me and my wife went there and ordered the fixed menu. everything was fried and truly disgusting

delicious and inventive taiwanese cuisine. yummy small plates and great cocktails. love the idea of whiskey and tea pairings! they recently started serving the tea time menu and it's absolutely superb - lots of small plates/dishes to try. the mini tea ceremony is also really fun. highly recommend the tea!
service was good, could be improved, however food was on point! my favourite is the chilli egg drop crab!
amazing food and excellent, cozy environment!

delicious food in a very nice setting. the restaurant has good service and has comfy booth seats. upstairs has a nicer ambience, so ask for a table upstairs. the starters were very tasty and the main just the right size. overall great food that is different from the usual, and every dish has it's own distinct flavour.
this is so good. i recommend the chicken house special and the taro dim sum. also the tea tasing menu was lovely

fantastic restaurant, small tapas-like dishes with new and exciting flavours, good selection of drinks and wines. helpful and friendly staff. this is certainly a must-visit if you find yourself in the area.
it's a good place for people who prefer flavour over taste of ingredient. they cook meat in a distinctive way, juicy and tender. overall think it's overpriced for the portion of food.
some of the dishes contains flavours that are surprisingly true to taiwanese flavour. but some of the fusion dishes can taste weird.
amazing experience. great pre theater menu with a twist.
great decour, innovative and interesting food.

food is excellent - dishes prepared with great care, are unique and delicious. interior is very well done - like stepping into a taiwanese tea house. service although friendly was disorganised and slow. if they can sort this out i would love to go back.
this place is absolutely beautiful. tea and food delicious. well worth the visit.

so unusual and so good. this restaurant has such a comforting lush oriental class. you feel like you've been transported across the globe to another country and i guess that's the idea. food and drinks were both superb. staff could be friendlier and some of them would be more suited working in a gp surgery.
great place, very professional and friendly staff who made our experience feel extra special. food was so tasty and interesting. thanks again.
fantastic, authentic taiwanese food. the set menu is a good offer, highly recommend the chickens and crab mains.

it's all about the ambiance i am afraid. the restaurant space is pretty small. the food is way too greasy than it should be and i dont quite agree that these are typical taiwanese food. most of the dishes have confusing names and are not taiwanese recopies.
great interior design. excellent food. you feel as if youve time travelled to taiwan in 30s.
good place, nice modern take on taiwanese food but found everything a bit salty. authentic flavours and good service
almost all of the dishes that came out were exceptional, the mocktails too.
highly recommend the shoupa chicken and the caviar toast. the  lord rice was so authentic that take me back home from the first taste. didnt find the dumpling or xianbing too attractive though.
the dumplings were fantastic - great variety of choice and the teas were very good. love the atmosphere - reminds me of old hong kong style

went there a while ago but loved everything!!! really nice take on taiwanese cuisine and super happy to have a nice taiwanese restaurant in london. will definitely return whenever i miss home. booking highly recommend.
very very tasty and special chinese dishes. only downside was that after being at the gym before coming, i left a bit hungry... we had the tasting menu which was excellent.

had a really nice afternoon tea here! love the tea and the sweets, especially the pineapple cakes, but the savouries can be improved (lack a little in its flavour). overall a very unique experience, with great service and not too pricey.
good food and nice atmosphere
consistently amazing food and service!
nice atmosphere and service, but not the place for authentic taiwanese food. dumplings and sticky rice were tasty and hot, but the rest of the food arrived cold.
so crowded. the restaurant crammed way too many people into such a small place. the food is okay but does not justify the high price.

fantastic place with great flavours and gentle ambience. ordered the crab (singapore style), cuttle fish toast, chicken char sui and pork puffs. everything was amazing with each dish better than the last.
the flavours of taiwan, from teas to full meals, served in a wood panelled take on 1930s taipei.

had never tried taiwanese food before coming here, i'm very glad i came, you're doing your culture proud by serving food that good. very impressed overall. good service, friendly staff and a warm and welcoming atmosphere.
the chat sui is a must try!

great decor, amazing taiwanese food, and tea.on a pricey side. an evening for two with no alcohol for almost 100. you can get a 3-course menu in a michelin star place for that. i'd recommend revising the prices.
excellent. good service, creative delicious food and wonderful teas and drinks.

very innovative and tasty food and good service. set lunch is very good value. the restaurant is small so i would advise to book. we did not and ended up at a table by the door, which is somewhat exposed to the elements every time the door opens.
very nice place, good service and great food. try the smoked tea duck, best thing ever!
excellent service, a staff very friendly, the food was really good!
very bad food and service. i had a stomach ache after i ate there.
really nice looking place and good service but hugely overpriced. tiny portions that did not taste great.
the service in this place is incredible. super friendly staff, very attentive, and very helpful when describing the menu. if you go here, get the iberico pork for main course! it is incredible!
amazing food great atmosphere

while rather pricey, this traditional tea house offers a unique experience. the food is delicious, skillfully prepared, and well presented. the service is also excellent. overall very satisfied with the experience. would definitely meet here with friends from london or visiting next time i get a chance.
fabulous place with great food! the waiter was extremely good and took his time to explain the food and wine. top notch!
wonderful experience! delicious food, great recommendations from the stuff, amazing decoration and atmosphere. we had a lovely evening here! try their cocktails, unusual and full of flavour.

a very pretentious restaurant one should avoid unless you want to feel unsatisfied and unhappy at the end of the meal. yep, this place do that to you. neither chinese nor taiwanese, not for people who have real class tastebuds. their xian bing is so awful, and wasn't cooked through properly...
great food. pricey with small portions though.

attentive service. delectable cocktails. engaging atmosphere. sumptuous presentation. but most importantly... top class taiwanese food, vivid flavours that are beautifully presentedl, perfectly timed, and gleefully unafraid to serve signature dishes laced liberally with chicken and pork fat.

a fascinating place to eat! with it's old colonial style decor and brilliant service xu offers great food which will keep you coming back for more. we had the pre-theatre veggie set menu and it was morish, speedy and very tasty. their tea and drink selection was great and i would recommend to anyone in the area.

wow. what a pleasure. definitely the place to go for a nice lunch or dinner. makes you feel like you in a french little city restaurant with authentic well delivered taiwanese cuisine. definitely on my list of favorite restaurants.
the food is ok. but very very slow. also very expensive compare to the quality and quantity.

every single dish we tried was very good and special. the cocktails were also divine. i also loved the classy decor reminiscent of the 1920s. the staff was polite and attentive. i would highly recommend!
probably one of the best taiwanese in london, gin made drinks are very good too

steamed egg was not hot enough but tasted good. lard rice is good but too much juice to make it too greasy. others are not bad! the environment is great and comfortable. im  a taiwanese. the char siu pork is a little bit salty and fatty!

good atmosphere. good sound insulation good toilet good service. but the food was not good. especially at the price point with small portions, not at all recommendable. with all the nearby options, not a place to go to enjoy food.
