vegetarian options are quite average to be honest. a forgettable meal. they also forgot that it was my partners birthday. service could be improved in terms of attentiveness. the decor, branding and overall vibe is very cool.
the atmosphere is 5 star. however as taiwanese food, its toooooo modern and loses the original flavor. not a good choice if you really want to try taiwanese style:/

great food. there were three of us and we ate the try menu. the food exquisite and the red wine was especially good from the drink menu. we will come back. nice atmosphere, cozy and good customer services
best food, super nice staff, constantly fantastic atmosphere. they charge reasonable pricing and the food quality is awesome. keep up the good work.
very nice food and great staff. our server simona was amazing!! we had a great start of the new year!!

the atmosphere in this place is unique! the furniture and the ilumination it makes you feel like you're in asia. i went for a ceremony tea ( pictures below) and i could taste two different top quality teas combined with two rounds of excellence delicatessens ( savoury and sweet). i totally recommend the whole experience!
very special i think. the decor is very romantic and the food amazing. lovely place.

if two people order two set menus, it would be better if the food comes in separate plates, not in one plate. the servers touched the bowl when serving, and it was not hygiene. pricey.   mapo tofu was not original at all.
great selection of interesting dishes, modern take on classical taiwanese. the interior is also very enjoyable.
excellent food and the tea is amazing. would definitely go again.
possibly my favourite chinese restaurant in london at the moment  the sweet potato dumplings are

i would say its not authentic taiwanese cuisine, more like fusion chinese food. for my experience, compare to the taste of food, its a bit pricey, you pay for the interior decoration and the atmosphere. and for most dishes we ordered, its either too dry (eg. the duck) or too creamy/ greasy (eg. the crab).
nice restaurant, excellent service, delicious exotic food. if you want to discover something new try it!!
very neat little place,quirky design.worth a visit.

excellent restaurant with a unique twist on taiwanese food. there is a welcome focus on ceremony without seeming overly demanding to visitors. the food is wonderful, the cod roe sandwiches, chili crab in egg drop and fried pigs tails were memorable.
nice atmosphere. creative, contemporary and not didascalic interpretation of taiwanese cuisine. very good dumplings, tea and cocktails.
lovely interior. staff were amazing. food delicious however would not recommend set menus. portions are incredibly small.
tapas style asian food v tasty tasting menu is a bit pricy but with it
we had the a la carte menu with the wine pairing and it was good. i wouldn't say it was exceptional but the staff kind and attentive.

food look good but way too pricey for what you get. being born and bred in taiwan, these are not authentic taiwanese food. the service was awful, we waited for 15 mins to get our food menu and waited for more than 40 mins between our starters and main dishes. overall too overpriced.
a bit pricey but the ambiance is really good, so ideal for a date or special occasion.

no bad comment on the taste of food. the two stars is all because the service and partially the price. servers are not welcoming and no patient for any question. we got steam rice served at the very end of the meal when theres only 1 dish left to eat with white rice.
love the ambiance here. portions are on the smaller side but the food is always great and delicately made, one of my favourite places in london
good restaurant. the pork is amazing. very nice interior and good drinks

had a really good time here - lovely food (especially the dumplings) and a chilled out and relaxed atmosphere. nicely decorated, and a great place to come for a celebration or romantic meal. good service

an excellent representation of a taiwanese tea house. the interior is mahogany dark. you are transposed to 50s taiwan a remarkable transformation and the food is exquisite. perfectly balanced. we experienced the hospitality of a tattooed german gent. and the food well, check the pictures.

decor to die for and the friendliest service youll ever experience. the food is authentic, tasty and (for the location) reasonably priced. can recommend the tasting menu, especially if youre unfamiliar with taiwanese cuisine (and lets be honest, apart from the taiwanese, who is?)
interesting food, and i like my steak. but the portion is quite small.

xu is genuinely a different experience from the usual chinese restaurant experience and the place really does feel like you are in 1930s taiwan. the egg drop crab is amazing and the shou pa chicken too. i will definitely be going back ....not the cheapest, but excellence is not cheap.
best bubble tea of all time! i always queue for the mudflip special, but defoo worth it guys!!!
serves its purpose.very, very ascetic.fresh taste.
a little surprise on the bottom
love the mudflip (aka brown sugar pearl milk tea) but the wait can be long and they only have it at two time slots during the day until sold out. their fruit tea is refreshing
delicious tea - best bubble tea ive had. i would recommend milk tea with slight sugar and bubbles!
delicious milk tea and pearls. quick service, yet to try their famous mudflip milktea which is sold in limited in quantity.
refreshing fruit tea. cant believe i try this in london instead of hong kong!
the mudslide

drinks here are good but really annoyed with the one drink per person policy for the brown sugar pearl milk tea. so if i'm buying more than one of these drinks for my family/friends i need to keep coming back in a disguise... why the 'exclusivity'??? it's unnecessary.
excellent tea shop in london, be fond of their fruit tea. all natural taste can be rich in the mouth
they produce a cone with lots of bubbles (should have taken a photo of it).
terrible brand....never buy it again
excelllent ambience and great food

love how there is fresh fruit in my pineapple green tea! ive been waiting to try yi fang but wanted to avoid the long queues. the tapioca pearls are on the smaller side and arent very chewy (just soft) but apart from that, the drink was refreshing. i can imagine itd be even better on a hot day. adjustable sugar/ice levels available.
this small outfit was at a recent food festival in london they have a great team and serve proper thirst quenching teas
always park on the yellow line and block traffic
best bubble tea around!

we had to wait 25 min after ordering and paying for the drinks. then we were told the pearls were told out but they would be happy to refund us. a waste of time. you couldve mentioned that when we were ordering.
best ever !!! loved it
i highly enjoy the tea here only issue is that teas do sell out quickly, its not worth going in the evening as none of my favourite flavours will be available
bought bubble tea once. from the liquid it seems they put less milk than other bubble tea sellers. it tastes not rich, more like a mixture of sugar and water. overrated.
have applied many times but they never respond after viewing my cv. guess prejudiced in appointing staff only from china
basic
such great drinks - amazing.
super delicious milk teas ;)
the best tea i've ever had! also great customer service.
too watery the bubble tea not worth the hype. there are better bubbles tea places in london.
just as good as the original. their mudflip is awesome.
i love this so much
delicious fruit tea cold drink. would recommend. service is quick.
what a drink! i never had that kind of tea drink, bad azz!
nice but still prefer the original stores in taiwan though:)

their fruit teas are great, tried sugar cane and felt disappointed, just tasted like water with sugar. the queues are really long, we walked past a few times but it was just getting longer. and they dont have many menus, you have so many people standing there obviously youd need more? and the worker was very confusing too.
went on 27/08, the cashier was without any smile and didnt give me the points card.

this is a authentic franchise tea shop from taiwan and the taste is exactly the same as it would be in taiwan. both of my friends loved what they ordered. and i had a fruit tea which makes you feel so  happy.

great fruit and milk tea! the long queues are for the mudflip tea, which they only serve twice a day. i tried it in hk and its really good, but ive yet to try it here. the fruit teas are really nice though with a generous serving of fresh fruit!
the taste is just normal, the staff is not friendly. and milk tea is quite no taste even i ordered normal sugar
good fruit tea.
very nice place, i ordered fresh milk tea and yi fang fruit tea and both of them were amazing!!!
pineapple green tea way too sweet even with only 30% sugar... tastes like sugar water, not worth the queue.
pretty cool...although not sure we actually went there. google told us we did...
bad service
poor service
delightful tea shop.
good tea
good.
tasty but expensive
not authentic. they put too many artificial and unhealthy stuffs in the drink.
fantastic food
the worst bubble tea i have ever had

limited menu available however, they offer unique flavours. the yakult milk iced tea is strange as it has a slight sour taste. but overall it is quite pleasant. the store usually has very very long queues so beware. furthermore, my server lacked good english proficiency so it was slightly difficult to communicate.
hyped but the hype was worth it
super authentic
expensive
104 shaftesbury ave
amazing taste! but quite pricy for bubble tea i would say. the price has gone up quite a bit since they first opened.
i like the fact that they have more of the authentic flavours. wait times can be long though, as they're always busy
this yifang doesnt have the hot option unlike their spitalfields one, here they only have warm which cooled down much too quickly.also the pearls were clumped together into a  mass.
absolutely love their milk teas. also, very convenient to have them at bond street station. staff is very friendly! :) highly recommend!
a no bs hole in the wall store - which is great. ordered very quickly and the milk tea was delicious.

come here for authentic milk and fruit teas.their signatures are the best - milk tea with pearls and fruit teas are all winners. love that the teas are sourced and all the recipes of milk/fruit teas have their unique flavours. never been disappointed with the quality. definitely recommend!
this location  makes better drinks than the other one which is like 5 mins walk away, the other shop constantly gets the sugar level wrong...
let's try 50% yi fang fruit tea in this summer!
the best brown sugar boba, made fresh daily. sells out quickly and longs queue for the quality.
limited menu but almost all taste good, especially fruit tea.
best authentic taiwanese bubble tea. recommend fruit tea!
amazing!!! love the brown sugar pearls with milk, will defo come back for it worth the wait. highly recommend it!
tea was ok. their signature drink was sold out.
authentic taiwanese bubble tea!!  highly recommended
milk tea was ok, very limited choice of flavours
it's like normal bubble tea. how bad can it be?
great taiwanese bubble tea
one of the best london bubbles tea
incredible experience the food was very very good
i love fruit tea very much! fresh and delicious
best original taiwanese bubble tea ever
its too slow, it takes 30 mins to get your drink when there are about 15 ppl in the queue only.
the most delicious pearls ever had at europe!
nice
good
hands down the best bubble tea in london!
best bubble tea in london! had to wait in the queue  for almost one hour but is always worth it.
best bubble tea & fruit tea ive tried in london
japanese food hmmm

very dear for a fruit bubble tea (without bubbles but fruit chunks instead). expect to pay 4.50. tried a sweet potatoes drink, very thick, lumpy and rich, needed to drink water after. novelty purchase, located in heart of china town, long queue.
pandan ice cream, need i say more
smooth and creamy ice cream.  durian is very good!
delicious, rich beautiful ice cream. friendly staff, with reasonable prices.
the rose and lychee macaron ice cream is the best dessert ive ever had but be sure to check they have it as the menu options vary each day based on season.
horlicks & pandan coconut flavor

amazing selection of home made 'south east asian' flavoured ice creams. corn / durian / pandan / milo / vietnamese coffee / etc. highly recommended ! let me know when you are able to deliver nationwide
omggggg can't say any better words about this place!! amazing, that's it. you must come here! icecream are the best flavours you will ever try and the soft serve boba ice cream too !
love, wish more vegan flavours though!
nice flavours! tasty ice cream! matcha cookie worth a try!
great ice cream. lots of accurate asian flavours.
the best & most delicious lychee ice cream ive ever tried!!!
fantastic ice cream - milk tea flavour is excellent! can diy ice cream sandwich from macaron or cookie. is quite warm in there though
yummy ice cream with macaroons. the matcha oreo flavor is quite good.

i had a hard time choosing which flavour to try, i went for the hong kong tea with condensed milk.woah! it was incredible!the flavour variety here is original and i recommend visiting. my partner is coeliac, so gluten free is essential. they were cool about that and had some great choices.enjoy!
love this place and have revisited. delicious ice cream macaroons that are not overly sweet. however they no longer have the pre-made ones so you just build your own. tastes just as good!
macaron ice cream sandwich is a good idea but the ice cream texture is not very creamy
best ice cream in london. possibly the world! such cool flavours. i'm a big fan of durian
such a colourful place! its not all about instaworthy looks they have very unique flavors too
delicious ice cream. try with macarons.
place is a bit rundown and there's no loo, but the service and food are nice
amazing! great and very tasty ice cream and ice cream sandwiches- you can creat your own. good location and friendly staff.
fun concept and good ice cream. however the opening times seem to differ from those mentioned online.
the pretty pictures do not reflect the end result. the macarons are not well baked and the ice cream itself is not the best.... not worth the 5
delicious ice cream in a calm and welcoming surrounding
seriously good! ice cream is more milky than creamy, but beautifully & freshly flavoured. lovely staff, pretty place. ammmmmazing macaroons. perfect.
i was so excited to try their macaroons and it was super yummy! im actually heading there now and cant wait to have more
really cute little ice cream place with loads of asian inspired flavours to choose from including milo, pandan, pocky etc. nice atmosphere with a few tables to sit at too.
my favourite macaroon sandwiches! the best x

very underwhelming especially for the price. i saw the raves online so hurried here to have ice cream with chunks of actual ice in it. the ice cream wasn't creamy either. i wish i ate at some of the other shops in the area truthfully.
great service,  friendly staff and nice atmosphere. had their vegan sorbet and that was delicious
fantastic ice cream. a++++
incredible pandan icecream and macaron. highly recommend going here!awesome staff too
lovely wild variety of ice cream that doesn't disappoint

popped into this ice cream shop while visiting london. macarons were crisp on the outside and chewy in the centre, which made for an enjoyable ice cream sandwich. flavours were great - we tried the matcha oreo, taro, red velvet and egg tart (our favourite of the 4). 5 is a little pricey for an every day treat, but quality was good.

if you like macaroons this is the place to go!about 5 different flavours to choose from and you can make your own. each one is roughly 4.50 which i thought was reasonable. it's filling and yummy. it's only a small place and so there is limited stock. i went on a sunday at around 4pm and there wasn't much left to choose from.

lovely little ice cream shop with asian-inspired flavours. the ice cream sandwiches were delicious, the brownies were especially scrumptious. maybe could use a little more variety of ice cream flavours, but its asian inspired and theyre not huge on sugary things, awesome nonetheless.
very cool flavors like pandan coconut and vietnamese ice coffee!

wonderful ice cream store. it's in a great location, where it is close enough to the action, but not so close that it's swarming with tourists. the desserts are out of this world, and are well worth the money you pay for them.
nice little treat...nice ice cream idea but is expensive and ice cream wasn't as smooth as i was expecting for the price.  tried the lemon meringue which wasn't too sweet.

i was visiting from the us and had seen this place on a list of insta-worthy stops. definitely a gorgeous photo, but the ice cream sandwich with macarons and lucky charms "milk" was maybe even more delicious than it looks! it's huge, so i'd recommend sharing with a friend. sad i don't have something like this more local to me!
really good ice cream enjoyed the novelty of it as well as the high class finish. however, you do have to pay a pretty penny for the experience and so next time i will be having a 99 flake!
would recommend the brownie and raspberry macaron sandwiches.
absolutely love this cute little store! i have been countless times as they change the flavours regularly. love the ice cream macarons and the unique flavours.

brownie ice cream sandwich with a scoop of coconut matcha - the brownies were really good but the coconut ice cream was ok. it's pricy and by the time we went there (around 3 oclock) the special ice cream sandwiches were almost already gone.
the flavour variety here is original and i recommend visiting.
very cute atmosphere with amazing food and service, rated the bts songs!

from the days that yolkin would just have pop up shops to now. it has always been good. love the variety and create your own from the macaron ice cream sandwiches. the brownie was a perfect combination with the viet coffee ice cream

yummy treat! i tried the smores ice cream sandwich and my partner had the coconut (thai style i think it was) they were both delicious and not overly sweet so i could actually enjoy it fully. the macroon is is a great substitute for cookies for an ice-cream sandwich! and great for anyone who is gluten free
best place to go for ice cream on a sunny day with flavors you won't see anywhere else.
first time visitor, was recommended this place by my girlfriend. wow the ice-cream filled macarons are incredible. next time i'm in london i'll make a detour and go back

absolutely amazing macaroon ice cream sandwiches! me and my sister were visiting london from canada and were blown away by these ice cream sandwiches. they are so unique and so delicious, the macaroons are delightful and the ice cream is also delicious. these are a must try if you are in london!
special ice cream flavour
such a colourful place! its not all about instaworthy looks they have very unique flavors too.
i don't know of any other places like it. it's a good place to go for a treat. i would go for the flavours you wouldn't typically find elsewhere
interesting and tasty ice cream flavors. staff is adorable and the shop is lovely!
one of the best ice cream parlours in london, would go everyday if possible
cute little ice cream store, big portions. nice quiet store, can be annoying when you're trying to get past several instagram photos being taken. staff are lovely.

i think id definitely go back to try the ice cream on its own. this rose water flavoured macaroon sandwich was good but not a favourite. very friendly staff and pretty cosy. very pretty designs and selection of flavours. reasonably priced compared to other deserts places. will visit again soon.
ice cream tasted great
highly recommend the boba soft serve!
heavy hong kong flavour influenced homemade ice creams well worth trying. my favourite was the hk tea flavoured ice cream but the egg custard tart was interesting with flakes of pastry.
great atmosphere and great music played in the store. best place to go for ice cream on a sunny day (or any day) with flavours you won't see anywhere else.
everything is pretty in design. flavors were better than average for ice cream. macaroon was average. not like laudure macaroons (but of course i didnt expect that). its more for looks here.
love the ice cream, i got the red velvet flavor. it was delicious. it worth to break your diet for
the ice creams are amazing! staff are very friendly! definitely come try out their ice creams!!

pricy (as expected) but the hk milk tea + hollicks ice cream was probably the best ive had in london! around 4 for two scoops, its enough to share for two people. the macaroon ice creams ran out but i went quite late
lovely independent ice cream store.
a new concept of ice-cream sandwiched into macaron which both were delicious but not very practical when it comes to eating it. gets all clumsy, but nice attempt.

it's a nice concept, was expecting the store to be more inviting but to be fair they are refurbishing. i would say, if you are in the neighbourhood definitely try it but dont travel across town for it. very pricy, so more something i would try once.
very tasty ice cream with macaron
nice macarons and great ice cream

i've been warning to try the ice cream macrons here for a while and they are pretty damn good, wish there were more flavours on offer as none of them stood out to me as great and i was desperate for a matcha flavoured one.
absolutely amazing flavors. plus i personally really like the window spot - perfect spot to have ice cream.
strange but delicious ice cream flavors. you can get it either sandwiched, or in con, cup of different sizes. also you can taste the flavors before you buy.
been coming to this place for forever amazing food very well priced would come here every day if i lived closer!!!

the best value for money restaurant we found in london. you have unlimited refills on a big variety asian buffet and everything is tasty. prices are 10,50 if you stay in and cheaper for takeaway.worth it!
dessert  food
food was fine but it is very hard to access the buffets.
nice food very good taste and sort of friendly stad
i visit with my family and her friendsthe foods was ok that chinese style dim sum is fine not to very  but some of them foods is nice duck tongue and not to expensive.
the menu in chinese is a hidden gem. great food and reasonably priced.
good experience. a bit too small but the food was good.
this place is not recommended at all. food was cold and dry
food are good. i am from hk. food are almost as good as food in hk. free dessert was served. overall everything is fine
food is alright. love the dim sum, however, the roast duck was served a bit of cold which i believe affected the taste.
pricy
very good place for authentic cantonese food. my regular restaurant visit everytime i am in london
best for dim sums in soho because that is the case can get very busy

this for me has always been one of the go-to chinese restaurants in chinatown. my family and i have been frequent customers and the food has always been great and tasty. the prices are more acceptable than a majority of the restaurants down the main street (gerrard street).
the waiters were very rude and did not address us properly. they got the order of my food wrong and delayed their service. the waitress then had the audacity to ask for a tip!! overall never again!!

decent chinese food in china town coming from an asian. definitely a local place for dim sum and comparatively cheaper than other restaurants in china town. going in the morning for dim sum is recommended
large portions, mediocre quality, poor value for money. chicken is terrible quality. if the menu was 30% cheaper it would have felt fair.
really lovely attentive service, good food
friendly staff and great service. do not expect english waitering though, they express their hospitality here differently. reliable dim sum and cantonese dishes at reasonable prices.
tasty frog legs with pepper. vietnamese spring rolls and octopus in spicy sauce are also great dim sum

favourite place for dumplings! (even though i'm not a dumpling expert)but it seems very reasonably priced and portions are huge.don't expect much from the service. it's a fast paced restaurant which just gets things done. no extras, no niceness.oh, 10% off if you pay cash!
food is great but the service just feels weird. definitely worth going for the food. just the service cuts it short of 5 stars
lovely place to eat best beef curry i have had in a long time
amazing dim sum and very generous portions. very fair pricing too. don't miss out!
came here twice now, the food is lovely, quite a lot of choices :) staff is alright
disgusting food! dry! not labelled correctly! really greasy! staffs attitude is very poor. would not recommend eating here!

poor food, little choice, very oily, worst wings, worst chow meing, worst duck. food was very bland, very disappointed. staff rushed us to eat, very little hospitality. did not feel comfortable at all. you dont have to listen to me but if i were you i would spend my money at a restaurant elsewhere.
not as so good as normal. still 4 star to give them chance for next time ... hope quality is not an issue. see next time..
great food. fast service. try the peking duck and black tea

terrible service, miserable staff who serve like they hate you and act like youve offended them when you ask for water. food gave me food poisoning, terrible bland garbage. do not go here. even mcdonalds has better service and food.
amazing chinese good.would recommend.
friendly service left alone to make decision instead of hovering with notebook..food tasty left feeling full ...

my favourites were the siew mai, prawn cheong fun and stir fried radish cake. service was kind of lackluster, we ordered two plates egg tarts but the 2nd plate took forever to arrive despite our asking them three times about it
very nice banquet meal for four.
splendid food!
great value authentic dim sum. always efficient service and excellent quality food. top tip - lift the lid of your tea pot and leave askew for a top up of hot water.

very kind staff, small but complete, the broccoli perfectly cooked, and the noodles...omg loved it. very cheap. if you are fit or so fancy this is not your place, here you could eat (really) good food with your budget.
good dining experience and good value for money on the lunch menu.
cosy restaurant, with tasty food. went on chinese new year weekend and although it was busy still was served quickly and food was great. the bbq meat were particularly good here !!
please do not go there it is horrible hooorrible rude staff very rude
the worst chinese food we've ever had! this has nothing to do with real chinese kitchen! the waitress ignored our complaint...
had the buffet on sunday night after a little day it out in london. food was decent and price not bad, also staff were friendly and helpful. would recommend.
great food and service. really liked the duck!great selection of veggie options too.
faultless dim sum . xiao long bai better than the fancy places. staff quite old school but also quite lovely.
for the tea the 1 star but only because i have to give a star. worst food in london. service was a joke, they even lacked respect for their customers.
the food was good however the service let it all down so much and it smelt like cat
we always return here - always lots of chinese customers so  you'd think it'd be good. food ok. service bearable
very nice food. i had a very nice dining experience. would go again. it's cheap, it's good food and the fact that it's cash only didn't bother me at all.
fantastic meal. the chicken and black bean sauce is the best around
food was great, especially the dim sum and plenty of non-standard menu items to try. warning though the portion sizes are massive.
they short changed us and would not admit their mistake. thieves. please avoid this restaurant that actually does theft.
the absolute worst customer service i have ever received in my life. princess leia would probably get better service on the death star, if darth vader waited on her.

the restaurant that i always go to with my family. must try their lobster with ginger and spring onion! also their scallops!i note that some reviews have mentioned that they had buffet food, and therefore rated 1 star. they must have this restaurant confused with another, young cheng are definitely not a buffet restaurant.
price raised, no longer inexpensive, food standard also has decreased, no longer automatic 1st choice.
worst restaurant i've been to in london, service was horrendous, had to wait twenty minutes to pay the bill, then was ok for the price, service charge was a complete joke!! -5 rating
good ginger spring onion lobster. dim sum also fair, above average. good prawn dim sum. we found service to be fine. fairly priced too.
my regular and favourite dim sum restaurant in london. the interior is not fancy looking but the food is very authentic and reasonably priced!

i love this place!cheap excellent dim sum (lunch only) the tea is bottomless and i recommend the shrimp and char siu bao fluffy dumplings with their hot and sour soup. get there at 12 noon on weekends, they fill up fast although they have two levels of seating.
the best value and tastiest dim sum in the area i'd say, just don't expect friendly service
pretty fair dim sum for a low price. the trade off is atrociously rude service.  lower your expectations, try not to to take things personally and enjoy some nice dumplings.
nice and cheap. good food
a very good and popular chinese restaurant.
food tastes terrible

i have to say the staff were extremely rude and  unprofessional, just because the restaurant is gonna be sold soon. the manager even ask the customer not to come back any more. the staff wont serve the customers politely. what a poor job they did!

the food at this place is fabulous. it tastes so authentic and that's what makes the difference. there's a wide choice on the menu to choose from, service isn't bad. it's a bit of a small place with seating on 2 floors. in busy times expect to queue but well worth the wait!
enjoyed the dim sum very much, so delicious and affordable!
best value for money dim sum in london
nice food, but most grumpy people ever...

there are always loads of chinese people dining here, which for a chinese restaurant can only be a good sign! ever good value - top food at reasonable prices, with a vibrant atmosphere. highly recommended.
for the most authentic chinese food, this place does not disappoint. wonton noodles soup is massive for the price. avoid lunchtime rush though if you want to walk in without waiting.
cheap and cheerful - wouldnt be an authentic chinatown restaurant without slightly rude servers either!

went there with my hubby as part of our romantic weekend away from our children. the food was good, its the only reason i am giving it 2 stars. but the service was so bad that we felt like we were not welcome there. we left as quickly as we finished our first order. we end up having to go to another place for another meal.

surly, uninterested staff, with the young ones message on their mobile phones, rather then being attentive between serving dishes to the table. the older supervisors, apathetic in the main i find but the food perfectly adequate.
good food, always crowded and waiting for table. waiters serve food quickly hoping customers to finish eating quick and have table ready for next customers!

the cleanest chinese restaurant! plates and cutlery so clean. also staff proper dressed and tidy. food was also very tasty good value for the money. i have been looking for a long time for a clean rest in china town and i really recommend  this one. thank you!
good place for good value plate rice with bbq meats and authentic  dim sum  staff can do with a bit more smiling very busy as prices are lower than surrounding  chinese eateries.  will come again

i could get a better meal out of a tin of whiskers. when the bill come my partner refused to pay the service charge because the meal was so bad  the staff couldn't even understand what we were ordering. pathetic restaurant,  pathetic staff,  pathetic food.
it's used to be good, but now is operating under different management, the quality of food is not as good.

visiting london chinatown for the first time and randomly selected this restaurant. as a taiwanese, the food is delicious. the special fried rice () is surprisingly light(not greasy) but flavorful. cheap eat in london. i remove a star for the service.
a nice little order dim sum...clean and full of hungry folks
pretty average chinese rest off the main area of gerard street

this is my "go to" dim sum place in chinatown. been to many, but always gravitate back here. service is what you'd expect in this type of place, but food is good and reasonable value. have recommended to many who have not been disappointed.
dim sum was excellent, nice staff and keenly priced too.
great food

very bad service. waiter/waitress had no manners at all. will not recommend this restaurant. theres one sentence in chinese means dogs eyes look down others, like how they look their customers :) wouldnt give any tips for this kind of service!!! do not waste your time and money for these kind of services. its not that cheap tho.
ate okay but besides one lady, the service was bad.. they came to collect the money of the bill while 2 persons were still eating & couldnt even say thank you when receiving the money... not okay
lobster is great here

the food is great a very reasonable prices. i ordered the sweet and sour chicken and the crystal prawn dumplings every time i've been there. i highly recommend both of the dishes, but the service could improve.

do not waste your money i didn't want to even give 1 star. we were taken downstairs with less choice of food what was there was cold and tasteless. the staff were very rude and practically threw our drinks at our table. save your money   very very poor quality
reasonable dim sum
great dim sum served till 5pm
excellent dim sum, very enjoyable
amazing dim sum (lunch)

my sons absolutely hate chinese food. my family wanted to eat here and we were refused. the man said that we had to pay for the boys even if they are not eating! absolutely disgusting! they lost out on 50 because they thought we were going to feed the boys from our plate. shame on them.
good food, all you can eat, nothing to complain about the food from me... just that the hand drier was not working

unassuming outside and inside but very satisfied with food. busy for midweek lunch (queued for about 10 mins). restaurant has 2 levels. what appeared to be chinatown locals eating there is a good sign. will be back next time i'm in chinatown.
omg lobster at a reasonable price yummy
lovely dim sum and great service as usual
we could not use the karaoke and the waiter was rude
the food is great quality here and for a good price. ideal for large groups and casual eating. the seafood is good here. lobster, crab and clams and must orders!
food quality really bad ! sorry
friendly small restaurant good food
for quick noodle soup and some dim sum look no further. lunch menu is great for a quick lunch and dinner menu is also ok as they serve nice sea bass with some dim sum dishes
food was a bit bland and took a while to come but we were a group of 16 people, i'm sure it's much quicker in smaller groups
very good  testy  food...enjoyable unpretentious  chinese  resto...family   happily  eating out  ..value for money  all the  way..
not a big fan of chinese food... the scallop dumplings were absolutely delicious.great place for dim sum my husband ordered the crispy duck pancakes but it was way too dry.
good arabian food here.
delicious roast pork and duck
walked past here and gave it a random try and was not disappointed. very good quality of food and dim sums for the price. would recommend for a quick nice meal. i would happily go again.

one of the staff was very racist and started yelling in front of everyone when we asked for some white sugar. he was mocking and insulting us asking if we need green sugar or red sugar as well and finally never gave us anything. very racist is what i felt.

one of the best value vs taste in china town. we have been visiting for 20 years, and never disappointed. dim sum and noodle / rice dishes always delicious. space a little crowded. dim sum is to a high standard even compared with restaurants in hong kong.

the dimsum were really delicious especially these steamed ones on the list with shrimps. the skin is very thin and crystal clear you can see the ingredients inside.the service was not good i waited 10mins then someone came to my desk to take the order however all dimsum came on the table was hot!
fresh crab with noodles. .exciting and yummy.

if i could give 0star which its i will. the service was extremely terrible. staff was very unfriendly and rude. food was disgusting greasy and tasteless. it cause reactions to me after 30 minutes. never gonna eat there again not recommending this restaurant

we have a late sunday lunch with teenages there. the food quality is good for their price. (9 dishes of dim sum plus fried beef rice noodle in soy sauce for 46) the staff has asked if we have any allergy when taking order. quite considerate. i'll certainly come back again.

our favorite chinesse restaurant in china town, authentic food, staff is quite rude but we dont care as we got there for the food, they do their jobs without being nice but there are quick and effective. food is lovely!!!!!! honestly the best chinesse food that i tried in london so far!
fab lobster, amazing meal
always good cantonese cooking in nondescript setting.

3.5 stars if i could because we came here for dinner and the portions size were very good, plenty of chinese folk which is always a good sign! 4 people, a couple of ching tao beers, 4 main dishes including black bean eel roughly 50.. can't argue with that!
had takeout from here twice and its definitely on par! fairly fast and efficient service. havent tried their dimsum yet but will do as soon as i get the chance.
on the sunday, i went it was very busy. the food was very good

all the negative comments here are from people who have no chinese culture awareness. the food is perfectly acceptable for the price range and the location.the service... well, you are in chinatown... what do you expect?!!
decent chinese food at reasonable prices
avoid this place. the only good dish was the slice of orange at the end. service - probably the worst in london. never again!
excellent food, normal chinese service, used to that, well worth the money, and staff were very helpful when i said i wanted to take my leftover food home.
all you can eat for only 8,50 great quality
okay place but my duck with rice was full of bones and really very greasy.
its a pity theyve closed the one onshaftesbury avenue but this one also offers good value for money increasingly expensive china town, i thought i this place is part of a group that has royal china
lovely tasty food.
excellent food, large portions and very well priced for central london.
visited this restaurant many times, the food is always good quality, the new staff are very hit and miss which is a great shame.
cheap but very very poor quality!!
the rudest people ever. there are plenty of nice places in chinatown. avoid this place
fast service, very good lobster.
valuable, especially for the crab noddle. good cantonese restaurant

this is a great hidden gem for dim sum. it's just as good, and better in most cases, than even some dim sum places in hong kong. just remember that dim sum isn't served all day, i think they stop serving it at 4pm or something similar (which is actually later than most places as dim sum is usually served at lunch only).

prices very reasonable sweet and sour rib especially good and the crab with noodle is very good. the oyster with hot plate is a bit disappointed as the the oyster is small and look like the dry oyster but not fresh oyster.

i have never visited this place but if the allegations of discriminatory or racist behaviour is anything to go by, then this must be thoroughly investigated by the appropriate authorities. this country has gone past this sort of small mindedness and racism of any sort, covert or otherwise is simply unacceptable.
best lobster noodle in london. great value for the price too...
wow!! this place is awesome, love the staff 5/5!!
firmly average in terms of food quality.
service is about as bad as it gets! no one knows what they are doing and mostly children running the place. food is fairly good for a buffet, but very much cheap and cheerful-ish kind of place
don't be fooled by the looks of the restaurant, the food is great here!
be prepared for a long wait if you're going for dim sum on the weekend.
i love pork buns and i cannot lie
great value, good quality cooking.
cold food bad attitude and they said there card machine didn't work.
the food is delicious with a wide variety of dim sum dishes. the price is the same as other chinese restaurants.
authentic food and service. food was ok quality.
busy little place.  service can be a bit slow due to being busy
not the best dim sum, but ok for tourists.
i ate a piece of steer wire in the turnip cake. and they gave me a new one. =#>!!!
quick. good. relatively cheap.
this place is always busy i only go here for dim sum, customer service is ok don't expect much. i like the food.
big fat zero very aweful staff
really rude staff food wasn't great plenty of other better choices in chinatown
too busy and meat much too bony...
best dimsum in town
loved it
reasonable price and free soup.
really good food ! really tasty , completely full !

although visited young cheng before, i picked oysters and pork stir fry-big mistake, had the worst tummy ache the next day...bet the oysters were off...but then what did i expect? :( never ordering that dish again...
ok good food

disgusting food that made me and my partner feel ill for about 4 hours after, very limited selection of dishes and we were treated like dirt by the staff for asking for water (mainly to balance the fact the food is so laden with salt!) avoid at all costs
waitress was rude and not professional. so we decided not to eat there.
delicious and good dim sum
delicious food and good wine.
pretty decent dim sum.
horrible service.
nice good and a fair price
amusingly rude, even by hong kong standards. cheap and good food. got yelled at for asking for chilli oil :-)

abit smallish for a restaurant, dim sum average and indistinguishable like many other in chinatown. price is okay for the quality. can't say much else except sorry if you're stuck here lol, maybe order the char siew soh (char siew puff pastry). it's the only solid thing here for dim sum.
one of my favorite dimsum places in london
very delicious chinese food
there are better places in china town.
nice place to eat.
fresh and excellent seafood
cheaper as it's off the beaten track, can get busy as expected, but great service
bad service like really bad (if you can get service) very unprofessional. unclean, cold food, dirty dishes!

always make sure i come here for dim sum when i'm in london. the staff are quite brusque but their service is excellent. i've been coming for several years now and the food is always wonderful and cheap for london! as it's just off of leicester square, it's in the perfect location if you want to grab a bite before going to a show!
nothing special but not expensive either.
good quality, good service, fast. dim sum are good!
great service! we we're very well looked after

for some reasons, people are standing lines for this restaurant. but to be honest, i didn't like this place. no lie, i found a hair in one of my dish. i saw a cockroach under someone's seat. the waiters are ok, but not friendly. the cheung fan was disappointing.... go to another restaurant. unless you don't mind these things!
fabulous chinese food. dim sum from 5pm but all food excellent & set menus have  imaginative choices & good value.
very authentic cantonese food and very reasonably priced!
great food.
good food but staff need to smile a little bit
good services
good food with good price, but prepare that there is always packed.
salt and pepper squid stuffed with prawn.
really bad service, food was horrible!never temp to order their noodle in soup and dim sum. they ruined my craving!would never go there again!!
this place is horrendous!  below average food and inferior staff. get ready to be sworn at in chinese if u go there. do not go there.
good food. quick serving. polite staff
my favourite place for lobster noodles. but must ask for extra gravy. the eel is damn amazing too. affordable prices.
horrible food, rude staff

me and my mother had an incredible lobster at the restaurant yesterday, and we paid excellent price-quality rate. we plan to go again tonight for dinner. we come from spain, so we are used to eat good sea food and we found the one at this restaurant extremely tasty
poor service didn't feel welcome
best mix of cuisine i have had in a long time.  definitely a top contender for best restaurant in china town.
dim sum is great here. just tick what you want on your paper, which is on your table and it arrives. pretty good price too
food is average but as expected. service friendliness isn't great and a once in a blue moon occasion. prices are doable if you're here in a group sharing the dim sum.
food was good service also good yes they don't smile but i am not there to be smiled at just eat good food
a small restaurant but decent cantonese cuisine. famous for its stewed lobster with ginger and spring onions bedded with deep fried noodles. highly recommend.
very good food at young cheng. the decor is typical for china town and the food is great at good prices.
reasonable service, decent food, quick delivery of food.wide variety from independent  meals and dim sum.nothing amazing but decent stop off for something to eat when in china town

visited this place on a friday night. amazing and fresh lobster and steamed seabass. the pork and preserved egg congee was perfectly cooked. one of the best chinese restaurants i have tried in london. price is reasonable. service is good.
fabulous chinese food if you order the right dish
enjoyed it been before lush again
good for dinner, the crab and rosted pork is very good and the price is reasonable.
decent food, staff were a bit rude.
the most authentic dim sum you can get in china town for that price. chinese speakers get free chicken broth! :)
waiting 40 mins for our starter so left and went elsewhere
nice one in chinatown

decent dim sum, not the best in  london. i would class it as distinctly average, 3/5 stars.what gets me to 4 stars is that it is insanely cheap! you can get very full for less than a tenner per person, which is almost unheard of for dim sum in london.
one of the best dim sum in china town, worth the wait in the queue my favourites are prawn dumplings on soup, plain cheung fun and red bean fried dumplings love this place!
the chinese dishes served here are decent. it's one of the restaurants on my list every time i come to china town.
not a massive restaurant but clean with tasty quick dim sum. for a table of 7, the bill came to 10pp. not bad!
roasted duck! supreme!
had supper after cinema here, standard chinese. had a set menu, very quick and efficient and food very tasty.
great food, big portions, moderate price
good food and nice staffs
please just don't go there. terrible food.

like most other chinatown restaurants, the service is brusque and almost to the point of rude. ignoring that, this place offers some of the best dim sum and food available in chinatown. well worth getting here early!
amazing dim sum. come with three people so you can have as many different ones as possible. good value.
favorite restaurant in chinatown. great range of delicious and authentic dishes at decent prices. peking duck is a winner and service is standard for chinese restaurants
everyone please continue complaining about the service, so that this gem will continue flying under the radar!
the food here were hot and  delicious, the service was fast and the bill was inexpensive.

a busy place, seemed to be more for the locals, which suits me. my first menu was chinese only.... but they brought me an english one when i asked. the food was fresh and tasty, service quick and i loved the bustling, very chinese, atmosphere.
food still have its quality, but service is so bad, could compare to wang kei....
dim sum and cantonese dishes excellent value
the best dim sum in chinatown. decent a la carte menu as well although i'd definitely recommend the dim sum more.
went there to try the lobster noodles. wasn't as awesome as other people have suggested. not amazing and not a lot of lobster meat
i'm from the states so i know bad chinese food, but this really takes the cake
slow service, poor hygiene, did not get what we ordered but charged for it. argued when we would not pay  service charge. quality of ingredients very poor. anywhere is better.
always a winner. might not be award winning but for the price of dim sum they're charging you couldn't be happier with it. it's delicious and cheap.
yes.
looks nice from outside,  i was walking by
lovely
great chicken and always tasty. super busy
chinese new year is coming and is always good to visit chinatown
barbers always accommodate your requests with minimal instruction needed - they can work purely off of photos you show them!
food was great. i learn how to eat by sticks
good place!
